I'm sure  he's probably long gone by now but I recently returned to Forks for a dinner date after a long hiatus, and my experience was still very pleasant. The place is never overdone like some  dining establishments. Simple stylish restaurant with simple tasty meals. I had to ask the waitress for bread though, I was starving and wanted bread to snack on.

Fork is nice looking, but the food is pretty bad. We got the focaccia, octopus, and striped bass. The focaccia was dry and the eggplant that comes with it looks like something that came out of my dog's backend. The octopus was surprisingly well-cooked, but the sea bass might have been the worst piece of fish I've ever had. It was hardly cooked, you couldn't even cut it with a knife it was so tough and stringy and the portion size was TINY for $36. Would not come back or recommend it.

Fork is back on my good list. All staff are wearing masks, tables inside are spaced out and they have several tables outside in a cute little structure. The only downside to eating outside is that you have the old city party crowd parading through, but the upside is you're probably not gonna get covid! The cocktails were excellent. We got rock paper plane and a reposado one (I forget the name). The crudo was so refreshing, and the tomatoes in it were awesome. The focaccia was just okay; it was a small portion (2 pieces). We enjoyed the duck and the mackerel very much! 20% service charge automatically added to the bill, and the server told us to review it carefully because of that, which was very kind.
Amazing brunch here! Loved the chimichurri on the eggs bacon and squash! The potatoes were very good as well. Would definitely come back.

I've been meaning to try this restaurant since it was featured on one of the news channels, I believe possibly FYI Philly;  so I saved it in this app. Our hotel was within walking distance so we tried it out.  The waiter seemed a little bit snobby which would've been fine if the food was actually great and there was a bigger menu.  We went for lunch there were very few things on the menu so we figured well they must do the things that are actually on the menu well and neither of us really particularly liked our burger. The role was completely saturated in grease and it was over salted.  The restaurant itself was beautiful.  I have noticed the quality just about everywhere has declined recently due to covid issues so this is actually probably one of the better places to go.

Normally I would make reviews a little more long winded, but I will keep it simple and say that our dinner Friday night was one of my top 5 meals of all time! Everything we had was absolutely phenomenal. Our table ordered and shared:
The focaccia
Fluke crudo
linden Dale cheese
Dry aged ribeye for 2
Golden tilefish
Sweet corn & heirloom polenta
Chocolate profiterole
Coconut custard
Several cocktails (the cantaloupe daisy was my favorite!)

I can't wait to go back!

Good food, good waiter, ok drinks, and good service.  Walked into a nice ambiance and were seated by the kitchen. I ordered an old fashioned which took over 15 mins to come out... it was gross and they used a smokey whiskey for some reason. They fixed the problem , gave me a different liquor which took another 15 minutes.  The apps were ok, not many choices and our rib eye was pretty good. It seems like they are still getting over Covid.  Overall good place.
I had the best server ever, Justin, was extremely knowledgeable and friendly without being ever bearing.  I would highly recommend to any foodie out there!
What a total disappointment  in every way! crap menu, crap service,  and just the crappiest meal at a place that previously was known as one of Philly finest.... not so much anymore ..

3.5
Just a little overrated. 

Came here to celebrate a birthday and it was good but not an evening of food to remember. We had a reservation at 8:15 and we were only able to sit at 8:40. What seemed like a long 25 minutes, the staff were very apologetic and accommodating to our wait. They gave a small cheese plate appetizer and a dessert for free. I honestly have nothing to complain about the service because it was great. Our server was friendly and all the staff were very helpful. The main reason I'm not giving Fork 5 stars is because of the food. The menu didn't really have a dish that caught my eye. I ended up ordering the tilefish which I had to send back because it was raw and cold in the middle. I did hear it would be "tender" but I had a hard time cutting through it. I sent it back and got a new fresh one that was much better. I liked it but I wouldn't order again. There was a cold salad on top of the fish and a sauce on the bottom that in my opinion, were too sweet and didn't mix well. But, my brother enjoyed his burger and the fries were great. In the end, it was a pleasant evening but nothing memorable.

Had dinner at Fork last week to celebrate our anniversary. While Fork is located so close to us, it never occurred to me to check it out.

We started dinner off with the Unlitro Tuscan blend, and it was deliciously easy to drink.

Per our waiter's recommendations, we decided to go with the pate appetizer and the feast for two with the whole black bass (you can also opt for the short rib).

Our appetizer arrived, and we dug in. It took some time for us to realize this wasn't the pate appetizer that we ordered, but the Yellow Springs cloud nine cheese. An error made by our waiter, but this local French styled goat cheese handmade to look like a snowball was sooo yummy and tasted much better than the pate that we had after. I highly recommend ordering this.

The feast for two took 30-40 minutes to prepare, which we were warned about. In hindsight, we should have gotten the short rib instead of the black bass for ease of eating, as the feast involved wrapping the protein in a lettuce wrap with Korean noodle salad. Even though the black bass was already deboned, there were the occasional bones.

After all that food, my husband still wanted dessert, so we ordered the olive oil cake. I took a bite of the olive oil cake, which I was so glad I did. The olive oil cake was amazing, and the BEST thing I ate that night.

Fork is underrated for sure. The food was good and the staff were very nice. Would love to come back again if not for dinner, maybe brunch.

Staff was great but there's a few concerns as far as flavoring.  Farm salad has too much vinegar in it. It's very bitter although it's very healthy. The custard has rhubarb in it which also is a bitter flavor that doesn't work well with the custard.
Easy to write. Michelin star food at a fraction of the price. FOH was VERY cool, too! I think our waiter was Cory. We'll be back. AND will visit the other spots in the group as well.
This place made me comfortable even in covid with the shields! Perfect for eating too! Such delicious food!! Totally recommend for anyone.

I went to Fork for the first time last night. It was a delightful and delicious experience. The interior of the restaurant has large, colorful floor to ceiling murals, which provide a warm atmosphere. 

We started off with the Yellow Springs Cloud Nine cheese, with strawberry-date jam, orange blossom, flax and pumpkin seeds.....just the sound of that dish should have your mouth watering....and yes, it's that good. 

Our main course was not on Fork's online menu-it was the fish special - a Whole Black Sea Bass...it melted in our mouths. It was one of the best whole fish dishes I've had. It came with a flavorful dish of Korean noodles w-lettuce cups. 

It was my first visit to Fork; it won't be my last. It was truly a wonderful culinary experience!

The Yelp menu is not representative of the actual menu when we went. We saw burgers and pasta, but on the menu, there was only 8 fancy veggie starters, 4 mains (3 fish, 1 beef) and then 3 desserts. There weren't enough options for us to have a meal (not big fish people and the beef was for 2 for $145) so we split a handful of the starters. The teens and one adult in our group, who had been adventurous eaters all week on our trip, didn't eat.  I liked what I ate, but please check the menu next to the door before going! Don't rely on the online menu.

business.name: Lacroix Restaurant at The Rittenhouse
business.categories: Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Brazilian, American (New), French, Asian Fusion

reviews.text: Pretentious prices with average food. Ambiance was good, server made every attempt to sell us on a menu and I appreciate it but even the server was no match for the fundamental LACK of good food. Beautiful place, wish there was better signage to lead you where you have to go when you enter the building (gotta go to an elevator) but you can't expect much else from the location which is also not a strong suite. Good luck with parking and finding your way. I'd keep my coins & walk down the street to Pietros.

The Culinary Adventures of Tom Coghlan, FB·
I have been to La Croix Restaurant in the Rittenhouse Hotel at 210 W. Rittenhouse square a number of times for Brunch and enjoyed it very much ! The staff was ALWAYS wonderful and accommodating, and the food was always top notch ! Acclaimed James Beard Award-winning Chef Jean-Marie Lacroix honed his craft for two decades as the executive chef of the Four Season's Fountain. He then established his namesake restaurant, Lacroix at the Rittenhouse..   I saw that they had a page on Facebook, so naturally I liked their page... I began receiving notifications from them and viewed pictures of their beautifully presented food ... I HAD to go there for dinner ! I found a single seat at the bar and met my server, Amy...   For my first course I chose one of the Specials,  Cantaloupe Soup with Honeydew and Celery... "That's something different," I thought, and I ordered it ! Amy recommended  a flute of Castellar Brut Cava, a Spanish sparkling wine that was very much like Champagne. The soup was served cold, and it WAS different...The broth was all Cantaloupe complimented with the earthy taste of the celery. There were slices of sweet honeydew in it that tied the whole dish together... My taste buds were confused at first, and it wasn't until I was finished with it that I realized I liked it ... I REALLY liked it !  The wine was PERFECT ! For the Main Course I ordered, Alaskan Halibut, Buerre Cancalaise, Caviar, Watercress. The Halibut was beautifully presented on a Buerre Cancalaise. a tasty sauce made of root vegetables. Caviar was in the sauce and was easily detected in my mouth. It was as beautiful as it was tasty ! The halibut was perfectly cooked and flaked apart into the  Buerre Cancalaise. The flavors were amazing together !  A side of watercress accompanied it...  Amy recommended a glass of Kamptal Riesling from Gobelsburg... PERFECTION ! Pure perfection !  Then came Desert ! Strawberry Charlotte, served with cappuccino and Sambuca. It was a bit like strawberry short cake and was delicious ! La Croix is an EXCELLENT restaurant with high standards and impeccable service, that I highly recommend ! I shall return !    https://www.lacroixrestaurant.com/

A very good meal and service; pleasant atmosphere; extensive drink, cocktail, and wine menu; well worth the money; you get what you pay for! I would recommend this establishment. Everyone should take advantage of this establishment, in my opinion. Whoever approaches me with a question about this establishment will receive my highest recommendation.

If you're hanging out/staying near Rittenhouse, I highly recommend checking out Lacroix at the rittenhouse hotel. The restaurant is facing the park, so you can dine and people watch. Everything about the restaurant is beautiful, from the curtains to the tables to the artwork on the wall. We went for breakfast and ordered a little of everything. Highly recommend the eggs Benedict and the galette. It reminded me of the savory crepes I had while living in France. 

The service was amazing, our server Michael was extremely helpful and attentive. 

Sadly they're only open for lunch on certain days and breakfast daily. Can't wait to come back when they start dinner again!
Great spot for brunch after staying at the hotel. Beautifully decorated and spacious.  Great quality food and service.

Brunch Extraordinaire! I came with my wife for an anniversary brunch. They were very accommodating. The staff is extremely well trained that certainly elevated our experience. They paid very close attention to finest details, such as I saw a staff member making neighboring table while placing glass not only he perfected placement of the silverware, he went through fine detail to check glass for any fingerprints as well. Apart from the service, food itself also deserves raging reviews of 5 stars. The chef accommodated my vegetarian request, and prepared dishes that were finger liking delicious. It was very peaceful fine dining experience in middle of the city. #VeggieAbroad

Truly a disappointing Birthday lunch experience. Will not plan on returning.

Setting: Birthday lunch taking my parents out to a nice meal as an appreciation for helping me become the person I am today.

Ambience: Beautiful interior with lovely classical music playing at a comfortable decibel.

Service: Unfortunately, this is what distracted terribly from otherwise okay dining. We were seated at our table for reservation without delay. The water servers began the lunch great attention. Our server Jorge disappointed in his recommendations for our meal. I asked which items off the lunch menu were most recommended and why. He pointed out the Blue crab toast and Fois Grae, as well as the Lobster and Halibut dishes without much explanation of their flavor profile or their selling points. 

My mother inquired whether the restaurant was still doing any sort of gift dessert for a birthday celebration and he stated no, but if we ordered a dessert and we reminded him that it was my birthday, he could request the chef write out happy birthday on the plate.

Onto the entrees:
When our food finally came, he placed the dishes in the center of the table, as he knew we were sharing. However, he did not give us any small plates for service. It took 3 minutes before we hailed him back for the plates. He stated, he apologized given that he thought someone else would do this. I then immediately requested he take a picture for the table. He said to wait one moment and then he left our table.

I watched as he serviced multiple tables and he never returned back to our table. He poured another table some wine, he took orders from a table adjacent. While my parents and I waited for the picture before starting to eat, our food started to become lukewarm and he started to help ourselves.  

We finished our food, unfortunately disappointed by the temperature, the portion size, pricing and abandonment of service. 

After we finished eating, the waiter finally came back 15 minutes later asking, Oh right, you wanted a picture? At this point, our mood had already been tainted.

A supervisor Jennifer Noble fortunately came by the table and profusely apologized; but the damage was done. She gave our table several small dessert bite sizes to nibble on. The sour taste of the meal could not wash away the prior hour.

Food:
Foie Gras - it was a thin layer of the liver sandwiched between an herbacious bread and slice of mango. These triplicate layers were repeated three times on top of each other in a stack. The bread layer definitely overpowered all other flavors. The mango was bland. The liver was virtually unnoticeable.

Lobster (3/5) - there was a beautiful lobster in appearance, but in taste, it was relatively bland. 

Halibut (3/5) - the fish was prepared over a nice white sauce and small little grapes and mushrooms adorning the dish. The grapes introduced a sour but bright contrast to the halibut, which I felt could have used some additional seasoning.

Steak (4/5_ - these were tiny slices with two pieces of asparagus, it was cooked well, the meat was tender and balanced in saucework.

Tips/Takeaways:
Although the food may taste okay, this was a birthday meal to remember for all the wrong reasons. 
From the lack of service checking on our table in between placing the entree dishes out to grabbing the check, from the lackluster explanations of dishes, from the inability to honor a simple picture request, from the smaller portion sizes and bland tastes, this ultimately was a meal that was not worth the heavy price tag.
It pains my heart to have to rate this experience so lowly.
Always an A+ experience. Perfect atmosphere and service - consistently. Ask for window seating if available. Hotel valet parking makes the entire dining experience even better!

Magical experience with the best food my wife and I have had in a long time. Highly recommend the 6 course meal!

Prepare to be whisked away to food paradise. They will treat you like Kings and Queens.

If you want to have an incredible dinning experience this is the place. The tasting menu and wine pairings are fantastic. The service is phenomenal. It is the perfect place for a formal, french, dining experience.

TLDR: unprofessional, messy service, questioned my friend's food allergy and had no knowledge of the menu, hosts wore customers coats from coat check, decent food

Went for our friend's birthday. While the culinary was pleasant, we found that the service was beyond underwhelming. From the start, our waiter forgot to take the order of someone in our party and left to go to another table. This is absolutely unacceptable for a high end establishment, and he came back seeming annoyed. Furthermore, the waiter filled the champagne glasses of everyone in our party except the same friend! My friend did nothing to that waiter, so I don't understand why it happened twice in a row. The waiter was also incredibly rude to one of my friends who has celiac disease (gluten allergy). When she asked if there were gluten free options the waiter seemed baffled, questioning the validity of her allergy, stating he had no idea which dishes could accommodate her allergy!! Furthermore, the waiters were quite slow and messy in their service. There were long stretches of time where we felt unattended. When they did some they were constantly spilling the liquids all over the table. In one instance, they spilled some champagne on a hand made card I gave to my friend. In another instance, water was spilled all over our plate. In both these cases, there was no attempt made to acknowledge the incident nor apologize. Even worse, we noticed some of the hosts going to grab coats for guests from coat check. We saw a host have the audacity to put on one of the coats and act as though he's walking a runway!! Absolutely ridiculous and unprofessional. We were looking for a pleasant afternoon experience and were instead left with blunder after blunder. Miss this establishment.
very good service and food. Location is also very premium. One of my best fine dining experience for sure.

Great food and service.  Wait staff is very customer focused.  While there the power was out and we were not able to order off of the menu and settle for what they had which wasn't our first choice.  Because of this they waived the bill.

I enjoyed my birthday brunch experience here so much. I was a little hesitant to dine at a restaurant inside a hotel initially, but I was so glad to get one of my birthday meals here. For $75 per person, you get a brunch buffet with some of the top-quality food, top-notch service and very elegant environment. Everything was impeccable. 

After coat check, a staff member showed us to the beautiful table right next to the large windows, where you can overlook the Rittenhouse Park. As first timers, we were shown around by the restaurant manager and introduced to different stations all over the restaurant. Some of the stations were located inside the kitchen and you're able to see everything that happens there. 

The food selection was amazing. You have your regular breakfast/brunch items, and you also have a variety of very specialized appetizers, entrée and desserts, even cheese and chocolate fondues. I particularly enjoyed the raw bar where we could get unlimited east coast and west coast oysters (east coast ones tasted better!). They tried to combine different styles of cuisines in their dishes, like a Vietnamese pho broth shooter, or a French Foie Gras S'more, etc. Each tiny dessert was a pleasant surprise too and they were so delicate. I did not have enough room to try out everything that looked tempting. 

To add on to all the good food, our server was so attentive that he made us a personalized list of all the food that contains cilantro, as we added a note about our dietary restriction on the reservation. 

I would love to go back again for brunch, and I would love to try the afternoon tea here too!

Wow! Wow! Wow!  My husband found this restaurant online for best places to eat Dinner when visiting Philly.  We arrived at the beautiful Hotel and were immediately blown away by the architecture of the building and beautiful setting.  We headed upstairs to meet our reservation and were sat immediately (we did make a reservation ahead of time).  This was a prefixed menu with very little variation and a specific cost for all courses.  We were not disappointed and extremely pleased with the courses.  Every new course was more amazing than the previous course.  The sommelier was on hand as we did the wine pairing and we also rec'd a complimentary glass of champagne upon arrival with a Yelp Check-in.  Every course was beautifully prepared and presented with such care.  We had a server, a head waiter, a busser, a sommelier and a bread and water attendant.  The service is one of the best I've had in a very long time and the price was worth the amazing and delicious courses and for the outstanding service.  I will be eating here again when we come into Philadelphia again because it was such a culinary experience.

I am not generally a fan of so-called fancy brunches--I feel no need to help clear-out some restaurant's leftovers amidst a roomful of hungover strangers when I can cook my own damn eggs in peace and quiet; nor oft do I partaketh in the hair of the dog.
This is different. 
This  here, this, is THE consummate Easter egg hunt for adults.
Here, one wanders wide-eyed thru a shimmering dream-field of inox, toque and open flame  Your neurons and olfactors, both reptilian and civilized, shall prickle with anticipatory dopamine as your visual cortex overclocks on the sheer magnitude of food so deeply detailed.
For here, in this open kitchen, the magic really is real.  

If you don't have a reservation, they'll fit you in but you won't get a window.
If you wipe out that grey/black pile of caviar with a teaspoon you will not be shamed. 
If you head to the elevator with a baguette sticking out of purse or pocket they will pretend not to notice.

Ate dinner here a few years ago and was blown away by the quality, selection, and creativity.  Was given choices for each course and loved everything I got.

Attempted to do dinner here more recently.  Stodgy, dated, limited menu with animal cruelty dishes in almost every advertised course (e.g., veal, foie gras).  No answer to my phone calls to see if alternatives available.  Broken promises to call back when I contacted them on FB Messenger.

Atmosphere opulence. Service impeccable. Food delectable. Overall decadence.

I don't even know where to begin, literally. I didn't realize it was inside the Rittenhouse Hotel, and then a series of twists and turns to find the actual restaurant. At least the lobby area and hallways are pure eye candy so it's nice getting lost. We came for the brunch buffet which is $75/person but it is well worth it. The service is what you would expect at such an upscale place. I also love the view of RIttenhouse Park with the entire wall of windows. We were a bit hesitant to bring our screaming toddler with us, but there seemed to be alot of families there with kids running around. This is a strange thing to note, but I was also very impressed by the high chair they provided us. 

The food is incredible. We skipped the food found in the seating area which consisted of standard breakfast items and a raw bar. Without giving away the surprise, we were whisked away to the main entrees. There are lots of fancy items between the appetizers, entrees, and desserts. My favorite appetizers are the Pho Broth Shooters with Quail Eggs and Shrimp Cakes. I tried all the carved meats, and my favorite is the giant scallop sausage.

This brunch is par excellence!! Don't bother with any of the normal brunch staples. The selection of unique food offerings across multiple food groups is nothing short of outstanding!  It is not inexpensive but treat yourself. It is worth every penny. You will come to the same conclusion that I did. All the other places are IHOPS compared to Lacroix.

Service -Outstanding
Food - Superlative

My only complaint is that the valet parking was very slow but in no way will that stop me from going back.

Nothing here is wrong - it is a perfectly lovely eating experience from the wonderful staff to the exceptional food. Not sure what to say except if you can, eat here. Most of the restaurant has park views, the bar gets lively, the attention to detail of the table - covering to settings is incomparable - and food - oh the food!!! Simple delicious every thing we had. Will go back just for the halibut.

I mean, I feel like it's kind of silly to write a review about this place as everyone knows it's one of the top notch places in Philadelphia. I went here for my birthday and the menu said "Happy Birthday", uhhh adorable! My favorite part was when they had my boyfriend taste the wine, when I was the wine person, and he corrected them. But honestly, the food is unique and fantastic, and the tasting course, despite the sizes are super filling. The caviar tasters, especially the leek one, was so delicious, I recommend all four of them 100%, this was my favorite part of the entire meal. They accommodated all my allergies and literally cooked stuff in separate oil for me. It really shows their care and seriousness to good service. However, this isn't a place for "fun", the decorations definitely hint at that BUT The service was fun, especially watching a drunk lady at the next table hit on our waiter, who handled it so well, (Go Dan!). Anyway go if you have an extra  400 bucks to spend.

Lacroix, without a doubt is definitely Michelin contender of the year. 

Must get: tasting menu, mocktails, Dan as your waiter
Missed out: wine pairing
Meh: nothing

We celebrated our anniversary here and immediately felt as if we were transported to another world of culinary and service excellence. The staff were highly attentive (the one's who'll fold your napkin if you leave your table for longer than 10 seconds), the decor was beautiful with large windows that overlooked the rittenhouse square. On arrival, we were treated to complimentary glasses of champagne, and multiple rounds of flavorful mid-meal snacks. Our main meal was white asparagus, halibut, rabbit, beef, with a multi-course dessert tasting including frozen coconut, marshmallow on a stick, and decorative cake, and truffle tasting and chocolate desserts to go. My favorite dish was definitely the wild rabbit with fava bean, sauce royale and the smoked sturgeon with chavings of white asparagus. Still have mouth watering memories.

At the end, we ate and were treated like kings and queens. This was a meal that I will never forget in Philadelphia. 

Food: 5 stars
Ambiance: 5 stars
Service: 5 stars
Price: 5 stars

I just celebrated my birthday here and had a wonderful time!  We had the plated 7-course tasting dinner but we had some extras courtesy of the chef since it was my birthday. I also remembered to check in at Yelp so we got two free glasses of champagne.  The waiting staff, the chef and the host were all very polite, nice, and attentive.  The plating, explanation, and the food itself were all very delicious.  The ambience was very nice.  We got cocktails on top of the champagne which was about $16 each.  The 7 course tasting menu was $125/person which is pricey but worth it because of the very unique experience.  We will be back again and maybe try their lunch/brunch menu some other time.

I eat out often but rarely write reviews. I wrote this because this restaurant has one of the best duck dishes I've had in the city! The service here was also fabulous  as was our view of the park. I plan on eating here again soon.

A high end and fancy place that caters to the finest of consumers. The lacroix restaurant presents itself very nicely and is definitely one of the fancier places here in Philly.

I have dined here a few times and would have to say, it is one of the more unique experiences. The food is delicious and the staff are one of the best. 

The first time I came here was on easter morning for a nice bunch with my grandparents and girlfriend. We were blown away by the presentation and staff right off the bat. The wait staff tended to our every need and gave us a tour of the food presentation areas. 

This is an all you can eat brunch, so there were many foods beautifully presented, along with nice decorations. Each station is very easy to access and use. 

The more unique part of this dining experience was the entry and food located in the kitchen area. While cooks are making the food, you can walk around and take food off of the stations. There are also manned stations  in which you can ask for specific things such as a cut of meat or a freshly made ice cream made with liquid nitrogen. 

Each station is clearly laid out and the waiters will assist in giving you a tour and helping choose tasty foods. Many of the foods here are fancier such as the caviar and the tasty s'mores foie gras. 

For specific stations, there is a meat station, where you can get tasty, freshly cut in front of you, steaks and things such as Wagyu. There is a dessert station, which hosts a plethora of tasty desserts, a chocolate fountain, and a person that makes ice cream for you. (Also in front of you) There is a breakfast station, that has many of the basic breakfast foods: eggs, potatoes, bacon, etc.  there is also a raw bar with many oysters, shrimp, and other delicious options. There are many more stations as well. 

The dress code here is more upscale and nicer, so you should try to wear something a little nicer. I have seen individuals wear jeans and a tee shirt, bu t this sort of makes the place awkward since everyone else is dressed up. 

For drinks, there is a full bar with many options. You can order whatever you want, and it will come back perfect. They try to make it a really great experience, so your happiness is taken into account. 

I would also like to address the more classy, spoiled, and rich people. My first encounter with a waiter involved many sirs and pardons, so if you are a fancy snob, you will be treated as a king/queen. At the time, I found this funny because of the fact that I am very used to talking to waiters and waitresses casually. This waiter made me feel special. Very cool!

The amount of tasty food you can eat is massive, and you will be amazed at how full you can get. If you want to have a great experience, I would say try everything and if you are still hungry, take the things you enjoyed the most. 

The bathrooms are also very nice and upscale. I was surprised to find complimentary bottles of mouth wash in the men's room and complimentary sewing kits and other things in the women's (found by girlfriend) 

Getting reservations for here is a little tricky, as it is usually booked and very upscale. A person needs to pull some  strings to get here, but it is well worth it. 

Overall, this place was very unique and impressive. I recommend going here, and if you want to be even more impressed, go during a holiday/ special occasions. A really great place to go and even better food pics!

Views are awesome too so get a window seat!

business.name: Fleming’s Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar
business.categories: Nightlife, Seafood, Steakhouses, Bars, Restaurants, Wine Bars

reviews.text: Food was great, service was excellent. The building was a bit warm, we did feel the ac kick on for about a min.
Our Go To for every special occasion. Great food, very pricey, but you do get your money's worth.

My husband and I came because we were celebrating our when your anniversary, I should've been more hesitant in the beginning when hostess gave us attitude. But we proceed to sit down and enjoy a nice meal, a lot of people had told me that it was a wonderful place to have luxury steaks( I called them liar) the side dishes were better than the actual steak! My husband ordered medium and they gave it him raw when that waitress asked if we needed anything we brought it up to her attention she just shrugged and walked away and brought us our check. I wouldn't go back, they really need to go back to basics.

Do yourself a favor go to the market get yourself a steak and make it at home. I've been less disappointed eating a steak at chilis for a fraction of the price. Since when Does medium mean raw? And when I told one of the waiters there she said ok and kept going with her day and this is supposed to be quality? Miss me with that. I wouldn't return if it was free. #SorryNotSorry
#ItsBloodyRaw!
Visiting the area. We arrived on Tomahawk Tuesday and, of course, ordered that. Meat cooked to perfection. Wonderful salads, sides and desserts. We were very full & happy!
We had a lovely New Year's Eve dinner!  Food was delicious and service was excellent; perfect way to ring in the new year.

Second time coming here and I must admit the first time was better.  We had the booth last time as well.  Perhaps, I could've asked.  Lobster bisque, Mac and cheese, and calamari are still good.  We tried the seared pork belly and it was out of this world.  Ordered the dry aged ribeye.  It was a bit well for me as I wanted it medium.  The server did offer a chance for a re-done but I was super hungry so I just ate it.  It was still good, but the robust flavors I was accustomed to was not there.  Service was good.

Flemmings is a staple chain about a half step down from a Capital Grille. I really loved their Duckhorn pairing tasting. Excellent (and consistently excellent) service as well as consistently good food. Make sure to make a reservation as I was last in on a Thursday night and it was absolutely packed. Would not recommend it for those pandemic anxious as there were minimal if not any covid precautions. Would definitely recommend it for that special occasion or business dinner based on the food and service.

Always a great night out- great food and atmosphere!
The crab cakes are my absolute favorite!
The ABSOLUTE BEST steakhouse in Tucson.  My husband and I enjoyed EVERYTHING about our experience there.
Delicious high quality food great ambiance highly recommend. Definitely special occasion
Great outdoor patio with heaters. The food is phenomenal! Fabulous customer service.  Highly recommended.

Best spot for a nice dinner in Tuscon. My folks live on the south side so it's nice to style them out here when I come back to visit. Goood eats, good service. Wine list is about as good as you're gonna find out here. We'll be back!

Excellent meal and great service love dining in.

We had bone one bone in ribeye with poached lobster. Another bone in ribeye regular. French onion soups and the pan seared pork belly, and augratin potatos. Carrot cake we took home.

Everything was delicious cooked to our liking. We would not do the pork belly again we didn't care for it. Soups were tasty and filling the cheese melted on top is like a meal itself so good! Love the augratin potatos with chilles the perfect amount of heat with all that creaminess. 

You can never go wrong with Flemings love it for dinner.

This was the most spectacular meal we have had in the USA!  Everything we ordered was perfect! The salad was so  fresh, the plate was chilled and the taste was delicious. Everyone's entree, and each of the four sides we shared were all phenomenal. Our drinks and the wine were each fabulous. The service was absolutely amazing and perfect in every way. Our wonderful waiter Chris was fun, friendly, curtious, polite and so efficient. We're all looking forward to another evening at Flemings!
They always have excellent service and make the best carrot cake and key lime pie on earth!!!

Calamari appetizer to DIE FOR. Get the seafood sampler too. IT WON'T DISAPPOINT . Had some drinks at the bar, great female bartender and friendly. Well worth the price . Oh and the appetizers are enough for a dinner.

Danielle V was our server. I have been coming to Fleming's for years now. The food has never been anything less than superb. This review is more about service. Our server had a spot on night. Attitude, sense of humor, personality, mannerisms, precision in everything made our experience tonight top notch. Her performance would be competitive in any venue. Fleming's is privileged to have her and so we're we. Thanks again Danielle and Mateo

Fleming's made our 51st wedding anniversary extra special. Service was impeccable, our Server Host, Chris, was attentive and informative without being obtrusive. The Ribeye and the Fleming Potatoes were superb. The added touch of the anniversary card and cake were a nice touch.

We just popped in for a quick nosh and a drink .
This was a disappointment.
They have done away with happy hour and a wedge salad is half the size it used to be .
The crab cakes were horrible . They were very salty and filled with onions . Poorly done.
Now the SHOCKER - we ordered martinis and a Kettle one martini was $17.00 - yes $17.00.
This is ridiculous.
Even in some very swankier places it's not that much .
We still not be going back any time soon for sure .
Management should be looked at if they want the clients to come back .
By the way , the table beside use 3 business me commented how over priced the place is .
Stay away
This is a upscale Manhattan quality steak house in Tucson. This is my favorite restaurant in Tucson. Delicious. I suggest the "Fire" prix fixe.
Fleming's is our go to place for fabulous food, cocktails and service.  All of the staff work together to ensure a wonderful experience.  We highly recommend Fleming's for the perfect evening out!

5 stars from the minute we walked in the door until the moment we left. The employees at the hostess station were very nice and even more professional. The wait staff was top notch. The food was great. I have nothing bad to say about our experience. It was my husband's birthday and they recognized it without being over the top or embarrassing like those no class steak joints. They presented him with a card on arrival, provided dessert with a nice "Happy Birthday" design on the plate, and gave him a gift of chocolates to take home. Our server and his helper were just fantastic. They were friendly, professional, personable, and fun. The meal wasn't inexpensive. Unfortunately it isn't a place you would attend regularly, but for a special occasion, I highly recommend it. A fantastic experience all around. Great job Flemings!!

Excellent restaurant!! Has it all - great food, service, ambiance. In these days where many restaurants are so short on staff, service and air conditioning Flemings is a stand out place to have dinner!!

As predicted, this was a great experience. Excellent service, excellent food. Went there for my dad's birthday. Walked in and saw a card on the table and left with four melt in your mouth chocolate truffles on the house. Very nice touches. My dad was happy.

Calamari was a great starter. Surprisingly generous portion, perfect crisp, and very fresh (not rubbery at all).

Mac n cheese and mashed potato's were delicious. I like more texture in my potato's but their version is smooth. This is just my preference. Mac n cheese was very smooth. Again I prefer more texture--but theirs is just smooth gooey cheese. Also just my own preference. Asparagus was tender and well cooked. Very buttery as well.

Steaks were high quality, and tasty. Lobster was fresh and delicious as well.

Desserts were awesome. Loved the cheesecake. Loved the lava cake, which was great with the ice cream. Beautiful presentation.

Waiters were very kind, professional, attentive. Bill was high but expected. You pay for the experience and I personally had no regrets.

business.name: Govinda's Vegetarian
business.categories: Vegan, Cheesesteaks, Restaurants, Vegetarian, Sandwiches

reviews.text: Loved this place. Their cheesesteaks would fill my belly and soul. Some of the best vegan food I've had. Govinda's will be missed

This used to be a pilgrimage spot anytime we came to Philadelphia.
The BEST chicken cheese steaks around. I know so many people who'd drive hours just to eat here. The desserts and drinks and everything was just on point. 

It's such a shame that it's closed. I was in the city yesterday and my heart dropped to see the closed sign. Hopefully the owner decides to open up again one day. This restaurant will be terribly missed.

The food used to be good but I don't know what happened. The chicken cheesesteak bread was stale. The Fries were completely trenched in oil and soggy. It's was literally like tasting the bottoms of the fryer. Disgusting, go at your own risk.

I've been here 5 or 6 times and it's really a hit or miss. The chicken cheesesteak, chicken nuggets, and fish sandwich are great (Blackbird's cheesesteak is still better). Shrimp nuggets and fries are okay. Meatball sub is decent but wouldn't recommend it.

Last night I got the golden tofu wrap which was completely inedible. I can usually choke down food even if it's not great, but this was just bad. The rice was undercooked, the tofu was soggy, and the flavor was weird. I don't know if I'll go back after that.

Tooooookkk forever for some damn chicken nuggets and for my quesadilla with hardly cheese all the soy was falling out all over and they didn't have salsa to dip in so they gave it to me dry .. so now I've been waiting for 40 min and looks like my quesadilla is about burnt  ... never again

Loved this place! Came to visit from Florida and was so excited to try Govinda's! I had read different blogs and they came up often. I came in with the mindset to try a Phillycheese "steak" but instead was recommended to try the chicken cheese steak with mozzarella, bbq and hot sauce. I was hesitant but once we tried we were left shocked it was amazing!! So sad I don't have it back home but def recommend for all my vegetarian pals!

Innovative and simply delicious.
Freshly prepared and hot.
The tangy meat texture can be felt with the soy in the sandwiches.... staff is friendly and conscientious of vegan etiquette as it is the way of life for many.
Nice little corner spot on south and broad.
Good food, decent price! If you are getting your food to go definitely call ahead because you'll be waiting forever. The cheesecake is the best.
This place hires workers from the ghetto who mow over customers with trash bags. Rude, dirty, and disgusting.
Good food, new location that didn't quite find its identity. I believe to have met the owner/chef who was very friendly but the cashier who took our order was a little unprofessional.
Finally got there and yes great would have like to have tried more from the menu but my regular veggie dishes worked and the service was good.

Thumbs up for vegan food!! I've been searching​ for a vegan spot sinceI​i changed my diet...slowly...I thought to give Govinda a try by the search​engine​e of yelp to help me find you! I don't​ regret my visit and will most likely return​ if I'm​ ever in the city again!

Not sure what happened to this place but it is now disgusting and their service is extremely slow. Upon walking in, I was almost skeptical to order but I felt bad just walking out. It no longer has the same feel as when their location was right on the corner. Will probably never return again. So unfortunate.

This is the best Philly cheesesteak in philly! The "chicken" is peppery and delicious.  The vegan cheese is creamy and you can't even tell it's vegan.  The bread was crispy.  My only complaint is they don't have a bunch of seating

called made reservation
joke only three seats inside
no one waited on us
place FILTHY
wont go back
stay away
had to beg for menues

We always return to this place each time we visit Philadelphia. Their chicken cheesesteak tastes just like meat and is so delicious. I cannot believe it is not meat. Customer service is fast and efficient. This is one of my favorite vegan places.

I ordered from door dash on a Friday night.. it wasn't too long of a wait, but I ordered the quesadilla and everything was falling apart. There was only a little vegan cheese on their as well, it was like they didn't even try to make it good. It's not too hard to make, so I was a little disappointed.
Customer service is not good. Food is hit or miss, mostly misses but 2 stars for the occasional hit.

I am a vegetarian. I came to Philly for work. When I arrived I was tasked with finding some philly cheese-steaks, which wouldn't be very hard obviously, but I also, wanted to eat. I was really excited about a vegetarian philly cheese steak in Philadelphia. I did a search and "Govinda's Vegetarian" was the first place I found that looked relatively close, had plenty of options for me, and had some other options nearby for my non vegetarian passengers.

At 11:00am, I shared the small restaurant with one other patron. I was greeted by the very friendly hostess promptly. She made recommendations, and I ordered a vegetarian chicken cheese steak sandwich with vegan mozzarella and vegan mayo. The sandwich took about 15 minutes to come out, the fries were another 10 after that. The food was delicious. There is a place to eat outside on the sidewalk that looks to be shared by 3 other restaurants.

My overall experience was very good because of the food. The only negatives was the time it took to make my French fries, which I can only conclude was some sort of fluke with the fryer or something, and a seemingly rude boss, who I sure wouldn't take being talked to the way he talked to his employees. Despite that, I would definitely come back.

Great place for vegetarians! Place was a little small but food is def work checking out! Has some "fake meat" options which is why I went there! They have pizza and other food too, I probably will go for that next time I'm in Philly.

If I could give negative stars to this place, I would. Not only was it the WORST "food" I've had in q very long time, but it was ridiculously overpriced, especially considering they didn't have half the items on the menu, and I had to settle for a different soup after I'd already paid for the one I wanted that they didn't have.  Ypu couldn't PAY,me to ever eat hete again.

Extremely slow customer service. They charged my card multiple times just to void it out and recharge it. I spent 15 minutes paying for a slice of cake and ended getting a ticket on my car as a result. Management didn't seem very apologetic, or very knowledgeable about using a cash register. Never again!

Unfortunately, after years of loving this place, I can't say the same about it anymore. The buffet food I got was cold, and I had to encourage them to make it for me because they did not look like they were planning on even making it unless I said something. The chicken cheesesteak was great, but we waited almost 30 minutes for them to make it amongst many other costumers who had ordered long ahead of us. It's clear that the staff do not care about this restaurant anymore, which breaks my heart a little because this used to be one of my favorite restaurants (and that says something considering there are a TON of excellent vegan restaurants in philly). If you decide to come here, be prepared to wait a long time and do some nagging in the process, and only get one of the cheesesteaks or a quesadilla.
God tier vegan food. Anyone who says otherwise is wrong. Absolute best faux chicken I've ever had in my life.

Innovative and simply delicious.
Freshly prepared and hot.
The tangy meat texture can be felt with the soy in the sandwiches.... staff is friendly and conscientious of vegan etiquette as it is the way of life for many.
Nice little corner spot on south and broad.

business.name: Ocean Prime
business.categories: Steakhouses, Seafood, Restaurants, Desserts, American (New), Food

reviews.text: This place is amazing!!! Food was the best ever. Steak and fish was tender and flavorful. Mashed potatoes were so creamy super yummy!

Had a wonderful birthday lunch with my goddaughter yesterday and the only reason I didn't give it five stars was tho the service was  consistently very friendly, and started out great, we seemed to lose our waiter about halfway through the meal. 
Someone else delivered our entrées, our waiter or actually no one checked back with us to see how everything was, (food service 101-you always check back with the diner to ensure everything is to their satisfaction), I had to flag down a different waiter to let him know my food was actually cold. He took it away and then someone else came and checked back to see if it was better this time - so... Overall very good, but more consistent & attentive service, & hot entree Would've made it perfect.

So let's start off I really wanted to give them 5 stars. It's a beautiful high class Resteraunt. We'll laid out with a nice water view (some buildings and a shopping center) but still a nice view of a big body of water.
There are servers and bus boys and girls and helpers all over.
Nice table outside the main dining room but still covered and warm. Waiter (started off) helpful , friendly and attentive (that didn't last). Great menu choices and specials all high end with an appropriate cost to match. 
Bread basket outstanding with soft pretzel sticks my all time favorite. French onion soup appetizer well done and Washington State oysters. First 5 really tasty the 6th, rancid and sour. Mentioned this to the waiter then one of the managers came over apologizing and offering another serving which I declined (big meal coming) so she comped these on the bill. That's great service and relations.
Dinner comes NY Strip with blue cheese and an imported filet mignon oscar and a lobster tail. All perfectly cooked, another plus.
Here is where it falls apart, but first I digress. Wife tells me business casual. On their web site no issues, socks, shirt l, shoes and a sport coat. In the lobby people being seated with shorts, flip flops, T-shirts etc. hey everyone deserves to eat right and pay these prices.
Back to our sever he disappeared for about 18 minutes after we had stopped eating (we had leftovers). Why you may ask? We'll he had a table of eight and was opening and pouring bottle after bottle of wine. I can imagine the bill and tip associated with that. But hey we're just 2 people with a measly $200+ bill why worry. 
Finally he stops by, can we get some containers for left overs? Sure and another 10 minutes while he's pouring more wine and hopping around. Meanwhile there are numerous bus people moving about, so we grab one can we speak to the manager from earlier. 
She pops over we explain and she's again apologetic and tells us when you come back see her she'll make sure everything goes right. To her credit she also comped our two drinks and offered me my free birthday dessert to go which I declined.
Bottom line, great atmosphere, food and view. Hopefully you get the more observant server?
Such a nice restaurant with attentive staff. The food, atmosphere, and vibes is all around beautiful. I been here so many times and still till this day.. no complaints. Highly recommend!

We took my parents out to eat here for there anniversary dinner. This was. One of the best meals we ever had in Tampa. I would recommend Ocean Prime to everyone. Food was spectacular, drinks were good. But the desert was simply amazing! The server was one of the best As well. She knew everything about the menu and was on point.

Ocean Prime is one of my favorite places to eat in FL. From the moment you walk in you are graced with a beautiful and elegant entryway. 

The hostess' are super accommodating and very friendly. Not to mention the servers are fantastic. It's truly an experience eating here. Yes, the food is 100 percent worth the price. Your paying for perfection and that is what Ocean Prime provides from service to food and every aspect in between. 

I got the sea bass, which is the best sea bass I have ever eaten. Its laid on top of mash potatoes (which are mouth watering) and compliments the fish perfectly. Just order it!! 

My husband got the filet mignon - he's from WI and is a meat man, he said it was the best he had ever had. We also ordered the truffle fries, which again the best I've ever had. 

We had cocktails which were mixed to perfection. Everything about Ocean Prime is fabulous and out of all the upper class places to eat, this one takes the cake. 

Just go there, you won't regret it.

I hosted my Father's 80th here in their private room and I have to say the team at Ocean Prime is top notch.  We had a set menu so I can't comment on the entire Ocean Prime dining experience; however, for what we enjoyed, I recommend.

My Wife's and I first Anniversary! Set reservations 2 weeks ahead of time just in case. Upon arrival we were greeted with a glass of champagne for each of us as a celebration for our special day. All the staff were smiling and greeted us. As soon as you enter you can feel the good vibe and the atmosphere of the place is enthralling! After being seated we met our waiter, Austin, who provided the best of service! Very friendly and helpful with any questions we had. The food didn't take long at all. I went with them Lamb Chops and a side of grilled mushrooms. My wife opted for the crab cakes with a side of asparagus. All of which was exceptional! Spot on! Her Black Orchid drink tasted perfect. If you haven't been here and your reading this, this is your sign

Yes ! This is it ! I can't say a single thing that bothered me. From drinks to desert it was just perfect. I just don't know how we haven't been here before! Ha! 
Dinner included bottle water, several alcohol drinks , steak, fish , desert.  All around $350. It was worth it. 
I always just restaurants like this one by how well they can cook sea bass. If you have eaten this fish you know even a minute longer on grill or oven could ruin it. 
I'll be back   Recommend

This was Novio and my first time at Ocean Prime! We made reservations about a week in advance and at that point only the outdoor patio was available (completely worth it and COVID SAFE). The outdoor patio is gorgeous with fans for air circulation, built in heating lamps for when it gets cold (72 is cold in Florida), and a beautiful view of the late at night. This is a great place to celebrate something special! It's very intimate and well decorated.

Time for our favorite part, food! Okay the food was absolutely delicious, we ordered the chilled crab meat cocktail as an appetizer "like butter" and not too filling. OH an before the appetizer, they bring you BREAD, delicious warm assortment of bread!

Now for the entree! I ordered the FLORIDA GROUPER gfm Lobster, Gnocchi, Spring Peas, Lemon Jus (copied that directly from their menu to make it easier on you, you're welcome). It was absolutely mouth watering! I could have licked the plate.

Novio (promoted to future husband) ordered the 10 OZ FILET MIGNON, you may think Ocean Prime is seafood only, think again! As sides we ordered the SAUTÉED MUSHROOMS gfm and BLACK TRUFFLE MAC & CHEESE. The sides were a little too large for the both of us so we ended up taking most of the mac n cheese home because reheated mushrooms are  no no. 

DESSERT TIME- Okay don't think twice, order the butter cake, ORDER IT. It is the most delicious cake I have eaten in a very long time. 

Overall, great time! I recently got a new job so guess where Novio and I are going?

Everything was good! First time, second time, they do it to perfection. The steak, the lobster, the soups, dessert. Top notch service, and excellent food. They deliver, you get what you pay for...it all worth it here! I highly recommend this place, it's in one word excellent.

This was our first visit to Ocean Prime.  The restaurant is located right next to Crate & Barrel on the south side of International Mall in Tampa. They share a parking lot.  We made reservations and you should too!  The place was packed for a Monday night.

For appetizers, we ordered the Point Judith Calamari and the Jumbo Crab Cake.  The fried calamari was covered in a delicious Thai-style sweet chili sauce.  It was perfect.  The crab cake is a dish that everyone should order.  It was great!  We also both got a bowl of the Lobster Bisque.  It had a nice presentation but it wasn't the best I've ever had.  The lobster was chewy and it was a bit too thick. I wouldn't get it again.

For entrées, we ordered the Blackened Snapper and the Florida Grouper.  The snapper was spicy and perfectly cooked. It was served atop spoon bread and a tasty jalapeño corn relish.  The grouper was served in a bowl atop lobster and gnocchi in a broth.  It was also perfectly cooked.  These were both wonderful dishes!

For side dishes,  we got the Roasted Brussels Sprouts and the Jalapeño Potatoes Au Gratin.  The Brussel Sprouts were ok.  The star of the show was the Jalapeño Potatoes!  

For dessert, we ordered the Warm Butter Cake and the Chocolate Cake.  The Warm Butter Cake did live up to all the hype as their best dessert.  The chocolate cake was rich, decadent and delicious.  The only negative about their desserts was their price point.

Overall, we had a great time and would gladly go again. The service was speedy and friendly.  It's a beautiful restaurant however it can be a bit noisy.

Ocean Prime has been my all time favorite restaurant, as it is hard for me and my fiancé to eat out, because he is a chef. I have been a loyal customer for years, and I say this with sadness that the quality has gone down. General manager Cal is no longer there, and the new GM doesn't handle the customer service end even nearly like Cal. A reservation of mine was deleted and the GM had basically blamed me and my group, stating that someone must of called and canceled. So he had to "squeeze" in my reservation. I ordered my steak, medium rare, it looked as if it had been thrown on the grill and taken off immediately. A few of our orders were messed up as well. Our server, Luis however was friendly and welcoming. I am disappointed with so much of Ocean Prime that I do not think I will be returning. I raved about this place to all my friends and family so much, but now the quality had def gone down.

I took my elderly Mom to celebrate her Birthday and she chose Ocean Prime. Upon arrival, the entire Staff treated my Mom like a VIP and added special celebration decorations to our table. Our server (Kathleen), even while very busy with other tables, did not miss a beat, and gave us INCREDIBLE wonderful service every moment!!!!!! The food also was fantastic. We have been to many high class restaurants in NYC and Tampa in our lives. Neither of us have ever gone to Ocean Prime before. With that said, having a 5+ star dinner with said awesome service, Ocean Prime is now our family's GO TO restaurant for all our family special occasions & wanting a great meal/atmosphere/service. Thank you Kathleen, the Chefs and Staff  My Tip happily reflected my appreciation. Additionally, I made it a point to speak to the Ocean Prime Manager to convey my great appreciation of what I have already stated. Thank you Ocean Prime to make a Senior Citizen smile and feel like a Queen!!!!!!
The place is rely fancy and cool like a movie star place.  My mom said she did not like the crabby legs.  They are small and was mad that they are little.  I hope I can go back there.

Finally a date night at one of my favorite places. Ocean prime has a very sexy vibe and perfect for an intimate dinner. It is on the pricer side so keep that in mind. 

We started with jumbo crab cake and dynamite roll with shrimp tempura. Both delicious. 

Both Entrees were filet mignon and our sides were lobster mash potatoes and creamed spinach. Absolutely out of this world. I mean, this meal is seriously outstanding. 

Then with no room left, of course we had to get the famous butter cake. I believe that was my ultimate reason for coming lol

Definitely one of the hot streak houses in the Tampa area. Must try at least once for perhaps a special
Occasion. You will not be disappointed.

Great dining experience.  Went to dinner last night with family in Tampa. The restaurant is beautiful inside and they have a few dining table options with reservation which I highly recommend even on a weeknight.  Bar tables can be reserved as well as outside dining.
We started at the bar for a quick happy hour because we arrived a little before our reservation. Found a bunch of seats and sat. The bartender had a bit of an attitude which rubbed us the wrong way at first but luckily he (name starts with a J and rhymes with possum) did not serve us most of our drinks. We found they had a happy hour drink and snack menu with a small but good variety. 
The TEQUILA COCKTAIL  Corzo Silver Tequila, Fresh Squeezed Orange And Lime Juice, House Infused Agave Nectar was very sweet but nice and flavorful. They make a very good Espresso Martini even though that was not on the happy hour reduced price menu. The bar bites could easily be a good meal option and everything on the bar bite menu is $5 off during the hours of 4-6pm. 
The  JUMBO LUMP CRAB CAKE  Kale, Pickled Fennel, Horseradish Mustard Aioli  was delicious and not much wasted filler. Lots of big pieces of crab body meat. 
The  SPICY TUNA*  Cucumber, Scallion, Tempura Fried  was awesome. Not much rice and a great flavor of chopped tuna on top. 
In the dining room, we had Jake as our lead  server from his team and he was one of the best servers we have ever had. On point with recommendations and spaced our meal out perfectly so we had time to enjoy the evening. My synopsis of what we ordered. 
We started with appetizers for the table. The SONOMA GOAT CHEESE RAVIOLI  Golden Oak Mushrooms  were tender and the pasta in the sauce make them perfectly silky. 
The OCEAN ROLL* gfm  #1 Tuna, Salmon, Hamachi, Avocado, Chili Garlic Oil was so fresh and good for sharing which we did. The WHITE TRUFFLE CAVIAR DEVILED EGGS gfm had a little drop of caviar on top and although they were not complicated, they were smooth and very good. (Like momma used to make). As if we had not ordered enough appetizers, we also added The SMOKED GOUDA TATER TOTS from the sides and were so glad we did. They were not greasy at all and a pretty big portion. It came with a mayonnaise flavored dipping sauce which was perfect. I added a little Tabasco to it and it then had the perfect added kick.
On to the entrees.
I ordered the SHELLFISH "COBB" SALAD gfm Bacon, Blue Cheese, Gourmet Dressing and I don't know what was in the dressing but it was perfect and not overpowering the shellfish. Perfect portion and I felt it was the best after all the appetizers eaten. Most of the family ordered  the 8 OZ FILET MIGNON which they claimed was just as good as Bern's prime beef with a Loaded Sea Salt Baked Potato. My son had the TERIYAKI SALMON*  Shiitake Sticky Rice, Soy Butter Sauce and I think he ate it before I was able to get a picture (it was that! good)
Jake then asked if we were celebrating anything special for our family and since it was the weekend of our son and his wife's  baby shower he was happy to bring us 2 desserts for the table. Two of their best by my accolades.
Chocolate Peanut butter Pie was OMG delicious! Creamy, silky and wonderful. Not crazy sweet but perfect. 
The Warm Butter Cake with a big scoop of Vanilla Ice-cream on top and a maceration of berries on the plate was a great alternative if you are not a chocolate and peanut butter fan. The cake was warm and moist. Easy to cut and share. 
Overall, it was a fantastic dining evening and really look forward to my next return visit and I will definitely be requesting Jake and his team!

I went for the first time on my birthday. No complaints. I had the dynamite roll for an appetizer and the surf n turf for dinner although that's an appetizer as well. My boyfriend and the blackened snapper. We also had the chocolate cake for dessert. It's a large slice and very rich, we finished it at home.  Everything was delicious. The service was great, Nate was our server. We sat outside and had a perfect view of the pond and fountain and the full moon.

Personally, I'm not huge of major chain restaurants, especially when they're on the pricier side, so I would've never thought to give Ocean Prime a chance. However, I was surprisingly very pleased with my experience here. 

They were kind enough to make pregnant me a non-alcoholic version of their signature Berries and Bubbles cocktail (the one made with dry ice)! All of the food was fresh and flavorful, and the portion sizes were larger than expected. The grouper with lobster and gnocchi was a combination of three of my favorite things. It's like it was made for me. And the lobster Mac and cheese was pretty much perfection. Still, the price was rather steep, even with the quality food and good-sized portions. 

Although we dined as a large group of 10 people, we were served promptly and all of our orders came out timely and just as we requested. All-in-all, I was rather pleased with Ocean Prime!

Good service. Just not when the waiter said the brussel sprout side was pretty big and it could feed 2 people. Hmm, no way whatsoever. I am glad I didn't get another side. Also, he said they were to order as is, so. No modifications. That was unfortunate because they were covered in everything that  makes the vegetable totally unhealthy.

We celebrated our 24th Anniversary last night at Ocean Prime and it was excellent!  From check-in (2 glasses of champagne) to presentation (rose petals on the table) food and service it was all 5 Stars.  For a first time visit, it couldn't have gone any better.  Table ordered ribeye steaks one bone-in (24oz) and one (16oz) boneless (both were amazing), seabass (unbelievable) , grouper (excellent) and twin lobster tails (very good) everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals.  And I can't forget the warm butter cake for dessert, it's definitely a must have!  Thanks to the entire staff including the manager who stopped by twice to wish us a happy anniversary, we will be back soon!
If you're looking for a cheap this is definitely not it the prices are very expensive per person but the food quality in the service is fantastic so I guess one offsets the other excellent place

I had the calamine, crab cake and the snapper.  Truly disappointed with the main dish, it was average at best.  On a positive note the crab cake is excellent.  I would highly recommend this place for a date and sit near the piano bar.  Would recommend the crab cakes and not sure about anything else.

Not impressed tonight. 3 steaks undercooked. Lobster tail was covered in seasoning. Sides tasted delicious but they brought a side we didn't order and by the time we receive the correct one we had already finished our entree. Brought wrong dessert. They did end up bringing what we ordered eventually. Just a lot of mistakes and no real wow factor with service.

Took my husband here for his birthday, food was good, however I don't think it was worth the prices. Our server was a little weird. My inlaws wanted dessert and our server took the menus and let me and my husband order dessert but never even acknowledged my inlaws and asked what they would like. We had to get our servers attention and let them know that my inlaws would also like dessert. We all felt pretty awkward after that. Not sure what happened there honestly.... The manager was very nice and came over to tell my husband happy birthday.

business.name: The Ritz-Carlton Bacara, Santa Barbara
business.categories: Restaurants, Beauty & Spas, American (New), Event Planning & Services, Hotels, Massage, Resorts, Day Spas, Hotels & Travel, Venues & Event Spaces

reviews.text: Beautiful setting. Nice addition to the chain. Great service by Jon! Food was good. And the ambiance was nice too.

Only a solid THREE STARS. 

I will put in details for my review here. This review is not biased, pure 100%  our experience staying at Ritz Carlton Bacara Santa Barbara. 

Ritz Carlton SB is not located in a prime area. This is a resort,  their property is isolated away from downtown so that customers can enjoy the activities that the resort provides, such as hiking by the beach, biking around the hotel area. Mind you, this hotel is not walkable to restaurants in SB, they provided their own chain restaurants to make guests enjoy and relax at the property.

Here is our experience:
Like any other experienced travellers, we booked our hotels through credit card partners using our mileage. Who pay their hotel rooms in full nowadays anyways? Most smart people pay their hotel rooms with points or mileage affiliated with credit cards company. Originally we booked for double beds. However a day before, I received an email from them that my room was changed to single bed. This is quite impossible to our situation since we have 2 adults and 2 children. So I called (many times) to our credit card company and to Ritz to make sure we would get 2 double beds instead of 1 single king bed. The number of phone calls to change the number of beds did not happen only in one call, unfortunately. I had to call them several times before our arrival. 

So, arrival day, we got our 2 double beds. Perfect. Checking in was a smooth process. The receptionist was polite, explaining us everything about the resort. By the way, the resort has so many activities that you could book first through their website. And I also appreciate the concierge emailed us days before reminding us about the activities on the days we stay. (Tips: the receptionist offered us a transportation like a luggage cart to transport the guests to your villas, ACCEPT IT! Ritz carlton property is so huge that you can even get lost in the area. You can walk if you want to reach your 10k steps, though). 

When we got to our hotel, problem arise. Tv did not work. I called the receptionist, and the technician came after an hour later. They tried their best to fix tv, unfortunately the problem was much bigger than they expected. The sad part was they KNEW the tv was broken already and Ritz didn't even solve the problem. (Technician told me our previous guest also had the same problem - broken tv). So, me just being me, asking for a compensation for the broken tv. The technician was very generous giving us $100 restaurant fee.  And I took it with my grateful heart. 

Resort wise; this property again has a lot activities that you can do with your kids, partners, etc. Hiking by the beach is the most popular activities done by my people. Biking around the area also a great thing to do. 

During check out time, there was a bit problem since I wanted to redeem the $100 certificate that the technician gave me. A bit miscommunication happened at that time, but they resolved it quickly.

Would I recommend you guys to stay here? if you have $1000 extra to spare for staying a night here, sure you should. 
Don't forget to add
Parking vallet is $53 a day
Resort fee is $50 a day. (that's why maximise the property since you're charged hefty for resort fee). 

Other than that, yes I would stay again here. Hopefully I can bump this review to 4 star next time.

Amazing hotel with such such comfy rooms. We had a iv and there was an area right outside the room where he could go in the morning..so so convenient..there was a small lawn with a gorgeous fountain right outside the room which was awesome. The GYM WAS BEYOND FANTASTIC!!! the views were great. Service was great at the coffee shop and the bar. Room service we got it in the lobby was great. THE YUCCA FRIES ARE A MUST Have!!! The chips and guacamole were totally yum! We got takeout in the lobby and hung out which was so fun! Having a fridge and microwave in the room was so helpful. We will definitely come back. Highly recommend!

I was very cautious staying here with the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised! The front desk representative, Spencer, went above and beyond to make sure our stay went well. He greeted us with a smile and checked in with us when we were leaving the lobby. I cannot say enough about he made our experience. I don't give reviews often, but my experience with him set apart our experience. I would gladly come back because of how he made our experience! I cannot recommend this location enough!

The location is great. However, the hotel itself is lacking. First, they'll send an email requesting information, ie are you celebrating a special event, etc and if so, to let them know if you have any requests. So we let them know we were celebrating a special event, and if possible, we would like a room with a view. They responded that it's probably not possible lol but sent us a menu of items we can purchase to make our celebration memorable haha 

This hotel charges around $800/night + parking (whether self parking or valet, it's $50+) + resort fees. And they couldn't be bothered to make it memorable. We got a room with no view and with broken items.

We stayed for 3 nights. The entire stay the television was broken and the water wouldn't get hot. It is winter, and 2 out of the 3 days, it was raining. A hot water shower would've been nice. When I told the front desk, kindly, she was condescending about my complaint. Like I was an idiot for even watching tv lol and she even didn't bother to address the lack of hot water, at all. Instead, she kept asking if I needed an envelope for my folio. No, I do not need an envelope for my receipt lol

Overall, I don't recommend coming here. There's hotels that cost 80% less that provide better service and actually has hot water and working tv's (if you watch tv lol).

One of the most fantastic places one can stay in SB! Gorgeous, well-styled rooms epitomize luxury,. Even those rooms without a view wil have you wanting to stay out rather than venture out. And why would you go anywhere when the flagship restaurant, Angel Oak, offers sumptuous delights and stellar wines? I cannot fathom why this isn't universally five-starred, but it deserves every star!

SPLENDID! sums up our Ritz-Carlton Bacara stay. From the Bacara team's warm and welcoming hospitality to an unexpected avalanche of surprise-and-delight moments, every minute of our stay was enchanting. 

A heart-happy thank you to Serenity, Beth, Stan, Luis, and Francesca for making our trip so special! 

PROPERTY (5/5)
Sprawling across 78 acres overlooking the Pacific Ocean, the Mediterranean-style resort offers:

-358 rooms and suites
-five restaurants and cafes: modern steakhouse Angel Oak; elegant round O Bar for cocktails and Latin cuisine; The Bistro for breakfast/lunch/dinner; pop-in Lavazza caffe for coffee plus grab-and-go; Haskell's poolside. 
-three infinity-edge heated pools 
-direct au natural beach access. We spotted dolphins frolicking close to shore in the morning! 
-can't help but call out the gorgeous Holiday Rose Tree - created with 1800+ real red roses - and Ritz blue-and-silver Christmas tree avenue in the lobby 
-42,000-sq-ft holistic spa
-clay tennis courts
-ballroom and lecture hall
-versatile ballroom and meeting rooms

ROOM (5/5)
Upon arrival, Stan smilingly checked us in, congratulating us on our special occasions. The resort upgraded us to a 850 square-foot suite suite featuring:

-master bedroom with a heavenly four-poster Frette-linened bed, desk, TV, and sitting area
-separate living room with wet bar and coffee + tea + bottled water station, gas fireplace (so cozy!), TV, and comfy sleeper sofa and armchairs
-two full bathrooms, including a soaking tub complete with fragrant bath salts
-huge wraparound double balcony
-easy elevator access to pools and cabanas

Next, a bevy of in-suite surprises awaited us..

SERVICE (5/5)
Three words: ABOVE AND BEYOND! Starting with a helpful pre-check-in call with Serenity to concierge team members Beth and Luisa's thoughtful gestures to the cheerful friendliness at both check-in and check-out, we felt continually amazed by the Bacara's hospitality. 

Highlights included:

-Beth and Stan's enthusiastic welcome and personal greetings of our party's youngest little member
-generous room to suite upgrade (wow!)
-quick golf cart ride to our villa and bag drop off by Tony
-surprise gifts for occasion 1: Moët champagne; gift box containing a poetically-inscribed crystal and romantic blank message and a bottle; and a lovely handwritten card
-surprise gifts for occasion 2: Martinelli sparkling cider; balloons galore with stuffed Ritz lion; fruit gummies; gift box with a stone moon-and-stars mobile, inspirational crystal, gummy bears, and butterfly ornament; and TWO kind handwritten cards. Incredibly, the gifts were even individually themed! 
-adorable surprise rubber ducky for the smallest guest
-eco-hike guide Francesca's knowledge of the many benefits of local plants, including cowboy's cologne (ie California sagebrush, used by cowboys to attract the ladies!) and purple sage

AMENITIES & EXPERIENCES (5/5)
In addition to beach trails, complimentary bicycles for adults and kids, and heated pools, Bacara offered a wide array of regular fitness, spa, and outdoor and indoor experiences as well as special holiday activities! 

We especially enjoyed:
-guided morning eco-hike with Francesca who illuminated our understanding of local flora and fauna, Chumash culture and traditions, and area history
-Easels and Eggnog painting. Everyone had a blast! 

Other experiences including Aqua Fit, Core & Booty Blast, Zen Den Yoga, Yoga Meditation, a guided daily afternoon beach walk, CSI: Coastal Scene Investigation, Paint and Pinot, and Build-a-Succulent also sounded fantastic. 

Thank you, Ritz Bacara team, for a truly memorable celebration stay! 

PRO TIP 1: Book your desired experiences online well in advance of check-in. Some experiences fill up quickly. 

PRO TIP 2: Bacara is the place to be for the holidays - and any other time of year! Build a Snow Globe, Cookie Decorating, Homemade Hot Cocoa, Wreath Decorating, etc - we wanted to try all the holiday experiences!

This was our first time staying at this location. With an average room rate of $750 a night my expectation was that of other resorts that we have stayed in with equal or higher cost.  Upon check-in it felt as if we had entered a true five-star resort however once checked and it was very evident that either they were not ramped up for a new season where they had failed to understand what five-star service

The view is exceptional. That is all I can say positive about the hotel. They have very poor management and staff. I had my reservation canceled on arrival day. Called and was given the runaround. I did stay. I have not received Marriot Rewards for the stay and cannot get answers as to why. I have spent too many hours on this.

My wife and I were very excited about staying at the Ritz-Carlton Bacara for our baby-moon to have a relaxing and stress-free get away before the upcoming birth of our child, but unfortunately our experience was the complete opposite of that.
