The staff had several large misses throughout the weekend which made our experience stressful and unenjoyable. We found ourselves stressed when our room wasn't cleaned, when we called to have the staff pick up our room service food only to come back 5 hours later and it still be there, and terrible customer service at the Bistro and other dining venues. The dinner service that we had at the Bistro the first night was one of the worst restaurant experiences we have every had, fine dining or not. The property is beautiful and has great access to the ocean, but the service was some of the worst we have ever experienced at a 5-star resort.

We complained to the concierge during our stay at the hotel but they did comp any of our meals or do anything to make our experience better. There are plenty of other beautiful resorts in California where you can expect a higher-level of service for the steep price of the Bacara.

My fiancé and I always enjoy staying at Ritz-Carlton properties and our recent visit at the Bacara was an incredible experience from the moment we pulled into the gorgeous entryway. The entrance to the hotel was super cool as you drive underneath an overhang of sorts which then opens up to a large courtyard with a giant fountain in the middle. The team of valets quickly rushed to our car and welcomed us to the property. After helping us unload the bags they walked us into the lobby where we got checked in. We were celebrating our recent engagement so the person who checked us in was nice enough to upgrade our room to an ocean view in Villa #9. The property was absolutely stunning and all the villas were surrounded by very well maintained landscape. It wasn't a long walk to our room, maybe 2-3 minutes, but they also offer guests a ride to their room in these long golf carts. Our room was fantastic and the views were insane! The layout of the room worked perfectly for us...the bathroom was a great size, there was a working fireplace, a nice sized sitting area, and the balcony overlooking the ocean was very spacious and private feeling. There's also nothing quite like hearing the waves crashing on the beach while sitting on your balcony! The room was nicely decorated and furnished although it did seem like it couldn't hurt to freshen up the room a little bit and update everything. The beds were a little firm but it didn't bother us too much. The shower had good water pressure and got very hot if you cranked it up. There were a few pools on property with the main pool and then an adults only pool near the spa building. There is also a short little trail that's right on the cliff side overlooking the ocean. The trail starts near the parking lot and goes all the way down to the beach. A word of caution if you're walking on the beach, the sand apparently has tar mixed in so be sure to check and clean your shoes real good after you get done walking on the beach. They have cleaning stuff up at the pool so it wasn't too much of a big deal, you just need to be aware of that beforehand. We also got the chance to dine at Angel Oak, one of the restaurants on property, and thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience. The atmosphere was great and their food was fantastic. They also had an impressive wine list with a lot of great varietals to choose from. The O Bar was another good place to grab cocktails. We didn't get the chance to eat there but the vibe was great and the bartenders whip up some really tasty drinks. Overall our stay here was incredible and we experienced great customer service throughout our entire stay!! You can tell the staff here really cares about the customer experience! We already can't wait to book our next trip here!

Back in early September, my wife booked a stay at Bacara using the advertised $733 AAA rate. My wife didn't have our membership number for AAA available at the time she booked, but the booking agent told her "no worries, just present the card when you check in". A week before our stay, my wife called in with the AAA number, and the agent told her "Sorry, we can no longer honor the AAA rate, the room is now $1000/night, and because you are within the cancellation window, you can no longer cancel your stay." Incredulous, I called Marriott to explain the situation, and I asked them to listen to the recording of the original booking to ensure they would honor our quoted rate. They promised me they would resolve this in 3 days. Three days later, there was no word back from Marriott so I called again. This time they told me it would take 10 days to get the recording. So, now we had no choice but to go to Bacara because we were within the cancellation window.
We showed up on Friday after a 4 hour drive, and now they tell me the room is $1899/night! After 30 minutes the manager finally agreed to $1000/night, and said we will resolve the remaining issue around the AAA rate separately.

They gave us a completely non-descript average room and charged us $266/night more than what we booked with the AAA rate, and they are completely failing to resolve this issue. I don't know how they think they can get away with quoting one price and then charging people another when they arrive.

We've stayed at numerous Ritz locations and while the room we had wasn't the nicest we've seen (still awesome), the property was gorgeous with a beautiful view of the ocean.

We had bath salts for our giant tub and they smelled amazing.

It was designed very villa-esque and it was lovely and spacious.

They have a few restaurants on property and we ate at one which we enjoyed.

Self park is past valet...just keep driving if you're anything like me and prefer to park your own car and walk yourself in.

My wife and I stayed here for our wedding, in one of the bridal suites and as part of a large room block. While the hotel is stunningly beautiful, the service was not nearly good enough to justify such an enormous price tag.

Overall, you'll find much better value, service and satisfaction for your money elsewhere. We had originally planned to stay at a Kimpton property but got the Baccara as a nice surprise upgrade from our parents to make the weekend extra special. We probably would've been better off without that upgrade.

A quick summary:
1. Checking in - my mother in law had called maybe 30 minutes before we arrived to make sure everything would be smooth re names / cards on file, etc. the front desk had no record of this conversation- and couldn't find our reservation immediately after specifically going over the stay in detail. Checking in was stressful, took 30 minutes and when I said "man, y'all are kinda effing this up," I was upbraided by Stan at the front desk for swearing. I guess the customer isn't always right at the Baccara.
2. The bridal suite had major electrical issues. While my wife and her bridesmaids were getting ready, the fuse blew in the room at least 5 times. Not exactly the smooth and stress free prep experience you pay top dollar for.
3. I'm a big football fan, and we had a number of folks coming to the suite on Sunday to watch one of the games. We had called in advance to ensure that we'd get the specific game...but they didn't. We figured out a way to stream the game, and just needed an HDMI cord to make it work. The staff told us none were available...despite there being multiple cords in use, in our room. After an hour plus minutes, the cord arrived and we missed an entire half of football.
4. Every time we tried to charge something to the room, the hotel had a different last name on file. We ended up having to remember which service had which of our three last names at every different hotel venue. This isn't a big deal, but is indicative of the general malaise and inattention to detail we experienced throughout our stay.
5. Every service was SLOW. We waited 35 minutes for someone to pick up our luggage. Again, this isn't a big deal but it's just not what you expect at a top tier resort charging top tier prices.

We actually moved over to the Ritz from another hotel which we were originally booked at. I have never had to do that, but the room at the other hotel was very different than the photos and was not clean.  We were tired when we arrived at the Ritz, and it was more expensive than what I had wanted to pay but....

It was a great value. Although expensive, the rooms were lovely, staff was so welcoming and attentive and the grounds were lovely.  This is one of the nicest properties I have ever stayed at, and our entire experience was outstanding.  Worth every penny!

Just came back from a weekend here.

On our first night we had to switch rooms because there was blood smeared/dripped in the bathroom. All we got for the inconvenience of having to move rooms late at night was a cheap bottle of wine (which, I'm pregnant...so?). 

I also had to call multiple times (morning, evening and then night time)  to make sure that my car would get charged before driving back home.

To top it all off, when we were checking out I asked for a printed itemized receipt and noticed they were charging us for food purchases made 9/4/2021. We checked in on 10/1/2021. No apologies for the charges. No explanation. I also had to remind them that they needed to include the breakfast credits, which they hadn't done so.

Don't plan on coming here for a special occasion. Unlike other luxury resorts, the customer service team doesn't want to accommodate requests for special rooms.

I wanted to celebrate my birthday by spending the night in a specific room but the laziness of the management on duty wouldn't even check to see if it was available.

This property doesn't care about their guests, need your money, or want to make the effort to live up to the apparently outdated reputation of the Ritz Carlton.

Very scenic and awesome location + classy vibe. Rooms were a bit dated though and felt some price gouging for food onsite -- ex: a pre-made breakfast egg mcmuffin was $18.

Overall a very nice place, just hard to stomach $20 cocktails, $18 egg mcmuffins and $51 chicken nachos with already heavy nightly rates.

My review is from my visit back in April 2020.
At the time of quarantine, I was so stressed out from work that I needed to get away. 

My stay was an absolutely dream, it was only at 12% occupancy so I had the most attentive service I've ever had. It was quiet, peaceful, and a beautiful view at every corner! It was also half-off, so that was great. 

My room, of course, was gorgeous, clean, and bed was very comfy.

Because business was so slow for them at the time, I was able to rent an electric-bicycle for free. 

I know this will never happen again & this was an once in a lifetime chance, but I'm glad I got to experience at this location regardless!
Thank you for the amazing experience.

Haskell's bar and food truck ate amazing! 
What a truly beautiful setting on this beautiful beach with palm trees and beautiful flowers everywhere. I feel truly blessed to be here. The service at the Ritz Carlton is superior.

This is my review for my stays at the Ritz Carlton Bacara in Goleta, near San Diego.

2018 stays - five out of five stars
2021 stay -  two out of five stars

I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Bacara in 2018 and enjoyed it so much that I stayed there again a few months later.  I had not been able to go back until this last weekend (Labor day 2021).  Unfortunately I did not enjoy my stay and am so sad that a once great place to stay has not deteriorated so much.

My 2018 experience - No resort fees, no spa fees, no reservations needed to use the pool, while swimming in the pool multiple people brought by fresh fruit and snacks.  The pool had a small snack shack with reasonably priced food (a sausage sandwich was $8).  You could use the main pool or the oval pool in front of the cabanas for free with no reservation.  There was a happy hour in the evening in the lobby where free drinks were given out.  In the free spa there was towel and robe service, and free snacks and tea/infused water was available.  Shampoo, conditioner, and other soaps was in my room when I checked in.

My 2021 experience - I was surprised that I was being changed a 'resort fee' of $56 ($50 + $6 'resort fee tax').  But oh well, at least I could still use the steam room that I enjoyed so much last time.  However, when I got there I was told that I would need to pay another $95 to use the spa!  (plus no doubt anothe $6+ 'spa tax').  I don't know for sure because I did not go in.  So at the Ritz Carlton you have to pay fees on top of fees, then additional fees if you want more.  It wasn't like that in 2018.  I told the Ritz employees that I did not have to pay a resort fee or spa fee or taxes when I stayed in 2018, but none of them that I spoke with worked at Ritz Carlton Bacara in 2018.  I was told that the spa fee was because of 'covid'. But when I asked about it further, they told me that the spa fee started before covid started and would continue after covid ended.  So it is obvious to me that the 'covid' excuse is so Ritz can charge more money for what people used to get for free.   When I checked in my room there was no shampoo there.  The sink drain was broken and we had to call a repair person to fix it.  When we asked the repair person about the shampoo and toiletries, he was kind enough to call someone to bring them.  But why did we have to call?  Why weren't those in the room already when we got there?  They were there in 2018, as they should be.

Pool experience...I had to get a 'reservation' to go in.  After swimming in the large pool, I wanted to swim in the oval adjacent pool in front of the cabanas.  I was told that this pool was reserved for the exclusive use of the cabana rentals.  In 2018 I was free to use that pool and I didn't have a cabana.  No cabanas were being rented and the pool was empty at that time.  Just another excuse for the Ritz to squeeze a few bucks (by a few bucks, I mean likely hundreds of dollars) from their customers.

No doubt that customers of the Ritz Carlton are wealthy and can afford to be 'nickeled and dimed' (in this case, 'fifty and hunder dollared') but after staying a room costing $1500 for that Saturday night on a Labor day weekend does Ritz really need to squeeze every $100 it can from its customers?  I guess the answer is yes.  

Before my 2021 stay, I was constantly telling my friends how great the Ritz Carlton Bacara was, what a great experience, what a great value, etc.  I won't be saying that any more, and likely won't stay there again.  Not that the Ritz Carlton is so horrible...it isn't.  It's just way over priced for what you get, and there are better just as beautiful options available for a more reasonable price.  

So if you want a $36 breakfast burrito ($28 + $8 tax/tip) and $5 drip coffee (plus tax/tip), then the Goleta Ritz Carlton Bacara is for you.

Just getting the concierge on the phone before our stay to ask about recommendations took 3 phone calls and several days. Once I spoke to her, she said she would make us dinner reservations for Friday night but never did. And didn't follow up. 

When we arrived we had to wait roughly 20-25 minutes to check in because the line was so long and despite being a Marriott Platinum member, there was no separate line for guests with status. 

I was informed by the woman checking us in there were several upgrades available since I was a platinum member, but then pulled a bait-and-switch by telling me she would be happy to discount them from $800/night to only $600/night. I declined this offer and didn't appreciate the upsell attempt.

There was a nice card in my room with a stuffed lion and a ballon for my birthday, which was a nice surprise. But this is a great example of the inconsistency at the property. Terrible check in process, lack of follow-through from concierge but then does something very nice like this. 

Room service the first evening for dinner and even the next day for breakfast was wonderful. We received our order correctly and very quickly. We were very happy...

But here comes the inconsistency: breakfast on Saturday was supposed to take 50 min (which is already a very long time) but it actually took 75 min and our order was incorrect. 

Since we were now running late for our first winery tour, we had to inhale our food and take off because we didn't have time to have the order fixed. 

Sunday was a repeat of Saturday for breakfast...

It took longer then they initially told us, I had to call to check on it after an hour, and it was completely wrong again. And since we were checking out and now running late, we didn't have time to have it fixed. 

Service at the pool was actually quite good and we enjoyed our time at the pool on Friday. The bartenders and wait staff were courteous, professional, friendly, and actually got our orders correct. This should be standard service especially at a Ritz, but at this property -- it's the exception not the rule. 

Given it was my birthday we were celebrating, we were pretty disappointed with the service. I mentioned our frustration to the women working the desk during checkout. She wasn't a great communicator and didn't seem to care much -- my guess was because she was overwhelmed with the line of people checking in/out which was again very long. But did say she'd talk to the manager and see what they could do. 

While I wasn't satisfied with this at the time and I'm still not, they did remove about $200 worth of room service charges. This is too little too late and doesn't make up for the poor service or lack of professionalism that happened to my wife upon checkout...

Upon leaving we mentioned our frustration with the room service to bell boy and he said, "Oh yeah, everyone around here knows the food service is pretty bad." 

That same bell boy then followed my wife to the ATM to ask her for a tip which I felt was a little forward and unprofessional, but he was not to be outdone by another bell boy -- who knocked on our car window to tell me wife actually he was the one that loaded the car and not and not the other guy. And then proceeded to ask for a tip. 

Overall, I've received better service at a standard Marriott property let alone a Ritz-Carlton. We stayed at The Peninsula in Chicago a few months ago while on a visit to Chicago and the level of service we received there was far above and beyond this. And ironically, the Peninsula was cheaper. 

I feel fortunate I used points for this stay because had I paid $1500 a night, I might have started yelling at people. But then again, maybe that's the reason for the poor service -- I'm not sure but I've seen people hint at this in reviews.

Don't bother! We have stayed here in the past and the experience was pleasant. This time around, they are painfully short staffed, as one of the managers acknowledged, and this shows in all aspects. Our room was not ready when we arrived (3:50 pm). At 4:05, they told us we could go on up. How they "cleaned" our room in 15 minutes is beyond me! The room had an odor and as we have a 10 month old who is crawling, we were quickly able to see how little they care about cleanliness as her hands and feet were black with dirt within 20 minutes of crawling around the suite. 
Laundry bags? Sorry you have to call for them because they don't provide them. The crib we requested the day before as well as again when we checked in? Not there. Took 30 minutes to arrive. The television in the family room did not work and needed to be repaired. We asked for water-at least three times and. It's been an hour and it still has not arrived. And it's only day one. 
Save your money and go stay at the Four Seasons in Westlake Village. It has exceptional rooms and service and you won't be having to call three times to just get water. 
Ps. The rooms are shabby and the furniture looks dingy. The throw pillows smell like I don't even know what. The crib seems to be from the 1960s-dinged up and scratched up and down. Sad that they charge this much for such poor quality and service.

CONTEXT: I chose the Ritz Bacara for the brand name, location and as the site to propose to my partner. 

This is not a five star resort. The cost of the rooms is far higher than the amenities, grounds and experience warrant and you can book a better 5 star hotel for half the price.

GROUNDS
** Nice aesthetic.
** Staff driven Golf carts are all over the place, constantly moving behind guests on narrow pathways. It is extremely disruptive if you're attempting to relax. We saw carts driven without headlights at night, and carts with their brights on blinding us as we walked back to our room. It is not pleasant to constantly be moving out of the way of mostly empty golf carts as they zip by at 5-10mph.

ROOM

**We booked a partial ocean view.  Comparable amenities to other 4 or 5 star hotels. Nothing special.

** Found 2 moths in closet.

** 1-ply toilet paper. For a 5 star hotel at these prices, having 1-ply toilet paper was insulting.

ECO-FRIENDLY?

No. They use Nestle products. Single-use nestle water bottles are everywhere. Nestle is one of the worlds top polluters.

These single use bottles are in every room and every facet of the hotel.

Other, cheaper 5 star hotels have moved over to water dispensing stations and aluminum bottles that are distributed to guests for free at check-in.

FOOD

** Bistro breakfast buffet was basic. Cold food, potatoes had sat out for too long. The omelet bar had one chef and was a mess. Very basic,  not worth  $45 a plate.

** We ordered lunch from the pool bar. Fish tacos.  The fish was really odorous and was definitely not fresh. 

We did not eat at the main restaurants,  but expect they too are overpriced and not worth the effort.


COVID COMPLIANCE 

** We witnessed multiple staff members either maskless and moving around indoors, or with masks pulled under their noses. Several of the valets wore no masks whatsoever.


STAFF
A bright spot. They were friendly and attentive.

BEACH
** Be warned it is a state beach and there is tar on it that will stain your feet, clothes and posessions. The Ritz staff could warn guests on check in to take slippers to the beach, but instead allow guests to discover the tar on their own.

Overall the Ritz Bacara does not live up to the brand image. The issues stem from a poor logistical oversight of leadership who, in my opinion,  have cut corners and implemented poor standards and processes for the hotel.

There is a lot to be improved here and we will not stay at this location again. I encourage you to explore other options in Santa Barbara.

My wife and I had a mixed experience during our five-night stay.

The good:
* The grounds are stunningly beautiful.
* The location on the beach is fantastic.
* The staff are incredibly friendly, accommodating and well-trained in guest service.
* The food at Angel Oak and O Bar is great.
* The fitness center is excellent.

The bad:
* The interior of the guest rooms needs an update in the WORST way. There's an incredible amount of deferred maintenance on this property. The rooms appear not to have been touched in 25 years.
* The food at San Setto is mediocre and wildly overpriced.
* Before you show up, check with the staff about your room number. If you are sensitive to noise, or are expecting a quiet and relaxing stay, make 100% sure that you are not near the kids' pool. The noise from that area of the hotel is insane. You'll have techno music audible in your room 10 hours a day.

Overall, there's a lot to recommend this place, but there shouldn't be as many red flags as there are for how much it costs.

business.name: Charlie Gitto's On the Hill
business.categories: Restaurants, Italian

reviews.text: Make sure you make a reservation . Great fresh and homemade pasta. The Seafood Pasta Suzanne is a must!

My wife and I had a very nice dinner at Charlie Gitto's. It is a very nice restaurant. They have an extensive wine list and a very diverse Italian menu. Our appetizer was the eggplant Napoleon. It was very tasty.  I enjoyed the Sea Bass special topped with nunzio for my main course and my wife had the Chicken Marsala. Both meals were cooked to perfection. Our waiter kept a close eye on our drinks and made sure we had a fresh one when needed. Since it was our anniversary, we got a piece of Cassata with a candle. Very nice touch. I also ordered Cannoli which was very good. Charlie Gitto's is rated as a five star restaurant and that is exactly what it is. Great food, great service, great location and tons of ambiance.

While I don't mean to discredit any of the abundance of great restaurants on the EXCELLENT area of "The Hill", I must say that this IS THE BEST OF THE BEST on "The Hill." My fiancé and I go here every year for our anniversary, simply because it is the best. The service is impeccable, from coat service, bussers, bartenders, and the wait staff, you will not be disappointed. On our most recent anniversary, we ordered a bone-in-ribeye, medium rare, and it was cooked perfectly to a tee. It featured a delicious sauce on top which was to die for. My fiancé ordered a seafood pasta, also, excellently prepared. Definitely make reservations if possible, because this place is busy, as it deserves to be--ITS EXCELLENT. However, the number of patrons does not compromise the superior service you will receive. This is an excellent restaurant and cannot be skipped if in the hill.
They have the best toasted ravioli I have ever had. The ambiance of the restaurant itself  is very relaxing. Service was pleasant, and the entrees were delicious as well.

If you're looking for an old school red sauce joint who's food is as classic as it's decor, welcome to Charlie Gitto's. I confess, I'm an old school Italian food lover and CG's hits the spot. They have all of the classics and they do them well. On this visit I indulged in the lobster ravioli. Magnificent. Rich, creamy and a good amount of lobster. The atmosphere is classic and upscale. You feel like you are in a nice speakeasy. Definitely recommend reservations and wear your Sunday's best. But you probably shouldn't wear white as you slam dunk T Rav's into your marinara sauce.

Great service, good food, nice atmosphere. I had the chicken Spiedini and my wife had the chicken parmigiana. The spiedini was one of the best; the parm however fell short of our most recent competing restaurants (cunnettos & Joey Bs).  Growing up in St Louis, I've come to learn the Hill is a fantastic place to get good Italian food, in massive portions, for a reasonable price.  Charlie Gittos has marketed this restaurant to be more upscale. The portions are smaller and the prices are higher than many of the competing Italian restaurants on the Hill. In the case of our latest meal, our dishes were $28 & $29 for each chicken entre, and did not come with a salad or side. 

 I'm sure I will be back, this is a good Italian restaurant but it is not 50% better than its peers as the prices indicate.

Drove 90 miles each way to eat here for my birthday (after I called and the girl told us they were booked with reservations but if we came at 5pm, we would have no trouble getting a table) but the extremely rude older gentleman at the hostess desk when we arrived told us we could not be seated. Horrible customer service. They didn't even care that we were told to come at 5 BY THEIR EMPLOYEE!!!  We won't be back.
I went here with my husband on a date night and we had a great time.  The food is delicious and the service is also exceptional.  I recommend going here if you are craving some pasta!
Overhyped, overpriced, and subpar flavors. Wouldn't recommend for a family, it was mostly businesses taking people out for dinner.

When we heard there was an area of St. Louis with a ton of Italian restaurants, we were sold. We couldn't NOT go, right?! We waited just a little to be seated and then were brought outside to the glowy patio. They had a beautiful guitarist playing and it set a romantic mood. We ordered two bolognese dishes and they were both delicious. Parking took awhile to find and we'd recommend getting reservations next time, but we'd definitely recommend to anyone else and would love to return!
Delicious Italian food, i have never been disappointed once! Atmosphere is slightly fancier than what I'm used too but everyone is very friendly and treat you nicely.

Have I really never written a review about this place? I thought I had! Anyway, I love Charlie Gotto's. I've been here several times and have gotten so many different things. Each thing better than the previous! so I can't necessarily call anything out in particular. I do often get the specials they have that aren't always regular menu items. I highly recommend you check this place out. It's great for any special occasion, a date night, anything really. And so yummy!
Might be the best lasagna I've ever had. Also great ambiance. Great spot for anniversary dinners. Def make a reservation.

Walked in the door and was insulted because I had on a ball cap. Did not even have the chance to remove it
Before being told to remove it because it's their policy and to remove my goat and put it in the coat check. Sorry but that is my choice if I choose to do that. We walked out very very rude. Will not be back.
It's a higher price point, but has great food and service. Every item we ordered was delicious the drinks were perfection.

Amazing food and even better sevice. There was absolutely nothing negative I can say about this restaurant. It is by far the best ran restaurant I've been to in a very long time. I wouldn't be surprised if it recieves a Michelin star.

Walked in. First time there. Very rude 
No ball caps for anyone even just walking in. And told to remove it and where to put our coats. Sorry. Not for me. Walked out.

The food was outstanding, and the service was incredible! I ordered the petite filet mignon, It was excellent! I ordered it medium rare with a herb butter. The flavor was fantastic! The shrimp I ordered was huge. Good flavor, but the overall size just exceeded my expectations. My cannoli was awesome too, great flavor and the the perfect texture. Our servers, Timothy and Ernest were very nice and always on task. This is an excellent place to go if you're traveling through St. Louis, and I would recommend it to anyone.
2nd visit was just as good as the first! This time we sat outside on the cute patio area with lights. Standout favorite of the night was the risotto- already waiting to come back and have it again!

Wow! I don't even know where to begin. My husband and I had a rare date night on a Friday evening. We didn't have reservations, but the wait was short considering the time. Upon arrival we were seated at the bar, and were warmly welcomed. The bartender was kind, and attentive. Mr. and Mrs. Gitto we're also at the bar, and were so friendly! Seriously, the Gittos take pride in their restaurant, and it shows. 

Once our table was ready, the generosity continued; the server was efficient and knowledgeable. The atmosphere would be enough for a five star review, but the food knocks this review out of the park. Generous portions, and fabulous flavor! We had the toasted ravs, lasagna, and chicken marsala. I'm sure you could not go wrong with anything on the menu though.

I highly recommend this restaurant for the food, drinks, service, and atmosphere!

The Zenith of our LONG 5,000-mile road trip coalesced with nostalgia at Charlie G's. We were regulars (privilege granted) 1998-2001 and to walk into the casual/cozy/romantically shades of darkness in booths was...extraordinary. 

From the welcoming as if we had just been there last week, to the superb service from
Fahmy, to the fun we had sharing a photo of us - same corner of the bar, 1999 - the feeling was overwhelmingly nostalgic. 

But let's talk cuisine, also. 

Legendary toasted (never say fried) ravioli possessed two decades' prior flavor resonance. We then tried one of their brick oven pizzas. Razor thin snd superb. My wife opted for the lasagna ("six layers of goodness") and I the swordfish special. Excellent. 

Tossup between you can or cannot "go home again" but when it comes to us and
Charlie Gitto's....

We loved playing it to a taste-FULL tie.

Second time here when visiting The Hill in St Louis. Last time was 16 years ago. Vibrant restaurant with excellent food. Perfect choice for Dinner over Family Weekend at WashU Stl. No need to describe what I had as everything on the menu is excellent. Great service and staff that make you feel special.

I was craving some pasta so I called to place a carry out order. Man answers the phone, tells me to "hang on", then hangs up... no big deal I called again and said I think we got disconnected. I place the order at 7:41pm and was told it would be about 20 minutes. Long story short, my food was brought out at 8:32pm, 50 minutes later. When I called during that time to check up on it I was told they would bring it out when ready and was abruptly hung up on. When I looked at my receipt in the bag it had been written on with marker saying "8:05" I guess the written time that it was ready to go. So it sat inside in a bag for 25 extra minutes before it was brought out to me. Pasta was cold and hard. Mind you I am a bartender and have worked in the restaurant industry for 6 years and I am very polite and felt like I was treated so poorly. I believe the older man I spoke with on the phone was the owner himself. So disappointed

For the life of me I don't understand the high rating of this place. Other than a pleasant greeting by the host, the service was average and the food atrocious. The dining room was so cold I wondered where the dead bodies were being stored. After sitting down we received a basket with a few slices of  cold bread and some pats of butter. Want olive oil to dip your bread into? That's a $5 "appetizer" item. Even The Bonefish Grill, a seafood chain, serves a complimentary fresh, warm loaf with seasoned olive oil.

Caesar salad was decent but croutons were too hard... Like risk cracking a tooth hard. Got served our meal but weren't offered freshly grated parmesan cheese. Marinara sauce was bland other than an overwhelming taste of pepper, and meatballs also had way too much pepper in them. If the food needs that much pepper, they're doing it wrong. Dining companion had cannelloni, which he thought was just okay.  We were not offered option of dessert or coffee/espresso (because espresso is not on the menu, but certainly I saw other diners drinking coffee!) Not to be mean but this was the worst Italian food, really one of the worst meals, I've ever eaten out in my life.  It struck me as an old school idea of what Americans used to think "real" Italian food was.

Ok, I don't get out to nice Italian restaurants very often, so take this for what it's worth.

We were in St. Louis (from Chicago) to visit my daughter who is at SLU, and we decided to check out CG's because it is one of two restaurants in St. Louis where toasted ravioli originated.

Located in an Italian-American neighborhood called, "The Hill" the ravioli appetizer was outstanding with a wonderful combination of spices, unlike anything we had ever had before!

I had the baked spaghetti and meatballs, which was very good, covered in cheese, which was a nice touch.

We also had the carrot cake for dessert, which I highly recommend.

All in all, great experience. Our waiter was a gem!! Loved it : )

business.name: Barclay Prime
business.categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Good atmosphere, Good Service and Delicious Steak. 

Lived in Philadelphia all my life and this was the first time I tried this restaurant. To a certain extend, I do believe this restaurant lived up to the expectation
I had but the reason I cannot give this restaurant 5 stars is that ALL OUR FOOD CAME OUT LUKEWARM. 

I mean oyster, of course it should be cold but we didn't expect our soup, scallop, steak and side dish to come out cold. The only thing was somewhat warm was the Brussels sprouts and that did not taste that great. 

I am giving this place 4 star based on the phenomenal service I received from everyone in the restaurant and the quality of the steak. But I hope the can improve on the logistics for the food delivery so the guests can enjoy the food hot not lukewarm.

This Starr restaurant does not disappoint. Cozy and romantic aesthetic. Still dreaming about the salmon appetizer and that wagyu!
Just remind ya rents to bring their reading glasses and pocket light, because the lighting is pretty dim.

*HIGHLY RECOMMEND*
4.5/5 STARS

Barclay Prime is part of Starr restaurant group so you know it'll be good. This upscale fine-dining restaurant is great for special occasions when you are prepared to splurge because it is definitely not cheap. I love the low light setting with low table couch seating because it enhances the intimate atmosphere. Dress code is also more semi formal than casual. Steak wise, they have a good variety of options from standard to American Wagyu to Japanese Wagyu. They know how to prepare the steak to medium rare perfection. They also have a good selection of seafood platters as well. They served the quality of the ingredients and it is definitely worth the experience.

*DINNER*

Hamachi Crudo - 4 slices of fresh hamachi with citrus ponzu and avocado jalapeño topping. The hamachi was very fresh and decadent. The citrus ponzu, not as sour as I thought, perfectly pairs well with the light hamachi flavor.

Seared Diver Scallops - the scallops was cooked to PERFECTION. The texture was so soft and tender, not chewy at all, like you're eating raw scallops but it was fully cooked. The citrus sauce was the highlight. It was sour, which I love. The broiled mushroom was also very juicy but crispy, 

Glatt Kosher Ribeye - perfectly medium rare. A bit too salty for my liking. Think it would go very well with some sauce but we didn't get any. Good but not my favorite.

American Wagyu Filet Mignon - when you think about how tender and buttery Wagyu can be, this did its jobs. Easy to cut, easy to chew with just enough saltiness. Perfectly cooked to medium rare.

Truffled mashed potatoes - great mashed potatoes, pretty heavy with the truffle flavor

Creamed Spinach - not as heavy as I thought, very good pairing with the saltiness of the steak. 

Banana pudding creme brûlée - let's just say, this is the best creme brûlée I've ever had. 

*VERDICT*
Would definitely come back again for another special occasion

Barclay prime is the best restaurant that you can visit within the city. My fiance proposed in rittenhouse square (yes 100% romantic), and we made our way to barclay prime to celebrate after. The service was phenomenal, the food was to die for, an the atmosphere was pleasant. If you are celebrating a big event/milestone within the city, consider visiting barclay prime!!

Overall experience was spectacular. The service we received from getting seated, to getting our orders taken and food being serve was very professional. With the increase cases of covid they do check vaccination card and ID at the door so be sure to get those ready before coming. The restaurant is lightly dimmed and gives off a romantic dinner vibe, which I love. Food was a bit pricey, but definitely worth going to. We ordered the famous cheesesteak and honestly it was amazing. I love the extra hint of truffles they add to it. The dish is also served with a small bottle of champagne. The ribeye was medium rare, so soft and juicy. The only thing I wish had been different was if we got to choose the knife we wanted. However, that probably changed due to covid which is totally understandable, but would have made the experience unique.

Nice romantic restaurant !!! Low lights and music playing in the background gives it a nice feel to date night. The service is exceptional. The waiter was very attentive and provided excellent service. We tried the $100 cheesesteak and it was worth it ! We also ordered lamb chops, Mac and cheese, tater tots, potato's. I did not really care for the bass. I also appreciate the fact that the restaurant has great social distance practices. We were not sitting next to any others and we were all spread out.

The service was omg just incredible, our server came back every 5 minutes to check on us and to make sure we were good. I was happy eating and the food was served hot and crispy m. Literally everything was good

So we made reservations 4 weeks in advance for 10. They refused to put us at the same table and intentionally put us at 2 tables of 5 across the room from each other. Why? For the insane prices you would think they could accommodate us. Numerous requests and this table of 10 next to us sat empty the whole time. Our one chance to have a Christmas dinner with the whole family. We won't be back. So disappointing.
Amazing steak; waiter was extremely helpful with recommendations. The Oaxacan coffee and chocolate tart for dessert created a perfect ending to our delicious evening.

I can't believe that i have not done a review of this place yet... its one of my go to steakhouses and have not stopped going here. 
Atmosphere and space is one of the top place in the city (perfect for date night!)

The food is solid, i feel like covid, the experience (food wise and they no longer offer you the knife selection) has taken a hit but the service remains top notch.  

I highly recommend the sliders, ceasar salad to start and then the bone in filet or lamb as your main course.  The desert menu is also very good

Have had the pleasure of coming to Barclay Prime twice in the past couple months and it is always exceptional. Great cocktails, wines, food, and service. Pricey but very worth it for a special occasion or if you are looking to splurge!

We ordered the truffle mac, popovers, potatoes au gratin, and creamed spinach as sides. All of these were excellent and rich versions of these dishes. 

My 60-day aged Ribeye was spectacular. The fat around the edges was a highlight, as that was so deeply savory and complex. The exterior had a heavy char that added a pleasant crisp and grill flavor without being overpowering. The tradeoff with ordering medium is that the center of my cut wasn't that flavorful and could have been more juicy. But, that's a tradeoff I'm willing to make to get the perfectly rendered fatty outer parts of the cut. The whole piece was evenly tender. 

This place is super expensive, by the way. So set that expectation before you go.

In my opinion Barclay Prime is not just the best steakhouse in Philadelphia but among the very top restaurants in Philly period. 

Front of house is exceptionally professional.  Arriving for a dinner in a private dining room has the host walking the diners outside and into the room accessible by its own entrance. No pointing, no loose directions, just handles the customer. 

Servers are professional. Understand and can review every menu selection thoroughly. Most importantly, once you place your order, from drinks to appetizers to dinner......you receive your plate/glass at the same time as others in your party without a hint of questions about "who had the Manhattan ". They know. They always get it right. 

The food is great. Not sure I can articulate any descriptions that haven't been used. The waygu sliders, just try them. Even the chopped salad gets the works. Crispy, vinegar flavors, feta adds creaminess and salt. Rest assured if I made this knowing the ingredients it would just not balance the same way. 

Heading to a 4 $$$$ restaurant should be an experience and Barclay Prime delivers.

The Culinary Adventures of Tom Coghlan, FB
I managed to get a 5:00 pm reservation on Friday for Barklay Prime, at 237 S. 18th Street. Barklay Prime is the fourteenth Steven Starr Restaurant in my series so far... I arrived with my friend Robin. We were seated at a quaint table for two where we met our server, Glenn. I ordered a flute of, champagne, ployez-jacquemart, 'extra quality brut', ludes, france, as  I often like to start a meal with Champagne.  Robin was feeling a bit adventurous, and ordered a cocktail she never had before, The Metropolis, belvedere ginger zest, limoncello, thyme, white cranberry. For me, this was the beginning of an exciting evening. I enjoy sharing a meal with someone who is willing try new things ! We ordered our appetizers. Robin ordered Seared Diver Scallops, carrot, citrus, with broiled maitake mushroom, While I ordered, Oysters on the Half Shell*, half dozen, red wine mignonette. I also ordered a soup... Lobster Cappuccino.  While viewing the menu, Robin expressed an interest in, Wagyu Beef Carpaccio, aged parmesan, arugula, lemon, porcini, scallop mousseline, but never having tried it, she ordered the Scallops, "just to be safe"... She didn't want to order it and find out she didn't like it. I have had Carpaccio and I like it. Since we started out trying new things I wanted to continue that theme, and suggested we order The Carpaccio and split it...Much to my excitement Robin agreed... Glenn brought us a Puff Pastry like bread that was made with Guyer Cheese and called a Popover... It came with a small bowl of soft butter that was sprinkled with sea salt... It was SOOO good ! The Oysters came out first. In my excitement, I regret that I didn't take a picture of them. They were served with a red wine mignonette and horse radish and were very good !  Robin never had Oysters before and was willing to give one a try. The excitement escalated ! Although she didn't like them very much, we both agreed, it was so much fun ! Next came The Carpaccio, Robins Scallops and my soup, Lobster Cappuccino. I had another flute of Champagne and Robin had another Metropolis as she found it to be "Very refreshing!" The two large Scallops were served with  a sauce of, carrot, and citrus,  and with broiled maitake mushroom. They were presented beautifully. The Lobster Cappuccino was assembled tableside. Four small Scallops Porcini Mushrooms and mousseline were presented in the center of the bowl. Glenn had a small pitcher of a "Lobster Bisque" like soup that he poured around  the bowl circling the contents highlighting them well. It was as beautiful as It was delicious ! I tried a bit of Robins Scallops and she tried a spoon full of my soup. Once again... DELICIOUS  !  Then we shared The Carpaccio ! Robin was pleasantly surprised at how much we both enjoyed it... ANOTHER FIRST for my adventurous  friend ! For our main course. Robin decided on, Ribeye prime 40 day dry-aged, with Kennett Square Mushrooms,  House Steak Sauce  and  Whipped Potatoes. I ordered, American Wagyu, Ribeye Cap, snake river farms, Idaho. with Creamed Spinach and Small Potatoes. Both Steaks were cooked to a perfect medium rare temperature ! And both were AMAZING !!! Glenn so aptly recommended a Ripasso by Valpolicella, Italy...It was a medium bodied red wine with a complex flavor profile that was excellent with my steak. After sampling my wine, Robin decided to stick with her Metropolis which by this point was quickly becoming her "favorite drink." Naturally We tried each others' steak and while they were both EXCELLENT we both agreed that The Wagyu was the better tasting of the two... Now was time for desert !  We shared a slice of Lemon Cheese Cake that was sprinkled with small chunks of Dark Chocolate and crowned with a crispy vanilla wafer. We each enjoyed a cup of Cappuccino with our desert. I had a Sambuca with mine... I even managed to talk Robin into trying  Sambuca with her Coffee... One taste was enough for her and she enjoyed the rest of her cappuccino by itself... lol ! Again I regret that I did not take pictures... We had a BLAST ! It was SO MUCH FUN ! Everything was PERFECT ! In fact Robin said it may have been the "best meal she ever had !" It was made so with the expert help of Glenn, who was the perfect gentleman and most proficient server ! I had a wonderful time with wonderful people and wonderful food, and will not soon forget the evening or the meal...  https://barclayprime.com/.

Opulence is a word that comes to mind. The thought of spending $600 for 2 people kind of opulence. Facial recognition temperature checks kind of opulence. Leather chairs kind of opulence. It's very much a vibe. Right off Rittenhouse square which is incredible in October. Walking in you can tell it's going to be an experience. The famous cheesesteak was really good. Less of a traditional Philly steak, imagine cheesesteak on a seeded hoagie primos hoagie roll with some peppers. It was really good but it's more of a novelty than worth the price. The Waygu was life changing. It was crispy on the outside but pure buttery, melt in your mouth perfect. The portion is way small tho so again novelty not a try again thing. It was a great experience, they take it very seriously, I left a bit hungry and had all courses so portions aren't huge but besides that, if you want the song and dance fancy, this is the place.
Honestly one of the best steakhouses in the county.      Everything is absolutely fantastic food, service, and atmosphere.

wow. last time I came I had terrible service, cold food, the waitress offered to heat our food up in a microwave which is ridiculous! But tonight, my fiancé and I had an incredible time. Our server Glenn was so kind and attentive. The food came out spectacular and i'm so glad we gave this place a second shot. Amazing food, and amazing service thanks to Glenn!

Barclay Prime is one place I've wanted to visit since I moved to Philly seven years ago. It's a pricey place, much more expensive than the restaurants I normally frequent, so I held off for a very special occasion. Well, that time came this year and I'm happy to say that it was a wonderful dinner. 

Ambiance: Relaxing and tastefully decorated. Like a modern, somewhat minimalist, library. The lighting was dim and perfect, the chairs were comfy armchairs. It was a comfortable setup for the hefty meal we were about to have. 

Food: Honestly, I eat steaks infrequently, so I kept my order basic. I got a bone-in New York strip cooked medium-rare. It was cooked perfectly and super delicious. My wife got a ribeye cooked medium, same results for her. We loved our steaks. We got three sides: creamed spinach, mac and cheese, and tater tots. All were delicious, but the tater tots, being so random on the menu, were such a standout... like deep fried cylinders of mashed potatoes. We also got the skillet cookie dessert, which was fantastic. Highly recommended if you want something sweet, the cookie is sectioned into chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin, and sugar, all were excellent. 

Drinks: The drinks were great, but they're extremely pricey. As delicious as they were, $17 for a cocktail is wild. I knew what I was getting into, so I don't think it's be fair to take off a star for this, but the price is ridiculous. And that's not even touching their $30 signature cocktails...

Service: Great. Our server was kind and accommodating. He answered all of our questions nicely and his suggestions were great. My only note is that he could have come by our table a little more, but I know restaurants are having staffing issues these days and the place was pretty busy for a Tuesday night, so it's all good. 

Overall: We loved our dinner at Barclay Prime and would absolutely go again. It's a pricey meal, 2 steaks, 3 sides, 2 drinks, a dessert and tip came out to a bit under $300 for two people, but it was worth it for delicious food on a special night.

Amazing meal - the best I've ever had. I would not do justice if I described it, but I'll try. The filet melted in my mouth like butter. The asparagus, creamed spinach, sautéed mushrooms and whipped potatoes were delicious. And the rolls! Devine! Drew was our server and he was the most professional and charming individual.. The experience was top-notch. Thank you!

My sister and I are visiting Philadelphia and chose Barclay Prime from among other highly rated steakhouses on Yelp. We are glad we did, as it is an excellent dining establishment. Service is attentive, and the food ranged from  very good to amazing. We ordered a cesar salad, ribeye steak, halibut, truffle mac 'n' cheese, and potatoes au gratin. For dessert, we ordered their sorbet. Everything was delicious, but the standouts were surprisingly their complimentary popovers which were hot and buttery and the sorbet. For the latter, we ordered a couple of scoops of watermelon and one scoop of strawberry habiscus, and it was the best sorbet that we'd ever eaten. The flavors were so concentrated and fresh. Overall, it was an excellent meal, and we'll be sure to dine at Barclay Prime again the next time that we're in town.

OK hear me out I was staying at a hotel nearby this restaurant came highly recommended made a reservation party of one service was spectacular I had William as my server start it off with the Alaskan King crab which was two small pieces for $30 Which would've been fine if it wasn't preserved in a salt brine couldn't eat it asked them to pack it for my wife she will eat it he asked if there was anything wrong I said it was way too salty for me and took it off the bill so I ordered a crabcake which was as salty as the king crab I didn't want to complain again so I took it and stuffed it in my pop over(bread) Ordered the 32 ounce porterhouse it was also oversalted on the outside had to scrape off the $100+ steak.  Ordered the corn and truffle mac & cheese the latter was guess??? Oversalted couldn't eat it the corn was incredible, I talk to some of the people at the hotel I'm staying at and they thought I was crazy said its  a great steakhouse I believe it wholeheartedly but tonight they were way off. I got all my food to go and gave it to a homeless guy. $500.00's later and I just ordered Uber eats!  Call me a glutton for punishment but I will try it again in six months Due to the fact that I think it was just tonight that they were way off.~

I took my brother here for a belated birthday dinner on a Friday night. I'm a Stephen Starr fangirl, and I was determined to take him to the best of the Philadelphia restaurants in his empire, and I really couldn't have chosen better than this. 

At the time that I made the reservation, only bar seating was available. I was initially disappointed because I didn't want to sit at the bar to eat dinner, but where we were actually seated was in a pretty lounge area in the front room, with plush seating and lovely lighting provided by candles and shaded wall lamps. Our server was extremely friendly and informative, going above and beyond in service quality (more on that in a bit)! We started with glasses of water, the Clover Days cocktail for my brother, and a delectable basket of popovers, which were flaky, light, rich and delicious all at once, and came with a whipped salted butter, though the popovers were so good on their own they didn't even need the butter.

I'm a vegetarian, so I decided to go with the Caesar salad (I make an occasional pescatarian allowance), and an order of tater tots. My brother loves a good steak, but he never treats himself out to a steakhouse. So like the bossy older sister that I am, I told him, get whatever you want! And so he got the American Wagyu NY strip steak, and an order of truffle whipped potatoes. He's not as effusive as me, but he finished every bite of his meal with enthusiasm, and declared it one of the best steaks he'd ever had. He insisted that I try his whipped potatoes, and while they were very flavorful, the super-smooth creamy texture isn't for me. The tater tots, on the other hand, were incredible. The waiter thought I was nuts when I told him I've never actually had tater tots before. Pretty sure if I ever have them again, nowhere else will they have such a shatteringly crisp and deliciously salty exterior, with a perfectly cloud-like mashed potato interior. I confess I had to take most of the tasty little bites home because the Caesar salad was huge, and the dressing and grated cheese so good that I shamelessly mopped up the dish with the last of my popover. 

Now, getting back to the above and beyond service by our waiter - the steak and salad were brought out by a another member of the serving staff, (sooner than I expected), but no whipped potatoes or tots in sight. When our main server returned to check on us moments later, he exclaimed over the absence of our side orders, (turns out they were sent to another table) and remedied the oversight within minutes, all the while apologizing for the mixup. It was barely a delay at all, so my brother and I hardly minded, but he insisted on removing both items from our bill, effectively making them on the house. Maybe it's because I'm not used to restaurants with such stellar service, or maybe because I'm more used to having to point out missing food to the server myself, and getting an annoyed reaction, with the missing items eventually being brought out later. 

Yes, Barclay Prime is quite expensive, but it's worth every penny, from the amazing service, to the beautiful decor, to the insanely delicious food. For a special occasion or if you want to super-treat someone (or yourself), this is definitely one of the top options in Philadelphia.

Simply put, Barclay Prime is the gold standard for steak houses in Philadelphia. The food, service, and ambiance are of the highest quality. No expense has been spared; accordingly, prices are extremely high. That said, every dish Barclay Prime serves is delicious and worth the price. Bottom line - a truly transcendent dining experience. Above and beyond five stars.

Just came in for a cocktail, and maybe some appetisers. Barclay Prime is a classic Philadelphia steak house. Dimly lit and very rustic inside. There are also tables outside. 
I love the small bar area here. There are also small tables in the vicinity of the bar you can reserve for an intimate drink and dining experience.
I'm not sure if they have happy anymore, but I do remember it being a pretty good deal. Great food options and reduced drink prices. 
I totally recommend coming to Barclay Prime for the great food, wine list and experienced mixologists at the bar. 
The only surprise I ran into was the price of the cocktails.  There must have been a recent price increase? For example their Old Fashioned was priced at $30!  I ordered a $17 cocktail, The Metropolis, it consisted of Belvedere ginger zest, limoncello, thyme and white cranberry juice.  It was very good.  The bartenders are highly skilled and very friendly. I will come back again for sure, just not happy with the drink prices.

From start to finish our experience here was amazing! The ambiance inside is beautiful and the seats were so comfortable! Our server whose name I don't remember was amazing and went over the menu with a lot of knowledge. We got the cheesesteak to share as an app and it was DELICIOUS! For entrees we got the lobster, wagyu steak, and truffle Mac and mashed potatoes. Our food took longer than expected so the server brought out a small dish for us to try that was compliments of the chef( we didn't even complain about the wait time) and didn't realize that it was taking a while as we we're still full from the chew steak. Anyways the wait for the food was well worth it as the wagyu steak was a perfect cooked medium and the most tender thing ever. The lobster was in a delicious butter sauce and the sides were both amazing! Will Deff return again!

business.name: Bimini Steakhouse
business.categories: Steakhouses, Restaurants

reviews.text: The food is great the surrounding is even better than that great place for a birthday dinner, I've been there did that and I will be back to do it again,

It is my 21 anniversary so I decided to take my wife here. The food was amazing the steaks to perfection the scallop potatoes very rich in cheese and our server was 6 stars his whole attitude was awesome and you could tell he liked working there
Took my wife to one of our favorite steak houses in Reno Nevada definitely a must if you like a good steak service is excellent

After the  Harrah's Steakhouse forever said goodbye, I can't find a good steakhouse. But, This year definitely changed my mindset the Bimini Steakhouse gives an excellent service ( though sometimes some servers are lacking of passion of what they do) not a big issue.

The Ambiance is great, spacious and has classy taste.

They will first serve you different kinds of bread and butter ( which is dangerous).

I got to experience some of the best foods that ever served in Reno, We had a Japanese wagyu and scallops for appetizer incredibly a mouth watering experience. The wagy melts in your mouth. so soft that you will feel a different ecstacy, the scallops are humungous  served with delicious sauce.

Before they served you the Entreé, they will serve a sorbét ( depending on the flavor they have) my favorites are lemon, mango and watermelon added with Chamagne.. It's a delight to clean your palate, the servers are happy to serve us one more round.

For our entreé, I have been three times pardon me if I don't remember it. We ordered steaks, flavorful and beautiful curated according to your needs. We ordered a crab legs,  they are sweet and doesn't have salty taste, it's juicy and perfect without a butter.  The risotto salmon was creamy and light. The noodle in the menu with bunch of seafood was our favorite, pasta was fresh and tasty, adding with seafood was sumptuous.. 


If you want to order a ceasar salad they will prepare in front on you, I got to experience the freshness.  I ordered a lemon drop lavander martini, your server will prepare in front of you, the sourness is that excites me..

They'll give you a hot towel to clean your hands

Their dessert was good, I recommend the cheesecake and the chocolate. But if not they will give you a chocolate caramel at the end of the meal.

I got to experience to meet the chef that all do the wonders and magic in our food. He gives so much love on his plate masterpieces. I commend Chef Kirk Zion Miranda, he is humble and graciuosly gives us his small amount of time..

Everyone, the staff are warm and welcoming. I highly recommend this place for an intimate dinner with friends, family or a special someone.. 

Thank you, Bimini Steakhouse for the high class experience. hi

I rate Bimini as the 5 star fine dinning experience it proports to be.  If Bimini was a neighborhood steak house or an Outback the rating would be higher; however, the price point and "service" was in question.
   A few of my friends were in town and asked me to make a recommendation for all of us to dine, a good steak and great service.  I have heard good things about Bimini and made the reservation.  
   I am not a snob nor a professional critic but when I am paying 50 to 75 dollars for a steak or lamb I expect it to be without flaw.  All four of us, MEH, mediocre cuts of meat, small cuts and just plain bland.  Could have gotten the same quality and cut for one third the price across the street.  10 to 15 dollars for the sides, bland, nothing special and really small potions, shareable, not.  Oysters Rockefeller for an appetizer, dry and tasted "old".  Finally, we all shared the table side prepared Bananas Foster for dessert.  Which brings me to the service.  Two gents shared duties and neither of them had one personality between them.  Overworked, running around, no care, no love, no passion for fine dinning service.  I felt as if I was at Moes diner at rush hour.  Terrible service experience.  Either they were both pissed off, didn't care or were poorly trained.  All in all for a $400.00 bill the food was sub-standard, the service was weak and the general atmosphere left me angry and dying to leave the Bimini and the Peppermill.  
   At this price point, I will not except the now stock excuse of - we can't get anyone to work-, not when one pays this kind of money and gets a one to two star experience.  Nobody is asking for their butt to be kissed, but check on your table, a thank you, engage in conversation when you are making a table side dessert.  If the customer doesn't desire conversation, use your brain and figure that out.  Dumping plates at a table and rolling the dice for a 15 percent tip is NO WAY to bring customers back.
   Truly a real disappointment, I wanted my friends to have a great meal (me too) instead it was a poor experience, overpriced and over rated.

This was a very Important dinner celebration for me! Celebrating my 65th birthday! Wow, Yukoo :)

It's a funny thing because when I made the reservations about a month before I thought we had been here for my husbands birthday a few
years before we had moved to Reno. But as we were being escorted to our table, I realized that I hadn't because it was completely new to me...
My husband corrected me and said it had been the Atlantis steak house... This was perfect since I'm always on the hunt for new places to try here
in town. I've been very happy with the eateries in the casinos thus far. 

We did bring a bottle of our own champagne since they really mark them up so much. I'm always happy to pay the corkage. Anyway our server Robert
was excellent and so fun to tease and banter with. Having a wonderful person waiting on you makes the whole experience so much better In every single 
way! I usually ask the sever their opinion on certain apps and desserts. This has always served me so well in the past. I mean who knows best? Them! 

Three of us got red meat, 2 filets and one porterhouse. My husband had the snapper. Robert had recommended the lobster mash potatoes and they were
yummy and fun to try. The breads were great because they had 3 different kinds to choose from, I love that. They were very tasty. These kinds of high end steakhouses 
always cook your meat just perfectly and they didn't disappoint here. Our filets were out of this world yummy. It's hard to find new adjectives to describe awesome 
meals.

We had a great dinner here. The food was excellent, the servers were top notch and the environment was lovely. When you go take the time to dress nicely and make it a classy experience. Leave the jeans for the cafe and the sweats for the gym. This place deserves the respect to be a dressy place.

We ordered Caesar salad as an appetizer to start, delicious! As an entree we ordered 8oz. Prime filet mignon. Hands down best steak I've ever had in my life, sides; potato au gratin and sautéed veggies great experience! Drinks were well made (Bimini/Old Fashioned). Our waiter Patrick was great! Definitely a 5 star experience to end the night.

We had a late reservation (9:00) but got a text about 40 minutes early saying there were available tables, which was nice. From beginning to end, service was top notice! Very attentive without being overbearing. Food was all delicious too, all the way down to the little sea-salted caramel chocolates that were brought at the end of the meal. Would definitely recommend!

Let me begin by admitting that I am not the city of Reno's biggest fan. I don't gamble, I don't love the smell of cigarettes. But what I do love is good food. Well, with Bimini Steakhouse at the Peppermill, boy did we find it. And because we weren't throwing our dollars away on tables and slots, we had plenty to throw down on quite possibly the BEST STEAK OF MY LIFE.

I ordered the coconut prawns and the beet salad to start. Both delicious. All the steaks are served a la carte so you need to order sides separately if you want them. I got the 8 Oz filet, and I ordered it medium well. Before you scoff at my temp preference, let me assure you, they cooked it perfectly. Still the slightest amount of pink in the center and the most tender and flavorful cut of beef I've ever had. I savored every bite of it. Because we had so much food, I took half home to enjoy later and my husband and I were like two ravenous chickens pecking at the remaining pieces. Sides we ordered with our steaks were the mushrooms (highly recommended) and the steaks came with a chef's garnish. Something with lentils.

One person in our party ordered one of the table side cocktails. While entertaining, was also a bit over the top, but the lavender lemon martini that took him 10 minutes to make was very delicious.

The palette cleanser of champagne and sorbet was a fun touch before our main course. We were so stuffed we couldn't eat dessert. 

I will definitely make it a point to return if I am ever in Reno again. I may even venture to say I'd make a special trip (3 hour drive!) to eat here. Do give this spot a try. You won't be disappointed.

We celebrated our anniversary here and it did not disappoint. Patrick and Amyre took care of us and they were awesome . We didn't have any issues with our visit probably just couple opinions. 

Complimentary bread ...delicious especially cheese and bacon one .
Table side Cesar salad the dressing was soo good 
Diver Scallop - fresh and cooked perfectly with truffle potatoes. ( I think it's a bit pricey $22 for 1 piece ) 
American wagyu New York strip - cooked perfectly 
American filet mignon- cooked perfectly but ( was bit cold and smidge dry ) but did get roasted garlic cabernet sauce which helped & the steak was very tender still.
We were treated to dessert and it was amazing not overly sweet for being all chocolate . 
Definitely recommend this place and we'll be back

First time to dine at Bimini Steakhouse located at the Peppermill Casino.  Finding the restaurant was a little tricky as it's on the second floor (hint: near health club).  We were greeted by two very nice hostesses who walked us to our table for our 6:00 reservation. Book your reservation AT LEAST 3 weeks in advance for Friday or Saturday as they were booked for the most popular times.Our wait staff of 3 were VERY SEASONED PROFESSIONALS (Gary and gentleman from Sonoma who's name escapes me sorry). We started with a lemon sorbet to freshen our pallet.  We ordered American Wagyu beef.  We decided to split the 16 oz. ($75) because an 8 Oz. was almost as much as the 16 Oz.  This was my first time for American Wagyu.  While it was very good, it's still not nearly as good as Japanese Wagyu ($200).  We ordered the King Crab Oscar which was very good.  The hollandaise sauce was delicious.  We had mushrooms and Brussel sprouts which had bacon.  We brought our own bottle of Cab and there was a $30 corkage fee.  Overall the service was EXCELLENT and the meal was good.
Thanks !!  We will be back.

Great steaks, great Mac and cheese and lobster potatoes sides, has an amazing Caesar salad.

Service was good. Lots of waiters. 

8/10

Amazing! We celebrated our anniversary here and I have to say, GREAT JOB BIMINI. I see why people speak so highly of this place. The food was amazing and the service even better. I can't wait to come back.

This place was amazing all around! I ate here with my husband for our anniversary dinner, and it did not disappoint. The servers were all very friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating to my gluten free diet. They even had fresh gluten free bread! My husband got the wagyu steak and it was melt-in-your-mouth amazing. The lobster mashed potatoes were excellent, and brussel sprouts were crispy and delicious.  My tomahawk was seasoned and cooked to perfection. It was well worth the price, and was an experience we will treasure forever!

We love this place. This is the 4th time we have been here since we moved from California. 
We had Franz and Rose as our servers. They were very attentive and friendly. Pete the manager is always friendly and really knows his wines. We had 4 filets, a prime rib, lobster whipped mash potatoes, true chopped salad and brussel sprouts. Only complaint I could ever have was the brussel sprouts were slightly under cooked. Everything else was absolutely amazing. We will definitely keep coming back here.

A fantastic experience for my husband's birthday! The service is exceptional (thank you, Robert!) and the food was outstanding. Hubby went all out with the 26 oz. Tomahawk Ribeye. I had the 8oz. Filet and the French Onion soup. The steaks were cooked to perfection and the soup was like something I've never seen before. If you're in Reno, and at the Peppermill, this is THE steakhouse. Reservations are pretty much required.

What an awesome experience !! 

I highly recommend the Peppermill and when you go you definitely have to stop at the steakhouse!

I have never been to a restaurant before or the service was this incredible, they even served us a raspberry sherbet mix for champagne to cleanse our pallet 

The fillet was so good and so tender I highly recommend the coconut prawns and the stuffed mushrooms

Thanks again Bimini ! See you soon
Ate here for the first time last night and I had the prime rib. Delicious!!! Service was extraordinary as well!! The sourdough bread was great too! I really enjoyed my meal

Wow! Our first trip to Reno and our first dinner totally set the tone for the trip. We had the best service, our waiters Franz and Gabe totally made the experience extra. I believe it was the manager that came by twice to just check on how things were and poured us wine. Maybe we just ordered the best dishes, but the tables around us were interested in everything we ordered, which we took as a complaint. Thanks, Bimini for a great evening!
Always a solid experience. This place never disappoints . Seafood that is fresh every time
Adding one more star as the Manager, Dave reached out to me during our stay to address our concerns.

Major disappointment.  Our first getaway since the pandemic.  Didn't want to travel too far so took the drive from the Bay Area for 5 night stay in one of the luxury suites.  Got in yesterday and was really looking forward to dinner here.  First off it took about 10 minutes after we were seated for someone to come take our drink order.  Hubby has a shellfish allergy so couldn't really order any appetizers.  But we did order the bone marrow.  It was basically tasteless.  Only finished half of one bone.  Our Waiter wasn't aware that there were two different 22 oz bone-in ribeyes on the menu.  I had to get the menu back and show him.  I asked for mine to be cooked between medium & medium well (Ruth Chris calls it medium plus).  The waiter had a hard time with it...  It ended up coming out more like medium rare.  No pink at all it was pure red.  They took it back to cook it more and what a disaster.  It was overlooked.  All brown.  More like well done.  Very dry and no seasoning whatsoever.  I only ate a few bites.  My scalloped potatoes were dry and not good.  After we were done our waiter came by and said he would bring our check.  Did not even ask us if we wanted dessert.  That is a first.  Never ever would I visit this place again.  We are here a few more nights and have reservations for the Italian restaurant but I will be cancelling.
Our sever, Bob, was excellent! The food is great, but the experience is what makes this place memorable. Table side signature drinks are so cool. Highly recommend.

Back at Bimini tonight, servers Bill and Saryvel were excellent. I had a filet cooked perfectly, very tender and had good flavor., My wife had the prime rib and was happy with the meat. Pricey bit considering the service and quality of the meat I can recommend this restaurant.

business.name: Eddie V's Prime Seafood
business.categories: Jazz & Blues, Nightlife, Bars, Arts & Entertainment, Lounges, Restaurants, Seafood, Steakhouses

reviews.text:
Super chic!
Attended a private party here and was very impressed.
Service terrific!
Nice dressy place.
Extensive menu and wine selection.
Best bruschetta I e ever had as well as the side of rice was phenomenal.
Sea bass super good.

So, I would give this place 3.5 stars if I could. We had reservations and were seated right away. It has a very upscale environment which was expected. 

The service however, meh. Our waiter took our drink order and let us know he'd be brining out bread for the table that never got brought. We had to ask another server for bread and he promptly delivered warm bread that was delicious. Our waiter came took our order and delivered our food, but the service stopped there. He didn't ask how our meal was, if we needed anything additional, etc. It was disappointing. 

The food. Ordered the Calamari for an appetizer which was good once we found the sauce. What I mean by find, was that you had to move the calamari and dig to the bottom of the plate to find where all of the sauce had pooled. 

For entrees we ordered the 2 filet mignon steak, one was Oscar style with asparagus, lobster, wrapped in bacon and Hollandaise drizzled on top. Both steaks were disappointingly under seasoned. Like, absolutely no salt, seasoning or butter to be found. It broke my heart. The bacon wrapped around my steak was almost inedible. It wasn't really cooked and shouldn't have been served. We also ordered the truffle Mac and cheese for our side which was very delicious. We topped off the evening with the Hot chocolate Godiva cake that comes with ice cream and ate every bite. 

Needless to say, probably won't be back.

One of my ultimate favorite places to visit not only because it's beautiful inside and the hospitality is amazing it's one of the best places to get a smoked old fashioned yessss honey... I'm that girl who loves a good old fashioned. Hands down they deliver every single time!!! They really go all out for you and make you feel special. 

Sorry I totally forgot to take a photo of our Butter Poached Lobster, White Cheddar Mashed Potatoes
Oh my word delicious such an amazing flavor and whipped to perfection. I also decided on the oysters  and they were really great as well. Honestly I've been here several times and definitely on my husbands birthday as this is one of his favorite places to come. 

If you're in town or near by, get jazzed up  and go enjoy  a great night. We sure did AlwAys

I made reservations for my husbands birthday and we had a great time at Eddie V's. It was a hefty bill but I will say that the steak was excellently cooked and marinated. We really enjoyed it. They oysters were also very delicious. I took off one star for (not pictured) beet salad. I was really excited because I love beets but once I tasted it I was not impressed. Also the crème brûlée was more pudding like than I'd like it but the flavors were great. I really appreciate the effort they made to make sure my husband's birthday was celebrated. They had happy birthday confetti and a birthday card on the table waiting for us. We also got a complimentary banana cake desert with fire! Lol. I have to say that my filet mignon was delicious. I will definitely come back to enjoy the steak here for sure. Oh - the lobby area where we wait for our table is really small. It was really uncomfortable especially since a group of like 6-7 women were in a circle taking up the whole space.

5 stars nothing less
This had been on my bucket list and did not diss appoint

And someone else was paying!!
Lol

I had the sea bass
I asked them to grill it
They said yes
They didn't 
But it was still amazing

Yellowtail sashimi like nothing I've had anywhere else

Lobster mashed potatoes
Asparagus
Crème brûlée

Simply amazing


Parking sux 

I'll be back

There was a bunch of other things I wanted to
Try
Probably the best meal that we have ever had. Just straight up steak and lobster. But wow they do it better then anyone. Service was spot on can't wait to come back to try other things.

We enjoyed another excellent night out at Eddie V's a few Fridays ago - live music is back!  We saw Off the Cuff again - they are outstanding!  Kirsten can sing anything and really gets the crown engaged! 

As always, our drinks were made perfectly and were expertly balanced.
