We started with their fresh Blue Point oysters with a favorite add-on: thinly slices serranos for some heat! 

This time, we eschewed the bovine offerings and went for the crustacean...and why not?  Their jumbo shrimp cocktail is still the best in town, IMHO.  The shrimp is tender and soft: they must poach it in butter? Olive oil?  And the side sauces are on point: cocktail, to which you can add more horseradish if you prefer, and a delicious stone crab-esque sauce. 

Service was again impeccable; Brian is fantastic, and one of the OGs, Christine, stopped by to say hello!

What can I say... EVERYTHING was a 10/10! Drinks, steaks, sides, appetizers and dessert! No exaggeration! The only thing I was not a fan of was the crab fried rice, BUT it still had great flavor! Service was phenomenal! Definitely have been recommending this place since I left!

What started as terrible service..25+ minute  wait for our drinks was righted by the Manager. He noticed our situation,  took our drink order, our food order and sent over complimentary incredible appetizers to the table. From then on our service was perfect. He righted a wrong asap. The food was amazing as always and the appetizers He brought added to our favorites. Also the water young man was amazing. Attentive, he noticed  our situation, came into
 help when needed and eager. Everyone has a bad moment and the team at Eddie V's turned the night around! Thank you especially since we were celebrating a 16th N day!
Love Eddie V's! If you haven't been, you must go. Also, their happy hours are incredible. Shrimp Cocktail, Tuna Tacos, Calamari are my top faves and their Scallops.

LOVE THIS PLACE! If you are in the area this a MUST.  Eddie V's has the BEST steak we have ever had. The swordfish special is delicious. The server Marc was a dream! Such a sweet man who took amazing care of us and gave us free dessert.  The lounge had a fantastic live jazz band. 100% love recommend this place. Eating here made me want to move to Tampa

This was our first time eating here. We made reservations for our anniversary. 
They offered complimentary valet parking which was nice since parking was limited. We were greeted by the front of house staff which was welcoming. The restaurant was dimly lit, and very romantic. People were dressed to the nines and in hoodies which surprised me. 
Service was amazing and not rushed at all. Food was great, minus the asparagus which was completely over cooked. But will let that slide as everything else was stellar. Sameerah took great care of us. Highlights were the caviar, oysters, burrata salad and truffle Mac and cheese.

Each time I've gone to Eddie V's it's been a wonderful dining experience.
Everything you eat there is delightful.  The staff from start to finish, I've never been disappointed there.
WOW! Is all I can say. Went here for our anniversary and everything was fantastic and upscale. Would greatly recommend this place for higher end dinners.
Put me in a food coma.  Everything was FANTASTIC. Large portions..... Excellent staff.

Eddie V's happy hour is one of my favorite happy hours. This visit, I had oysters on a half shell at $2 each, which is a phenomenal price for such a classy and luxurious experience. My cocktail was delicious as always and service was impeccable. 

I had the lobster tacos (not on the HH menu) and they were good, but not like the fish tacos which are no longer on the menu. Well, I am a creature of habit and Lord knows I loved those damn fish tacos. R.I.P. I will say that I have never had anything at Eddie V's that wasn't tasty. 

I didn't order any this time, but if truffle Mac&Cheese is your thing, you're in for a treat. I'll be sure to order that first next time I go there.
Very fancy restaurant and the food as well my steak was delicious and my wife really enjoyed the fish as well highly recommend

Tonight was the second time we have had dinner at Eddie V's. And for the second time we had the most AMAZING service & food. The service is flawless and their food & cocktails are pure perfection! Tonight between the 4 of us we were celebrating 3 birthdays this week. Table decorations, a card & beautifully presented desserts for our birthdays topped off a perfect dining experience! We unfortunately had to cut our evening short after I received a call from my son who was not feeling well. But our server rushed to bring us our surprise desserts & had our check ready soon after for us as we informed him we had to leave. In a time where supply shortages & staffing shortages plague many businesses, it's wonderful to visit a business pre & post pandemic and receive the BEST food & service both times!

Eddie V's

We had the DREAM TEAM!  The evening started with Christine recommending specials and taking our order, and then Alicia began making classic cocktails - if she wasn't familiar with a drink she came to talk to us. Alicia made every 100 year-old drink we threw at her and each one was 100% perfect. The food is amazing, but you could totally come here for the drinks alone!

Christine decanted our wine so it was ready when our steaks arrived. Food was what you would expect from a fabulous restaurant- everything was perfect. 

This was a fabulous evening. Thank you Christine and Alicia!  Best night of the year thanks to you ladies!
First time, very nice atmosphere great live band, the food and service were both outstanding. Recommend, We will return soon.

Came and dined at Eddie vs after my table was 15 minutes later after my reservation. Samantha was my server and literally THE BEST server I think I've ever had! Attentive. Attention detailed. Pro active! I can't go on about how great she was! 

She turned my frown upside down! 

Thank you so much Samantha!

Good food and great service.

Let's get this out of the way. Get a reservation. Ask to sit in a booth. You're welcome (unless you have a large party, there's limits on booth size). People without reservations seem to wait quite a while.

Eddie Vs has valet parking and thank goodness because I didn't see any parking that wasn't valet. They are super busy people at the valet stand so please don't spend ten minutes digging in your car for god knows what and holding up the whole process. 

We dressed up a bit for this place and I'm glad we did. There were a few folks underdressed and they stood out in a bad way. We were seated quickly. 

The cocktails we ordered were great, especially the purple Diamond Martini thing. It was fairly sweet so I wouldn't have more than one but it was very good. All of our food was cooked well, served at a good pace and good. Good, very good but not GREAT. None of the desserts were appealing to us so we skipped that part. 

Our server was extremely nice, professional and attentive without being obtrusive. 

This restaurant does not appear to have reduced seating or increased space between tables. While the staff is masked, this place is quite crowded, even on a weeknight.

We have been here several times the staff, ambiance and food are stellar. Chris the manager is absolutely professional, welcoming and fun! Brittany our first waitress was stellar and one night we didn't have a reservation and stood at raw bar and Ashley the bartender totally worked so hard to her us chairs. She made the best wine recommendations and the steaks and seafood tower are killer. Our next time we sat at bar and Nicole and Tyler knocked it out of the park with waiting on us and recommendations! Can't wait to go back again.

This was my first time dining at Eddie V's and I was excited to finally see what the rave was about. Unfortunately, upon arrival at 735pm prior to our reservation for 745pm we were pushed aside and not seated until 815pm even though we had a reservation. What made it worse was 4 other tables were sat before us and they had arrived after we did. Then the experience got even worse since there were so many delicious options to choose from in an effort to save room for dessert we requested to go boxes for the left overs and our server took our plates away and informed us he would box the food for us. Upon arriving home I noticed we were missing a box then I realized the waiter never gave us our truffle mac and cheese that was left over. I am very disappointed by this entire experience and highly unsatisfied with the treatment I received.

I hate to give a restaurant a bad review but I have to after I was there this evening. The only reason is after ordering the halibut special this evening I had to. The halibut dish was the special this evening and was possibly the worst seafood dish I have ever had. The fish was tasteless and so dried out that I couldn't eat it. It reminded me of dried fish. Other than this the rest of the meal was fine. I'm sure that this is not normal here however our order was so bad I had to write this review.

business.name: Modo Mio
business.categories: Italian, Gluten-Free, Food, Restaurants

reviews.text: Went on a Sunday when they have a special all inclusive menu. Was not disappointed! From the antipasto to the pastas to the meats to the desserts...all were great! Different, as it was family style, but enough food for a doggie bag!

This has to be one of the best restaurants I've been to in Philly. We got a four course meal, and the duck main course that I got was absolutely delicious. Dessert was also amazing, and so was every course. They are moving locations, so I hope they keep the food quality.

The servers were pretty rude. They were a bit defensive about their errors. All they need to is say "I apologize but that is restaurant policy". We also sensed some competition amongst the servers. They weren't nice to each other either lol. Food was good but nothing spectacular.

Updated review from our visit on Friday

Service is the focus of this review, and the reason for the star deduction. Our table was missing water glasses and silverware to start. Once we got our appetizers, we asked for our silverware which they did kindly replace for us. But each time the dishes were taken away and a new dish brought out, our silverware would be taken away but new ones did not replace them -- this happened a few times.

The biggest offense in service though, was that on the tasting menu there is no mark up noted on the MP fish of the day, nor the lamb special she had explained to us when we ordered/ ask about it. I specifically asked what the fish of the day was , and she replied and explained but did not say there'd be an upcharge of $10 or that there would be an upcharge of $5 to my friend's lamb dish..

Once we got the bill , after already setting the check on the table she said " oh god you guys are going to hate me, but I have to add the $5 on top and the $10 for the fish"... what up charge? She didn't tell us. The usual route and the best customer service is to note it for next time, let us know that "  hey by the way there was a $5 and  $10 I forgot to tell you guys about, but since I the server forgot to tell you, we'll waive the charge". Instead of " hey i forgot to tell you guys about this $15 up charge soooo I'm just going to add it to your bill... "   (since 20% gratuity is included anyway and she knows we cant deduct that). 

Overall I was pretty displeased with the way she handled that and found it completely manipulative and unprofessional.

Food was good but the service left a unpleasant taste in my mouth.

First time  here with my husband to celebrate my 40th birthday . Loved everything about this restaurant ! The food and our waiter James were excellent!  We had a 4 course meal for $40 per person and everything was so delicious! They are moving to another location . There last day open at this location will be June 29th. So if you in the mood to try some real Italian cooking you  need to go and check this place out! Looking forward to come again

Modo Mio has become me and my man's very favorite spot for date night. The food is always phenomenal and the menu rotates frequently, so there is always something new to try. 
We always do the tasting menu, which has to be the best deal in town. For $40-$45 (I can't remember!) you get four courses...app, pasta, meat, and dessert. 
My favorite app we have ever gotten has to be the mussels. I don't even fucks with mussels but decided to give them a try here. They were so fresh and the sauce was very flavorful. Definitely the best I've ever had. 
I love pasta in all varieties, so it is hard to pick a favorite pasta I've had here! I will say I prefer their red sauces, especially meat sauces, here. The specials are always great too. 
As far as the meat dishes go, I had a swordfish here that blew my tits off. So unbelievably delicious!! Last time we were here my boyfriend got the skirt steak which he really loved. For the price, it really can't be beat. 
You must leave room for dessert, because they are always fabulous. I got a raspberry custard here once that was very unique and delicious. The tiramisu is our favorite, and thankfully it seems to always be on the menu! 
Another fun thing the restaurant offers is Sunday family style dinner. You basically don't order and eat whatever they put in front of you. When we went it was a charcuterie board, mussels, spaghetti, meatballs, sausage, lasagna, various meats, and dessert. We could barely walk when we were done because we were so full! 
Mood Mio is a BYOB which is pretty much the icing on the delicious cake. Everything here is perfection and I will continue is to come here first for my Italian fix.

OK, after reading all of the YELP reviews suggesting Chef "over salts", "salts forward", "heavily salts" the food, I had visions of walking out of the place looking like Lot's wife, ya know, from the bible. ;-)  But it didn't happen...NOT EVEN CLOSE.  And I have been a critic of salt overdose for years, in an attempt to create flavor, as amateur-like food prep.

Moving on....

This small BYOB, was cozy but full of sound, but as I always say if you want quiet, stay home.  The service was good, food delivery to the table a little sporadic, but wtf, not a big deal once you started eating.  The prix fixe tasting works like this, which took a couple of explanations by Alexis for it to sink in:  Four courses, you pick each course from menu yourself, $40, of course slightly smaller portions than regular, but trust me, each course is plenty, and I ain't a light eater.

I had the Lumache, Sicilian style braised snails with mushrooms in a lovely buttery sauce with a touch of tomato, with fried cheese, my favorite dish of the evening -- 5 stars
Followed with the pan seared gnocci with spinach.  I love a wonderful pan seared gnocci, this was good, not wow. -- 3.5 stars
My entree was the branzino, filleted, crispy skin side up, fresh, delightful.-- 4 stars
The tiramisu, scooped in a ball was tasty, soft, creamy, a touch thin in flavor --  3 stars, not the best I ever had

Overall, a satisfying experience and looking forward to a return visit or three or four to try the rest of the menu.

CIAO

I am not sure what that hype is about. When I first walked towards the restaurant, I saw one of the cooks sitting on the steps outside in the back of the restaurant, scratching his foot with his bare hands, it made me feel weird about how my food will be handled. 

Ordered the chef special or experience:
-mussels, which was extremely salty and very buttery.), 
-rabbit ravioli, which was had a sour spoiled taste.
-swordfish, which was very fishy like they used cheap fish to make
-some olive oil cake, which was ok

My $40 experience was very unpleasant. I won't be returning to this place.

So I guess you should give a second thought to a restaurant when the waiter describes the chef philosophy as "salt forward" .  There were three of us dining we each had two courses.  Everything was well prepared with interesting flavor but each dish was very salty.  We didn't finish anything.  I asked the waiter about the salt forward philosophy and he stated that they get a lot of complaints about the food being too salty but the chef would not change his methods so they came up with salt forward.

To be fair the restaurant was packed and others review it well.  I can't figure that out.  We'll never go back.

I hate to say it: the food wasn't impressive AT ALL! Homemade bread + ricotta and olive oil was good; scallop was good but not sure what it was sitting on; grilled squid salad was bathed in balsamic so it was hard to tell one ingredient from the other; razza was tasty but not a refined taste at all and potato cake was burnt; my friend had the fish soup, which he didn't like. I am Italian, born and raised in Italy, and I was disappointed. 3 stars instead of 2 because our server was very nice, happy, and helpful (but the others didn't seem to be).

A man is not measured by his experiences in good times, but rather when faced by desperation and struggle. So begins the ordeal of my fiancé's graduation dinner. And Modo Mio can be measured as one of the finest, most accommodating, and frankly tastiest restaurants in the city.

Perhaps the world.

Our group had to be enlarged at the last minute because many people wanted to celebrate my fiancé graduating law school. I assume because many of her family members have secretly been living lives of crime and will now get the help they need. Modo Mio was very helpful. Not in committing crimes! In making room for a larger party! They were great.

The food was amazing. I've eaten some weird stuff in my day and I've eaten boring stuff in my day. This was neither. The mussels were delicious. The ravioli was delicious. The rib eye was (wait for it) delicious.

The staff was exceptional. There were people in our party that I wasn't speaking to (because of an incident last month playing mini-golf. I won't get into it, but 8 year-olds need to learn that a stroke counts even if you just bumped the ball while lining up the shot.) This is all a way to say the staff was so nice I would have rather sat with them all night.

Go to Modo Mio. Tip well. If you don't take advantage of this incredible little gem, you are a fool and I will not send you a Christmas card.

Very disappointing. Went on Sunday which is a fixed family style menu. Oops! When making reservation they forgot to mention that. Ok, they were apologetic and tried to accommodate, but still limited choices. 

As to food, bread was nothing special and chef doesn't like to serve it with better or olive oil so it's dry only.  

Anti pasta plate was good. 

Pastas were SALTY! Another review said the chef likes to cook with salt forward. OK but my experience is that good food and good recipes can be done with a minimum of salt. 

The meat plate was fine, but again very salty, and really nothing special.

The highlight of the meal where the desserts which were very good.

The service was dreadfully slow even to the point where they have trouble making change for a $20 bill quickly.

Fantastic food that will fill you up but the service sucks. We werent given menus for over 15 minutes. I looked around at one point and no one at other tables, including ours, had food or drinks. They ran out of bread. They didnt bring us drink refills or more olive oil until we asked a few times. It took us 3 hours to get through dinner because they were so slow. The restaurant is so loud my voice is sore the next day from screaming at the person across the table from me. The waiters were not attentive even though the restaurant probably has less than 20 tables. Oh and the atm was out of cash and its a  ash only place. I was told to go to the bank across the street. I went to two of them and neither atms were open so I had to go to acme instead.

This place was all I hoped it would be. Have been meaning to come here for quite a while now, and finally made it here in a group of four. Make your reservations in advance. We did it the week of, and managed to get a very early time on Saturday for dinner, which we didn't mind!

Since we did get a variety of dishes (turista menu of course!), I'll just list the ones that stood out to us:

Antipasti - The sformato (crab cake) was delicious. You can occasionally go wrong with a crab cake, but this was fantastic, not at all bready or heavy, and very creamy.

Pasta - Every pasta we got was great, but the ditalini and agnolotti were amazing. The ditalini was baked in a dish with multiple cheeses on it and was really flavorful, and the rabbit and sage butter really came through in the agnolotti. 

Secondi - My absolute favorite was a special they had that night, a veal cheek cooked in a double broth. The meat was extremely tender, and it was so rich that we couldn't even finish it despite it being a smaller portion of food. That may have been due to the other courses we had before it, though.

Service was great. For as crowded and busy a small venue it was, our server explained everything in detail and was so kind. I will say that everything was extremely salty, and that's the only reason I took a star off. But with the flavors as rich as they were and for the dishes being so well-crafted, you won't even mind.

Did you know they have a sister restaurant called Monsu?!?!?!?!?
It took us three visits to figure that out...

Went for the tasting menu again: 
1st: 
- Sicilian snails: came with mushrooms and cheese in a tomato sauce. Very juicy, good amount of snails and mushroom 
- crispy zucchini: a little heavy, and a little salty, but it had great flavor 

2nd:
- pappardelle: flat pasta "dragged" in shrimp and tomato sauce. BEST. DISH of the night. The pasta wasn't starchy like other pasta it was kind of crispy. Also, did not know tomato sauce could taste THAT good. Licked my plate clean. Also not joking, my boyfriend started fighting me for this plate. 
- Gnocchi: it was good, just nothing like the pappardelle. A little too filling, and too oily for my taste. 

3rd:
- salmon fillet: little over cooked, came in a tomato sauce, would prefer the whole orata fish. Also came with olives and I'm not a huge olive fan so I might be biased there 
- veal with arugula: fried veal, with arugula salad on top, nice balance 

Dessert:
- ricotta cheesecake: like always, amazing. 
- tiramisu: I thought there was too much cream at first...but then I looked down at my plate and realized I ate it all...so there's that

My daughter recommended this place because she loves food and we were celebrating a bunch of birthdays.  There were seven of us on a Sunday and we ordered their family style meal.  We were made to feel comfortable right away by the front of house staff, George in particular.  The four staff members were extremely nice and efficient while explaining the menu.  The antipasti was amazing - everyone raved about the mussels, the home cured meats and the overflowing tray of an abundance of delicacies.  My two favorites - the shredded carrots with fennel and the bread with gorgonzola and balsamic mushrooms.  The sharp cheese was also excellent.   Next the heaping platters of pasta came out and the lasagna melted in your mouth it was so good.  There were also trays of meats - pork, chicken, sausage and meatballs.  Finally, a palate cleanser of arugula salad.  The desserts were amazing - tiramisu, olive oil cake with nutella, and ricotta cheesecake.  We had brought our own wine and beer and we ordered cafe americano and were served complimentary sambuca because of our birthday celebrations.  The whole time, the staff was amazing and the chef greeted each table.  For the price, I think it was $37 per person, the food was fabulous and the service was top notch.  I"m not sure why it is rated as three $$$ to be honest.  It's a small place, so you definitely need reservations.  I can't wait to go back to try their a la carte menu.  My only tiny concern is that I need to watch my sodium and a few of the dishes were really heavily salted.

At the recommendation of a co worker, the lady and I decided to try this restaurant a few months ago.  It was absolutely amazing.  The fresh bread and pasta are amazing.  I do like my comfort foods, but the snails were so good.  

We decided to go again recently and they delivered once again.  My lady is not a fan of mussels, but they were highly recommended.  Even she loved them.  I had the skirt steak.  I did not know you could make a skirt steak into something so incredible.  She had the swordfish and I think I stole half of it from her plate.  We had a raspberry dessert which was a great way to end the meal.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  It's not high priced and it's always impressive.  Btw, the serving staff is knowledgeable and helpful.

I tend to not go for Italian restraunts as they are not my cup of tea but I went here a month ago for my cointerns birthday dinner. It was crowded! Our waitress looked stressed and we had limited interaction with her since she had multiple customers to tend to. The ambiance was nice. The food itself was meh....We had the fixed menu. My first dish was mussles , which were delicious. The second dish was the gnocchi. It was dry and not too flavorful. The third dish was the lamb which was underwhelming and salty. I tried some of my friends dishes and we were in consensus too much sodium all around. The steak that my friend ordered was also undercooked, she had wanted a medium steak. The fourth course was dessert. Since our party was 7 people we received two dishes with three small items (tiramisu, chocolate cake and lemony cheese cake. The cheese cake was delicious. The chocolate fudge was very heavy and the tiramisu was on point) so as far as the desserts go they were an A. But overall with the pricing and the other dishes I'd give this place a C+. Will I be going back? Likely, no.

We came here twice, no pics from the first time since we scarfed down our (boyfriend and I) food because it was aaammmmaaazzzing, so we came back a second time!

FIRST TIME: we did the turista, obviously, $40 for three courses and dessert who wouldn't?!
- 1st course: scallop and pork belly, I got mussels. Scallop and pork belly was great, mussels were a little salty but we were warned by our waitress beforehand. 
- 2nd course: rabbit ravioli, garden lasagna (has meat). Lasagna was absolutely mind blowing with the hints of truffle, ravioli was good too, but lasagna was better. 
- 3rd course: veal cheek, whole orata fish with the crushed tomato sauce. GO WITH THE WHOLE FISH. It was incredible, he finished his dish and started picking at mine. Best dish of the night. Fish was soft and the sauce was INCREDIBLE. 
- Dessert: four cheese cheesecake, blueberry panna cotta. Both were good, would go with the cheesecake though. Boyfriend finished it in less than a minute, didn't really share...

(sidenote about this visit: suuuuuper crowded and a table of 6 next to us held up the table for 45+ minutes waiting for 3 people. waiters and managers were getting pissed since other people were waiting, so we were rushed a little at the end to pick up our check and leave. But we were fine with it!! Super small place and not okay to hold up a table on a busy night)


SECOND TIME: 
- 1st course: meatball, grilled shrimp salad. Meatball was good, sauce was great. Grilled shrimp salad was great!! Shrimp was sweet and not overcooked, it was like a small burst of flavor in your mouth!
- 2nd course: Lasagna, sea diver scallop bucatini. Lasagna was amazing just like the first time, came prettier than the first time too. We practically licked the plate. Sea diver bucatini was amazing as well, scallops went really well with the bucatini. 
- 3rd course: Branzino, whole orata fish. Branzino was small in portion compared to the orata, but the meat was soft and smooth, good flavor but nothing like the orata. Again, it was amazing and I would recommend anyone coming to get the whole fish. 
- Dessert: cheesecake, different from the first time (i asked my boyfriend if he remembered what type and all he said was delicious), and raspberry panna cotta with white chocolate. Again, amazing. 

Also: BYOB!!! Our total came out to be $86 before tip, cash only!

Wow! I suddenly feel like I've never really had Italian food until now. So many delicious and unexpected flavors in every dish. It was, as the waitress put it, "salt forward" with lots of olives and anchovies, and it made everything come together beautifully. Every plate, including dessert, was amazing. The decor is underwhelming, but the ambiance sets in after the sun goes down and the tables start to fill up. The staff are courteous and professional. The bathroom and ATM are located out of sight at the end of a hallway in the back which is nice. And this BYO is conveniently located across from the best wine shop in the city.

I was here with my family on Saturday for my Birthday dinner. We made reservations a few weeks ahead of time to ensure our spot. I've heard so much about Modo Mio since moving to Northern Liberties and I was so excited to finally come here. 

My family and I ordered their tasting menu which is choosing four different courses from each section of their menu. I ordered their burrata, eggplant dishes and their ricotta cheesecake. The rest of my party ordered the fish of the day and their gnocchi. 

My family has some dietary restrictions and Modo Mio was super accommodating. I can't say enough how wonderful the service was at Modo Mio. I felt so at home here. I will definitely be back

Great Italian restaurant. Loved the menu. Really interesting combinations. Decided on the tasting menu which was priced very reasonably considering the large portions. Thank you to Lilly our waitress and chef/owner Peter who couldn't have been nicer to us as he walked around the dining room meeting and talking with all his dinner guests. Also, the busboy and other 2 waitress all very professional. Low keyed atmosphere and BYOB. Definitely make a reservation. We arrived and the dining room just starting to fill up but by the time we left, maybe one table available. Only downside is that we thought the food was a bit oversalted. Definitely will go back again.

The service was awful. When we asked for recommendations, the server quickly brushed us off hurrying to the next table. Later, my significant other was given the wrong food and we had to wait for 20 minutes until the correct dish was brought to us. On top of all of this the food was a bit too "salt forward" for me.

6 of us went for my birthday and it was a night that was beyond disappointing.We had been here several times and the meals were good.However,we should have known when the waiter said"Northern Italian cooking is salty"it was a signal that we should've left.We each ordered 6 different meals figuring we'd share with each other.As we tried each other's dishes we couldn't believe the saltiness of each of them. Each of us had at least 4 glasses of water.We won't be going back anytime soon.

Best deal in philly when it comes to Italian food and byob's. Vibrant flavors, authentic and good portions. Bringing a great bottle of Barolo is a must at this place. Be ready for heavy sauces (not the greasy kind) rich and full of umami. Menu is very varied, they do serve some classic Italian but this is not your boring Generic American Italian restaurant. I would call it a philly institution at this point.

business.name: R2L
business.categories: American (New), Lounges, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Perfect!!! Perfect!!!! Perfect!!! I have no complaints, everything about my experience here was breathtaking. The food & drinks were delicious. My server was marvelous. I give him a $100 tip (lol.. with my poor self) and I haven't did that in a while. The ambiance was amazing. Not often you get to go and enjoy yourself without errors.

Update: With sad notice I tried to go back to this restaurant during the Coving Era, a few times and they were closed and I have recently found out that they have closed their doors forever. It's the great places like this who need our support. Man, this was a gem.

Good food, great service and beautiful view of sunset & the city at night! 
The server got a great sense of humor. We got lobster, pork chop, filet mignon and seafood tower. All was delicious.

Customer service is okay. I went here once for a birthday and another time for New Year's Eve. It was a lot going on nye. Our waiter kept forgetting about us. Food here is good but over price. You're paying for the view I guess. This place is in need of some redecoration. I wouldn't recommend it for younger crowds.

I'll take you through my experience and from this I hope you'll make your own decision on wether a place like this is for you. 
First, we showed up at the front of the "tower" where R2L is located at (the 37th floor).  My girlfriend and I were greeted by a lovely hosted who asked our names and offered to check out coats and then to check us in for our reservation.  After, she directed us to the elevator which took us straight up to the restaurant.  We arrived at the 37th floor and walked out of the elevator to enter a low lit but elegant entry hallway. The hosted was set up at the kiosk ready to take our names and seat us immediately. We sat down at our table which had an immaculate view of the city! Quickly our waiter "Glen" a master at his craft greeted us and informed us he'd be helping us with everything for tonight's evening. We informed him it was our late Valentine's Day dinner/anniversary (that will come into play later). I ordered a few drinks and then it began... I orders the tempera artichoke and the truffle bread as an appetizer.  Shortly after, we ordered the main entree which was lobster (my girlfriends choice) and the ribeye (my choice). Both meals combined could have served 4 people! But it made for something to take home later. We finished the night off with a desert, the names evades me at this moment but it had chocolate, ice cream and marshmallows (delicious). The nicest thing was that when the desert was brought out he wrote "happy anniversary". Glen made my girlfriend feel really special and myself too, he showed us that guest here at R2L aren't just plates being served but that each group was a valued customer. Thank you R2L. Oh and the view!!! The view is out of this world!

I will preface this by saying that the view is beautiful. That being said, the inflated prices solely come from the skyline ambiance. My boyfriend and I went for Valentine's day. They had a Valentine's day menu, an appetizer, entree and dessert for $84 per person, not including tax or tip. For the first course I ordered the shrimp and scallop dumplings. The three tiny dumplings that arrived were cold and tasted like they were microwaved from a frozen package. The roasted chicken for the main course came out cold, and was dry. For the dessert they offer a cheese menu option. This turned out to be 5 small pieces of mediocre cheese with 4 crackers and a tiny dollop of some berry compote in the center. Since we waited a substantial amount of time for our food, the restaurant comped our drinks, which was nice considering a glass of wine is about $14-$16 per glass. It was sadly disappointing for what they were charging.

My boyfriend and I have wanted to try R2L for months, so he surprised me with a romantic pre-valentines day dinner, and we will definitely be back! 
The first thing you notice when walking in is how modernly elegant R2L is decorated. During my experience it was dark outside, so the dining room was very dimly lit to allow a spectacular view of the city's lights. We could see outside for miles and couldn't stop staring all night long. While taking in the view, we enjoyed the most incredible appetizers. Our absolute favorite was the pressed truffle bread. Wow. We ended up ordering more  because of how mouthwatering it was. We wanted to lick the plate clean! We also ordered the shrimp cocktail, as well as the lobster Mac and cheese. The shrimp came with a seasoning on top which in my opinion really boldened the flavor. The lobster Mac and cheese was delicious as well, but the cheese was just a bit too thick for my liking. The presentation, however, was very unique. I've never seen Mac and cheese served in a long, skinny, boat shaped dish. Lastly, I ordered a sangria and it was one of the best sangrias I have ever had! It was very flavorful and fruity, without much of an alcoholic taste. 
For our entrees, I enjoyed the shrimp and scallops, while my other half had the fluke and scallops. Although the portion size was small, the scallops were HUGE. They also melted in my mouth. By the end of the night we actually found ourselves completely stuffed, but to complete our date, our waiter brought out a small cake plate for Valentine's Day. It was a simple surprise that closed out our night perfectly. 
We had an incredible night, incredible view, savory dinner, spectacular service, and cannot wait to come back!
Enjoyed the view. Food and service at the table was good but trying to get a drink at the almost empty bar was a struggle!  Bartender looked right through us.

The service was absolutely horrific! Reservation was for eight at 6:30 was not ready. We waited well over a hour for food. One of the staff members thought we should do his job for him;  other one was forgetful and scarce. The only thing to brag about is the view.

Hmmm okay so there are a lot of negative reviews mainly having to do with the deposit. I eat out a lot down the shore and while restaurants don't require such a high deposit they do require due to limited seating availability to avoid over bookers/ cancelations. 
Anyway I went to my reservation that requires a $25 deposit that was applied to the meal. It's pretty small inside and the tables are close together unless you have a window seat. 
They still had their restaurant week menu so we ordered from there. I had the Shrimp app, filet main course, and the cheese plate for dessert. I thought it was all well prepared and tasty. However, the cheese plate was so weak. I wasn't expecting 4 cheese but 2 slices and some blueberries was quite sad. My sister had the caesar salad, salmon, and chocolate banana bread. Her's was also prepared well. We did not care for the banana bread just wasn't our style. She had a beer and I had a glass of Malbec to the tune of $16... ouch. But my wine was good. We also had the lobster mac and cheese which was probably the best item on the table!
Overall, this place has a fun interior, great view if you can see it, and the food is just what you would expect.

I came here during resturant week and I have been looking forward to coming to this resturantt for months and finally booked a reservation. The food was great and the service was even better. The waitresses  always made sure we had everything we needed and we didn't wait long for our food to come out

The view, beautiful, the Staff friendly and pleasant, the food, delicious. My Co-Workers and I decided to have dinner at this restaurant due to it being  Center City Restaurant Week.  We enjoyed pleasant conversation along with a calming  atmosphere. I will consider returning with the Hubby. I observed a few romantic corners.

I came here with my best friend during restaurant week. This place was recommended by a coworker so I was excited to try it out. It is on the 37th floor and the view from inside the restaurant is amazing. The ambiance is so nice. The booths have zebra seats and the lighting is dim. I ordered from the restaurant week menu and got the thick cut bacon, the salmon, and the lemon blueberry crumble bar and sangria. The sangria was delicious. The thick cut bacon was good, a little too fatty but the taste was still superb. The salmon was amazing. I got mine cooked through and it was crisp on the outside yet nice and tender inside. The lemon blueberry crumble was good but a little too sweet. I wish they had different options for dessert for the restaurant week menu but overall everything was great.

Went here for my birthday and it was fantastic. We were given the best table in the room. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The food was out of this world. The whole experience was great. 
We had a party of five, so we needed to put an initial deposit down on the meal, but that was then put towards our bill in the end.

The view was good (and similar to one I had just seen from a hospital room), the food was good (restaurant week portions) but be careful with the service....the reservation requires a deposit which is kinda unusual but the worse part was our waiter decided to double his tip.  We had a gift card and told him to give himself a $40 tip but he decided to process it as $80 and then we were given the balance on our gift card.  Had the balance on our GC not be checked by me, he would have made $80. Luckily we caught it and now have a major sour taste for this place.  Someone fixed it for us but the waiter never can back to apologize sohis tail must have been caught between his legs.  Buyer beware.

The view was good (and similar to one I had just seen from a hospital room), the food was good (restaurant week portions) but be careful with the service....the reservation requires a deposit which is kinda unusual but the worse part was our waiter decided to double his tip.  We had a gift card and told him to give himself a $40 tip but he decided to process it as $80 and then we were given the balance on our gift card.  Had the balance on our GC not be checked by me, he would have made $80. Luckily we caught it and now have a major sour taste for this place.  Someone fixed it for us but the waiter never can back to apologize...his tail must have been caught between his legs.  Buyer beware. Should have lowered his tip but I'm not like that.  Kinda wish I ddI tho.

i've been here 2 times in the past and had such great experiences but i'm pretty upset about my most recent experience!

 i made a reservation to come here for my dad's birthday and made the deposit with my credit card. because of a family emergency i had to cancel (5 days before the reservation) and i called to cancel. i was notified that i wouldn't get reimbursed for the credit card hold and instead can either get a gift card or it will go towards another reservation.

i've never heard of you not being able to get your credit card deposit back from a restaurant! i was pretty upset and said what if you're not from the area and there's no way of you being able to come back to the restaurant and she had no answer for me.

basically... if you're not 100% sure that no life emergencies will happen and you may have to cancel your reservation, don't make a reservation here unless you're OK with losing $25

Very disappointed and underwhelmed with this place. Wanted to really like this place. First time here, will also be my last. If you're coming for the view, come and look and then leave. Horrible bar service.  Bartenders were absolutely terrible. Never got the coffee we ordered. Wanted to get some bar food but wasn't worth the aggravation. Stayed for one drink.  God forbid we interrupt them talking to one another and too busy to actually take care of their guests. Have had better service at McDonalds which is where these bartender need to be....Long wait for the elevators...so many people trying to leave with one car operating. What a waste of a Saturday night. Never again.

very disappointed. I booked weeks in advance through open table only to have it cancelled by the restaurant and when I called they stated I needed a deposit of a minimum of $25 to hold the table ($100 if you want a window :( ) Why subscribe to open table at all? A deposit in a city with many many fine dining options was a bit surprising but I went along with it, hearing good things about the views. This place does not deserve a deposit. The table we were placed at was much like a Mcdonalds table, we were practically sitting on top of the other couples' beside us. The table was not wide enough for more than a plate. Very uncomfortable. Then the waiter had to lean in over us shouting the menu options in my friends ear.  Also website indicated men must wear collared shirts, man next to us was in a hoodie. We ordered 2 drinks, had the deposit applied to tab, made reservations at a neighboring restaurant within walking distance and left. We did explain to the waiter why we were leaving and he said he "hated the tables" that were sat at. Only offering that we should make the $100 deposit for better table. No thanks R2L. Too many other options in the city to make this place a "go to".

Atrocious customer service.  Contacted the "hospitality" team to make a NYE reservation.  I was lead to believe that there were tables available and all I had to do was wait for a call back the following day.  In addition to not receiving a call back, when I called back myself to follow up, I was told the restaurant had no availability -- and that it hadn't had availability for "days."  Being at the top of Liberty One does not entitle anyone to treat people like a doormat.

Overpriced average food, small portions, slow service. 
 I love the area and the space is beautiful but nothing else then view.

The food was outstanding, the view of Philadelphia from the 37th floor was awesome, and our server was superb, he knew the menu and made relevant suggestions and was super friendly . All the food we ate gave you several layers of flavor. Highly recommend this place!

I made a reservation with Opentable.com for New Years Eve.The website wasn't clear about needing a deposit for the earlier seating and I never received an email from the restuarant to do so (I checked my spam. It wasn't there either). When I received an email saying that my reservation was cancelled, I called the restaurant directly almost immediately. They no longer had a reservation available at 8pm and could not seat me at a 2 top any time after 6pm, which was unacceptable. The lovely and helpful hostess, Chelsey I believe, inquired with her manager about seating me at an available 3 top and he refused. 

This is a poor way of doing business. I'm sure they will seat the 3 top, but I will never dine with them again. This happened on December 19th at 6:30pm, so whoever the manager working at that time is the issue.

My service this past Friday was horrible. The waitress did the bare minimum for my husband and I while laughing it up and giving the table of 6 in front of us what looks like the best customer service ever. I was celebrating a birthday and normally places like this gives you a complimentary dessert which it was not for me. She came to my table very nonchalantly and asked since I was celebrating a birthday, did I want a dessert and I said yes. So, when the bill came my husband inquired about the dissert, and again the very nonchalant waitress said we don't do that. But without us asking, the manager came over and said we only give a complimentary dessert if you do not order a dessert. So, basically I should have said no to ordering the dessert and recieved it complimentary. That makes no sense. I didn't put up a fight and said that was ok. And, as the manager left and the waitress came back, they gave each other a look as if we were going to give them a problem. My husband suggested to not leave a tip but I felt bad about not leaving a tip although I was very disappointed. I don't think I will ever return!!!
Very intimate. Beautiful view and the food is very tasty. I love going here for very special occasions.

Yes, the view was magnificent! But, I was turned off immediately by the service at the bar. We waited a while without being greeted, which is understandable since the place was busy. But, once we were offered a drink by the bartender, we were treated as if we were a problem, rather than a guest. When she did serve us our drinks, they were awful. How do you make a bad martini? She used a shot glass, and the rest was vermouth. It was so disgusting, I didn't drink it. This is the first time that I've ever nit finished a martini (especially at that price)! My husband had a Manhattan, and it was way too sweet, but he drank it after the bartender basically threw it at him at the bar....oh, and no cherry, that's way too much work! Additionally, the martini glasses were filled half way, which I think is a disgrace. 
Needless to say, I was pretty turned off by the time I got to our table. But, surprisingly, the food was good! My risotto appetizer was delish, and the nachos were really tasty as well. My filet, although over cooked, was pretty tasty as well. Everything was covered in truffle butter (overpowering actually), which helped the flavor. All in all, I won't go back, too many other great places in the city. I would like to say go for a drink, but no way! Find another place with a view in the city!

business.name: The Victor Cafe
business.categories: Restaurants, Bars, Performing Arts, Gluten-Free, Wine Bars, Nightlife, Italian, Arts & Entertainment

reviews.text: This place combines great food, great entertainment and great ambiance.  Highly recommend!

We came here for dinner this weekend. The ambiance is cute and the singers are so talented, but the food is really average. We ordered a bottle of wine, calamari to start, and then I had the house made brichole as an entrée which was not great. I dont think the pasta is made fresh in house. My husband got a ravioli special and it was a much better pick. We closed out the night with espresso martinis and some gelato, and by gelato, I mean, it really could have been breyers vanilla ice cream and I wouldnt have been able to tell you otherwise. 

We were in the back room and were on our way out at the end of our meal when one of the singers was about to do a performance, so we had to wait a few minutes for the performance to conclude, so we had to SPRINT to make our train. Not the performers fault for the timing, but it was a frustrating end to an average meal.

10/10 ! 
This is probably one of the best restaurant/ cafe that I have been too. This cafe is quite and quaint but it bold in the experience it presents. Our waiter Alexis explained how the restaurant went and was super attentive with our orders. While I was order I heard someone tap their glass calling for attention I was so confused then she started telling a story and began to sing guess.... Drumroll OPERA! My mouth dropped all of the waiter are classically trained opera professionals. This legit took this place for 10 to 20 immediately. I was so in awe when all the singers were harmonizing together while still serving us! The food was nothing short of great as well. I order ravioli, penne and a shrimp dish and had more than enough left overs. A true Italian would love this place it is extremely authentic, pleasant waiter and amazing food! Will 1000% come back here!

I always walk past the Victor Cafe, occasionally passing by when a singer comes out on the Juliet balcony. Victor Cafe has really transformed their outdoor space during COVID, and I think it is one of the best in the city when the weather is nice out. They make the most of their sidewalk space (solid deck and love the string lights).

Had a great experience when I finally got to try it. Food was good, prices fair for a fancy dinner. They even made my husband a cocktail that was no longer on their menu (he wanted to try something with chartreuse) since they still had the liquor.

Mad props to the waiters and waitresses. They take turns to sing every 15-20 mins, and they're all pretty impressive. Must try if opera is your thing but still very enjoyable even if it's not. It's great live entertainment during dinner!
Poor service , mean  very condensing , new again go to this Resturant . The most demeaning unprofessional people

I had one of the best dinners of my life at this café! And I am a foodie! My two companions said their dinners were awesome as well! After a superb Caesar salad appetizer, I had the most amazing and delicious entrée - I have to say one of the most delicious entrees I have ever had - Dido & Aeneas "Jumbo shrimp & dry scallops in a garlic, butter, lemon and white wine broth over linguine".

My companions loved their dinner as well telling me all was absolutely delicious! One had the Burrata appetizer "With roasted red peppers and garlic crostini" and the entrée Rack of Lamb.  The other had the appetizer Roasted Beet Salad "Goat cheese, toasted almonds, field greens and honey balsamic" and the entrée Pollo Tosca "seared chicken breast au jus stuffed with fontina cheese and prosciutto over creamy polenta".

Along with the superb food we had an excellent reasonably-priced red wine: 2017 Varvaglione Papale Primitivo di Manduria 2017.

And the singing!!! Every 10 minutes so, one of the waiters sang a number from an opera. I was stunned at the quality and skill of the singers! I thought I was listening to singers in the Kennedy Center Opera House! Popular melodies, for example, from La bohème

A true hidden gem of Philly, Victor Cafe stands out as a true one of a kind experience. Professional Opera singers will serenade you as you enjoy your meal.

The food is good, but the ambiance is what attracts you to Victor Cafe.

We had a really great night at the Victor. The atmosphere was beautiful and the opera performances were really unique. We were brought bread with a really yummy pesto oil. The bread was wrapped in foil but cold and hard. I thought maybe we had just accidentally gotten bread that had been sitting out, but they brought another loaf to us that was also cold. We asked if we could get the bread warmed up but our waiter said no because "it's policy." What? The burrata was fine but a little bland, and came with three small pieces of crostini. The Pasta Igor and Penne Fra Diavolo we got totally made up for the rest of that. They were so delicious, and we couldn't finish them even though they were split between three people. Highly recommend those two dishes.

Six friends came for a birthday dinner. 
The food was good, the opera singers were great but the service was bad and unprofessional. 

We were seated outside and told by the hostess, it's a good table, she lied, we couldn't see anything. Pretty pathetic. 

When we told the waitress we don't desert, she brought the check and slammed on the  table and was rude until the end. It

 Very bad experience.

These Italian seafood devours come from the famous Philadelphia landmarks @victorcafe in south philly! The history behind this place is that it stared in every ROCKY Movie. On the weekends, every server is a certified opera singer and they sing every 30 mins. While here I ordered the "dido et Aeneas" shrimp and scallops in garlic, butter, lemon, and white wine broth. This dish was absolutely phenomenal. The shrimps and scallops with huge and tasteful. The broth was excellent and extremely good. Of u ever find yourself in the south Philadelphia area and wanting some authentic Italian? Please check out @victorcafe and tell them shimmy shinzo sent you! #italianfood #italy #shrimp #scallops #wine #seafood #food #foodie #foodphotography #foodblogger #philly #philadelphia #resturants

The food was better than average, but not amazing. The atmosphere was totally fun, and we loved our waiter. We were totally come back and cannot wait to bring friends. The lounge looks absolutely amazing. This is a very special place to come and I would highly recommend it. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Philadelphia. The only reason I did not give them five stars, is the the food could use a little bit of improvement.

This Cafe has a warm, cozy, and family friend atmosphere. Not only is the food delicious, but the waiters are friendly and sweet. The opera was beautiful, elegant, and heart warming. I would absolutely recommend coming here to experience the exquisite food, opera, and the atmosphere.

What a fabulous night of drinking and eating while the service staff sang opera.   I'm not an opera fan but these men and women were amazing.   Every 20 minutes a different server would get up explain the story behind the song and belt out amazing sounds that I don't have the words to give them enough praise.   

The meal was delicious.   My Veal Saltimbocca had two nice sizes pieces of thinly cut veal topped with crispy Prosciutto with a mushroom grave on top of Risotto.   Every bite was a mouthful of flavor.   The Shrimp and Scallops Linguine was in a light yet tasty sauce.   The linguine was perfect cooked as was the seafood.   Everyone else at the table verbalized what a wonderful meal they were having.   I would have liked a more aggressive Caesar dressing.  

Desserts were not pictured here as they went too fast.   Frozen Lemon Sorbet,  creme brûlée and warm chocolate cake were enjoyed by the whole table.  

Definitely a place to try at least once.

We recently dined at The Victor Cafe for my husband's birthday. We thoroughly enjoyed the opera and it was such a cool experience! The food isn't the best Italian I've ever had, but the experience makes it a place to check out for a special occasion or first date. We both had Caesar salads to start (which were delish) and I had the Prince Igor and my husband had the Fra Diavolo. Our waitress did seem a bit annoyed or overwhelmed, which would have made or experience 5 stars even if the food isn't out of this world.
This place was absolutely amazing. From the staff to the food to the opera singing, I was blown away. This is now definitely one of my favorite restaurants.

The Victor Cafe served us a special meal. My husband and I both had the bone in veal chop with mashed potatoes, spinach and broccoli rabe. It was all cooked to perfection! Our young girls, 7 and 4 years old had the pasta rusticana. They loved that as well. To top off the wonderful food, the waitresses and waiters serenaded us all night with their beautiful voices. We will definitely come back.

This place is a hidden gem in South Philly! It was quite the unique dining experience as all the waitstaff are professional opera singers and they serenade their guests every 20-30 minutes. There's a balcony where they perform so make sure you get a good seat! The ambiance is excellent. This is probably the most romantic setting I've been to (especially the upstairs). 

Food on the other hand, was not so great but the live performances and ambiance made up for that. We started with the Burrata as an appetizer and that was pretty delicious. It was similar to bruschetta but instead of tomatoes, it had red peppers. Most of their menu tries to be different and I don't think it works in their favor. For example, the penne alla vodka came with salmon and asparagus. The penne was good but the sauce didn't pair well with the salmon. I also ordered the Tosca which was chicken breast stuffed with fontina cheese and prosciutto over polenta. The polenta reminded me of mashed potatoes and I probably would've preferred that. The chicken was cooked well and was flavorful but it was a very heavy dish. The portions are also huge which I usually don't mind but for a place like this, I would've preferred smaller dishes. 

I would definitely come back to dine here just for the ambiance and opera singers but I'll be trying different items on their menu.

I always enjoy the atmosphere, but on my last visit the food was disappointing. The polenta was like cement, and the chicken stuffed with cheese and ham was overcooked and no cheese at all. I would recommend the place, but i wish i had returned my meal to the kitchen... something was wrong

All I can say is wow! Some of the best Italian food I've ever had and the live opera just made the experience that much better. We had some eggplant croquettes that were served in some gravy that was to die for. The grilled bone in veal chop and sweet potato tortelloni were the highlights of our entrees. Thank you to our waiter Kyle and the entire staff for making the experience truly remarkable!

Have not been here in a year & i live a block away! My dear departed mom for decades felt it was hyped as far as quality..she use to say they are highly Known for the ambience - beautiful vocals (which after a bit i feel annoying having to interrupt the meal) but they weren't known for terrific food.. kinda so so we would not go a heck of a lot even if a short walk away!! I must say though they surely have improved in recent years in taste & quality Italian meals! Soo If u want a true touch of south philly a bit of rocky vibe that its famous as well for id very much recommend!!

The menu has a good variety of Italian food and everything I tasted was very good. Food was tasty and service was great. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking to have a good meal and an even better ambience to go with it. 
We ordered two meals and three appetizers for three people, it was delicious! The ice cream dessert was even better than the meal and definitely a must have!!
The whole staff is trained opera singers which was a pleasant surprise and made the feel of the restaurant all the better. It's a beautiful place and I am already excited to return.

Ok, so I'm a bit late posting this but better late than never. 

We came here because of the movie Rocky and let me tell you, it was definitely worth it. We made reservations for two around 6:45 so not too bad. 

Covid precautions are top notch, it's the only place that took my temp and I'm totally okay with that. 

You have a 90 minute window at the restaurant and it was totally doable. 

I love the atmosphere, it was super cozy and comfy. The servers were all nice and In case you didn't know, all of them are professional opera singers!!! Like wow! They sing every 30 mins, I believe, you just can't record. Let me tell you, they are all great! 

The cocktails were delicious, the food was great and totally worth the price, the app was also savory. We went on Easter and they had some very good specials. 

Also, If you go upstairs you can take pics of good ole Rocky. Lol! 

Overall, I'd say they are 5/5 for sure! If you're in the area, I'd definitely stop by.

Amazing happy hour!!!! Food was delicious! We got the $1 oysters.... wasn't bad but wish it was a bit smaller. The oysters were so big it was a little intimidating. The trout was amazing. So was the crab fries (actual crab meat) and lobster roll!
Perfect place for a special occaision. Wait staff are attentive without being overnearing. The meals were excellent. The taramisu is to die for accompanied by the expresso martini.

Saw lots of good reviews about this place.  Came in with the bf for his bday and was not disappointed.  We got the chicken piccata,  spaghetti with meatballs, and the Tiramisu.  The food was great, service was great, and the servers periodically sing throughout their service.  It was a fun experience and would definitely go there again.  Lastly, third floor looked cool and looks like it can be used for an event ;).

business.name: Chima Steakhouse
business.categories: Brazilian, Food, Desserts, Restaurants, Barbeque, Chinese, American (New), Dim Sum, Steakhouses

reviews.text: One of the best Brazilian steak houses. Meats are grilled in perfect texture with right amount of salt. Severs are very well-attentive and knowledgeable regarding meats and wine. Specially thanks to Cameron for awesome service. One area if they can improve will be being less messy when they cut meats. Thanks for great dining experience.

The hostess seemed a bit rude, and did not answer my question. I also seen a mouse run across the lounge/waiting area. Even though I seen it, we still decided to stay and eat here. The food was good overall but the salad bar needs to have better selections. Our waiter was wonderful. I like Fogo de Chao better

The service is quite good and rapid very little wait time between going to the salad bar and having the various meats delivered to the table. Staff was exceptionally polite and attentive. Thank goodness Philadelphia is only a short distance away it definitely beats the traffic going into New York City. As a family or individually we will be back here again

I came  here with my family and was told we couldn't eat because my daughters were wearing "gym attire". The staff were unpolite, especially Tara. I called to make reservations and never was told about the dress code. They asked us to go home and change, but we refused to do so because we live 45 minutes away, they offered to us to speak to the manager, and they called security before calling the manager. They had a very intimidating guy standing next to us the whole time, and the manager, Edgar Da Silva, when he finally came was of no help. My young daughters didn't understand what was happening and why we were being treated like that.
We had to pay their Valets full price for being there 10 minutes (most of the time waiting for the manager)
Overall a very bad experience, not returning there.
We ended up going to Fogo de Chao, with no dress code, great ambience, and most importantly great food.

I like Chima, my first experience was good. But last night with friends we were seated at the very far back, so we would have to wait a long time to be served with meat. In the meantime, we get full while waiting. This is the only downside. The bathroom and on the way there is kind of slippery, and I am pregnant, so I was being very careful. Second bathroom lock is broken, I got someone ran into me while I was using it.

Today I just had the worst experience at Chima steakhouse restaurant From the management staff to the security who refused to let me in to my wife party that I was paying for do to the fact 
that they were done serving in 15 minutes  after I'd let them know that I would not be ordering  anything but I was here to celebrate my wife's birthday yesterday they refused to seat me .
 I will never visit this restaurant again poor managerial skills as well as customer service especially when I'm the one paying for the party with these very very expensive prices . P.s terrible Manger she would not even speak with us .

I went to Chima for my birthday with my girlfriend. I was very disappointed. The salad bar had nothing tasty, low quality. My girlfriend had salmon, for $45, it had no taste. A dinner makes salmon better. The meat was too salty and rare, not the best quality. The cheese bread, fried yucca, and mashed potatoes was inedible. We had cheesecake & apple pie that was too sweet & had no taste. We were very dissatisfied, and don't know how people
The meats were good!  The salad bar  weren't good at all.. rice was raw, beans were dry !! I personally won't go back.  The service sucks.  Waited so long for my drink.  Very disappointing

I wish I could give 0 stars for false advertising,  I booked a party for 10 because they was offering a $100 gift card for the host of the party and when I asked them about it they said it was for a party of 15 or more which they didn't not specify online and not to mention they wouldn't even let me book a party for more than 10 people so I'm pissed for wasting my time and money and for them not honoring what they advertised online but never again because the so called manager was very unhelpful!!!

I did not appreciate how Michelle mad myself and my party feel: she was dismissive and very nonchalant.y sister is not a red meat eater but it took 45min to bring her shrimp and salmon. The worst part was not being asked what beverage we would have liked to drink. To top the night we asked for spoons for the mashed potatoes and she advised that we use the serving spoon. SO INCONSIDERATE!!!! & COMPLETELY UNPROFESSIONAL! I couldn't understand why she treated us this way and I don't want to blame race or say she's racist but she just was not welcoming or accommodating. She had a attitude from the start. We did speak to the manager after 35minutes who acted as if she understood but the damage was already done I didn't finish my food. I pushed my plate to the side and waited for the check. Michelle ruined my evening. It was a disappointment to be honest and she should do better. As a manager of a major hotel chain this shouldn't have happened and no accommodation was met. By the end of the night after we spoke to the manager Michelle never came over and apologized which was enough for me. 

I don't think I would return not even for a managers dinner. This was uncomfortable and a waste of $700 dollars.
The service is rude and indecent. The waiter asks for dresscode. It is really rude and inappropriate. We highly dis-recommend this one for its arrogance.

Solid steakhouse. Their meat particularly was very good and salad bar was also good. I went for my birthday with family and friends. We were treated very well by the staff from the moment I called and made a reservation. As a Brazilian, I didn't find there was anything too special about this Steakhouse, in a way I think I expected more. If you're a meat lover it is definitely worth it, if not then maybe consider some other place.
Very good food . Nice ambiance and service was excellent. We will be back soon. There was no wait and the food and drinks were great .

Tried this restaurant as part of center city restaurant week and was pleasantly surprised. They had reasonably price bottles of wine and we were seated on time. The salad bar offered as part of the meal was a nice touch but did not really enhance the meal to be honest. This place is all about the quality meats. The lamb was my favorite item on the basic menu, and all the steaks were juicy and flavorful. We opted to get dessert and the apple pie was solid, but beware it has a strange bitter aftertaste that some may not find appealing. Overall 4/5, service 5/5, food 4/5, ambiance 4/5.

Authentic Brazilian steakhouse with some cultural twists! The servers are so nice here and the food really is amazing! You feel like you're in a different world when you enter their restaurant. They serve a lot of fresh filet mignon and they cook it exactly how you like it and they will come back to you knowing your preference as well! The salad bar has a lot of nice, fresh choices as well like asparagus, apple salad, Cesar salad, fresh cheeses and meats, brown rice and jasmine rice, all kinds of sauces and beans. They also serve salmon with passion fruit sauce or pesto, grilled shrimps! The famous cheese with honey and grilled pineapple with cinnamon! We were celebrating my bfs completion of his phd program and the waiter came to surprise us with a nice cheesecake dessert which wasn't even on the menu! Delicious! Definitely a place worth a fancy meal experience, I wish I discovered this place sooner since I had always been a regular at fogo!

Chima is where we eat every year for my boyfriend's birthday.  I learned the hard way many years ago and woke up the next day with a meat hangover.  It made me not want to go back ever again.  But by the time his next birthday  rolled around I was ready to hit Chima up and eat a little more thoughtfully.  

First off, you can't eat just meat.  I, of course, thought the salad bar was a waste of my time the first time I dined here and only ate a tiny bit - but now I know you have to eat salad bar to not feel meat-sick the next day.  The meat itself is tremendous.  And they just keep bringing it.  I don't like to create food waste, so I had to keep turning my "stop/go" card over and over so I didn't get crazy amounts of meat on one plate.   But then when you know what tastes the best you can make sure they direct that guy over to you more often.  

Personally, I don't need chicken when I come to Chima.  I want red meat and maybe a tiny but of seafood.  I also love the grilled cinnamon pineapple.  They have different sauces on the salad bar but I didn't think any of the cuts of meat needed it.  

Lastly, this year they sent my boyfriend home with delish birthday cake.  I don't remember them doing that any other year but it's possible I didn't mention it on the reservation until this year.

So most people know this as a decent Brazilian steakhouse that is a great place to bring a date vs group of people vs family for a nice hefty meal to celebrate something... Or to come during Restaurant week, which the restaurant always participates in... More recently, I've discovered an amazing thing about this place, it's happy hour! It happens almost every day and their caipirinhas are great! Cheap and strong! Also with a decent happy hour food menu that won't burn your wallet. 

Rating: 8/10
Pros: Great happy hour, decent meats, Restaurant week! Also great location and staff
Cons: Brazilian steakhouse price

I was excited to finally try Chima during restaurant week and overall I had a great experience. I was wasn't blown away by all of the food but I still enjoyed it. The flank steak was my favorite. You definitely need to come on an empty stomach.

My favorite part was the atmosphere. The interior has a romantic vibe and I liked how all the tables were spaced apart just the right amount (although that's probably because of COVID). 

There's not much of a dress code. The patrons were wearing a variety of things from jeans to dresses to more causal outfits. The servers who came around with the means were all very friendly!

I like to see if the bathrooms match the quality of the restaurant and these bathrooms were not the cleanest. 

Overall, I enjoyed dining at Chima and would go back.

Well hello, Chima! How have you been? I haven't been to Chima's since my daughter was born which was 5 years ago, but me and my friends all had a rare baby-free night and did what any crazy parents would do: go eat peacefully! lol

I learned the hard way that eating breakfast, lunch or anything else in between is not a good idea before visiting Chima. The food just keeps coming and you'll need an empty stomach to fully enjoy it all. And I made sure this time to ask for smaller cuts of meat instead of YOLO'ing on the first few. 

MY least favorite of the AYCE meats was surprisingly the chicken. IT was cooked perfectly, but had zero seasoning. I had to grab some pesto from the salad bar to give it some life. My second fave were the grilled shrimp. The char and seasoning on them was just wonderful and I could have ate those all night. My favorite thing by far was the lamb. I have no idea what type of seasoning is used, but it's literally the greatest flavor on a meat I've taste in a long time. 

My wife ordered the creme brulee and actually let me have a bite. She must have liked me today!! The creme brulee had that sugary crust on top which bursted into the pudding so perfectly. I can't wait to come back to Chima in about 6 months, because I need about a few months to digest all the food I ate lol

5 stars for an amazing full course Complete Rodizio experience during restaurant week. They gave a $20 off coupon for future experiences, but it expires within 1 month of dining.

They also offered a discounted bottle of wine (red/white/rose)

Occasion: A group of three of us went on a Monday night for a friend's birthday, were seated promptly 

Ambience: Beautiful interior, mix of dark and bright, romantic

COVID19 precautions: gloves and hand sanitizer for their salad bar - it's not as extensive as Fogo, but also, you really don't need to eat much from the salad bar at an AYCE Brazilian steakhouse, do you?

Cuts of meat: 
-Definitely request food if you don't see what you want early on, they come out like lightning as soon as you place the order
-Favorites: Filet mignon, Lamb, Pineapple with cinnamon
-Salmon was also great with a pretty unique sauce (peach?)

Our bottle of red wine paired nicely

At the end of the night, they came out with a surprise little birthday cheese cake with bits of chocolate and a divine raspberry sauce. The cake was sweet and the sauce was perfectly paired. Perfect end to a perfect meal.

Tips/Takeaways:
-Beautiful interior, COVID19 conscious 
-Worth the full selection experience
-REQUEST WHAT YOU WANT and go for the more expensive cuts!
-Great for BDays and other special occasions - surprise bday cake was so nice!

Outstanding place to eat at anytime!!!!!!!  I took my wife there for her birthday and the food and atmosphere was great and professional. The food and salad bar were great!!!!!!!! I would highly recommend anytime!!!!

I come to Chima periodically for Happy Hour because of the bartender Anthony. I remember going there a few years ago and seeing that there were customers known as "regulars" and I aspired to be a regular somewhere. I've been there every few months, including during covid, and it's been a great experience. Everytime I go, he sees me from a mile away and greets me. He knows exactly what drink I get and always checks in. I love it there and would strongly recommend it. I've also gone for the Rodizio a few times and it is definitely worth it.

Me and my girlfriends came here for dinner and we had an amazing time. We love the atmosphere and the overall vibe. Our server was super friendly and attended to our needs with the best of her abilities. The different cuts of meat were delicious and we will definitely be back again!

Went for an anniversary dinner and everything was spectacular. From the attentive service to the well made tasty cocktails the restaurant blew us away. The selections of meats where brought around constantly sometimes at a overwhelming pace. There was a wide selection that catered to many different tastes. I ordered my meat medium rare and my girlfriend wanted hers well done, and almost every time the waiters were able to accommodate to our request. 5/5 would recommend and return again.
I live very close to Chima and omg you can smell it outside all the time. I ain't mad. This place is so good and never disappoints. The team that works there def know me and my boyfriend lol

business.name: Studio Movie Grill
business.categories: Cinema, Arts & Entertainment, Bars, American (Traditional), Restaurants, Nightlife

reviews.text: Went to see a Journal for Jordan with my sisters and my daughter. It was an early showing so there were only 2 other ppl in the theater with us. The sound quality was amazing and the server was extremely attentive. We ordered popcorn and they have the best theater popcorn EVER!!! We also got an order of cheese fries, my daughter's favorite, and she had no complaints. The seats were comfortable and we had an amazing time. I recommend the movie as well SMG for a great experience

We used to go to movies all the time here (pre-pandemic and pre baby lol) but we hadn't been for quite some time until Spider-Man!!  Although things have changed with Covid, I felt the theatre did a great job with guests, especially on an opening weekend for a major film.  

We didn't eat there this time but have many times in the last and like a lot of the things on the menu.  Our friends did order food at the bar and then transferred it to their seat, however, they never received their order.  There was a pretty substantial line of people waiting for refunds after the movie due to this same issue, probably from staffing shortages.  

Overall, this is still one of our favorite places to see a movie!

I'd give a zero star if possible. Our orders got missed three out of four times. My husband and I only ordered two cups of coffee... we've been waiting throughout almost the entire movie and nothing was brought up. The order was already paid so we had to call the server back to remind him that they forgot about our order. So we literally got our coffee finally at the end of the movie and walked out of the movie theater like two dum-dums holding coffee. Another time we ordered only two things: one Sierra Mist and soft pretzel bites. They brought up the pretzel but forgot to bring us the drink.
