We finished eating the pretzel and got super thirsty wondering where our drink was. We then pressed the service button but nobody showed up. When we talked to the manager next the manager was very rude and only gave us a refund on the drink when he claimed that he gave us a full refund. The tip $3 was automatically charged so don't wish to get that back even tho there was no service whatsoever. So we went back to the manager and asked him why he only refunded the drink but not the tip, he was obviously annoyed and said,"well it's already included. Have a good day, I don't wanna deal with this." We walked out dissatisfied and pissed. It's only a matter of time for this place to shut down one day. Nobody working in this movie theater seemed to care about their customers.

With Flix Brewhouse still being closed, opted to give Studio Movie Grill another shot. They haven't impressed me in the past, but haven't been terrible either. 

The place was not very busy. I stopped at the bar and got a beer. I was not offered a menu, but luckily my friend had already gotten something I knew I would like. As we were sitting at the bar, a lady came into the lobby with a portable microphone and speaker yelling some nonsense. We thought at first maybe she worked there, but we soon realized she did not. The employees were not in any hurry to do anything about the situation. It left me feeling uncomfortable, so we went to the theater.

The theater was pretty empty. You push a button to get a server to come to your seat. We both ordered burgers and fries. The food came out promptly and was hit and fresh. The fries were hot and crispy. The burger had good flavor. The server was attentive when we pushed the button again and need utensils and ketchup. 

All in all, I'm not sure I would make it a point to go back to Studio Movie Grill. It's pretty far from my place and the experience over all just wasn't worth it.

We recently went to see Dune and dine there
Our food was pretty good hot and fresh we got the cheese fries and a veggie burger  great staff friendly the only downside was the movie was a bit loud even for a movie theater but all in all it was a good experience.

Watched  server serve my food to another guest in front of me. The guest picked through the sandwich and called the server back over, who promptly removed the plate, took it back to the cart and sat it down amongst the other items about to be served, and then proceeded to bring it to me. When I spoke to the floor manager he seemed somewhat concerned and accepted my request to have it remade. However when the food was served the second time missing items and special instructions, my concern was again brought to light. Spoke with the supervisor John, who informed me that the problem had already been dealt with and seemed like he didn't understand why it was such an issue.... I left without eating the food and paid my full bill because I didn't feel like talking to management again. Movie was good. Wouldn't eat the food. With standards and training like this it's only a matter of time before it's shut down or worse, they get people sick...

This used to be my husband's and my favorite date place. After Covid though, it all went down the drain. We've tried going back twice to give it another chance. Same issue. I placed our order at 6:50, movie was supposed to start at 7. Movie trailers started at 7:30. My food came out, but no drink. At like 7:45, I finally broke down and asked another waitress. Still nothing. I asked two more. Around 8, I got frustrated and had my husband talk to someone. They brought me out my drink, but it was the wrong one. Had to tell someone else about it and then finally got my correct drink at 8:20. My husband ordered two of the same alcoholic drinks. Neither of them looked or tasted the same as the other so not sure what he was given. And then at the end, after giving our card to pay the bill - we waited in the theatre for a solid 15 minutes, it was empty, lights on and never got our cards back. My husband had to end up going out to ask someone for our card back. And they forced a tip out of us. Normally that's not a problem, but the service was TERRIBLE. So we felt very cheated. Like I said we used to love this place, but we will not be coming back for awhile unfortunately...

There is a new manager that is super uptight and very disrespectful. AMIE QUIMBLY I brought to her attention nobody was filtering people on Valentine's Day so everyone isn't late for their movie. There was only one that wasn't seating yet, I had kids so Sonic was def seating. She demanded to see my tickets and told me she controls the flow of people. I said your a manager I should be able to bring u issues with out u talking to me like this in front of my kids she then told me that me and my kidS could leave if I didn't turn around and leave In 2 seconds. I've never been more humiliated in my life. Then when I shared my story I learned she was about to come to blows with a man in front of his kids over a refund just the day before. This is def not how manager should act in any situation.  She needs to learn ethics and how to deal with people before she is aloud to leave others. And I also heard she had the biggest turn around in employees too. Very upsetting. Besides the fact the food and drink never come in a timely manor. They are quick to swipe your card and takes over an hour for a drink. Go anywhere else. Please.

Studio Movie Grill was an acceptable experience ONLY. Small enough to not have a bad viewing position. However, the seats were not comfortable as not only did they not recline and so deep you couldn't stretch out and lean back but were in such a fixed location to not even be allowed to open up the arm rest's so as to be able to sit next to a date. Definitely not a romantic date experience.

Most anytime I go to the movies this is where I come. I've yet to have a bad experience but I also pick movie times that are less busy to avoid the rush and I purchase tickets online. I get to eat and watch movies and the seats are comfortable.

This place used to be a local gem. It's been over 2 years since I've gone to the movies and I wanted to do something special for Valentine's Day. We came here knowing to place your order before the movie started so it's easier for the servers and kitchen staff. We ordered the nachos and one Pepsi with grenadine. Pretty easy, or so I thought. We NEVER got our food and the only thing we received was a bill for the food and drink we never got as well as attitude. I asked where our food was about 45 minutes into the movie and I was told "We're busy". Then, when one of the girls brought the check over, I said I haven't even gotten my food. All she told me was to stop being rude to her and she's gonna take it off. I was so appalled and embarrassed, I actually started crying. On Valentine's Day. In the movie theater.

I really wanted to enjoy my time at Studio Movie Grill, but the movie itself was the best part by far. The seats are not comfortable and the people at the front desk were not helpful. When we sat down and pushed our button to request service it took forever for the server to come over and I constantly had to request items, like a straw, napkins, silverware. I just feel like those items should be dropped off with the food, especially silverware. We ordered the 2 for $28 option, with an appetizer to share and two flatbreads. Our drinks were $5 a piece too. The food was not flavored well and my boyfriend got incredibly sick afterwards. I think next time I'll just go to a regular movie theater.

It is a shame that this place has declined so terribly. Buttons on tray tables are broken. We were forty minutes into the movie before someone arrived to take our order. The kid's chicken tenders didn't get delivered at all but they charged us anyway. And then we had to wait for five minutes after the movie was over to get the charges refunded. The popcorn tasted like it had been made last week. Just terrible service overall. I wish we had a theater that served good food.

Edited to add: the theater was not remotely crowded. There were fifteen folks in there total. So no excuse for slow (nonexistent) service.

Asian bento box at a movie theatre? You bet! SMG has been working hard to re-image themselves and it really shows! I've been thoroughly impressed with their service. They've hired staff who are genuinely pleasant and concerned to provide you with excellent service. We had a great experience last night watching the new Star Wars feature. They had $5 wine specials and the food is really very good - try it! You may be surprised! I have gotten the Asian bento box multiple times - it features chicken satay, an Asian slaw, edamame hummus and Asian vegetables plus some wasabi peas! They don't waste the little space in the middle! The bbq chicken pizza is very tasty also. Watch for 25% off bottles of wine on Friday - definitely cheaper to ditch the sitter and take the kids with you on date night!  Seating has nice comfortable recliner seats and I would like to try the gourmet popcorn next time with an optional Dill salt topping.

If you love dinner and a movie then you might enjoy this option.  This is Dinner while watching the movie.  Seems like a great concept but it was just ok!

I ordered tickets online and they were a better price than other theaters.  A $3 convenience charge was added to the order but still made the tickets a nice deal.  When we arrived at the theater it was jammed packed with people.  No one knew what they were standing in line for... was it to purchase tickets? Print tickets? Or just enter the movie?  We asked several people but no one seemed to know for sure.  We moved through the crowds and found a line that wasn't moving but let you enter the screen area.  Our movie started in 15 minutes and we wanted to order food.

Finally the line to enter the screens started moving a little but it still took the while 15 min to get through.  Another ticket taker was definitely needed.

We got to our assigned seats and looked through the menu.  The best option was the 2 for $28 deal.  Appetizers and two entrees were the options.  Dessert was another $5 and drinks were $5.  All seemed reasonable for movie food.

Our order taker was a real piece of worker.  You call the order taker by pressing a red button on your table. She shoved my arm over and shut the button off.  Then she said "what do yuh want to order?" No hello, so rude.  I said hello, how's your day? She replied fine, do you want to order.  Little Miss Sunshine for sure!!  Mind you it was after the movie start time but the start was delay because the mostly sold out theater was only a  third full due to problems with the ticket taker.

When our food arrived the server went to every person in the row and said did you order the coke? Or did you order the Mac and cheese?  They had no idea where the food or drink went.  Luckily my row was not full or anyone could have claimed our food.  Some people in the row behind us did get the wrong food and had to reorder.  All of this was going on while the movie was going.  Such a disruption!!

I will say though the food was good--especially the brownie sundae.  The prices were a little high but hey, it's the movies.

The seating was ok... not as comfortable as other theaters.  The depth of the seat and the table placement was a little awkward.  You had to lean up from a slightly reclined position to eat..

When we left the smell of sewer gas filled the hallway.  It was not a problem before but it smelled very bad when we left.

I do not think I will return.  I usually try to give a place a second chance but this one had too many issues to work out.

Can't give it zero stars unfortunately! This place is a classic bait and switch compared to the seats in the lobby for display. The chairs are uncomfortable and don't recline like most other similar places (and that's after I switched from the office chairs with no padding in the back), waited over 20 minutes after pressing the button for service in the seat next to mine since I didn't have one, and to top it off, the staff was very rude. Spend a few bucks less and go to Flix Brewhouse to get more. You'll be glad you did. It's the generic version of Flix but in an alternate universe.

I'm glad I gave this place another shot! My most recent experience was far better than any of my previous visits, and I have to acknowledge that all of the items I mentioned in my last review seem to have been addressed!

Last time I was concerned about the maintenance of the theater, the quality of the service, and the overall cleanliness of things like the bathrooms and the theater seats - and I'm delighted to say that everything was quite nice this time. Everything was clean and in working order, and the wait staff seemed on top of things (and the waits for food were much better). And everything was clean! (Well- more or less. It is a movie theater so things are never spotless, but I would say it was on par or better than other theaters).

I have to say that this is probably not my *first* choice to see a movie, because no matter what it is still somewhat distracting to have food service during a movie... but it *is* a pleasant experience overall and I will undoubtedly return! I feel pretty good recommending it now, and you should give it a shot.

Disappointing! We had 3 different servers. It took 40 minutes to get our appetizer. Our food came out luke warm, obviously it had been sitting in a serving window for a while. The plus side was that since we had 3 different servers we weren't even charged for our meals. Honestly I feel bad for the kids working here because they have been poorly trained which leads to bad service and bad tips.

This place can be a management nightmare! The good thing is you can watch a movie while eating decent food and also not be bothered by the wait staffs trying to get everyones orders. Now the bad - if you plan to actually buy ticket at the counter, be prepared for a loooong wait. Its a small space to wait in line with few ticket staff. If you buy ticket online and try to do what the email notification tells you(i.e. go to the kiosk in the theater and printout the tickets) the kiosks RARELY ever work. And then you will find out, the email notification is just enough and you just wasted 10 mins banging your head against a kiosk! 
If the show is full, well good luck trying to get your food order taken - it can be a short wait or it can be a 30 min wait. Few of the servers will serve the water/drinks pretty sloppily. Also there have been times when my order has been messed up - entree came in with no appetizer ever turning up but being charged for(it was fixed). Last time a waiter other than the waiter who actually took our order, gave us our check but then our original waiter came by and said - naa thats not the right one...go figure!
However there have been times the food order has been seamless and has made the movie watching experience even more enjoyable. I hope they can get good wait staff that can stick around cos the theater is good and there food is actually good.

When I come here I'm usually a party of 6 or 7 In size. This was my 7th and last trip to this place.  Service is worse and worse every time.  Wrong meals received and cold meals finally when served what ordered. Oh and desserts were brought out first. Rejected, then brought out again later and double charged.  Appetizers brought out after the dinners and the servers not even trying to stay out of the way when taking orders so you can watch the movie.  Waited forever for a manager so I just left, we definitely won't be back have already given too many chances.

Great service.  Great menu prices.  Good drink prices.   And you're watching a movie in a recliner!  How much better does it get.
Now, there are some things on the menu that can get a little pricey if you don't get the specials...  But, if you have dinner and a movie combined... Please take that into account.  You'll come out on the right side :)

I attended 11pm Movie December 1, 2019 the service was awful & unbelievable I order 2 drinks chips, salsa they every 5 minutes someone was bring me something asking me did I order no and I could not even enjoy the move. I kept telling them that I did not order these things and that I am not going to pay for them needless to say at the end of the night they brought me someone else tab I gave it back and told the waiter that that was not mine and were was my tab everyone in that place was confused it was unbelievable now I wake up this morning with these charges on my card.....I never got a receipt 
I have been trying to call no one is picking up and when I push #7 it hangs up on you. A. Hill

So waited a few years before trying this place again. Was hopeful they had improved. Sadly no. Food was awful, took forever to get drinks and they didn't even project the movie correctly. More than a foot was projected above the screen. definitely not coming back. They did take the inedible food off my bill. So there is that. Love the idea of this place. Shame they can't get it right.
Horrible customer service.  I will not be going back to this theatre and would not recommend it to anyone.  Sad as this is our neighborhood theatre.
Customer service was extremely rude.  Will not be returning.  Do not recommend this location.

business.name: Atlantis Bistro Napa
business.categories: Nightlife, American (New), Wine Bars, Restaurants, Hotels & Travel, Bars, Seafood

reviews.text: Wife and I came here on date night. We have been talking about it for some time now. I had the lamb shanks and she had the short ribs. Food was absolutely amazing. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable. If I had any complaints they are very small but here they are. Server had way too many tables to be extremely attentive to any one table. Next complaint would be the one I always have but will always bring my own bottle. $35 for corkage just seems to be extreme. They take the cork out and pour our first glass. We pour the rest. All in all we absolutely loved the place.

Dined here last night for our second time, and boy howdy, it won't be our last! They have a wonderful happy hour with a fairly extensive menu of half-priced items, as well as drinks, and we really enjoyed everything we ordered. 

We had the mushroom flatbread, which was a steal at $8. Loaded with fragrant wild mushrooms and cheese, it could pretty much be a meal unto itself. The clams ($9) were cooked perfectly and were served swimming in a huge vat of delicious garlicy broth. Super tasty! The oysters ($18 for a dozen) were the freshest I've had in Reno (save for the ones I buy at Sierra Gold). They were plump, cold and not too briny - more creamy than anything else - and were served with four different sauces, each of which added their own unique twist. I'm hella coming back for more of these soon! And then finally we had the ahi poke nachos ($9), which featured wonderfully crisp wontons, a light coleslaw and a somewhat meager portion of blackened ahi that, while not being my favorite, was still pretty damn good. 

Dinner for three with six drinks and four items off the menu was $90. I'd be hard pressed to think of a better deal for a dinner of this caliber anywhere else in this great city of ours!

Bistro Napa happy hour is so much fun. I'm new to this gem and heard it used to be much easier to snag a spot. We thankfully were able to get a table for a birthday get together.  

There are soo many options on their small plates menu, im pretty sure we got one of each and no one walked away hungry or unsatisfied. The Asian bbq pork ribs were perfectly cooked and the sauce was spot on. Don't skip the sexy fries! They come in a giant basket and are hands down the best fries I've tried. The kids got pizzas, both enjoyed them thoroughly. 

Great atmosphere, best service, and so dang quick. If you're looking for a great after work spot with coworkers, or even a fun dinner spot with your family definitely check it out. If you can get there early, definitely do, as a wait forms rather quickly!

Had some drinks downstairs before happy hour at Bistro Napa. Even before the restaurant opened at 4:00 PM, there was already a line. The gentleman behind us in line recommended the calamari. He said there's a sous chef that only makes calamari all night so they're fresh!

The signature cocktails were amazing and it was half off small plates. We had clams, raw oysters, lamb meatballs, fries, flatbread, and calamari. The gentleman was right, the calamari was amazing! The raw oysters comes with 4 sauces and I loved all them all. I wasn't a big fan of the lamb meatballs though... the texture was soft and a little gamey for my taste. The bread (naan?) that accompanied the meatball tasted charred and burnt.

The waitress was really attentive and service was quick. 

Overall, I would come back again to try other cocktails and small plates.

I think that it's not quit as high end and refined as I would expect for the cost. The service was just ok. The best server was a young girl who filled the waters and removed the plates, she smiled and looked you in the eye. Everyone else was rushed and did not care about how you are treated. The food reminds me of many casino restaurants, it looks really good, some of it tastes pretty good, but nothing wows you. The veal was more like a chicken fried steak, it was chewy and strange. I would never order that again. The dessert was tasty, and perhaps the best part. I would only go back to that restaurant for the 4-6 happy hour menu if I wanted a fair price for yummy-ish food and drinks. Not on my "top high end food places to go to in Reno" list. My fiancé (who is a professional chef) agrees

Second time around at Bistro Napa.  Just as good as the first time. All of the dishes were a hit!  This place is a must every time we are in Reno. Chilean sea bass and Cioppino are to die for!  I can't wait to go back and try their other entrees.   chefs kiss!

After two years and many menu changes this is still my favorite happy hour in Reno! The menu is complex yet approachable, the service is fantastic and the prices are reasonable. Just come early because it typically fills up.
5 stars for Happy Hour!  There's a great wine and specialty cocktail selection, and everything on the happy hour menu is half off. The flatbread is delicious. And so are the artichoke hearts!  Enjoy.

This place has happy hour everyday from 4-6pm and it's half off most things on the menu.  I love the sea bass!  Even though we go for happy hour our bill will still come out to be over $100.  Maybe we eat a lot but I think this place is pricey even with happy hour.  But it's a nice place to splurge on once and awhile.

We made reservations for dinner for two at Bistro Napa a few weeks ago. This place is elegant, but not pretentious. The menu and the service is perfection, and the ambiance is inviting, romantic and lively. We were fortunate enough to have a table with a view of the open kitchen, which was visually appealing and awakened our senses. 

The cocktail and wine menu was superb. They give you a smart tablet to view the drink options with, which I have never seen before. Cool points for sure.

We ordered the artichoke hearts appetizer-- phenomenal! The macaroni and cheese side-- winner! And the Cauliflower "Risotto"-- disappointing! Oh man, I had such high hopes for the "Risotto". Hopes of creaminess, lusciousness, smoothness, richness. Unfortunately, this was truly not a risotto. While I am so happy that Bistro Napa is attempting to embrace vegan options, this is not it. What I received was a crunchy, chewy cauliflower dish with Romesco sauce on the side. If I was in the business of giving advice, I'd say either rename the dish on the menu or make an actual vegan risotto with coconut milk.

The mac & cheese, the amazing service, and the fabulous cocktails were my saving grace, hence the 4-star review. The cotton candy at the end of our meals was also a really fun, nice, sweet treat.

I certainly recommend Bistro Napa, and would come back in a heartbeat-- just stay away from the risotto.

We came on a Monday night for dinner, and ordered appetizers and food.  The steak was cooked to perfection, I was also really happy with the artichoke appetizer!  The food did not disappoint!  The service was really mediocre, mainly the waitress seemed more interested in her six top seated nearby.  The busser was really on top of everything though (I even slipped him a little cash because I appreciated his hustle!). We will come back but hopefully we get a more attentive server.

A great dining experience we can count on! For me being gluten free (celiac) I appreciate that they are the only restaurant I've been to in Reno that offers gluten free bread at the table! And it's some of the best I've had! Besides that, the steak is always amazing, Béarnaise sauce is perfect (saying a lot these day apparently, since I've had some terrible ones lately). 
The only critic is the lobster escargot style, they used the pincher meat which was actually very disappointing. Hopefully they will change it to tail meat in the future as it's one of my favorite foods! 
Oh and the service is always amazing, we've never had to ask for water or drink refills.

Let me start by saying, if you're looking for a good deal start here! Bistro's happy hour is half off small plates and signature cocktails and they are both amazing! For happy hour you have to put a name in (you can't call in the reservation), but they have a nice waiting area with couches and obviously gambling just down the stairs. 
We put our name in at 4:15 and it took a little over an hour to be seated (trust me the wait is worth it). 
We ordered the strawberry basil cocktail and a mojito, both were delicious and strong! For food, in order of favorite to least favorite items, we got the butternut squash and pumpkin ravioli, which were to die for! One of the items I would gladly pay full price for. Next we tried the street corn flatbread, which sounds odd but was pleasantly surprising! Not too much corn, just the right amount and the cotja cheese on the flatbread was delicious. After that we got shrimp tacos and beef sliders. The shrimp tacos were good, the salsa was a really great flavor and good spice level. I could have passed on the sliders, the meat was slightly over cooked (and i typically like medium well so that's saying something) and the bun was nothing special and the aioli just tasted like mustard and horseradish. BUT the sliders come with sexy fries which are garlic/parm fries and they steal the show every time. I know they are short staffed so I'm sure that's why the service was slow. Our waiter was funny and really wonderful, but it was 20-30 minutes in between each time he checked on us. Like I said, I'm sure he was just spread thin because he was a really wonderful waiter otherwise!
This is the best place in Reno. It's always our go to place when we want to have a fabulous dinner. Never been disappointed! From the raviolis to the lobster and filet. Excellent!!

We came here to eat on Friday night the 5th for a few of our friends birthdays.  The food & service was excellent.  

We started off with the Oysters Rockefeller, they were baked nicely and had perfect parts of spinach & cheese on top of them.  

I had the bone in ribeye steak, & my wife got the filet and scallops with my buddy and split them both.  

This place is located inside the Atlantis and you need to book in advance prior to dining there.

Hands Down the best calamari in Reno. I went there for happy hour after a day at the spa and the food and specialty cocktails were so good! Everything came out quicker than expected with how busy they were. My only quibble is the wait staff was not particularly friendly.
Top notch service and great food. Highly recommend the cotton candy and their wine selection is pretty massive but full of great picks.

Have I never over the last 5 years reviewed Bistro Napa?!  I should keep it a not so secret still probably... I have been to happy hour countless times here. Also holds a special place in my heart as it was my first date with my now husband, in the main restaurant. We also had a Thanksgiving dinner in the main restaurant. Everything is more than fantastic.  I'm keeping this one short and sweet because there really is so much to write about that I'm telling you should just go find out for yourself if you haven't.  You cannot go wrong with drinks, appetizers, happy hour, main courses.  Such a high level of all the foods - not to mention fantastic service shout out to Susan our main squeeze!!

Just starting off our staycation in Reno!

After checking in, we went to the pool, had a nice relaxing Jacuzzi and then headed here for dinner. It is not only a beautiful restaurant, but the staff is very friendly as well as the menu is amazing.

One thing I have to say, as they do have a lot of Napa wines, but you do have to pay for them. The wine prices are not NAPA valley friendly LOL. My wife and I have frequented wineries throughout our 30 year marriage. Our favorites include silver oak, Cakebread, Mondavi, Joseph Phelps, stags leap, Cakebread. They have them all. 

I called ahead and made reservations. We were sat immediately in a very comfortable booth. I ordered my usual Cadillac margarita, my wife had a peach drink (orchard sewing) that was on the drink list. She really enjoyed it.

What we ordered:
Cadillac margarita on the rocks 
Orchard swing cocktail

Six oysters on the half shell
Napa spring salad
Caprese tomato salad
Bacon wrap scallops
14 ounce prime rib medium rare

Burger and fry dessert LOL really not kidding. (well sort of kidding because it was mimicking a Burger fry and shake. )

It took quite a while to get the cocktails. well over 15 minutes. Not sure why, the place was not really busy. I actually had to kind of remind the waitress. The second margarita I ordered was the same. Took about 15 minutes. 

They gave a nice bread basket that had three different types of bread in them. After getting the cocktails, we ordered our food.

The waitress told us they were out of the slow cooked prime rib. My son was very disappointed because he been asking for prime rib for at least six months. She said she would check and see if she can have one of the primes from the steakhouse. They were able to accommodate my son with a very beautiful cut of prime rib.

The two salads and the oysters arrive fairly quickly. One enjoyable thing about the oysters is they gave a sauce plate that had more than just cocktail sauce. There was a dill sauce, a cucumber sauce, and some other sauce. They were fresh and delicious. The prime rib and scallop dish arrive fairly soon after our salads. I have to admit that was the largest scallop I've ever seen. It was as tall as the bacon was. It was served on a bed of mushroom risotto that was creamy. It was a little overcooked and mushy, but definitely really good tasting. The prime rib a stick and It was served with sauteed broccoli cauliflower and fingerling potatoes. My son enjoyed the cream horseradish so much that he actually ate every bit of the horseradish before finishing his steak. 

For dessert they have a very interesting burger and fry platter that made a burger out of a doughnut and brownie with strawberries and Keewee's for pickles and tomatoes. A miniature root beer float, mango fries and a concentrated strawberry syrup to mimic ketchup. Genius really. They also gave us some cotton candy.

Overall a very enjoyable evening. Food was perfect Though waiting 15 minutes for each drink was a bit rough LOL. Also, we actually had to chase down the waitress and hand her the credit card for the check because she just didn't seem to return to the table after dropping it off. So a solid 3 star service and 5 star food dinner.
The best happy hour on  the West Coast!  Menu is amazing, service is unbelievable  and pricing incredible a must do if in Reno!
Great place. Staying at hotel but read this was the number one happy hour in Reno. I would agree. Here for a conference. No traveling companions, but I had s

Bistro Napa's HAPPY HOUR game is strong!!  I love coming to this place for some cocktails and delicious food. It's offered everyday from 4pm-6pm and all items in their bar menu are half off. 

They have delicious appetizers that come in generous portions. My personal favorite is definitely the calamari rings. I like how it's just lightly breaded. But what keeps me coming back is their signature cocktails, its fun, creative and the presentation is on point. I love the fruity drinks and they sure have lots of them. Every once in a while they would change their cocktail menu (I'm guessing seasonal changes?). But if cocktails are not your thing, they definitely have an extensive list of wine to offer as well! so... pick your poison! 

Special shout out to my favorite bartender Alan, he's very funny and attentive, he always make sure you are having a great time!

This is my third time at bistro NAPA and I come to realize it's probably the gouge in usplace there ever was in Reno, There was four of us first of all their waiter was so slow it's pathetic, everybody had their food and we're sitting here without even or alcohol, where are the drinks . Prime rib sliders there was two of them the original price was $19 oh and our price was $10 it was hardly any meat in them, then we had an art of chalk slivers original price was $16 we got over 850 what a joke they were, all in all four of us the price tag was $140 and we were out of there in a half an hour after we got there food, then they were trying to clean it tableBefore we got a got a payment, do you know be different than music in there they don't have nothing sit down and try to get a place to sit down and that's a joke, do I recommend a place to know if you want to get screwed go to someplace else

We are visiting from Vegas and was looking for some fine restaurants to have a nice dinner, this restaurant was definitely hitting the spot for that. We love seafood so we ordered all seafood starting with half shell oysters, crab cakes, lobster escargot, and five cheese lobster mac, I think my least favorite is the lobster escargot, it was way too salty for me but I usually eat pretty light so if you like your food to the heavy side, it's a dish with good presentation and very cheesy. Their crab cakes were just ok too, again, it was way too salty but it wasn't bad to the point that I wasn't able to finish it. We also ordered their jumbo lump crab chowder, this chowder was phenomenal, we killed the whole bowl it was so rich and so flavorful. We got their seabass as our entree to share and added the truffle corn risotto, the seabass was very nicely done and with gorgeous presentation as well, I think it's the prettiest dish out of all, I really like the texture of the seabass that it wasn't over cooked, it was crispy outside but not chewy inside, and the asparagus that came with it was also cooked well. The truffle corn risotto was also great, I liked it a lot, it was very creamy but not overly salty and they somehow was still able to make it rich in flavor. Overall the foods were all fresh and nicely done. 

The ambiance in this restaurant reminded me of the Venetian in Vegas, it's very classy looking and I like how they seated each table apart so people could dine and still have some privacy (also social distancing due to covid). Our server was super nice and gave great recommendations. Cherry on top is that they give you the cute complimentary cotton candy dessert. We had a good time here.

business.name: Tequilas Restaurant
business.categories: Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Mexican

reviews.text: Yummmmmm. Love this place. Mex food is just too good and place inside is nice and cute. Def try!

Great food and atmosphere.  I had the steak lava bowl which was amazing. Only complaint is that they didn't get my drink order correct. But was happy to correct the mistake. Either way, great place and I will be back when in Philly.

Hands down the best margaritas in the city! Staff is so fun and friendly!! We got a cute little song sang to us and la cucaracha shots to celebrate our birthdays! Would absolutely recommend for happy hour or dinner.

Three of us went to dinner at Tequila Saturday night. We had a 5:30 reservation. We arrived early  hoping to have a drink at the bar first. We were told the bar was full, but we could be seated at a table in the bar area and have a drink. We ordered drinks, guacamole and chips. We asked for jalapenos on the side and were told they probably didn't have any because they run out of food by the end of the week (it was Saturday evening). We asked for more chips and we were told we had to buy them, which we did. As we were enjoying our cocktails and chips we were informed that they have a 90 minute limit on tables. At this point we hadn't ordered our dinner yet. We had not been at the table more than 20 minutes when we were told this. We ordered our dinner and the food came super quick. The wait staff was constantly interrupting us to clear a plate or glass. Multiple staff came to our table several times. Needless to say, we were rushed. The food was okay but the overall experience was disappointing.  There weren't people waiting to be seated and there were empty tables throughout the restaurant. With so many good restaurants in the City, we won't be coming back to Tequila. They obviously don't care about how their customers experience.

For a place that looks like nothing from the outside, it's quite beautiful inside!

Sometimes you need something to revive your cocktail palate from vodka boredom...and a good quality tequila can be just the answer. The cocktails here are expertly crafted (many are tequila-forward) and our friend was flipping out over how delicious the Chanoc was. If you like cilantro, then this is the cocktail for you. The rest of our crew enjoyed our jalapeno margaritas. Nice kick of heat, but nothing that will set your stomach ablaze. I also especially love bartenders who provide water without having to ask. If you keep your cocktail-to-water ratio equal, then you will never experience a hangover!

We only stopped in for drinks, but one member of our party ordered the Sopa De Tortilla, and she was "oohing" and "ahhing" the entire time. Broth based, and chock full of queso fresco and chicken. It was a texture lover's dream. The tortilla chips are made in-house and we could have easily eaten a vat of them if given the option.

This is a perfect spot for a date (music is low and classy) and the ambiance is swank-tastic. Love the chandelier in the center of the bar area.

Can't wait to return for that soup!

I just came back from Mexico City having tried a lot of the fine dining locations there, and I think Tequilas gets close to that experience. I got the stone beef bowl and it was really great if not a bit too hot. Seasoning was apt with plenty of sauce. Drinks were nothing special but still looked nice. Overall a decent spot for kind of upscale Mexican dining with strong flavors.

Three of us went to dinner at Tequila tonight. We had a 5:30 reservation. We arrived early  hoping to have a drink at the bar first. We were told the bar was full, but we could be seated at a table in the bar area and have a drink. We ordered drinks, guacamole and chips. We asked for jalapenos on the side and were told they probably didn't have any because they run out of food by the end of the week (it was Saturday evening). We asked for more chips and we were told we had to buy them, which we did. As we were enjoying our cocktails and chips we were informed that they have a 90 minute limit on tables. At this point we hadn't ordered our dinner yet. We had not been at the table more than 20 minutes when we were told this. We ordered our dinner and the food came super quick. The wait staff was constantly interrupting us to clear a plate or glass. Multiple staff came to our table several times. Needless to say, we were rushed. The food was okay but the overall experience was disappointing.  There weren't people waiting to be seated and there were empty tables throughout the restaurant. With so many good restaurants in the City, we won't be coming back to Tequila. They obviously don't care about how their customers experience.

I used to come here often when I lived in Philly in the late 90's. Just went again for the first time since then, and the food was as delicious as I remembered! Molcahetes de pollo does not disappoint! We sat in one of the outside heated "rooms," which was very comfortable despite temperatures in the 40's. Our server was fantastic. Drinks were delicious (I had the Short Rib, an odd name for a jalapeño pomegranate margarita, but it was on point). Highly recommend!

We sat at an outside table during their happy hour. The staff was so friendly and attentive. We ordered the Tequilas Margarita and the Roses Margarita. They were good but a little too much lime for our taste. The food was excellent. We got the guacamole, which was a little oniony but very tasty and the tortilla chips were excellent. Afterwards, we had the Pollo (chicken) tacos and Callejeros (beef tenderloin) tacos. Both were fantastic. We would definitely visit again.

We got reservations for a Friday night. A little pricey but the food and ambiance matched. The food was pretty good and I enjoyed my margarita as well as some tequila. I find it a bit odd that it closes so early! Overall, solid spot for a fancy-ish night out.

It took me ages to finally get her and it's incredible. What a fool ive been to wait!  Friends took me and it was so perfect I cant wait to take other friends to this spot.  Great food, drinks and the tequila offerings are amazing and rare.  Very down home, not pretentious like you'd expect in this neighborhood,  but really nice space.

So happy we decided to stop at Tequilas on the night they were celebrating 35 years! Can only claim to have been customers for the last 17 or so, but it is our favorite spot in center city and we were happy to toast to their success and hard work. It is consistently delicious, the service is impeccable and the atmosphere is just lovely. And this wonderfully authentic Mexican spot is lucky to be in the most beautiful building of any Philly restaurant. The decor, molding, chandelier, high ceilings,huge windows make you feel you are in a 19th century home which is exactly what it was. It is both romantic and hip and even a great place to impress a colleague. Plus, they make their own excellent tequila which is distributed nationwide. It's almost as good as as being in Mexico!

I love Tequilas. It's a vibe, for sure. The ambiance is amazing. Great decor. Service is attentive and kind. 

They have an amazing guacamole. I also love their empanadas, as well as their enchiladas. 

For all of my fellow seafood lovers: try the pescado al mango!

Tried this restaurant after recommended by a friend and saw that they were participating in restaurant week. Was very underwhelmed by the food. Food lacked flavor and the meal was not worth the price tag. Will not be returning.
Best margaritas in the world. Truly. Excellent customer service and atmosphere. One of my favorite places to go. If not my favorite.

Super yum!    Excellent service, well presented food and pricy but fair.   The balance between a beautiful plate and a generous helping is hard but they aced it.  Not a place I would take the kid, but a great date night.
Really nice service and really good drinks! The fundido cheese dip was very good as well!

This place was AMAZING. Came here for some drinks and apps before my graduation and I want to go back ASAP. Drinks were bomb, food was delicious and the service was excellent. Price was awesome too. Cannot say enough good things.

I really enjoyed my experience at Tequilas for restaurant week! The service was great, our waiter was attentive but not too overbearing, and was able to make some nice suggestions. The food was delicious- I found everything had a great balance of flavor, and what we ordered was not very spicy. 

Dinner did get pricey even with the set $35 menu because of drinks, but the margaritas were very refreshing. I'd definitely come back but it may be difficult to do on a budget.

We went here for restaurant week pre-pandemic and had to order again! We got takeout and the service was phenomenal- everyone was so kind and welcoming when we picked it up. The food is delicious and you get so much for what you pay. I started with the taquitos de pollo which were nice and crispy and came with a phenomenal sauce. The mar y tierra comes with steak, shrimp, rice, and beans. I had this in person a couple of years back and it was so good I had to order it again. So flavorful and filling! The flan was perfect, and my friends had nothing but great things to say about the tres leches! If ever I am in Philly again, I will have to eat here. Tequilas definitely gets my south Texas stamp of approval.

This place was decent. I took my family out for restaurant week. We did the outside seating, which I thought felt very comfortable and cozy. We all ordered margaritas to start off; mine being the Rosa Margarita. Looked so pretty. If you enjoy margaritas this one will feel refreshing. 

The staff wore masks and gloves at all times. The waiter was friendly and answered all of our questions, patiently. Based on what I ordered, the taquitos (starter) and flan (dessert) were my favorite dishes from the menu. However, it seemed like the steak was the most popular dish, based on the waiters recommendation, so I suggest ordering that. I was also able to taste some from my my aunts plate and it was very delicious, in my humble opinion. 

I took a look inside the restaurant when I went to the bathroom (which was very clean) and it was super cute. They create a nice Mexican-style vibe with aesthetics and music. 

Solid spot, thought I wasn't entirely crazy about the food. Give it a try because it just might be for you.

The atmosphere is great. You feel as if you are in an upscale restaurant in Mexico City. The waitstaff is knowledgeable and polite. Restaurant follow covid-19 guidelines completely. The drinks are good and filled with tequila. Highlight to eat or try- Chips & Salsa, Queso Fundido, Salsa Tequilas with shimp, Enchiladas Playa, and Molcajete. Will be back to try more dishes at this lovely restaurant. Best Mexican in Philly.

It's been a while since I've been to Tequilas, with the pandemic locked down and since I started working in the burbs. When I was in workin in city this place was  my first choice for special Client /team work dinners and hanging with friends after work.  My BFF wanted to take me out for my post birthday  celebration for dinner so I booked  reservation on RESY ( so easy BTW , love the app but wish for points like me Open Table). I was so excited  now that the bar is open and the restaurant has opened inside to 50%. Eating outside had been an option for a while. They built genius comfy booths on the street, however the exquisite decorated ambiance  was what I yearned for after eating take out for so long. I was looking forward to what I remembered the delicious and beautiful food, high quality tequila drinks, stellar service, friendly staff and cool ambiance of the restaurant.
When we arrived we were greeted by a charismatic friendly host at the door. The restaurant inside was buzzing with a vibrant vibe as we walked past the bar and tables. We sat at a 2 seater against the window overlooking the street and alley. Very cool city view to people watch as people walked through the alley walking their cute dogs. A kind man waived at us and lifted his little dog to the window so we could see him and say HI. My friend captured a pic. What a touching experience and memory. 
Our server came to our table right away after we were seated end was super helpful in describing the margaritas and other drinks. My friend went for the traditional margarita on the rocks and I got the red sangria . The sangria was excellent! Lots of fresh fruit and I could taste the infusion of fruit juices. 
Next we had the queso dip with chorizo ( my fave in the past) Yummy as I had it before!  And for the signature entree : The molcajete beef. Super comfort with bubbling suave of chilled and spices and tender beef in a large mortar bowl. Just as I remember fro the past dinners. Rice and beans beautifully presented on the side. And...blue tortillas! The highlight... blue tortillas! So delicious! 
After eating the delicious food I wish I had room for desert- Tres leches cake is epic as I remember. Next time for sure.

We were looking for a post dinner hang out and decide to hang at the bar. Why not as the gorgeous crystal chandelier was illuminating and the decor took us back to being in a fancy palace. The  bartender was so friendly and made us feel so welcomed. My friend is a Spanish teacher who lived in Mexico and enjoyed conversation with the wait staff as they were picking up drinks . The jalapeño margarita is the bomb! My friend had a palamo grapefruit tequila. 
She is Spanish teacher and also loves Mexican and Latin cuisine and she enjoyed conversation with the staff as they were picking up their drink orders 
Way at a wonderful experience! We will be back soon!

David, Dan (Marcos), Max, and the crew were amazing! We were thrilled to be able to sit at the bar and talk with/ learn from Dan. He introduced us to amazing mezcals and made us terrific margaritas for 3 hours today! The food was great: creamy guacamole, flavorful enchiladas, and tasty steak. Can't wait to go back!

Walked in with a friend and asked for a table for two. Instead of seating us, the hostess immediately said "you guys are going to order food, too, right? You have to order main courses if you're going to seated. We have a lot of reservations tonight."

What about two Black women entering a RESTAURANT would make you assume that they weren't going to order food?

I should add that there  were a lot of empty tables both inside and outside. My friend and I are both visibly Black women and wearing our hair in long braided styles-- I guess our outward appearances didn't fit the profile of a typical diner at Tequilas because there was literally nothing that would've indicated that we weren't planning to dine. If you recall, the hostess didn't even say hello before launching his interrogation. 

We left immediately. FOH.

business.name: The Ranstead Room
business.categories: Bars, Lounges, Nightlife

reviews.text: Was looking for nice little hidden gem with a speakeasy vibe, and Ranstead was perfect. customer service could of been a little better but maybe it wasn't her night... nevertheless the bartender was so nice with her mixology skills! so my two drinks were delicious... don't come hungry, but they do have a small bar menu you can pick some treats from. I'll definitely be back!

Love this hidden bar. Really cute date night spot. It's definitely not recommended for groups larger than 6 people since the space is limited. 
The drinks are little pricey but very unique.

Hard to get in, 2 hour wait first try, got in 2nd day right at 6pm, place was full by 6:15pm
Nice setup, had 2 good drinks but the rest were just ok. 
Service was disappointing, not going back

This place was cool. We got right in after dinner at El Ray. They took us through the kitchen and down into the cellar, through a basement to get to a back door entrance. It was good, I liked that they had non alcoholic drink options. My boyfriend liked his drink. If you liked it here though, you will LOVE hop sing laundromat.

Want a lowkey spot with great cocktails and dope ambiance? This is the place. Down a little alley with dark moody lighting, it's a great place to go with no more than 2 people. It's one of my favorite places to go to grab a drink if I'm getting to know someone. You could also take your side piece here, it's that lowkey. Never ate here but I can imagine the food being good.

I love coming here for dates. You will never have to worry that your drink will go wrong. If you love creative unusual drinks and trying new bitters and flavor combos, while impressing your date go here! 
It's a super cozy place

My fiancé and I had such a great time here!! The staff was very knowledgeable and it was easy to get a table. The ambiance is awesome, and our server Patrick was a gem! The house cocktails are delish, and I even had Patrick make my all time favorite drink, a Oaxacan Old Fashioned. A lot of places don't even know what it is, but he knew exactly what it was, and how to make it. And it was sooooo good. They also have a great selection of tequila, which is another huge plus in my book. Go, you'll love it!

A friend and I whom have known each other for 6 years (but haven't seen each other in 5 of them) were able to meet up in Philly and run around for a night. 

He (Julian, as it were) stumbled upon this place while maneuvering through a kitchen and beyond a door in the back that leads to The Ranstead Room [Insert compellingly provocative and suspenseful key]. 

Fast forward 200 years and we enter through the front door this time. LMJTY (I'll explain this later), place. was. packed. 

Threw GaryBusey.ftw's ESA card on top of the stack of cards presented for ID - the creative points enabled us to get two reserved seats at lucrative corner seats of the bar. 
{*side note - when swinging outside your proverbial (& literal) financial/status-oriented fence, BE CREATIVE*}

Anywho, back to the cocktails, SUPERB; I was like, "Damnnnnn, Gina," how they gonna hit all the keys (i.e. presentation, aroma, texture, palette progression and finish) to compose the right notes (i.e. a little known blissfully slice of flavor akin to Heaven) - apologies for the masterful run-on. 

Sidebar: a lonely woman next to us was lonely (and somewhat sad), so we struck up a convo and now Julian has dinner plans tonight. We will leave her confidential to protect the innocent. 

Sidebar II: The mixologist (do a quick Google search to review delineation between bartender and mixologist) was offering up recommendations in the "Gayborhood" because it had more amazing vegetarian options to offer. However, the look on this dude's face, after 3 or 4 mood-based drink requirements, was like watching somewhat of a soulful connection being made. The drink. The recommendation leading to that drink. The unbeknownst cosmic association that was created based upon serendipitous events happening in his life. 

I digress. This place was dope and I simply recommend it.

This was my first experience and we enjoyed every minute of it! my boyfriend turned 40 so i thought that would be something different to try as we hung out in Center City. yes, we had to wait...but not longer than you would at a restaurant. Patrick was our bartender and we asked for Bartenders Choice and we we were both very pleased. we will definitely return!

The Ranstead Room is a nice little speakeasy just off a main road in an alleyway. The drinks are yummy and will cost you ~$14 each. The bartender was nice and the dimly lit red atmosphere makes for a relaxing night for a couple glasses of your favorite poisons. I like how it wasn't too loud inside too so you don't have to have yelling conversations. This is a great secret drinking establishment and hopefully you don't need to wait too long for a table!

Ranstead Room is a great spot for when you want to pretend you are a sophisticated and sexy woman-about-town who knows how to get places without relying on Uber and Google Maps. Your cover will be blown when you get lost trying to find the entrance to Ranstead Room, as it's an unmarked door in a dark alley that you've never walked down before, and you are terrified. 

Fortunately once you enter the bar, it's so dimly lit that no one will be able to tell you were profusely sweat-panicking just a few minutes before. Actually, it's so dark in there that this is an excellent choice if you are breaking out, having a bad hair day, or "look tired." I suspect it's a popular Hinge date destination for similar reasons. 

The decor is what you'd expect for a speakeasy, complete with tasteful, vintage paintings of scantily clad women. This is a great opportunity to find out what kind of person you're on a date with. For example, if you comment on the paintings and they respond with, "Oh, so you like nudes, eh?" it's probably a good indicator that the evening is not going to go well.

Cue the cocktails. If you're a vodka drinker and have a sweet tooth, the Coco Chanel is what you're ordering.  Coconut milk, ginger, lime, and vodka- so refreshing, it's almost as if you're sipping this drink on a beach in sunny Mexico instead of listening to your date pretend their French-Canadian accent is thicker than it probably is. If you're in the mood for a "healthy" cocktail, order the "What's Up Doc?"- lots of tequila with a splash of carrot juice, lemon, and honey.  

Ranstead Room is one to check out if you're into killer cocktails, speakeasy vibes, ... and nudes. I'll definitely be back.

Love this spot! Definitely one of my favorite places in the city. I always take out-of-towners here. A real speakeasy with great custom cocktails. Their Cocktail menu changes regularly and the bartenders can make you anything you want.

They have a small food menu (appetizers) which runs out of the same kitchen as the Mexican restaurant behind it, El Rey. The food is very good but we usually go just for cocktails. 

There's usually a wait to get in but it's worth it.
Grew date spot. Don't blow it.  Great drinks. Good snacks. Hope they have  the duck salad.
If your looking for a place to have high quality drinks you need to go here . Each drink I tired was mixed to perfection I will be back I have to try more signature cocktails

Everyone has a hobby, and my hobby happens to be speakeasies and tiki bars. I quite literally travel the nation hunting them down everywhere I go. Of the 213 speakeasy/tiki bar I have patronized thus far...,  THIS is the one that started my obsession about 10 years ago.  I have returned here time and time again, both alone and with guests.  Although the entry into the bar is not particularly creative (by modern speakeasy standards), it still maintains a great secret bar feel. The overall vibe and ambience once you're inside more than makes up for the lack of a flashy hidden entrance.  As to the magic of the mixology itself, they offer a good selection of craft cocktails with minimal trendy hype. If you are looking for a classy cocktail experience in the heart of Philly, take the time and effort to track down this gem. You will not regret it.

So dark inside. Love the entrance. Very speakeasy. So dark inside. So dark. Drinks are expensive. Popcorn is even more expensive. Food is expensive. Tastes great. But expensive. Drinks are strong. But expensive. Great for dates. If he's paying.

The Ranstead Room is frequently listed as one of the top bars in Philly.  It deserves this status. First of all, it has the feeling and atmosphere of a speakeasy.  Hidden away behind a non-descript door on a tiny Center City back alley, you just have to know it's there. You would never walk by it otherwise and there are no signs identifying it.  Inside is dim lighting and sexy.  Sit in a booth or sit at the bar.  Service is formal but not pretentious at all. Order one of their specialty cocktails or perhaps one of your favorites.  I did the latter and as it was a warm late-summer evening I opted for a "Hugo."  This Triveneto (Austro-Italian) cocktail is a favorite of the cognoscenti - but I happen to know and drink it anyway.  And I chose their tasty Diabolo Huevos to accompany my 'Hugo.' Life in the Ranstead Room speakeasy was totally cool in Philly that summer evening.

Found this place by searching unique experiences and this place didn't let down. Between myself & my wife we probably ordered just about every drink on the menu! The Elvis was our favorite just because it was so different. Definitely stop by if you're in town.

Beautiful ambience - dark and sexy! Lots of wall portraits of nude women and black/red upholstery gives this place a very vintage vibe! 

The bartender is amazing! She was single handedly taking orders and creating drinks for everyone at the bar and while she was super busy and continuously at work, she never looked irritated and was really pleasant while interacting with us! 

They have a great drinks menu and also have a bunch of food items which you hardly find in a speakeasy. I asked her if they had any spicy drink, she said she'd make one for me and got me a Spicy Dead Lady which was amazing!! I had two of those and switched to An Evening with Aphordite for my third one which was great as well. 

I loved the spicy drink so much that next time I am just going to order it without even looking at the menu :) Unfortunately the kitchen had closed when I went there but would definitely love to try the food next time.

Did I delete an ancient review? How is it possible that I haven't written a love letter to Ranstead Room before now?
It's such a unique little space. It's dark. It's got velvet wallpaper and retro art. The candle lit ambience, the ban on cell phones being out at full brightness if they have to be out at all (hint: put it away!) There's nothing not to love here except that some nights you just might not make it in if you don't arrive early or aren't willing to wait nearby for space to open up. If you're deadset on visiting get here right after they open and do pre-dinner cocktails (or eat and drink at El Rey on Chestnut and ask your server if there's any tables available in the Ranstead Room. You'll be escorted through their kitchens via an underground access to the tiny vestibule of the bar and have a very Prohibition moment.)

At Ranstead I almost always end up starting out with Bartender's Choice... and specifically asking for  Water Lily. 
Next drink though I always let them surprise me, and have discovered some great cocktails I like that I've never had before. Service here is always attentive and they keep you pretty well stocked in water (always smart with strong drinks...) It still remains one of my favorite places over the years!

Food (Drinks) [5/5] - There was a reasonable drink selection, but the cocktails that my friend and I tried were satisfying and delicious.

Service [4/5] - The staff was kind, and our waiter checked in at regular intervals to check if we wanted to order additional drinks. The service was perfectly satisfactory for our group of 6 on a Friday night.

Ambiance [5/5] - The Ranstead Room is a single, dimly-lit room made to look like it's from the mid-20th century with booths and tables spread throughout the space. You feel like you're walking into a different world when you enter, a world that invites curiosity and just the right amount of tension. This is the reason you come here.

Value [4/5] - The cocktails are a bit expensive for a Philly spot, but the price is well worth the experience of coming here. Some of the cocktails are in quite large cups as well, which is always something I like to see.

My wife and I went to Ranstead Room at the recommendation of Whitney at The Dandelion. Patrick was an awesome server with excellent interpersonal skills.  He was an expert in the craft of cocktails and made our experience unforgettable.  We will be visiting The Ranstead Room in our next trip!

Came here on a Thursday, no wait and it was very quiet. The drinks are strong and very well made, worth the price tag. A good place to just grab a drink with a friend and catch up for awhile. Be prepared to be sitting in the dark, it definitely has the speakeasy vibe. I tried coming once on a weekend but the wait was too long. I think going on a weeknight after work is a good time to go if you're looking to get right in.

Very cool spot. There's nudes on the wall. The lights are low. The music is classic. The drinks are strong. You'll pretty much find whatever it is you drink in here, and it'll be done proper.

The wait time can be aggressive, and you'll put your name down to receive an anonymous call, but it's worth it.

Coolest spot I've been to in a while. This little speakeasy is tucked away in a quiet side street that looks sketchy but honestly isn't. It's right in center city. The drink menu is limited but know the bartender is extremely knowledgeable in his craft. There wasn't a drink he didn't know how to make. The decor is like something out of the 20s mixed with Harry Potter. Tealights everywhere. I highly recommend it for the experience alone. The drinks were great but a bit pricey. Again, something to be expected when you're in the heart of Philadelphia.

business.name: Sheraton New Orleans Hotel
business.categories: Cajun/Creole, Hotels, Venues & Event Spaces, Hotels & Travel, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Booked the club level package on their website that includes breakfast and parking. My family was put in a room on the 46th floor. With that said you would think we were on the ground floor because the street noise was so loud. My husband said it sounds like the cars were in the room lol. I'd suggest sleeping with ear plugs or bringing a white noise machine with you if you have trouble blocking out intrusive sounds.  That's the only one of two downsides to our stay. 

NOW to the positives because there are plenty!

Check-in was a breeze and the customer service from everyone at the front desk was amazing. Normally I walk away with a bit of worry but every question I may have had was answered fully. 

The package I purchased included a breakfast buffet in the club lounge however due to covid breakfast is now at the restaurant on the second floor and it just gets charged to the room then zeroed out at check-out supposedly we shall see at the end of my stay when I get the folio. I'm doing this review in real time so by the end you'll get all the nitty gritty. 

The rooms are decently spacious. CLEAN.However I feel jipped with these double beds felt like I was back in college fighting over mattress space with my husband lol. Sheraton could really benefit from having Queen beds. The beds were perfect for my two toddlers to share though. The price I'm paying for this room doesn't correlate with the bed is all I'm saying. There were plenty plugs in the room for all our charging needs! There are 4 plugs 2 on each side of the night stand. Invest in a dual charging block or bring a surge protector if you need to plug in a lot of stuff close to the bed. 

Valet was simple Jazmine went over everything I needed to know to get my car back and was very pleasant and warm. You text a number to get your car and they'll text you back when it's downstairs ready for you takes about 15 minutes. However valet was crazy at night the line to get to the front door stretched down the street.

Now these are some fancy elevators and they're fast. So instead of pressing a number inside the elevator you type in what floor you need to go to outside and then it tells you which letter elevator to go to. No more having to worry about your kid playfully pressing buttons. 

There's a Starbucks in the lobby but perks of club level I can get some for free in the club room but if you want specialty coffees and fraps the lobby is where you'll be headed. 

There's also a doggy area right outside the property it's gated and big enough for your fur babies to roam and do their business. 

Masks are required in public areas and vaccination cards or a negative PCR tests for dining areas and restaurants as we were asked to show them when we went to Coteries for dinner.

Breakfast was buffet style but you hand them your plate. These grits were phenomenal! I didn't have to add anything to them. Everything taste great and fresh. People please stop fussing.

Whew checkout was a rollercoaster but with Tequila or however you spell her name. she kept moving her name tag to where it wasn't fully visible but to be an Envoy Elite member and treated in a dismissive manner put a damper on what was a great trip. I'm not sure if the overwhelming amount of people who were there for other events got to her but she could've told me she needed a moment and I would have totally understood. I had questions about my bill but another clerk came over with an issue from a guest they were helping and they totally forgot about me. Thankfully Sarah came and asked if I needed help since I was still standing there lol but she addressed my concerns with the bill because it was$230 more than I was to be charged initially. 

All in all I would definitely come back but would book a king bed suite for more space for my family. This hotel is super close to everything as we were able to walk short blocks to every place we wanted to go.

Dated hotel in need of remodelling, but great location.

We all know that the heart of New Orleans is the French Quarter, and the Sheraton is located close enough that most bars / restaurants you want to go to are only 10 min walk away. Even better, its located next to the Sazerac house which is one of my favorite attractions.

However, as convenient as the location is, the hotel leaves much to be desired in regards to its upkeep. The lobby is spacious, but not great for sitting or even a fun bar area. Restaurants are old and dated, especially the breakfast area. The rooms look like the 80s, dark carpet, old worn furniture, and a tiny dark bathroom. Not even enough plugs - you have to hunt for them. At least the floor to ceiling windows are nice. 

The club lounge is decent though, plenty of snacks and drinks so thats definitely a plus. Service was also decent - front desk and housekeeping staff were polite, friendly, and efficient.

Stayed at the Sheraton which is situated perfectly from everything. The elevators are pretty interesting too. The rooms are very nice. We had a nice view. I loved the location. Really close to harrahs casino and Bourbon street. Lobby is big and has a nice bar in it. Also the Starbucks inside gives it a nice touch

We booked this hotel as part of a wedding block and stayed here a few weeks ago. Upon entering it gave all the good vibes - check in was easy and the concierge lady was lovely - and the lobby seemed clean and spacious. Everything went south after that though. The elevators were slow and frustrating and broke multiple times during our two nights stay. Walls were very very thin so when the elevators were working, or if anyone was making any noise in rooms nearby, you could hear the mechanics and voices crystal clear. On top of that the ice machine outside our room was broken and beeping every 3 seconds for hours our first day. We had to call multiple times to get it fixed. All in all - this stay was not peaceful and when you're on the 31 floor you expect quiet. Sadly nothing really worked out and I wanted to love it :( I don't recommend staying here - especially for the price tag that goes with it!

I am currently staying at the Sheraton Hotel on Canal.  I am changing my review from 3 stars to 2 stars.  I'm here for 4 days and 3 nights.  No one cleaned my room on yesterday.  No one cleaned my room on today.  

The parking is also very hectic.   There was one time, where it appeared that it took 5 workers, to deal with one guests lost car keys issue.  Why did I have to be impacted by that if there were enough workers to get my car, while one person could have dealt with his lost car keys issue.  

I also have to say that they need to highly invest in new remote controls for their televisions.   Trying to use their television remote had to be one of the most frustrating experiences of my stay.

The remote was slow to react to every press of the button.  There were times that I had to pray to keep myself from wanting to just throw the remote at the television.  

Even when I scanned the code to use my phone as the remote, I had the same issue.  Please fix this so that your guests can have a more pleasant stay.  It should not take almost 30 minutes to log into Netflix because the television is slow to react to the remote.  

On another note, I inquired about a refrigerator before I traveled.  I was told that my concerns would be forwarded.  I was given the impression that a refrigerator would be available.  

There was no talk about a first come first serve basis on refrigerators before I traveled.  Yet, when I called the staff like 4 times regarding a refrigerator, I was told that they would check.  

It's okay to check.  It's even okay to even not have one if they are all checked out.  Yet, the issue is that the staff NEVER followed up with me regarding whether they had a refrigerator or not.  

The staff simply ghosted me each time and never followed up.  This is downright disrespectful.  You should at least call to let your guests know whether they will be accommodated or not.  

There were also times that I called the staff, and no one picked up the phone.

phoenician and crystal at the front desk lack the ability to function at a corporate level, it's appalling that they are employed here in the first place. The level of professionalism is rudimentary at best, my recommendation would be to take your business across the street to the JW Mariot.

We ordered drinks and food and they just somehow forgot to give us both then looked at us crazy when we asked about it. They weren't that busy so I'm not sure how our order could of been lost. Don't waste your time.

We had a nice stay here at the Sheraton on Canel St.  Our room was on the 36th floor which had a great view of the city.  Our room was nice and spacious with a comfy king size bed.  There is a Starbucks in the lobby, open in the mornings.   The Sheraton is walking distance to lots of places.   CAFE beigent was a block away.  The Aquarium was also a few blocks away.  BOURBON St. is also walking distance.  There is a high-end mall down the street as well.  We had a wonderful time in New Orleans. We would definitely stay here again the next time we visit.

It was a good location. Now the bad side. You press your room floor outside of the elevator. There are not any buttons  inside the elevator,except for open/close. Unfortunately, if you don't want the creepy person in the lobby to know what floor you're on,this will make you uncomfortable. We put the  do not disturb sign on our door, only to come back with housekeeping in our room. We're aware that she didn't miss the sign, due to her knocking it off the door and putting it back on as she informed us she didn't make one of the beds because it had personal items on it. However, both beds had personal items on them before we left.  The parking area is an extremely tight, dark dungeon without elevators, and last but not least, they had roaches.  We could not switch hotels due to everyone else being sold out.

This hotel gets at least one star because the beds were comfortable. 
But that's it. 
The first night I was greeted by a newborn baby cockroach on my nightstand. The next day, one was in the shower. 

The "upgrade" given as a loyal and revered Bonvoy member was an Executive Suite with Club Access but A) to get to the club we had to go to an entirely different building and it took two elevator rides to get there. Fine.  But when we got there there were small bags of potato chips, two types of granola bars and that was it, no matter what time of day you arrived. All four days we were there the Espresso Beans were never refilled. I get that it's "Covid Tome" but have some imagination. At 5 pm, put out individually wrapped crackers, cheeses and veggies.
Small bottles of wine or something that makes me feel like a valued Bonvoy Member. 

And why is it that everywhere I went on the lobby, it smelled like Dank Weed?!?

The restaurant was a disaster. We had "coupons" for breakfast. The first day they handed us a menu with limited options, I get it. 
The second day we were shown to our table and TOLD there's the buffet, enjoy. 
I didn't want the buffet. There were no other options given. 
So I went to the buffet, which is more money than the "meal tickets" allowed for which is unexpected.
Here's what I found on the buffet: 
There were flies in the bread rack, the pancakes were, literally, cold and hard. The eggs were inedible and the sausage links were fry, overcooked and tasteless. The fruit cup was old, and was clearly from a previous meal.  And on the second day they made us get our own coffee and carry it to our table without providing saucers. 
There were no saucers to catch the coffee that splashed as I walked.  And other than someone Seating us and handing us a bill, no one ever came to our table.  I finally lost my appetite completely when I realized just how dusty and dirty the banquet seating and chair rail were. I'm pretty sure it hasn't been dusted since Louisiana was purchased.
And why, for the love of goodness are people in the portico selling weed?  I can tell you. Probably to service all the college kid's who were staying 8 to a room across the hall from us. Thank goodness we travel with ear plugs and a sound machine because we would not have been able to sleep at all otherwise. 
And finally, the bed linen. The comforter was stained with blood and looked and smelled like it hadn't been washed in months. Thank goodness I bring my own comforter and pillows. 
Completely dissatisfied and disgusted with this sloppy, unrefined waste of my time. It's almost as if they said "Hey! I know, let's just see how far below the Sheraton Standards we can go!!"  We have a long history with Sheraton and Marriott but this hotel is clearly the dregs. It's a shame really.

Do not stay here, parking deck is terrible and the management is just as bad. They threw away a bag of all of my toiletries when cleaning our room, and then after calling to try and get it back the desk was unhelpful and said our only option was to file a full report with statements that wouldn't even guarantee we would get anything back or any type of compensation. Would recommend going anywhere else if you can.

i haven't even got there yet and they can't simply tell me what the incidental / deposit is due during check-in. i've been on hold 10 minutes . the person on the phone sounds like their not even sure wait hotel they work for .. deadd lmaooo .

.. stay tuned because i'm updating this as i travel :) .

The staff members are wonderful but the up keep is not so good and the first day here they sound off the Alarm so we had to walk down 28 flights of stairs and after everyone got to the bottom they said nothing I had to go to the front desk and ask what was going on and was told it was a false alarm but they still had us out side and said nothing on top of that you have too pay to park your own car in there parking lot that they say is not there parking lot but one of the people that work there are writing tickets on vehicles I stayed 5 days and had to pay on top of the hotel stay an extra $211 and if you valet it's$15 for 2 hours and if it's over night it's $48 for each day

I stayed here in July for a convention. Starting with the check in the women at the registration desk were so helpful and friendly and really took their time. They made sure me and my friends were on the same floor and that our rooms were fairly close. At the present time there is not any room service so they gave us extra bags of towels which was very convenient and also gave us as many bottles of water and other amenities as we wanted.
