The convention rooms we used were on the fifth floor and they were very nice, the temperature was comfortable and the lighting was great. 

The location of this hotel is very convenient to many of the activities and main streets in the area. They have limited meals that can be delivered to your room and one morning I did get a breakfast sandwich and that was fine they charge a five dollar delivery fee

Room was dirty parking was complicated no toilet paper in room water damage through out pool out of service... bedding was comfortable staff was friendly but not a repeat stay...really surprised for a Marriott property.

Love it here! Really beautiful room! Spacious! Nice! Best of all, the view! 

Starbucks coffee in the room.  Furniture was nice.  Nice tv.  Overall a wonderful stay. Def would love to stay here again!

IF YOU LIKE  BUGS THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY. They have roaches. I saw 2 in the bathroom crawling on the tub and on the walls. I report the incident to the night shift manager ADOLPHO  he basically insulted me by offering me $50.00. Called corporate spoke with Bruno he was understanding took the complaint and said he was very sorry. Spoke with Katie the day shift manager the morning I was checking out she applied a credit to my room which in my opinion was not enough. She also told me that these type of things happen which is another slap in the face. I've stayed at lots of hotels I have never seen a roach in my room. Can't bring my suit case in the house It's just sitting in the garage. I've been Waiting on corporate to call me back to discuss this matter and I have not heard from anyone, no emails no phone calls no text. But yet I'm getting emails thanking me for booking with them and asking about my stay. I Guess this is how they treat BONVOY members. SMH THEE WORST!!!!!

Great location! Close to all of the French Quarter/Bourbon street action. However, it is not the cleanest hotel. The comforter inside of the duvet was noticeably yellowed/stained. The carpets also need to be shampooed. However, for the price and location, you definitely get what you pay for.

Based on lobby restaurant only. Hotel rooms are fine. I know still opening from covid but really? The gumbo is an embarrassment to NO. Wings are small and sad with hot sauce on the side (blue cheese served in a resale packet). Everything reheated in a microwave. Crappy beer options to boot. For heavens sake just serve drinks till your really ready to open.

Check in was awesome . River view . Hotel needs updating for the tech savvy people . Clean room and customer service is very good .  Main thing again is update rooms for the tech savvy , wanted a fridge and microwave too . The staff makes up for everything . Update - I am enjoying my stay and appreciate so so much the reply .  Takes time to check on guests FIVE STARS !! Again great staff
In retrospect I was too harsh in my previous review. It is a fantastic hotel/great location. I don't like the corporate policy regarding the cleaning of rooms.

I have stayed at this establishment before and it's now subpar.   For a comparable price you can book the  Westin or Marriott.  First they have no bell hop service.  Second their atm machine doesn't work.  Third housekeeping can't pass out essentials including towels, toilet paper, tissue, ect,.  Fourth they come to your room to tell you that you are too loud. This is NOLA.   Get over it.  In a nutshell: soccer moms and Karen's are welcome.  If you are looking for a a good time I recommend the Marriott or crown plaza across the street

Great location and easily accessible to all of French Quarter. Hotel pool and restaurant was  going through renovations during the time of our stay which was disappointing. Room was clean, carpets although dark definitely needed cleaning (at least in our room). View from the 28th floor was amazing. Also, do not pay to have your car parked- do it yourself!!!! Premier Parking is not affiliated with the hotel and they  were the worst to deal with regarding me trip!

If I could give zero stars, I would. Really unprofessional. Booked 2 rooms and the front desk wrote our room number wrong and took our stuff out of the room while we were out for us to come back to find our stuff missing and in the lost and found. How they could have gotten the room numbers wrong but then to remove our stuff is beyond ridiculous. Do not appreciate anyone touching our bags, especially during COVID. Would never suggest anyone to stay at this location.

The hotel is nice but concierge and housekeeping  is ridiculous.  We had to ask for towels multiple times, which they just threw on the beds and never got dirty ones. They never came to take the trash so we got bags for housekeeping cart in the hallway. Not to mention concierge was not at the desk when we would go and we had to wait while many employees stood there. Their were a pair of eyelashes( not ours) into bathroom and sticky substance on the floor, missing picture on the wall with wall hanger exposed. Valet was prompt and polite. For such a nice hotel you would think that the accommodation would match ...not so much

business.name: Hilton New Orleans Riverside
business.categories: Event Planning & Services, Hotels & Travel, Hotels, Venues & Event Spaces, Restaurants

reviews.text: I had such a horrible experience at Riverside hotel in New Orleans. I have a disabled son who was denied access to his room along with his service dog during the thanksgiving holidays.  He had cell phone and no money.  He had nothing on but pajamas because they woke him saying that his dog was barking.  The dog was probably barking at them.  My son was missing in a bad area of town due to the managers disrespect for human life. I wouldn't recommend my worst enemy go to this hotel Due to the bad choices in management. There laws against removing disabled people. Especially when it's an Ike crime infested area Which was confirmed by the people that work there. This hotel does not deserve even a one star. I would give it a zero.

In late July 2021 on a Girls Trip to NOLA, I got into a turrrible  physical altercation with a relative that I was sharing my room at Hilton, New Orleans Riverside with. It was the second night of my trip and let's just say that she was bitten by that boozy Bourbon Street Bug and she could NOT handle her liquor. Although the unfortunate event occured off of the hotel property, here's where this particular Hilton did me DIRTY!
After the altercation, my drunken relative high tailed it back to The Hilton, ahead of me and proceeded to lock herself in the room, keeping me from getting inside. It was just after midnight. Feeling distressed and increasingly embarrassed by all that was developing, I went to the hotel's front desk for assistance and was handled like an idiot. I was told by a so-called night manager named Vincent Howard, with a smile, that it was best that I leave. He reasoned that although the room was registered under MY name and paid for with MY credit card, my relative was also a guest there and that they had no right to remove her from the room. Vincent Howard flatly explained all of this to me as I stood in the hallway feeling foolish and defeated. While I was being talked down to like a child, my relative was allowed to remain on the other side of the door, drunk out of her mind, loudly babbling and threatening to fight me. There was a very nasty hotel security guard who accompanied the night manager to the room, threatening to remove us both from the hotel which would've made more sense than what actually happened in the end. 
My relative was allowed to plunder through my luggage, smash a few items and pack my stuff for me. Most insulting, they locked her in the bathroom where she continued to rant and rave, rushed me into the room to get my things and offered me the opportunity to wait in the lobby for my phone to charge before leaving The Hilton altogether. I was never offered another room or a refund. Thank God some of the other ladies on this trip had accomadations at a Marriott Hotel in the area. I was able to bunk with them. 
My Hilton experience was embarrassing and hurtful. I will never forgive or forget the garbage staff for how awful they treated me in the midst of a family fallout. This place SUCKS!

Front desk was very helpful and welcoming. We had two separate rooms and they were able to make them adjoining upon request.  Great location and access to the Riverwalk.  The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the water was hot.  I saw a few negative posts on google about the train noise, but it was not an issue. I would recommend the Hilton Riverwalk to everyone! It sounds like I work here but I don't.

If you are going on/off a cruise, this Hilton is very good location because the dock is right by it.  If you are planning the most of your time in French Quarter, then it is a bit of a walk (15min plus).  The second floor is connected to Riverside Mall.  

The room is just okay.  It needs updating and the bathtub was very clogged.   The staffs were mostly nice, the receptionist, the security and the cafe staff.....the concierge not so much.  That's really all I have to say about this place.   Nothing special.

My family were register at the Hilton Hotel in New Orleans Riverside with plans to stay for Thanksgiving. On November 24 at 2 am my son was awakened by someone at his door.  Management along with 3 security personal and 5 policemen were at the door.  There was a very rude manager who told my son his dog had to leave.  (When he registered, I asked if they allowed service dogs and they said yes). In defense of the security at the hotel and the police officers, none of them agreed with what the rude manager did.  The security acted scared of this rude manager.  Probably for fear of losing their job.    The rude manager kept insisting for my son to take his dog and  to leave.  My son asked why and rude manager said the was barking earlier that day and the neighbors complained.  My son told him it was a service dog and he needed him with him for his disability.  The rude manager proceeded to tell me son he had to leave.  While this was happening, my son called me.  I was in another room two floors up.  All I could hear was "mom, mom".  I immediately went to his room and was completely surprised when I saw the number of security and police at my son's room.  My immediate response was "oh my gosh, is this a swat team, what is going on?
The rude manager was telling my son he didn't care about him or his dog and to leave.  My son was sleeping when the people knocked on the door and the dog was quite.   He had been barking earlier that day.  I said, well he can come to my room.  Rude manager wouldn't even allow my son to come up to my room.  He was escorted out by the police and security.  Due to his health condition he was confused and couldn't understand what was happening.  He didn't have his phone or wallet and all he had on was a t-shirt,  thin pants and slippers.  He had never been to New Orleans.  It was in a dangerous area which was confirmed by the hotel security and the police.  I could not find my son for two days.   I called the police department to report him missing and spoke with one of the officers who had been at the hotel that last saw him.  I called my manager at work crying because I knew I was in no condition to work.  When he was finally found, he was curled up with his dog next to a car trying to stay warm.  To make it worse, the hotel charged his credit card for two nights when he wasn't even there.   The situation has caused more distress for my son and has set him back in his treatment.  He has had multiple  PTSD episodes since this event and his doctor has scheduled several back to back appointments to try to help him through this set back.  As for the dog, he had to go to the vet.  The barking could have been because he was sick.  He is now being treated by a vet.  As for me... I was so distraught over this situation.  I drove for hours looking for him and crying.

We stayed at this hotel because we couldn't find anything else and we knew we were going to stay here another day to do with our cruise and it worked out they had space for us the first night. I have to say they have been very very accommodating with extra coffee condiments to go with it and many other things and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Wow, expensive and old. So much construction going on around it, crazy. 
Dragos bar staff was super personable and attentive. The concierge was so very nice and extremely helpful. 
I Needed an address that apparently the guest services ladies could not be bothered with, so she stepped up and found the address and showed me on a map.

Front desk personnel had bitchy attitudes and the air of, " what do you want". It was like my very presence was an inconvenience to them. It was like they were seething. 

One actually told me when I couldn't connect to the WiFi that it must be something that I'm doing wrong, then  told me to call ATT for help because no one else had reported an issue. Hum... I have been connecting to hotel WiFi for years. Oh well it must be me. I figured it out on my own, thanks. 

Every time ask them about something they tell me, well I was about to get to that, Whatever that means. 
I run my own medical business and I know that people can be difficult, but the customer is always right. Especially if you want to have return customers. This place is pretty empty because of their economy killing covid crap, so I would hope the any customers would be welcome. 
Next time we have a conference in New Orleans we will stay at the lowes or the Ritz Carlton.

This is one of the worst hotel you can stay at, o have attached pictures of the damaged broken walls and furniture of the hotel , nothing good about staying there , save your money and stay at a motel 6 which is way better

We had a great family staycation at Hilton New Orleans Riverside. The hotel has so much to do from food, nearby shopping, conference rooms, and great customer service.  We had a suite on the 29th floor. The room was AMAZING. This luxury hotel view was overlooking the city.
It's all about location in New Orleans and the Hilton New Orleans Riverside places you at the center of it all. Nestled against the banks of the Mississippi, guests can watch the ships come sailing in or dive into the city life just steps away. Grab a beignet, listen to live jazz, ride a streetcar, or hop into a parade, you never know what you'll experience in the vibrant culture and excitement of New Orleans just outside our front door. Make it a trip to remember with Hilton.

I've stayed at this Hilton years before when I was younger. Overall, I would say it's not as nice as I remembered or expected, but it gets the job done. Booking was easy, the rates were good, staff is helpful, check in was one of the easiest I've have and the location is excellent. The location is by far the best part of this hotel. 
The rooms were clean enough. The beds are okay but not luxurious by any stretch. The room quality overall is closer to that of a best western or comfort inn. A little smokey smelling and basic toiletries. It was great having a mini fridge and coffee maker. 
This would be 4 star but the disappointment lies in the pool and the comfort expectations of a Hilton. The pool is pretty sad. It's a square of water, the area is kind of industrial feeling and rusty. The best part of the pool is it's right above Dragos so you get the constant smell of buttery, garlicky charbroiled oysters. 
Another issue was the elevators, keys and doors. Despite having two separate groups of elevators, the wait was always extremely long. The keys are tricky and the doors all have quirks. We were stuck a few times. 
I would stay here again for function, location or a cheap rate but it's definitely not good for a special occasion.

TL, DR: Be prepared to wait 20+ minutes for an elevator to the lobby from your room. Also be prepared to wrestle with your door handle in numerous unexpected ways to get it to open.

This is a hotel geared towards convention-goers, so, apart from its location, probably not ideal for a "staycation", which is what my girlfriends and I used it for last weekend. The hotel itself is in good shape, the carpeting in the halls and in the rooms don't show too much wear. The lobby is unimpressive but clean. The pool is much smaller than it looks in photos but well maintained and there are ample pool towels, unlike the situation at some other hotel pools. The pool is near the exhaust fans for Dragos, so know that you will smell food cooking while in the pool. 

We were able to check in an hour early and the room was clean and had nice bath products. The view is also lovely. We enjoyed the pool for a couple of hours and then left for dinner and to go out downtown. We got back around midnight and gathered in my friend's room to continue chatting until around 2am. At that time, we walked down the hall to our room and couldn't get in, even though the light on the door turned green. We pushed the handle and door over and over as hard as we could. Nothing. We also tried using the room key on our phone with the app. Nothing.

So we headed (in our pajamas) to the elevator bank to go to the lobby, assuming we had an issue with our room key. Pushed the button. Five minutes passed, then ten. Then fifteen. (We started timing after 5 minutes). Then twenty. At 15 minutes we picked up the phone in the little cabinet next to the elevators. Spoiler alert, nothing happens when you dial that phone pursuant to the directions. It is purely decoration. I did call the lobby with my cell phone. When I was able to speak to a person, he could not explain or help with the elevator situation. 

Another important side note: the hotel's elevator banks are divided into 2, with one bank servicing the bottom half of hotel floors, and the other bank servicing the top half of hotel floors. Each hotel bank has 5 elevators. FIVE. 

For over twenty minutes, at 2am, my friend and I listened to elevators periodically whizzing up and down, without stopping on our floor. There is absolutely no way that all 5 elevators were so busy at 2am that not one could stop on the 13th floor for that amount of time.

Between the 20 and 25 minute mark, an elevator finally opened. It seemed like a mirage. But it did in fact deliver us to the lobby, where a man and woman were at the front desk, complaining about being locked out of their room. Interesting. When it was our turn at last, the front desk clerk dispatched security to help. The security officer came up to our door and watched us struggle and then suggested we lift UP on the handle. Notably, NONE of the times we had previously opened the door did we have to lift up on the handle. Ever. After wrestling the handle up and doing some maneuvering, the door finally opened. 

The issue here isn't that some doors are apparently quite temperamental. The issue is that our epic 2am journey could have been entirely prevented if we had simply been advised at check in that the door may not open the same way every time, and that you may have to be quite forceful with it. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels over the years and never once had an experience like this one. 

At the cafe getting coffee the following morning, we overheard several other guests complaining about the wait for elevators. When we warily attempted to head down and access the lobby for coffee (around 8 am), two other guests were standing by the elevators and informed us that they had already been waiting for over 5 minutes for an elevator. About 5 minutes later (so about a 10 minute wait), an elevator arrived.  When checking out, around 11am, we also had to wait about 10 minutes for an elevator. Inexplicably, though, the wait in the lobby to get an elevator to a higher floor was never long. 

So, although there are some positives here, I cannot recommend this hotel. We were plainly not the only people who repeatedly waited an exorbitantly long time for an elevator, nor were we the only people who had trouble with the door. While our situation was not dire, just inconvenient, it is easy to imagine scenarios where it would be (a child in the room alone; a guest feeling sick and just wanting to get back to their room; a computer or presentation materials in the room and a deadline or scheduled presentation put in jeopardy).
Nice place to stay but bring supplies to snack and drink. Not much at the end of road to get your fill in between going out and about.

I was a guest at the hotel from 7/14/2021 until 7/18/2021. I had 3 separate reservations, which the front desk agent told me they linked together to avoid me having to switch rooms and having to have my keys reprogrammed. When I checked in, I requested for my room to be cleaned every day of my stay.

Issues during stay:
7/15: 3 supposedly clean towels, but 2 had visible stains - red-orange, brown-green. Complained to front desk agent & promptly received a service recovery bonus, which I appreciated.

7/16: Room wasn't cleaned per my request. Had to make a second request, so it ended up being cleaned after usual housekeeping hours.

7/16: Keys no longer worked for my supposedly linked reservations. I had to stand in a very long line to have keys reprogrammed, causing me to be late for my dinner reservation.

7/17: Room wasn't cleaned per my request. I only received a set of bath linens after complaining.

7/17: Keys didn't work again, so I had to stand in an even longer line to get them reprogrammed, and was late for dinner reservation. When this happened the day before, I was assured that I would not experience this same issue again.

7/17: Complained to person who identified themself as the manager about my many issues. They spoke in a harsh tone for part of the conversation. They also promised to add 5500 points to my account for the inconveniences I experienced, which never materialized.

Why 3 stars? The third star is for the location of the hotel, as it's very close to the French Quarter, French Market District, the riverwalk, restaurants and bars.

This Hilton location really needs some work. First, their website should be updated with current covid restrictions and guidelines. They offer things like room service, 24 hour concierge, etc.... but during my stay, room service was suspended due to Covid and they offered me a $15 per day credit for room service. What kind of sense does that make if I can't even use it. The concierge was not 24 hours.... in fact, when I went downstairs to ask, she said she was only open til 4:30 pm. 

My room wasn't as bad as some of my friends' rooms. They had leaking toilets, the cold water was shut off, etc. My only complaints for my room was the TV didn't work and the water pressure was non-existent in the bathroom. It didn't matter if you tried to run the cold water or the hot water... it trickled the same, whether barely on or fully on.  

Also, something to note is that they do have a mini fridge and provide you with 2 bottles of water, but there is no microwave and there is only one ice machine on each floor, which is to the left of the elevator and down the hall.I stayed on the right of the hall so I didn't even know an ice machine existed. 

The AC worked but it would automatically reset each day back to 72 degrees. I'm from Washington. I needed my AC at 64, all day, everyday. Hah.

They only got their extra star for location. This hotel is very over priced and outdated. They nickel and dime you on everything!  WiFi is extra! To pay around $250 a night I expect certain quality of service. First, parking is about $40 a night and valet is $45. The valet and bellman were the only employees that cared and it's because they work on tips. Every Hilton employee and restaurant worker was lazy! There is no room service. We came to the restaurant close to closing and just wanted a quick dessert. They didn't even serve us! We said we would take it to go and tip extra! Their lazy workers just said nope! No one wanted to do extra. The main pool is closed and when we figured it out we were told there was another in a different building, but it was closed because it closed at 8 pm! It's the summer and it's hot why close so early? The beds are horrible! The bed felt like I was spending a night in jail! My back and neck are stiff from a night in their beds. If this is really a Hilton, then wtf?! Also, a train went by at around 4 am blowing a whistle! The train was right outside our window and you walk on the tracks to go anywhere. Then at 8 am someone got on the loud speaker and said the alarm was taken care of. Uhh what alarm? We didn't hear one, but thanks for letting us sleep!! No breakfast at the restaurant only counter ordering at a little coffee place. The fake Starbucks is closed as well. There is also construction all around the hotel and on the boardwalk! It is hard to just get outside the hotel and enjoy the scenery when the walkways are torn up. Again, good location but bad everything else!! I wouldn't stay here again.

So, if so can sleep on a train track you should be fine here. Our room was 533, it was nestled around in a corner. When we arrived I thought to myself it was a tiny room for the price, but we're just here a couple nights. First night we crawled into bed and went to sleep. Around 2 am, I woke up to a blaring noise, somewhat dazed and confused I was unsure what it was. I fell back asleep after a few minutes, then at 4:37 the noise again, it was a train air horn. It came again at 6:30. This happened both nights that we stayed. The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the manager refunded one night. Just trying to be fair and share my experience. I know it won't make money, but the few rooms on the train track should be remodeled into storage.

Do no ever come here! Whoever works the front desk are horrible, my first day the toilet does not work. I call to ask for someone to fix it they took 4 hours. By the end of the night I ordered uber eats and never get food. Two hours of waiting and calling the front desk my food was sitting there waiting. They collected my food, I heard them laughing waiting as if I was muted. The woman told me TO COME GET IT. I asked her can someone send it, she was unclear IF the food will be spent. I asked her what do you mean if- she literally RAISES HER VOICE AT ME. I tell her, please don't raise your voice she HANGS UP. This is thee worst fucking treatment I've ever gotten! TRASH ASS STAFF DO NOT FUCKINF GO HERE!

The hotel was clean and the staff were courteous.  We arrived earlier than the check in time and we were able to go to our room early  The room was clean and the view was amazing.  We noted that if we needed any housekeeping services that we would have to request them.   Which we did.  Albeit some of the work was half completed (didn't empty all of the trash cans) the room was clean.  The hotel is showing is age however my stay was pleasant and Drago's was downstairs  Till next time NOLA

Location is amazing. 

It's close enough to walk to the French quarter, but far enough from the chaos and noise. Pay the extra few bucks to include self-parking. It's totally worth it (can go in and out unlimited). The outlet mall (which has another location of cafe du monde) and actual high end mall are also right across the street, along with harrah's casino. Drago's restaurant is downstairs - I'm not a  big fan, but folks do flock it, so maybe the cocktails are good? There's also a small convenience store in the 2nd floor (not 24/7).  Didnt check out the pool, but was told one of the two is currently being renovated. 

Service at the desk was lovely. They were super nice and helpful. 

Rooms itself can use an upgrade - carpet and tv are outdated. Beds are pretty comfy, though. 

It was also very tricky to get in and out of our room with a stroller. Granted we had a corner room that had the view of the city and the River  - which was really awesome since my kid was super entertained with the cars and boats. Also, we decided to eat in our room once at sunset, by the window, with take out food and that was also nice. Room came with a small fridge with no freezer, and no microwave. Coffee maker and blow dryer were provided. Shampoo/conditioner/hand soap provided, but nothing very low end. 

The sink in our bathroom didn't drain well so that was inconvenient since we have a kid and we do a lot of "washing" (utensils, bottles, etc). Shower pressure was great. 

If you're sensitive to noise, ask for a room away from the elevator AND the ice machine. We asked for a room from the elevator,  but we didn't think of the ice machine. 

All in all, it was a good stay. Now, we did find a bottle of coke in the fridge, but we just went ahead and chucked that out. No big deal. Everything else was clean - no funny smells or anything like that, so we are happy and will definitely stay here again when we come back to NOLA. 

Hope this helps!

3 hour wait for towels...come on Hilton! I'm appalled at the level of service here. The room is decent, bed is nice, definitely needs a little updating in the lobby. It's as if there's no staff but fully booked for the hotel. If you cannot manage the needs of your guests, maybe reduce your capacity.

Asked for a nice room, well the room was nice but the mattress was probably 20 years old. Complained and they offered to upgrade me to a better room with a better bed, total lie, just switched me to a worse room, lower floor with a worse view! This one had folded up cardboard screwed into the bed frame and the light switch to the LED lights over the bed was gone. Oh yeah, they said I have the best bed in the hotel and all the mattresses are the same. I asked to speak with a manager and not the desk staff again, nope, no manager just the girl who checked me in came over and talked down to me and offered me a smaller room with the same mattress or I could take my bags and kid and leave (politely stated as they would waive my early checkout fee) at 8 at night and try to find a better place.

Booked this hotel for 3 days. The service was great, the rates are great. But the rooms are not Hilton clean .. I like staying at Hilton hotels, but was a bit disappointed here. They have a restaurant downstairs so that's a plus. Will probably stay at a better hotel next time, but then again, it's New Orleans, so maybe are all like that ?

The location is great-right across from Harrahs and beautiful view of the river. Lots of construction on the river walk mall while we were there (April 2021) that made it a little difficult to get around. We bought streetcar passes and used that often (stop right outside hotel). 

The hotel is attached to an indoor mall with lots of great shopping and fun food choices including takeaway daiquiris, a cafe du monde location (with short lines!), and a winery (free tastings!). 

Some annoying things-
-You have to pay $11 daily to use the fitness center. 
-It's REALLY hard to figure out where to go in the hotel. It's just a huge location. 
-The restaurant and bars were only open Saturday (we tried to hit happy hour both Sunday and Monday and it was never even open). 
-Only one pool was open and you had to call to have it unlocked even though posted times were open-and then you waited there for 30 minutes for them to send someone to unlock the door. 
-Rooms were pretty icky. Our wallpaper was peeling off the walls. We asked for housekeeping, and they didn't come.

So where do I start ! A from from the rude service and front desk people to the room attendant telling to go buy toilet paper at the stores! To begin I fell In the lobby and rolled my ankle on a huge wet spot after i asked for help or if they  wheel chair I was told if I was faking.   I uploaded a picture so you can see how bad it was and I was refused any help . From the none help to all the vending machines broken this hotel should be ashamed to be a Hilton because the one's in my hometown Chicago all hold a standard of excellence that here in New Orleans lacks !  Trust me it's not worth staying here go else where

Ok. I'm gonna jump right into it on this one ladies and gents. Rarely do I ever rate with such a low rating. You've gotta really drop the ball for it. Ok. Soooo. Came in Sat 03/13/21 happy, JUICED!!! This pretty gorgeous place in a dope new city and state for me to discover. High ceilings with rooms overlooking the front desk and loung area of a awesome restaurant named Dragos. (check that review out. You won't be disappointed) Front desk staff was super friendly and helped me with a upgrade on my room too. Big thumbs up on that my guy. The room is nice and spacious. The only issue is it has TWO conjoined room doors. Guest on both side crazy loud. But hey it's NOLA and it's spring break. we go out and enjoy the food fair and sites that NOLA has to offer. (Swamp tour was beyond fun by the way.) upon our return from the swamp tour we get texts from our banking provider of clearly fraudulent charge attempts.. (by the way ppl always let your bank know when you're traveling. It'll save you major headaches in case of situations just like this) we get back to the room and to what do we see... OUR luggage, drawers and closets are all ran through. The safe didn't work so nothing was stored in it. The thieves stole a few valuables that could fit on their bodies because all the big cash cow items like our Mirrorless cameras and, drone and shoes and all were left alone. They stole off body wallets and AirPods. The thing is all that is easily replaceable. So that's not the big thing to sweat over. The thing that's bad is the management has done nothing and technically turned a blind eye to this. There's only two keys and we have both of them. We turned down room service at the front desk upon arrival. We want NO ONE to have access to our room especially during the covid times. Management hasn't come and spoken to us about any type of compensation to remedy this unfortunate situation or anything. They've been very dismissive of it. I shouldn't have to reach out to them after we filed a report of a situation on YOUR premises. Your job as a supposed prestigious hospitality is to always insure that you've delivered satisfactory service to your patrons. You should be reaching out to US to help ensure that this unfortunate situation can be rectified on your end. Very dissatisfied with the service and level of treatment. Hotel security is more helpful than its own hotel management. At this point. We know it's a inside job. The police reports been filed and this a black mark will have to stay until I get a better outcome to this situation. Which lets be honest. I won't hold my breath on. Other than that. Simply because of front desk staff and Dragos. I dropped the rating you have.

business.name: Sinema
business.categories: American (Traditional), Event Planning & Services, Cocktail Bars, Venues & Event Spaces, Nightlife, Restaurants, Bars, American (New)

reviews.text: Everything from start to finish was a dream! Great wine selection, amazing service, & food was 10/10. The selfie situation in the bathroom was by far the best part tho

I came in for dinner to celebrate my birthday which had been canceled /post poner due to weather. We had reservations and we were promptly sat. Our server was amazing. He paced our meal just right. 

We started with meatballs and the angelotti. The meatballs were a touch dry. And it only came portioned as 3 meatballs which isn't ideal for a table of 2. But the sauce with it was very tasty. The angelotti was great, very soft pasta. My favorite part was the sun dried tomatoes which added some nice acidity to the dish. We got the short rib and the gemelli. 

The short rib was short alright. A pretty small portion. The potatoes under were delish. The gemelli was the better of the dishes. It had a nice heat level but again the sausage was just a little dry but the sauce helped with that. We also got the duck fat potatoes. Honestly, If I didn't know they were roasted in duck fat I wouldn't of known. 

We ended with the stuffed skillet cookie and the maple pear tarte. The cookie was SUPER rich. We couldn't finish it.  But the heat from the cookie paired with the cold ice cream was nice. The tarte was nice and crispy and light. Over all we really enjoyed our meal and would return.

Brunch Buffet. Go. Go now.

Worth every penny.

That's it. That's the whole review. Please see photos and videos - it is absolutely worth the wait (if there is one), but grab a reservation for the best experience!

P.S. The bathroom is VERY selfie-friendly, LOL. Gorgeous dressing room lighting and all.

All you can eat brunch?! You bet I'ma pull up!

This was our final stop on our Nashville tour and what a way to end it! Someone recommended this place and I heard about how the brunch menu is amazing. One thing about me, if it's a brunch I'ma have it!

This restaurant was initially the Melrose Theater and  management maintained the movie experience.  Walking in you feel the old Hollywood vibe and are greeted by very friendly hosts. We were seated upstairs near the bar area. The decor presents a regal atmosphere. And they have movies playing, Sister Act was showing when we went. We also briefly spoke with a manager that introduced himself and our server was great! Honestly everyone here is really friendly!

Y'all know why I came...that bottomless brunch. The price was $37 and an additional $20 for bottomless mimosas. I just got a cranberry mimosa a la carte ($8). Our server said he hasn't tried anything bad on the menu and you know what, he was right! My favorite was the cinnamon roll pancakes and the Usual Suspects. We also ordered the Chilaquiles, Bacon Jalapeno Cheddar Grits, and Pumpkin Pie Pancakes. You can really order whatever and it's going to taste amazing!

This place is a must when visiting Nashville, next time I'm in town I'll try their dinner menu because I see people raving about that too. The bottomless brunch is definitely worth it!

Don't forget to to take a #SinemaSelfie in the downstairs bathroom. The restaurant itself calls is a photo shoot!

Pretty overpriced but friendly service, clean venue and nice atmosphere. The food and drink quality was good but for the prices you can get a better overall experience elsewhere. It was a good one time visit but not somewhere I would return to or recommend.

First time at this restaurant and definitely the last. We arrived early so we wanted a drink from the bar which was in the lobby area but they told us the bar was closed even though there was a bartender serving drinks at the bar (????). After ordering our entree we waited for
1 1/2 hours and still no food. Tables that had arrived way after us already had their dinner entrees. I asked for the manager and after waiting another 15 mins and no manager, we walked out. Manager finally calls me later to apologize but we were long gone and way too late for apologies.

Came here for my brother's wedding rehearsal dinner, and it was great. We had a private entrance with a private room. On the menu were several options for the three course meal. I ordered the ricotta ravioli, filet, and tiramisu. 

All of these dishes were great. What sticks in my mind about this meal were the tenderness of the filet, and the tanginess of the steak sauce with mashed potatoes, and the ravioli. Maybe it's because I haven't had filet in a while, but that was a perfectly cooked piece of cow that melted in the mouth. The ravioli was memorable simply because it was such an amalgam of so many different flavors. Savory ricotta cheese, tartness of sun dried tomatoes, earthiness of mushrooms. Tiramisu was good, but I think the better choice would have been the carrot cake by the looks of it. It came with a homemade ice cream that was nearly like custard. 

Wish I would have gotten just a couple more pieces of tasty ravioli, and the salad didn't impress me, but everything else was great.

Met friends for brunch. Excellent food and amazing service. Reservations are best. 

We sat outside and the weather was perfect. Please try the fried chicken on the unlimited brunch menu. Yummmm!!!

#fatjared say...HIGHLY suggest coming here. This is as close to a 5 star review as you can get! I would come back in a heart beat, but there was 1 thing that really fell short for me unfortunately.

When I review and grade places, I have a very strict criteria. If I have ANY complaints at all, it can't be 5 stars. 5 stars is perfect on Yelp, so you must be perfect, which means no complaints.

Sinema was as close as any restaurant has been to my 5 star review. I can start with my 1 small complaint, and that was the brussels. You'll see in the pic they do not have a char on them at all, most were undercooked and under seasoned, and just not good. It's truly unfortunate because everything else at this place was unreal!!

We started with drinks, and their menu of drinks is awesome! All kinds of different spirits and wines to choose from. I got a flight of bourbon which I love when places offer spirit flights. My wife's drink was perfect for her, and the waiter did a great job of listening to what she wanted and finding the right drink for her.

Our food order was angolotti, tomato soup, meatballs, brussles, and Tagliare Stella. 3 apps, 2 sides, 1 entree to split.

I unfortunately do not have enough room to go into detail about each item. If I could I would, but people would not read it all. I will point out that all their pasta is hand made in house fresh, and you can truly taste the tenderness. The meats were spot on, the flavors amazing, and vegetables seasoned perfectly. Everything other than the brussels were absolutely perfect!!

Such a great experience. Loved it! I would come back in a heartbeat! almost perfect, but give this place a try. You'll love it. Well done Sinema!

Oh my word...get the cinnamon stack. For dessert or your main course. Shit. The crispy edges and fluffy center....whew...I am full and happy. That was a brunch well done! Damn. Make a reservation...go see Gary and have a great day! Also, the chicken is so freaking good! I don't think they missed!!!

Celebrated my Bach in Nashville and it was epic. Unfortunately, Katie confused the dates and put us down for August  instead of September. So there we were a party of twelve with no Saturday dinner reservations. Fortunately, my babes were great and up for spontaneity. We decided to split up and and explore food spots on Broadway. Sinema was empty when we showed up. We could have been seated, had dinner and out quickly. Yet they insisted on our month too late problem. I think with the alcohol and exhaustion I didn't question Sinema. When I returned home and looked at our email thread I found the ball dropped on Katie. Can I just get my refund back and an apology. I'd appreciate it greatly. Thank you. #staynashty

Located in Nashville's historic Melrose theater, Sinema is an over-the-top chic restaurant that has a menu with a modern take on your typical American classics. It's an amazing brunch spot with a totally unique vibe. Want to take it to the next level? They also have an amazing bottomless mimosa and bloody mary bar to top off your experience.

Sinema was chosen by my some and his fiancé to host our rehearsal dinner. They did a fantastic job!  The service was great, the food amazing and the atmosphere incredible. I highly recommend!!
We had 43 people and an hour of cocktails. Bar tenders were awesome and kept everything going. We loved it!!
awesome place for brunch!!!highly recommend...food and service was amazing! make reservations

This was my first experience at this restaurant, and it was terrific. I enjoyed how the building was converted from an old cinema to a restaurant. The customer service was excellent, but the food was a bit mediocre. I'd definitely return for the all you can drink and eat brunch they offer.

Came here for a bottomless mimosa birthday brunch. Our waitress brought out a bottle of sparkling wine to start, along with small carafes of orange juice, grapefruit juice, & cranberry juice. Then, she brought out the entire menu in three courses, as Sinema is currently doing family-style due to COVID. I really hope they actually keep this style & don't go back to self serve buffet! It was great to have everything brought out to us. 

Our favorites were the Sinema scramble, biscuits, fruity pebbles french toast, and both of the pancakes. The cinnamon roll pancakes are to DIE for! I need the recipe. 

The restaurant itself is amazing. The historic theatre adds a very fun element & the decor is on point. I love nice bathrooms with vanity rooms separate from the actual toilet area. 

One star removed because our waitress was pretty clearly trying to hurry us along. Less than two hours into brunch, she told us that the bottomless mimosas have a limit of two hours even though the website clearly states 2.5 hours. At one point she even told us we really needed to wrap it up. She took awhile to bring new bottles of wine, so we would have gone quicker if not for that. We also were not requesting an unreasonable amount, especially considering it's bottomless -- we only had 3 bottles between 4 of us.

Came here for my 30th birthday dinner with a group of 6. The food tasted great but our service was very lacking. It seemed like the waiter didn't want to serve us and was unhappy. I got a bowl of ice cream for my birthday which was nice but our server never came back with a spoon or anything so it just melted. The lovely ladies at the front welcoming everyone were amazing though!!! Very sweet and nice.

Perfect for a large group. We had a rehearsal dinner for 58 upstairs. Cinema worked with us for a three course sit down meal, with three shared appetizers and a choice of one of three entrees and a choice of one of three yummy desserts! We did a signature cocktail as well. They provided a special printed menu and drink descriptions and worked with us to allow our own table decorations. They have a great audio system to work with their wireless mic and easy projector to do a slide show from our laptop. They will loop a full length movie of your choice on the big screen. The service and food were very prompt and the food was awesome!

Perfect for a large group. We had a rehearsal dinner for 58 upstairs. Cinema worked with us for a three course sit down meal, with three shared appetizers and a choice of one of three entrees and a choice of one of three yummy desserts! We did a signature cocktail as well. They provided a special printed menu and drink descriptions and worked with us to allow our own table decorations. They have a great audio system to work with their wireless mic and easy projector to do a slide show from our laptop. They will loop a full length movie of your choice on the big screen. The service and food were very prompt and the food was awesome!

We had a cocktail at the bar first. The bartenders were friendly. We had great service at the bar and they have great bourbon selection but at our table, the server as very slow. We had to try to get the servers attention for everything; refill water, place order, and ask for check. He was very inattentive. The food was good but not great. We had the meatball appetizer which was pretty good. Agnolotti appetizer was okay but small portion. I really enjoyed the scallops for entree. They were perfectly cooked and the orzo pasta it came with was buttery and delicious. My husband had short rib and it was dried out on top like it had been sitting under heat lamp a while.

We had to push our reservation back to the last spot because of flight delays. The bartenders downstairs were really nice and they have a lot of drink selections and many high end bourbons including michters 20, Pappy 15, 20, & 23. I did have a 2oz pour of the michters 20, it was a reasonable $125.  We should have just ate at the bar honestly after the service we received from our waiter. We signed up for 5 course but when we were seated it wasn't mentioned he asked if we knew what we wanted and we didn't even have a menu yet. He then said oh the QR code is downstairs let me try to find some menus then he walked over by the bar and magical produced a paper menu ‍. The service was bad maybe because it was the end of the night ? Not sure he took our app and drink order. We got the meatballs and Agnolotti they were ok, we were starving at this point it was almost 10pm. Then he disappeared and the app and drinks came and we finished them and we had to track him down to order our entrees. I hate the short rib and my wife had the scallops. He raved about the short rib but it was a very small portion and very dry, maybe because it sat under heat lap to long not sure. It had decent flavors but I wouldn't order it again based on how dry it was. The scallops were cooked perfect and the spinach orzotto it came on was pretty amazing. We had again finished our meal and were looking for the waiter to trying to get our ticket and tab out. Very frustrating we were tired and ready to go. I would say service was pretty bad for this caliber of Resturant and the food outside of my wife's scallops was just average at best. When visiting Nashville I can't recommend this Resturant.

Excellently seasoned, delicious food. We made a reservation on open table for late on Saturday night. Luckily we arrived early for the reservation, because the parking situation is tough. There is parking, but it's shared with several other businesses and we had to circle the lot a couple times to wait for someone to be leaving. 

Once inside, we were greeted by a host and told that the QR code on the host stand is how we would be able to access the menu. Pretty standard but I didn't realize when first told that we needed to open the menu while in the lobby because the QR code wasn't available on the table. No biggie, but I had a difficult time hearing the host speaking in the loud lobby. 

We were sat at our table and ordered the lamb loli chops and watermelon salad to start while we decided on some more food and drinks. The server was maybe a little confused because of how we were ordering, but the apps came out quickly and that's what we wanted to do, so what can I say?! 

We shared and both were super impressed with the lamb. Perfectly seasoned and seared, just remembering it is making my mouth water. 

I really loved the watermelon salad - the watermelon was juicy and a little salty and spicy. So good and not exactly what I expected. 

Next, we shared the bass. Again, everything on the plate was perfectly cooked and seasoned. I really loved the tomato & leek sauce on the plate. 

For dessert, we got the skillet cookie -- what the server said was a crowd favorite -- and the peach pound cake. Pound cake is made with local peaches, served with a peach compote, maple bourbon ice cream, and some caramelized pecans. Every element was tasty and went so well together. 

The skillet cookie might have been my favorite thing of the night. Sweet and salty, with such a great crisp on the outside and gooey inside... combined with the melty ice cream running down, it was perfection.  

Overall, we would eat any of these dishes again, especially the lamb and cookie. The service was good but I would have preferred a little less talking -- as in, not interrupting in the middle of a conversation to say that you're putting a spoon down or that something is coming soon. It didn't make the experience bad by any means, because I appreciate that the service was attentive and we were given information about menu and such, but for a date night and being in the midst of conversation most of the times the server came back, I'd have preferred that not every touch point involved an explanation. 

Anyway, we'll absolutely be back for some more fantastic food.

Reservations are a must.  It's a 2 hour limit, but you can always finish cocktails in the upstairs lounge.  
Danielle was our server.  She was a delight!  Friendly, knowledgeable and very attentive to us.  

I would say, download the brunch menu.  They bring out everything!!!!

The last few times we have walked in to grab a drink, they said they are "no longer seating". This is during non-busy times where tables are open and the restaurant isn't closing for at least two hours so it just doesn't make sense. It stinks because we have had one or two good experiences in the past - one of the bartenders makes great craft cocktails. But we are not going to frequent a place that seems to not want any walk-in customers, especially when it's happened numerous times and for no apparent reason.
I like this place.  Real nice for a business meal or a special occasion.  regular menu or tasting menu so variety.  Wine program seems to be coming along, a few good choices amongst the noise.
Never disappoints! A hidden gem! Obsessed w the decor & vibe it's stunning! The food is absolutely delicious and the staff is professional and timing is always spot on! Testing menu is bomb.

business.name: Sacred Pepper
business.categories: Restaurants, American (Traditional), Food, American (New)

reviews.text: The food here is amazing. Service is great.  Gabriela & Kelly were so awesome! I could come here once a week, easily...but I live in south county

Used to love going here on a Friday night and sitting in bar area listening to music. Usually have to get there early but even that doesn't matter anymore bc bar and table reserved . We've been told a number of times bar area is first come. My daughter met some friends a few months ago and it was a full band. They couldn't even talk to each other. Unfortunately, Sacred Peoper is going from nice dining to a club. ‍ Don't know if we'll be back.
Their nasty food got my entire family food poisoning, and I was up all night puking my soul out. Im pretty sure they were serving expired food. DO NOT GO HERE

A bit of a drive for us, but when we are close to this place we try to go. It's owned by the DebarTolo's, so being owned by billionaires never hurts... beautifully decorated and one of few establishments that has a proper sized bar area. We frequently eat at the bar, so we love their layout. Decent selection of drafts and bourbon, and a very good wine selection (reserve list). Also one of few higher end places that offers a happy hour too.

As for the food, the fried Brie app is killer, the short rib cavatelli and filet are standout mains for us. Great side selections with the tilamook creamed corn with bacon being my favorite (add japs to kick it up). Have not made it to dessert, so can't comment on that just yet.

Nice to find a great dining option that's not a chain...

If you want great tasting food and cocktails this is your place! There is a good variety of cocktails and entrees on the menu. The service was excellent (shoutout to Tony!). We had the chicken parmesan and the Hawaiian Delmonico. I definitely need to come back and try the other dishes!

This was my second time at Sacred Pepper and again I was impressed! First of all, the decor inside is absolutely beautiful. There is a main dining area as well as a room for private parties. The bar is actually quite large and has plenty of seating and full service. The menu is quite large and has a little something for everyone. I ordered the blackened steak bites for a starter and OMG delicious, the steak was cooked medium, was the and juicy. I decided to keep it simple an ordered the Salmon and a side of the caramelized brussel sprouts for dinner which was equally just as great. The customer service was very pleasant, my server was attentive and offered suggestions of his favorites. Even the support staff was on point, they were quick and helpful when the server was helping other tables. Live band was amazing, they played a mix of genres, they were interactive and got people up and dancing. It was a great night out and I definitely see myself returning any night of the week!
Great food. Great variety. Great ambiance. Good prices. Never had a bad meal. Highly recommend this restaurant. Other than the noise level because it gets crowded it's one of Tampa's unique and best.

I visited Sacred Pepper with my family for the second time this year on Christmas Eve. I recall the first time we went. The food was great, which is what brought us back, but they also have a very loud live piano player. I was immediately reminded of that the moment that we walked through the door. Instead of the expected holiday carols, we were treated to a (another) rousing edition of Billy Joel's Piano Man. 

So then, why not kick back and enjoy the sounds of the season with a glass of Bourbon Barrel-Aged Spiced Sangria? 1000 Stories Bourbon Barrel-Aged Zinfandel with Washington Hills Merlot mixed with brandy, fresh lime juice, fresh orange juice, and a blend of vibrant spices were just the right concoction to set the holiday mood.

Once our orders were placed, a nice assortment of bread was brought to the table for us to snack on. Served with a generous helping of olive oil to dip it in to.

I ordered the Prime Ribeye, 12 ounces of delicious beef cooked to a perfect medium rare and served with a serving of Yukon mashed potatoes. For my side, I ordered the Fresh Tillamook Cheddar Creamed Corn with 
Applewood bacon and smothered in Tillamook cheese.

Everything was fantastic! We ended our meal, and the evening, with a shared piece of Vanilla Bean Crème Brûlée. It was candy coated and topped with fresh whipped cream and raspberry sauce. Muah! Chefs kiss!! So good!
Definitely was nice for prom night! Was super hard to get in though.... Also the prices are a bit high..

my boyfriend & i just spent our anniversary here tonight & it was amazing. our server amanda was so attentive and helped with recommendations since everything on the menu sounded magnificent. everything came out perfect & in short time. definitely will be back! oh and--- GET THE CREME BRÛLÉE!
One of ho to places, the good is always great as bf service is marvelous.   Great place for a date night

The inside was decorated with dark blues and gray vibes. It feels upscale and chill at the same time. The big tufted chairs felt luxurious and comfortable. I didn't even notice there was a tv playing football behind me. They also had a live singer doing cover songs as well as singing a soulful version of happy birthday to guests. The music was nice but I felt it was a touch too loud and made talking more difficult. Service was great. I made a reservation and my table was ready as soon as I arrived. 

The bread provided while we waited for our meal was different than the usual from other restaurants. They offered two options: pretzel bread and ciabatta (maybe, not sure). Both were warm, soft, and accompanied by a red sauce (perhaps with red pepper & oil) but whatever it was tasted great. 

Crab stuffed shrimp- This was offered as an appetizer but they let me make it into an entree with two sides and it didn't cost a lot more. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the crab mixture on top (not really stuffed) was rich & full. 

Sides were also great. The fries were crispy and well seasoned. Brussel sprouts with bacon- Crispy and fresh at the same time. The bacon didn't added any greasiness; it was a great balance. Even if sprouts aren't your favorite, I think these would satisfy anyone.

My daughter & SIL are visiting from AL and were meeting friends for dinner. We suggested Sacred Pepper, as we go quite a bit and always enjoy. They did not have the same experience . There was a band playing ( not a big enough place for a band) which was so loud they could not hear each other or be able to have a conversation. Feel really bad for our recommendation, as these are friends they aren't able to visit often.
First time and won't be the last. Gabriela took care of us with some apps & drinks. Amazing amazing food. Highly recommend the Espresso Martini and the steak frites!!!
This is a great restaurant! I always bring friends and family who come visits here for at least one dinner! The food and service is always good and the ambiance is amazing!

So I usually keep bad news to myself, but this place deserves the bad press. 

My wife and I went to Sacred Pepper for our anniversary. (AT 4:45 PM) on Friday. (Pictures enclosed) when we arrived we were one of maybe 10 people in the restaurant. (There were more staff than customers) we were seated  at a table so small you wouldn't be able to fit much more than dink glasses on. When the waiter FINALLY came over, (between 5-10 min) I politely asked if we could be seated at one of the (entire restaurants) empty booths as it was a special evening and we were very cramped. I was told "no" they were being saved for larger parties later that evening. We left without eating. Needless to say we will not be back. And unfortunately will never know if it's good or not as it was our first time there.

What a lovely place. A few friends and I were looking for something new in town. This friend group is one in which we can only get together a few times a year if that. It was so delicious and such a great environment, that my friends husbands were messaging to check and make sure their wives were ok and dropping a pin location of their home incase we were lost or forgot to come home. Lol. ( yes, they still love us) delicious food and great atmosphere.

I came here before a work meeting and this place was highly recommended by a coworker of mine. There are some amazing eats here! I was able to enjoy a nice drink, some appetizers, and a nice entree! Overall a super fun time here and the food was excellent too. Hoping to come back again! It was so good I forgot to post photos!

I've heard nothing but good things about Sacred Pepper so I went on a week night with coworkers. The Lavender Dream cocktail was delicious; would totally order that again. We ordered the crab cakes as an appetizer and I must say the crab cakes are a must! The only criticism is they don't give you enough of that delicious aioli. I had the crab crusted shrimp skewer. It was pretty basic; I wouldn't order it again. My coworker ordered the chicken burrata. Being that it's chicken at a restaurant I had low expectations for it, but boy, was I shocked! That might be the best grilled chicken I've had-so moist and flavorful My other coworker ordered the pan seared grouper and I was very disappointed at how dry it was. Although there were some misses, there were also some hits. My experience was good enough to go back to try other menu items. I do appreciate that I don't have to go all the way into downtown Tampa for a "fancier" restaurant.
I have been to sacred pepper several times for birthdays and anniversaries and the Food is always amazing as well as the ambiance. I recommend Rockefeller oysters.

Fabulous meal and atmosphere !  Chelsea was super sweet and all the guys were so nice as well.   The food is so exquisitely prepared and cocktails were great too.   Made for a wonderful 80th Birthday celebration for my mom !  Look forward to coming back !
Always excellent! We absolutely love the pistachio crusted fried Brie appetizer... Delicious! Drinks are tasty also, smoked old fashioned is so good!

Wow is the best way to describe this place!  The food was excellent, portions are large, the service was fantastic and the music and atmosphere were also great!  We went to celebrate a birthday and will be going back very soon.  The appetizers (shashito peppers and cheese fries), main courses ( filet, shrimp fra diavalo, chicken parm and lobster&crab stuffed pasta), sides (Brussel sprouts, mac&cheese and creamed corn) and dessert (berry shortcake) were all delicious!

Go here as soon as you can get a reservation!

Celebrating my parents 50th wedding anniversary dinner at Sacred Pepper was a success. I chose this restaurant because of its elegance and sophistication. The decor is beautiful and has the fancier and fine dining feel. 

Our server Lauren was great.  She was very attentive to our table and even gave us a complimentary dessert for the special couple. 

My whole family was impressed with their entrees and loved the ambiance. 

Thank you for making this milestone anniversary for my parents a moment to remember.

OMG....why was this my first time here & its in my neighborhood....this place is breath taking & definitely a good sexy romantic date night spot.I went with my neighborhood & the food & drinks were absolutely delicious.

business.name: Tashan
business.categories: Asian Fusion, Indian, Modern European, Restaurants, Vegetarian

reviews.text: The ambiance & food was great. My husband & I enjoyed the butter chicken and biryani. Great choices. Aside from our inattentive waiter, the extremely warm temp inside, and having to ask multiple times for things....it was still a great experience and we will be back.

My experience with Tashan was not a memorable one.... Inspite of asking if we were late when we stepped in at 8pm, they assured they are capable to serve within an hr and there would be no room of asking more. However it was realized they started closing the counter 15 mins early and hence weren't repeated the last few courses. The proce is too exorbitant for the food being served, so am pretty sure this food joint is not going to be much talked about in future and its days are numbered. Seriously disappointed at the behavior of the manager as they made no effort in compensating.

Its sad that a decent restaurant gets 1 star because of the poor customer service. I went to Tashan with my wife on our anniversary and ordered butter chicken and lamb shanks. Butter chicken was nice but stay away from the lamb shanks. Lamb is very tender but is tasteless and bland. I ordered an extra lacha paratha and it took 15 -20 mins for it to get delivered, by that time the chicken and lamb was cold. The waiter was arrogant about the whole thing and rather than being apologetic, further refused to reheat the chicken and lamb. Later he just threw the bill on our table and left. Its a shame that a restaurant suffers not because of the food but because of the arrogant waiters. Stay away......

I must admit, I am not a huge fan of Indian cuisine but I went here with a friend for restaurant week and was pleasantly surprised. The decor is rich and vibrant in dark hues and tones. There was subtle, relaxing and calming music being played throughout the time there.

The flavors were discrete yet bold. Nothing was overpowering or over seasoned. I enjoyed being able to look into the kitchen area and see the staff prepare your food. The hostess was very friendly and the wait staff was extremely accommodating and attentive. 

I loved the naan! I am a bread lover, so I was overjoyed when hot, fresh naan bread was brought to the table. The food was excellent and everything was delicious.

My favorite place in Philly!!! You MUST get the tasting menu and you can tell them things that sound good to you!! Soooooo yummy!!!!! My fav is their fried spinach salad, it's amazing, and the cauliflower and of course their curries!!!

Ok so Tashan I am disappointed 
The food was not bad.... but it was not great
I was disappointed!!! Don't think I will be back

Went during restaurant week which they have a great menu for.  I will definitely be coming back here.  It seemed they were very short staffed the day I went, but the two servers there handled it so well.  Yes, we had to wait a bit for our drinks and our order to go in, but the food was hot when we got it and the servers were so kind and thankful that we were patient.  Very well done.  I'd love to come in during normal hours and see what it's like.

My first time, with the  Restaurant week multi-course menu -- the friend who brought me was right, it's super food, with a good fusion edge to some of the Indian-based menu. This is a restaurant, not  a curry house! Service kind and polite, ambiance pleasing in my view, i'll be back and bring people for sure.

No exaggeration the absolute worst service I've ever had in my life. Let me preface this by saying I waitressed and bartended for nearly a decade and I've complained at a restaurant only one other time and I have NEVER left less than 10% as a tip as a result of having done their job and knowing how hard it really can be. Tonight I broke both of those rules because I could not believe what was happening. 

We arrived for our 7:30 reservations and were seated promptly. There were two other tables in the restaurant, our server Randall (tall,Lurch looking guy) and another gentleman in a vest and bow tie for front of the house staff. First we were left to sit for an excessively long time waiting to order. Randall was seemingly annoyed with his job and was unable to hide his displeasure while waiting on our table. I ordered a glass of wine and that was met with a scoff, I was sort of surprised at first considering we were one of three tables in the restaurant. I was willing to over look it...and it all went down hill from there. We waited a long time to place our order and when we did he did the absolute bare minimum in terms of interaction with us...as in he stood there and we ordered. He didn't even speak to us, it was so strange. Our first two courses came out and then we waited nearly 30 minutes for our third (main) course. All the while we haven't seen Randall again, the kitchen runners were delivering our food (very pleasant btw). After finishing our third course the restaurant started to pick up. We sat and watched Randall approach and wait on several other tables. Nearly 20 minutes passed after we had finished eating our third course and he failed to stop at our table a single time despite the fact that neither of us had touched any more of our food. It was so incredibly strange. We finally stopped him after he attended to the table immediately behind ours as he was walking by still completely ignoring us. We asked to place our dessert order, again not saying anything he stared at us blankly while we ordered. He did come back with spoons, which he placed on the table beside all of our finished plates. At this point it took everything I had not to ask him what his problem was but I refrained. He continued to wait on other tables while leaving all of the dinner dishes on our table when he finally came over to take them. I specifically looked directly at him and said thank you. He did not look at me and again did not say a word. It was the strangest and rudest dining experience I have ever had in my life and I can't even begin to understand why. We ate our dessert and again had to ask for our check. He dropped it off and eventually forced my dining mate to approach him at the computer to ask him to run the card because it had now been 2.5 hours since we sat down despite other tables coming and going. After paying the bill lest anyone think we were trying to get something for free (you see it all when you serve tables) we asked to speak to the man in the vest and explained what had happened, although apologetic I can say w/o a doubt we will not return. 

The service was so bad that I am very sincerely contemplating calling the manager tomorrow to follow up because I can't imagine they run their restaurant like this on the regular. Atrocious service completely ruined the experience. 

The bathroom was filthy, I went three different times (2.5 hours there) in three different stalls. Not a one had toilet paper. Also, several of the faucets I approached were broken. 

The food was average overall. 

First Course: Mulligatawny Soup (grainy texture, well seasoned, overall decent) and Samosa Chaat (average)

Second Course: Naga Beef Sumi (delicious, well cooked and the peanut-cucumber relish was delicious) Gobhi Manchurian (normally one of my favorite Indian fares, disgusting. It was like vegetarian chicken wings doused in bar b que sauce. Do not recommend) 

Third Course: Old Delhi Butter Chicken (perfectly cooked and very well seasoned sauce. One of the better I've had) Lamb Vindaloo (good, exactly as expected, perfectly average, Lamb was tough)

Fourth Course: Tashan Crème Brulee (Not even a Brulee fan, and this was amazing! Its the only thing about the place that lives up to the hype) Spiced Molten Chocolate Cake (my dining partner nailed it when he described it as a stale Little Debbie)

Ok so Tashan I am disappointed 
The food was not bad.... but it was not great!!! Decor and bathroom are amazing 
Our server was excellent "Jason" I think... 
the presentation of the each dish was on point. But the authentic taste of Indian cuisine was just not there!!! And for a Friday night is was very empty 
Oh but Tashan your signature desert made me give u the 3rd star

The food was good, but at this price point, I expected a lot more. The butter chicken and wagyu beefs were both delicious, but the meal was let down by an average biryani and subpar chicken kebabs. 

The ambiance is also just not that great - the tables are oddly sized that make your fellow diners seem miles away. The restaurant is also really dark - if you are in a group, you'll be seated in these dark alcoves that while I'm sure are lovely at night, just don't feel right when the big bay windows across the room are still letting light in at 7pm on a summer night. 

Our waitress seemed quite confused by the menu, especially when we asked her for clarification on certain dishes. 

Again, the food is good! I just wouldn't pay "$$$" for it. Travel a few blocks north and go to Indeblue instead - better food, cheaper price.

Seriously... this place makes me so sad. Charging an arm and a leg for mediocre food is the worst. At least if the food was good then i could somehow justify the prices. It's bland and the portions are for a 2 yr old. 

I've ordered to-go from here and the biyriani was awful. huge pieces of meat and bland rice. Naan is $6 for ONE PIECE. uh what? The service is sub-par... when i went to pick up my food it wasnt even in the computer which means i had to wait another 20 minutes for it. 

the other time i went was for restaurant week. I really wanted to like this place. i thought 'hey maybe my last experience was just that one time?" nope. i was wrong. the service was awful again. food awful again. and the dessert 'molten lava cake' was an ice cold brick! smh... sad times for a place with prime real-estate on Broad St. 

never again. If i want amazing indian food i'll go to Karma (on 2nd st in Old CIty) or Saffron (on Walnut b/w 12th n 13th)

We went here for a bite to eat during their happy hour post-Center City Sips. The host / waiting staff who served as were incredibly professional and almost too accommodating. The cocktails we drank were all excellent and something I would expect at a much more expensive / higher quality place such as Franklin Mortgage Company. We had the Bhal, Chaat, GOC Naan, and the Green Tikka. The Bhal and Chaat are amazing and the other two are pretty good -- though I felt the portion size on the Tikka was a little small. I will definitely come back next time in town, and I highly recommend Tashan for both happy hour and normally.

An update to my previous review, still my favorite indian food in the city. Also, they have a happy hour every week day 5 to 7 and a late night happy hour on food and drinks. Spinach Chaat, GOC Naan, Butter Chicken and Lamb Rogan Gosh are my favorite. It's my home away from home. Thank the lord for this place, possibly the only indian restaurant in Philly that can come close to eating in India.

I came here with a living social or groupon, one of those promos. We got the vegetarian chefs tasting menu because I'm not adventurous with my meat so it wouldn't be worth it. 
The chefs tasting menu was 100% worth it. Every single item that came out was delicious. 
My favorite was the spinach/kale chaat. Perfect amount of masala and crispness. Well done chef. 
My breath was kicking because the naan was stuffed with fresh garlic, but I could eat it everyday. It was soft, perfectly tore apart and the flavor was on point. 
Most of the paneer curries were typical cream based things. Nothing out of the ordinary. 
I also had the mango lassi, it was the perfect proportion of mango and yogurt.. Not too sweet either. 
The coolest part? The fusion dessert of gulab jamun and creme brûlée. Weird? Yes. Delicious? Absolutely. 
The only reason I gave this place 4 stars because it's super pricy. The food was definitely different from typical indian food, but I don't know if I would come back without another deal.
Love this place thanks to the great food and fabulous service by Anthony! I'm definitely returning!

So I read the review on Google and also here on Yelp. I had no expectations because of that. I mean the bar was set so low...it was pretty much in the ground. I read or poor servers, bad drinks, and little portions.

How misinformed I was...

I went in early May 2015 and not only did the wait staff know every ingredient to their dishes but they gave a healthy and safe alternative when one of our friends told him he had a nut allergy. 

The drinks are fast and great tasting. (Don't drink to much, this is a classy place and being piss drunk is apparently frowned at there). The food comes out as soon as it's done so everything is always hot and steaming. The wait staff will tell you the intensity of spices and ingredients of ever plate. The naan is out of this world. We also used their car parking service and it's about 10 bucks well spent, especially in center city.

Bottom line, you'll see a love it or hate it polarized view in ever restaurant but this place is great. The food is made on the spot, it's designed to be shared as a family meal not as one dish per person, and you are always made to be the most important thing to that particular server. 

I will definitely return again and again.

Food:
I went here and ordered a ton of different dishes because I was eager to test a variety of food.  All tasted good except the wagyu beef.  The wagyu beef was burnt to a crisp.

Price:
The pricing was unfavorable.  The menu has a lot of small plates which add up to be a very expensive meal.  For example the crab cake appetizer was $14 and it's really only enough for one person as an appetizer.  Additionally, I went here on a Sunday and upon going inside they have a list of daily specials, Sunday's special is "Industry Night, 20% off your entire bill".  I thought this meant I'd get 20% off but I was unpleasantly surprised when I got the check and the server told me only people who work in the restaurant industry get 20% off.  Their sign is very misleading.

Service/Ambiance:
The ambiance is fancy and nice.  However, the place was very empty.  Somehow even though there were only 5 parties in the restaurant in total, they managed to forget 1) my beer, and 2) my butter chicken entree.  The server actually came to the table and asked if we were ready to go and I had to remind him that I hadn't received my entree yet.  It also took forever to get the check.

In summary, I think this could be a better place if they'd simply lower the prices.  Paying premium center city prices for an understaffed Indian restaurant is ridiculous.
Love the food and decor. Wish I could afford eating here everyday. Wish they had a better location as well. It's kinda in a deserted area!

The service was not worth the price you pay for! Clearly overpriced and more importantly we encountered a strange experience! The restaurant closes at 10 pm, we knew we were late when we stepped in at 9pm but asked upfront if it was too late for the chef's special.
