Initially they greeted us in to get the guests, but the chefs stopped cooking 15 mins prior to close of business. Meanwhile we requested for a second serving of lamb chops and even the server was nice enough to entertain our request. But the chef declined upfront and backed by the manager, they rejected our request! I felt it too rude and this one experience will turn me & my friends away forever! None of the dishes were out of the world and even the portions served were scanty, so by all means I can give it only 1 star for the ambience. Horrible service and mediocre food!

Previous 5 star rating reduced to 1 star after 3 experiences. 
1st experience - Valentine's day weekend - great ambience distracted me throughout the night, 'ok-ish' service, food was sub-par at best. 
2nd experience - Easter weekend - "chef tasting" menu aka cold buffet.... disgraceful, completely ruined my experience and the Indian food culture. Samosa with barbecue sauce.. really? who the f*** has barbecue sauce to go along with samosas? Clearly NOT an Indian authentic chef cooking
3rd experience - Invited back for a complimentary dinner (biggest mistake of my life) since we posted a crappy review on Yelp and the manager at Tashan begged us to take it down and invited us back. We decided to give it just one more chance. That is a choice I will regret for the rest of my life. The service was absolutely horrendous, food was way below average. I'm not sure what they did to that kobe beef but I know that was not kobe beef. This is definitely not Indian food. This is not even imitation of Indian food. This is whacko. It is sorta Indian-Chinese food with a half-hearted French inspired plating whatever the heck that means. 
As a recommendation, IndeBlue is far more superior in it's food and menu (10 times better than Tashan !!!)  and I can't wait to go back there again to get rid of the Tashan in my mouth. Don't blow up your money, you will be sorry just like us who literally ran out the door.

TASHAN CAN KISS MY REAR END, GOODBYE FOREVER. Try offering a free meal again and I'll tell him to shove it where the sun don't shine.

I heard a lot of good reviews about tashan and I had to make a point to go visit it, as so far Philadelphias Indian cuisine has been a happy surprise. But tashan was a big disappointment.

I ordered the green chicken tikka and plain naan to share for two. The naan was extremely dry and unimpressive. The chicken tikka,although cooked extremely well,lacked any taste to it, it was very bland and the only taste to it was from the chutney sauce it was placed upon,which was awfully sweet. The side of salad also had a very unappetizing bitter after taste to it. The food was quite unappealing.

The wine list was also disappointing, their best being the primitivo,at best being a mediocre wine. Their liquors were sparse and did not do the ambience justice. 

The interior was very pleasant and the service was great, they tried to accommodate us as best as possible and even allowed us to taste some wines before we got them. Alas, the quality of the food was not enough to override the pleasant restaurant vibe.

Overall, I was very disappointed and am sure that there are many other Indian restaurants to go to that are worth the price here in Philadelphia.

This was our second visit.  First time a year or two ago on a Groupon we did the chef's tasting menu and loved it.  So it stuck in our minds and we came back recently for a replay at full price for a birthday dinner.  With tax and tip, a $150 meal for two for Indian food in Philly.  That's a pretty high bar to rise to.  That's like 15 buffet lunches in West Philly!  That's like dinner for 4-6 people at any of the more upscale places.  So it better be pretty spectacular,  And I have to say, at full price, I was a little disappointed.  First of all the menu has not changed at all from our last visit, and it's pretty small- especially for vegetarian offerings. So we were eating most of the same food.  Secondly, not all dishes are all that creative or interesting.  The entrees in fact were competently typical American Indian restaurant fare, palak paneer and butter chicken (which an Indian friend told me is more British than Indian) and completely skippable.  The small plates were very nice as before, creative and tangy and just the right level of spice. But they were identical to before.  The goat cheese pastry thing was tasty but not the slightest bit Indian, and not as good as what I've had in French places .The rice was dry and the bread was boring.  Last time they had given us two beautiful stuffed nan choices.  This time it was one plain nan and one garlic nan, neither of which I can get excited about (especially for a $150 dinner) and neither of which was among the best I've had.  Gulab jamon-creme brulee fusion dessert was indeed brilliant and tasty and unique and I enjoyed it- but again exactly same as before.  We did get a few new things this time as my wife is a carnivore and we ordered one veg and one non-veg tasting menu, and she reported that the lamb chops were good and salmon mediocre.  But all in all it seems that we simply got fewer food choices by splitting it up between veg and non veg.  So, in the end, maybe if this had been a half-price Groupon I could have enjoyed it more or seen better value.  As is, I am giving my rating on the quality and variety of food for the full price charged, hence the 3 stars.  I don't think we'll be craving this place or rushing back any more.  And if we do, we are done with the overpriced tasting menus and would stick to ordering a number of small plates and not bother with the entrees.  It's still good and creative place but with so many good Indian restaurants (or chathouses serving interesting small dishes for only a few bucks apiece) in and around Philly I would go elsewhere.

Would probably be a 3.5 in my books. The ambiance here is cute-- definitely looks like a slightly more upscale Indian restaurant (especially as compared to the ones I'm used to in University City). That being said, the prices definitely reflect that. Make sure you know that Tashan is Indian small plates style dining-- portion sizes are relatively small, and thus they recommend doubling your typical order size. Thus, you have to be okay with family style dining here to really experience the variety and quality of the food.

The dishes we get were all done well-- the flavors and seasoning were on point, and we got to try a variety of rice dishes, curries, and bread dishes as well. Some of my favorites were definitely the Gobi Manchurian, Old Delhi Butter Chicken, Paneer Lababdar, and Kale Saag Paneer. 

Overall-- cute setting, good service, good quality food (but nothing STANDOUT). Be prepared to spend a little more than what you bargained for, and to not be extremely full after your meal! Would probably return if I was looking for a trendier Indian restaurant to take people to.

This place has been on my list for quite a while. I went with my roommates for a mid week happy hour. The drink specials were great- half priced everything. Although I was a little disappointed they didn't have any food specials. We ordered anyway, and split Palak Chaat (baby spinach, yogurt, pomegranate dressing), GOC (garlic, red onion, cilantro) naan, and the Old Delhi Butter Chicken. My disappointment immediately faded. Everything was melt in your mouth, absolutely delicious- bursting with flavor. To give you an idea of how good it was, we ate all the chicken and (pathetically?) asked for a box to take home the leftover sauce. I want to go back tomorrow and try everything else on the menu. Go, now!

business.name: Ocean Prime
business.categories: Cocktail Bars, American (New), Bars, Restaurants, Steakhouses, Seafood, Nightlife

reviews.text: The dining experiences here were excellent. The food was great, service at table was great! I had steak that was cooked to the perfection. I had lobster that was seasoned well to where you didn't even need butter. The only issue I had was with the valet parking! they left us sitting in our car for 15 minutes and charged me seven dollars extra when my Kia Sorento is a normal size vehicle and is charged as a car anywhere else.
Went with my wife and we absolutely loved it there the atmosphere to the food were perfect and our waitress was great! Would definitely go back there!

If I Could Give Half To No Stars I Would...


To Begin The Shenanigans Me And My Party That I Arrived With Made It On Time, But Our Table Wasn't Ready Until 45 Minutes AFTER The Time We Had Scheduled. Mind You This Is For A Birthday Party That Was Suppose To Host 23 Guests. We Made Reservations For A Private Dining Hall But They Put Us In A Public Section Anyways. Strike One . We Finally Make It To Our Seats And We Receive Bread For The Party That's Gone In A Few Seconds And We Order Our Drinks. We Didn't Get Our Drinks Until 30 To 45 Minutes After We Order Them. The Bread That Was Suppose To Come Around Didn't Come Around After The Second Time Of Receiving Bread Which That Was Also Very Late. At This Point Everyone Is Just Waiting On The Food We Order. The Food We Order Was On A Pre-Fixed Menu So There Weren't A Crazy Selection Of Food That We Ordered But Yet The Food Took 2 To 2 And A Half Hours. We Arrived At 7 Didn't Get Seated Til 730-745 Ish And Didn't Receive Our Entrees Until Approximately 10 pm. At This Point Everyone Was Tired And Ready To Go. The Food Was Horrible Too And Came Out Cold. Strike Two . The Last Thing I Will Add Is That Nothing Was Taking Off The Bill After Numerous Complaints And Times Talked To The Manager. That Was My First Time Going Definitely Will Be My Last Time Going To Such An Establishment. I Would Like To Reiterate That I Would Give 0 STARS If Possible.

I haven't been here in a while and I liked it from my last visit (years ago). However, the wait time was long for everything. I made reservations for 7:45 on a Saturday and we were seated 20 min later (even though we arrived on time. Our waiter did not arrive for about 15 min after we were seated. The food was good but the wait times were not. I guess I have to get used to the fact that covid may be the cause (wasn't the first restaurant that had this issue). I would go again, but on a weekday.
Absolute best entree I have had in years.  The blackened cod special was superb.  The sauce was flavorful without overwhelming the fish.  The butter cake was a ending to an incredible meal

Yum! Such an excellent meal. I came here for my birthday and couldn't have been more satisfied. Since it's both a steak and seafood house, there are a lot of good options if you're not a big steak person. I made my own surf n turf by ordering a prime rib and a lobster off of the menu. If you do the same, come with an empty stomach and go light on the bread because the steak and lobster are filling! The prime rib was perfectly salted with the ideal amount of fat. The lobster was also absolutely perfect. 

Drinks wise, I would recommend the berries and bubbles just for the novelty of seeing vapor come out of your drink.

Great food, great service, and great ambiance!

Ocean Prime is absolutely fabulous!  The food is delicious and the ambiance is wonderful.  I had the pleasure of meeting Amer, who took care of my family and me on Sunday.  He misses NOTHING!  He provided the most amazing dining experience and was so friendly and helpful.  His menu recommendations were spot on!  We also we met Julie, the manager of the restaurant when we dined.  She was so affable and cordial.  All of the staff were truly top-notch.

If you are ever in Philadelphia, this is a fantastic place to dine!

This place is worth ALL the hype. To start the interior design is beautiful. At the bar they serve free popcorn with drinks that is so good it must be infused with crack. (Just kidding, it's truffle oil, salt, and parsley). They also serve free bread baskets WITH PRETZELS!!! Amazing. The pretzels had a crisp bite to them but a soft interior. I could easily cut it open with a butter knife. My friend got the fish special but I ordered the 8 oz filet rare (cooked PERFECTLY) with truffle butter and a lobster tail. I ate every single bite. We also got the creamed spinach with bacon as a side which was really good and more than enough for two people. I also ordered Prosecco during dinner which was great and a chocolatini for dessert. I did order one glass of Sauvignon blanc which I didn't like but the waiter was happy to exchange it for me. The service was amazing! Big props to all the employees! Thank you so much for this awesome experience!

Husband and I were on first date night in 2 years. Was very excited to try this place. He ordered the Chilean sea bass, I ordered the scallops. His sea bass was raw in the middle, like still 1/3 translucent pinkish. My scallops were so disgusting tasting. Im not sure if they were rotten or cooked in a strange oil but they were completely inedible. We are not complaining types but was so shocking that we BOTH had issues with our orders. Reported to manager who remove them from the bill. The point is, we left hungry and sceptical that a $$$$ establishment will serve this to any customers at all.
 I would LOVE to hear what the chef was thinking while preparing our meals...

Met all my expectations!
Celebrated passing the bar exam with a delicious dinner at Ocean Prime.  Per the recommendations below, we went with the spicy tuna roll over the ocean prime roll and it did not disappoint. The tuna was so fresh and the tempura was lightly battered. Then, we tried the east coast special oysters from Virginia. For our entrees, I got the Chilean sea bass which is a best seller and now I know why. My boyfriend got the filet mignon with truffle butter and he said it literally cut like butter and was juicy and tender. Last, we spared some room for the 10 layer carrot cake which was so decadent and rich. 

Overall, it was a great experience for a special occasion! The menu is pricey which is why I will categorize this as a "special occasion" spot. Highly recommend!

One of my favorite places to dine. 

Parking: street, lot or valet

Atmosphere: comfy with low lighting

Service: Every server I have encountered is so nice and helpful with assisting with food and beverage selections. 

Food: Every meal I have had was delicious and cooked just right.  From their crab cakes, lamb chops, teriyaki salmon, Point Judith calamari, asparagus and roasted Brussels sprouts your tastebuds will be satisfied with great flavor. 

I like to go here for their happy hour. My favorite drink is the berries & bubbles! Delightful!

They also offer private dinning. 

Enjoy!

Some of the best calamari I've ever had! As for th steak, it was bland and needed more seasoning. I also tried the teriyaki salmon which was very delicious. I probably won't visit again, considering it's a fine dining restaurant  with fine dining prices, but the food was not to that expectation.

I have been wanting to try this place for awhile & finally had the chance. The only negative about my experience was how slow the service was and there were missing items in my order. Maybe b/c of short staff or Covid but the place was only opened for 4 hours this night. All the food ordered was great and when it did arrive the presentation was perfect. My favorite was the potatoes & the dynamite sushi. A good spot but because of service I will choose another restaurant next time.

Price: 2
Flavor: 5
Variety: 5
Ambience: 5
Service: 5

Amazing, simply done to perfection. I joined a group and we ordered appetizers (sushi and oysters), steaks and sides. Everything was delicious. 10oz filet was tender, well seasoned and flavorful. The 34oz ribeye was bananas. You could share between 3 people,but it was a little less than they wanted for the 3 male carnivores who ordered it. All steaks need to have accompaniments, or side dishes. We ordered truffled Mac and cheese (5*), mushrooms (5*), asparagus (4*), Brussels sprouts (5*), and garlic mashed potatoes (5*). The wine selection was ample and great.

The ambience of the restaurant was very nice the staff was very welcoming and our service was great. The only thing that I have an issue with the price of the food. The salmon was very very distasteful the chilled crab meat had no flavor and my steak was a little tough and small for $60. The drinks was wonderful and the dessert was very delicious. If you're coming for drinks and dessert a perfect atmosphere. The restaurant/chef needs to work more on the food for the price. I should have gone to Outback Steakhouse house if I wanted a good meal.

Second time here.  First time was right before Covid shut down.  Another excellent experience.  Adamor our server was excellent and allowed for a relaxing celebration.  The food was outstanding.  The twin lobster tails were delicious as was the 10oz filet cooked a perfect medium.  The other entree was the king salmon.  Started with calamari which was excellent and highly recommend.  It had a sweet Thai chili sauce.  The the spice was very tolerable.  Finished with the signature carrot cake and a chocolate cake which were both excellent and would get again.  Overall great experience.  This is a great special occasion place
Very good but very pricey and everybody was very nice Our waitress was amazing to the bartender service waiting for a table would  go again

Celebrated my big bday here 2 weeks ago and boy, did I pick the right place. Not sure if the reason we have a separate, more intimate room bc I put "bday celebration" on my reservation or it was my lucky day, i absolutely loved it and we also had a spectacular and attentive waiter so that adds on to my first time experience.

We started off with east coast oysters; they were fresh & tasty. Lobster bisque was good but I personally didn't like the chalk-like after taste- not that I have tasted chalk before but let's just say it wasn't too pleasing for my palate. We had the surf n turf and baybeeeee when I  say that short rib was moist, it was melts in your mouth.  And oh the scallops were delicious as well. We had some sushi, it was good but nothing out of the ordinary.

Onto the main dishes. The bday girl (me) had the Twin Lobster and pheww juicy, tender, and sweet. Ribeye was on point on the temperature-redish pink inside and good seasoning. The chilean bass was good and salmon had good flavor but a little dry imo. We ended the night with Creme Brulee- my fav dessert and it was a good finisher, nothing out of the ordinary, but i likes.

Overall, this was the perfect restaurant to celebrate my big day as long as I didnt have to look at the bill ‍
Happy eating!

On the "Good-Meh-Suck" scale, this was a "Solid Good". It was a business dinner during the week but it was fairly busy. Service was fine regardless.

The Caesar salad was very good as was the seafood special. The steaks were excellent also. It is a chain but they do it well. No complaints.  I will come there again!

Food was really good! We were celebrating our one year anniversary! We felt super special and enjoyed our experience. Love the location in Miami. Philly is just as great!!!! Definitely coming back! Such a great atmosphere

Even though this is a chain, for the price you pay I was expecting way better of an experience. The inside of the restaurant and the bar area are beautiful so my expectations were for a super dinner. We were seated and server came over quickly and offered us drinks and they came out quick.  The bubbles drink is Deff interesting to watch and tastes yummy but after having two of them can't say I felt much off a buzz.. Moving onto the food- we got some oysters and the sautéed shrimp. They were good but nothing out of the ordinary. I also got an ocean sushi roll. The fish was fresh but the avacado inside the roll was still hard. For entrees we got the crab cakes and filet cooked medium  with shrimp scampi added on and the tater tot sides and a side of garlic mashed. The crab cakes tasted like a frozen crab cake cooked at home with no taste. I took two bites and sent it back. The filet was burnt on the outside... not something I'm used to for a steak cooked medium. Shrimp scampi was super lacking in garlic flavor and was rubbery. The server did take off the crab cakes, but we will not be returning.

Great evening for our anniversary. Sara gets major kudos from the reservations to accepting the flower delivery the day of. Arrived a little early and waited less than five minutes to be seated. The table was set with the flowers I had delivered. Waiter Adhemar was a superstar. The drinks Black Orchid and the Old Fashion were superb. We had the Port Judith Calamari and the Ahi Tuna Sushi Roll was delish. The Riesling was fruity and delicious. We decide to go with the Halibut special with fingerling potatoes, corn relish, asparagus and cherry tomatoes. This is we're the meal went left. The entire dish was extremely under seasoned. The Halibut was over cooked and dry. The corn relish broth was tasteless and in my dish I had one cherry tomato (cut in half). We did not complain as we were in our own world celebrating our anniversary. But unfortunately we will not return. Nice atmosphere, decor and a very attentive and friendly waitstaff but the main course being a special lacked attention and Love. The three stars are awarded to the Sara, Adhemar and the waitstaff.

This is not a revenge review: I was treated fine as a walk-in to the bar. Nothing "happened". I was admittedly in a bad mood. But that meant I was willing to spend a lot of money to feel better. Nothing was off the table. But I had had mediocre experiences before (see earlier reviews). So I ordered cautiously. When I was presented with a happy hour menu (though the server was careful to tell me, I had missed the happy hour) and it was sticky, the music was "Muzak inner city edition", and the restaurant was practically deserted, I should have taken the hint. I had cocktails (fine) and I ordered calamari. What could go wrong? Seriously that was the worst fried calamari I have ever had. Gloppy sauce. Unfresh tough calamari. Truly awful. And that is a $21 dish!
 
Ok but I was still hoping for something to save the day. I ordered the chicken how can THAT go wrong? Oops. Chicken in a fancy restaurant is supposed to check off certain boxes unfortunately this one checked off the wrong boxes. Appearance ugly, flavor barely above grocery store chicken. It was something my mother packed for lunch not a glamorous take on roasted chicken like it was supposed to be. $34.

Years ago I tried this resto and was stunned by its mediocrity. It's gotten worse. I would urge anyone eager for a special night out to skip this place. I am VERY suspicious that the five star reviews for this place might be all shills. And I have never felt that way before.

Let me preface my 2 star review by saying, our waiters and the managers were PHENOMENAL and why I gave the 2 stars. Now, I don't understand the hype. The food was horrible, my date ordered a steak and I ordered the lamb chops, ordered both medium well and both came out super rare. They put his steak back on the grill instead of preparing a new one (yuck) and the chops came back burned. I hate sending food back or complaining but this meal was unacceptable, especially for the price. Both proteins lacked flavor and salt. The truffle Mac was bland, with some watery cheese sauce pooled at the bottom of the dish. The asparagus was ok at best.  My date enjoyed his drinks from the bar but we won't be returning.
The ambiance in itself is worth it.  Food was decent.  One of the better seafood spots in Philly.

business.name: Vic Sushi Bar
business.categories: Japanese, Sushi Bars, Restaurants

reviews.text: Always have a great experience here. Not much seating, so if you have a bigger group order takeout. The fish is always fresh and service is prompt!

My favorite sushi place in the city. We order it about once a week... usually their 3 rolls special for $12. Can't beat that. Super quick gets to us in about 15 minutes each time and reasonable. Amazing place.

We've been ordering from Vic for years, delivery only. They are fairly consistent, sometimes their rolls can be a bit sloppy and I wish there were a bit more rice on the nigiri but it's an excellent deal, the fish is fresh if not quite at the level of more upscale places but I never worry about the safety. We love the yellowtail scallion hand rolls and the prices are excellent. The delivery is very fast.

Good fresh quality for price!

A friend recommended the sushi from here and it didn't disappoint. They let us swap out a roll and pay for the difference so that was satisfactory.

Delivery was free on $15+ orders, and I paid with card over the phone (charged tip right then and there). They call you when the driver is outside which is nice especially if you live in a building where food orders aren't allowed to be brought directly to your door.

It was just a good platter of sushi! Felt like a comfortable version of sushi buffet for 2 at home.

I love coming here. Definitely my cheap go to place for decent quality sushi. Their lunch deals are worth it and they are BYOB too. Tea and water are self serve on the side. Can get packed sometimes due to limited seating.

This is the best value sushi I've had in Philly. My friends and I each got the three roll special which came out to be 24 rolls each. 

I got the spicy tuna, alaska (salmon + avocado), and eel. All of my rolls tasted very fresh and had a lot of flavor. I did like the spicy salmon roll my friend got more than the spicy tuna but I tend to like salmon more than tuna anyway. They also give you hot water for green tea which is nice. 

Overall the sushi is great at the price point and the service is very friendly. Will definitely be returning.
This is literally such a diamond spot in this city. I do takeout here like 3 nights a week... SO yummy, such a great price, and quality delicious food.

This is my go-to spot for sushi in Philadelphia! For the price, it's impossible to beat. As of October 2021, you can order the 3 Roll Special (anytime - including for dinner) for $12.75, which comes with 24 pieces of sushi. This would easily be $20+ in almost every other restaurant. Oh, and they do free delivery for any order $15+ (but don't forget to tip the deliverer)!

To be honest, the taste of Vic's isn't on par with any high-end, mind blowing sushi restaurants out there. But if you're craving sushi and don't want to break the bank doing so, Vic's is hands down the best spot in Philadelphia. They'll be ready in 20 minutes if you call ahead for pickup. I usually get the spicy salmon, spicy tuna, and alaska roll (salmon avocado). It's exactly what you'd expect from a mid-priced sushi establishment.

Solid, locally owned spot with a killer three roll special deal.

Whenever you want sushi but don't want to break the bank getting it, Vic's is where to go. I've tried their spicy salmon, spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, Alaska (salmon and avocado), and regular salmon and tuna rolls and everything has been fresh and fantastic. They're fast and usually have everything ready for you in 20 minutes or less.

Limited indoor seating because it's a small place but great for pickup! No frills, clean, fresh, fast sushi.

One of my absolute favorite affordable sushi joints. I came here recently with my partner and we sat down in the very small space! Think mom and pop shop. You can fit maybe five or so patrons indoors at the counter but most people do takeout.


On this night it was busy but still a cozy atmosphere. The staff chat with you and even joked about us finishing our food when they saw how much we ordered. We got an assortment of the very bang for your buck three roll special! Salmon, white tuna, shrimp tempura and eel, along with salmon nigiri, a lucky roll, and a spider roll. Even just the three roll special can be filling if you weren't starving and walking around the city like we had! There's fresh tea for you to drink and grab yourself for the meal, as well.

Overall the flavors were good and tasted fresh, and I'll be back again soon to eat more!
Excellent for the $$. Obviously not the best, but the prices are very very reasonable. The venue is small ~10 people and byob, which is perfect for intimate meal.

Totally unassuming and wonderful. Small inside with only a sushi bar that can hold about 10 people (side by side), so either come early or order take away. 
Wide variety of rolls, plus great quality that won't break the bank. Highly recommend and can't wait to come back.

I wasn't feeling great but I was just there for my sister's wedding. I walked in and the first thing I notice was older woman which I assume was her child helping at the counter. As trying to order I notice she is placing objects near her reach in her mouth. No mask whatsoever.

Walked back to the hotel initially they looked well portioned (I believe 16 pieces) which was for what I paid for until I looked closer. I ordered 2 eel and avocado rolls and one shrimp tempura. Instead I received 1 eel and avocado, one cucumber and avocado, and the shrimp Tempura barely had any shrimp in then. The seaweed salad wasn't great, but it wasn't bad either.

I could notice that the rolls were rushed because most of them fell apart and you could neither use chopsticks to actually eat them or anything else besides placing it into one container and almost have to shovel into my mouth. I do appreciate the 4 mini containers of soy-soy even I asked for one one. It bothered me to the point where I just threw a lot of it in the garbage. No point in returning it because the walk was a bit over a mile and for what reason?

Vic Sushi is on my list for places to avoid. Overall, while the amount provided was generous, they were clearly made in a rushed manner . For at least, this is absolutely a place to avoid if you some sushi. What I tried to eat was mostly rice and not well made, lacked must flavor but I guess that is why they give you so much soy sauce. Avoid.
Not impressed. Rolls were sloppy. Fish had no flavor, might as well be soft tofu. Texture of rice was too mushy. If you want good sushi, don't come here.

Since I last left my review, I have left Philly and now live in Seattle. I have expanded my knowledge of sushi and Japanese food on the west coast with fancy edomae type sushi (from that documentary Jiro Dream's of Sushi), chef counter omakase, chirashi, and kaiseki-style dinners.

After eating my way around at some of the nicest and authentic Japanese restaurants in the PNW area, I still reminisce about Vic's in Philadelphia.

The sushi at Vic's is cheap in cost and it's made by Chinese people (not Japanese) but the taste is very well balanced and true to the basic ingredients. It doesn't have the qualities of bad cheap sushi: rice heavy, hard or cold rice, overly cloying topped with greasy tempura flakes, or drenched in mayonnaise. The tempura batter they use at Vic's is among the best I've found anywhere and their shrimp tempura has a nice "meaty" texture to it.

I stand by Vic's mackerel (saba) nigiri and spider roll (soft shell crab). These two items are hands down among the best I've found in the US. I've only found similar in more expensive Japanese owned sushi restaurants where the mackerel is $5 a piece and the spider roll is at least $14 a roll.

Vic's may not have fancy Alaska king salmon, otoro, or sea urchin flown in from japan but wow for the price and quality this place is a hidden gem.

I can't wait until I go back to Philly later this year to have some Vic's! Y'all are lucky being able to eat this every day!

Vic is a classic 
Great service 
Great sushi
Great location
Fair price 

I recommend the unagi and 3 roll special

How can anyone not like this place?! They are so fast and my order has always been correct. I'm not a sushi afeccionado or anything but everything I've ordered has been fresssh and delicious.  If y'all wanna complain, let me clear up the confusion, surprise! you're not at Morimoto guys, okkkay. I do not like that they're closed on Sunday's though-as I'd like to order at the present time, but you know, gotta rest, Lord's day and whatnot

Vic sushi is a small restaurant along an alley that you wouldn't really expect a good sushi restaurant to turn up. But luckily enough, I stumbled in, and it was amazing. 

This is by far the best value for sushi that I have had in Philadelphia. The rolls averaged less than $1/roll ($0.50/regular roll & ~$1.50/specialty roll). Despite the cheap prices, each roll tasted really fresh and delicious. Vic could easily double the prices of their sushi, and I think the meals here would still be worth it. I am always a sucker for tiger rolls and shrimp tempura rolls, and I think Vic did these rolls justice. 

I would definitely recommend anyone looking for affordable sushi places in Philly to come here!

How bad can sushi get? This bad. Then again, Philly is known for its amazing hoagies, great German, Italian and Vietnamese food... Just not its sushi... But, no, seriously, this is the very worst of the worst I've had around the world. And I had really bad sushi in a remote region of Chihuahua once. This place was worst. There was a piece of sushi that was the size of a vitamin. I understand Philadelphia is not by the sea, but this level of frugality and misery left us dumbfounded and feeling bad for everyone who thinks this place deserves anything more than 1/2 a star.
Vic is my go to place in downtown when I am craving for sushi. They have a really good deal for the 3 rolls. I have tried the special rolls and sashimi, and they are always delicious.

Eh. Sushi wasn't great. I got the 3 roll special and the rolls I got were pretty bland. I also got the seaweed salad which I figured would be difficult to mess up but I was wrong. I took one bite and couldn't eat any more. I feel bad giving 1 star so I put 2 :/
Extremely rude when I called them, telling me that it is too far to deliver to University City even though its like 14 mins drive.
loved it! Super cooperative staff with my allergies and extremely cheap for good sushi truly a gem in rittenhouse

Vic's is great if you stick to the 3 roll special.

The 3 roll special pricing is unbeatable here in Center City - you get 3 rolls for roughly $13. Unfortunately, it's not very filling. I've also tried their tiger roll, spicy combo, and the Samson roll, all of which are highly rated. My reaction to them all is, 'meh'. For that pricing, I don't think the flavors are strong enough. In fact, I don't think sriracha mayo and eel sauce are enough to bring the flavors together. I was quite disappointed by the mediocrity of the taste of the speciality rolls.

I would come back, but maybe I'll just stick to the 3 roll special.
I tried this spot for the first time today and got a Sansom Roll delivered. The food came in a timely manner and it was delicious.

business.name: Kanella
business.categories: Mediterranean, Food, Greek, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text:
Came here and Kanella immediately became one of my favorite restaurants in Philadelphia! The food was very flavorful and delicious. I ordered an appetizer and the quail special. I was on the fence on whether to give Kanella a 4 or 5 rating, but the fact that they're a BYO pushed them up to 5 for me. Make sure to make a reservation before going, this place gets packed. I definitely need to try brunch at Kanella and other items on the menu.

Food Rating: 5/5
Service Rating: 4.5/5
Ambiance Rating: 4/5
this place is great and i'll miss his location, but it looks like theyre just relocating!

Phenomenal food. Excellent service and outstanding center city location make this restaurant a must visit and a top choice in a city already known for outstanding restaurants. Certainly one of my favorites!

Had an early dinner with my friend here a few weeks ago. We split three apps: octopus, malohwa, and lamajun. They were all fine, no complaints.  We had decent outdoor seating too.  However, there was nothing too mind blowing about this place, it was all very adequate. I would by no means steer people away from here, but I'd simply state to expect a satisfactory dining experience and nothing more.

Food was good. We were a party of 4 who ordered appetizers, mains, and dessert / coffee and then...were asked to leave. 

"You're out, Tom"

Ranked best of philly but disappointed by the menu. Not familiar with greek food, I did not know what their food is. I had one of their brunch and it was really good. I recommend if you really want to try new food types!

It was lovely to sit outside and people watch.  It was the best part of the meal.  We to Kanella's on Sunday evening.  We were among the first to be seated for the evening service.  The hosts was rather curt.  I asked if we could sit at an angled table and we were told that the restaurant would be full and that table was going to be full.  During our time at Kanella's both angled tables remained empty. 
The food was hit or miss.  Some dishes were good, some were only fair.  $30pp for the Chef's taste meal (the only option on Sunday nights) was quite steep for what we got.

I can not see us trying this restaurant again.  Sorry.

I came here for the first time based on a recommendation that it was the best Greek food in the city. We had reservations during prime dinner time during the week but was running about 45 minutes late given traffic after work. The hostess was flexible with us and was able to keep our table, so when we arrived we were seated immediately. That was a nice accommodation. 

We ordered the lamb dumplings and the hummus for our appetizers. To be honest, the dumplings tasted like something I could get at a Chinese restaurant but they were pretty good and the spicy sauce was very tasty. We liked it so much we dipped the bread they provide in it. The hummus was also very good but not enough pita bread is provided given the amount of hummus you get. So we asked for a few pieces of pita bread to finish the dish but found out when we got the check it was $3 extra, so that was disappointing. 

For our entrees we ordered the lamb stew and Greek meatballs. Both had good spices and had a variety of vegetables in them. The meat for both dishes was tender which was another plus. The lamb stew was a pretty big portion and they didn't skimp on the lamb. 

The one significant downside of our experience was the customer service. Our waiter hardly checked on us and never made eye contact when we tried to get his attention. We found that he was actively waiting and checking on other tables so that made it frustrating. It took about 20 minutes before we were able to wave him down to get the check.

After a memorable breakfast I am really looking forward to trying dinner when they reopen in a new and bigger location. This is a far cry from any breakfast I've ever had, to me that is a good thing. The chef/owner's presence even during the morning hours shows how much commitment he has for his traditions and craft. How can you not like a place that serves fried Halloumi for breakfast.

Once upon a time, in a land far away from Greece ,a good Greek/ Cypriot had the best breakfast to offer!  

Wonder why Kanella has the best reviews of the opinionated reviewers? Well, wonder no more.

I started with a perfect cup of sweet Greek coffee. Then,I ordered what immediately caught my eyes on the menu, the Cyprus breakfast. It was my best bet, a mosaic of bright colors and mild flavors. I also had the ( Chef's Mother's Coconut, Date, And Hazelnut Cake - with date and orange syrup) for dessert! 

A traditional, strong, and D.E.L.I.C.I.O.U.S Greek coffee came out with a creamy foam on the top. After a sip, I was like, "And that what you'd expect a Greek coffee to taste like. Man, I'm game."

In front of me, an enormous plate was placed. Light on calories, big on taste:
- Crispy fried eggs. Runny yolk and cooked white. Fried in olive oil.
- Fried halloumi, very  distinguish flavor and texture. Made of sheep's milk.
-I substitute the lounza (smoked pork tenderloin ) for vegetables. The tomatoes and cucumbers were great add to the cheese. 

The Coconut, Date, And Hazelnut Cake - with date and orange syrup, was another favorite. LOVE LOVE LOOOVVVVEEEE anything with dates. ( I'm talking about the Middle Eastern sweet fruit of course, not the other date! LOL) 


Pro highlights: 
- Low key breakfast/ brunch, and very popular. Don't forgot to make a reservation!
- Cozy and small restaurant.
- Kanella South will be open sometime in June. Keep your eyes and ears open for the exact opening date.
- Great spot for family, friends, and dates. yes,now I'm talking about the other dates not the sweet fruit!!!!


Cannot wait till I visit the new Kanella!
Four Solid Yelps.

had to squeeze in a 'last meal' before they close this weekend pending their move. it was amazing - even better than the last time i dined there. my two friends and i split the grilled octopus (perfectly cooked - melted in your mouth), bureki and halloumi (prob one of my favs in the city). i had the watermelon salad special and the shrimp kabob app special for my meal. the kabob was served with the best tabouli salad i have ever had - loved that it was light on the grains and heavier on the tomatoes and parsley. the watermelon salad was great but needed more watermelon for the amount of feta or maybe to be served with some toasts or something for all the cheese. otherwise, a perfect last meal. 

the other girls had the stuffed eggplant and quail special. i did not get a chance to taste the quail but was told it was amazing. i am not a huge eggplant fan in general but it was tasty!

for dessert, we had the salted caramel tart, burnt lemon and fresh berries, and the galaktoboureko - all were fab! just wished the galaktoboureko was less sweet... but still enjoyable.

good news - the queen village location will be open in july!

Got flagged down by some friends and found out that Kanella is closing the 10th and Spruce location and moving to 2nd!

Great food and BYO. New location will have a full bar and liquor license ...

Kanella, it breaks my heart that you are moving but I am quite excited for the rumors of a wood-burning oven. Earthy, gamey meats done exceptionally well, perfectly grilled octopus that is a winner every time, and specials that are always intriguing- I feel like you can't make a misstep with this menu. A great spot when there is something to celebrate.

2 weeks after a great meal at Kanella, I had yet another delicious meal, accompanied with some of the worst service I've ever experienced in almost a decade in Philadelphia.

Our server, George, was inattentive and flat out rude. To start, George did not come to our table for about 10 minutes once we were seated. Once he did, he started walking away halfway through our drinks order (a few ppl wanted coffee to perk up). He barely made eye contact, didn't introduce himself or even half-smile, and was clearly distracted.

Distracted by what? One might ask --- well, George had a couple other tables that I guess he assumed would yield bigger tips than what he would get from a group of 5 young professional women. Bad assumption, George. 

After dropping off our coffee and waters, George proceeded to make 3-4 visits to his other tables (one with two middle aged couples and one with a group that appeared to be parents and their  grown children) before returning to our table to discuss appetizers and specials. In fact, we watched helplessly as George blatantly looked away several times when we tried to make eye contact with him to signal we were ready to order.  I would be surprised if he didn't have whiplash he was turning his head so quickly.

When we finally got his attention, we ordered several appetizers to start. We all have been to Kanella several times and are familiar with the menu. At that point, in an attempt to save some face, George informed us he thought we were waiting for a 6th person, as there was an empty chair at the table. Nice try, George. At that point, only a fool would think the table place covered in wine bottles, menus, and purses was going to be taken. Instead of having a laugh about it and getting on better terms, though, George rushed away again. 

Our apps came out and we ran out of pita quickly. It took us 10 min to get George's attention to order more pita/bread to enjoy with our dip heavy appetizers. When he finally came over, the first thing he said, and rather rudely was, "are you going to order any entrees?". Not would you like to order entrees?, or would you like to hear the specials?--- it was more like a demand to suggest we were wasting his time and costing him money. He said he needed to know because most of the entrees take a while to cook and prepare. That's funny, though, because just the other week, I had a lamb stew and pork souvlaki appear pretty quickly post-order--- don't ya think, George, there might be a more polite way to address a customer? I digress. When we informed him we just wanted to order a few rounds of apps, his expression fell flat, his shoulders dropped, and we were officially invisible. We went ahead and ordered the rest of ours appetizers, several rounds worth, and knew we would be seeing very little of George until check out time. 

As our apps came out, our dirty plates failed to be removed in a timely manner, and George didn't return once to see that we were enjoying our meal. I know that clearing of the plates is the busser's responsibility, but I also know a good server makes sure it happens. George seemed shocked when we ordered 2 desserts, how could a bunch of female YPs afford it?, and I don't remember him even saying thank you for coming in. What didn't George forget to do? Add a 20% gratuity to our bill. Touché, George. I guess you win. 

All the appetizers/desserts were delicious but the meal was ruined by our server's prejudice against our group. No one should walk into a restaurant and be treated a certain way because of their demographic. Guess what, George --- joke's on you. We are the types of young adults that regularly come here with our parents when they are in town and run up the high tabs you were chasing after with those other tables. Next time my parents are in town, however, the only way I will come back to Kanella is if I can have the restaurant guarantee I am not in your section.

When people talk about great Greek restaurants in Philadelphia this one escapes them until I mention it. Then the knowing "yeah"". Kanella is small unassuming but sure of itself. Overheard from EVERY table as eager patrons discuss the menu, "Everything is good here!"

Indeed, everything is good. I've tried numerous dishes and people whom I've recommended this place to have filled in the blanks. Feel free to order anything.  I'm positive it will be brilliant.

FABULOUS food as usual!!  The special was a salmon and watermelon salad with sumac, and the flavors were amazing together.  The only issue was with the Yelp SeatMe service, which allowed me to make a reservation and receive confirmation, but when we got to the restaurant the hostess told us she was sorry, that coincidentally while I must have been making a reservation, she was also trying to book a table (perhaps by someone who called in) and "the system kicked her out."  Either way, I got a confirmation, walked with my group to the restaurant, and no table as confirmed.  They were nice and got us a table outside, but it was certainly too cold to sit outside and we rushed through our meal to get out of there as fast as possible.  So, for Kanella, couldn't sing higher praises; for the reservation system, not a happy customer!!

One of my favorite restaurants ever. Ingredients are simple but the outcome once they are prepared is exceptional.

Got a last minute reservation last Friday after my sister checked into Pennsylvania Hosp to give birth! We wanted to give her some space as her inducement was delayed and also wanted a nice family meal. Arrived for a 5:30 pm res and the only table was outside in direct, bright sunlight. We decided we would cope bc we know how good the food is.

As soon a reservation cancelled and a table was free in the shade, they moved us. 
Between three people split the dip trio, kanella platter, lamb stew, pork souvlaki, and a galaktaboureko (sp). More than enough food. On the dip platter was an outstanding pumpkin dip with scallions and chives that I am currently try to recreate at  home.  I raised my eye at pumpkin in the spring, but  the added herbs/green onion made it light and springy.The lamb was extremely tender and did not have the oiliness a lot of restaurant lamb stews drown in. The serving of stew extremely generous and we each got several large pieces of meat, in addition to plenty of sauce for dipping pita into. The pork souvlaki was cooked perfectly, and plenty favorful, but I would go for the brick chicken if it's on the menu when you go.

Can't wait to go back many more times. Servers were sweet and the food came out with time between so we could share and enjoy.

Do not skip dessert. Split at least one among the table and order a greek coffee.

Kanella is touted as one of the top restaurants in Philly and for good reason. The food here never disappoints; but what I appreciate the most is the sheer simplicity of it all. There is no pretentiousness or complicatedness in the dishes, yet they still taste amazing. I had the shakshouka with merguez sausage, while my mom had the shrimp saganaki. She loved it, which is saying a lot considering how picky of an eater she is, and needless to say I was very satisfied with my meal. The portion sizes are just right in my opinion - while some dishes may be more substantial, they contain, for the most part, just the right amount.

The restaurant itself is fairly low key with a nice Mediterranean vibe. The wait staff is also extremely friendly. I was having trouble deciding between the shakshouka and the falafel sandwich (which my brother is a huge fan of), so our waitress brought out the chef to give me his suggestion. Overall, if you're looking for a pleasantly quaint dining experience, then I highly suggest you come here.

Kanella has skyrocketed into a comfortable place among my favorite restaurants in Philadelphia. I absolutely love Greek/Mediterranean food and Kanella does it best. I'm definitely a little sad that they have outgrown their cozy little BYO on Spruce and are moving further east to a larger location with a liquor license... but that won't stop me from going the extra distance, either. 

At dinner or brunch, we always start with the trio of spreads. This is the only time I have ever eaten beets and enjoyed them (pureed with who knows what but this spread is delicious). The pumpkin feta spread is wonderful as well, and I'll always love the potato and onion spread. While I love the pita, I have been trying to cut back on carbs and I was able to get a side of veggies on my Friday night visit, which was awesome. 

Lately when we go for dinner, my fiancé and I order a handful of small plates and just share everything over a couple courses. The octopus with white beans is excellent, as well as the grilled halloumi with tomato and fig salad. We recently tried some lamb dumplings which were super flavorful and a little spicy. If mussels are on the menu, I highly recommend those as well. 

Basically, you can't go wrong with whatever you order at Kanella. I'm hoping for one more visit at their current location but I'm looking forward to seeing what the future brings as well!

As a cypriot, I am usually dissapointed at Greek restaurants but not at Kanella!  The food is delicious.  The chef uses traditional recipes but elevates them to a sophisticated dish.  I had better food at Kanella than at most restaurants in Cyprus! The restaurant is small and noisy, so I would not recommend for a quiet, romantic dinner but it is perfect to visit with a group of friends.
Very very good brunch spot. Eat outside and get the mint tea. Definitely headed back there. Byo

It's been a long time coming, Kanella.

Friends of mine have raved about the appetizers/small plates, so my boyfriend and I opted to create our own meal out of a number of small plates. This was a really fun and interesting way to sample the menu without trying to juggle the appetizer/entree order ratio. And, it end up being comparable (if not a smidge cheaper) than two entrees would have been.

Our dishes (ranked from favorite to least favorite): 
1. Manti (ground lamb dumplings with yogurt sauce with paprika, mint, and parsley)
2. Bureki (phyllo dough stuffed with feta & thyme, drizzled with honey, served with roasted beets)
3. Daily Dips (potato/garlic, red beet, pumpkin/feta)
4. Grilled octopus
5. Grilled shrimp skewers with lamb sausage and tabouleh (daily special)

Overall, all of the dishes were supremely flavorful, uniformly fresh, and perfectly sized. 

The Manti (groung lamb dumplings) were by far our favorite dish. The bright, spicy, rich sauce and the tender dumplings were a near-perfect dish. The Burkei (phyllo dough with feta, thyme, and honey) was also near-perfect. The drizzle of honey on top of the light and flaky dough added just the hint of sweetness that balanced the flavors from the feta nicely. 

Our favorite of the daily dips was the pumpkin/feta. All three were delicious, but we found the pumpkin/feta and red beet to be the better of the 3. Warm, fresh pita only helped the dish.

The grilled octopus was really tender and grilled nicely, but we tasted that after our palates had been awakened by the Manti, so the more subtle flavors fell a little flat. The shrimp & lamb sausage skewer was only ok. The dish didn't help or hurt our experience, but I appreciated tasting yet another protein. 

I was somewhat underwhelmed by the service. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and take equal responsibility for not requesting our dishes be paced similar to a meal. One of my friends, who has been a number of times, mentioned they have always done this for her, so I kind of expected it. We ordered our dishes and within 10 minutes, our table was overflowing with all 5 dishes (plus starter bread.) We managed, but our table was kind of hectic and crowded the whole time.
Very very good brunch spot. Eat outside and get the mint tea. Definitely headed back there. Byo

Seating issues despite a reservation caused us to leave, despite a prior positive visit. We were given the choice of a cramped corner table inside or a tiny outdoor table right in the flow of the pedestrian traffic on the sidewalk, despite several larger empty tables inside. They were supposedly being held for other parties which did not appear during the time we were there. Efforts to accommodate us were half hearted.

My boyfriend and I went there for dinner recently. He ordered the poaches monkfish and was pleasant surprised by it. The sauce was absolutely delicious - a bit of citrus flavor to it - and the dish was nicely balanced with chickpeas and some veggie. He is already talking about going back for brunch! Lol So you won't be disappointed by the monkfish. I ordered the lamb, which was nice but didn't blow me away.

business.name: Maggiano's Little Italy
business.categories: Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces, Event Planning & Services, Bars

reviews.text: We had an amazing experience once we got a new server. Daniel was absolutely a rockstar and management handled our situation very professionally and quickly. Daniel ensured we were taken care of through every step of our meal, and we could see him treating each of his tables with such kindness and attention. The food was amazing, we got the mozzarella, meatballs, fettuccini Alfredo, four cheese ravioli in red sauce, chicken Marsala, and chicken pec. Desserts - cheesecake, chocolate cake, and lemon cookies. We had an exceptional experience and will be coming back again and we hope to have Daniel next time!

We really enjoyed our food here at Maggiano's version of Little Italy. If you are seated in the main dining room expect to be in close confines of other patrons here. Not mad at it because I don't mind but I could see some people getting unnerved by how close the other tables are. My recommendation would be a large table on the mezzanine if they're seating people there. Appetizers here are good too. We got the zucchini and mozzarella which were both amazing. Not going to break down the meals we got but all in all I like this place. Waiter Patrick was on point too that helps with the experience but the food makes you come back.

Came back for lunch today. The experience is as pleasant as our first-time dinner experience. Their lunch combo is very affordable--even cheaper than Panera bread pick 2. 

I had soup of the day and flat bread. They are delicious and you feel fulfilled afterwards. My husband had salad and meatball sandwich that comes with French fries. He enjoyed his meal very much as well. 

I didn't realize the corner bakery is part of the establishment, which has its own lunch menu. I will definitely try that in the future.

YUM!!! I haven't been to this restaurant since I was in college and it's even better than I remember.

We had spectacular service - Emma, was our waitress and I will be requesting her when I go back.

We did the family style entrees for four. It's $34.99 per person and comes with one salad choice, two appetizers choices, two pasta choices (some of them have meat like shrimp Alfredo, etc), two entree choices, and two desserts. For our appetizer we chose the fried mozzarella and the bruschetta- both were amazing!!! The fried mozzarella was HUGE and sooo cheesy!! Then for pasta and entrees we did spaghetti with marinara, fettuccine Alfredo, chicken parmigiana, and chicken Piccata. Each one of those were incredible. The chicken in the parm and piccata was perfectly tender, the Alfredo was SO CREAMY, and it the marinara on the spaghetti was classic.

For dessert we chose the tiramisu and the chocolate cake - both equally as good. Next time we chatted about trying the butter cake instead of the tiramisu. I also had a double espresso with dessert and it was only $3.99 which is reasonably priced for an Italian restaurant.

The only reason I am giving this restaurant a four star rating instead of a five is because the meatballs were so hard that we couldn't eat them. We told Emma that they were hard so she quickly brought us more and it was the same thing with the new ones. So we just told her to forget about them. 

Ultimately - we had an amazing experience with outstanding service, hot tasty food, and a great atmosphere - will absolutely be going back.

Our family had a 21st dinner party for one of my nephews and this is one of his favorite restaurants.  There was a bit of miscommunication about whether or not we could have the cake refrigerated but the manager (Amanda) worked it out so that was great.  Our server (Marcus) was AMAZING!!  He was VERY attentive, he took all of orders with ease and with a party of 16 including young adults and people over 30 isn't always easy LOL!  Marcus repeatedly asked if we needed anything, our food was brought to our table in what we would consider record time because it didn't take more than 30 min!  Our appetizers were delicious and made to perfection!  I must say between Amanda working out the issue with where we were originally seated and the customer service provided by both her and Marcus really ripped off our party!  Marcus made jokes, brought extra plates, provided utensils to cut the cake, and even offered to take a group photo for us!  Maggiano's:  I hope you take care of Amanda & Marcus the way they took care of us!!

Had not the best experience at maggiano's tonight. The atmosphere is cute however we were sat right where the servers seemed to hang out when their tables didn't need them and one was using a vape which isn't really what you want to be around when you're eating. Our sever was very inattentive. She didn't clear our sharing plates or the dish our appetizer came on making our small table even tighter. she never came to check on us or refill drinks, another server must've noticed as he offered to help us in anyway he could (this was very much appreciated) 

The food was decent would say it's on par with olive garden; good for a quick meal wouldn't recommend for a date night or special occasion. We did the dinner for two which was a good deal.

Haven't come here in a while and won't be coming again. Used to have good service years ago, but unfortunately that has changed. We were seated for 40 mins before deciding to leave due to no waiter being assigned to us at all. After 20 min we told one waiter that they might have forgot to assign one for our table. After another 10 min we reminded another waiter. After sitting there for 10 more minutes still unassigned, we left to a better restaurant and won't be returning.

I would have given this restaurant less than zero if possible. My wife and I went into this place for lunch at 1:30 pm and the dining room was mostly empty. We expected to be seated immediately but the two hosts announced that we will have to wait thirty minutes for a table. When we pointed out that the majority of tables were not occupied and asked why the wait we only received blank stares in response. DO NOT BOTHER ATTEMPTING TO EAT HERE; they clearly do not want your business.

If you want a place that is handling the crowds with no excuses- this is your place. This place was crowded! There was a wait for big parties- but our party of three got in quickly. We had water and bread within a minute or two- our appetizer within 5 minutes- and our food within 15. It was hot and delicious. Our server, Kate,  was kind and attentive. Everyone that worked there was running around like crazy- and the vibe- everyone was happy. We were in and out but I NOT rushed at all! It was like pre-covid! It was the best restaurant experience I had in years! 
I recommend the mozzarella marinara- it was the perfect bite of cheese, sauce, and breading. The chicken parm was amazing- the sauce has a nice balance- not too sweet not too acidic. Everything u have ever tasted at Maggianos has been delicious- but this was- by far- the best service experience I had in a very long time!

We ordered takeout via their website and the process seemed rather seamless. The restaurant is beautiful and the pick up process seems rather easy. Overall the food was good but the pick up service could have been a bit better. I'd love to go back and dine in one day!

Service is terrible. I stopped in on my lunch break. Stood at the takeout window for 10 minutes, noticed two ppl standing back there talking,
and no one came to assist. Went and stood at the bar for 10 minutes and the bartender finally acknowledged that I was there. Then I told her I just wanted to just order something and I knew what I wanted. She then said "well I have to go serve a table outside first and I will be back". I wasted 25 minutes of my lunch and got no service or lunch. I just walked out totally pissed. Maybe they are understaffed and need a lot of help. However ,I'm never going back.

Curbside pick up? Hit or miss..
I ordered two entree dishes with side salad today for my family's lunch as I had to work from home this morning with no time to cook but wanted to serve some warm, decent food for lunch to celebrate surviving a hardworking week including the first couple of back-to-school weeks. It turned out that it was another disappointment from Maggiano's. Some staff is attentive and respectful, but some are not in our past experience. However, food is usually good. My child asked for Maggiano's recently, so I gave it a shot today for pick up. When I arrived at curbside pick up, I texted to the number with my full name and spot # according to instruction on a sign board. Nobody came out for good 10 minutes. Sometimes food prep takes time since I chose for "ASAP" for my food ready time, I wouldn't mind giving some extra time for them to cook. However, I sensed something was off. I decided not to wait any longer and went into a store. I haven't been there in person for a while due to pandemic so I wasn't sure where the pick up place was. There were three young people smiling and chatting in their red Maggiano's shirts at the counter. I told them I came for online order pick and gave my name. One young lady nearer to a register pointed out at a shelf next to me where I could see my name on a bag. There was only one bag and no other customer around so they were not busy. I told her that I was waiting at a curbside. She seemed to become defensive and told me that she was busy and alone. I was confused because three of them were enjoying socializing. One lady was sipping a drink, another young man was smiling, and this lady was also chatting with them when I stepped in. I wasn't sure if two of them were on a break, but it was lunch time, the busy time at a restaurant although it wasn't busy day for them today. I wasn't pleasant by her response, but didn't want to waste any more time since my family was waiting. 
When I came home and opened containers, another disappointment was waiting. Side caesar salad was already saggy and croutons were wet. I know another restaurant keeping salad order in a cool place until pick up time, but Maggiano's just kept everything in one bag (salad on top of pasta) and didn't even care to bring it out on time when customer was waiting outside for more than 10 minutes. Pasta was cold. I hate using microwave that is reason I chose to pick it up myself instead of choosing delivery. So it seemed that food was ready on time by 11:47am at my pick up time, but it got bad and unfresh since almost 20 minutes of delay was made due to negligent staff who didn't even acknowledge of their wrongdoing but busy hanging out with other peers. Well, I met wonderful servers and staff there before, but had some impolite and negligent staff like today. That is why I am reluctant to choose Maggiano's and we havne't been there for a while although we started to go other eatery places. I wonder if inconsistent service quality is a part of management problem. If they keep checking up on their employees and providing appropriate feedback throughout shift, and before and after, they probably can provide much better service to customers. 
I am very disappointed and uncertain if I would like to place my next order at Maggiano's. There are so many other restaurants doing better jobs in KOP.

One of the biggest Italian restaurants I've ever been too. The grand entrance is majestic. It can host hundreds of people at one shot. The vibe is superb. 

The staff are efficient and friendly. This is our first time and the server did a good job of introducing the dishes. We ended up with lasagna and chicken Marsala. Both came out great. It's definitely better than any other regular franchised Italian restaurant. 

Since the portion is generous, we didn't order dessert afterwords. But I'm curious to try in the future when we move back to Philly.

I am 9 years old and I have had an amazing time at Maggianos. I was full but the food was so good I kept eating. My Family had also enjoyed it. With a quiet environment and a wonderful balcony, this was one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. 

(And I loved the colouring for the kids menu.)

Zuma here. I just went to Maggiano's here in King of Prussia, and I have to say, I don't understand why this place got such bad reviews on Google, but Yelp's more legit anyway . I ordered the gnocchi in vodka cream sauce, and it tasted pretty nice! 

I custom ordered bacon on it, which was smoky and delicious! The sauce was flavourful, the gnocchi was soft and went down nice and easy. The seasoning was well used without being too overbearing. 


Finally, I ordered their creme brûlée, which wasn't the sweetest, but was still damn delicious, dude! This is one happy pup!

Great food and my favorite merlot. There are some restaurants that only have one dish that I like so that is what I order every time I go there. That isn't the case with this restaurant because most of the menu is so good it's hard to choose what to order each time I go there. My only dissatisfaction is that it is next to an incredible large mall and getting into Maggiano's can be difficult often times and their waiting area is inadequate. There have been a few time we have had to go back to the car and go somewhere else. But that just shows you what a poular restaurant it is.
We dined here a few weeks ago it was our first time there. We loved the food and the servers attentiveness to our party with refills of beverages and entrees. We will definitely be back!!

My husband and I have enjoyed coming here for years! We love to order the fried mozzarella and spinach dip as appetizers. They truly never disappoint! My husband is a creature of habit so he never strays away from his typical chicken parm which he adores. I tend to try out different menu items since everything I try is phenomenal. The latest dish was a steak dinner and it was phenomenal. We are always so pleased with the wait staff and service. I highly recommend reservations!

The absolute best restaurant I have ever been to. From the second I walked in to the second I left I was treated with amazing service. The staff all came over to the table to start up conversations when they could and the food came out so quickly (and we weren't even there for a special occasion). Not to mention how wonderful the food tasted. Also, our server (Kate) brought out a free dessert which I believe were lemon cookies because she wanted to apologize for her "horrible service" which I thought was actually amazing before she even said anything. I would 1000% recommend to everyone I know.
Love this place. An abundance of well prepared food with a variety of choice sure to please everyone

If I could I would give 0 stars. DON'T GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY!!! I ordered a pickup order for Mother's day the Friday before. My husband's credit card was charged and we received a confirmation email. At the time of pick up, 4pm, my daughter and husband went to pick it up. After being ignored in the pick up area for 15 minutes, they went in to ask about the order. They were told that his credit card didn't go thru and the order was canceled. My husband asked why we weren't notified, to which he was told that they did which was not true. My husband asked to talk to the manager and he told him that he was very upset that the order was canceled and now he had no dinner for me for Mother's day. The manager answered with " what's your problem ". Huh? My husband asked to speak to the manager outside so that the busyness of the restaurant wouldn't get in the way of trying to talk and rectify the situation, to which the manager told him that he was going to call the police!!! My husband told him to call the police as he was sure they would have an issue how they were being treated by Maggianos. The restaurant said they would remake the order and get it out to the car as soon as possible. They brought out the order minus asparagus that my daughter ordered. She went back in again to yell them she didn't get her asparagus to which they argued with her saying they did, which is basically calling her a liar, to which my daughter replied, " do you want me to bring the whole order back in so you can see there is no asparagus". They said no and made it for her. So after an hour of this ABUSE, BEING THREATENED WITH POLICE AND CALLED A LIAR, they gave my daughter a copy of an email they received from their OWN  corporate office by accident which  said that they couldn't get the credit card to go through, to call us and to prepare our order and inform us that we will be charged at pickup. We have that copy, and all of our original order paperwork. WE WILL NEVER GO TO MAGGIANO'S AND PLAN ON TELLING EVERY ONE WE KNOW OF OUR HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!! At least, the manager should be fired, and we should have received our order for free!!!! My husband also asked for the name of the regional manager and they wouldn't give it to him.

My youngest daughter wanted to come here to celebrate her 20th birthday and we had been to Buco Di Pepo and she wanted to try Maggianos this go around. 

I made the reservation through Google which was great! I wished more restaurants went through Google for food reservations.

Our waitress was GREAT. We didn't have to wait for long for our drinks or our food! We got the family style calamari and spinach/artichoke dip for the appetizer, I got a peach belini and it was all delicious!ngy.

Our waitress was GREAT. We didn't have to wait for long for our drinks or our food! We got the family style calamari and spinach/artichoke dip for the appetizer, I got a peach bellini and it was all delicious!

For the main course, we got a family size veal parmesan, chicken and spinach manicotti in a cream sauce, and clam linguine. Dessert was butter cake and creme brulee.

All of the food was outstanding! The chicken and the spinach in the cream sauce was soo stinking good! The clam linguine!!! Now, that was the star!! Chock full of clams and yummy pasta! The red sauce with the veal was awsome also!

The butter cake was ok, the cream brulee yummy. All in all a very good dinner and of course, they came out with lemon cookies for my babys 20th birthday! Nice touch. 

OH, and to pay, all you need to do is scan the bottom of the receipt! How cool was that? I will be back! Thanks for making my babys day delicious and special!

Service was good. The food was ok but nothing out of this world. I think the ambiance is what makes the place feel expensive otherwise it's no big deal for the amount you pay. The creme brûlée tasted very bland and the strawberry was obviously cut with a knife used to cut onions because that's exactly what the strawberry tasted like.

Ordered for lunch through door dash no utensils or napkins were packed!  The meatballs were very salty when I finally had them at dinner. Sometimes they get everything spot on and so many times like this leaves me unsatisfied

First of allu havent reccomend me any wine like you screamed in front of ppl i dont do rushing dinner...sorry..first second  #corygibbs MLS #serialstalker...#fifa #corygibbscouchstalker ...u know better...#ashe for whoever working for cory gibbs inside of thar spot so you know he got a restraining order against him......! So stressful everytime i go in that place gzzz.

business.name: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse
business.categories: Food, Restaurants, Seafood, Specialty Food, Steakhouses, American (Traditional)

reviews.text: We had a great time here with my family. The restaurant is in a beautiful setting. It was a hopping place but not too loud. We enjoyed great steaks, wine and conversation. The surf and turf special was excellent as was the ribeye. The crab cakes were moist and flavorful. Dessert was also excellent. I am so glad we ate here!

Just can't beat this place. It has everything. If I could give more stars I would. Yes, it is expensive. It's the drinks that push the dinner over the top with price. If you are looking for the best experience for an event, dinner, or a celebration of any kind DelFrisco's is it. I have had an event party here and it was so well done. I have had private dining with a crowd of 25 and did not disappoint. I've been here for dinner. Was the best dinner of my life. I will say the more people you have, the longer you wait for dinner but it's worth it. It's perfection. Now if I could just more the location to out Philadelphia into the suburbs.... THAT would be the best!
Such a delicious dinner and beautiful atmosphere! The food was beyond amazing, staff beyond friendly, and drinks beyond tasty! Also would recommend the butter cake for dessert! 100\100!

Lolll, first of all, I wasn't sure if I should waste more time at this place by writing a review, after all, we had an amazing meal at the Finch a couple blocks away closer to home.   BUT, what is funny is that all the 1 star reviews are very lengthy stories.   Mine is the same lengthy and with the same "manager" Alice.


My parents came in first with our kids.  My husband and I walked in shortly.   Alice told us that my parents are not up to their dress code.  We were shocked. Mom was wearing cashmere "jogger" and host insisted they were sweatpants.  I told her it is my mom's birthday and can't she let it slide?  Nope.  Our car was valeted already.  Hubby took my parents home to change.  Me with two young children cannot be partially seated.  It was difficult.  

This Alice came over a few times, trying to be nice.   She told us we can wait in the high top area, but cannot be seated.  20 minutes later, she said she can "partially" seat us in the basement.  I said no.  The kids are not vaccinated and we made a reservation and the first floor had ample empty tables.  But No, cannot be seated.  Later hubby and parents returned and were told we only can get seated downstairs, because I was not nice to her. 


Grow up, please.  You sent a 60 year old birthday lady home to change because of your snobby dress code.  The definition of "business casual" is quite arbitrary. Sneakers, hoodies are allowed but cashmere joggers are not?   Or hoodies depending on who wears it,according to other reviews here?  You would not seat a mom with two young kids.  And when I told you - I don't want to talk to you.   You get offended?!   



It is New Year Eve.  So they figured they were in power and they wouldn't seat us,at all,not downstairs either.  When little people are in power, man, they go to town.  


Alice, if you really want a career in hospitality, grow some genuine heart and more importantly, improve your emotional quality.    Have a nice life.
One of the best Steak's I've had in my life was from here . Sheesh and the calamari was delicious, a little spicy though. Will visit again .

Came here tonight with a couple friends for an annual get together. I'll make it short. Server delivered the food and asked if I wanted to check the temperature of my steak which I couldn't even fathom what she meant. I was talking to my friends when she dropped the food off so I said 'I'm sure it's fine' trusting that the chef in a steakhouse knows how to cook a steak and also not knowing what 'checking the temperature of my steak' meant, cuz I don't bring a thermometer with me and shouldn't have to.. anyway.. Half my steak was medium rare, half was Chicago blue uncooked. Point it out to the server who offers to put it in a broiler but also chastises me for not checking the temp in the first place? I didn't want twice cooked food or butterflied steak. I don't want to have to slice my 16oz steak in half in front of the server upon their request to make sure their chef cooked it right. I want to cut the thing and eat it. I wanted a chef in a fancy restaurant to know what they were doing. It didn't happen. It's whatever. Server was nice but was also making light out of the predicament. When server came to take my bloody plate away she said 'do you have a dog to take this home to?' Which is a funny quip except it's basically acknowledging I paid $57 for 16oz of dog food. She was making the best of it.  The chef fucked up royal. I was offered nothing other than to cook the same steak again which is basically offering me leftovers that weren't good enough to eat in the first place. Kinda shocked. Kinda laughing.
