Kinda weirded out enough to write this. I had a good time with my friends. My friends dishes were good. It's a cool building. Trying to not totally drag this place but MY experience was ass. If you want to impress a date or have a good time this ain't the spot unless, you love twice cooked steak or places that can't say 'I'm wrong, let's make this right'. 

Tipped server over 20% because everyone should.

We went to Del Frisco's Saturday for a 7pm reservation. The building itself is absolutely stunning. Decorated beautifully for Christmas by the way. Downstairs there is a former bank vault where you can dine as well, which is a great touch. 

The previous few times we were here we had excellent service. Some of the best we have had. This time, not so much. The food and previous experiences save this from being two stars. To be honest, this experience was more two stars. Our waiter I believe tried to be attentive but I have to assume they were under staffed. Regardless, everything was very very slow. Drinks, taking orders, getting water refills, etc.. when we were served our food, the servers asked us to cut into our steaks to make sure they were cooked to our liking. Issue was, we had no utensils. They were cleared off and not replaced. To say I was disappointed in the service would be an understatement. For the price we pay for the food, I was hoping it would be better or to what it was a few years ago. 

Food was delicious though. The app was great - we got the calamari app. We also got a Caesar salad, and that was also very good. 

Main entrees we both got filet mignons, cooked well and both were good pieces of meat. We also got lobster mac n cheese and creamed spinach. We also got a complimentary desert from the waiter which was a nice touch. 

I hate to be critical when the food is very good. But for the cost, time the meal took which was about three hours (I love long meals but this was too long) and the service, I think it will be a while before I come back.

We arrived about an hour early to sit at the bar to have a drink. We were told we would be seated closer to our reservation and it was noted that we would be at the bar. We sat and ordered drinks when the hostess arrived to tell us we could be seated now. My wife went to the table while I waited for the drinks at the bar. When I arrived at the table with our drinks the bread was already placed on the table and was already cold. Our server was wonderful, very pleasant, professional,  and attentive. We started with oysters and calamari, both were excellent. The oysters tasted fresh and the accompanying sauces were delicious. We ordered steaks and sides. My strip med rare and my wifes filet medium. My strip was med well and the filet was rare. My wife decided she would keep hers and let it rest a few minutes. Our server offered to have a new one cooked for me but knowing my wife's food, and the sides, would be cold by the time a new steak arrived I declined. Unfortunately it was not as good at that temperature but it was good still. My suggestion would be to offer to have the drinks brought to our table so we could have been seated together. If a steak temp is incorrect have new sides brought with the newly cooked steaks. The manager did approach us, we assumed because the server mentioned the steak temp to him (the server confirmed our assumption), but he never mentioned this fact but I was almost halfway through my steak and wasn't about to mention it. It's always very disruptive to the dinning experience to have one guest with food, eating alone, while the other waits for the chef to correct their mistake, especialy at a high end, high priced, restaurant. We were there once before and it was an excellent experience, not so much this time.
Amazing food amazing atmosphere amazing service!! Loved everything about it!! Especially their bread with shaved sea salt.

Let me start by saying the food was delicious, always is. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. I had the petite filet, creamed spinach and potatoes au gratin. My partner had a salad and cheesesteak egg rolls. And as you can see I started with a VIP immediately upon being sat because what we went through at the host stand was infuriating...

When we arrived my partner was wearing a hoodie. ALICE, who I also believe is a manager informed us that he wouldn't be allowed inside with his hoodie and needed to change. We left, went to a store close by to buy a shirt and then returned. When we went back to the host stand we saw someone walking out with a hoodie and asked Alice "how were they allowed in with a hoodie and we just had to leave and buy new clothes?" Her response was "I assure you they were not wearing a hoodie, we apply the dress code to everyone". Not only was that a dismissive comment but it was also WRONG because when we sat down we saw at least 5 more hoodies (im including photos of some). We pointed it out to another person working there who apologized to us and apologized for their inconsistency. Alice never apologized or said anything. Rude. 

It is not our issue that hoodies are not allowed in the restaurant. My issue is that my partner was asked to change when others weren't and I can guarantee it was because of how he looks. He has tattoos and a hoodie on him probably looks different than a hoodie on others. We felt judged and profiled and I wanted to take my time to write this because it happened, and it wasn't right. Mistakes are made, things get missed but Alice's arrogance made everything worse and made us feel invalidated. She is unapologetically rude. 

Our server was lovely, I didn't catch her name but Thank you for helping us salvage the evening somewhat.

It's a very beautiful restaurant but the experience was not good. The service was horrible and the food was very sub par. Especially given the pricing of the restaurant. It was a $600 evening for three people including tip. One child included. Drinks and food, were not delivered in a timely fashion and not even close. We were there for 2 1/2 hours. It was very surprising to us. The table was never cleared either. We will not be returning.

Giving one star only because site won't allow me to give less. I am an avid Yelp user and have never given a bad review on any establishment. I work in the city and am a frequent restaurant consumer. This place is the most overrated and over priced sub par steak house I have ever had the displeasure of dining at. Went to restaurant with a group of 6. On a Friday night before a show.. Not going to go on for long but here are some facts
- drinks inconsistent (2 old fashions  2 different colors and tastes)
- bread covered with mystery sauce and doughy (all6 agreed 
- cheesesteak appetizer served cold in center
- dry aged strip steak $75 tough and tasteless 
- chicken under cooked. 
- wife and her girlfriend ordered Damon and both were sick 1/2 way threw show
- 1st time in a so called high end restaurant where 4 out of 6 drinks were dry twice threw a $650 meal
Save your money and go to a legit restaurant
OUTSTANDING. wow could not have been better the ribeye was cooked perfect. Service was great. really fantastic. The sides were shareable. Drinks were awesome and a very nice wine selection
I've gone here 3 other times in the past year, food is always great. The waiter was a little off but I definitely wouldn't let that stop me from going back.

I came here last night for my birthday party, it was a party of 8. We had an 8:30 pm reservation.  It took about 30 mins to receive a drink. A few friends ordered an appetizer and the rest of the group was ready to order our entrees. We were told that we were not allowed to order our meals yet because the appetizers were being brought out. It took her another 30 mins to come to get our order, at this point we were already done with our drinks. Throughout the whole time dining there she never asked if we wanted to order more drinks. Once the food came out at 10:30 pm there was a mixed up and we told the servers this. One rudely stated "whatever" and continued to throw the food on the table. At the end of the night, I wanted to put candles on my cake and asked our waitress who we saw a total of 3 times, for candles. She tried to light the candles with a full table of DIRTY dishes. I asked her if she could clear the table for us and she started to. She came back and lit the candles and I told her we were not ready because the table was still DIRTY!!!!!! She tried to blow the candles out and caught herself saying "oh I forgot it was COVID". She now had an attitude that I was confused about because we asked nicely the FIRST time to clear ALL the dishes off. We stated we would let her know when we were ready and she never came back to light the candle. Not to mention it took them almost 2 and a half hours to get our FOOD. We spent over $800 to have a not-so-great service. This was our first and last time here.

This 3 star review is really based on the average of all my visits here... on a good day, it's amazing. On an off day, it's just... off.

This last time was the most frustrating. We had reservations, and the front desk kept saying the table was being bussed. For 1.5 HOURS. Seriously. Granted, we were a party of 7, but we even said go ahead and split us to 2 tables nearby. 90 minutes past our reservation time, no apology, nothing. If you can't manage seating, this is truly a problem.

Service is good if at times a bit awkward--I can't explain it. It's like wearing a great suit that is just like half a size off. 

Overall, the food is what you would expect from a steakhouse--the meat is consistent to temp ordered, the sides are ridiculously large and I'm sure 10000 calories each. The creamed corn is probably my favorite, the others are good as well.
The starter bread is not my favorite--sometimes overly dry, overly buttered/sweet/salt (maybe this is their attempt so you don't eat it?). 

The place is beautiful, if a bit loud. 
Pricey but on par with other steakhouses in the area.

Summary: a place for a consistent piece of steak and sides.

This is a review of the Butter Cake with Butter Pecan Ice Cream, Fresh Whipped Cream, and Caramel Sauce. It was honestly mediocre and not worth the calories or price. While I don't enjoy writing negative reviews, I think it's important to be honest. Especially where it concerns relatively high priced or calorie dense food. I had high hopes for this dessert, but it sadly fell short. The cake was luke warm, overly sweet, greasy, and generally bland. While the ice cream tasted like store bought Breyers. Even the caramel sauce was far below average. At a price of around $15 with tip included, that's not acceptable. Bottom line - skip dessert at Del Frisco's. Don't recommend.

I mean we all enjoy Del Friscos food but the management at this specific location are rude. I live in Philadelphia and I've come here numerous times and its always a problem at the front when checking in! Its a restaurant not a secret club they need to be mindful we are paying customers. I feel like im targeted because I am young which people assume young people have no money. Which believe me is not the case! 5 star food 3 star attitude!

Price: 2 (very pricey here)
Ambience: 4
Food: 2
Service: 2

Joined a group in the vault for EDUCAUSE. The vault was cool and we were comfortable. It was a novelty. The server came to take our ordered and I ordered a Caesar salad with extra blue cheese. I also ordered the rib eye steak medium rare. The salad arrived and it had no dressing. No big deal, I asked for a side. 20 minutes later ranch arrived. I asked for blue cheese. Another 10 minutes and it arrived. The server was visually annoyed. A younger girl didn't seem to want to be at work today.

Just started on my completed salad and my steak came medium well. No biggie. I asked them to fix it. At least 8 can eat salad. The group started to eat. After 20 minutes more another a new steak came the same way. I asked a new server (as ours hadn't been seen for 20 minutes) for a replacement at the proper temperature. After another 30 minutes the manager came up to ask how my meal was. I told him I didn't know as I have still not received it. He was flabbergasted. Thankfully I had a new steak at the correct temperature in 10 minutes. Unfortunately, by this time the entire group was finishing dessert, while I stared to eat my steak. It really made me lose my appetite. I spoke to a few other folks at four other tables and they experienced similar mix ups. 

All in all the flavor was good once I received it. Yet after waiting over an hour for the food to arrive properly, I have to say I was disappointed. If you can't handle a large group in your banquet facilities, just don't accept the reservation. I wouldn't go back.

This was a business client dinner that was exceptionally poor.  As a caveat, I do work in the Hospitality/Restaurant business and have for over 25 years as a senior manager.  I recognize things are tough with Covid but the Del Frisco's experience was pretty bad.  After looking at my $1700.00 receipt for 7 people last night, I was just ridiculously disappointed.  Multiple send-backs due to steak temperatures.  One of my guests literally had to wait until the rest of us were half through our meals to get their meal.  Note--they REALLY undercook their steaks.  Even another client mentioned this from THEIR previous mediocre experience.  I cannot really say much good.  A seafood "tower" for 7 people for $427.00 with rubbery shrimp, a few shooters and some misc other items for $61.00 a person was a joke--even at Philadelphia prices.  

The server was perfunctory at best.  Manager stop by didn't even acknowledge the issues to the dinner host (me) with an apology.  For a Tuesday night,  this was a wholly underwhelming experience.  Oh..at end of meal offered the Landry Membership card at departure.  Nice, right?  Yea....they charged me $25.00 for it without mentioning the "fee".    With the price point, the service and execution flaws and the last "shady" pitch for $25.00, would YOU return?

This is only for you fellow Yelpers as this restaurant usually doesn't even bother responding to bad reviews (see below) unless you apparently have been drugged (also see below).
We had a group dinner in a room downstairs -- food was delicious! The butter cake was amazing!  Atmosphere through restaurant was nice!

My cousin reserved a table for ten in the private dining room "the vault" located in the lower level of Del Frisco; in celebration of her 43rd bday 10/1/2021. Reservation was for 8pm.  
Upon my arrival greeters were extremely pleasant, helpful and welcoming.  I wish I could say the same for our waitress.  
I can't recall her name however, this woman was extremely rude, slow and condescending.  While She failed miserably to remember one order to the next or serve our drinks in a timely manner; she did remember to remind us twice about the 1000 dollar minimum spend; since 3 of the guest at our table were no shows. I get it though, maybe she assumed we'd forgotten.
Needless to say, I ordered the prime steak & iceberg salad wedge without bacon. This woman managed to bring me the wrong salad 3xs.  The third time I accepted what was served to me. The steak was flavorful, tender & very well seasoned. However, I'm issuing a self proclaimed sodium warning!
My sister ordered two lobster tails which were served charred, cold, with no garnishings.  It's typically drizzled with butter. The Waitress had the audacity to note on the bill (didn't like) Lobster was never touched. 
While in the restroom our table was cleared of all of our food remaining. Waitress argued with us over the fact she would never remove anything from a table & it was just a spoonful of mashed potatoes left. LIES!!!! I was extremely appalled.
Some of these establishments that pride themselves on minimums; need to retrain staff on proper etiquette. This woman was rude, impatient, obnoxious and I will not ever spend another nickel at this establishment.
This place still BLOWS!!!!!!!!!! Food is overpriced and just Sucks they should turn that place into a WAWA

The five stars is for the food and the service only! The ambiance is "zero stars"!! Why you ask well because your site and the lobby say numerous reasons why you will not be able to come in to the restaurant yet there were numerous people who were not in the least bit presentable for such a       "High class" restaurant. 
Also the music was not appropriate for the mode that such a restaurant should play and having tv's on for football games makes the restaurant look and sound more like a bar/pub than an High end restaurant!!
My wife took me for my birthday and she was very upset. She get she disappointed me because the site does not tell the truth of what you are truly trying to give a customer.  
A memorable experience, for the right reasons. 
Mike M.
ALSO. You claim to have valet parking!!
We arrived at 6:15 and guess what 
"No Valet Parking"!!
I am handicapped and had to walk two blocks from where I parked which cost more than what I would have paid if the Valet parking was available!!
You are NOT a Five, Four, or any stars!!
When it comes to all the above. 
Unbelievable!!

This was my first experience with del Frisco's. It has taken me over a month to write this review.  I did not want to review while I was emotional or angry.  I don't go into the city often for dinner but it was my daughters birthday and she wanted a special night.  I made reservations for 6 people on 8/15/21.  We arrived and had to wait for the car in front of us to discharge its passengers.  Three scantily-clad women climbed out of the car and immediately had to straighten  their outfits as the process of getting out of the car rearranged some vital body parts in congruence with public decency.  We followed these women into the restaurant and immediately questioned if this was the most appropriate restaurant for family dining.  Four of us went to the bar to wait for my daughter and her friend.   I received a call from my daughter who was outside the restaurant, in tears that she wasn't being allowed in because she didn't meet the dress code.  This was unimaginable to me as we just walked in after 3 provocative, indecently dressed women.  Not to mention that my daughter is an extremely conservative dresser.  Her friend had a collared shirt and pants. She had loose pants, sandals and a shirt.  I spoke with the manager who said her belly is showing and that's not allowed.  The bottom of her shirt met there top of her pants.  It was straight neck, sleeveless, not low cut...very tasteful.  I was completely confused as to how 3 women with plunging necklines, one so low you can see her belly were allowed in but a young teenager with no neckline was stopped at the door.  We were told bare midriffs we're not allowed. Yet, there was a man in the bar with gym shorts, tshirt and baseball hat---which is also not allowed per the website.  Clearly these guidelines are enforced subjectively by the management. How and why my teenage daughter was targeted as not being allowed into the restaurant is a reflection on the management and culture of the company.  We made these reservations in celebration of a special night,  Obviously, the manager preferred having provocatively dressed, scantily clad clientele patron the restaurant as opposed to more modestly dressed young women celebrating with their family.  This is not a family restaurant!  I should have read previous reviews about "strip club" atmosphere.  By the way, we went down the street and were welcomed with open arms at McCormick and Schmidt's and has a great celebratory dinner.

business.name: The Steak House at Western Village
business.categories: Steakhouses, Food, Salad, Desserts, Restaurants

reviews.text: We had an lovely, romantic dinner here last weekend. Sierra was our server and she so was on top of things. Everything was so delicious, well timed and beautifully presented. We ordered the crab stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer, along with the sea bass and halibut. Amazing!! The pear mule was perfect! The complimentary photo was so classy and nice to take away! We hope to be back one day!

After a couple of recent disappointments, I am glad to be writing of a positive experience.  The Steak House at Western Village has been on my list to visit for some time, COVID and other factors have limited my opportunity to visit them.  But at last I was able to get a table, the wait was worth it.  The service was first rate, numerous servers abuzz throughout the establishment. The steak was excellent, everything was done with effort and respect. It was a relaxing and enjoyable experience. Of note was the Maple Old Fashioned made table side. The aromas from other dishes was delightful. I will definitely be returning again to sample the other selections.

Make a reservation ahead of time! The whole experience was great! Our waitress was amazing! We went for my birthday and they really made it special! Table side cocktails are a fun experience and the old fashioned with whistle pig maple syrup is the best in town!! Homemade bread brought to the table was warm and fresh! Entrees we're cooked properly! Definitely my favorite place in Reno for a nice dinner! Don't be suspicious because the outside of the casino is kinda dumpy!

Wow, my boyfriend and I had a fantastic experience here the other night! We made reservations and were seated immediately upon arrival, which was great. The guy serving the bread and water introduced himself and the other server. We ordered the table side Caesar, which I've never had before! It was very cool to watch our server make it tableside. Only note is that it's VERY garlic-heavy, which made it difficult for my BF to each much of it, but I really enjoyed it. I ordered the New York 16oz, cooked well done to perfection! I always have issues with fancy steakhouses thinking I'm confused when I order well done and perhaps I don't actually mean it, but I do! Both my steak and his prime rib were absolutely delicious. They also give you a thoughtful little sorbet bite before dinner, which was much appreciated after the flavorful Caesar. 2 steaks, tableside Caesar for two, and a bottle of wine came to $180. This will definitely be our go to spot for celebrations or when we have family in town!

The whole experience was great. This steak house has been on our list for sometime now but they are always booked and we aren't the best at making reservations. However, the hubs surprised me and made a reservation finally, while it was a very late one, we made it work. 

From start to finish, every bite had us wanting more. The seasonal appetizer (pork belly) was tender and you could taste every ingredient with every bite. The Michelada soup tasted like a michelada but warm and full of shrimp. 

The simple sorbet and addition of chocolate chip cookies plus the edginess of the salted butter, it all just worked!

The entrees, I mean, just look at the pictures. Cooked and made to perfection!

The service was just right and easy, for being one of the last tables at closing time, we got exactly what we paid for. While this is clearly an extravagant meal experience, and not a daily one for most of us, it's perfect for a special occasion or random treat yourself date. I can see why they are always so full, everyone who has ever told me these guys are the best in town was spot on!

I have been coming to this steakhouse for 31 years. Probably six times a year. I have always had top-notch service and the best food ever. It's my go to place anytime I want to celebrate or take someone out for a good experience. Matter fact I'm going there in a couple weeks.

First class.  The food and decor are both excellent, the service is also excellent, and many of our friends and neighbors who have been in the Reno area for years will tell you it's the best steak house around.  I would concur in that having eaten at, and enjoyed, the Atlantis, Peppermill (which owns this restaurant), GSE, etc.  The only one I find as good is Cactus Creek, which is wonderful, but not as accessible if you live in Reno or Sparks.  The Steak House at Western Village is very highly recommended, both for a Saturday night or holiday dinner, and for other special occasions.  Go there.  You'll have no regrets. 

The only two things I'd also mention are that the Peppermill discounts may not apply at this restaurant, even though Peppermill owns it.  Second, if you go to Pancho and Willie's, next door, also in Western Village, you can get these giant size margaritas.  They're wonderful and it's something they should also offer at the Steak House.  Highly recommended. 

Merritt Weisinger
Spanish Springs, NV

Service and wait staff were wonderful and very attentive. Ambiance was great, the manner of food preparation and dining was enjoyable.  The sorbet before main course was a nice touch, the warm towels after dinner were soothing. The service, presentation and atmosphere win the stars in this review! Food was just ok the steaks were all good but the Halibut was really dry, pilaf had a little too many extras (didn't get a picture but lots of nuts), baked potato was slightly overdone and risotto (didn't get a picture) was consistency of mashed potatoes.  The food was good but I can't say all great and pricing starts around $40 a plate so I expect attention to overcooking.  Would go again but would order differently. Maybe try the seafood pasta...?

When asking my son-in-law where he wanted to go celebrate his birthday, he suggested we go to a steakhouse in a neighborhood casino, we of course agreed, and later thought, "that was fun" so why not try them all and compare? So we've started on this trek, and the Western Village was
the second.

Seems all of the locals think this is the best steakhouse in town - bar none. We started thinking that to be true when the earliest reservation we could get was in three weeks. Western Village is a unique place, part casino, part hotel, and part truck stop. They're owned by the Peppermill so they know their stuff. 

The room is nicely appointed with lighter colors, in upholstered booths arranged around the room. My wife quickly commented that it seems more light and airy than a typical casino steakhouse. Translation - she liked it better. It's right off the casino floor but you can't really tell when seated. 

The staff, including our waiter were a little young, but all very professional. Compared to other neighborhood casino steakhouse we've frequented the menu was pretty high-end. There are a variety of steaks as you'd expect (I had the filet and it was excellent) but also more elaborate dishes such was Beef Wellington and Steak Diane. Of course they have seafood too, my wife had the salmon but didn't seem too impressed. It certainly was good but we weren't bowled over by the food. 

The hook here is the little touches. They bring sorbet between courses, frequently combing off crumbs and refilling water glasses, they come take a picture then present it to you at the end of the meal.  All of those things are kind of special occasion touches you'd get at a higher end place. My wife loved that. 

Overall a fun experience, but frankly it's the same as you'd get at a bigger property - experience or price-wise. Definitely worth a go, especially for special occasions. 

Tip: Sign up for their players club and a week or so later they'll send you some 1/2 off coupons.

I visited this steak house for a family dinner. We ordered food at around 7:30pm and the main dishes were finally served at around 9:00pm. Even for a steak house, 1.5 hours of waiting time for main dishes is too long. And my steak was over cooked.(I ordered medium rare, but it was almost burnt.) This experience was not satisfying at all considering it's price. So i would never visit this steak house again.

We chose to go out to dinner the night before Thanksgiving because we were going to be doing a lot of cooking  and honestly I wanted a break. Rarely do we go to the steakhouse just because, it's usually to celebrate a birthday or anniversary. It was nice and I'm glad to say that this return visit was delicious!! I was hesitant about dining here again since our last visit wasn't the best but I was proven wrong! 
We started with drinks off the seasonal menu. I had a sangria and he had a cranberry margarita. The sangria had many fall flavors with sliced apples and cranberries. Hubby thought his margarita needed more cranberry flavor but still enjoyed it. 
Hubby said his blackened prime rib was the best he's had. He got the end cut and said the spices were perfect!! He ordered lobster risotto also and said it's as delicious, which is a compliment coming from an east coast guy!! His meal also came with a choice of potato he chose mashed and vegetables.  I ordered slow roasted salmon off the seasonal menu, it came with spinach and Parmesan orzo. It was tasty!!! Both of our meals came with salads as well. 
We are so glad that our little oasis is back on track!!

Can't beat Western village Steakhouse for a fancy dinner in Sparks!
Went for my BFFs birthday tonight.
Great service, atmosphere and food.
Prices have gone up the last year but still can't beat the great food they serve!
Brought our own wine, corkage fee has gone up to $35 but if you have a great bottle of wine (which we did!) it's better to go that way.
Started with assorted breads, salad and an appetizer to share, perfect amount not too filling.
Dinner comes with a vegetable and potato of choice which many steakhouses charge extra for.
Great sorbet palate cleansers before our meal, touch of elegance!
Hot towels are given at the end of the meal, where else do you see that!? 
Birthday girl got a special dessert, we were stuffed so didn't need any.
Special occasion? Western village Steakhouse will treat you right!

I know I might sound like a broken record but this place is amazing. Came here tonight for our once a month or twice a month dinner. We had Sierra as our server and Tamya as our busser. They are definitely amazing. Sierra is our favorite server. Always smiling and very fun to be around. Tamya is always on the ball. She is there to clear our table and fill waters or anything else that is necessary. We always feel so welcome here. 
Katie the manager is always so friendly and makes us feel almost like family. We will definitely be back again and again. 
By far the best value of any steakhouse we have ever been to.

We absolutely love the Steak House at Western Village. The service is some of the best in town. The table side salads, cocktails and deserts are such a fun way to serve. We love celebrating birthdays at the steak house. If you haven't tried it, it is completely worth it.

Even though This  steakhouse is hidden in a little casino they definitely will  impress you. Their service is top notch for  a steakhouse and I've never had a bad meal here in the dozens of times I've gone. The atmosphere is very romantic for special occasions or date night. Definitely a place to try.

Went there for the second time it was not as good as the first time but still good .Oh my voice fish was probably fresh frozen she didn't like it, the prime rib had a lot of fat on it but it was still good I don't know it was all right

I've now been to this steak house twice with family. Everything has always been delicious and we've had zero complaints or errors. The most recent visit we all had got the bone in ribeye. My medium cooked steak was exactly as described at the bottom of the page. In the past a family member had the sea bass and loved it as well. We appreciate the sorbet champagne palette cleanser between courses. They have delicious cheesecake for the birthday boy. I also really liked their butter. They add some kind of black salt and seasoning to it when they bring out the bread. The one thing I do tell people before going is that it may look iffy on the outside but once you're in the steak house it is very high end. They're owned by the same group as the Peppermill's steak house, but better prices. We will definitely be back when there's another birthday. Thank you for the great service!

Just fantastic, prepare to spend money but the mashed potatoes alone are worth every penny, this was hands down the brsy steak ive had in years, seasoned to perfection with great mushrooms and wine? Cant go wrong here

Stopped in tonight for my birthday.  I don't get to visit many "fancy" places, but the menu was too interesting to pass up.  From the bacon cheddar bread with black salt and fennel pollen, to the pink pineapple upside down cake, everything was perfect.  Lucky enough that they were still doing the summer menu, because a few items were going away very soon.  This place is my new favorite birthday stop!

I had an amazing experience at this establishment. I am not one to post on Yelp ever but this was a culinary experience that I had to praise in a public forum. The service was sensational, attentive and professional, the food was equally impressive. As a fine dining industry worker, I was very happy with the whole experience, and I will be returning... hungry for more!

Best steak house in Reno / Sparks a hidden jewel --- Menu amazing as well as food preparation --- service / servers take you back in time when everything is taken care of --- these are true professionals. The prices are unbelievably good!

Our experience was terrific. The understated (for a casino) decor was appreciated by us. The service was stellar - both April and her understudy
were warm and very professional. My
request to receive my food hot was the best response I've ever had. 
We thoroughly enjoyed the coconut prawns, blackened prime rib and the
NY. And the Carol Shelton Zinfandel was delicious and complemented the steaks nicely. My only complaints are with the stuffed mushrooms (tasteless and gloppy) and the butter. The black salt gets all over the tablecloth and is very unattractive. Has the kitchen considered a compound alternative?
All in all a terrific evening.
Always a pleasant place to eat and excellent dining coupons if you are a casino player

Wonderful food, service was above average, but not great.  I believe our server was in training... but she was trying.  Her table presence felt awkward and a bit clumsy.  We had prime rib and a filet.  Both were cook flawlessly and on time.  The appetizer sampler was a spot on old school classic.  The free pictures at out table was a nice touch as well.  I look foward to returning here again.

Went to Western Village for my wife's bday. We had to add some more people to our party but they were booked out. Fortunately for us the Manager Katie was a super star and made it happen for us. I had the blackened prime rib with the whiskey butter sauce that was scrumptious. I washed it down with an old fashion that was made to perfection. Our server April and her assistant Travis were very attentive and timed everything perfectly. It was a great experience and we got a free picture of our night.

business.name: Founding Farmers King of Prussia
business.categories: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Restaurants, Desserts

reviews.text: This place is aesthetically pleasing as well as delicious. The staff was so kind and our server was incredibly informative and helpful. The staff was very accommodating when I came late to my reservation. Overall 9/10!

goodies? Decor and design are well done.  The servers seem to be in the know and I liked the manager.  But the food is "look better than tastes".  We had a night of fiasco where they kept bringing the wrong food. First both of us.  Then one of us had cold dry fried chicken. After they brought the wrong steak back to me.  Then the potato came back with onions.   Finally I just ordered a potato with just butter, so it couldn't get the kitchen too anxious.  I think they had food runners.  What a fiasco. They tried to make it right.  My honey won't be going back any time soon.  I recommend going for maybe dessert and tea, as it really is a lovely interior.   Also.  The steak may have been wrong cut but it was flavored well.

Great variety for the Saturday Brunch! I had a little but if everything. Food included salad, tacos, and impossible sausage, mac n cheese, fish (salmon, fried catfish, etc), and more! The French toast, which looked like a simple block of bread, was delicious, and they had various toppings for it. Our server reminded us to try to crab and artichoke dip, so we were sure to get that. The fruit was also delicious! I ate so much food, but was sure to save room for the juicy and sweet grapefruit! Don't pass that up! So many tasty options to just choose one favorite.

The $29.99 price point is perfect for this. I could imagine paying more, honestly. I'll be visiting again.

Excellent experience tonight.  First I have to say that the restaurant itself is beautiful.  Yet it doesn't feel pretentious, it has a comfortable, casual feel.  I also like that the tables aren't on top of each other, like you might find downtown.  It was nice not to have to hear other people's conversations.  The hostess was excellent in finding us a table that could accommodate a high chair.  Apps were good, drinks pricey but good.  Service was a tad slow, but the bigger problem was that my entree wasn't very good.  Green Chile in the title, but not spicy at all, bland in fact, and mushy.  Still, I would go again to try something else.

Less than stellar experience,  service was good everything else no. Ordered farmers platter out of ribs, back up prime rib out of that as well. Opted for fried chicken specified  thighs, got three pieces of 95% breading with dried out white meat sent this back next three were just as bad (18.99 to boot!). Won't be returning any time soon. Really missed the mark.

Aesthetically this place is beautiful. The attention to detail in design and decor is amazing. The specialty coffee mugs were great, the creamer pitchers were adorable. I really appreciate those little things to make an experience enjoyable. The brunch buffet on the other hand left much to be desired.  Nothing blew us away. Eggs under a heat lamp are never good, hash browns sitting on a warm griddle ended up being hard and dry, beer can chicken was dry. Food was room temperature at best. The double espresso that was ordered was also room temperature.  We asked an employee for salt and instead of just saying "of course" she replied with I'll let your server know. She was definitely bothered that we asked her for something.  I'd hoped for so much more.

There is something for everyone on the menu. The food is phenomenal. Served hot, freshly made, and they give you time between each course. Just enough to give you little time but not too long so you are looking around wondering where your food is. Our server was Craig and he was the best waiter I've ever dealt with. He was friendly, knowledgeable about every item on the menu, and very attentive. They were extremely busy and he had a lot of tables, but he made us feel like the only two in the restaurant.  I highly recommend trying this place at least once and I promise you'll go back again and again. Oh and definitely try Death by Chocolate for dessert.

What a nightmare! No what a $200 nightmare. Went for the Christmas Dinner Buffet because I WAS impressed by the menu, ha ha what a joke. They didn't have half of what was listed on the buffet table, and what they did have was always empty and not refilled, I mean come on that was embarrassing to the guests I invited out for Christmas Dinner....F. F. needs to reimburse everyone who was there for their Christmas Dinner Buffet some of their money back! I will NOT BE RETURNING, and I will recommend to all my friends and family to stay away! Unbelievable! Oh should I mention how we was all packed in small booths on top of each other next to a weird staring teenager who for some reason was mesmerized by me and my guests? The f*ck!?

Went for Xmas Dinner ($44.99/person - which did not include a drink and a 5% up charge for what they said was a fee to cover COVID cost increases that are impacting all restaurants). Buffet was messy, some meats at the carving station were not available for our entire time frame, salad area was never refreshed while we were there, meat that was there was tough, most desserts were not all available while we were there. Super disappointed. Honestly, we would have felt cheated if the Xmas Dinner was $22.50/person. Clear that they were severely understaffed but they kept more reservations than they could realistically handle. It was interesting that nobody on staff ever asked how things were or if we enjoyed the meal... I think they knew it was a madhouse. We felt sorry for the staff, what an awkward position for them. We love supporting local restaurants--even chains like FF, but we won't be returning to this establishment. BTW--we were seated 15 minutes after our reservation. Again, epically disappointed from first to last!

Party of 5 went for dinner on sunday. The place was pretty packed but we were lucky to be seated right away. I love their atmosphere and decorations. Overall food were good, especially, pasta was amazing. Pizza was average. They are known for chicken but chicken was rather disappointing. Too salty for my taste. 
Except there was long gap in between serving food, overall experience was great. The server was pleasant as well and attentive 

Will definitely revisit

I've been to Founding Farmers a hand full of times in the past and this year I went with family on Christmas Eve. It was actually surprisingly busy and lively. The hostess was pleasant and greeted us upon arrival  so I was hopeful that the rest of our time there would go well but needless to say that didn't happen. Our waiter was inattentive and lackluster and the service was super slow. It took 15 minutes just to get drinks. When the food arrived it was cold and some of it was inedible- especially my over easy eggs that were basically raw. When we were ready to leave we paid the check in cash and the waiter didn't even give us all of our change but we didn't feel like tracking him down or waiting another 20 minutes for him to come back  around just to get it so we left. He never thanked us for our patronage or said anything to use before we left. I won't be breaking my neck to go back there- especially during the holiday season when I can just spend my money someplace else with good service and friendly servers. This was a miserable experience.

Founding Farmers in KoP is one of my favorite restaurants in the area & certainly in the town center. I feel pandemic-era FF is less awesome than what it used to be by way of portion sizes and quality.

I visited the restaurant the first few times to dine in person over the last couple months or so. I order my favorite items on the menu like their dark & stormy cocktail and the chicken pot pie.

The d&d cocktail is now served in a smaller glass instead of a plentiful beer pint and it no longer is served with a piece of candied ginger, though it still costs the same if not more. The chicken pot pie is half the size it used to be and is now stuffed half with oversized potatoes which means there's very little filling of chicken, sauce or other veggies.

The insult to injury here now is that at the bottom of the bill, there's an additional $3 or so unadvertised fee for recovery or something like that. So basically... They slash the quality and portion sizes but keep prices the same...would be better if they at least maintained quality and then on top of that, they also add unadvertised fees.

I used to blindly and loyally talk up FF to anyone, but TBH after considering the ridiculousness of how they've adjusted their menu and offering along with the unadvertised fee, I think I've sobered up a bit.

Had a waiter that was good with my gluten-intolerance, the last time I came here with my family. I ordered the salmon which was wonderful, however the second time I had come two nights ago with my mother while out Christmas shopping, I didn't have any consideration towards my allergy.  The waiter we had, promised my cauliflower steak would be prepared gluten-free, which means exclude the barley. Barley isn't gluten-free, as the waiter was claiming. It's not even rice. It just looks like it. I didn't dare to eat it, because I feared going into shock. There has been others with my allergy that have done that. If you have a gluten-allergy this restaurant isn't for you, go to Tru-Foods they're much better than this, or that nice Mexican Restaurant across the street. Any restaurant, which takes food allergies seriously is worth spending your time and money on!

The food was exceptional, the staff was friendly and attentive. Me and my family chose the brunch. The brussel sprouts were amazing, the catfish, the Texas brisket and the honey glazed carrots were all delicious. I could go on and on you but I won't you just have to go and taste for yourself!!

Just okay overall. Nothing to rave about here. Drinks were very good, we got a glass of wine and one of the house bourbons. However, the food was not impressive. We both ordered pasta dishes, Cacio e Pepe and Butternut Squash Ravioli. 

The pata in the Cacio e Pepe was overcooked and the sauce had a texture similar to glue -- it was a mushy mess of a dish. The Butternut Squash Ravioli was better, but rather flavorless. Butternut Squash should be sweet, moist, and earthy, but this filling was dried out and just not very good. 

On top of all this, a 5% restaurant recovery charge? You know, I am all for helping out the local spots but I am confused by such a steep charge at a chain restaurant, which happened to be PACKED on a weeknight by the way (which I hear from a server this was the norm). I get the supply chain issues, labor shortages, and related consequences of the virus, but why did you increase this to 5% when it was just 3% last year during the height of the pandemic?

Tasty food and service! Service was excellent. For the food, the freshest fried chicken I've ever had! The mashed potatoes and collard greens were cold when the plate arrived and the greens could have used some salt but still very tasty.

I guess being close to the mall around the holidays makes it busy and a bit hectic for staff. However there is no excuse for rudeness. We had a reservation and when we got there the table was not ready. No worries, we'll just grab a drink at the bar and wait. When I asked the bartender for a drink menu - "sir, you will have to wait a few minutes" For a drink menu?? Ok, so we left the bar with no drink and my girlfriend got paged saying our table was ready. When she went up to the desk to check in and say that we were paged - the receptionist rudely lifted her finger, cut her off mid sentence, and said "I'm helping another guest". 

The food was good. Waiter was good.

Arrived on a Friday morning and was immediately greeted by the hostess upstairs. We arrived around 8am and it didn't appear to have anyone seated but I was wrong. One area of the upstairs area had a few morning customers. 

Once seated, the manager approached our table to take our drink orders (Bellini and Hibiscus tea) and as soon as he turned around our server was behind him and he was telling the server what we ordered.  Not too long afterwards he arrived with our drinks and explained that his manager was helping out a bit due to staff shortage that morning. 

He took our order (Valley Forge Breakfast) and we didn't have to wait long for our food to arrive. Looking at some of the meals other people had ordered had me wanting to taste test their food, there was a French toast that looked like there was chocolate on it and it looked sooo good. 
One Valley Forge breakfast was ordered w/ciabatta bread, hash browns and the other had the English muffin and Parmesan grits. Both came with 2 eggs and we selected the Applewood bacon.  Everything taste really good, the English muffin was fresh and thick. One bite and I could tell it was fresh and not store bought. 
Everything was perfect. Staff was friendly and attentive despite their being  a staff shortage. 

Note:  There is a 5% recovery charge for the restaurant due to the pandemic and the effects it has had on the restaurant industry.

Ordered the spicy fried chicken and was really pleased with it. Mashed potatoes were fine and the collard greens needed some additional flavor.

Quick service!

Fried chicken 5/5
Side dishes 3/5
Service 5/5

Definitely worth a stop for the chicken alone.

Amazing service and even better food. I for the fried chicken entree. It had so much flavor
 Would come
Back
Again

I came here a couple of months ago, and as far as the layout and environment very chill, and clean. Everyone was nice and I had an aztec latte which was really good, I enjoyed the spicy kick it gave, but the food was decent at best. If I'm being honest for it's grand appearance there wasn't anything special about the food. Overall the experience was okay. I would like to touch on one thing and it is why I won't bother going back. They state why they names it "Founding Farmers". It's and od to founding fathers, and on their site they state because the founding fathers were trailblazers and built this country. As a black foodie this is one hundred percent wrong. America was built off the backs of enslaved Africans. And the founding fathers owned people. For the halfway decent food and this problematic statement I personally wouldn't recommend and they're only getting 3 cause I really like coffee.

Tip: Make a reservation using Open Table. 

This restaurant has always been on my list to try out. I met a few friends for dinner the other night. I had a reservation and when we arrived We we're seated almost immediately. Everything turned out great. 

Our waiter Ryan was very attentive, especially since it was his first week. He did a great job at explaining things the best he could. He was great! Hustled all night and took great care of us. 

I love all the small details. The silverware had numbers on it that signifies things that go to the restaurant that Ryan knew the answers too. Even the cute creamer containers that were metal milk cartons. 

The food was great. I ordered the spatchcock chicken and enjoyed it! It was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. The sauce it was laid in was super tasty. My friends ordered burgers and had no complaints. Earlier in the week my brother had the pot roast and enjoyed it and raved about it. My favorite dessert was the peanut butter pie! So good!!! 

I will definitely be returning

We were excited to have a lunch buffet after almost two years not eating out. Somewhat disappointed. Choices are limited. Those tiny donuts, spoon size yogurt, did not find bread pudding cookie cheesecake. Pancakes look like kids making so irregular. Sample plates are cheap plain tiny donut cinnamon bun pound cake. Glad we came, just to conclude no more.

Ordered a grilled cheese with avocado, received a grilled cheese with bacon which is not an acceptable substitution as a vegetarian. Also, this is the skinniest grilled cheese I've ever seen. The 7 cheese mac is unremarkable. Way overpriced.

This was a thanksgiving luncheon with family. The price was $42.99/ per person with limited choice of menu. We also picked the Prime Rib which was an additional $8 on top of the $42.99. First off, the regular dining area was not open but rather the small section to the side. The food seemed like a premade and heated up platter that was thrown unto a plate for serving. They had people eat bread off the table because they couldn't spare plates. And the was a restaurant recovery fee of $5.70 included on the check. Hello, they charge 42.99 a person for food I've could have scraped up from a supermarket's buffet, Wegmans had better food and service. It felt more like hurry up eat your platter and go on. Today was thanksgiving and founding farmers, you go there for a reason, farm to table, but today and for goodness sakes, it just felt like an excessively overcharged soup kitchen. 

Should have taken more pictures but was rather upset throughout the entire experience.

business.name: Osteria
business.categories: Nightlife, Restaurants, Italian, Bars, Wine Bars

reviews.text:
came here for restaurant week and was so glad i did! they let you choose any two appetizers, two pastas, and one main for the table, and there's also a dessert at the end. they were super accommodating with my allergy situation and gave me alternatives which i was really lucky about how well they handled it. the interiors are also so pretty. my only complaint is that for a tuesday night their service was very slow. i stood at the host stand for 10 mins before they came to address us and we waited another ten minutes for them to prepare us a table. the restaurant was already quite empty and i saw about 7 waitresses in addition to the host so i don't really understand why this happened.

in terms of food, i really recommend the candele-- best dish of the night. i would say the pork milanese was cooked very well and would be a top recommendation of mine. the francobolli ravioli, charred octopus, and yellowtail crudo were all delicious as well. 

the apple crumble gelato was delicious and fluffy-- highly recommend!

definitely try to get a seat in the outdoor area- it's so pretty!

We had been searching for some good Italian food when visiting Philly, and we found it!! If you want homemade pizza and pasta, this is your spot. We had trouble finding a reservation and were able to find one here for the day before, so it may be easier to get a reservation here compared to other iconic Italian spots but that doesn't mean the food isn't as good by any means.
The garden room is SO beautiful I would highly recommend coming here for a brunch or dinner to celebrate something. 

Heres what we had:

Aperol Spritz and Red Wine- I wasn't a huge fan of this spritz sadly, it was super sweet, but the food made up for it! My boyfriend had red wine and that was really tasty.

Broccolini Caesar to start- this was amazing, I love adding in some veggies to a carb-filled meal

Chicken Liver Rigatoni- do NOT let the chicken liver scare you. This was some of the best pasta I had had in a while, the flavors were amazing!! I am also a huge rigatoni fan so that helped too :)

Proscuito Arugula Pizza- I thought that this was amazing. My boyfriend wasn't as big a fan as me because he doesn't love too many greens on his pizza but I LOVE lots of arugula on my pizza so it was perfect for me!! 

Homemade Gelato- This was AMAZING. So fluffy and flavorful, huge fan!! Our food took a long time to come out (we barely noticed) so our waitress surprised us with this gelato on the house. 

I definitely recommend Osteria!!

I came here for restaurant week (4 courses for $40) and it was amazing. I did not prepare for all the food I was about to eat. You and your guest(s) choose 2 appetizers, 2 pastas, and an entree + chefs dessert. They serve everything family style so the portions were very generous! Every course we ordered was mouth-watering, presentation was nice, and service was attentive. This was a delicious restaurant week and really gives guests the opportunity to explore what the menu has to offer!

Yes, yes, yes! Come here for happy hour or dinner and you will not be disappointed at all! The ambiance and decor is on point, staff extremely professional and attentive, and the food is mind blowing.

A very intimate and romantic setting. I highly recommend dining here.

I came here for restaurant week with 2 other people. $40/person and we were presented with 7 courses to share. Every single dish was incredible! 

We ordered the Charred broccolini Caesar, grilled octopus, Rigatoni, Candele, Chicken al mattone, and budino. Winners were the charred broccolini Caesar and both pasta dishes.

I cannot wait to come back here and try more pasta + pizza! 10/10

Came here on Tuesday for happy hour with my friend. Their happy hour is from 4-6 but we only got to enjoy an hour of it since we got there at 5. They had a decent menu and more importantly, decent prices for happy hour. They have a cute interior with dim lighting for dinner vibes and their outdoor patio is so adorable especially when it's lit up. 

I originally ordered their cocktail of the day, pineapple daiquiri but it was too sweet for me and didn't taste like it had alcohol. I told the waitress and she was kind enough to let me get another drink - red wine, $5! The wine was great and I regret not asking for the name lol FYI, the same glass of red wine is $13 outside happy hour - that's almost 3 glasses! 

We ordered some food as well - also included in their happy hour. We ordered the broccolini and margarita pizza. The broccolini was good but the margarita pizza was great! It had the perfect amount of sauce and their crust was crisp to perfection. They also provided complimentary bread and oil - and bread is amazing as always, especially free bread lol 

Happy hour was located at the bar and the nearby tables - but I don't think they did a good job of spacing tables apart. I felt they were really close to each other and it was pretty crowded for that area given the times we're in. They did comply with the new vaccine mandate and requested to see a copy of my vaccine card (I had a picture on my phone) and also verified it with my Id.
Excellent service. Great food. Cool atmosphere. Wood fire pizzas. Wood fire grill. Pastas from scratch

This is one of my favorite spots around for amazing food and a wonderful experience. The restaurant has a great layout including kitchen view, garden area, and outdoor seating. The menu includes an assortment of northern Italian specialties. We ordered multiple plates from the appetizer, pasta, and protein sections. Everything was superb and the random timing of the arrival of dishes makes it very relax and authentic. Sean, the manager was very nice and checked in with us during the meal. I highly recommend you give Osteria a try. You won't be disappointed.

A dark ambience kind of Italian restaurant. I think I would have enjoyed our experience better if we were not smushed to the wall where the next table was less than one feet away from us.

The food and drinks themselves were great. We ordered two cocktails: 1) Milano coretto and 2) gin cocktail and we liked the gin one a lot. The Milano corretto smells like espresso but once you taste it, it was quite bitter.

For dishes we ordered the squash, the bucatini and the rigatoni as highly recommended by our server. All three were hits. I don't think I could chose quite a favorite although the rigatoni had an aftertaste (probably from the chicken liver) that I think could throw some people off. I think in that case, go for the bucatini.

Our server was very friendly and was quite attentive throughout the whole time. I would definitely go again.

Osteria has one of my favorite happy hours in Fairmount and honestly the city. My favorite is the chicken liver pasta and all of their cocktails I've had have been amazing. The service is also really great and the servers are all incredibly nice and knowledgeable.

Was really looking for a great experience, Osteria did not deliver. I think this place is fine for pizza or a small plate and a glass of wine, but otherwise it's a pass for me.  Lots of small plates for sharing and some had very good flavor.  Anolini, Prosciutto  plate and Mushroom ravioli were all good.  Grilled Broccolini caesar was just cold, chewy broccolini with some cheese... like chewing on shoelaces.  The worst was the prawn entree...horrible and sent back.  Dry, mushy, fishy, awful.  Ordered something different, 20 min later it arrived.  Then they offered to comp dessert which was the right thing to do, and another 20 min as I am trying to leave, that arrived.  Server was apogetic but honestly the food and associated price will probably keep me from returning.

I came here for my birthday tonight and had an absolutely awful experience. I made a reservation for 6:45 and was not seated until 7:10 leaving my party of 8 standing in the doorway for almost 30 minutes without even being acknowledged. After we finally got seated our orders were not taken for another 30 minutes. Our drink orders were put in and we were served our drinks. 10 minutes later the server came over and said he forgot to ask for our ids, someone in my party left their purse at home and therefore did not have their id on them. The server took the drink away after it was already partially gone. By the time our food finally came out most dishes were cold and the "family style" portions looked like a kids meal. I am very disappointed in my experience tonight and will not be coming back.

I had been to this establishment several times over the past two years and was always satisfied with the service as well as the quality of the menu. Unfortunately my recent visit yielded a completely different experience. To start the staff appeared to worn and bedraggled. The seating was haphazard with take it or leave it approach. The pasta had way too much parmesan that smothered the taste and made all the pasta taste the same.
Worst of all was our waiter who clearly was not having a good night and decided to abandon us after we finished the main course. This was topped off by the "bouncer" that acted like he worked for the restaurant. Unfortunately for our table the bouncer stopped to ask how our experience was without introducing himself or engaging in any way. We had to assume he played some roll at the restaurant?  He did not like the candid input received and retuned shortly thereafter with the check. My kind of guy! This is a place to be avoided that treats customers so poorly and hires staff that have no manors or communication skills. Osteria - food is questionable, service is poor and head staffing needs some lessons in basic manors.

Disaster. The service was absurd. Our table was served one drink (the waiter was m.i.a), the food came out all at once, the shrimp were mealy, the 4 dishes of pasta tasted the same. The waiter showed up once (John). AND The new manager (Mike) was the most unprofessional representative of a restaurant I have ever met. The most upsetting part-Both Mike and John were discriminatory towards someone at our table(being dealt with). SO SAD. This restaurant has seriously gone down hill. Don't go.

You never expect to be discriminated against at a fine dining establishment, but Osteria checked that box tonight. The GM (Mike) insisted that our handicapped friend was intoxicated (instead of, you know, handicapped) and effectively asked our table of 6 to leave. No explanation was otherwise given, and we were halfway through an otherwise pleasant dinner. Bad management since the sale. Very sad for what was a good restaurant, but no more. Tonight was a new low for restaurants everywhere.

The food was good but the service was terrible.  It took at least 20 minutes for our server to take our drink order.  Entrees came spread out 15 minutes apart.  This was our first time dining there and definitely our last.  We are understanding of staffing shortages but Osteria needs to limit their reservation.

I really wish I didn't have to give this review, but I did not have a 5-star experience tonight. This was my 3rd visit to Osteria during happy hour. I usually order the cacio de Pepe, broccolini and whatever pizza is on the special. Today I while visiting with two family members, we ordered drinks, 2 cacio de pepe, the apple/endive salad and 1 broccolini. The wine and drinks were great, but the food tasted like a pound of salt was added to every dish. The food  tasted nothing like my two previous visits. We could not finish the pasta or broccolini due to the amount of salt. We did let our server know, but no accommodations were made. 
I'm pretty disappointed since I was beginning to consider Osteria a go-to happy hour spot. I may return again, but I won't be ordering the cacio de Pepe or broccolini again.

This was a last minute reservation for my wife and I on a Friday night. We moved to Fairmount a year ago and have been trying various restaurants as the pandemic restriction permitted. This one was within biking distance of us so we rode over. What an excellent choice! Everything was completely on point. The service, the food, the atmosphere...all exactly as we all hope for every time we click "confirm reservation". Here's a weird mention...the bread pre-meal was dangerously delicious. My wife had to pull it away from me otherwise I wouldn't have eaten anything else. 

I won't belabor this review beyond..."its good, go" because honestly, it feels like I'm gushing now but...well I am.

As a side note, they must be treating their staff well as there were definitely enough of everyone to and all staff seemed pretty relaxed and cheerful.

Came here Friday October 15 for a 7pm reservation.  Seated promptly, by friendly staff.   Was told that there was no substitutions per the chef, and we had to order all at once, we could not order in courses.  We serve also told that the food would come up whenever it was ready, not necessarily at the same time.  This lead to a dish never arriving, we had it removed from the bill. The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable, but disappeared for extended periods of time, I can only assume overburdened with too many tables, not a lack of skill. The food was good, not "OMG this is awesome" . The service and food at a restaurant that has an average $60-75 per person  cost needs to be better.  I would go back for the perfect Old Fashion the bartenders made.
Very good service. Food was good. Fun atmosphere. Great apps. Entrees mediocre. Would go back.

Osteria was a mostly great experience, I'd certainly recommend to others and go again myself. The menu is designed for every dish to be shared with the table, and they recommend placing your entire order at once and enjoy receiving dishes as they're prepared. We personally were hoping for a bit more of an introduction to the menu, seeing as how it's largely in Italian some additional guidance and recommendations would have been helpful. The bread service was fresh focaccia and was amazing, definitely got us excited about everything else coming our way. I was most excited about the Francobolli Ravioli, which was a little disappointing; they weren't nearly as filled as I was expecting, and could have used a good bit more goat cheese to balance out the sweetness of the corn. The Salumi Misti was fantastic, along with the Flank Steak. The baked ricotta was nice and lemony, though one in my party thought a bit too much that it almost tasted artificial. The ricotta came with more focaccia, this time grilled and still as delicious. We were far too full for desserts but all the gelatos sounded fantastic.

My wife and I dined here and were blown away. Our server John was awesome! Very friendly and made us feel at home immediately. He gave a great intro to the menu and all the food/drinks were on time and tasted great! We will be back. Thanks John!

Came for happy hour, had a great experience! Service was great, food was good, and drinks were great as well! Happy hour is served only at the bar and in these couch/armchair setups (that basically each seat 2) that I think were called the "lounge" area. We sat at the couches and had a great time.

Had the daily cocktail which was vodka-based, and enjoyed it. 
Chicken Liver Rigatoni - Quite salty. (and I normally like salty foods, but this was too much) Flavor was good but I had to drink a lot of water to get through it.
White pizza - Never had white pizza before but it was great! Would recommend. 
Scamorza alla piastra - mozzarella +honey on sourdough. This was pretty incredible... especially the honey. 
The free bread was also amazing!! Would definitely recommend the happy hour experience :)

fire happy hour. $5-6 wines/cocktails and nice amounts of pasta for 8$? good seasonal pizza too (squash white pizza for us). it's only offered in the lounge, which is really just like 2 ikea strandmon chairs in the back, or the bar so you do need to navigate eating from a table thats at like knee level.

food actually tastes good, and you're getting a good amount of it. prices are definitely affordable. highly rec for happy hour.

ALSO they start you off with a bunch of free foccacia which is great if you come starving.

I am very sad to say I did not have the best experience here...I went with a friend for dinner on a Friday and to start this all off the restaurant is stunning. I was blown away by how beautiful it was and was so excited to try it. Overall the Restaurant is overpriced for the quality that they give you for example we started off with drinks and I got the Lazzi and when the drink came out it was not even half of the glass full it was about 1/4 of the glass full it was supposed to be frozen but it was almost mushy because most of the ice was melted when it got to me and for $13 it was definitely not worth it. Next we got the Margherita pizza the bottom was completely burnt and black I didn't even finish one slice since the burnt part overwhelmed the full taste and my friend had two slices and we didn't take the rest home. Finally I got the Bucatini Pasta because I asked our waiter for a recommendation and my friends got the same and the pasta was raw and hard and I thought it was just a mistake on just my dish but my friend had the same experience and ultimately we ended up not even eating half of ours. To ultimately pay over $50 each and not even eat half of the things that we were given is really disappointing and although the service was nice and the restaurant itself is beautiful I don't believe that I will be returning.

I'd like to share my experience this evening, which was deeply disappointing. We came to Osteria to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary and we're disappointed by the horrible service. I made our reservation 1.5 weeks ago. I confirmed it on the phone and reminded the individual I spoke with of our anniversary. Upon entering the restaurant there was no greeting, no happy anniversary, which I didn't think anything of until we we're led to our table outside. This table seemed like in afterthought. It was outside right by the entrance gate, not in the greenhouse or in the true outdoor dining area. It was loud and smelled like diesel exhaust from all the cars going by. The view was of Broad Street.
I asked Grace, the host who led us to our table, to take our photo because it was out anniversary. She begrudgingly agreed, took a few awful photos that she put no effort into, and didn't even have the politeness to say happy anniversary or enjoy your meal. We then requested to sit in the green room, with all the other happy, comfortably seated diners but instead, were led inside. We ordered four pastas, the baked ricotta, a cocktail, and a glass of prosecco. The prosecco and cocktail took 20+ minutes to arrive. I didn't drank one sip and it was room temperature. I did not take another. I voiced my concerns to TJ that this was our anniversary and I was expecting a different experience and he was unapologetic. In fact, rather than use this as an opportunity to improve our experience, he did the opposite. TJ did not check on us once during our meal. He did not bring clean plates or silverware. Another server took pity on us and brought us clean plates for our pastas. The pastas were not timed properly. They all arrived within 5 minutes. While the fazzoletti and the ravioli were delicious, good food is only fully enjoyed by good ambiance and service. Grace and TJ need further instruction and training on customer service.
1) Grace was unfriendly, unwelcoming, and sat us at a horrible table that was very noisy due to sitting in front of traffic. Not the romantic setting for our anniversary we had hoped for.
2) We asked to be seated in the green room, where there were empty tables, and were denied
3) Our server, TJ, did not check on us ONCE during our entire meal. He picked up a plate and when we called to him he did hear or pretended not to hear. We had to ask multiple times for clean plates for dinner after our antipasti.
4) When I communicated that we were disappointed with the seating and the experience to TJ, he did nothing to improve it... nor did he apologize.
5) It took 20+ minutes to receive our drinks - my prosecco was room temperature.
6) We were there for a special occasion, not once was it acknowledged. There was a mind-blowing lack of customer service.
7) The four pastas were timed so that they all arrived within a few minutes- they didn't even fit on the table.

The food was good, but the service was despicable.  I wish we had gone to WM Mulherins instead.  Better food and better service.

business.name: Kayne Prime
business.categories: Restaurants, Steakhouses

reviews.text: We were absolutely blown away by our time at Kayne Prime. The food was amazing, drinks were great and service was awesome! Highly recommend taking time to enjoy a meal here. We will definitely be back!

Best food of my life. Best meal of my life. Have never and will never have a meal this good. The bacon, the kale, the filet, the salmon, the broccoli, the potato gratin, and COMPLIMENTARY SEA SALT-GHEE BREAD that was sent from heaven? You can't top it. I will have my engagement dinner here, rehearsal dinner here, bring every person I know here, crave when I'm pregnant, and I will have them host my farewell dinner one day. I love it. Service was spectacular. Vibes were on point. Lighting was sexy. I will not eat for a week because nothing will taste like the meal I had tonight. This food is what life is about.

We went for dinner last night at Kayne Prime.  I was looking forward to a fine dining steak house.  The vibe was nice, beautiful restaurant with a great view of the downtown Nashville skyline from the bar.  We ordered a drink before getting seated, titos/soda water.  When the bill came it was $11.  Totally reasonable for a cocktail.   After we gave our card, the bill came back to add tip & signature & it was $13.67.  I was shocked that $2.67 added on for taxes, not tip.  My husband verified with the manager that the 25% tax rate was in fact correct.  She said yes it was.  I was surprised that it was so high but no problem,  paid it.  

Our server was very friendly.  We ordered a nice dinner, 2 appetizers (wedge salad & cotton candy bacon).  Both were really good.  We ordered 3 entrees (one 10oz filet cooked medium-plus, one 6 Oz wagyu filet cooked medium rare & one scallops) along with 4 side dishes (creme brulee corn, potato agnolti, roasted broccoli & Mac n cheese).  When the entrees & sides arrived the sides were HOT as expected, the entrees were not even warm.  The medium plus steak was cooked medium rare, the scallops were gritty, cool & tasted rather fishy according to my husband. The creme brulee corn was exactly how I imagined it, too sweet for my liking but the others in my party liked it ok.  The potato agnolti was AMAZING, mac n cheese & broccolini were good as well.  The steak toppings were additional costs so we ordered a trio for $10 (chimichurri, truffle butter & truffle bernaiase).  The steaks were so NOT hot that the truffle butter never melted on the steaks.  The chimichurri sauce was delicious. 

The manager that came & spoke to my husband in the bar explained about the taxes & was super friendly.  Even said sorry about the confusion, I will send an appetizer to your table on me.  In a fine dining establishment,  I wouldn't think that I would have to "remind" management of their comment so waited to see if the bill reflected her offer, it didn't.   But I'm not one to complain or bicker about $20 but it was just the principal. My overall experience was one that I wouldn't return to this place but it is beautiful & a nice romantic place to try.
Ill never get sick of this place! Excellence service as always. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Love Kayne Prime! Steaks are always great and the service is phenomenal. Someday I'm going to try the bone marrow appetizer. It looks rich and creamy!

Was looking to come here to celebrate my boyfriend's job offer on short notice, but couldn't get last minute reservations. We showed up around when they opened & got seated at the bar. I was a little hesitant to drop so much here while not even having a table, but our experience at the bar was simply amazing -- not loud & partyish at all & the view was great. I also really appreciated that our bartender properly set our places, so it really was like a full dinner experience. 

We ordered the 10 oz wagyu filet, macaroni grantine, Brussels sprouts, & brûléed corn, plus each got a glass of Malbec. The wine was chilled perfectly (many places don't properly chill reds!). A little after we ordered, the kitchen brought out complimentary amuse-bouche of compressed honeydew & prosciutto for us, so again it felt like we were getting the same dinner experience as those in the dining room. The kitchen perfectly timed all the food to come at the same time, and brought us their complimentary popovers as well. 

I really cannot emphasize enough how perfect the food was here. The wagyu was perfectly cooked & tender, the Brussels sprouts had truffle oil, the mac was perfectly creamy & crunchy. I was blown away by the flavors & textures of the corn -- it's jalapeño creamed corn with a brûléed top, so the sweetness perfectly offsets the spice & the cream goes well with the sharp sugar topping. Their popovers are also incredible. 

We even shared a steak & it was still quite expensive, but on the other hand we could only finish about half of each side & took the rest home. I highly recommend Kayne Prime for a special occasion as they made us feel special even when we couldn't get a table in the dining room. I'll be back!

My wife and I had Friday night reservations in early December. We sat at the bar before dinner to have some cocktails. Kyle was awesome and got us started off right. Dinner was EXCELLENT. The bone marrow appetizer was mind blowing. I could've just kept ordering it. The potatoes aligot appetizer was all I hoped it would be as well. Our server was great, the meal was top notch, and we visited the bar one more time for hand crafted excellence and some recommendations before we headed into the Gulch for more libations. If I find myself in Nashville again, I will be paying another visit.
Service was not impressive. The presentation did not live up to expectation. The food was ok. I do not recommend.

Here it is. The best meal Star to Finish I have ever had. Never thought I could say it. Been blessed to travel the globe. Nashville!  Unbelievable!  Shiitake pepper appetizer, Wagyu fillet to Banana bread and Mascarpone ice cream. Staff was incredible!  What an unbelievable experience!

I celebrated my 40th Birthday at Kanye Prime. Traveling in from KY and my guest from Florida I started the planning process in early September and after reviewing several reviews selected Kanye Prime as the venue of choice for a formal dinner party of 10. I contacted the restaurant and received an almost immediate response back from the event manager (Kelly) who was FANTASTIC to work with. We went through private room options, menus, and ultimately I secured a reservation with the venue. During the months that led up to my reservation, Kelly and I kept in constant touch and I felt reassured my bday dinner would be perfect and it was! Thank you Kanye Prime for a first class and Amazing experience. Oh... the food was FANTASTIC! Yes you all want to know about the food! Everything including dessert was phenomenal!
