One of the beat steakhouses I have ever been to.  The starters were phenomenal, highly recommend the bacon with Cotton Candy and the lobster with popcorn.  The flavors and contrasting tastes made them both a crowd favorite.  Grant our server was amazing and very attentive.  There was a mishap wirh one of the steaks, but Heather the manager was quick to respond and rectified the situation very generously.  I will definitely go back next time I am in Nashbille and highly recommend for not only he food, but the staff and armosphere alao.

Very good meal, but loses a star because the food didn't live up to the price. Appealing but loud dining room. Sides were very good (root vegetables). Steak was good, but not what you'd hope for given the price. Enjoyed the meal but probably won't return.
We had a wonderful dinner celebrating our anniversary. The staff went out of their way to make our evening very enjoyable.

My favorite steak house in the world!  Our party of four entered the dramatic foyer and were promptly escorted to our reserved table.  The Waygu steaks were perfectly mediumly rare, prepared sous vide.  The salmon was also perfect and served with caviar garnish.  Service was warm and professional -- and delivered via a team.  This is a locally owned restaurant and far exceeded any chain in which we've dined around the country.  Highest recommendation.
Impeccable service by Liam and Thomas. The food is perfection.  It's a beautiful space and away from the touristy noise.

Came here for a birthday dinner and it did not disappoint. Food was cooked perfectly! Tons of flavor and tenderness. Drink selection was fantastic and everything on the menu was excellent. Highly recommended

Pretty pricey experience but the steaks were awesome and the service was good and attentive.  14oz NY Strip quite possibly the best I've ever had (and I eat at a lot of great prime chop houses).   My wife had the fillet and it was top notch.  The popovers are a treat.   Again, a bit pricey but if you love good steak you won't be disappointed there.

Well located with valet parking. Greeted and seated on time for our  reservation of a six top. FYI, gratuities are added for tables of 7+. Large footprint with extensive available seating. Several sub bars are available with adjacent meeting areas. Two rehearsal dinners and a 20+ bachelor dinner were all running concurrently. They are somehow well staffed during these trying times. With the separate areas the noise level was comfortable.
Zoe greeted us , got waters, asked for special occasions and maintained our table through our meal. Mathew our waiter took our drink orders and checked on food allergies
We shared the popcorn buttered lobster, cheese plate and bone marrow canoes, all very tasty.
We had a cross section of the menu steaks which are extensive. Both Wagu and prime, the strip steak progression and filets. They hit the temp on 6/7. My Wagu ribeye was way over. The manager expedited a new one literally within minutes and waited while I checked the new one. Great manager!  
The sides are all shareable. We shared the mushrooms, crepe brûlée corn and potatoes. Classic popovers we're delicious
The wine list is varied both in selection and price. It's not an encyclopedia like most steak houses.
We shared crime brûlée and cc cookies/milk.
High price point but matching high quality service and products.

Highly recommend 

Slainte

Enjoyed visit to Kayne Prime on a business dinner.  I think their unique items are lobster popcorn and bacon with cotton candy as appetizers.  But, I enjoyed most their sea food tower.  Wonderful large prawns are on the tower.  Only addition they could use is side of melted butter for lobster.  For sides we had the kale salad, iceberg salad, tater tots, au gratin potatoes, and mixed veg. The kale salad, au gratin potatoes and tater tots were wonderful!! I ordered the 6oz Filet Mignon done medium.  It was good, but a little more on the medium well side.  The ambiance was great and the restaurant is much larger than it seems from the outside with multiple rooms. Valet parking is available too.

We came to Kayne Prime for the first time back in June and it was one of the best dining experiences we've ever had. The service was great throughout the meal and everyone was very friendly and helpful. We started out with a cocktail and bourbon to pair with the lobster popcorn, which was so indulgent and absolutely delicious. The staff noticed how hungry we were and they brought out popovers early for us. They were so buttery and fluffy and we could eat them everyday (but you really shouldn't!). We both got bone-in ribeyes for our entree along with a variety of delicious set of sauces (bone marrow, horseradish, and blue cheese). The steaks were cooked perfectly and were one of the best steaks we've ever had. We finished our meal with an espresso martini and sambuca, both of which were delicious, and the key lime pie, which was almost as good as the steaks. 

This is such a wonderful restaurant and it's now our go-to for any important event. Make sure you get your reservation way ahead of time though as it can be backed up as much as a month. Enjoy your meal here!

This place was amazing.  From the maple cotton candy bacon to the filet, everything was delicious.  The steak was possibly the best steak I've ever eaten.   I will absolutely be back next time I'm in Nashville.

I was disappointed. I was under the impression it was a high-end steakhouse. Nothing was over-the-top, the food was good, the atmosphere was OK, the service was OK. I guess I thought it was going to be more like Jeff Ruby's.  The only thing we really enjoyed was the tuna appetizer. There are better places in Nashville.

This is my favorite go-to spot for an all around incredible meal in Nashville! Kayne Prime is an upscale steak house worth every penny. It's a fairly large restaurant but feels intimate with soft lighting and dark, cozy interiors. I almost always start with the tuna appetizer b/c it's so unique and delicious. It's presented as a brick of sushi rice topped with sushi grade tuna and jalapeños, then spritzed table side with a smoky soy sauce made in house. The Caesar salad is also great with a yummy Worcestershire sauce made in house. I usually have the 6oz prime filet and it literally melts in your mouth. Best steak ever! In the past, I always ordered the Potato Aligot b/c they are the best mashed potatoes I've ever had and couldn't eat at Kayne Prime without ordering these. One night they sent out the Potato Gratin by mistake. I've never been a big fan of potatoes at gratin but these are out of this world. I have ordered them every time since and they've taken the place of the potato Aligot. The banana bread is one of their classic desserts and never disappoints. The service is as good as the food which is hard to find these days. I can't say enough about this place. It's a wonderful way to treat yourself.

In town visiting from California. Had a late reservation for 9:30pm with my Mom. We were seated quickly and greeted by Patrick our server. Overall this place was great. Atmosphere was clean and crisp. The service was good, the drinks were strong and the food was amazing. I only deducted 1 star since we waited a little while for the food to come out. However, Patrick did pack it us up some amazing chocolate chip cookies to make up for it! If you're in town definitely check this place out. I recommend the popcorn lobster, wagyu filet mignon and the cream corn brûlée. Enjoy!

We took out of town family here for a nice meal. I liked everything the server was great ambiance was very nice and food was decent. Just kinda eh. The cotton Candy bacon appetizer was just squares of fat with cotton Candy on it. I was kinda grossed out. We got almost every side on the menu the brûlée creamed corn was so good everything else was ok. My old fashioned drinks were good but such a small drink for the price. Like, very small. Steak was eh. Very burnt on the outside and just eh. Expected more since the bill was over $500 but it was a nice night. We probably won't go back, too many other places to explore in Nashville.

business.name: The Black Pearl
business.categories: American (New), Restaurants, French

reviews.text:
All I'm going to say is if you want to feel like you're literally eating love just come here and order the food! Every bite, every morsel is so utterly satisfying and beautifully crafted. The atmosphere and music are fantastic and the service absolutely wonderful.

I would kidnap this chef if I could, you laugh but I'm serious, the man's a food God/ genius. Thank you chef for the most magical date night experience my husband and I could have had. The prices may seem high but they are absolutely not for what you get, worth every penny. 

Whats that? No pictures you say? That's right, I forgot because I was too busy enjoying every bite and holding back my tears of joy.
Amazing food, absolutely amazing. Brilliant service (Peter in particular) it's pricy but top tip top quality. The best food in the area by far. Need a reservation well in advance.

For as long as I lived in this area, over 30 years, Black Pearl has excelled.  Even though there was an ownership change a couple of years ago, this is still a wonderful place. You owe it to yourself to try it.

Wow! What an experience.  My wife and I chose this location to celebrate our anniversary.  My wife described the experience as perfect.  She is very picky that food is heated probably and food is fresh.  That is exactly what she got.  The wine selection vast.  The white truffle lobster risotto was amazing.  My wife chose the 5 grain quinoa risotto.  They decor is appropriate for a romantic atmosphere with only 12 tables.  Reservations are required.  Prices are expensive but understandable due to the quality of the food prepared by excellent chefs.

The Black Pearl had awesome food and the service was excellent.  Anytime we have someone who comes to visit us, we end up taking them there.  Most agree it's one of the best places they've dined at before. This is the place we go to spoil ourselves!

First time here as I normally steer clear of Main St restaurants, but this one is an exception to the rest. The service and food quality are top notch, while it can be considered pricey by some, this is a prime example of getting what you pay for and you get a 5/5 dining experience.  I am super picky about food and their menu covers all options at a high level, save room for dessert as it too is top quality. First restaurant that we will definitely return to for all special occasions. It is my favorite restaurant in this area.
The Sea Bass was terrible!  Was so fishy I could not eat! The waiter did not even inquire as to why it went untouched.  Thank

My husband and I celebrated our one year wedding anniversary here yesterday and we can't even begin to describe the amazing experience that we had. Upon arrival you open the doors to a dark exterior and find yourself completely immersed into a portal leading you to the most romantic restaurant you can find. From start to finish the night was perfect. We had the pleasure of having Sean guide us to one of the best meals of our life. 

We began with the lobster risotto which is not only the best risotto we have ever had but quite possibly one of the best things we've tasted in years, And my husband doesn't even eat seafood. 

The pork belly appetizer is a must and the squash soup was perfectly balanced. 

For entrees we had the filet which was cooked to perfection and my husband ordered the lamb which too was amazing. 

We ended the meal with the tarte and the white chocolate cake. I am seven months pregnant and desserts are my absolute favorite so believe me when I tell you although both were fantastic the white chocolate cake was out of this world. I was fighting my husband for the last bite. 

We couldn't recommend this place enough and cannot wait to experience this again in our future.

What a hidden gem!  We made a reservation to celebrate our elopement and it was perfect!  The quality of food and service far exceeded our expectations and was worth every penny!  We definitely plan on returning next time we're in Dunedin.
My wife and I absolutely love this place. Food is amazing and The staff is very friendly and on point. You have to make a reservation but it's well worth it. The lobster risotto is to die for.
Top 5 meals of our life! Zach was an amazing server! 12 tables total make you feel like you're exclusively recognized. The risotto was to die for and the atmosphere was memorable.

The food was good, but we overall had a 3-star experience. 

First, they offer amuse bouche on the menu to order and pay for, which is contradictory to the general definition of it in that it's usually complementary and offered without ordering.

Secondly, my boyfriend ordered a glass of wine. When he had about 1/4 left, the waiter asked if he wanted another glass and he said yes. The waiter came back and poured wine in the unfinished wine glass to the original fill line. Essentially only pouring 75% of an already weak pour but charging 100% of the price. I have no problem with waiters not measuring a pour, but at least be on the generous side. 

And lastly, the woman sitting next to us was quite rude and not minding her own business. Since she was talking loud enough for us to purposely hear, we found out that her father worked in the back. When I ordered my filet mignon "medium", she spoke loudly to her date that I ordered it medium and I shouldn't have done that. She goes on to say "when someone orders the filet more than medium-rare, I just want to yell at them." While I'm trying to enjoy my entree, she continues to speak loudly how "people don't realize that the meat at these types of places are really good so they should only order medium-rare." She also continued to get up from her seat and talk to her mom dining at another table. Our whole experience was tarnished by this girl who was commenting on every part of our experience and making rude comments to her partner about how we're not doing it correctly. It's one thing to be mocked by your table neighbor, but for them to be an extension of the staff is pretty embarrassing for the establishment. Especially at a place that's touting itself as fine dining. 

Overall, I wouldn't say someone shouldn't try this restaurant. We personally just didn't have a good experience and don't really see any reason to return.

Went here on a last whim about a month ago, while looking up restaurants in Dunedin. I went with my date. It's very small inside, intimate. The lights are low and the dark painted walls are very cozy. Our waiter had extensive knowledge on the different types of wine and suggested what dishes would go best with the Pino Grigio. 
We started with a complimentary appetizer and I ordered the duck liver appetizer, it was a little too rich for my taste. Still delicious. I ordered the duck, which was perfectly cooked. The skin nice and crispy and the inside juicy and not over cooked. It came with polenta and edible flowers. My date got the pasta, he said it was ok. But he complains about everything. 
We ordered another bottle of wine and then it was time for dessert. I got the bananas foster and he got the chocolate flourless cake. 

It wasn't cheap. I would go if you're celebrating a work promotion or anniversary if you're so inclined. Well worth the money and the service was spot on! 
Thank you Black Pearl for a wonderful night!

Wow! The food was amazing, for such a small place I was not sure what to expect but I trusted all the reviews. It lived up to all the good reviews. The food came and was exactly what we wanted in presentation and taste. Very creative dishes also! There were 4 of us so we got to see the wonderful creations by the chef. I will definitely be back to enjoy more

You pay for it...that is the only reason why NOT a five star.  From when you enter this very small restaurant, the staff takes care of you.  Think there was only three front end staff and they each made them selves available for anything you asked.  Busted their butts for us.  Food was excellent and the staff knows their stuff...define the entire dish and ask if you have any questions about it.  Relaxing atmosphere...we were there almost two hours and it did not feel that way at all.   It looks like a hole in the wall, but get past that front door and you will be very, very impressed and happy that you did get past that door.  RESERVATIONS a must.

I used to enjoy dining at the Black Pearl and I'm sure their food is still very good. But when trying to make a reservation for several day in advance I was told they required a credit card to hold and unless I canceled 24 hours in advance there would be a $20 charge. Shame we no longer will be dining there.

This was our all time special occasion restaurant. I don't know what happened but the last couple of times the lamb chops were chewy. The lollipops were not as big or tender. I always get the lobster risotto as an appetizer but something was different. My wife ordered Lobster risotto for diner and there was very little lobster and a lot of risotto. Not worth the money we spent. On this last visit with friends two weeks ago from Winter Park, they were also disappointed. The lights where bright and the atmosphere didn't have that cozy romantic feeling.  I won't order the lamb chops again and that is one reason I go there.  Wayne W.

We had an amazing dining experience here last night. The staff were so professional and knowledgeable, while being personable too! Zack was very welcoming when we arrived. Our server, Shawn, was excellent! He guided us through the menu, making recommendations and sharing his favorite selections. And the food!!! The oyster appetizer was served steaming hot and the oysters melted in my mouth. The pork belly appetizer was so delicious and cooked to perfection. The lobster risotto was creamy and delicious and the sea bass was incredible!  For dessert we had the bananas Foster which was to die for. I will definitely come back next time I'm in town!

An amazing night, great atmosphere, presentation was spectacular and service was great. Wonderful place for a celebration dinner or any special evening. Reservations were about two weeks out so plan ahe

My husband and I dined at the black pearl for our anniversary. The service is wonderful and the food was beyond anything we've ever had before! We were so pleased with our choices for appetizer and entrees. Our server recommended the lobster risotto for our appetizer and it will be something I crave for a lifetime!

Hands-down the best food and staff around I cannot say enough! Thank you for making our anniversary so special... Our waiter was the most knowledgeable We pretty much just let him order for us lol and we were not disappointed compliments to the chef

I had the lobster risotto here 8 years ago and it is on the top 5 dishes I have ever had. 8 years later and Black Pearl still amazes.

We came for the Dunedin Restaurant Week menu, which was a 6 course prix fixe menu with a choice of entree. It was absolutely phenomenal. My entree choice was the sea bass! It absolutely melted in your mouth. The entree of my guest was the duck - she could not stop talking about how good it was. She compared it to filet mignon.

If you are looking for a phenomenal, intimate experience - there's nothing better than Black Pearl. I had enough self control to stick with the prix fixe menu but I will be back soon to get the lobster risotto!

We had reservations tonight for my birthday  and had to cancel because our babysitter was sick and with the virus going around we didn't want to risk her coming over and then we could have brought it to your restaurant. We have social awareness and respect for your establishment (did). 

You charged us 20$ per person even though I called and explained and canceled hours prior. I am floored you would charge a cancellation fee during these times. We are locals and bring visitors to your restaurant and I am a medical rep who has medical dinners at your establishment. I will never be doing another medical dinner nor be back.

Last night we celebrated our 40th anniversary at the Black Pearl. We are new to this area and so I read many reviews before making our selection. Oh my, did we get lucky!  Neither of us can remember the last time we had a dinner as elegant as this.  The food was spectacular, the service awesome and the atmosphere perfect.  I really can't say enough about this spot. My husband just loved his Chilean sea bass and my papparedelle was spot on. 
We had some lovely wines and finished with our customary anniversary dessert of bananas foster. It was an absolutely wonderful evening.  We will definitely return.

My favorite steak is medium with a nice thick crust on it. 
You would think that would be easy to get something like that at restaurants like Capital Grille, Morton's, Ocean Prime, Mastro's or Ruth's Chris.  Even fancy steak houses in NY City, Chicago, or Las Vegas. They all try. 
I can say that I have never had a better filet than tonight at Black Pearl. Every bite was perfect. 
That's all I have to say.

business.name: Eleven Eleven Mississippi
business.categories: Restaurants, American (Traditional), American (New), Sandwiches, Wine Bars, Tuscan, Vegetarian, Bars, French, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Food, Nightlife, Italian

reviews.text: What a special time here for our wedding anniversary . The food was so delicious and extra special. Our server was charming and attentive Can't wait to go again  what a great steak !
I was going to write a review, but I am too full. 5 stars for food, service and the cute birthday card the staff signed. Thanks, Nicole!

Great good and vibes/ambiance. Service is decent as well... I've been several times before and recently came here for a celebratory dinner. Food was excellent. I really wanted the wild boar ravioli but due to being short staffed and the labor that goes in to making them, they aren't able to serve those right now. All pasta is made in house and wonderful. Worth a try even if the famous ravioli isn't available. :-)

Whether you want to experiment with charcuterie, eat a pleasant steak, or try something new this hidden gem hits all three. As many people would hit just the negatives I think this place had great positives. The customer service was great, with a welcoming staff and quickness with refills and answers. For the food, the steak was beautifully cooked and the braised pork was extremely tender! My only problem was the seasonings... I wish both the steak and pork as well as the mashed potatoes were more properly seasoned or at least have salt and pepper shakers at the ready. The Flourless Chocolate Cake was good but it needed something but the tartness from the raspberry was great. I overall loved this place and would come back. Staff was great and I enjoyed the design and privacy of this place!

Good food and plenty of option to choose from. Service is good too. I would describe it as American food with Italian influence rather than Italian/ Tuscan food. We liked it but felt pretty "heavy" after dinner.

Amazing steak. Amazing service. People are all so kind. Went for a birthday twice treated like royalty. So clean and the environment is great. All of our servers were extremely nice and knowledgeable m. Nothing but good vibes.

Almost everything was really good. Mussels and antipasti board, the mussels were very tasty but the winner of the night, and I liked both my drinks sangria and chardonnay, was the seafood linguini, it was delicious! One of the best seafood pastas I've had in a long time and probably the best in STL so far. 

Now the not so great things, the duck/pancetta pasta was not good, it felts like a glorified mac and cheese (although the duck and the pancetta were good) just not our thing. And the service was pretty slow, maybe short staffed (?) like every other place, but still. 

Overall good dinner, and we would probably go back for the seafood pasta.

Very accommodating!  I must say, if you're impatient and don't want to relax in the beautiful atmosphere, you may be disappointed.  The staff takes their time to present wonderful meals and it's definitely worth the wait!  Sit back!  Enjoy!  Have a cocktail!  Visit!  Had the Cioppino which was scrumptious.  My friend had the meatloaf...not your mama's meatloaf....delectable!  Just a totally different flavor combo with a sauce that sends your tastebuds reeling!  Bread pudding is a MUST!  You will NOT be disappointed!  Try it!  You'll like it!!!!!

We had a fantastic dinner last night!  I made a 5:45pm reservations and we got there right on time.  The host seated us upstairs at a corner table right by the prep/kitchen area.  Spacious table that normally seats 4, not one of those little ones so I'm really glad for that although it was too loud for conversation being so close to the kitchen/prep area.

Our waitress was very nice.  She immediately ran us through their specials after placing our drink orders.  Our drinks (a cocktail and a glass of wine) were delivered freakishly quick.  That was definitely impressive! Normally, we wait for at least 5 minutes or so but not at Eleven Eleven.

Our bread was delivered shortly after.  It was a good slice for 2 people, warm and topped with some caramelized onion and came with a small plate of olive oil with cheese and herbs.  I had a bite, it was good and fresh.  We started with the pork belly for appetizers, 3 oven-roasted slices served over some polenta and honey and some brussel sprouts slaw.  Delicious! I had 2 out of the 3 slices.  

For my main entree, I had the pan seared swordfish.  It was perfectly cooked and the flavors were excellent!  My husband had the salmon and he enjoyed every bite of it!  I couldn't finish my but took the leftovers home intending to eat it for a late lunch today.  I saved a tiny bit of room for dessert so we shared a Napoleon.  Our waitress described it as not being overwhelmingly sweet and she was absolutely right.  The custard was tasty!

I am so glad we finally came here.  It was absolutely a fantastic meal! Fantastic food and wonderful service.  I will definitely be back.

Yesterday was my wife and I 3rd year anniversary and we went to this restaurant. The workers were really nice and our waiter was nice as well. The restaurant also gave us free glasses of champagne for our anniversary. The food was great and if you want to take your girlfriend, boyfriend, husband, or wife on a date this is the place to go.

Love everything about this place! Food selection, atmosphere, service, quality. Have never had an unpleasant experience. They have an urban garden they harvest some of their greens from that are yummy. Ask your server about this so you select something from their UF offerings. The freshness is wonderful! Nice wine and cocktail assortment. I've heard they have a nice happy hour offering that is a hit with the locals. Have not done this yet!

Went with friends last night.  Wow.  Great service, great food.  Quiet enough to have a good conversation.

We had the stuffed tenderloin special. Really great.  Perfectly cooked, fork tender. 
A couple folks at the table had the rib eye and loved it.

Not an inexpensive experience, but well worth it.

I read lots of positive reviews about this place, but dining here resulted in one of the worst Italian experiences ever.  First let me clear what kind of restaurant this place should be competing with: a nice sit down place, with waiter service, the provides fresh and quality meals at above average prices.  Now that we have set the bar, let's see what happens.  The meat and cheese board was a joke.  The cheeses and meats were of the store bough variety.  Tasteless.  Gummy.  Disgusting.  The pasta at Eleven Eleven could likely be out-performed by any 11 year old and a microwave.  First, the pasta was over cooked, as in falling apart.  Second, the sauce tasted like something straight from a Ragu bottle.  Note I say Ragu, because if it were Prego tasting, the sauce would at least compete with the local pizzeria.  I could not finish my meal, it was that awful.  The ONLY redeeming quality of this place was the interesting and inexpensive wine list.  It was nice to see a restaurant not jack the patrons with overpriced alcoholic grape juice.

I love trying new food destinations, but when it comes to the special moments, Eleven Eleven is my place. The food is never disappointing and consistently delicious. The ambiance is lovely and allows you to be among many while feeling a sense of privacy with your party. The servers are experienced, well-informed on the food and drinks, and are attentive. Eleven Eleven is one of my favorites!
Delicious as always. Had the polenta with chicken and it was amazing. May I suggest the BlackBerry mule. Came with frozen blackberries that were soaked in vodka. Wonderful.

I don't know what is going on with this restaurant and why the reviews are so complementary.  

We were very excited about going back here after Covid.  The service was good but the food was some of the worst we've ever had.  The 16 oz steak special was tough and bland almost like it had sat in a too cold freezer for too long.  The seafood dish was supposted to have lobster and scallops.  The lobster was slivered and looked like the pieces that come from the legs.  The scallops were soggy.  In addition we got the dinner salad.  It was way to over dressed and the greens were wilted (and not in a good way).  Worst dinner we ever had.  At least they comped the dinners.  For what this place charges, I will go anywhere else.  There are too many really good restaurants in this city!
They serve very delicate and delicious dishes. I went their 2 times and really enjoyed the food I ordered. 100% recommended to STL visitors and of course the local ppl.

The BEST!

Super staff and food.

Eggplant Parmesan is my go-to food here.
When I'm on death row and the warden asks what I want for my last meal, this is at the top of my list.

The wines are a bit pricy.

Great first experience at Eleven Eleven. While visiting STL a few weeks back, it was an impulse dinner choice and I'm glad we went. 
Very nice atmosphere, higher end cuisine choices and a nice drink/ cocktail menu. At the time we visited, the tables were a bit close together so if that's not your thing, you may request to sit outdoors...their patio looked lovely! 
Tasty dessert trio topped off our great meal. Overall, I'd return!

One of the absolute best restaurants in St. Louis. They put together a great experience here and I will keep coming back for more. The ambiance and space is just beautiful. I love the consistency and kindness. They have gotten me in with very short notice and been so kind to my family when we have dined here. They make great mock tails for the kids too! The food is absolutely delicious. I've been dining here for years as a vegan and an omni and I've never had something I didn't love. They have something for everyone with amazing seafood offerings, vegetarian, and a full vegan and gluten-free menus. They make great scallops and the cocktail list is very solid as well!
Excellent service, excellent food. We had the mussels and scallops and  they were delectable. The wine list was also worth the trip!

Eleven eleven is always a solid choice for dining in Lafayette square. I've been here a handful of times now and always had a pleasant experience. Most recently I went with some friends for dinner. I got a jalapeno-pineapple margarita and it was one of the better spicy margaritas I've had - perfect balance of sweetness from the pineapple and slightly spicy jalapeno flavor. 

For appetizer we got the white bean hummus. It had great flavor, but was a bit more runny that typical hummus. I didn't care much for the flatbread it came with, we ended up putting it on the bread they brought to the table than the plain flatbread. We also had the poached pear and fig flatbread. Although I didn't care for the plain flatbread with the hummus, I loved this flatbread. All the flavors on top went were fantastic and flatbread was the perfect amount of crispy and salty. 

For dinner we shared the green salad special and the assorted wild mushrooms & pecorino polenta. The green salad had the perfect amount of delicious dressing, we all really enjoyed it. The polenta was great - rich and creamy. It had a great earthy flavor from the mushrooms. 

The disappointing part of the evening was that we were celebrating our friend finally getting his US citizenship, and when we made the reservation we put it on the form that we were celebrating that. The waitress never said anything about it at all and I know they must have seen it because they mentioned an allergy that we put on the form. To me, if you are going to ask people what they are celebrating, if they put something it should be acknowledged.
Highly recommend. Great food and service. I've also heard nothing but good things from friends too. I would come back
This restaurant is one of my favorite in STL. You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. Great for date night!

I always have the best time st Eleven Eleven! A colleague turned me on to this place a couple years ago and I have been twice recently during the pandemic. Ambiance is great, service is good, food is delicious! 
I have tried a number of dishes. 
Apps: mushroom and roasted red pepper vegetarian arinicini- absolutely delicious! Fried calamari is lightly fried in a light batter similar to tempura and it along with the plate sauce was good!

Main course: I have been here twice for lunch and I had the grilled salmon, which was PHENOMENAL and most recently I had the lobster BLT with bourbon apples, watercress and thyme remoulade. It was ok. The sandwich I wouldn't order again. I brought half home. The toasted bread was really toasted. Too crunchy. The lobster was good but even tho I like thyme, I didn't like the flavor of the thyme with the lobster.   Also the watercress looks and tastes like arugula lettuce and it has a bitter bite kinda like arugula. They did have a great portion of lobster on it, so worth the $14.99. I didn't care for the lobster sandwich but that is my personal preference, nothing about the sandwich was wrong or ill prepared so no need to punish the restaurant with less than 5 stars. 

Dessert: I tried the sampler and everything was delish, especially the creams custard Napoleon. I liked it so well that I ordered the full portion on my most recent trip. I am not a chocolate person but if you are, the chocolate flourless cake cannot be missed. Sooo dense and chocolatey. The third dessert was stl's fave, gooey butter cake. It was a good gooey butter cake and the fresh fruit on it was a nice touch but this Chicagoan can't get into stl's beloved dessert. 

The manager asks about your experience and the customer service is great. It's a classy place, but not too stuffy and it is perfect for dining especially upstairs it is so spacious and perfect for social distancing concerns. 
Try it out! You won't be disappointed!

business.name: Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center
business.categories: Venues & Event Spaces, Performing Arts, Arts & Entertainment, Hotels & Travel, Food, Convenience Stores, American (New), Beauty & Spas, Restaurants, Museums, Event Planning & Services, Hotels, Cinema, Resorts, Day Spas

reviews.text:
Was there for one night, but was at the hotel during previous day because my brother was down for a DuroLast convention. I liked it, overall, a nearly $400 per nite stay. I'm 68 y-o so I'm too old to go up and down Broadway downtown Nashville, though I did some on Sat. nite. Main problem for me was finding my room. Got lost a handful of times. Went to cocktail hour then ate at the fancy steakhouse Sun. nite, lobster bisque was fabulous, good steak..
One negative, Monday's buffet breakfast for $24 total was not good. Waffles were terrible, scrambled eggs (nothing special). Very little meat selection. Poor quality, questionable service. Had lunch at same place (lobby restaurant) on Sunday... Good food, service, so disappointed buffet was not good.

In fairness this is not the first time that I have stayed at this property or a Gaylord. Just as in the past, expectations across the board were excellent!!

I stayed here the evening of the 23rd to take in the Oak Boys Christmas show.  The rooms, service and show did not disappoint!

I will add that compared to the Gaylord in Dallas in 2020, that property was much more festive and decorated for the Christmas holiday than I found this one here in Nashville.  

However, this is a hotel that I would gladly frequent again for my next trip to Nashville.  You just cannot beat all that it has to offer as well as location.
This place is disgusting. Don't waste your money. Zero service and they're rude. Hotel is filthy. Food is inedible. I'll go back to the one in Orlando any day over this.

This is specific about the Mission: Save Christmas featuring Elf just so no one is disappointed with the experience like we were. Tickets are $40 per person and not even worth $15 in my opinion, plus the good old $32 dollars in parking. When we got to the end of the exhibit we were all shocked it was over. When you first enter the attraction they snap a picture, which I assumed was complimentary after we were done. WRONG! They can be yours for an extra $34, but don't worry because it comes with digital photos too. HAHA! This is a complete money grab - highly disappointed and would stay clear!

The set up is totally disjointed. The rooms are small for the price. You cannot get anything to eat after 5 o'clock without waiting about two hours. The one restaurant that takes reservations reported to me that they were booked three weeks before my reservation for the hotel. However, when I arrived I was able to get a reservation. Definitely would not recommend this for the cost. You pay a premium price for the room and every other thing in a hotel it's all a cart.
Beautiful resort with a good amount of decorations for the holidays. Parking is a bit expensive, but you can always walk over from the mall.

Spend the weekend at this magical resort and it was wonderful. My only warning was that Nashville as a whole doesn't seem too concerned about Covid spread. The resort was Packed!!  No social distancing and no masks except for hotel staff. I was checked in by a super nice front dress attendant, Simone who booked me into a room where thankfully I didn't have to walk through the main lobby area to get in and out of the hotel. That being said room was nice & spacious. I wish it had a tub  ( shower only). All the restaurants were open it seemed. I actually ate off property except for some events I attended in the convention center and that food was very tasty. They also have several Christmas themed activities and a water feature activity in the center of the hotel they was hugely popular with my co-workers. I'd definitely return to this resort. Beautiful resort!!

Bought tickets for all 7 of us to attend Mission:Elf. Assumed it was another ICE! Experience with Elf as the theme.  I had not attended any of the ICE! Shows, but wanted to and decided to buy tickets via Groupon. However, It was not ICE! and I should've dug deeper on the Gaylord website to find that info before I bought the non-refundable tickets. It was my birthday and I wanted to do something fun with all our kids- while we are all still together- however our kids are 13-23, and they were quite a bit over the demographic age of Mission: Elf. We took pics and "played" the basic child games, but it was hardly worth the $20 plus we paid per person and any "toys" they had were glued down so there was a lot of frustrated younger kids who couldn't pick up the toys.  I will say we saw the lady cleaning the screens off quite often so they were doing a great job with cleanliness with the Covid going on. 
We walked through it and it had nice photo ops- but if your kids are over 10 it's basically lame- not really anything super interesting to see and I had wished for ICE! As I had heard good things. (ICE was not available as the sculptors couldn't get to the US from foreign countries due to Covid) All the advertisements make Mission: Elf seem fun- and I assumed it was an ICE! Theme- but it's basic touch screen "find the messed up toy" take Elfies with various Christmas decor- make virtual cookies but you never see the cookies.. the dance off and the snowball fight are virtual screens that aren't set to pickup adults or adult sized kids. Basically it was meh and at over $20 a person plus $27 a car to park (and walk a 5k basically to get there!) it took forever to find where Mission: Elf was located as the Gaylord had hard to find signage both outside and inside and it was hard to find anyone to ask. There were several other people just wandering around lost.  We did not plan on eating there, but the lines were huge for restaurants and the other venues- pretzels, drinks ,souvenirs had pretty long lines also. We did not stay overnight but the hotel was decorated nicely in the areas. 
I looked for reviews for Mission: ELF & found nothing that wasn't from a news source or Gaylord. I just wanted people to know in advance what it was like, and if you have older kids- teens then it's not really worth the money. I'm hoping ICE! Will be back, but next time I'll make sure!

Cool place to go every few years or so. It's for sure a tourist trap though and the prices are pretty crazy. The place was very clean and well maintained. The Christmas season is a good time to go, especially with little ones.
Please dust the beautiful glass sculpture in the lobby! Ludek Hroch would be devastated.

We went to the Elf experience tonight. Felt pretty disorganized, was confusing to get to-kids were kinda bored. Probably best for toddlers definitely kids under 8. Would be fun to walk through but I'd never buy tickets again to an event of theirs. We walked out and they had some maybe 11 year olds singing in a screechy voice Nirvana on a stage. What? Maybe some basic Christmas music would be better since we just dropped $170 to walk through a 10 minute event. Yikes. Then we got to pay $32 to get out of the parking lot.  what in the world. Completely overcharging us. We need to stop buying it. Don't go. It's nice but it's not that nice.
Don't waste your time and money with doing Christmas at Gaylord. WAY too many people!!! Not enjoyable with that intense crowd.

I'll start with saying the Christmas lights & decorations truly are beautiful BUT everything from there goes down hill. Checking in was troublesome, even though I'd checked & double checked that all was good on my Marriott account before arriving; my partner wasn't going to be there so we wanted to make sure we could pay via the app. From there we go to our room. This room is gross, mold on the tile, hair everywhere, it had clearly not been vacuumed in awhile, mold coming from the vents of the room, a tub stained brown, a huge grease stain on the headboard & children's candy on the floor. The vending machine down the hall didn't work so we had to walk super far for water. We tried to have dinner at one of the restaurants in the hotel for them to tell us we don't serve food...they were serving food right in front of us. The next night we made reservations for the steak house & they never bothered to call us back after putting our name on the list. The staff treats you terribly unless you're a senior citizen or family-if you're under 30 & just taking a girls trip DO NOT STAY HERE. They also make you walk around the outside of the hotel to catch your Uber rather than allowing your car to pick you up upfront. Downtown Nashville is 15 min or $16 car ride down. The hotel advertises shuttles but fails to mention they cost more than the Uber & only run Friday & Saturday. Our room cost 2k after taxes (which we paid for upon arriving), I've received multiple charges (of up to 1k) since leaving Monday morning; we only ordered two things to the room, a pizza & a burger & charged nothing else. All in all this place is a dump besides the lights. Save your money, stay somewhere else!

The room was average. There was no microwave. There was a lot of noise coming from the common area. There is a lot of walking and very little help with directions. The availability of affordable food was disappointing. We went to a burger place and it was closed. We finally found a pizza restaurant, stood in line for thirty minutes, and when I got to the counter they told me they couldn't serve any more whole pizzas. I would have to purchase all my pizza by the piece which of course was much more expensive. They have sit down restaurants, but they were like starting at $40-$50 per person so with a large family that was prohibitive. I booked this hotel through Expedia. I was quoted $1,010.80 for two nights. When I actually got the credit card charge from the hotel it was $1,121.40. No invoice was given. I've spent 40 minutes  on the phone trying to get in touch with someone. They charge you $32/day to park your car in the parking lot even f you are staying there. It's pretty much  a rip off. For $550/night you would expect better. I wouldn't recommend this hotel even as a last resort in Nashville. I would go to another hotel.
Beware: Buddy the Elf tickets are a complete waste of money.  The exhibit is just a few rooms and a few activities that are not that fun or novel.  Save your money.

I love this hotel so very much!  I think the holidays here are my favorite because I feel transported to a different place - over Thanksgiving weekend we went and walked around looking at all the decorations, decorated a gingerbread house, ate some very yummy pizza at Paisans.

The lines were long and there were a ton of people but the atmosphere was amazing and we had such a great time!

I highly recommend purchasing your tickets in advance for all the activities they have there.  Fun for the whole family!!

We stayed at the Gaylord Opryland hotel the week of Thanksgiving- loved the Christmas activities (although some were overpriced - the Elf exhibit, the ice bumper cars, the boat ride, the scavenger hunt) and all of the beautiful decorations.
The front desk agents and valet were wonderful,
The food was just ok, the lines for coffee were very long (thank goodness we drove and brought a travel coffee pot) and the room (garden atrium suite) was out of date and should be updated.

Save Your money and stay somewhere else! 
This resort was a total BUST! 
The venue had so many people it was hard to walk it was so congested. If you wanted to find beer, water, or better yet food GOOD LUCK! Half the restaurants were closed. Some of the restaurants were first come first serve and had LONG lines ( hour plus waits) if they would even accept more people SERIOUSLY ! We were turned away from places to eat on site because they were full or we didn't have reservations. With a venue this big there should be a place to get a burger or something to eat ! I thought I was being punked at first. 

For the price you pay at this resort they FAILED!!  Staff is nice but overworked and I'm assuming underpaid. Marriott do better ! 

Skip the water park not worth it ! No lounge chairs just regular chairs! It's like a hotel pool with a lazy River Ugh! So disappointed with this whole place !

Stand around a hole with your family and throw your money into it.  It will be more fun and you won't have to stand in line for hours to do it.  

Worst service on the planet.  Insanely overbooked.  No room to even breathe.

We had been warned.  We should have listened.  Total shit show.

Bought tickets to Mission Save Elf. Thought it would be as precious years. Went through all the sections of the games waiting for the ice sculptures only to get to the end without any ice sculptures. $30pp for an Christmas, Chuckie Cheese experience. A TRUE DISAPPOINTMENT!!

Well, reviewing this resort and convention center which i visited and stayed for a number of days. Unfortuanety during my stay, I was unable to get food and beverage very easily. I don't know what the reason was, but breakfast restaurants either were not open or had very long lines. Not sure what was the issue. Also trying to get a quick bite to eat at lunch was difficult as well. This was for all the restaurants at the resort. So I don't feel I need to write a separate review for each restaurant as this is a resort that maintains all the restaurants on property.

Just don't. It's like 6 flags threw up in here. Unsupervised teens run amok. They are not ready for guests post COVID. We had technical issues with the hotel checking us out a day early causing many calls and time wasted at the front desk.  Most of the restaurants are closed and those that are open are way, way understaffed. We waited 3-4 hours to eat mediocre meals. Nowhere to even get a nice glass of wine. We left the hotel time and time again because everything here is closed and there are a million people trying to use the very limited resources. The Elf thing is awful just nothing compared to ice and the many past years of great shows.  Overall, they need to lock down 1/2 the rooms just to have a normal staffing / guest ratio. We have stayed here many times over the years to get ready for the holidays. We won't be back. This "vacation" has been stressful and miserable walking only to find things closed and waiting in long lines for crappy food and crappy service. Spend your money elsewhere. Desperately wish we had stayed downtown.

This place is a tourist trap x1000000!!!! Sure the Christmas lights are pretty but it's not as decorated as they make it seem & everything costs SO MUCH! Parking $32.99, tubing $20 ea, carriage ride $65 for 12 minutes, etc! The worst is the boat ride for $18 each and then they try to SELL YOU ONE PICTURE they took during it of you. They have them printed and ready to go for $25! Literally should be included in that $18 boat ride. It's also insanely crowded with zero COVID protocols. All other large venues we went to in Nashville the same weekend were checking vaccine cards or for negative tests. I highly doubt I'd ever go back here.

We paid $35 to park to see the Christmas lights. Not one staff member could tell us how to get outside to see the actual lights. It's a maze of hallways And gardens but we wanted to see the lights in the outside garden. I legit felt like I was in the movie the shining. We just kept going in circles. I feel ripped off. Come to find out it's nearly impossible to get to the outside lights if you're not taking the stairs which we couldn't because we have a baby with a stroller.

Crazy expensive, but I believe if you can splurge for even a one night stay, you won't regret it.

We visited in mid November and they had the Christmas decor and lights up in the courtyards and it was gorgeous! So cool to walk around and just take in all the gorgeous plants and water features too.

We had tickets to go the the Grand Ole Opry and this was perfect as far as its proximity to the venue. The hotel has a free shuttle that will transport you to and from the Opry, which is wonderful.

If you are looking for a good burger joint I recommend the Jack Daniels restaurant in the resort. Best burger ever!!

business.name: Victory Brewing Company Downingtown
business.categories: Brewpubs, Restaurants, Food, American (Traditional), Breweries

reviews.text:
I love going to Victory in Downingtown.  It is the old Pepperidge Farm plant and from what I understand many operations over the years have been in the Victory restaurant space including a Godiva Chocolate and Campbell's Dry Soup production operation. A lot of history there.

The beer is excellent, and the wings are a good size for the price ($10 on Wednesdays).

What makes this 5-star spot a 4-star?  The last few times I've been here the initial service has been slow - takes between 5-10 minutes to get a server, then an unusually long time to get initial drinks.

Everyone is dealing with short staff issues right now, but I have to give an honest review nonetheless.

Surely not keeping me from going back though...

Different Cheesesteak #981 in the last 4 years.  Guest Eater Amigo Dan.  Back to back shockers, unfortunately this was shockingly bad.  I was very very happy to see a Victory Brewing Co made beer cheese using their Prima Pils on the menu.  There is a very good amount of beer cheese mixed with the meat but then they pour wiz onto the top of the cheesesteak.  That was scary.  There was plenty of cheese but it had little to no flavor.  I am a big Sour Monkey fan but can we have some new sours.

Been a while since I visited Victory - but its every bit as good as I remember. Great beer selection ($2 off happy hour btw) and the meathead pizza was just what the doctor ordered. Oh yea - you can now order sprits (locally made) as well! All in all, Victory remains a steadfast option for the beer connoisseur in your life with a lively crowd that fits all ages.
shoutout tom and mike, best bartenders in the game. such an amazing experience in downingtown.

FAITH WAS AMAZING!!!!!! She actually knew exactly what we needed before we even knew we needed it. Brought us baby beers once we got our check because we had so much fun with her. Every time I come here I am so impressed with their serving staff!
My server Lydia was the best!!!!!! She knew exactly what we needed before we even knew we needed it! Nachos! Pumpkin spice! sour monkey! She was the best she needs a raise! Be back next week
Great local brewery. We were at the Downingtown location. Great ambiance, great beer selection, the place is huge inside and has a large outdoor patio.
Jacqui our server was amazing! She was attentive and answered all of our questions. food was top notch and we had a great night out
Our server Kristy was awesome -  friendly and attentive! Fun Halloween atmosphere tonight, great beer and yummy food.
Stopped in for Dinner today and our server Kiera was stellar! Quick and friendly service, great recommendations, and the food was outstanding!

We ordered takeout fish and chips.   The order was ready at the time promised.

Parking is a bit of a hassle on busy nights.  

The fish was a tad overdone.  It was a good portion but lots of beer batter type breading.    Was not a super fan of the Old Bay fries but when ordering online we were prompted that no substitutions were allowed.   Oversized portions on fries.   Good value for the price

First time at Victory. Mike our bartender was great. He was kind and extremely knowledgeable not only about the beer options but food as well. Will be back. Thanks Mike for making our experience unforgettable

The absolute best place in downingtown! Get the wings. You won't be sorry. 
Summer love is the only love

mm white monkey on tap ! 

came friday night around 930 and were sat immediately. service was slow, but it was busy & im sure they're under staffed. 

we ordered mozz curds, cauliflower, a pretzel, wings & pulled pork nachos to share - the wings are huge ! everything was a good sized portion and pricing was low.

Stopped in on way home, early afternoon on a Saturday.  Zero wait and we were even able to pick a booth.

Good selection of beer.  They have several styles with popular styles like IPA having several offerings.  Maybe a dozen brews on tap yesterday.  I don't think I've had a bad beer here. Some of the classic Victory beers have been around a while and might not seem exciting if you've had them many times before. They are still quite good and sometimes I think they taste a little better on site.  For me the newer and rotating offerings are where it's at. 
 There is plenty of beer for you to take home directly from the brewer if you'd like.

Food is a good selection of pub food.  I seem to recall the menu being larger, but I might be misremembering (or maybe its a covid change, not sure).  We enjoyed the Smoked Wings (a bbq flavor), nice texture.  Daughter demolished some loaded fries.  I've had some tasty sandwiches here.

Have to say that our waiter Sam was outstanding.  He was always one step ahead (napkins/plates etc) and had superb timing. This made for a really smooth experience.

There is a little construction going on in the parking lot and entrance, but don't mind it, I couldn't tell anything was happening from the inside.  Looks like getting a new deck? that would be neat.

Next time we pass through would definitely stop in.

I've always enjoyed Victory beers, but this was my first time at the brewery. I will happily return! Golden Monkey is among my all time favorites, though the IPAs are also delicious (highly recommend the Cloudwalker and the Brotherly Love). The food was solid bar/brewery food. The Loaded fries were excellent, and the fried chicken sandwich was tasty (thin, nicely tenderized chicken breasts perfectly breaded on a soft seeded bun). They seem to have great daily specials during the week, including deals on growlers and crowlers. Only wish I lived closer!

It looks like you're pulling into a loading zone- but you're in the right spot. The food is awesome! Try the Monday night $5 burger special too. There is a kids menu/ just ask the server. 
The large warehouse dining area accommodates lots of social distancing. Would highly recommend. All the food we have tried is delicious.
It never disappoints! Not many betters way to kill some time on a snowy Sunday afternoon. Taylor was bomb.com. ...couldn't have been friendlier and more accommodating. We'll be back!

Stopped in to kill some time on a Sunday afternoon.  Waitress Kristy was more than accommodating in helping with sour beer selection and some delicious buffalo wings.  Proud of this Downingtown establishment.

Food and beer is always great. It can get super super crowded and loud on weekend evenings, to the point where you have to scream for your table to hear you. There's always a long wait for a table as well, sometimes an hour plus.

We really miss sitting at the bar for their happy hour pizza special, but we still order pizza. take out once a week! It's my favorite pizza to get because the crust is perfect and it reheats so well that even the left overs are delicious! Obviously, the beer is great too, but try the pizza!

Really fun place to visit for good craft beers and food. During COVID, they have a large tent and tables set up outside as well as table service inside. DJ outside with good adult contemporary music. You need a reservation but times are readily available. I arrived with a party of five with reservation and was seated immediately.  The beers were very good as expected. I really liked the Festbier. For food, I had the soft pretzel with mustard and cheese sauces. It is very large, homemade, soft and delicious.  My wife got the homemade smoked turkey which she let me sample. Fantastic!  Really friendly service start to finish. Gift shop inside for shirts, hats, etc.

My boyfriend and I have been coming to Victory for years. They brew their own beer in house, which ships to all parts of PA and more! I am not a big beer fan but I have always been open to trying new brews at Victory. The atmosphere is cozy and fun! The food is what you would expect, mostly bar food but I always find something I like. Will be coming back for years to come, Cheers!

BF and I wound up at Victory for dinner on a recent Saturday around 530-6ish after we tried to go to another nearby establishment and found they had a 90+ min wait. Victory was able to seat us immediately in appropriately distanced outdoor seating. They have a number of picnic tables under a tent, and then several smaller tables that are not covered (though weren't particularly sunny that day). They have music piped in, but the waitstaff are clearly serving as DJs and had a tendency to keep changing the song 30 seconds in, which isn't a big deal but was a little weird. All staff were masked and service was friendly and prompt.

The beers were solid. My favorite was the Twisted Monkey, but also tried the Tart Monkey. We like Golden Monkey and Sour Monkey as well, but were not in the mood for such at high ABV. They have a lot of options to purchase beer to take home available as well.

Based on Yelp, we ordered the Fried Pickles to start and were not disappointed. They achieve a perfect, crispy breading overtop pickle chips served with a fennel aioli. The basket is huge! Luckily, we ordered it prior to ordering our entrees, because we actually wound up splitting the Turkey and Avocado sandwich instead of each ordering our meal --- and we were stuffed! The sandwich was kind of like a BLT with added turkey and avocado and was pretty tasty. The house-made chips were a good choice as well.

Want to give a shout out to this place. This frontline worker really appreciates the special treatment and how you make all of us feel appreciated. Props and kudos. You'll get my business all the time. And great beer too.

business.name: City Diner
business.categories: American (Traditional), Local Flavor, Restaurants, Diners, Food

reviews.text: Our first trip here won't be our last! We stopped by on a whim, and couldn't be more impressed. The employees were very kind and helpful, and the food was so dang good too! I highly suggest giving this place a try!
Sign says "We open at 8AM...usually". Monday morning at 8:15AM: not open. I'll revise if I ever get to visit. #fail

Placed order on Grubhub, received incomplete order...

Called, and person who identified as manager wanted to argue over the mistake...

my chicken fried steak was missing mashed potatoes and gravy for the meat...

we chose baked potato and garlic bread options for tilapia dinner on grubhub, manager argued they were upcharges (not on grubhub) and said i had to call grubhub to clear it up...

continued wanting to argue rather than make it right...

wouldn't give me owners contact info  so...

here we are, one star review over an incomplete order that wouldn't have been an issue in house (hopefully)...?

I ordered a chicken bacon Swiss sandwich in Marble Rye through Grub Hub. I got a chicken bacon cheddar with barbecue sauce in texas toast. I called the restaurant and the lady knew the order as soon as I told her what I was supposed to have and what was actually delivered. She then says, and I quote, "they just made the wrong sandwich." She asked me to come pick up a new sandwich. I told her if I could pick up the food, I would have done so to begin with. She then said they just made the wrong sandwich. This used to be one of my favorite places. The last time we went in there was this spring and the service was bad and the fries were so overcooked and hard I could barely eat them. So, I guess, my love affair with City Diner is over. The did get my salad correct. I think they knew they gave me the wrong sandwich and anticipated a phone call. These restaurants need to understand that despite how they feel about food delivery platforms; it is ultimately the customers who frequent their restaurant whom they are screwing over. Won't order from them again.

Their website says they're open til 11 tonight. I called them just in case, and the recorded message said they were open til eleven as well. Got some friends together, drove here, and they're closed at 7pm. Wtf?

I had left a previous review; however,  since then the service here has gone completely downhill. The last time we went in there is the final time. The server had her mask tucked under her chin as she took the order. My girlfriend order breakfast with extra toast. Half of her meal including the toast did not arrive till we were paying our bill to leave. The well-done steak sandwich was more rare than anything. The sandwich could not be eaten due to the bread being so soggy from grease that it was dripping from the bun. The attitude of the staff that night was a I do not care attitude. The worst part is the owner was there dealing with issues in the back and not even caring that half of his customers were complaining. I will never step foot in here again and will never recommend it again. Last but not least is our seats and table had food crumbs all over it along with several others. Do not go here!

Cons: Slow Service, food quality, dump of a neighborhood, dirty tables, pay for parking
Pros: Servers were nice (I think they were embarrassed)

Really no need to go here.  Sketchy place, sketchy food.  Plenty of better diner options.

This was the worst service I've ever had in my life. We walked in, NO ONE talked to us for 20+ minutes. Then after people started walking back and confronting the workers ignoring the people piling up at the door, is when they cleaned off one table and sat them. They had about 4 parties leave because no staff said anything to them. 
Then the waitress was talking about how she was going to punch one of the girls who was asking what the heck the wait was for. 
Also, food was trash. Glad I wasted over an hour for over cooked eggs and stale tortillas.
GOLD STAR. 
Get your crap together.

Stopped at City Diner for evening chili, which is heavy on meaty ground beef and light on beans. Getting it in a to-go cup made easy sipping while keeping a hand on the wheel. 

Friendly, quick service given at no extra charge. If you want to eat in, this diner has plenty of booth and counter seating amid nostalgic photos of 1960s rock and movie stars.
Not great. The biscuit was hard, the hash browns were cold, and our server had her mask completely under her chin the whole time.

This spot use to be the spot,  but recently my husband and I went in for breakfast and had to order lunch, the waitress informed us that nothing was that great. My husband ordered a  Reuben sandwich with fries and mac & cheese,  and I had the south city philly with fries and mac &cheese,  the ENTIRE meal was horrible,  I could not eat half the meal it was so bad. I tried because I'm pregnant and was hungry, but I just couldn't eat it.  When the waitress came to give us our check and asked how things were I told her it was horrible and told her that the cook needs to be bussing tables, that he needs not to be cooking. The sandwiches was so greasy, the mac and cheese was dry and blend and the fries tasted as if they were from the day before. I was very disappointed with the whole ordeal.

You know...just right in the middle as far as ratings go. There's nothing great about it, nothing too horrible, it is what it is which is a place to eat that's not expensive and is very casual. Don't expect a perfect 10 out of 10, lower your standards a little and you'll find it a pleasant visit. The waitstaff is very nice, have been for the number of times we've gone there. The food has been relatively quick out of the kitchen, the menu is varied and should offer something for everyone.

During COVID they are social distancing tables, the staff wear masks and they require the customers do as well.

The decor is nice, kind of a 50's/60's motif with movie posters that are pretty much "Attack of the Mutant Camels from Outer Space"

Go have a sandwich, give them a try.

I have been coming to the City Diner for several years now. Up till now the service, food, and atmosphere has been awesome. During that time I have seen both good and bad employees go through the establishment the food has always been excellent except for one fish time. Tonight though, the kitchen staff proved that they could care less about the customers or the food. When we first came in we seen an older couple has just placed their orders and the cook screamed he wasn't going to cook that with a great deal of profanities. Customers were complaining about the loud curse words and several tables complained about not getting all their orders and all we could hear was more profanity from the kitchen.

 The next issue of the night was apparently first come first serve is not honored here. I placed an order for a pork steak sandwich and the waitress went to find out if there was any left, which I was fine with. When she asked the cook about it there was more profanity and then the waitress at the counter turned around and sold the last one to someone who literally just walked in after we had been there for a little bit. After that, I ordered the ribeye sandwich and request the sautéed onions be diced a little bit even if it is just hitting it with a spatula. The waitress replied with "I will try" and we heard the cook cursing her for the request all the way back to our table and he refused to do it. This type of thing continued and delayed our orders and other customers order because of the temper tantrum being thrown in the kitchen. Next as we were finishing our meal, a new server came in and was complaining loudly from the register that she did not like one of the girls she was working with.

 In all the times I have been here before, there has never been a visit as crazy as this. I would like to say that our server bless her tried her best to give excellent service even with everything that was happening.  Also the steak sandwich was excellent. I will give this place another chance due to the fact that I enjoy the food; however, if the atmosphere created by some of the employees continue in the future I will not return and find another good steak sandwich at a competitor.
My food tasted so old. The omelette was good but my potatoes and French toast were so bad I spit it out. Felt sick for the rest of the day

Ordered brunch from this place thru Grubhub. Left several special request but none were followed,  Additionally, part of the  order was missing, avoid at all cost. (also no utencels or napkins & $30).

So happy we found this place.

We have just moved to the area, and are not used to chain restaurants, but haven't found a lot of good breakfast options.

Chorizo & eggs, omelettes, biscuit and gravy, real breakfast.

We will be regulars!

So happy we found this place.

We have just moved to the area, and are not used to chain restaurants, but haven't found a lot of good breakfast options.

Chorizo & eggs, omelettes, biscuit and gravy, real breakfast.

We will be regulars!

My husband and I attempted to have lunch there today. The waitress made racist comments about Arabic people.  She yelled at the chef to learn English.  It was completely offensive and inappropriate so we left.  We will not be going back

I hate to write a bad review now but I don't want anyone else eating old food. We placed an order through Postmates and the food we received seemed old. Not like it cooled off during the drive, but as if it was expired.  The salsiccia was slimy and had a weird taste, the pancakes tasted as if they had been sitting out and not made fresh and my salad was warm. Please double check that your food is ok before  sending out these orders!

Just got told that we have to pay for our meal before we eat because we LOOKED like people that dined and dash before While we were in full AT&T attire. I'm sure it's mainly because we're black. Our AT&T store is literally 50 yards away from City Diner where would we dash to??? Clearly this was racially motivated. Clearly they didn't want our business. Just trying to do something nice for my guys and left extremely disappointed, hurt, and discriminated against.

This place has gone straight to the dumps. Ordered a country fried steak and sides (easy order right?). The steak was rancid, the mashed potatoes cold, and the corn clearly just out of a can. The only saving grace was the poor waiter that was running around trying to help the guest against the angry, yelling cook, that did nothing but complain about being out of everything or how hard it is to do his job, or read ticket with a screen right in front of his face. 

Talking to the wait staff over my stay, the told me (and it clearly shows) that the owner doesn't give a crap about the place, or it's future. If you have any  love for industry workers and know if some open positions, please pass them to the waiters (if any are still working here much longer). 

Stay away at all cost. Please come back Goody Goody Diner!!!
Dining room is now open.  Tables are marked for where you can sit.  I enjoyed my chicken fried steak and vegetables.  Glad to be able to eat out close to home again.

Horrible food, every thing was dry and unflavored. Not even seasoned with salt and pepper. The service was bad, Jamie could have told me to come to the side patio and where it was since I had a call-in order. I waited on the side patio for 10 minutes in the rain to get unflavored and unseasoned dry food. 
I wish Courtesy Diner was open, would have went there without hesitation.

I love the food and atmosphere. The service has really been hit and miss for a while now. One thing we noticed on our last visit was that there is never a host. This leads to confusion on seating and serving that could have easily be avoided.

Came here because I had a coupon for this that I had found on Groupon and it had always been a place that was recommended to me by others and on multiple food lists for St Louis. I went on a weekend and it was really busy and it really truly has a "diner" feel. The menu is as you would expect for a diner for breakfast food. You could see that the waitstaff was trying hard to meet everyone's needs but it was quite busy. However I found the food overall extremely greasy (I guess part of the diner feel) but almost overly so.  I guess this is a good place for comfort food, diner food. You get big portions, that's for sure! Glad I went but not sure I will be back anytime soon.

business.name: Sushi Pier Midtown
business.categories: Japanese, Restaurants, Sushi Bars, Buffets

reviews.text:
I see this place has finally closed.  Good riddance.  This place was absolutely disgusting, management had absolutely no clue what they were doing, the sushi was the worst I have ever experienced anywhere on earth, and the staff was consistently inattentive, uncaring, rude, and seemingly entirely unable to take an order correctly.  The four and five star reviews here are baffling to read.  "Our mussels were pretty good, they were just dry and tasted a little off, and they forgot to remove the adductor muscle, BUT OTHER THAN THAT...."  

Glad to see Reno finally throwing this place on the trash heap where it belongs.  It's just too bad we didn't get Gordon Ramsay to come in here first to give the owners the humiliation they deserved.  Hopefully someone who actually knows something about food, or cares even a little, takes over the spot.

Extremely disappointed. We have been coming here for 3.5 years and always had a decent experience, but always great food. Went in for dinner last night and saw the menu had changed ( which usually is a good sign) but we're reluctant when we saw our top 5 favorites had been removed, including smoked salmon. We got our drinks pretty quickly but it took 40 minutes for the starters & another 35 minutes for 1/2 of our order of sushi. 10 minutes later the other 1/2 came out. The meal was decent, nothing fantastic-- I might even say a little on the fishy side in comparison to my experiences before. My husband said his sushi was okay though. Only one drink refill, one waiter the whole time for the whole place, & a brand new host who was very slow/ inexperienced at what his role was. I left and most of the tables were still full of the same people.  A large party with reservations were on their way in and I genuinely felt bad for them. I even said out-loud that we need to find another sushi place. Finally, went to use the bathroom on the way out and it was disgusting. Both toilets were heavily clogged, tissue in the ground, no paper towels, and water drippings on the floor. So gross I walked out and wasn't able to use it. Really bummed, but something has to drastically change for us to come back. When you're spending good money to eat sushi, the whole experience needs to be on point, this missed the mark BY FAR. Choose elsewhere!!

I see why it has lower stars than the original. Although the service from our server is good, the quality of food is terrible. I had a lot of skepticism when I walked in and didn't see one Asian person working or eating--that's the first thing I look for when I go to an Asian restaurant. The sushi rice was not fluffy, but hard and tightly packed around the sushi roll. The quality of fish was low as it didn't taste fresh and was chewy. The options of fish were limited--salmon, tuna, yellowtail. The options for sushi rolls appeared to be many, but a majority were fried, had cream cheese, or were spicy. This made me realize how fortunate I am to live in the Bay Area and have all these wonderful and fresh options at the local sushi restaurants. 
Loved the service but not the food!

I have been seeing posts on Facebook about Sushi Piers new menu and when it was announced that it would start this week I decided to check them out. It's a big place with a nice bar, they have plenty of seats and the music is reggae at just a little bit loud of a level for me but not too bad. It definitely was busy.

Our waiter was very nice and the service was prompt. We didn't have to ask for anything more then once and our drinks were filled regularly. 

My wife doesn't do sushi or seafood so she ordered the Vegetable Tempura, and cucumber salad for appetizers and the Chicken Katsu Skewers as main course. I ordered two orders of baked mussels, some different nigiri, and some different rolls. I have to say it's nice to see a place have different rolls. A lot of places in town have almost the same exact menu when it comes to sushi. 

My wife's Vegetable Tempura and Cucumber Salad came out and they were decorated very nicely. The Tempura had great crunch and nice big vegetables. The cucumber salad had nice flavors and the addition of the lemon garnish actually lent some citrus to the dish and made it better. Unfortunately wires must have been crossed cause I only received one order of two mussels. They weren't bad just dry and a little chewy, they didn't remove it from the abductor muscle so it was a little tough removing it. 

I started receiving my sushi items. I was disappointed to see that the ordering menu didn't have the two new rolls from Nevada Brining Company on them so I didn't know how to order them. I received my orders of nigiri, a California Deluxe Hand Roll, a Salmon Skin & Octopus Hand Roll, the How We Roll long roll, and the Mr. Blonde. I figured I'll order more if I'm hungry later. The How We Roll was really good, I was very surprised cause I'm not into baked fish but it would be something I would order again. The Hand Rolls were both good and the nigiri as well. Wasn't a huge fan of the Mr. Blonde. My only issue was the rice. The rice had zero flavor, it didn't have that vinegary pop that you expect. It was also a little mushy. I know most people say "it's just rice" but honestly rice plays a big part in sushi. If the rice isn't good it changes the taste of the fish. Maybe they were busy and didn't have time to flavor the rice when they cooled it. It was disappointing and honesty stopped me from ordering anything else. 

My wife really enjoyed her Chicken Katsu skewers. They were nicely decorated and came with a salad and some edamame. They were nice and crispy and the edamame was a nice snack with it. She would definitely order it again. 

All in all it wasn't a bad meal, trust me I've had worse sushi places here in town but it wasn't the best. I liked the different rolls and the presentation. My only issue was the rice. I will try them again hopefully when it's not so busy. I'm hoping the rice will be better. Check them out for yourselves.
