Amazing service by all who helped us out yesterday! A must stop anytime we are in Reno for sure! Worth every penny! Only regret? Ordering way too much food on the ayce!

Well, today I spent 2 hours in a AYCE sushi session... with no sushi in front of me for 80% of the time and an empty water glass 50% of the time. The sushi we did receive was mediocre and they lost our ticket, so I cannot comment on the sushi that we ordered but didn't receive. They get 1 star because their manager was kind and cut our bill for poor service. That being said, we still paid $50 and two hours of our lives and left hungry.

Overall: Go elsewhere!

HORRIBLE "service" and "staff"!!! Ruined my wife's birthday dinner with my family. Crappy food! Impossible to get anything ordered to table. They bring you other people's food and offer it to you as "extra". Will NEVER be back!!! D-Mo

Answer me a simple question as someone who works and allegedly is a manager in the food SERVICE industry: should a customer have to beg for food to be correctly served as ordered, drink refills, napkins, and a check?

Seems to me is staff was attentive as they are paid to be, this would have NEVER been an issue.
Great food and the service is mediocre otherwise it would be 5 stars. Love visiting this place too bad it's only 1 time every other year. Keep up the good food.

FYI this location is NOT the original Sushi Pier and is under different management. This location DOES accept reservations, so just call ahead of time!

Visited the Reno area during the fourth of July weekend and was quickly seated after a 10 minute wait for my party of 5. The hostess in the front was kind of confusing because she told me to wait in the waiting area without taking my name for my party??? I ended up asking her to write my name down for my group... Anyways, my party crammed into a 4 person booth and went along with ordering from the AYCE paper menu. AYCE for dinner is ~$23 per person. The ordering process is fairly straight forward, but one will need the menu to get the descriptions of each roll etc as the paper ordering menu only has the names of each dish.

Apparently, my party of 5 ordered way too much and the manager was nice enough to notify us that he slashed our order in half in order for us to eat a little before ordering more. Definitely a nice gesture on the manager's part and I thank him for that! I've been to my fair share of AYCE sushi places and this place rocks! The quality of the fish and rolls is amazing. The nigiri (salmon and eel) is perfect. It has fat pieces of fish and small rice underneath it. Just the way I like it! In fact, most of the rolls here have a good rice to fish ratio in my opinion. Don't forget to also make room for dessert! The "happy ending" dessert has fried banana with whip cream and ice cream. Super good and a perfect way to end a meal. The 5 stars here boils down to the charismatic manager who checked in on my table and the great sushi here! Definitely wouldn't mind coming back here again :)

So tonight it was my pleasure meeting the hostess Raylin , and talking in her downtime while waiting for my order. I love the fact she told patrons "im gonna sit you with (sushi chef name)" ... better than not knowing and saying "heeyyyy" all night. Great customer service.  Im real big on returning to the same people when i find good service.

My boyfriend was taking me out to sushi for my first time.  He isn't familiar with the area, so we picked this place because it was close.  The bar was full, but overall the place wasn't that busy.  Our waitress took awhile to even approach us.  She brought me tea without any sugar, and didn't even ask if I wanted any.  No straws...I get it, they're taboo these days, and I would have asked her for one but she disappeared forever.  My boyfriend got up and got me one.  I ordered the shrimp tempura because I knew I would like that, and he was going to order some things for me to try.  It took awhile to get our food, and she brought no ginger and wasabi,  and offered none. No napkins or chopsticks were brought either.  My boyfriend should be tipped for doing all her  work.   Actually, it wasn't even her that brought the food.  My boyfriend was disappointed in his food, so he told me not to try it because he didn't want to ruin my first time.  Needless to say, we will not be back.

Used to be my favorite sushi place in town, but over the past couple years, I have not been all to impressed. Pricing has gone up over the years, which wouldn't bad (i get costs go up), but the service and quality have really gone down.

Food is ok. Not bad, but not great. Just ok. My daughter ordered the udon noodles and when she tasted it, she said the noodles were slimy, and very unappealing. To top it off she was given a small plastic to go spoon to try and eat it with. we had to ask the waiter for a proper spoon, and then he told me they dont have any. As for the sushi, the fish portion is small, the rice portion has increased. Food is super slow to come out, and when it does, the presentation is not very appealing. Quail egg shooters should not come out scrambled or with shell peices, just sayin'.

Service in general is very poor. Slow and unattentive unless you are a friend of the service person. This is the case for the last three visits. Even placing an order (when it is empty) takes 15 min just to turn in the paper for AYCE, and even longer if you wish to place a non sushi order. took 25 min to get an order of teriyaki chicken plate. 

Needless to say, I do not think I will be returning anytime soon. I would not even recommend this place to anyone (and I used to, that is the sad part). To anyone reading this looking for a sushi place to eat,, I say go somewhere else. Not worth the time or the money to come here anymore.

I have been to this Sushi Pier many times and have never had a bad experience. However, last Saturday my 10 year old son wanted to celebrate his birthday at Sushi Pier with his family(7 people).  The sushi was delicious but the service from our waiter was very lacking. It took 2 1/2 hours to have dinner because he only came to our table about every 20 to 25 minutes and several times I had to wave him down. I was was just going to write a bad review on Yelp but I decided to call a manager to see if they would make things right and talked to a manger that believe was named Tabitha . She told she was aware of the service issues the restaurant was having and they were trying rectify the situation. After talking to Tabitha, I am willing to give Sushi Pier another chance.

I wasnt going to write a review but changed my mind..lol..My husband and I drove from Sacramento to come eat here because this was our favorite place and the first place we had sushi. But unfortunately we will not be coming back. We should have known better. 

1. The hostess asked us if we wanted a table or bar...we said table then she asked us again if we wanted a table or a booth. She asked me for my name and said 10 mins. She kept calling some girls name and when we realized she was calling me. She goes ya you whatever your name is. I was like it's ok, I understand.
2. It took about 20 mins for us to get drinks and a paper. We ordered sprites and waters. When I took a drink of my sprite it was a boat load of salt water. The waiter asked the guy in the back to refill the machine but it was still the same and they ran out of cups and then my husband and I had to share a straw. We did happen to have a really nice waiter. Shout out to Adam. We did appreciate that he was super friendly and didnt look at us with discuss.

3. We didnt get most of our first order. However, the first part was ok. I didnt bother taking pics because it was good. Then we ordered again but we ordered a little amount cuz the guy said it was still on it's way. He gave 6 mussels that had sriracha all over it. Then a lady came by to drop off our food and I told her it was the wrong order she said she couldn't take it back just eat it, you never know it might be your favorite.  I didnt touch it. So I decided to try the salmon hand roll, a bunch of grease came out and the salmon was soggy. Then the shooters we got had shells. We told the waitress and she said....and? But took a minute to realize what I was saying and brought new ones....they looked gross. Then they brought us upside down shrimp and it looked like they just gave up on them. 

I just got done throwing up and I'm currently stuck in the bathroom double dragoning it. Good times.

For 54 bucks...wasnt worth it. I wanted to tip our waiter but we kept getting new ones and the lady was a bitch, excuse my language. I'm pretty sad that I couldn't say it was the best experience like the previous one. 

I

We sat down at 6:30. Dinner rush had yet to start. We ordered 2 kids bento boxes, ordered mussels and upside down shrimp, and turned in our AYCE paper slip. We were SIGNING THE CHECK when our children's bento boxes finally made their way out of the kitchen. Over an hour. Our mussels and upside down shrimp were never seen. We asked our waitress numerous times where the items were. While she apologized, still nothing ever came. How very disappointing it was for a birthday dinner. Never again. 

Folks, if you want a good meal where everyone actually gets to eat something, DO NOT go to sushi pier. This place has fallen so far down, it may as well take itself off the menu.
One hour... no kidding 1 hours for our kids meal to arrive... then we never got half of first order of all you can eat sushi....,NEVER again!!!!

Everytime i go i have a great experience and amazing food. Sit at the sushi bar and have the chef make whatever for you and they surprise you with some amazing combos not on the menu. Definitely my favorite sushi place in town. Always fresh tasting, always fast service, always good. And don't forget to end your experience with the orange with plum wine on top. So refreshing so good!

Worst customer service ever.

My party got there about 8:10PM on Sunday 5/26 and the dining room area was nearly empty but the hostess didn't seat us. There was maybe 10 open tables and booths.

After about 20 minutes of waiting, I asked the hostess why there were open tables and booths but she wasn't seating. She said "Service is backed up, so it will be another 5 minutes" - I asked to talk to the manager. 

The manager came out and I asked him if my party could sit down, and he repeated "Service is backed up." There were quite a few tables and booths, all ready, so it was quite confusing- I asked him why and he said "Service is backed up."

I told him "it was bad for business and I was going to leave a bad review," this upset the manager because as we were walking out he yelled towards the closing door "Why don't you go to McDonalds?"

Why would this midget manager attempt to insult his customers on top of the bad service?

The manager said his name is "Jeff" - he was a slow, small, short man with lots of horrible tattoos, missing many teeth, and reeked of alcohol.

I really used to love this place.. after all it was the first place I tried sushi at 10 years ago. But over the years the service has dwindled and the quality of the sushi too.. I loved coming here because their unagi sauce was phenomenal and they had the best deep fried rolls hands down. But now the unagi sauce even tastes different. They say they make it in house I don't know for sure if that is true or not but it definitely doesn't taste the same anymore. 

I didn't want to post any negative reviews because like I said I have been coming here for over 10 years now. I know that they have been going through a lot of changes as far as turnover, new staff, new management and/or new ownership so I wanted to give them a break. However the last five or six times that I've been there my orders have been incomplete or messed up, and the service has been subpar (to put it nicely). 

My husband also had his first taste of sushi at Sushi Pier Midtown and he was in love with the place. He isn't hard to please when it comes to food but even he now  prefers a different sushi place. So the only reason why we have come here at all within the past year was at my request. Prior to today, the last time I had come in was on May 4th. I came in with my sisters, my mom, my daughter, and a friend from out of town (party of 6) and our orders were messed up so many times. We never got any refills on our drinks, we tried asking but every time the server came by they quickly left before we could ask for anything. It seemed like our server had a bit of a attitude. However, because we had a party of six we had the mandatory tip added to our bill. I love to tip people but for quality service. I've tipped pizza delivery drivers $25 before because I received excellent service. I really loved this place and hopefully things will turn around in the future.

We REALLY wanted to like this place.  We sat at the bar and our sushi chef wasn't rude but he was definitely not friendly or even a little bit engaging.  I think one time someone came to clean up the dishes. A server never came to check on drinks and we had to stop one to ask for our check. The place was virtually empty so there's really not an excuse for that.
The sushi itself was fine.  Nothing really memorable and there are far better places out there.  Maybe it's better at dinner time, but I don't think we'd try again.

Been slacking on going twice a month like i use to... probably cause the quality of my rolls went downhill.  But they have redeemed themselves. While i order specifically one roll this time it was all perfect. I always get 4 California long rolls on soy paper and add cream cheese. With sides of spicy mayo (theirs is the best in all of Reno, and its even a diffrent mix than the other sushi pier)... i always say no sesame seeds no wasabi and no ginger (dont want to waste it cause all i use is the spucy mayo)... guess ill be back next week again for my fix. 4 rolls takes me about 12 hours to eat. But definatly worth it. Costs about the same as the all you can eat.

Used to be a great family experience for sushi. Not anymore. Terrible table service, took 10 minutes for anyone to come to the table to take our drink order. Not due to any rush of people, there were maybe 5 tables filled including us. Ordered happy hour sake. The waiter came back another 10 minutes later with the sake then let us know sake isn't on happy hour, even though it was clearly printed on the happy hour menu. Took another 10 minutes for someone to come take our sushi sheet. We ended up leaving and not even eating there the initial service was so terrible.  The last few times I've been the fish was warm, flavorless, and blah. No innovation on the menu. Won't waste my time again there.

Ok so first off, this review was going to be a negative one, however it turned around and ended much better than expected. As we arrived we were seated immediately which was great. We ordered water all around we placed our orders. When our food came out we noticed that not everything we had ordered had come out yet. We had ordered salmon nigiri; 11 x 2 = 22 pieces, however we only got 4. So when we asked our server he stated that they were being made and that they'll be out shortly. So about 10-15 minutes came around and we still had not received our order, and since it was the main order we were waiting on that. Eventually we asked again, and he went back to check and came to us and told us they had ran out of salmon. So we were kind of irritated with him just with the inconsistency with our waters being refilled and food that he kept presenting us with, and the fact that I had to get up myself to grab chop sticks for the table since the food was was dropped off with no utensils. Ok, so that's pretty bad, now for the good. A kind woman who we believed was the manager, turned out to be the owner and essentially fixed the issues that was happening, and not only did she find out there was salmon but actually came back to the table so that we could edit our orders since we had already placed another order with the server in leu of the salmon. I'm glad she did this because then there could've been food wasted, and we don't want delicious sushi wasted! That's horrible! Thank you to the Owner Christine and the girl that not only brought us our food, but also topped off our waters multiple times, without being asked! I look forward to visiting this location again, since she saved my sushi night from being ruined. I will be back, not only with my appetite, and friends but also with a fresh slate for the restaurant. !!

Sushi Pier Midtown has really stepped up their game! We had heard about the new ownership and decided to give it another shot and it was well worth it! The food was super good and the service was friendly and fast  We also found out about an off the menu secret item.. just going to say "cheek" that's it. YUM! Highly recommend spot achieve the infamous "sushi coma"

The first time I ate here was about 8 years ago and the sushi was OK. I decided to eat here because it was the closest sushi joint to the event we were attending, big mistake. The service is mediocre. The sushi is horrible. I love sushi and have loved most sushi places I have gone to. I have been to various places in Reno. All of the sushi was super cold as well as the calamari. The rolls are messy. It's not worth the price and the mochi is not included in the all you can eat price and the server didn't even let us know, had I known that I wouldn't have gotten it. A complete waste of money, if I could give it 0 stars I would.

business.name: Café Soho
business.categories: Coffee & Tea, Food, Japanese, Restaurants, Chicken Wings, Korean, Asian Fusion

reviews.text: I love their chicken wings! The food here is excellent but the prices are ridiculous. It is a five star for the food but will get four star for the prices. Place was take out only last time I went. Their service is good and professional but go easy on the people with the prices.

I like cafe soho, I've been a huge fan since they opened. I go there at least once a week. But tonight someone took my order wrong, I wanted a cheese rice cake with ramen, but a cheese ramen for $10! But I'm not going to drive back and forth for another 20-30 mins!

I definitely put this spot in the upper tier for Korean Fried chicken wings. The carry out orders were non stop which is a great indication of how good the wings are. 

The Kimchi fried rice was pretty darn good too. Pretty spicy, If your familiar with Jollof rice It has that level of kick to It. The bang bang shrimp was alright, not quite what I envisioned for bang bang. I'm just not use to seeing long shrimp like that lol. Nonetheless they were ok.

I also got the chance to try Soju for the first time. Soju DEFINITELY packs a punch so make sure you got a plan to get home safely after. It does creep up on you. 

I sat down to eat and there were some gnats that were driving me crazy. Other than that my fiancé found a hair in her kimbap. That's no good either. Ultimately we had an ok experience, we will probably carry out next time though.

First I just wanted to say . I really appreciate the old workers that use to work there . The food was great . Service was great . Prices was great . Everytime you call you get a call back just to let you know that the food you ordered is ready or will be ready so I can head over and pick it up . BUT !!!! 2021 - the workers are lazy , leave the phone line closed so nobody can call and order . Leave the voicemails full so you can't complain to them . My story is that A few times I tried to call and order and it won't go through . So I'm thinking maybe they are busy or the phone service is bad . So I went in person to order and to find out the phone is left on the side so no incoming calls can come . While the workers are laughing and playing. Soho went from good service to had . The food also taste way different from before . They need a makeover !!!! And I know I'm not the only one who sees this ...

KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) is the absolute best!

Takes awhile to come out - but worth the wait!

This isn't your traditional Korean restaurant. They have a fusion twist to the food like sandwiches and quesadillas and the food here is pretty solid.

The soho chicken wings are very good. Very crispy and not dry. The Seasoned flavor was ok, it's a bit on the milder side of tastes and slightly sweet. If it had a bit more kick then it would've been perfect.

The seafood pancake is well made. If there were a little more baby oysters it would've been nice as you get big bites of just the pancake and nothing else.

The bulgogi dubap was solid, nothing too special about it.  Well flavored, but definitely isn't a top pick.

The real star is the cheese and fried dumpling rice cake. Delicious. A combination of sweet and spicy cutting through the cheese. Very enjoyable! The dumplings are well made, the meat nicely seasoned with a tiny amount of spice. 

All in all a great restaurant with excellent service. Some of the food varies with what you pick but you can not go wrong with the spicy rice cakes or the wings. They are a must have!

This is one of my favorite Korean places in the area! Parking is a little tough but there is usually some street parking available. Their tteokbokki is delicious, and the portion is HUGE. The fried chicken is crispy and flavorful every time. There are little buttons on the table where you can call over your waiter, ask for the check, etc, and they are always helpful. Only knock is that on some crowded nights, it can take a while for the food to be ready. Would definitely come here again!
Hidden gem in the heart of Cheltenham. Great Korean BBQ and unique atmosphere. Perfect place if you've never tried Korean BBQ before.

We started with the Crabstick Kimbap which was really good. My fiancé was expecting it to taste like sushi which it does not. She was a little let down by them but I thought they were good.

They then brought out the bang bang shrimp and the bulgogi fried rice. The bang bang shrimp was an appetizer but is definitely enough for a meal. The flavors on this shrimp were delicious. They were very breaded but were extremely well seasoned. The bulgogi fried rice was an entree but was enough for 2-3 people to eat. This was better than expected. It had vegetables and what seemed like a 2 egg omelette buried instead of it. The rice was also sprinkled with what seemed to be mozzarella cheese. I don't know if this is customary of Fried rice in Korean food but that was the first time I've had it like that.  I loved it. 

Lastly, those wings mannnnnn. Them jawns were serious. Best Korean fried chicken wings I've ever had. Nuff said!

As far as wings go I would rate these in the top 5 I've ever had in life and I've tried ALOT of wings. Super crispy, the sauces are all amazing, and the wings are tiny or super big. Service is pretty good too. 8.5/10 would def recommend!

Soho has the best Korean fried chicken that Philly can offer, however, stars are deducted based on overall experience. I've been here enough time. As stated, really good kfc compared to other ones offered, such as Bonchon. However, other dishes aren't as good nor nearly good, like the rice cakes, which is sickening sweet. Service is inconsistent and I've dealt a fair share of negative experiences. They may be attentive or you'll be ignored after being seated. It's easier to order take out.
The Korean fried chicken (soy garlic and any of the spicy wings) are just delicious.  Wings are always good and no fat which I detest.  The price has gone up due to this damn pandemic.
Went here the other night for takeout. The seafood pancake was delicious. We ordered the seasoned wings and soy. So crispy and yummy. Will be back.
Love their chicken and have some good spicy ramen. Always open late for the late night snacker

This place probably serves the best Korean fried chicken I've ever had. I've been here several times, all in the evening and there was always parking on the street. There's never a line and the food came in 15-20 mins. The staff aren't always walking around checking if you need service but there are call buttons on the tables to get their attention. 

I always get the large wings, half soy and half spicy. It's crunchy on the outside, but tender and juicy on the inside. I've had wings where there was just way too much sauce but Cafe Soho strikes a good balance. The spicy rice cakes are also pretty good, cheesy with a spicy kick.

Can't believe I would find the best Korean fried chicken in the US in Philly. Dallas has pretty solid Korean food so I was really excited when someone told me this place has better KFC than Dallas. 

The only downside is they only have KFC tossed in sauces. I really like dry rubs on KFC so if they had that option this place would be perfect! We got soy garlic and the special sauce and they are both delicious. The chicken is so light and crispy - I didn't feel guilty or bloated at all after eating it. Special sauce was more on the sweeter side, the sprinkled white sesame seed on top was a nice plus. Soy garlic was also sweeter than expected but the strong garlic flavor was nice. 

If you get the large (18 pieces) I  would recommend getting a savory & a sweet flavor so it balanced out or else it'll all taste too similar. 

*you can pick 2 flavor for the large order*

Also it didn't take as long for us to get our food. I was nervous because I saw a lot of people saying it takes 45+ min. But I think if you dine in, the food comes out faster!

My writing a review for this restaurant is doing nothing more but adding to the cacophony of the praise this restaurant has received regarding its KFC. Yes, Korean fried chicken (KFC). If you haven't tried it yet, this is probably one of the best restaurants in the area to try it.
Amazing food! Soy garlic fried chicken, bulgogi kimbap, radish, kimchi & milk tea slushy with Boba

Not sure why I have not reviewed this yet, it is one of the best places in the city if not THE best For Korean barbecue wings. I highly recommend multiple different flavors that I've had, they are crunchy and yet flavorful inside to see at the same time. That is not anything correct in that last sentence from what I actually said, I still think that AutoCorrect has a long way to go to really understand the true nuance of the English language.
Great honey garlic wings, they're hot and fresh and made to Order. Make sure you call in the order and have 45 mins to a hour to wait tho ‍

I used to like eating here until the staff cheated my family this evening. We ordered a large 20 piece soy chicken and three bubble teas only to receive 3 slushies and only 18 pieces of chicken. When we called back about our take-out order the manager came on the phone and admitted they have been giving 18 pieces for 5 years (even though their menu stated 20 piece). Then the manager offered 2 wings as if we were willing to drive back to the restaurant for 2 pieces of chicken.
Wings were cooked perfectly! Definitely very spicy sauce had a good taste! Potstickers were amazing also the side sauce was awesome would definitely recommend! Staff friendly

I love their soy garlic wings. The sauce on these are like nothing you've ever had. Whether you get take out or dine in you won't be disappointed. Make sure you order ahead because it takes time to make these wings, which I like because they are always fresh and hot when I get them!
Best korean chicken ever!! So glad it's less than 10 minutes away from my house. They're not open for dine-in as of now due to COVID :( for everyone who hasn't tried soho, yall are missing out!

Cool place kimchi Rice is so darn good and the wings are good as well.
Nothing else will do when you are in the mood for Soho Wings

business.name: Taco Bus
business.categories: Food Trucks, Restaurants, Street Vendors, Food, Mexican

reviews.text:
MOVED, not Closed!!!

That's it. This review is solely for folks who've missed the hell out of Taco Bus, especially vegetarians... and I'm betting I'm not the only one who didn't know what I had until it was gone. 

The food isn't fast. It hasn't been during 90% of my visits, including online orders. The experience in the new place is different. BUT, Taco Bus has this sort-of gourmet, fast food-feel (note I said "feel") when it comes to vegetarian food, and that's hard to come by around St. Pete at their prices. 

So join me now, vegetarians of St Pete...  HAPPY DANCE!!! woo-hooooo!!!!

Today, I cried in a taco. I think my tears helped to spice up the tacos but alas, I could not persevere and they met a fate that no other taco should have to face -  a trash can. Tacos, you deserved to be made better, you deserve to be photographed and eaten not tossed in the trash like a bag of doggie poo.

Having first tried Taco Bus when I first moved to the Tampa Bay Area, I was delighted to find a place that specialized in tacos and served a variety of vegetarian options. And I enjoy my meal there so I am at a lost as to why the meal at the St Pete location was so heinous. 

I ordered the butternut squash taco and the vegetarian "steak" taco. Bland, mushy,flavorless and inedible. It was a sad taco day.

I would consider it better than Taco Bell I suppose. Until I realize how much more it costs than Taco Bell. 
Also, all the signs that say "ice cold beer" are not true. They don't serve beer. 
So if you want a cerveza and a taco, go somewhere else. Even if you don't want a beer and you just want a tasty taco, go somewhere else. 
Do. Not. Eat. Here.

The ambiance is amazing. I enjoy myself here. Seating outside and people watching here are my fav thing. The food? So far, I'm not blown away. However, the eggs taco is amaziiiing. The other tacos are just average. To be fair I have only eaten tacos there. One of the girls and I have decided that I needed to upgrade LOL. I eat too many tacos. My belly is small that's the issue. I will have to update my review once I try other things, hopefully for the best. 
Try their sangria, I think it makes the whole experience nicer. 
The music makes it really worth seating here when they have it. The dj plays everything. I do wish he would play more latin music, but everything is fair to everyone.

We are long term customers at this Taco Bus. We have eaten there at all hours bringing many out of town guests introducing them to what we have always thought was great casual Mexican food. Today we stopped in for lunch and had the worst meal ever. The carne asada was overcooked, literally burned, dry and cold. So cold that the cheese never even warmed, let alone melt. My wife ordered the "rajas" which were supposed to be roasted poblano peppers. They never saw the grill, coming out bright green and cold as well. The place appeared to be totally unsupervised. The corn tortillas were not fresh and broke in pieces, the rice was cold and dry while the refríes beans were hot and tasty. I don't understand what happened as they were not even busy. They no longer offer the plastic bottles of green and red salsa. It is now served in containers like for ketchup but it remains delicious. We ate in the room with air conditioning but the AC was not on. The ice dispenser in the drink station was out of ice. The tables were sticky, no salt on tables only pepper. The ladies restroom toilet seat was broken. We were very disappointed and hope that this is a one time occurrence. I am debating if I will go back. It may be a while.

Came here with my sister and a friend who raved about this place to us. Our friend got a quesadilla and they loved it, slightly too much pico de gallo for their tastes. 

I got the two carne asada tacos with pico de gallo, cabbage, and guacamole on top. My sister got the two chicken chipotle tacos. We also got two agua de piñas, or pineapple water. That honestly changed my life. 

The food was really incredibly and also Guy Fieri ate here so that got me really excited. I felt full but not grossly so, good portion sizes and not super expensive at all.

The ambiance is amazing. I enjoy myself here. Seating outside and people watching here is my fav thing. The food? So far, I'm not impressed at all. The tacos are average at best. Try the sangria, I think it makes the whole experience nicer. 
The music makes it really worth seating here. They play everything. I do wish they would play more latin music, but everything is fair.

So we were the first customer of the day with one person behind us. We ordered the chipotle chicken quesadilla, roasted poblano quesadilla without pico, a kids chicken taco, and kids quesadilla. Roughly 30 minutes later, we got our food... some of it... and my wife's had pico. 
They took back my wife's to redo it. I also had to go ask again for the guacamole and sour cream I had paid for. About 5 minutes later, the food rearrived, as well as my daughter's taco. 
My chipotle chicken was more like a salted Dobie sponge with not even a hint of chipotle. At least the guacamole was good. My wife's roasted poblano may have seen a roast once, but it was not. 
After this meal, I feel terrible, because this was our last lunch date for the summer. From now on, we'll stick with Mercado.
Taco Bus is amazing. They have great food and excellent service. This is the best place to get tacos in the St. Pete area.

You guys used to be my go to for quick, solid tacos. I don't know if there was change in management or something, but the last couple times haven't been great and today's order was legitimately disgusting. The bag was dripping with refried beans before I got to the car, the peppers in the rajas con queso were nearly raw, and everything else was nearly tasteless. I won't be back.
First time here. Ordered the fish tacos. Hot, fresh, crisp veggies. Exactly what I'd hoped for -- fantastic!

This is the most overhyped taco place ever. On my one visit they got my super complicated order (chicken buritto, chido, no jalapenos) twice, brought out my dessert first and had me get up from my table to explain my incorrect order to the truck. Wtf.

I have such fond memories of late night Taco Bus at the original location on Hillsborough, so I was hopeful that TBSP would be just as good. I moved to the Edge District a few months ago, and I've come here 3-4 times. Not impressed.

But hey, I'm willing to give you another chance. Let me know when you start putting soap in your nasty bathroom, and I'll think about it.

This place has great potential for vegetarians because of the menu offering a variety of veggie options. Sadly the preparation and delivery of vegetarian items is NOT as it should be. We ordered 2 burritos with the portobello mushroom option and found meat mixed into one of the burritos. NOT comforting to know that I maybe ate MEAT.

Meat in my vegan burrito

Clearly Taco Bus DOES NOT use separate grills for meat and meatless cooking and food preparation. I found a trace piece of steak in my portobello ranchero burrito preñado with vegan cheese. Why did I have to pay $2 extra for the Daiya vegan cheese option if they served me a meat contaminated burrito?

I won't be dining at Taco Bus again.
Great food! The Grouper Taco is a favorite. It's location next to The Dog Bar is a plus!

We came here because Guy Fieri ate here so we had to try it. We're from Baltimore. The steak tacos were way over cooked and flavorless. The chicken quesadilla was really good. We also had shredded pork tacos and those were alright. I don't think we would come back here, not because it was bad, but because there are many other better taco places.
The most delicious authentic tacos in all the land. Very lowkey place but I truly dream of these tacos. The horchata and agua fresca is so good. I wish I could eat here every day

This place serves over-priced, mediocre food with a side of negative attitude. We ordered our food- two tacos and a burrito with soft drinks. We then had to remind the cashier that we needed two drink cups, not one. The cups came with no smile, no thanks, no response.
We sat inside waiting for our "for here" order, but came out every five minutes just to check on the order in case we missed hearing our name called. After 20 minutes, one of the employees came over and asked if we had ordered! We told her the order and she went back to the bus. Then, another employee came over and said that the machine did not print our order, therefore they needed my receipt to recall it, and, again, asked what our order was. The employee returned stating that the cashier could not bring up the receipt, and so asked what our order was- for the third time! I thought the printer problem was rather unique as it must have chosen only our order, as the customers right before and after us got their orders out and proceeded to eat.
After another 10 minutes, the order came out, and I had to ask for my receipt back, and the employee went back to the bus to retrieve it. In the end, the tacos were mediocre at best, and the "grouper" had been fried beyond recognition or taste. Please bare in mind that at no time was any apology made for turning a fast food stop into a 30 minute fiasco for less than acceptable food. On the contrary, we were made to feel as though We should apologize to Them for wasting Their time. The experience was bad enough to cause me to sign up for Yelp and write this as I depend on Yelp when visiting other cities.

My first time here and I had high hopes. I ordered two tacos once pollo verde and the carne asada both with guac & sour cream. The carne asada has some flavor to it, but not enough to really make my mouth water. The pollo verde lacked on flavor. K even used the salsa that came with, but it just didn't give it what I was hoping for. The pulled chicken was just dry and flavorless. I ate half of each taco and then I picked out the insides of each and ate with the chips we ordered with the guacamole. I must say their horchata is the best I've ever had! Sweet, thick and creamy with a hint of cinnamon and the taste reminded me of rizzogalo (Greek rice pudding). The pineapple water was also a delight! I wasn't expecting it to taste so delicious! I will have to come back and try other items on the menu because I've heard great things from other friends who've eaten here.

Second time In a row that I've gone and taken family visiting from out of town and was severely disappointed compared to past visits. Everything was wrong...the staff are "lazy" and cold, the food was terrible...my pollo verde was old and extremely dry, my daughter's carne asada was old and tough (consistency of beef jerky) and obviously barely reheated, we asked for extra sour cream barely got any let alone extra (which they charged us for), they forgot to give us the salsa verde to go that we always order. I was pretty disgusted by the whole operation. Had hopes that they would make up for the last visit when the food was mediocre at best and the girl taking the order was only half paying attention so we had to repeat everything to her twice. Also, the cook was snarky with me when he brought out the order and I simply asked if the cheese I ordered made it onto my tacos as a confirmation because again, I didn't have much confidence in the manner the girl took our order. We had given it another chance which was our last visit this past Thursday and things were worse as mentioned above so sad to say, that was our last visit except to simply buy the salsa verde to go. My parents and brother used to drive straight to the bus once they hit town even before seeing their own daughter & granddaughter/sister & niece because they loved it so much back when it was good. They would also eat there 2-3 times per week during their visit...no joke. I used to tell everyone about how awesome the bus was...now I'll be telling them something different..

Wish I could give them 5 because they have great food and usually good service... but I wish they chose more environmentally responsible containers. As a business owner, I know that the right choice isn't always the least expensive. But sustainability is very popular right now, I'm sure their customers would recognize and appreciate the switch. I can't justify coming back until then.

Worst experience at a taco bus ever. They forgot guacamole. The burrito was cold. They remade it. They insisted tacos full of only cheese curds were portobello tacos, so I had them make tofu tacos instead, then sometime after I received the tofu tacos they brought a cup of mushrooms apologizing for the new staff.  Other locations are amazing and the food expediter apologized but it was just too many problems in one order and the food still wasn't like other locations.
30 mins waiting for food and then the guy mouths off to me because I wanted a refund. Poor service and poor food

Visited for my first and last time this past Saturday. The food was so bad we didn't even finish the first taco, let alone eat the second. They put the guacamole on the wrong order, but it didn't matter when the only thing you can taste is refried beans. The fillings were very small in proportion to the shell. No way we will ever be back. The worst Mexican food ever.

business.name: 5th & Taylor
business.categories: Southern, Bars, Nightlife, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), American (Traditional)

reviews.text: Hi guys, this is my first review under 4 stars because I like to keep it uplifting - however we felt like our server was trying to rush us and get us out of the restaurant basically from the time we arrived at 7:40 pm - hardly end of the night slackers. He packed up our food to go & took our utensils while we were still eating! Meanwhile trying to sell us more stuff! How about letting us enjoy the expensive food we already ordered!? Super awkward. Do you want people to feel at ease & welcome in your restaurant..? Not the way it's done y'all. Not a good look. Otherwise yummy food & cool space - hence 3 stars.
Great scene and amazing food and drinks. I would go back just for the cucumber gimlet! Service was good and was super accommodating with me being celiac. Definitely great date spot.

Always wanting to try something new, we decided to try out 5 th and Taylor to celebrate my birthday! We made reservations but the restaurant wasn't too bust when we arrived. We appreciated the valet parking, because it was a nasty rainy Sunday night. We were seated immediately!

I ordered the Chai Chai Slide to drink and my husband got the All Day Caliente! Both were very good, we were happy with our choices! We ordered the Beef Tartare for a starter and it was very good. We enjoyed it while sipping our drinks!

When ready to order I asked our waitress which one she preferred, the Beef Filet or the Leg of Lamb... she informed me that they were out of the Filet! I was sort of upset because honestly that's what I was leaning towards. I settled with the leg of lamb. I will say, the title "leg of lamb" is very misinforming on the menu, as the lamb is not actually a "leg" it is more of a lamb chop. When I have ordered a leg of lamb in the past, I typically am presented with a lamb shank. I would have preferred my lamb been cooked for medium rare, it was still good. I'm not sure I would recommend the leg of lamb if I was asked what to order here. My husband ordered the Mixed Grill and he said that it was very good.

The atmosphere was very unique and the staff was very friendly. We might be back to try the Beef Filet and the Ribeye!

Always wanting to try something new, we decided to try out 5 th and Taylor to celebrate my birthday! We made reservations but the restaurant wasn't too bust when we arrived. We appreciated the valet parking, because it was a nasty rainy Sunday night. We were seated immediately!

I ordered the Chai Chai Slide to drink and my husband got the All Day Caliente! Both were very good, we were happy with our choices! We ordered the Beef Tartare for a starter and it was very good. We enjoyed it while sipping our drinks!

When ready to order I asked our waitress which one she preferred, the Beef Filet or the Leg of Lamb... she informed me that they were out of the Filet! I was sort of upset because honestly that's what I was leaning towards. I settled with the leg of lamb. I will say, the title "leg of lamb" is very misinforming on the menu, as the lamb is not actually a "leg" it is more of a lamb chop. When I have ordered a leg of lamb in the past, I typically am presented with a lamb shank. I would have preferred my lamb been cooked for medium rare, it was still good. I'm not sure I would recommend the leg of lamb if I was asked what to order here. My husband ordered the Mixed Grill and he said that it was very good.

The atmosphere was very unique and the staff was very friendly. We might be back to try the Beef Filet and the Ribeye!

Food and drinks were amazing. Service was fine. Had the fried chicken and could not have been happier with my decision. Came with creamy mashed potatoes. Cocktails were good too. Great higher end dining.

Great restaurant for a fancy dinner! The atmosphere is good for date night or fancy celebration. I got the short rib and it was cooked to perfection. Tender, juicy, delicious. The fig chutney paired extremely well with the short rib. The Brussel sprouts were flavored well and mashed potatoes delicious! They charge a split plate fee, so we opted to order our own dishes.

We recently celebrated my boyfriends birthday here, and we're BLOWN away by our experience. One of the best dinners we've had in Nashville, period.

The service and personal touches were unbelievable. I requested a cozy table to celebrate, and they delivered on a corner booth with a Happy Birthday sign already on the table as we arrived. Our server was so kind and knowledgeable on the menu.

The space is just gorgeous - open air, industrial feel, but still warm and comforting. We started with cocktails which were both delicious and reasonably priced, I think $12 which is reasonable for a nice restaurant in Nashville.

The food was all incredible. We started with the duck wings, coated with corn meal and topped with truffle honey for the perfect salty sweet combo. For entrees we had short ribs and a steak, along with a side of Brussels. All entrees come with family style mashed potatoes, as well - which I'm pretty sure are unlimited! 

All in all, one of the best special occasion meals we've had in a long time. bravo!

I booked a reservation online about 2 weeks in advance as we had a party of 7. The ambiance of this restaurant at night is very chic with the low light atmosphere. However, with the lighting, it was a little difficult to read the menu (we had to use the lights on our phones to read the menu), but I can appreciate the intimate atmosphere it created. 

To start, we shared the sausage-cheddar biscuits & the beef tartar. Both were excellent and would definitely recommend. For entrees, I opted for the beef filet with oxtail gravy & mashed potatoes. My filet was cooked perfectly and I savored every bite! We ordered a couple of side dishes for the table - the brussel sprouts (12/10!!) & cornbread. Both were phenomenal! The fried chicken had a chili honey drizzle was extremely tasty as well. I think they slightly over did it on the honey. In the future, I would definitely ask for the honey on the side to have more control over the sweetness of the dish. 

The service was just ok. They brought out our dishes at the same time, but the drinks took a little longer than anticipated. I also like to look at the menu prior to going to a restaurant. They have a daily rotating menu so the dish I had saw on their website and wanted to order wasn't on their menu when we dined there. 

Overall, this is a great date night spot if you don't mind splurging.

Let me start by saying that we had a medium sized group (7).  2 sets of appetizers were ordered. Both the biscuits and quail wings were delicious. We ordered 6 different  entrees and 5 of the 6 were very good.  Can you guess whose was not?   I had snacked all afternoon and was not that hungry so I ordered the Hamburger.  The buns were not just marked but we're charcoaled and tasted burnt. I ordered it medium and there was not a bit of pink in it, gray throughout.  Thought I might salvage it with more mayonnaise but that didn't help.  First place in an extremely long time that I have went to that actually screwed up a hamburger.  I will say the fries and mash potatoes were very good. The group may go back but it won't be for a burger.

Came here for our first dinner in Nashville and it was a good way to start the trip. We got the chicken liver mousse and the ribeye to share. Our server suggested we pair the ribeye with the wood fired mushroom and we were glad we agreed as they broke up the bites between the meat and complemented the ox tail gravy well. I would skip the chicken liver mousse and maybe get the duck wings instead. Saw a lot of those orders going by and they looked and smelled great. The rosemary bread was a bit crumbly and dry and the liver mousse itself was just okay.

We were almost an hour late for our reservation (flight delay and slow Uber). But we were treated with utmost respect and friendliness. Our party of four was seated immediately and our server was prompt on greeting us and diving into menu selections. 

We had our drink orders in and immediately relaxed and settled in for a casual fun night. 

The ambiance of this place is phenomenal and very festive for the holidays. 

Menu options had plenty to choose from. We always ask the staff their favorites before choosing. We had bacon wrapped quail and sausage cheddar biscuits - still craving the jam on the biscuits. Great starters as we pondered our entrées. I like to share and have opportunity to try a little of everything. The filllet was cooked to perfection - duck had so many flavor explosions with the sauces and our favorite was the braised beef cheeks. The meat was so tender and flavorful. We finished off our meal with fried apple pie. This is not your normal slice that mom served!  Ice cream and bourbon sauce were perfect additions and I really wanted this to myself. 

This place made me happy and nice kickstart to our weekend in Nashville. It is in a hip part of town away from the party scene on Broadway.  I will definitely be back.

The fried chicken is honestly probably the best in nashville. Also, this is a really cool and fun date spot. Its got the dim lighting thats perfect for a date spot, but the vibe is way more relaxed and energetic. Would definitely recommend
Great food, Especially the quail legs, duck, and the apple dumpling. Very average service, but rest assured, they will add gratuity without telling you!

Thank you for served us. We came from San Francisco. The ambience is beautiful and customer service is excellence. We came here on Tuesday night, I got a table right away the restaurant were not busy at all. All of our orders were good except short rib was too salty. I let my wife take a bite for a opinion. She also said short rib was too salty.

Came in as group of 5 with reservations and we were immediately sat. Our server was wonderful. Made recommendations, refills were done quickly, water replaced, dishes cleared. Seamless service. 

We started with the cheese plate and the jalapeño biscuits. The cheese plate I could only have 1 of the 3-4 as most were unpasteurized. Our mistake for not asking before. The biscuits were very good. Many of my dinning companions got the filet which were cooked well. One person sent theirs back to be cooked more not because it wasn't the temp that asked but because the person who ordered just wanted it more done so I don't count that on the restaurant. Some one ordered the Cauliflower entree which they liked. The mashed potatoes were described as "heavenly" by many people. We got mushrooms and spinach as well. I got the mussels from the appetizer menu as my meal. It was good. Almost all of the mussels were opened and the white wine tomato broth was yummy but I think it could use some garlic or something else to give it a touch more flavor. But I liked it. We ended with the fried apple pie which is a must! Pricy but yummy!

Now i'm not the most bougie boy on the block with boucous of money for browned bourbon and brussels sprouts, but I'd bound back to this big room of a restaurant if I ate out enough. 

Usually if I'm in a fancy restaurant I feel as out of place as an actual stag at a prom, or a beach ball at a Miranda Lambert concert. However I'm happy to say I didn't feel judged for breathing more often than a few times a minute. 

Our waiter was at the end of a long shift I could tell, but still told everything possible about the specials and what was good. He probably knew the name of the cow we ate from that night, but was kind enough to not impart that knowledge to us. 

And good news for fans of Rosie Food and Wine in Hendersonville! Same napkins. You'll feel right at home. 

The drinks were excellent, nothing too insane and nothing too sane. Bourbon drink was better than getting stabbed by Miranda Lambert. 

Brussels Sprouts came out in a tiny cast iron skillet. Usually this scares the shit out of me because it is the kind of thing a cook would do if they had been told what good cooking was, but had only executed a burnt chocolate shake. Fortunately it wasn't made by the squidward of nashville, I wanted to kick the people around me for not ordering it for themselves. Hell I might start kicking the people around me now just to convince them to go and get the damn brussels sprouts.

And the pot roast....... Jesus. Holy hell. It did for me what secretly staying up late in fifth grade to watch Family Guy did for my middle school sense of humor. I ascended. I mean this pot roast was so good, if I had covid it'd probably bring my taste buds back. Potatoes were hard tho. 

I will come back as soon as I'm not broke as a vase in a museum shootout.

Three stars for effort! The ambience is beautiful, the service is EXCELLENT and the recipes are inspired. BUT, the executive taster must have burned their salt taste buds because everything was so salty that we actually felt slightly unwell by the end of the meal. I wish we could somehow ignore this issue, but it overwhelmed us to the point that we won't return unless the chef changes the recipes -- or allows us to order the dishes with less salt. 

Fortunately, this is an easy fix: use more fresh flavors, like a dash of minced onion, a twist of citrus, or freshly grind an herb. Salt should only be used sparingly to help a subtle flavor pop or to bring a watery soup up to the right salinity. 

This restaurant has so much going for it, that we really do hope that they can fix the recipes and we will happily return.

Items ordered: Pinot noir, Rock Hill bourbon, Bacon wrapped quail, Alabama crab claws, Short rib, and Brussels sprouts. (We were too salt-logged to order dessert.)

This was a great dining experience from start to finish. Our service and server were amazing! I'm so sad I can't remember his name. He was fun to chat with but didn't linger and gave great recommendations for other dining options, as we were visiting from out of town. 

The menu had something for everyone in our group. Our table had:
Autumn Salad
Sausage Cheddar Biscuits
Duck'am
Short Rib
Fried Chicken
Burger
Brussel Sprouts
Cornbread Bites

Literally every single thing was amazing. My personal dish was the duck and it melted in your mouth. I had bites from everyone's plates and the beef short rib shouldn't be skipped or the fried chicken. The mashed potatoes were creamy and savory, and the salad was so fresh! Really don't have a single bad thing to say about our experience.

The food was exceptional. Pretty sure they had Angels themselves in the back cooking the food. We don't know how we will ever eat again. How do you go from eating that exceptional food and go back to McDonalds??!? No. Just. No. 


Service was wonderful. Very attentive. We never ran out of our drinks. This ain't no T.J.I. Fridays where you're waiting 10 minutes for your cup to be filled and you're asking yourself "Now, where did the waiter go?!" Very. Very good service. 


The vibe was intimate. If you're looking for a place for date night, or night out with the girls this is the place. It's dark but not too dark. The candles around the entire restaurant make the ambiance perfection.  I honestly have no complaints.

Really incredible place. The ambience is amazing, the service is top notch. Was visiting and wanted to get away from downtown/Broadway and this definitely did not disappoint. Food was a 4/5 but definitely still worth it! Cheese plate is a great starter, bacon wrapped quail is good- but wouldn't get again. Fried chicken was amazing!!!! Mashed potatoes are bland but were not needed with all the other food.

#fatjared say...WOW, BLOWN AWAY. For a restaurant experience you can't go wrong here, highly highly suggest coming. It is worth the hype it is given.

When I grade restaurants I have strict consistent criteria. 5 stars is the best you can give on Yelp so to receive 5 stars you must be perfect, from beginning to end. I look back on my experience at 5th and Taylor and can't find 1 complaint or something even remotely close.

The menu is simple, but will change seasonally. They stick with a similar theme and flavor profile for dishes during different times. They have vegetarian, but stick to mostly meats. AND...PRO TIP...almost every entree comes with bottomless mashed potatoes. They are creamy and delicious too!!

I'm a big taster, so we end up ordering lots of things. The sausage biscuits were homemade, with maple flavor on the sausage, dijonaisse sauce, and a sweet pepper jelly. The bacon wrapped quail had a blackberry reduction to go with the barbecue flavor and very tender meat. The crab claws were fresh, amazing lemon flavor, and they gave us about 20 of them!

The duck breast starts with a tender bite, hint of either gravy or blackberry sauce, and finishes with the salty kick from the prosciutto it's wrapped in. Amazing flavors!! The brussels were some of the best I have had, all tender, cheese and charr on them, and add that to the mushrooms that had a smoky flavor and it was perfect.

We obviously did dessert, ordered bourbon vanilla ice cream with chocolate cake. They accidentally brought out chocolate and vanilla ice cream, so said not worries it's on us, and brought the cake as well. The cake was AMAZING!! Cooked in the dish it is served in there is fudge on the bottom with walnuts on top and little charred bits of cake around the side. 

Elizabeth was a great waitress, thorough but not hovering, and the entire atmosphere was fun and welcoming. The people who have rated this under 5 stars are even more nit picky than me, and I have high standards. I love this place. Absolutely please and couldn't suggest it more. 5 stars all the way!!

New entree's menu every evening makes it a special place- a must to eat at during a stay in Nashville. Our Air BnB happened to be within walking distance of this gem and we weren't disappointed. Chicken liver mousse, Beef tartare as starters were delicious and fish entrees were worth the wait. Group's waitress Elizabeth was very knowledgeable and advised on the makes of dishes very eloquently. 
Highly recommend - try their variety of cocktails and different entree creations.

Thank you...thank you...to everyone at 5th & Taylor. First, you have an incredible location...and amazing food. Your servers were friendly and efficient. What really stands out for me though is that your events team made a very special evening even more spectacular. My friend had just gone through a heart transplant in May 2021, and he had to visit Nashville for more tests on his birthday. After explaining how important a relaxing but socially distant celebration would be, you made it happen. For your culinary expertise, your enthusiasm and creativity, and most of all for your kindness and compassion, everyone should know...THIS IS THE PLACE to dine!!!

We went to 5th & Taylor for our 25th anniversary dinner. We were very pleased with our entire experience. Service was excellent from the time we walked in the door until the time we left. Our food was delicious. The whole vibe was amazing. We would definitely go back and I definitely would recommend this place!

I haven't been to 5th & Taylor in a year and couldn't wait. They never disappoint!!! The Alabama crab claws were fantastic and the tri tip was delicious. We are at the bar and Steph and Abbey were very attentive and friendly. Skylar, their head of catering was outstanding showing us the party space and what she can do for us. This is the best restaurant in all of Nashville!!!

The food at 5th and Taylor was really good and very fresh! I tried the tuna poke and you could tell it was extremely fresh. The beef pot roast was also very good and the meat was very tender. 

I visited 5th and Taylor to try the halibut and I was extremely excited to check it out. However, the waitress informed me that the halibut had a bacon sauce in it. I don't eat bacon so I'm glad she mentioned it when I asked her opinion on it because it is not clearly listed on the menu. I'm sure there are other people with dietary restrictions that are being misled by the menu's lack of description.

business.name: XIX Nineteen
business.categories: Cafes, Lounges, Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Restaurants, Nightlife, Seafood

reviews.text: My family and I were here for the Thanksgiving Buffet. It was excellent affair. Every station offered multiple things I loved. Live Jazz trio too. Very elegant.  Ill be back next year.

Very formal restaurant, with magnificent views. When it comes to city skyline views at restaurants, this tops the list. Great spot to dress up, and celebrate something. Amazing bartenders, drinks were on point.

This restaurant was the absolute best service and highest quality food I've ever had in the city!! Our waiter (Rasheed) was so well versed and knowledgeable--it certainly eased my anxiety for my first five star experience.
Love the brunch, the lounge, the bar menu, the atmosphere, interior design, music, staff, food.

I went for breakfast with my daughter. The server overheard her mentioned how fancy it was and he went out of his way to give us top of line "fancy" service. Breakfast was simple- bacon and eggs for me, pastries and yogurt for her. It was yummy. But, the dining room, the view and the service are spectacular.

Good food. Nice views. Super service. Located on the 19th floor of the Bellevue. If you're just in the mood for drinks and small bites, there is a nice little bar with bar stools and chairs and tables for relaxing or working.

Elegant, sophisticated, classy! Never had braised boar before but I'll gladly have it again. I dined here during restaurant week and the meat was falling off of the bone! I enjoyed everything! The service was outstanding and the portions were good. I can't wait to go back!

Went there for City Restaurant Week. Enjoyed it very much. We had three course meal for $35. Winter vegetable and barley soup, wild boar shank and peanut butter cheesecake. All were very good. Boat shank was very tender and delicious. I would return again.

As a frequent visitor to XIX, I am usually impressed.  However, I have noticed since there is new management that the work balance is extremely unequal which impacts the experience.  When the bartender (yes, only 1!!) is literally running around and the hostess is on her phone, there is a big systemic problem.  The bar is in the weeds while the dining room is prepped for tomorrow's breakfast.  This never happened with others leading the group.  Cheers to Stephen the bartender for keeping the place running!!

So we spoke to management and they fixed it. Just unfortunate that it had to take complaining about an experience to make it right. But I appreciate the effort and it wasn't the waitstaff fault but the buffet. Buffet needed to replenisb itself.

Staying at this hotel so had breakfast at its restaurant which hotel is very proud of and recommended to guests. Had full breakfast buffet, standard stuffs with less choices than other hotels offered. Service is also just ok, last guest used two jams out of 5 on the rack, server didn't put new jams when they prepare the table.

My sister and I wanted to surprise our parents with dinner in the city in celebration of the holiday season. We researched many options and decided on XIX. XIX did not disappoint! It was the perfect venue for a relaxing evening of conversation and good food. We dined in the pearl room, which was intimate and quiet. Our waiter served a basket of bread with softened butter. We each ordered a different main dish- short ribs, salmon, pasta, and trout. I sampled each of them and although every dish was delicious, the braised beef short ribs were the best! They were perfectly tenderized and seasoned. If my wallet would allow it, I would eat them everyday. I highly recommend XIX for the excellent ambiance, great service, and delicious food.
Spare yourself. The quality of food is horrible, I've purchased better steaks from an Acme. They serve cheap wine and horribly imbalanced cocktails. Go somewhere else, anywhere else, really.

Booked a nice meal before seeing The Barber of Seville kimmel center this past weekend . Ordered off of the pre theater menu and chose the Cream of Fennel Tomato and Paprika Soup, Rohan Duck Breast, and Mulled Wine Poached Pear. For starters the soup could have been a bit hotter but very tasty. The duck was cooked to a medium and a bit under seasoned though the cranberry citrus puree really helped push the dish. Lastly I was a bit disappointed by the dessert which I was expecting a warm pear that would be easy to cut through , though it was hard . Though the dish had good flavor and I enjoyed the coffee. Overall I give a 3.5 an extra .5 for the awesome service that we received. Awesome view, awesome decor, close by for the arts.

Chosen for it's proximity to the Academy of Music, but now we can't wait to return for a more leisurely savoring of one of the best prixe fix brunches I've ever had.  You can imagine how spectacular it is if I say it was a great value even at $45/head. (Alcoholic drinks are extra.)

We were on tight timeline to make the 2pm matinee of the ballet at the Academy (literally next door on Broad, across Locust St).  Staff kept us on schedule without making us feel rushed -- just well attended to.

First course: mini-buffet around a tall bar area -- you serve yourself raw bar items such as shrimp and oysters, plus excellent nova/smoked salmon, a couple great salads, and sundry other delicious things.  Second course is ordered from an enticing list of entrees -- some brunch-like, some supper-like.  I ordered the crispy-skinned bronzino over faro, my mother (her special birthday) ordered crab-cakes Benedict.  Both dishes were perfectly prepared and beautifully presented and just the right portion size to leave room for... the scrumptious dessert buffet. Mini cakes and tarts, fresh berries, muffins too numerous to taste all so a return trip is necessary.

The place was surprisingly uncrowded -- perhaps people were put off by the requirement of 3 courses, or the $45 price (it comes to that or more in the end, at less expensive restaurants around center city) but the parking at $30 (with the unimpressive $2 discount from the restaurant) was very, very off-putting.  Parking should not add 30% more cost to your meal!  They really must solve that -- especially on weekends when the adjacent garage is not as busy as during the week.  They also should open the bridge entrance from the parking garage to the hotel -- it was sad to have my dear mother hobbling precariously to make her way to the hotel -- although there was a very slow elevator next to the Ludlow St entrance stairs.  A doorman's help is needed for access.  The lobby elevator is right next to it to travel to the restaurant on the 19th floor (hence the name XIX).  

Beautiful, romantic, ornate but comfortable for business.  Tables nicely spaced.  Great, glass-enclosed private dining room looked like it seated 16 or so.  It's a splurge that was so worth it for how much joy my mother had going there!

Went to XIX for a dinner cocktail and the cuisine and service was great. The view from the restaurant is nice. There is a dedicated elevator in the bellevue hotel that takes you to the nineteenth floor. We both like healthy food, and my wife has dietary restrictions and we easily found options that worked for both of us. We would recommend this location for corporate events in downtown Philly.

We went here for restaurant week. The room was pretty but that was the best part of our experience. I had a coconut mint gazpacho with 2 grilled shrimp. The soup was completely inundated with salt and the shrimp were dry and chewy. I couldn't finish it. My main course was braised beef over creamy polenta with squash. Again, the meat was dry and chewy and the totality of the dish was - meh. My desert was a lemon poppyseed cake. It was yummy. My partner had drum (fish) for her entree. Underwhelming. She had chocolate bomb for desert. Again, yummy. Her Manhattan was $24. The service was adequate.

I have no reason to return to this restaurant. If they were showing off for restaurant week, they did way less than impress us.

The view, YES! The decorations, YES! The food.... Eh. Note: it was restaurant week! But we were not impressed. We waited about 15 minutes for our table despite it being a slow night (only one of the rooms was open) and us having a reservation. The wait staff took a while to get us water, bread, and menus. Three of the five entres arrived at the same time and the other 2 were about 10 minutes later. It was fine, but with all the fancy ingredients in our dishes, we expected them to have more flavor. We shared so I got to try almost everything on their menu. The desserts were big and rich and we all left satiated if not full

went for restaurant week with a large group, I wouldn't suggest going with a group bigger than 4 since they had to push 5 tables together for us. But the food came out fairly quickly and was very tasty (i had the fish entree). Also the dessert bar selection was very good, little cakes, eclairs and cheesecakes.

You can't beat the views and ambiance. Came here for my husbands birthday and had an early dinner in the pearl room. Beautiful view of the cathedral and love park. We ordered crab cakes that were very well made and heavy on the crab. For dinner our fish and meat were also very good. Dessert was an orange chocolate mix which was an interesting flavor. A little pricey but nice for a special occasion. Surprised the bar isn't more full- popped my head in there and looked quite nice. Could use more advertising

I went to XIX for their brunch on Saturday. The room is very nice, and the outer cafe area has a huge domed roof. The views are great from the 19th floor. 

Their brunch has a limited selection of cold salads, seafood, and fruit in the center bar area, and desserts in an anteroom. 

The entree menu had about 10 items, ranging from eggs, steak and eggs, crab Benedict, to chicken and waffles. 

Everything was good, though nothing was really outstanding. This was Saturday, and business was very slow. We were the only ones in the room, and when we left at 12:30, there was one other couple. 

A nice room, but just OK brunch.

Went to XIX for the 'buffet breakfast' on Sunday.  Paid $50 plus tip for two people.  Seems like a reasonable price but it was probably the most limited, poorly prepared breakfast buffet I have ever been to.  Seriously, the free breakfasts at the chain motels are better then this.  The 'buffet' had two entrees - 1) scrambled eggs that were so over cooked they had the texture of chalk and 2) a few sorry-looking pieces of French toast.  That, along with some pan-fried potatoes and burnt bacon, summed up the totality of the hot items.  There was also a single table with a few cut up pieces of fruit, some bread, a small bowl of cut up cheese and some baked items.  It was clear that the kitchen took no pride in their work.  The server was generally indifferent and had to be waived down to get his attention.  The table lacked basic things like salt and pepper.  The coffee was cold and tasteless.    I honestly would have received a better meal at McDonalds and felt totally ripped off by this hotel restaurant.  To top off this miserable meal, they 'validated' my parking which reduced the $36 hotel parking fee (for 90 minutes of parking) to $14.  Awful, awful, awful experience.

Went here to celebrate my birthday. The atmosphere was nice. You could also sit outside which is a really nice option in the 19th floor. The service was good. We arrived for a 7pm reservation ad were seated immediately. The place was empty. Less than 10 parties in the main dining room. Our server was a great for the most part but there were a few times we needed him and were unable to get his attention. Overall this is a average restaurant nothing I had really wowed me. My cosmo was even had way too much lime juice. No I will not be returning but I'm happy I had the experience.

Good breakfast twice here this week, Wednesday and Thursday. I had the buffet. Good, quality selection and attentive, friendly service. Beautiful setting, lovely atmosphere, and scenic view of the city.

This review is based on more than one visit to this restaurant. The food is lackluster as well as the service. Unprofessional and not anywhere near what it used to be. The Bellevue was one of the most beautiful buildings in Philly. amazing architecture and grand ballroom but it's starting to show it's age. It's been eclipsed by the Four Seasons and the Ritz Carlton. I definitely won't go back to XIX. Stick to The Palm on the ground floor. It is 10 times better and you don't have to ride in the 110 degree elevator to the 19th floor for poor service.

business.name: Morimoto
business.categories: Japanese, American (Traditional), American (New), Restaurants, Sushi Bars, Asian Fusion

reviews.text:
I was so excited to dine here because of the hype of the ambiance and food.  My friend and I both came here to try mainly the sushi, but other items like the rice bowl and noodles.  We've observed that everything on the menu was of great value, regardless of the portions.  Every item we ordered was packed with flavor and we were impressed by the way everything melted in our mouths.  Service was also incredible - our server and hosts were extremely quick and attentive to our dining experience.

We were impressed - when we tried our dishes first before our sushi rolls, the server noticed and replaced our dishes with new fresh rolls to ensure freshness.

My fiancé met two years ago in Philadelphia so for his birthday I wanted to reserve somewhere extra special for dinner for the first time back in the city since Covid took over. After careful research online I let out a big sigh and booked a reservation for Morimoto. A back story on us is we like great food but at an affordable price so Morimoto being at its price point is something we would've never even thought about it. Firstly, when you walk in the ambience of the restaurant is simply stunning and breathtaking. It's a unique and modern look with slowly changing LED lights that set the mood. I ordered the "South Pacific" drink, a calpico soda with pineapple and cilantro from the non-alcoholic menu and it was very light and refreshing! For appetizer, we wanted something unique so we got the wagyu hot stone which is a cook at your table dish in which they put a hot stone in the oven and it comes to you very very hot and you cook it yourself at your table with the instruction of the employee. We had never had Wagyu this buttery soft and delicious and wish we could experience it all over again. I mean just WOW!! We ordered the $90 chef's combination for dinner which comes with sashimi, sushi, and sushi rolls. Initially, we were planning on getting two cause we do enjoy feasting but opted out to only getting one and getting more later if we were still hungry. The flavors were absolutely out of this world and nothing we've experienced before. I don't know how many times we said "this place is expensive for a reason" but it was so so worth it and just absolutely melt in your mouth. The portion was also very reasonably sized in which we didn't have to order more afterwards. For dessert, again going on the theme with unique, we ordered the fiery chocolate, that is essentially flourless chocolate cake with meringue, raspberry ice cream, bits of pomegranate encased in a chocolate ball that they light on fire using alcohol. It was so fun and pretty to watch and even more delicious especially the cake. Overall, I would highly recommend this place to everyone to at least openly consider and experience. The staff was very attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable and we left so happy and content.
Rock shrimp tempura was so good! Koji salmon was awesome as well. Service was impeccable. Very enjoyable night.

I already can't wait to come back!!! My friend got us a reservation here after having our original dinner plans cancelled. Wanted to try as many things on the menu as possible, so we ordered 7 things to split. I can't even pick a favorite dish from this meal because it was so incredible. Such an amazing experience with incredible ambiance.

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary last August. We made reservations & sat by the bar. We loved it. It was mesmerizing watching all the sushi chefs create master pieces.

We did the omakase chefs special where we followed a set number of courses chosen by the chef. Everything was absolutely divine. It was my first time eating at such a high end sushi spot and it did not let me down. I will definitely come back for a special occasion in the future. Staff was attentive and friendly. 

Highly recommend for special occasions, since it is fairly expensive.
Fish piece is so fresh and a shredded daikon radish as well as a fresh wasabi comes with sashimi. It's a real deal! It's the best sushi & sashimi experience in Philly.

We started the dinner with a sake flight and some yummy appetizers. The hamachi ponzu was good but the carpaccio tasted strangely like beef rather than fish. The main course of sushi tasted fresh and they had an extensive seasonal menu to choose from. We ended with some noodles, but these were not really worth the money. The ramen was a simple chicken based noodle soup without that much depth in flavor and the udon caught me off guard because they look like soba noodles. Overall, the meal felt overpriced for the quality they offered.

I like MoriMoto for what it is however I do think it is way over priced. Waygu dumplings are my favorite and I really will go out of my way to get them but I don't think the sushi is exceptional so I'd probably say save your money

It's been a while since going here but this is a 10/10 experience. I did the Morimoto Omakase and it was so fun! Lots of variety that comes out. Huge selection of flavors, textures and aesthetics. Definitely recommend to celebrate a special occasion.
Gorgeous restaurant, excellent food and service.   Some many delicious options.  Hard to make a decision!!
The hype and price of this place is definitely worth it. The ambiance, service, and food quality is outstanding. Although pricey, you can truly taste the freshness of the fish.

Great date night spot. Incredible ambience and wait staff was very attentive.
