We did the Morimoto 8 course Omakase tasting menu for a birthday celebration and the timing of the food was great, allowed for good resting time during meal. Another amazing Starr restaurant in Philly! Sorry in advance for not labeling some pictures!

If you've never been here, definitely try it out for the omakase experience. However I don't think I would come back for the Omakasè again, I would maybe try something else on their menu. I didn't get the chance to take a picture of each course but there were a total of 7-8 course and our total was somewhere around 300+. The food were delightful, but not enough to fill up an empty stomach. The interior was unique did give off the fancy/luxury vibe. Definitely remember to take a picture outside if you do plan to dine here!

While I'm a huge fan of Royal Izakaya and Sagami sushi, Morimoto had a unique flavor and experience that really quite impressed me. From the service to the interior décor and ambiance, I was quite impressed and pleased. 

For appetizers, we got the rock shrimp tempura and the hot stone wagyu, tuna tartare, and hamachi ponzu. The rock shrimp was good but I wasn't overly impressed. The Wagyu was perfect (especially for those who wants to try wagyu beef) and such a fun experience to be able to cook it on a hot stone. The tuna tartare was perfectly seasoned. The Hamachi ponzu was probably the best appetizer dish. It has a nice kick with the jalapeño, but the ponzu really helped balance it out. The Wasabi rice was also fantastic and not as spicy as you would think.

Dinner we got a Chef's Combo ($90), Black Cod Miso, Australian Wagyu Filet, and a Sukiyaki Udon. I was here with a party of 6 so two orders of the Chef's Combo was perfect with nothing left on the trays. The Black Miso Cod was PHENOMENAL and so flavorful and tender. The Wagyu filet was also nice and tender - perfectly cooked. The Sukiyaki udon was delicious as well (sorry! - no pic of this). 

Dessert was a whole different experience! We got the Fiery Chocolate, Sorbet Trio, ice cream, and the Chocolate mousse cake.  I'm a little biased because I prefer ice cream and sorbet, so these were my favorite. However, the fiery chocolate was a fun entertainment and was also quite delicious. It was a bit on the heavier side. The mousse cake was also delicious, however, I'm not too big of a mousse fan. 

Morimoto is a 5 $$$$$ restaurant that deserves 5 stars in my books!
The atmosphere, the meal, the staff,  the whole experience was fantastic. We did the Morimoto Omikase, and I will recommend that for first timers. If you are nearby or visiting, this is a must go!

another reviewer mentioned the hosts and i have to agree, 5:00pm and half empty, I'm obviously on a date with my wife yet they attempt to sit me at the sushi bar in a half empty restaurant and then act as if they were doing me a favor by giving me a table with the immovable dildo lamp. but it got better, Rock shrimp was plentiful and tasty, $70 sushi/sashimi combo was really good. some of the best tasting sushi I've had, the desert was good ice cream in chocolate that gets hit with fire brandy and melts.. cute gimmick and the dessert was good too. but then the drinks....jeeze $15.00 for a bit ore than a shot of saki, $18.00 for an old fashioned. drinks were $160+ and way too expensive. overall a fun time and would return but just drink water.

Morimoto was definitely an expensive experience, but I thought the items were amazing! The service was really nice and they were extremely attentive. The restaurant itself looked very intriguing, almost like an underwater aquarium vibe.

We ordered the following dishes:

Appetizers
Rock Shrimp Tempura - 5/5, the sauce was really good and the shrimp was very nicely fried
Wagyu Dumplings - 4/5, would say that the sauce was the best part but they weren't bad, just really couldn't tell they were "wagyu"

Mains
Black Cod Miso - 5/5, must get! The fish was so buttery (definitely leans towards people with a sweeter palleted) and honestly one of the best cooked fish dishes I've ever had in my life. The first bite truly surprised us.
Sushi - 5/5, we ordered maguro, chu-toro, o-toro, and uni, all of which was of really high quality.

I would recommend this place and would totally come back, but unfortunately it does lean on the pricer side.

Ordered for dinner last night via caviar and food was delivered hot and arrived quickly, but that's the only good thing I can say. Everything we ordered (wagyu beef dumplings, chicken soup, rock shrimp, shrimp tempura roll & spicy tuna roll) was terribly bland except for the beets that accompany the dumplings 
. For the amount of money I spent and based on the reviews I've read I was so excited for dinner but so disappointed! I've had better sushi from our neighborhood Chinese/Japanese place for 1/4 of the price .

This was my first omakase experience! The omakase came with 7 courses. Each dish was small but it was packed with a LOT of flavor and I enjoyed all of them. I got to try uni, caviar, and wagyu which I never had before! My favorite was the miso fish since it was the only hot dish so it stood out from the rest. 

If I ever do come here in the future, I would probably get the sushi plate since this is the first time I had fresh tasting fish in Philly---and also whatever flaming dessert I saw in the reviews haha. 

The staff explained each dish very well and the timing between the serving of each course was perfect--I was able to just chat and enjoy the ambiance of the place. The place was very relaxing with the dim lights, candles and the cool colored lighting. 

Ps: check out the bathrooms! They are cool

My wife and I came here for our first year wedding anniversary and were blown away by the 8- course Omakase and excellent service! We went all out with the Kobe beef upgrade and even had beluga whale caviar in the first course. 

First off, the aesthetic of the restaurant is gorgeous and modern... almost unforgettable in design with the sculpted wall art and brightly colored booths. The wait staff was knowledgeable about dishes, sake pairings, and details about each dish. 

The standout dishes for us was the Kobe beef cubes, which practically melted on the tongue. Also- they shared that they are one of 10 restaurants in the USA to sell Certified Kobe beef. The custard and beluga whale caviar was outstanding - a variety of textures and flavors from creamy to crunchy, salty to semi-sweet. The uni and beef tartare wrapped in mint leaf - amazing. The tuna tartare - one of my favorites- fatty toro and perfect wasabi sauce. The black cod in miso- more akin to fatty Chilean sea bass in my opinion (it comes from colder waters as well)- perfectly cooked and flavorful!  

I've been here once before and wasn't nearly as impressed... but I think it was because we stuck to what we were used to and didn't venture to try the unique dishes that they prepared for us last night. Absolutely amazing experience!

We dined at Morimoto's Friday 9.10.2021. Hannah took care of us and provided exemplary service. We had the Tuna Pizza, Rock Shrimp Tempura, Wagyu Dumplings, Fried Yukon With Bonito Emulsion, Koji Salmon, Black Cod Miso, and the Fiery Chocolate for dessert. Dinner was paced beautifully and the food was delicious. The Fiery Chocolate was more of a show than I was expecting. It was beyond decadent.  The only thing that is barely worth a mention from the evening is that neither of us enjoyed the Tuna Pizza. The tuna was high quality and fresh. The flavor profile should have worked. There was something off about the ratio of tuna to tortilla and accoutrements that didn't work for me mouth feel or flavor wise. It was awkward to eat and not exciting for me. We definitely should have ordered the Toro Tartare instead.

The food is not bad, the service is good, and prices are fair for what it is: an ambiance-driven restaurant, but I don't think Morimoto is worth it. It's a great place for social dinners, but for a food-oriented experience, I'd go elsewhere.

SKIP if you like to  be treated good. The host that work in this place on sundays afternoons are really rude, we came at 4:30pm looking for a table with my baby, the place was empty and they didn't even want to check for a table, they said they were "full" in a really "don't care" attitude, I understand when restaurants are full, but these two host they simply didn't want to make the effort for a party of 2 on an empty restaurant. Honestly I been there before and for its price people should treat you better at least explain to you in a better way, I know that they don't care if they lose just one good client, but they should care more.

The amazing atmosphere set the stage for what was about to come. Richard, our server, was on point. He knew the menu inside and out and was always there at the right times. We had the Chef's seasonal sushi combination, Chef's Sushi combination and Fiery Chocolate for dessert. From presentation to flavor, everything was spot on. Bravo.

Honey and I came here to celebrate my birthday and we had the legendary chef's omokase, which is expensive but well worth it. Like all chef-ish food, the various courses were full of confusing and mysterious ingredients, yet so delicious that I did not care whatsoever whether I knew what the f*** I was eating.

The omokase is seven courses; they also brought out a wee little amuse-bouche in between somewhere. The whole experience took about 2 hours -- if you choose to do this meal, just leave plenty of time. Obviously Honey and I passed the evening gazing adoringly at each other. 

Rather than rhapsodize about every course, I will just deal with the sushi course which was at the very end. It was five pieces of sushi, and they were small and slender in the more traditional old-school style. If you are a nerd and want to learn more about that, I recommend you watch the documentary Jiro Dreams of Sushi. It is adorable. So the waiter told us to eat the sushi in order from left to right. And we did. The first piece, a tuna which had some sort of intense flavor added to it, was so incredibly good that I burst into tears. I pulled myself together and continued on the flavor journey, and then the last piece, freshwater eel, was again so good that I burst into tears again. 

One note about the sushi: the rice was the absolute best sushi rice I have ever had anywhere. Not too sweet or vinegar-y, gently clinging together in a nice shape but not gummy or sticky, not overcooked even a tiny bit. As I chewed the little morsels, I could feel the texture of each grain of rice in my mouth. Astounding! When I mentioned this to the waitress she smiled and replied that they polish the rice themselves by hand in the kitchen. Which is pretty much the all-time most high-dollar chef-tastic thing I have ever heard.

I was so love-drunk on that food that I can't truly recall whether it would have good handicap access. It should be fine for anyone who's up on two legs with crutches or a walker. Not sure about a wheelchair. It's in Philly near the busy Penns' Landing area so parking will be a bit intense. Honey and I walked over from our hotel.

So. Uh. It might be a while before I can afford it again but I will surely return.

business.name: The Franklin Bar
business.categories: Cocktail Bars, Nightlife, Lounges, Bars

reviews.text:
Had a 9:30 reservation, and got here at 9:20. The doorman was EXTREMELY rude and gave us crap for being early, which is a fun new thing to complain about.

Other than that, everyone else was fine. Drinks were average and strong. The speakeasy vibes were cool. The dark room is very intimate, and the atmosphere overall was nice.
Great ambience, attentive servers, and a spectacular drink menu. The mood is dark and sultry and you WILL be banned if you are on your phone.

Best kept secret and honestly so underrated, Franklin Mortgage is one of the best cocktail bars in the city. So glad indoor seating is open again. It's dark and intimate,  the music is great and the mixologist are down to earth and personable. It's low key but high key a vibe.

Stumbled upon the speakeasy while waiting for our dinner reservations. The speakeasy is downstairs, luckily we found it as a bouncer was waiting on the street. We went around 6pm so there were no lines so we got lucky. The place has a very cool vibe, feels like what you would imagine a speakeasy to be. I can't remember the names of the drinks we got, but one was sort of an old fashion type and the other had a saffron/cardamom flavor liquor. Both were amazing and had a nice twist to it. The place is not a place you can be a regular at as the drinks are pricey. They have a drink that is $74! I do wonder how it tastes. It is something I would recommend if people are visiting Philly or if it's a special occasion or just feel like going at times. I want to go back and try the other drinks on the menu. The waitress was also helpful in suggesting drinks as there were stuff on it that I had to google.

Although something happened on my recent visit, this is still one of my favorite bars in the US because I think it's the only real emulation of a speakeasy from prohibition era. I say that because there's a guy (bouncer) who is dressed in attire appropriate to the times, the inside is very dim (gotta hide from the authorities), and they have a lot of rare/vintage alcohol.

The drinks are simply amazing and high quality so expect a higher price tag. I came one night without much expectation and happily ordered a $34 cocktail because I found value in the concoction. While it was worth it to me, it's probably not a random happy hour place you just casually go to with your buds.

Anyway, the thing that happened was overcharging me for $9 for the tip. Could've been an honest mistake, but it always makes me wonder how many times that "mistake" happens with hopes the customer doesn't notice.

So this has become one of my favorite place for drinks. The cocktail menu is great, the ambiance and vibe is cool and service has always been great. The first night we went crowd was super diverse and they were playing trap music (win). The second time crowd was similar and they were playing jazz and funk (win). Every time we go the energy is consistent. The only downside is having to stand outside in the winter to wait until a table is available. Other then that be sure to check them out! Try to keep in mind this is a speakeasy theme, so, the service at the door is designed to feel exclusive, shouldn't be perceived as unwelcoming.

Just left this place.... So I'll start off by saying the girl at the door is rude. When I walked up, she said "how can we help you?" I was sort of confused -- I mean it is Saturday night and this is the greeting I expect from some of the places in this area, but not this one. Anyway, I said food "we don't serve food here" oh, ok, alcohol? "Yeah but if you want tequila, you'll have to go upstairs...." I'm like geeze ok.... who took a dump in your cornflakes. I showed her my ID and walked in. The place smells like a toilet!! I was referred this place by a friend and after fashion week Philly, I felt this would be a nice wind down. The smell was so strong and I got no direction on where "upstairs" was and didn't feel welcomed, so I just walked out. Came to the Library Bar and feels like home ‍ Good night

Absolutely loved it! The doorman was very welcoming and brought us down to our table, his mustache game was on point. Our waiter took the time to learn what kind of drinks we like in order to recommend a cocktail from the menu. The name of our drinks escape me (both from the refreshing part of the menu) and both were excellent. This would absolutely become a go-to place if I were a local.

This speakeasy is a fun and intimate basement bar for drinks or grub.

Like any good hole-in-the-wall, it's easy to miss from the outside. You need to go down a flight of steps and enter below ground. The prohibition-era vibe is cool, and the people are nice, plus the drinks are unique and enjoyable.

Overall a neat place to hang with friends over a cocktail.

One of my favorite bars in Philly. It's meant to be hard to find, as it takes inspiration from a speakeasy, but that's part of the fun and exclusivity (iykyk). That being said, the drinks are all very unique and interesting. Their new menus never fail to amuse me. If you aren't as adventurous, you can always ask them to make you something off menu. Great place for a lowkey date and good conversation.

This place has really gone downhill I don't know what happened to it. This used to be one of our favorite bars in Philly to come to. I think it has gone downhill ever since they changed the name to The Franklin bar, it used to be The Franklin Mortgage and Investment Company. And once they added the upstairs tiki bar. I don't know if it switched owners or managers or what. 

Speaking of tiki bar, the doorman asked us a couple times if we wanted to get a drink at the tiki bar rather than wait for the downstairs bar. Seems like they're really trying to push the tiki bar. We said no because we wanted to relax and sit at a table downstairs. 

Well it wasn't relaxing downstairs at all. It was so hot down there it felt like I was in a sauna. I was going to complain but it was hard enough getting a waiter to take our drink order. Also there was club music playing so loud I had to scream at my husband for him to hear me. When did this place become a dance club and not a speakeasy? Are they trying to compete with the other speakeasies by making this one different? This just makes people want to go to other places. 

Our waiter eventually came over and took our drink order. I ordered the part time fluffer full time lover drink with peanut butter bourbon, graham cracker liquor, coconut, vanilla, cream and egg white. I was expecting it to taste kind of like the with a baseball bat drink that we had before but this drink was much sweeter. Didn't even taste the bourbon much at all, but it had good flavor I enjoyed it. They toasted marshmallows on top too which I liked.

We wanted a second drink but it took forever for someone to take our order again. We were almost ready to throw cash down and leave. Eventually our waiter that brought out our first drinks comes over to bring us water and asks if we're ok. We said we wanted another drink and he says ok well someone will be over to take our order. What? Wasn't he our waiter? He took our order earlier. He was still waiting on the tables right next to us. We end up giving our order to another girl that comes over and we cash out after our next drink order. Our original "waiter" that apparently wasn't supposed to be waiting on us brought those new drinks out to us. Drinks were good but we were ready to leave. 

Also i went to use the bathroom and there was water all over the floor it got my purse wet. Gross. 

Bottom line drinks are 4 stars but service is 1-2 stars. I'm being generous with the 3 star review really it should be a 2.5 stars. Even the drinks don't seem quite as creative as they used to be. 

It's a shame. Don't know if this is a server issue or management issue but something needs to be fixed. Seems like totally unorganized and lack of communication. I think maybe they are trying to push people in and out as fast as they can to maximize profit. Not sure if we will come back might just stick to Charlie's from now on.

I really, really, really, hope that we showed up on a weird night.  I've felt every time we've been here in the past two years it's been worse and worse.  I thought it was bad when they ran out of all of the ingredients we wanted before, but last night was the worst.  

The doormen have always been amazing, but this time we were told there was a five or ten minute wait.  No problem, we've never been able to just get a seat right away.  The doorman kind of made it seem like we shouldn't wait and go somewhere else though...   Two people left, he went down to clear our table and then from the steps below called up to us.  We were talking to another woman who asked us a question and I didn't realize the doorman was calling to us.  Weird...  The doorman always comes back up the steps to escort us down.  Was this guy just lazy? 

We were seated and I never remember music in this place.  I've seen speakers before, but was music every playing?  I don't remember, but this nightclub was loud.  Is it still a speakeasy?  Our Waiter? came up, brought us water, took our drink order and brought us our cocktails.  They were good.  Thankfully!  For the next round, another waiter, who has been there the last few times we were there, brought us a drink menu and disappeared.  We waited for twelve minutes for someone else to come to us.  I looked around and a lot of the staff were dancing.  Even the doorman.  I guess he wasn't lazy, just tired from dancing.  Our waiter? came back to fill the water and I told him we wanted another round.  He said something like "Someone will be over to take your order".  What?  Really?  If I didn't just use all of my cash up for dinner, I would have just dropped money and left.  Some woman came up, took our order and I gave her the credit card too to cash out.  So we wouldn't be waiting forever to leave.  Who brings us our drink?  The same Waiter? who took our orders and delivers them...   The same guy taking other peoples orders?  Why did he suddenly stop helping us?  First time in awhile there were no cocktail issues, other than not getting served, but everything else fell apart even more...  Still packed, but almost everyone coming in after us stayed for one drink and left.  Is that what they want now?  For people to wait in line, then be forced to get a drink since they waited so long, but then leave after one drink due to the music and service?
I had the fictional royalty and hubby the rugby shoulders. These bartenders are gifted

Easily the coolest speakeasy in Philly. Downstairs is perfectly dungeon-esque with a very dark and low-key vibe. The mixologists are talented, each drink being a true experience in and of itself. Cheers!

Can't believe I haven't written a review for Franklin before! In my opinion, cocktail bars are about the vibe, the music, and of course - the drinks. 

This is a below ground level bar - we had to wait about 20-25min to get in on a Saturday night. But after getting in, the vibe was definitely cozy. They had a cocktail menu which, although not too long, had some interesting choices. Me and my friends all enjoyed our well crafted drinks and the music was a nice modern mix (think along the lines of Childish Gambino's Redbone) which encouraged talking, but was there to sway to and relax as well.

The prices are on the pricier end, but that's hardly unexpected from a high quality cocktail bar, that too in the Rittenhouse area! Perfect place to chill and have not just some good drinks, but a conversation as well.

Cool slightly hidden speakeasy that's intimate without feeling cramped. The servers are highly knowledgable about their booze. All the cocktails we had were excellent. The Franklin Mortgage & Investment is a terrific spot for drink - or, a night cap after a dinner near Rittenhouse Square.
Expensive but super cool setting. Great cocktails. We got lucky on a rainy Tuesday night and were able to walk right in. Worth checking out.

Came here for drinks on a Friday night. Surprisingly wasn't difficult to get in. Inside there were booths that seat four. Was a little chilly near the door. Their cocktail menu was pretty extensive. Sadly the waiters weren't that knowledgeable about the menu.the cocktails are priced at $15 and $22. At this price you usually expect highest level of knowledge about the drinks but meh. The cocktails were pretty tasty overall. Not sure I'd come back since at that price you expect a lot.

I'll preface this by saying this was not my initial destination, we had another speakeasy in the city in mind. Unfortunately,  Hop Sing was closed on Wednesday, This was the backup plan. Not easy to fill in for a desired destination.  All that being said, this was a solid speakeasy visit that one of our local friends frequesnts regularly. 

The server was knowledgeable and attentive. He crafted drinks based on our preferences that were delicious - several were mescal fans. It was dark and loud with semi-private seating areas. We were a rather large group so being able to sit intimately and converse was just what we were looking for.

The atmosphere and ambience of this bar was incredible prices of the drinks are fair for a Philadelphia restaurant with pizzazz however the music on the Friday night was outrageously too loud to actually enjoy sitting there longer. The whole feeling of the place said, Instrumental Sinatra or something from the 20s era music. But the Speakers were blasting some techno my wife and I wanted to spend more money but chose to leave.

I like this place, I come here everytime I'm in Philly. Generally I have a good experience even if the waiters are a bit pretentious. Bartenders are top notch and real cool. I had an olde fashioned, very good, not too sweet. One of my compadres ordered a very basic cocktail, dirty vodka martini on the rocks. The waiter said "we don't have dirty martinis" I'm pretty shocked by this, either they don't stock vermouth, or they don't stock olives which generally come in olive juice because they surely stock vodka, right? And the way he put it, we don't have those. Funny, right? Like I ordered a hamburger at Subway. I guess we should've went to the bartender and not the guy thinking he knows how to tend bar. Any bartender worth their salt prides themselves on making a good vodka martini.

Not exactly what I expected from the pictures, but it's a dark underground spot. Music wasn't too loud, but it wasn't background either. It's only a small bar inside, which you don't approach, only the wait staff. Our waitress was nice. We weren't there long but got our drinks and were out. One in our party didn't like the smell, but my nose isn't consistent enough to pickup on odors like that.

The hipster doorman clearly has some deep seated issues from not getting laid in highschool and is on some weird power trip. He wears a ridiculous mustache then treats you like garbage, and not in a funny speak easy witty sort of way, but like you are a literal piece of trash. For the money one spends in this bar you'd think they'd actually hire people who make you want to come back. Don't worry, there's many other bars serving mediocre cocktails for $15 in Center City.

Went out with some friends to this place for the first time last week and the overall experience was good. The drinks were well made and they pull off the speakeasy vibe I think they are going for. 

The interaction at the door was super awkward. I knew where I was going (thanks to past yelpers and my sleuthing skills), their door guy/bouncer? was blocking the way and then just stared at me for a good 6 seconds. Then I had to ask him: "do you want to see my ID? Or is there something else..." Guy, I'm not sure about your other patrons, but I'm not a mind reader. Once we got the ID issue out of the way, he asked if I had other people joining me, I said yes and that they were already there, which is when I got the "Ok let me check" line. Don't know if he expected me to wait outside while he "checked" but it wasn't happening so I followed him in and found my party. As another yelper said the "let me check" seems to be part of their schtick. 

Other than the interaction at the door, and the overly loud music for such a small/intimate space, it's a cool place. Drinks are pricey and well done (read: strong) and they do not serve food - if you know those facts going in, you'll be in for less surprises.

Did not like at all. You sit at little tables and do not even get to watch the bartenders make your drinks. The drinks are all crazy with no explanation of what they really are or will taste like. Probably the worst speakeasy we have been to. Had one drink and left as fast as we could. Very plain atmosphere. Expected more after it being hyped up to us.

business.name: The Catbird Seat
business.categories: American (New), Restaurants

reviews.text:
My friend took me here while I was visiting town and It was a beautiful experience!  You have to make a reservation and they'll ask you some questions about allergies and food related questions. 

Place was very chill, nice music in the background, the bar seating is right in front surrounding the prep table where your dishes are getting ready to be served. It was nice to see that they give people covered in tattoos a chance to work in here. All the employees were very welcoming. Bathrooms were nice and clean. 

The food was delicious, all the dishes were very tasty, different delicious flavors and all prepared nice with a nice presentation. Wines were very fine and tasty. Definitely a good experience and hopefully I come back to town and visit again this place!

I really want to give this place 5 stars, but for what we paid I was surprised that I left hungry. That being said, I hadn't eaten all day so maybe it's just me? The food though was exquisite, although mainly vegetarian I wish there had been more meat and seafood. I would not go a second time but it was a great experience and enjoyable to watch the chefs do their magic

Wow. Ok so My fiancé and I were visiting Nashville and tbh, wasn't blown away by the food scene... until we made it over to Catbird Seat. It's pricey, but totally worth it for a multi-course tasting menu that is nothing like you have ever experienced.

The vibes were epic to start with - kind of underground speakeasy meets Scandinavian art space meets sushi counter. Great tunes playing, setting the atmosphere. It's an open kitchen, and different servers present each course to you individually - with a brief explanation of what you're tasting.

I am generally a semi-picky eater who has a strong pull to PB&J - so tasting menus always make me nervous, but I loved this. It helped that there was strong veg/seafood representation - with a dessert emphasis that I couldn't have appreciated more. I will think about the porcini mushroom chocolate mousse, and the deep fried milk bread for the rest of time. 

TL;DR yes, you must come here if you are visiting Nashville. It is expensive, but worth it and if you pre-pay, it seems free (and feel like a baddie dining and dashing)

The finest dining I've ever experienced! Their fall menu is absolutely delightful. They do everything to make the experience special from walking you in, taking your coat, remembering what you're there to celebrate and throughly explaining everything on the menu including the stories behind all the wineries of the wine they serve, and having the most stylish dishes and cutlery I've ever seen. They start by giving you a warm scented towel to wipe your hands and then the fun begins. We had 14 or so courses and opted for the wine pairing as well. They were also sure to add in a delicious complimentary birthday treat! I truly would have been thrilled with any dish as an entree on its own but the special thing about this place is how many perfectly crafted mini portion you get to enjoy. It's obvious they put great care, thought and effort into designing these delicious and unique recipes. Unfortunately I was too distracted with the mind blowing flavor of my favorite course, the spaghetti squash, royal red shrimp and amaretto, to take a picture of it but it might be the best thing I've ever tasted in my entire life! It was great to be able to chat with the chefs and watch them prepare each course and we were there for probably 3 hours or so. I really enjoyed most of the wine but it still felt a little pricey compared to the meal but full disclosure, I'm no connoisseur. Funny enough, their bathroom was also lovely. It's dimly lit by scented candles, has a warm bidet toilet seat and the best smelling hand soap to boot! I loved all the extra touches that made our experience great and was so glad to have finally checked this place out after hearing about it ever since moving here!

This was our last meal in Nashville and it was quite memorable. After parking on the street we entered and took the elevator up to the second floor. They waited until the minute of our reservation and then sat us at counter to watch all the action in the kitchen. The one reason that I was displeased with our experience was how loud the music was. I felt as though I had to yell at my husband just to be heard. I couldn't hear or understand what they were saying or asking for when taking our order or at times delivering wine for the courses even though they were only one seat away. I understand wanting the kitchen to feel lively and fun but please still allow for conversation. The food did not disappoint. We were delighted course after course and left feeling like we could not eat another bite. I love that since I was celebrating my birthday they brought a special small dessert. What a special touch. Also, even if you don't have to, use the bathroom while here, they have a heated toilet seat which is positively delightful. Parking is street no meter or they offer complimentary valet.

Let's start with the good...

The food was fantastic. Innovative, fresh, well conceived and very flavorful. The chefs created some unique dishes and some unique combinations of foods and preparations that were quite good.

The entire staff was very friendly, open to discussion and knowledgeable about all aspects of the food and its preparation. 

The sommelier was knowledgeable about the wines being served and created some fantastic pairings. Several of the wines were new to my wife and myself, and included wines from several uncommon and interesting regions.

The big downside for us was the timing of the meal. Because we were seated next to other people who arrived at about the same time, we felt the need to keep on the same schedule as others in the group. This made the entire experience feel rushed, and it felt as if we were on a schedule from beginning to end.

Also, the amount of food was a good bit less than I would expect from a typical tasting menu. There was only one course of protein, and the rest were vegetable and pasta based dishes.  

Given the number of courses (6), and the  quality of the wine pairings, I don't believe the meal was a great value.  This isn't my biggest consideration, but it is worth mentioning.

Overall, I was pleased with the food but underwhelmed by the quantity of it and the general experience. Which is disappointing as I really, really wanted to like it.

Average Joe review here:

Exclusive, pricey, and worth every penny.** But if you ain't one of them foodie kinda folks and need a common person's take - here is what you're in for:

** If you only eat chicken nuggets dipped in ranch - or have to pick the onions off a burger - this is not your place!!

Concept: 

Catbird Seat features executive chefs from around the world who stay for one or two annual seasons. During the year, the menu changes to reflect the flavors of the four seasons.

You will get a multi-course meal (we had 15 courses) and may pay extra for wine pairings. I personally found the wine pairings freaking awesome. I don't know much about wines - but all I can say is they just made sense. Tasting the wine with the bites was fun by itself! But don't get carried away - you're going to want to pace yourself on the alcohol (more to come).

Atmosphere:

First things first -- Dress comfortable - for real. You will see a couple in their finest dinnerware and another party with Slayer T-shirt's! So wear whatever you feel comfortable with and is respectful of others as you share an intimate space.

From the get go you're going to feel really important. You will be met by a staff member who  patiently monitors the awkward silence on the $29.99, two-way radio with optional CIA-issue earpiece. It's a tad awkward as you're kinda just standing on the street corner... but then you're also looking at folks passing by like, "What up G's I'm at the Catbird, yo!" But nevertheless you're kinda chilling until they tell you your spot is ready. 

And just in the moment you're questioning life's decisions - that two-way crackles and you're ushered into a private entrance and into an elevator which takes you to the second floor -- or the Catbird Seat.

You sit at what I can only describe as an American Hibachi - meaning you sit around a small kitchen in a horseshoe shape. There is plenty of distance between parties and it feels very individualized. The chefs prepare courses of food in front of you and expertly plate the food in beautiful presentations! 

The Food

Ok, look... if you're favorite meal is Longhorn steakhouse - this is going to be a drastic departure and somewhat uncomfortable at first. Go in with an open mind and prepare to leave full! 

So let's talk about those 12-15 courses. Prepare to blow your basic-Azz mind. You may not understand what you're eating or fully appreciate the talent it takes to execute the food being presented to you... but like fine art - you will stare at the show and marvel at its beauty while having no idea what the exceptional staff just eloquently explained to you.

The courses are small bites of exotic and exquisite fare that you looked your mamma in her soul and promised you wouldn't eat. 

And as you focus on the word, "sea urchin," a chef rambles on about some broth - you also begin praying to the lord of beans and cornbread for forgiveness... because the strange looking bite in front of you is really, really, really good!!

You're going out of your comfort zone tonight - but you will be glad you did!

Service:

Despite the fact you decided to wear your crocks and fancy flannel shirt - this restaurant is swankier than the back room at Golden Coral - and the service is truly exceptional. 

Whether you can appreciate what they are explaining or not - the entire crew takes a lot of time to explain every dish and help guests understand what makes it special. You will furrow your brow and nod accordingly while you kick your pinky finger out and dive into a mysterious bite of something that is nothing short of magical. 

And big guys - don't worry... you will be stuffed when you leave!

Bottom Line: throw on some jeans and a decent shirt. Make reservations for some date weeks from now. Then treat that special person in your life to a really awesome culinary experience.

Oh yea - and check out Patterson House on the way out the door... it's why you paced yourself on alcohol... it's a feast of exotic cocktails and snacks!!! And by snacks - they have menu items that will make even the most seasoned chicken nugget expert happy!!

Cheers :-)

I will start off by saying that this is a really special restaurant. We have been previously for a winter menu & it was a gorgeous experience.

We went again a few days ago & while all of the staff are lovely, we were let down. 

We found the summer menu to very vegetable-reliant (a lot of tomato dishes) and just simply not worth the price point. 

Also, the summer wine pairing was all whites this time with the exception of two lighter reds at the conclusion. While I get this is a summer menu, we really missed variety. 

When you are talking about nearly $700 for 2 people (with the wine pairing)... you would expect more special protein preparations for that level of pricing. 

It was our anniversary also this time & other than a "happy anniversary" at the beginning of the meal, there was nothing else. Although there was many birthdays around us & they all got special desserts with a candle. 

Anyways, I won't rate this place lower than a 4 as it's a unique place with talented, creative chefs. BUT they really missed the mark for us this time. 

I'd have to say, if we didn't have a previous experience with them- we probably would never go back. 

I don't suggest going here for a special occasion if you have never been before. You can't preview the menu & you don't exactly know if what they end up preparing will be things you enjoy. 

Out of all the courses this time, we only really loved 3 of the dishes. It just felt very "phoned in". 

We may try again in the future but probably won't return anytime soon.

Absolutely fabulous! 
From the front door until the last dessert and everything in between was amazing! 
The beverage director is doing a fantastic job (the most delicious wines I have ever tasted ) and the food was absolutely delicious. The service was awesome and I cannot wait to go back. Beef short rib lettuce wrap was perfect. Parsnip handmade Carmel's, okra and sweet peppers plus a tomato wish some hind of wonderful bread - they do wonderful things all around. 
Kiddos to the chef.

Catbird Seat is the most unique dining experience I've ever had. In an intimate bar setting centered around the chefs plating each meal it's kind of like dinner and a show. The chefs were fabulous and it was so cool to watch. It was fun to have the different chefs presenting their dish so we got to chat with all of them. 

There is a set prix fixe menu and they tell you to expect to stay about 2.5 hours. We had 14 courses on the Summer menu which highlighted mostly seafood and fresh produce. Even though they were all small bites the food was really rich so i did not leave hungry. There was only one dish with short rib but no other meat course. This is not the place to come if you're picky about food, although they are able to cater to allergies and to vegetarian/vegan diets as well. 

The only small downsides for me was that it was really hot in the room (after all there is a kitchen in the middle) and there were a few I did not want to try but the chefs were right there so I felt pressured to try everything (although my friend helped me out with a few dishes). 

Although this experience isn't for everyone it was what I hoped it'd be and more.
We really enjoyed this experience. The food and service were both top notch. It was fun to see the food being made right in front of you. Great wine pairing as well which I highly recommend.

A spectacular dining experience that I will never forget! We got the extended menu with wine pairings and everything I put in my mouth was divine. Impeccable service from the chefs to the wait staff and sommelier. There was a rose wine I wasn't particularly fond of and they even brought me a replacement for that course. 

I can't say enough great things about it and can not WAIT to go back for my next special occasion!

One of my favorite dining experiences of my life. The food was incredible, but the experience (from the intimate counter seating to the amazingly, ridiculous bathroom to the service) just elevated the whole night. 

It is definitely a splurge, but I think it is priced really, really well compared to other tasting menus. It is well worth the money. We're cocktail people, so we opted to just order a few cocktails throughout the meal instead of the wine pairing. The drinks were yummy and probably saved us a bit of money.  

I just think the whole night invigorated my sensory system. That bathroom is no joke. Definitely don't skip the trip to the bathroom. My mind was also stimulated by the adventurous menu (Do you think beets and mushrooms should be in a dessert? No? I didn't think so either, but that was one of my favorite courses of the night.) Of course my tastebuds were swept away by the utterly amazing food. 

I recommend coming right on time. We arrived 5-10 min early and were directed to have some drinks at their sister bar downstairs. Right after our drinks arrived, we were awkwardly given a check and directed to go upstairs with our full glasses in hand. The ambience at the Patterson House was great, we just felt like we were rushed around, so either come right on time for your res, or come a good 30 min early, so you can enjoy your drinks at the bar.

If I lived in Nashville, I think I would be a regular and just beg them to take all my money. Alas, I don't, so I only have fond memories to treasure in my heart.

My wife and I managed to get a reservation for our recent Nashville getaway.  Had heard of the place and it turned out to be interesting and many dishes were excellent.  However I was far more of a fan than my wife.  The website does not tell you what the menu will be and it turned out to be strictly seafood.  Problem is, my wife does not like seafood.  I was a happy guy as I got a double portion of some amazing dishes.  And the service was great.  But this could have been a so much better experience if they had included other proteins along with the seafood.  For instance, at this price range, a little Wagyu beef, quail, etc would have been nice.  The website needs a bit more transparency but it is an excellent experience if you like seafood.  If not, don't.

This place is unforgettably amazing!!!  The food, service, and atmosphere cannot be beat.  The wine paring was perfect!  We loved everything about this experience.  It's pricey, but you get what you pay for.  Definitely a great place to celebrate or treat yourself!

An absolute gem of a dining experience in Nashville. Not too high brow, they let the food speak for itself. My recommendation would be to have at least one person get the non alcoholic beverage pairing in addition to the alcohol pairing, this truly amplified the entire meal. We will be back.

We've been here many times post Trevor Moran and it never disappoints. Amazing, smart and innovative food, excellent service and experience EVERY. SINGLE. TIME.

If you seek out Michelin stars, James Beard awards and superlatives (ie. best of lists) for restaurants, this is a must visit in Nashville.  It's truly a Nashville gastronomic treasure in an unassuming and approachable way. It was way ahead of its time and is always evolving to keep its relevance.
One of the best meals of my life! Can't wait to go back. So incredibly creative! The staff were amazing as well.

If you are looking for a fine dining experience look no further.  It's an intimate setting that only seats about 20 people so you already know you are in for a treat.  When you arrive you will be seated at the bar top that overlooks the area where all of the staff are preparing the food.  We were seated at one of the few tables possibly because we were a party of four which I really enjoyed.  Fine dining with friends is the best.  That said, every bite I had was delicious.  Something many people don't understand about expensive meals is that you aren't paying for quantity, you are paying for the art, skill and craft that goes into each and every piece that you taste.  Literally everything that hits your palate is meant to be savored and appreciated.  Catbird did not disappoint.  Baxter and his staff were/are amazing.  Conversation was casual, entertaining and educational.  The food was on point and they even accommodated my wife who is a vegetarian.  I tasted some of her things and they were also outstanding.  I personally don't like a few types of things...onions being a huge one.  When I came here I didn't bother to say anything because the way that ingredients are combined to generate the flavor profiles is so artful that even if there are some things in it I may not normally like, they find a way to make it so delicious that I don't care.  Trust the staff.  Overall presentations,staff and experience is an A+.  A word of warning that this place is not for those looking for a bargain.  With wine and food you will easily spend $300 for a couple but you are able to bring your own wine if you like.  They have valet that is inexpensive but we were able to find parking right on the street.  That's not always the case though.  Lastly, be prepared to spend time.  We started at about 8:30-8:45 and it was after midnight when we were leaving.  Like I said, it's an experience, and a great one at that.  If you are looking for somewhere special, this could be it.

I had an incredible experience at this restaurant.

I made a recap video which features items from the Fall 2020 menu: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=twrppwtw03M&feature=youtu.be

This place was incredible. Definitely an experience. I was thinking that I wouldn't be full by the end, but man did they prove me wrong. I highly suggest the wine pairing. Every bite was made perfectly and tasted amazing.

My only visit to Catbird Seat was several years ago now, but I remember it as fondly today as I ever did. I was there celebrating graduation, Christmas, and an anniversary all in one meal; I think this is the only restaurant that could do that trio justice. 

I opted for the drink pairing to go with my meal, and I'm so glad I did. I couldn't tell you now exactly what I ate (unless I went to find the menu I took home with me and put in a memory box somewhere), but I remember during at least two courses thinking that I'd never had anything as good. And I remember going home so stuffed I could barely sit up.

Looking forward to graduating with another degree in 2022 so I have an excuse to go back!

We came here for dinner on our vacation and it. Was. Incredible. 

We love tasting menus, and this has one of the best I've ever had!

I don't know most of the stuff we ate, but it was all incredible.  If you can get a reservation, the food is incredible and it is so entertaining watching the chefs make your meals in the open kitchen.

The experience was everything I had been told it would be. The space is gorgeous, the staff all adhering to covid/mask requirements, the food was brilliant (summer menu) and the drinks were all paired well. 

The meticulous preparation of each dish along with the unique serving dishes was delightful. Everything explained and the experience was worth every penny. 

We didn't take photos because it was a magical moment but don't hesitate to go there!

This was an amazing experience.  Expensive, yes.  Worth it...  absolutely.  My wife and I celebrated our 23 anniversary with a splurge to a restaurant that everyone from the area raves about.  So glad we did it.  19 courses but each was portioned well so we finished feeling great and not full but happy.  I am a picky eater but entered the prefix menu with the don't ask questions and just enjoy.  I did.  I had the optional wine pairing and my wife had the non alcoholic pairing.  I loved my wine but their selection of various juices freshly squeezed and mixed for each course was equally as good.  We were able to split the two and it worked out perfectly.  I can't brag on this place enough and will try to include as many photos as they will allow.  We went in late August during the height of the pandemic and I was pleased with their efforts to keep everyone safe with distancing and proper hygiene.  Great job!

business.name: Gyu-Kaku Japanese BBQ
business.categories: Tapas/Small Plates, Restaurants, Barbeque, Japanese, Asian Fusion

reviews.text:
Forget this place and go to Dona Restaurant a few feet down. It's actually capable of providing service with competent staff. 

This is the second Gyu-kaku that I have had a bad experience at. 

They tell me that I can come in and there will not be a wait take my name down and everything....  I Uber there. Then they say they can't seat me for the rest of the night. Okay, so thank you for wasting my time and money. 

The manager on duty was Alex and provided no assistance whatsoever. Never coming back.

Im so glad they opened a location here in philly! I was a frequent dinner of the location in NYC!

I usually get a little lost in the menu, there's just so many options! If it's your first time here I recommend getting one of the combo meals so you can get a taste of all the meats and figure out which one you like. On subsequent visits I recommend just jumping straight to ala carte. The combo sets are quite filling, but some of the sides they add is a little unnecessary and nothing special. 

The marinated meats are usually my favorite, the seafood is just OK. The best part is the overall experience and quality of the meat selection.

Make sure to inquire about their happy hour menu items!

Terrible Scam! They listed that they have Doordash and we ordered through them.  Then when we called they said they had no Doordash and we were charged $100 for our meal and did not get any food.  The restaurant said they couldn't do anything about it even though they list Doordash on their website.  I will NEVER get food from them again.

My son and I ate here last night. We had the "happy-hou" set. It consisted of different kinds of meat. Two salads, two seaweed soup, edimame, some veggies,, and two bowls of rice. Lastly, for dessert,, we had the Green tea Teramisu! And to wash it down, we ordered the Asahi lite beers. The food was delicious!!  Just don't overcook them. Kudos to our waitress. She was very courteous and even apologized for their lack of staff. I highly recommend this place!!!

Update:
I don't know what happened to this place but the quality just went terribly downhill. The portions are much smaller, the veggies are not fresh, and the menu options lack variety. 

It was actually painstaking to see a $10 veggie tray filled with 5 pieces of assorted vegetables that did not take up more space than the palm of my hand. I really would never eat here again.

Is our first time and we got the happy hour set which we thought is pretty worth it. The marinated chicken is probably the best and I usually never get chicken at KBBQ. The rest of the meat was bland and nothing special. Also the cocktails Coco-Mo and "strawberry" gin mojito were delicious except we can't taste the alcohol and was completely sober. Made us questioned if they actually did add alcohol or not. Would go again but only for happy hour.

We have had a challenging relationship with Gyu-Kaku since it opened several years ago.  We have had some decent meals and some not so decent ones throughout the years but as the only Japanese style yakiniku which also happens to be a popular chain in Japan we used to enjoy we always "wanted" it to be great and have supported it for years.

Since the pandemic the place is a shell of itself and this was our first and surely will be our last trip to the Callowhill site.

Some highlights:
Around the bar as you entered the restaurant they seemed to be using this area as an equipment storage area.  I saw a colander sitting in a box as I went by.  Also in another booth which most likely was non operational the employees had left all their clothes, belongings etc.  rather than storing them somewhere away from customers.

The bathrooms were filthy even by train station standards.  We arrived at opening and the floors were filthy, trash had not been emptied and there were even many toilet seats broken.  Nothing like spending $100 on lunch in a restaurant you are too scared to use the bathrooms in.  Maybe they will get cleaned the mop and a smelly bucket were still sitting near the bathroom but in the customer seating area.

Restaurant cleanliness which has never been great through the years has fallen way off, sticky floors and tables throughout, chipped wood, dirty windows etc.

We ordered our normally favorite appetizer the Tuna Volcano roll but were told the "fryers did not start up".  Our waiter told us they could fry it in oil in a pot and rather than just say no thanks we went for it.  Big mistake, the rice was fried so hard it was inedible and the tuna on top tasted as though it had sat in the fridge too long.

My wife normally goes just for for the Japanese draft beer they always had on tap.  When we tried to order they alerted us they "have not had draft beer" for months.  Perhaps it's time to update the huge picture menu which shows beautiful looking draft beer then on the cover.

The meat was so so at best but nothing special at all.  The beef tongue which is also a staple of good yakiniku was bland and tough.

As we tried to leave and use our last 15% coupon their system crashed so we had to leave credit card details which we are still waiting for the charges to show.

Across the board anywhere you would look it was just super poor and honestly sad.  Even the grill grates the meat are cooked on we're rusty and needed to be replaced.  

It is impossible to give any positive comments about the entire experience.  Our waiter was nice and tried to be accommodating but in that place it can't be easy.

First time visit and I cannot wait to come back! I was so excited to try Gyu-Kaku out because you are able to grill your own food in the center of the table. What made me love this place, even more, was that they have vegetarian options. My friend and I both ordered the Beyond Bibimbap and wow was it delicious! The secret to making it even more delicious is making sure that you ask for their three sauces (they'll know what you're talking about). The servings were bigger than expected, so I was happy I could take leftovers home. We also ordered many different vegetables that were generous portions along with the mouth-watering Takoyaki, which is the fried octopus balls! So crispy, the right amount of chewy, and the takoyaki sauce drizzled on top was the best! For dessert we got S'mores and it was fun roasting your own marshmallows!

Clarence who was our server was attentive, FUNNY, and an all-around great server. The next time I go back, I'm going to make sure that I ask for him. The only reason I am giving Gyu-Kaku four stars is that the cocktails were not strong (more like juice) and some of the things we ordered were forgotten. Clarence was very apologetic and decided to take those things off of our bill, but we still made sure that we paid for it since it wasn't his fault. 

*RESERVATIONS ARE REQUIRED AND THEY BOOK FAST*
This is also a great date night place :)
The prices are also very reasonable!

Always so good! Love doing something different and we've always left full and satisfied! Highly recommend getting the preset courses they offer to get an understanding of what you like, it's a great sampling of a bunch of stuff! You can never go wrong with the Harami in Secret Pot or the Bistro Hanger Steak! Already planning our next visit!

Really disappointed in  the service I received and my experience. I hadn't been here since before the pandemic and decided to bring a friend that was visiting from out of town. I'm going to make a long story short, as a past server, the main issue has to be management. My Server was clearly overwhelmed and needed more assistance. We literally had to get up and find someone to get enough menus, take orders, get more water, or get the utensils that were not given when we were seated.    

I might come here as a party of two again but I wouldn't do more than that. I only gave two stars because the food is still good.

Update: I forgot to mention, not a single employee was masked going against the city's Covid-19 restrictions. I don't even want to think about where else they may be lacking in hygienic practices if they care so little about following rules that could shit them down.

I have been to other Gyu Kaku and let me tell this one has not the same quality as the others. The food quality was a 3 out of 5 and the service was 2 out of 5. We spent $150 for the most expensive course but it was not worth it. The most disappointing part was that service. We went at 5pm and it was not busy. We felt ignored and they forgot to give us all the dishes we ordered with the set. We had to ask them multiple times for utensils and dishes that were missed from multiple employees. They also didn't bring out multiple dishes until we told them they were missing. One item never came out because they were out but our server never told us. We had to get that information from another server talking to a different table. I would recommend going to any other BBQ place in the city except for this one.
Refuse to speak to the costumer. Nobody pick up the phone, unable to reach out, automatically transfer to a voicemail. The mailbox is always full, it is still an impossibility to leave a message.

This is the place for Yaki Niku!  Which is Japan's version of korean BBQ. ((Which I love because it's not fireball hot and spicy!))
I recommend you make a reservation in advance. 
So this type of restaurant is where you have The flame right in front of you and you barbecue your own food with a plate of freshly sliced red meat! 

If you like you can have them cook it in the back kitchen. 

Of course you pick what you like and there are also vegetables! 
Since this was the first time for friends of mine ....we got the group set... It was the "happy hour set". We had a salad and soup and then we had a plate of vegetables to be grilled and then there were several plates of meat. I chose chicken and beef. And it came with two different dipping sauces one was sweet and spicy and the other one was just savory sweet. It was so delicious. I also got the iced green tea & my friend enjoyed ordering from the bar! There were wonderful selections! Shochu , sake & even umeshu!

Service was fantastic. All the waiters were very attentive getting drinks getting whatever we needed ! Happy servers! It really was a great welcoming feel here. I was too stuffed eat dessert but they did have Matcha desserts which I really want to have next time I come back. 
I also love air conditioning and I hope that it works a little bit stronger next time I'm here.

If you're planning to dine here just know there is no air conditioning and it is hot as fish grease in there. Pay cash because when i paid with card they took extra money. Our bill was only $80 which was split between two people. They charged us not the $80 and a few days later took extra money as a "tip" which was not authorized. I did not tip because the service was horrible. We ordered things that never came out. The table was never cleared of raw meat plates our entire time there. We had to stack the plates tall on the wall end of our table. We of course were charged for the items we never received and only saw our waiter twice the whole dinner. We kept trying to get his attention to have drink refills and to clear the table. It wasn't at all busy this night. As we sat there sipping in melted ice we decided we were just going to ask for the check which took at least 20 mins to come. We were so ready to leave that we just paid for the items not received. I wish we hadn't because they ended up overcharging our cards anyway.

I have been to this restaurant in both NYC and Boston.  Their Philadephia branch is incredibly disappointing.  The tea is undrinkable, beef tongue was awful, and there service was slow and sloppy.  Management needs to step up their game.

I came here today for lunch and it was amazing! It was my first time here and I didn't know what to get so we got the happy hour thing for 2 people and it was way more food than I thought. I didn't catch our servers name but he was very nice and attentive! He changed our grills when it needed to be changed and brought water a few times. The hostess was very friendly too! Food was great and the service was great too :)!
Not too bad. The meat is good the service was okay. Nothing spectacular, but nothing bad either. The open grill where you grill your own meat is the main reason to go.

It used to be good. We were here several times before pandemic. Even in Oct 2020, when we came here, it was good. But today, the service was definitely disappointing. Five star to it used to be, one for now.

We've been to different Gyu-kaku in the U.S. so many times. This is the worst experience I've ever had.
We ordered beef tongue, the waiter told me he was not sure if it's available but he will check for me. Even after we finished the lunch and leave, we didn't hear any response from the waiter. 
No tableware after serving salad for 5mins. Eventually got those after our reminders.

Dirty plate, you can see the water and oil stains on the plate.

No empty bowl for edamame shell.

No sauce plate, even after we requested. The waiter told us this was the company's policy. So where do we suppose to put the sauce? The dirty plate?

No miso soup and Japanese chicken karaage for starter, served after reminding at the end of lunch.

No garlic shio cabbage and New York steak. After remaining, we was told that New York steak was sold out. The waiter has it replaced by filet. Garlic shio cabbage served after we almost finished the meat.

No water refills even we finished the first cup.

The table beside us has their tray replaced twice. After our demand, we finally got our dirty tray replaced when we only have one plate of meat left, by another waiter.

We didn't get the QR code on recipes for rewards.

Overall, it is really uncomfortable experience.

grill your own food. feel like a fancy pseudo chef. 

friendly staff and great ambience. really tasty food. very flavorful.

fun environment. great place to go to dinner with coworkers. would recommend.

Made reservations about 2 weeks ago for a birthday that landed on Father's day (Sunday), and it was a good thing we did. It was very busy, and there was a 15 minute grace period in case you are running late before they give your spot to another party. 

Service: 5/5* 
Our server was informative, and he made some decent recommendations. Even though he was busy at times, the team worked together to ensure our waters were filled.

Atmosphere: 4/5*
The place was clean, and everyone was spaced out well.

Food: 4/5*
- Appetizers = 
1. karage chicken (3/5*), and it was a bit dry on the inside. 
2. avacado salad (3.5/5*) was delicious with the house dressing. The salad was a bit pricey for the amount of avacado given.
3. Sukiyaki bibimbap (4/5*) was really tasty. I would recommend eating the rice dish with the bbq meat (extra) since there is barely any meat that comes with it. However, the sauce that they stir that rice with is chef's kiss.

- BBQ= 4/5*
Even during happy hour, it is quite pricey for the amount of meat you get. Steak ranges anywhere from $5-$9 for about 3.5 oz (roughly 5 slices of meat). I would highly recommend the japanese sausage (5/5*). The waiter said 2-3 meat dishes per person is recommended, and we got a total of 5 meat dishes for 2 people (as well as appetizers), and we felt it was enough food. The bbq was well seasoned, and it was delicious without any dipping sauces.

Conclusion= 4/5*
We would return to gyu kaku! It was a bit pricey, and some items were definitely hits while others were a miss. We would recommend to others.

Previous experiences and location was awesome in the past, but this location no longer offers AYCE? Table and seating wasn't cleaned properly. Half of our grill wasn't working properly, the meats were okay, and the service was just awful. Since when do we have to ask for sauces and water refills? At one point, I grabbed the pitcher myself. Our server was even eating at the bar while we're waiting for service, horrible experience at this location. I understand server might've been hungry, but accommodate your guests first! WILL NEVER RETURN.

MY GO TO PLACE!!!!  MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN THE CITY EVER!!! 

I've been coming here since the first time they opened and Oh god! Everything about this restaurant is just amazing!!!!! Good customer service, good ambient, and lastly AMAZING FOOD 

I always take my friends and family here with me.. 

Plus they have happy hour, such an amazing deal!!!!
Food was great, service was terrible. Was given the wrong dishes, asked for a new order because of the Mixup, and was told no.

With COVID protocols, social distancing was placed and my group felt safe to dine in! We made a reservation & got seated promptly. Waitress&waiters were very friendly & accommodating! Food was delish & we got the Ninja set! We are experienced with Japanese BBQ so cooking the meat was no trouble for us. The manager was very friendly & greeted us as well! We got Japanese green tea bags as a gift after our meal! Would totally recommend & come again :)
Such a fun place! The service was absolutely outstanding. The food was great! Our waiter was so attentive to our every need and very on point

business.name: Bern's Steak House
business.categories: Arts & Entertainment, Steakhouses, Restaurants

reviews.text: Don't bother going if you don't have a reservation.   Walk up is like Black Friday and despite lining up at 4:15 to try and get a table, folks rushed past us and into the restaurant and when they opened the doors.  Terrible crowd management.  So much for a special dinner for our anniversary.   Even if we'd have stayed the experience was souring.

Not sure who gives this place less than 5 stars right? I drank a bottle of wine from 1984 for $60, which was delicious and I still find amazing. Where else can you do that? The food is 10/10, ALWAYS, everything on the menu, French onion soup is a must have. Also make sure you eat some dessert and have a drink in their upstairs room after the meal, it's a unique experience for sure.

I wanted so bad for this to be an amazing experience. We had put in a reservation months in advance, then changed it near the date and they were great about it, even getting us in earlier. Service was impeccable throughout the night from everyone we dealt with. Now comes the BUT. But the food was just good. All of the meat was good and well cooked (save one entree) but it was just good. Not spectacular like the hype says it should be. And, quite frankly, not anywhere worth the premium we paid. It is a good steakhouse and the service is great, but the meal just does not meet up to the hype. Maybe that's just not possible.

The hype is real here. I've been told by many people I know this has to be one of the places you stop by if you're ever in Tampa, and it's true. This restaurant is an old school steak house that books up real fast so make sure to make a reservation way ahead of time. Service is stellar. All entrees come with their signature salad, soup, and sides. They can even book you a table at the dessert room when you sit down for your dinner. 
Highly recommended!

I will say this, I've never given a 5 star review and then have something I don't like, but I'll get to that in a bit.

 First, service was outstanding and very pleasant. Very attentive with refills. Kevin always made sure we were take. Care of.

 Appetizers and salads were tasty. My wife got a house salad and I got the crab cakes. If you like seafood, you would like the cakes.
 
 Entrees were also amazing. Wife had a 10oz sirloin and I had the flounder. Both of which cut like butter.

 I am still going to give this place five stars but I will say the dessert room was super disappointing. We were better off just stopping at Dairy Queen. Everything we tried was just dry and flavorless. Just a personal opinion, I wouldn't recommend visiting. Everything else is off the five star scale.
Try the three different meat option and the lobster Mac is delicious creme brulee is fire too

Go to this steakhouse each time I'm in Tampa and it doesn't let me down.  Great for rsvp or walk-in at the bar/lounge area.  The steak cuts with sides are reasonably priced and with great flavor.  Dont miss out on the upstairs dessert room and tour of their wine cellars.

There are few people in the Tampa Bay area who have not heard of Bern's. Most people know this local legend and hold it in high regard. Now that I have visited a handful of times I can solemnly swear its reputation is fully deserved.

Everything I've had is so so good and to be honest, even though it is very fancy and seen as expensive, it is actually truly not crazy expensive when you take into consideration that in most instances you are getting soup, salad and sides unlike many of the high class steak houses. You can easily spend double what you would here at a place like Charley's where every little thing you buy is a la carte and I just think the food is better anyway, plus you can't beat the dessert room!

They do book up fast! You can make a reservation online and you should do so in as much advance as possible. For instance I was trying to make a reservation for March the last week of December and they are already booked.

Also make sure you give yourself enough time to visit the dessert room after you eat, it is a whole extra experience and I don't think a visit to Bern's is complete without it.
Love this place! Amazing food, wonderful atmosphere and the desert room is just heaven. Always looking forward to coming here. The macadamia nut ice cream sundae is the best.

I traveled from New Jersey specially to eat at Berns for my birthday after hearing from a lot of people How good it is. I was
Not disappointed. Everything was perfect and we especially loved our server Tyler. Needless to say I will be back again hopefully sooner rather than later.

It's Berns! 5/5 stars all day, everyday! 

I've been coming to Berns since I was a little girl. To this day I remember putting on my best dress and glitter nail polish, which reflected against their velvet chairs. I remember sipping on the rich French onion soup. 

 Now, at almost 30, I still feel the same way. Berns is the place to go when you want to dress up and celebrate. If you're celebrating a special occasion or just making it through another week, Berns is the place to be. 

Anything I've had on their menu is superb. I've never had something I didn't love. My favorite part about Berns is, unlike other steakhouses, your steak comes with all the accompaniments (French onion soup, salad, seasonal vegetable and fully dressed baked potato). Anywhere else I've been, everything is a la carte, so that's a really nice feature. 

Service is always attentive without being overbearing. 

I personally love taking the opportunity to get dressed up. I will say sometimes I'm disappointed to see other people dressed so casually for dinner and I wish Berns would enforce a stricter dress code.

Wow! Best meal ever. THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! The restaurant itself used to be a strip mall which is why the set up of it is a little interesting and it has lot of different rooms! Each room is set up differently with a story for each one. I ordered the châteauBriand... I've been to a lot of steak houses in my life and eaten a lot of steak, but this steak was the best steak I've ever had. I order it medium, it was amazing. Words cannot describe. 
Their French onion soup was also perfect! It came as apart of the steak (you get a lot for your money!). 

Last stop in our tour was the dessert room! The fact that there is a whole different section for you to order dessert & dessert drinks is GENIUS! Gives more people an opportunity to eat at the restaurant because people aren't hogging up a table chatting over dessert. 

Overall this place was AMAZING, it was an experience. It was to die for! 10/10 will be coming again!
Excellent from the time you walk in. Staff greets you promptly and courteously. Ambiance is great. Food is Awesome! Don't miss the opportunity to go upstairs for dessert. Another great atmosphere.
Ehhh think it's going down hill with the food but the dessert room is out of this world

Really disappointed in tonight's service. We booked this 3 months in advance - our service was terrible. Also, right in the middle of our meal, the bartender kept bringing us a check from the drinks we ordered in the lounge instead of adding it to our tab like they normally do. Very annoying and unexpected. Also, the salad was terrible.. and the .. collard greens they're serving? Horrible! I normally love collard greens, but these were disgusting. 

The wine specialist knew absolutely nothing about wine, and missed out on pairing 2 courses with wine we ordered to go with the meals. 

Overall - very upsetting experience. I used to love berns - but if I don't get a response back, you'll never have my business again.

Also, the steak I paid good money for was burnt. I thought y'all were better than this.
Bobby and Emily were the absolute best servers ever!! They fully accommodated us and gave us the best recommendations. Definitely will come back to see both of them!

Since I was probably 8 years old, I had it in my mind that Bern's was "the best and fanciest restaurant in Tampa".

Up until last night, I had never been!

I also had it in my head this this place was outrageously expensive.  And, while it's not cheap, the food you get is largely worth the cost.  Where they get you is on alcohol (which is a little overpriced) and on all the little toppers and accessories for your steak (which are hideously overpriced).

I got the grass fed Delmonico (Ribeye), cooked rare.  First of all, it's one of the uh..."rare" steaks that  I've gotten that is actually cooked this way.  Second of all it was good, but not great.  I'm not a steak expert, but after reading 10-12 paragraphs about their steak process...I was just expecting more.  Despite all their verbiage about aggressively cutting away fat, this was a pretty fat ribeye.  I'm the type of person/weirdo that enjoys eating chunks of pure fat on his ribeye and...I left a lot of chunks of fat on the plate.

I love that the steak also comes with everything.  Too many restaurants now serve everything ala cart, and charge you for every little side. The steak here came with soup and salad.  When the steak comes out, it's served with a loaded baked potato and the veggie of the day.  (it was green beans for us)  Everything was good, except for the potato (which wasn't bad, it was fine, just nothing special).  Save room in your stomach for everything else!

Afterwards, we went to the "dessert room".  In my head I always thought this was like...a walk-in cooler where you point at the dessert you want.  I could not have been more wrong!

The Dessert Room is an entirely different restaurant and, in my opinion, a much better one that the steakhouse.  The ambiance here is incredible.  Every table is encased in it's own isolating structure, and they seem to go on forever, like some kind of low-lit labyrinth.  Some of them are apparently RED WOOD (yes, those Redwoods)  wine casks...which I didn't know were a thing.  How delightfully opulent!  I'm not big into dessert, but I loved the offerings on the dessert menu.  Everything was unique and made from scratch.

The service is very good, but very different that most restaurants.  They will make you feel like you're a mob boss, no matter who you are.  If you're into that, you'll love it!

Will I be back?  Probably not.

Am I glad I finally made it?  Hell yes!

Should you go?  Depends.  If you're into desserts...this will probably be the best place you've ever been to!  If you're into steaks...try to get around to coming here, but there's no need to make it your #1 priority.

Words cannot express how happy this restaurant made me feel. I came here with the hubs to celebrate our anniversary. We came from Miami. Friends have always recommended this place but I always thought it was hyped up. It's not. It's amazing. Best restaurant I have EVER been to. 

Their steak is to die for. So juicy. So cooked to perfection. Honestly priced very well. This place was cheaper than a lot of the fancy restaurants in Miami.

The wine is why you come here. This is the only place that you can get vintage wine at an affordable price. We bought a wine from the 1918 and it was only 500 bucks. Considering how old the bottle is , that was sooooo affordable. I never thought in my life I could try something like that. And I loved it!!!! It was so good! They preserved it so well! 

The famous dessert room. Omg come here do not miss it!!!! Amazing! Decorated so nicely and everything was si delicious!!
