I Sent my contact info to them immediately as requested so they could "follow up" with me further.  However They have not followed up.  Another indication that Berns has transformed into a mediocre establishment from being iconic for decades. Sad that COVID seems to have hurt them as well as the current generation running the place and not focused on what made Mr Laxer's establishment an institution.  No need to follow up with me at this point.......  before ever going again I will check the reviews to see if they have improved.
Very nice. I brought my fiancé there for he birthday. She loved it as I did as well. The table side service and tour was not available unfortunately.

I am a little late in posting this review.  It took me some time because I am in mourning.  The Bern's I knew and loved so much has truly changed.

Four of us went for dinner, a special occasion, after landing a reservation which required a call 90 days in advance.  90 days.   We arrived early and offered to give up our hard-won table for some seats in the bar because we love the bar.   We were told no.  Absolutely not.   No?  No!   I had never heard that word before at Bern's, which always did whatever it could to make its diners happy, right down to finding okra somewhere when I mentioned how much I love it.   That "no" created a ripple in the Matrix.

So....we found ourselves in the front dining room (not our favorite dining room) with a nice but less experienced Captain.   We ordered drinks and the caviar tasting to get things going, followed by wine and a variety of steaks.  

The Caviar tasting options were quite good, making the tasting itself a true value, but I missed the Bern's butters...long gone now with Bern himself.  We  had to ask for more toasts, which took a bit of time to arrive.  Our drinks arrived sporactically as well.  

We moved somewhat clumsily through the soup and salad courses.  The salads are still served with wonderful housemade dressings including French, something I don't come across often.  You can no longer choose between salads.  House is it.  Anything else is extra.  

The days of soup choices are also long gone.  French onion is what you get.   I opted for the vichysoisse even though I had to pay extra for something that used to be part of the meal.  I love Bern's vichysoisse and as good as the french onion soup may be, the vichysoisse wins with its caviar and truffle oil topping and its housemade chips.   

The moment when my love affair with Bern's changed arrived with the steaks.  Bern's always made a great steak, served on a sizzling platter, with butter still melting on top if you so desired.  Alongside the steak, crispy onion strings, a vegetable grown on Bern's farm and amaretto carrots.  Always amaretto carrots.  Until this night.   Our Captain said they were no longer serving them.

My steak was very good, but no Bern's great.  It was closer to medium than medium rare.  No butter once again.  I received a baked potato with toppings on the side.  The fantastic onion strings were there, a few (4-5) green beans but no amaretto carrots.  No carrots?   How could there be no amaretto carrots?   They are, make that were, a Bern's signature.

The fresh fish tanks are gone.  The soup and salad courses are set. No choices.  The little extras are no more.  The service isn't quite as precise.  Even the wine cellar feels a little lost.  I chalk so much of this up to the pandemic.  And yet, it was the missing carrots that caused me to pause.

I know that restaurants have to evolve with time.  It just feels as if Bern's is eliminating rather than evolving.   It made me sad to sit in Berns with so many of the things I loved about it now gone or an pricey upcharge.   I had to spend some time reconciling this.   Bern's still offers you a very good meal for a very good price in an eccletic environment typically served by a well-trained efficient staff.   It is far better option than any steakhouse chain in America.   I just mourn the loss of the good old days when it didn't say "no" and you were offered you so much more, including those distinctive perfect-with-steak amaretto carrots.

This is a staple in Tampa. In a nutshell it is an old school steak house with an incredible wine list. I have been multiple times and have never had a bad meal or experience. 

Great for happy hour but show up 30 minutes before the restaurant opens or you will wait 1.5+ hours for a bar seat. 

You do need a reservation. They open reservations 3 months out and you basically need to book the second new reservations open. 

Highly recommend!

Celiac friendly! They are super accommodating for dietary restrictions. Our server and the kitchen staff were kind and accommodating. I had a delicious meal with my husband and did not get sick at all! Will be going back!

I only had 2 glasses of wine and I am a large man. I got cut off because I was told I was struggling going upstairs (this was before I went up stairs) It was unprofessional and unacceptable for an establishment this highly regarded. It may be they saw my shaking hand upon ordering, which I have essential tremors disorder, which means they  are violating the ADA laws  Please respond to my inquiry

About a week before our trip to Tampa, we started trying to get a reservation without success but we kept trying and somehow we got lucky and got a reservation the day before. Our waiter was so charming. He made sure not to rush us and explained the menu. The steaks come w soup salad potato and vegetable that was a pleasant surprise.  The French Onion soup was delicious. I ordered the strip steak and it was fantastic.  Pretty amazing the whole upstairs is for dessert. I had a single scoop of the Macadamia Nut and thoroughly enjoyed. Highly recommend Bern's

business.name: Downtown Kitchen + Cocktails
business.categories: Cocktail Bars, American (New), Restaurants, American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife

reviews.text: We were saddened to learn that DTK+C has closed for April.  We understand entirely the desire to protect the staff in this difficult time.  We'll be on the doorstep when Janos reopens!   Join us!

Tough times, but some hearty folks are pushing on. We did drive-up tonight and were delighted with our choices! Ready on time at the side entrance, and, when we got home, you see rhe result. All tied up with a blue bow, along with microwave instructions!   Generous portions, very fair prices! Put DTK&C in your rotation!

After spending an afternoon with friends on the patio (spaced the approved distance of 6 feet apart while we worked on an art project) we didn't want the night to end and return to our isolation. Instead, we called Downtown Kitchen and ordered up six meals to go. Easy pickup of GREAT food. Generous portions, each order was a full and complex meal. The chicken was pure comfort, surrounded by black beans, calabacitas, salsa and tortillas. The jerked pork was both delicious and with enough leftover to make this morning's breakfast a reason to get out of bed. A friend's salmon was perfectly cooked and beautiful in its presentation, not something I would have expected from takeout. This was a bright light in these strange times.

Cute place located down town. You could grab a drink at one of the breweries and then walk over for dinner (which is what we did). We sat on the patio outside for the evening. With the heaters on, I was almost sweating. Our server was really nice and sweet. And they accommodated for our two children. The menu looked pretty good. We asked for their recommendations and ordered a few things, mostly appetizers and things to share and asked that they be coursed out. After a fairly long wait (not good with kids) all the items came at once. This was the biggest bummer and also, there was hardly any room on the table. We did like the squash soup and mushroom bread and Gnocchi (I should have ordered two Gnocchi). I did not try the Chilies, but my husband said they were very bland. And then, after everything came at once, our server was gone. It didn't seem that busy, but maybe she was. We just weren't sure what was going on and disappointed with the service.

My cousins are locals and rave about the fish tacos. And they didn't disappoint! Best I've ever had. We also tried the beef cheek tacos, garlic fries and calamari. Fries were excellent and crispy. Calamari was very different than anything I've had. It was served fried tossed in a sweet sauce with spanish peanuts, bell peppers, and pea shoots. Was a bit too heavy on the sweet sauce for me. I'd recommend asking for half the sauce. 

Happy hour is 4-6 including a great variety of food options! Not very attentive service but that may be only our experience at the bar. For example, our waters were never refilled and we waited about 15 minutes after requesting the check as he continued to help other customers...

Wow....not what we expected after eating there 20+ times.  Don't go on a Monday night.   
We arrived at 6:25, and by 8:10 we got our entree....then proceeded to send back the duck (raw and grissled) and the vegan pepper dish was supposed to have white rice, but found out after an hour that they don't even have white rice.     Nice waitress, and good ambiance, but honestly, it was one of the slowest services we have had in Tucson.   Apparently there is a new expeditor in the kitchen that got sideways somehow...it was a wreck.     We had guests in from out of town and told them this was our favorite restaurant - boy where they disappointed.    Food was just average after we received it the second tii



Looks like we will take a break from DKC for a while - we hope they can get their act together.     P

Omg this place is unbelievable! 2nd time here.. visiting from San Diego. Everything about it is incredible.. the simple and classy decor, soft music playing, the service, the chairs! And OMG the foooooood! I almost cried while enjoying my  salmon, martini, desert, and port. Drooooool!!!! Love this place, and will be back every time I visit.

The atmosphere was beautiful, we sat in the patio and our experience was great. I order a Tucson Lemonade and I loved the consistency and that the alcohol wasn't overpowering. The New York Steak tasted amazing, although the portion was a tad bit small. The Chocolate Jalapeño Ice Cream was definitely spicy, I thought that the name was just a catch but there is that sweet and then spicy after taste. Overall great experience and the staff were very professional.

I have not been here for a few years but I'm wishing I had been back sooner. The menu seems to change, which isn't a bad thing at all. The service is really great- the wait staff are attentive and give space so they're not asking every 5 minutes if you need anything   I ordered appetizers- the mushroom garlic bread. It was sooooo AMAZING! Bread drenched in sauce, no complaints here. I also had the sweet potato gnocchi, which my first time trying it. It was really tasty and had a cherry paste of some a sort under it. For dinner, I had the steak dish, which came with some veggies. It was tender and flavorful. I really enjoyed it. Finally, for dessert, I tried the bread pudding- minus the raisins, it was so delicious!! I also had the chocolate espresso tartlet, it was not my favorite but it tasted great too. Ooh, I also had the Cuban sunset; it has a slight kick because  of the habanero but the taste isn't too strong if you're not a big fan of spice!

This was a hit. My wife and I had a dinner certificate won in a silent Auction, Nourish. 
So this was a opportunity to explore and seek a new dining spot. 
The mushroom soup wasn't being served so we had the mushroom sauce over bread. 
Interesting appy. And so delicious, I must keep track of the soups return. 

We came for happy hour to stretch the cert.  
and sat at a huge wonderful vintage bar. 
I had the burger, not just, but a delicious burger served on a fresh Mexican Borillo bun. Which are only Fresh for a day , no preservatives. My wife had the J-dawg which was a excellent dog. It had a layer of black beans under the meat.  She loved it, so that's special. One of us had to try it after all the YELP praise. 
We shared the Garlic fries, another winner. Crisp and hot, enough to share and just the right amount of flavor. 

The setting is an open kitchen with no yelling at each other.  Lots of seating and more patio seating outside the front doors with heaters. 

I think the restroom could be bigger for a restaurant this size but no worries. 

Our only regret is we waited to come here. 
We ll  take care of that soon. 

As our bartender said, Everything is Good here! Guess it will be a few evenings.

The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because the drinks are pretty good. The food was Luke warm, simple, and wayyyyy over priced. I love lamb and do not have a discerning palate but the lamb was barely edible. The Fejoada was cold and just beans and steak with a basic chimichurri. We payed $200 for a family of 4 to eat here with mediocre service and basic food.
We stay away from downtown Tucson proper as much as possible. This, however, was a delightful surprise. Great food. Great service. Very pleasant setting.

There's nothing better than a fantastic happy hour, and Downtown Kitchen + Cocktails has one of my favorite happy hours in all of Tucson! 
Not only does this place have a wide variety of menu items to choose from, but everything they serve is of such high quality.

I'm so glad I tried their Cuban Sunset cocktail, it's made with habanero infused vodka and passion fruit purée, and the two flavors are an incredible combination that has never before occurred to me to try until now. If there's anything you should take from this review it's try the Cuban Sunset Cocktail!!!

We also tried the squash soup, the beef cheek tacos, the pork belly biscuits, the J Dawg, and the dark chocolate jalapeño sundae. Every single bit was spot on and delicious! I highly recommend the squash soup in fall, it's creamy and dynamic in flavor. 

Lastly, the setting is absolutely gorgeous. The low lighting, but bright pop of colors creates an atmosphere that's both romantic and fun. The bartender is very kind and funny and the chef/owner comes out to greet us every time we go there, which I think shows exactly what I feel when I eat here--a passion for great food and a friendship with the Tucson community.

This had been one of my favorite Tucson downtown restaurants until tonight. The restaurant wasn't particularly busy which makes it even more disappointing. I ordered the braised lamb shank and when it was finally served, it was nearly room temperature. It was also very dry. The waiter never inquired about the food or I would have mentioned it. I can't see returning with so many good options available now in Downtown Tucson.

I hadn't been here in a while, but I'm always impressed with the fancy menu with flavors from around the world. The cocktails are also really creative. We got the South 6th, and it was really nice and went down a little too easy.

The bread pudding was redonk. Perfect for a winter night (or as wintery as Tucson gets). Very boozy and yummy sauce, and warm squishy bread with cinnamon flavors. And ohhh the mescal laced throughout! What a treat! 

We also got the butternut squash soup, which had a little kick to it. 

I'd definitely come back, the seasonal menu keeps things interesting.
Food and drink never disappoint! Food is always fast and service is always good. The menu changes frequently to keep things fresh and new. Highly recommend.

Yes it's Jano's so quality not an issue, the overall ambiance is wonderful! 

The waiter we had on the other hand seemed very lost and confused when I asked for a daiquiri other than the one that was on the menu!?
I asked him for a fresh fruit option and he said they have orange juice or grapefruit juice?  No other fruit available? no! 

So I went with the lemon drop instead to be safe!

Overall this guy was rushed, confused, ill informed and seemed a bit too inexperienced for the position?
I actually thought he was the bread guy that forgot the bread at first, But no it was the waiter.

Meals were good but if your not a mushroom person your screwed cause currently there are mushrooms on about 80% of the menu!

I am surprised they don't offer a mushroom dessert?

My son and I do not do mushrooms so we were left with little to choose from.


Add more experienced staff for this price point and drop all the mushroom would be my suggestion!

Peace out!  



One star! This portion is based on service not food

Went out tonight for a birthday dinner to one of my favorite restaurants that started off with a very sour note from the hostess who obviously does not have much experience in customer service when she started by telling us we could NOT sit by the window or a booth cause they are saved for special occasions like birthdays and such! 
I told her it is my birthday and she said but your reservation is for tomorrow not tonight! 

I said that is a mistake we are dining tonight! 

She continued to argue and she had to have the last word!

After much resistance she sat us at the window seat. 

I just about told her I could go somewhere else and eat if she prefers? 

Very rude and unprofessional individual! 

What a turn off, Thanks for the happy birthday!

Calamari appetizer is incredible! I had the pork chops and my boyfriend had the chicken and rice. Both were very good. We had the champagne pound cake for dessert and it was so delicious! The mint jelly and figs were a great addition. Overall a great meal. We came for our anniversary and would come back.

When I ate at Downtown Kitchen they had a Spanish inspired menu and everything I ordered was packed with flavor and very delicious. Definitely different flavor pairings than I typically experience but they all worked and I loved it!
Love the place. Food good quality. Service staff very good and friendly. Also patio for dog.

I'm not sure what to say.  Great vibe.  Spanish peanuts with calamari is outstanding.  Get it with half the dressing or it's a little heavy.  

The steak is a safe bet but I really dug the calamari.

This is an unfortunate state of affairs.  I have been wanting to try Downtown Kitchen + Cocktails since I moved to Tucson a month ago, and the first and only visit was pretty terrible.

We were first half-heartily greeted by the hostess that seemed as if she had no desire to be there that night.  She took us to two different tables (we politely requested to sit elsewhere, which she obliged), sat us down along with the menus and sauntered off without saying a word.  The pleasant ambiance we expected wasn't there. We did not feel welcome. 

I was tempted to leave until our server greeted us.  She was cheery, helpful, funny and a pleasure to have.  We ordered a couple cocktails, and four appetizers to get things started. Because of the sheer amount of apps, we decided to split an entree and dessert.

The cocktails came first.  The special that came along with the World Travels event (this time was Panama) was actually quite good, and the best part of the meal.  I ordered an old fashioned, which had all of the right components.  Unfortunately, they use crushed ice for their cocktails, so within minutes the alcohol and flavor starts to dilute. 

The first round of appetizers arrived.  I actually enjoyed the Caesar salad, which had really good flavor and was interesting with the leaves unchopped. However, I didn't quite appreciate paying $4 extra for fresh anchovies, and receiving 2 slivers. 

The ceviche is horrible. The squid and octopus were very rubbery, shrimp overcooked and fish was well done as well (ceviche shouldn't have cooked seafood, yet all of this was steamed).  The sauce was fairly decent, and we dipped our bread in it as an afterthought.  Stay away from this.

The next round of appetizers came.  First was a cheesy ciabatta.  The flavor was okay, and ranked third on the list in terms of appetizing.  However, the calamari is absolutely horrible in its totality.  The calamari on its own is good, but the roasted peanuts with fresh mango really draw away from the essence of the dish. I tried hard to like this due to the unique nature... I just found it quite pretentious and unnecessary.

Our entree came out.  It was the final night of the Panama event, and this was their last piece of the fish.  Unfortunately, it had been cooked far too long, was dense, dry and lacking texture.  We had a few bites before deciding to cancel the dessert (which we already paid for in the pre-fix) and leave.

I was grateful they removed the old fashioned from the bill, and tipped our fantastic server accordingly.  None of this was the service's fault.  However, due to the way their cocktails are made (server agreed that they should use balls of ice for their cocktails), and the quality of the food, I will not return, nor recommend this place to any of my foodie friends.

Edit: My girlfriend did get sick moments after we left, though it had faded by the late morning the following day. I felt tightness in my chest, which I would attribute to the seafood.  Most likely cause is the fish they served (which was the last for that World Tour event) should not have been cooked and given to customers. It was on its last legs.

A Groupon that saved us $12 net brought us here on a Monday night. It was uncrowded and quiet, just the way we like it. 

We were really hungry so we got appetizers: I got the Patacones with shrimp salad (toasted banana crackers with salad on top) and my bride got the Grilled garlic + mushroom bread. Both we tasty and we recommend them.

The main courses were delicious. I recommend the carniceria grilled rib-steak, which were several slices of steak with a delicious mole kind of sauce. She got the cochinita pibil, achiote vinaigrette, caramelized pineapple + bananas, which was the pulled pork shoulder. There was more food than we could eat.

I got a decaf, but my Love ordered the ice cream sandwich nubios -- one almond cookie w/coffee ice cream; and a corn cookie with coconut milk-roasted caramelized banana ice cream, rum hard sauce + chocolate, cocoa nibs, and mango. Most excellent.

The waitress was delightful and tended to us amicably. My bride says she would eat at the Downtown Kitchen once every month.
Excellent food, ambiance, and service.  The happy hour is outstanding... highly recommend the J Dawg.

Mediocre at best had been wanting to try this place again for years the bar menu for was overpriced for the quality and wait Staff was unfriendly!

Ordered some kind of Asian salmon belly Taco which was average, the garlic French fries were lacking the garlic and the wedge salad was the best thing also very pricey cocktails for the type of alcohol used and would choose Obon next time!

business.name: Chef Alisah's
business.categories: Middle Eastern, Turkish, Restaurants, Serbo Croatian, Mediterranean, Modern European

reviews.text: Food is fantastic. I absolutely love this place. Owner came over to give us some soup his family made on special occasions. It was outstanding. The sausage was unlike any sausage I have ever had. It instantly became my favorite food group (that's what I consider sausage). I'm all in on this place. It's Bosnian European type food and a little different tastes from what I'm used to. We are now regulars. Bring your own wine as they don't sell alcohol.
Most excellent homemade Bosnian cuisine! The service has always been spot on and the food is to die for!
It's a nice and popular place. Friendly staff and clean. Tasty food there authentic food Guash and the one with sausage was a hit
Chefs son is always an asshole!  The food is always great but we are never going back because of the way the owner's son treats us.  It's to bad.

I am going to make this short and accurate. The owner was extremely friendly and helpful, made me feel like family. The food was plentiful and delicious! We got the surprise plate between me and my wife and we were definitely surprised by how varied and delicious the food was. This place has become one of my families favorite restaurants. Do yourself a favor and stop by this gem!

Excellent sausage and bread plate. Bread was moist and felt a bit like fry bread. Sausage felt like fried and flavorful. The veggie plate was also excellent. A mix of peppers, carrots, and eggplant in spicy oil stir fry. The baklava is nice, sweet, and flaky
The food is delicious and the staff is very friendly and warm. I highly recommend the Grah and some coffee on a cold day.

This restaurant kept popping up in searches for Greek food and then we saw the episode of Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives and decided we had to give it a try.
The reviews are absolutely spot on...this place is delicious! It's a small little cafe back from the main road so it's easy to miss if you're not looking for it. It's a shame it's hidden since they have delicious food!
We ordered the Grilled Meat Platter for 2. It's just $28 (not per person) and came with grilled chicken, lamb sausages, steak, and seasoned hamburger patties. It also comes with two different rices and two different sauces. It was all wonderful, and honestly enough for 4 people, not just 2!
We also got the baklava gor dessert and that was the shining star of the evening! Absolutely fantastic. My boyfriend even said it's the best baklava he has ever had.
We will absolutely be back again to try other menu items...I can't wait!

Best restaurant in town, family own, awesome customer service, delicious food! Chef Alisha will make you feel like home! 
Ps: Bring your own wine!

Wonderful staff and food was tasty and very comforting. I loved that the cook came out to greet us. I ordered the cabbage rolls and my wifey ordered the vegetarian Sataras, which she loved. It came with their own Bosnian bread. We also had the half and half appetizer--half veggie puree and have tzatiki cream. So good. We will be eating here again.

Not much to say other than this place has the best gyro and Bosnian sausages! Plates are authentic. You feel like you are really in Eastern Europe or the Balkans when you try the Gulash. Can't wait to sample the whole menu eventually!

Went for lunch 1230. Not busy, one other party who left shortly after we arrived. Was not that impressed. Expensive for what you get. The owners are cute and charismatic, but we didn't get checked on at all after we got our food to see if we needed anything. Unlike the other reviews, we did not get the best service. 

Got the 2-person surprise plate, recommended by the owner. We asked what is in it, and he revealed no information, just said it was the best in the country and "trust me".  $44 is pricey for not knowing what you're getting, but we just went for it: 

Cabbage salad to start was good. The platter itself: TONS of meat, mostly ground beef (lamb?) and chicken breast. Some broccoli and cheese which I would've preferred grilled veggies (tomato, onion, eggplant). A little bit of rice. The beef sausages and beef skewer were kind of gamey/old tasting, especially as they got cold, so not the best meat quality. Chicken was just grilled breast, nothing special, not bad. Gyro meat was actually good (I would get it again by itself). Tzatziki was also very good, they don't bring enough with the platter, ordered more to go (to finish all that meat later ) which was 3$ extra. 

The bread was EXCELLENT, however they did not bring enough for the huge amount of meat. Way too much meat for such little bread. Asked for more, but they were out. Any kind of bread would have been good to finish the meat (later since we took most of it home). So again, for the price, things like bread and tzatziki sauce should be plentiful. 

Bosnian coffee is very good (similar to Turkish/Arabic but with less cardamom flavor)

In summary, I prefer quality over quantity and would come back to try individual plates (like goulash and gyros), but do not recommend the large grilled platters for just two people. Maybe it was just a bad day?

The restaurant is very clean and the owner is the chef and wife is the waitress.  The menu is somewhat varied, home cooked food.  The portions are huge and we always end up with take-away.  The food is Croatian and it is tasty but not anything unusual.  Served with the meal is homemade bread, which is good.  We enjoy the country variety, not gourmet or anything special but home cooked.  The pricing is not inexpensive but not overly expensive.

Chef Alisah's is AMAZING!

We were greeted by the owner's son who was very courteous. 

As my wife and I were eating stuffed grape leaves as an appetizer, Chef Alisah came to our table with a chicken dish saying that it was something that he made for his family out of love from his heart. He wanted us to have it. WOW!  It was a very special moment for us as we had never experienced anything like that before. The food was  melt in your mouth delicious. 

The owner's wife delivered our main dishes to the table and she too was extremely polite and helpful.  The main dishes were full of flavor and cooked to perfection. 

We were looking forward to the dessert, but were too full. We had plenty left overs to take home. 

This is not an expensive place and for the quality of food it is under priced.  Extremely clean and well organized. The pleasant atmosphere was a joy and made the meal a wonderful experience. 

We are in Tucson on vacation and may never get an opportunity to return but if we do I will definitely return to Chef Alisah's.

I want to encourage everyone to enjoy Chef Alisah's love from his heart with his wonderful family.
Highly recommend this restaurant! The meat is so flavorful and we loved the grilled eggplant. It's a gem for Tucson.

Been there many times with a variety of friends, we all love the food and the service and the attention.  Chef has been to our table on occasion making sure all is fine, and he mingles with others in the restaurant.  It's small and intimate.  One of the best places to go for food in Tucson, prices very reasonable, and I can order something different each time and it's always  great!

I've come to this place many times and it's absolutely delicious every time. I haven't had anything I haven't liked. My favorite is the meatballs and the goulash. The family who owns the place is so nice and really make you feel at home. Please come and support this local business!

I was extremely impressed by the service and food at Chef Alisah's. The portions were perfect for sharing, and my company and I left with enough food for two more meals. I can see why this location is rated so highly -- the flavors are impressive & the team welcoming. 

Seating - 5/5 
There was adequate spacing between tables for indoor distancing. The place felt like a relaxing, lovely location for dinner with family, or a casual night out with friends. 

Menu - 5/5
Large variety, with options for all different taste buds. You can order things to-go or dine in.

Taste - 5/5
The cabbage was so smooth and mellow, while the various meats packed a punch. I can see myself ordering 100 of their lil beef sausages for myself or a party. The kebab stole my heart though, with it's succulence & strong pairing with the soft bread & onions.

Service - 5/5
Food was sent out quickly, and staff were friendly (seemed to be a team of 3+). They answered any questions we had about the menu patiently & politely.

Since my first review here roughly 2 months ago I have gone back twice getting a fair amount of new entrées and dishes that I uave never tasted before from Bosnia. The 2nd visit I went for lunch and ordered takeout and got: 1 order of the Sarma U Japraku, 1 piece of Baklava, and 1 extra side of Riza Rice. The Sarma tasted just like Dolma from the Med but hey slightly different at the same time. The Baklava was by far the best I've ever had in my life! 
On the 3rd visit which was only a few days ago I decided to order a few more new things that were highly recommended on their menu: the Cevapi Sausages and the Wienerschnitzel Chicken. I have to say these both were probably the best entrée dishes within the restaurant. The wienerschnitzel was cooked perfectly which also came with a side cabbage salad, riza rice, and bread. This is also a place the famous Guy from Food Network came to while in Tucson and emphasized how good this place was... well after 3 trips here and trying half their menu I can agree with Guy on this places cultural and diverse culinary uniqueness.

MEAT

EAT MEAT HERE. 

MEAT. 

LAMB
BEEF
SAUSAGE

MEAT.

Byob is pretty dope too. Kind of a hole in the wall place in a part of town that you wouldn't expect to find anything unique, especially not Bosnian food. Def recommended to go and eat MEAT

My friends and I wanted to try some European food while we were in the Tucson area and boy we were pleasantly surprised! Chef Alisah's serves delicious Bosnian food! We have never had Bosnian food before and chose several different items to share.

We first got the Bosnian soda, Cockta (1.5 L) it tastes like a delectable herbal Coke. Then we got one of the appetizers: Bosnian Style Tzatziki and Ajvar (Vegetable Spread). The Tzatziki sauce was super good and tasted very fresh and light. It was smooth and we loved the taste and texture. It was also our first time trying Ajvar, which was a sweet and flavorful spread. After trying it, we really wanted to learn to make it ourselves because it was that good! These two sauces tasted perfect with the bread that was served alongside it! 

We ordered the 2 person Surprise Platter (we were a group of three and wanted to order another dish to try too and also ordered the Cabbage dish.) And wow. We can see why this dish was called the surprise platter. At first the cabbage salad (perfectly dressed with the right amount of sour) came out. Right after that the Surprise Platter came out. We couldn't help but exclaim with surprise by the gigantic size of that thing! WOW! It came with broccoli/carrots with cheese, kebab, chicken, gyro with Tzatziki sauce, beef sausages, and chicken sausages. It was one of the best things I have had in a while. Everything on that platter was delicious. The beef sausages were delicious and tasted great with the bread served. The chicken was moist and perfectly seasoned. Best of all was the kebab! We thought we could soldier through and finish the entire thing but there was so much food we had to take more than half of it home! (Yum! Leftovers!)

The Cabbage dish was also super delicious! When it came out, the delightful smell of the dish captivated us! The rice was really good but a bit salty. The cabbage tasted buttery soft and melted in the mouth. Combined, the dish was perfect. It left us wanting more!

We loved the food here so much that we ordered the baklava to-go to eat later at home since we were too stuffed to eat anything else at the moment. We went home and tried the baklava and it was just the perfect amount of sweet and syrupy. One of the better baklavas that I've had. 

The server was awesome and very sweet and the owner even came out to see how we were doing. The service was amazing and we would come back to this place just for that! 

If I'm ever near Tucson, I will definitely be returning here to try more of their dishes!!!

Spectacular food.  Spectacular service.  I cannot think of a better restaurant in Tucson or Phoenix.  A huge bonus is that you can bring your own wine which is a wonderful money saver.  Without question they have the best stuffed grape leaves I have ever had. Unbelievably terrific grape leaves.  And the soup is the best I have ever had in any restaurant world wide.  Going back next week.  Worth it to drive completely across town. Love this place. The bread is home made.  If this restaurant was on the east side, I would go 4 times a week.

The food is just amazing!!!! Worth every bite

Chef is an amazing guy, super friendly 

Will come back again, and again and again

We love supporting local restaurants and Chef Alisah's is another one to check off the list. It's in a very strange location and run by the owners. I'm assuming it was the owners son who was the server. He wasn't the friendliest but got the job done. He said they were out of lemons for the drinks which is a little silly since there's a grocery store right down the road. My husband and I shared the surprise plate for 2 which could easily feed 4. Even though it was a ton of food and totally worth the price, I'm not sure I would order it again. The chicken on the platter was just plain sautéed chicken breast, the meat on the kebab seemed like the same meat as the Bosnian sausage and there were some kind of heated up sausages/kielbasa on there too. The bread that comes with the platter was amazing and we started off with the grape leaf rolls which were very tasty. We had enough leftovers for a few days (see the before and after photos).

Authentic Eastern European food. It is a mom and pop shop that doesn't have outstanding decor but makes up for it with the food. If you're looking for some classic dishes you're going to get it like you got it out of Grandma's kitchen. Flavors are very reminiscent of the area and reminded me of my travels. It's a lot of food so bring your hungry self!

business.name: Claim Jumper Steakhouse & Bar
business.categories: American (New), Restaurants, Seafood, Nightlife, Bars, American (Traditional), Steakhouses

reviews.text:
Lunch with a friend, wanted salad so good place to go. Not busy for a Saturday so got seated right away.
Friendly staff took our orders and brought waters.
Started with the lemon zucchini appetizer to share. Wow, came fast was hot and crispy with great dipping sauce! 
Salads came soon after, friend got the wedge salad with extra dressing on the side. It was half a head cut in half with a ton of fixings!
My salad was huge also, wish they served half for lunch, way too much to eat but I tackled it and ate most of the goodies on top which included chicken, avocado, hard boiled egg and bacon. Lots of blue cheese crumbles but I enjoyed the dressing better. Got extra as the lettuce was tossed but no dressing for the top of the salad.
The cheese bread looked good but doing keto so passed on it. 
All and all good lunch fair prices!

Nothing like it used to be before Landry's sold it about two years ago.  The menu is significantly cut down, they are now nothing special, steaks are very high priced, and, my personal peeve, they no longer have the great beef ribs they used to.  Portions are average, servers are delightful, atmosphere is nice, but oh, how it's gone down from what it used to be.  Sad.  I don't not recommend it, as the food was good and the place is comfortable but, as I've said, it's now nothing special.  Too bad.  Ownership needs to go there for dinner one night.  

Merritt Weisinger
Spanish Springs, NV

Haven't been in this place for a while and this was one of our favorite restaurants before. The food quality has gone down way down very disappointing. We ordered haystacked onion rings for appetizer and we were served with some bad fried onions! Never seen onion rings that bad! Not even from fastfood places. Everything else was so so. We were gonna get charged an extra $2 for steak fries that's supposed to be the side of my son's chicken sandwich. I asked why and we were told it's extra because steak fries are bigger than shoestring fries! Are you kidding me? I have to mention there were about 6 pieces of this expensive side of steak fries. Our nice server removed the extra charge. But really it isn't about the money. No wonder the place is almost empty. Sad to say we're not coming back.

We're staying at a hotel close by and decided to takeout a light meal. When I placed the order it stated the order was pickup only and would be ready in 20 to 30 minutes. Then when I received the text confirmation it stated it would be delivered in 45 minutes to an hour. I called the restaurant and was told the website would sometimes send the wrong information. The guy that answered the phone said I should come now as it would be ready in 5 minutes. Talk about confusing! Now let's talk about the meal, I use that term loosely. The $15 wedge salad was enough for two people and that was the only good thing about it. The tomato was minimal, the bacon bits tough chewy nuggets and the blue cheese sparse. It came with ranch and balsamic. They allowed for special instructions so I asked for blue cheese dressing in place of the balsamic. I did not get the blue cheese but I did get the thick sticky balsamic. The loaded baked potato was ridiculous. It was hard, cold and most certainly baked days before. It came with cheese a scoop of butter and a smidgeon of sour cream on the side. The best part was the tiny cup of calm chowder that had way too much salt in it.

Can't say it was great but it was mostly good. The drinks- I would skip, they weren't especially great. Appetizer- the potato skins- pretty good and the sliders were cooked to order. The service was good as well.  For the cost, I expected a bit more than received, as mentioned can't say it was great- but good overall.

Service was great (poor Alex kept trying to make things better... great guy!) food was terrible. Potato skins were rock hard, you could hardly cut them with a knife, much let bite and chew them; house salad was old browned iceberg with some cheese and croutons; grilled chicken was so burned, all you could taste was the burn and the mashed potatoes looked like something from a nursing home cafeteria (and tasted just as bad as they looked). Literally ate none of my meal and am headed for a drive through elsewhere as anything would be an upgrade to what I just ordered. Makes sense why this place was nearly empty during dinner rush.

We came here again for pick up. This last time I forgot to check-in. Claim Jumper has always been known for its large portions. However, it didn't seem as the portions were as large as I remember. 

I did get the meatloaf and mashed potatoes. The meatloaf is to die for and the potatoes are so creamy and tasty. Plus we got a slice of the huge tower of chocolate cake. It wasn't as good as I remember but it was super yummy. My son especially liked it. 

We called in our order and it didn't take long for our order to be ready. It was quick and easy. In and out with hot food. The server was cordial and kind. It's always hard to tell if anyone is smiling behind their mask. 

Good food and kind take-out personnel. What more can you ask for?

$20 for a subpar lobster BLT? Absolutely not. The lobster was overly salted and mostly just Mayo? It also took a while to get any food and drinks but for the price you're paying I think the food should have been much better. My friend ordered the salmon dish and it was overcooked and $30. Super disappointed.
We love this place for the apps and alcohol. We sit at the bar and get stuffed. This is a large quantity food place. I would suggest ordering to share. It's a fun place to go with large groups

Placed a small to go order tonight and we'll never return to this restaurant again. Ordered a chicken tender dinner meal for $16 only to get 4 super small tenders in the box. I thought to myself this must be the kids meal and they made a mistake so I sent my son back in the restaurant to bring it to their attention and he returned with one more small chicken tender. Because I could not leave the car, I sent him back in the restaurant and told him that if the manager did not make this right that I wanted a refund. Rather than the manager throw a couple more chicken tenders in the box so that the value makes sense paying $16, the manager refunded our order. I would think that adding a couple small pieces of tenders to the box would have been more reasonable than losing a customer but they obviously do not care about customers!! I would like to give a shout out to the nice young man that answered the phone and took my order. Very friendly and helpful.

Service was good, but new menu was limited and the scallops and lobster was burnt. Terrible  I heard the salmon was good and wedge salad. 
I got three burnt scallops, had to order baked potato and wedge salad separate.  They need to go back to old menu and find a chef

Awesome experience!  My daughter ordered blackened salmon and I ordered a Wedge Salad and by special request added Tritip.   Both plates were beautiful and delicious!   The Mozzarella Sticks (Large order) were SUPER!   LAUREN M. was our server and she was FANTASTIC!   Lauren was well versed in the menu, super professional,  polite, and attentive.  Lauren came by several times to ensure we were taken care of!    Great night!   Thanks, Lauren

I was really looking forward to Claim Jumper because I have so many great memories of family time and awesome food. I had the great family at this restaurant but was not impressed with the meal or the service. I guess Claim Jumper will blame it on a pandemic.

Very disappointed in actual quality and cooking of food. My scallops were burnt as well as the bacon around them. Another persons lobster was over done and cold like it was cooked prior .. some of the meals were ok. Wedge salad and baked potatoes good. We had a group of at least 20 people. The waiter was very good and working alone. Not sure after coming there for years, we will go back

We came to Claim Jumper because it was close to the convention center and we havent had it in in probably 15 years. We were seated very quickly and they were great at keeping people socially distanced to eat. Our server was friendly and energetic. We had the Pretzel Bites and Calamari.  It was so good but the sharing portions could have had more for the price we paid. My husbands salad had some dark spots so you could tell it wasnt fresh. Other than that our main dishes were good. I had the Chicken pot pie and it was so good. It tasted like it was homemade. We will be back again.

Been here a few times.  Service is always excellent.  Meals are always good.  Atmosphere is fine.

Need to do something about the house salads which are chopped iceberg, shredded cheddar cheese, a few croutons, and a few tomatoes.  For the price you are paying for quality meals, they should have a quality salad, not one that would barely meet Applebee's standards.  Lose the cheddar cheese.  It makes the salad cheap.

I showed up and was able to be given a corner table alone (thank you!) and I was very happy. I ordered a 12oz new York strip, medium well, and began reading a book while waiting for it to cook. During this time, the music from the restaurant kept alternating between whisper silent and blaringly loud, and the staff kept saying there were audio issues. This was extremely uncomfortable to be around. Adding to it, the waiter I had kept laughing as loud as he could whenever it happened, which was odd. Then the steak came, and it smelled delicious. I ordered it medium well, but as I cut into it I noticed it was beyond well done. So beyond, in fact, it was practically a burnt hockey Puck. (picture attached.) The waiter offered a free dessert, which I declined, as compensation... But that doesn't go nearly far enough to fix a burnt 12oz steak that was nearly 4 dollars an ounce. I was really and extremely disappointed by this steak. Such a shame.

Ordered online for pick up. Never got a notification that it was ready, but headed there during the given time range. We ordered a bowl of clam chowder and the top sirloin dinner. The steak dinner was cold upon pick up, not even warm. The serving size was smaller than we expected, it definitely wasn't worth the $30 we were charged for that. The clam chowder was watered down and more of a soup than a chowder there was also an over powering tangy taste that made it pretty inedible. Never doing that again.

Went to this CJ on 10/05/2021 at 8:30pm...from 1st entry it smelled awful! It smelled like rotten old meat or some type of spoiled food...I could smell the stinkyness through my mask. 
After waiting the front for about 5 minutes...no on was in front. We were finally seated far in the back on a side of the restaurant with no other guests...This side smelled of old micarpet...We gave up and opted for dinner at  Applebees. Also none of the employees were wearing masks. Disappointed as this was hubby's choice for his bday dinner.  We won't be back.

I attend a dinner with a group of friends tonight. Place wasn't busy but it did concern me that most of the staff at the front door didn't know how to wear their masks. 
We were seated and we had a very nice waitress. We told her that we would like separate checks and she agreed to. She got our drinks with no problem, then she took our order. I ordered a California Chicken Citrus Salad. After a wait we got our food. The waitress's helper put my salad in front of me and all it had was that I could see was chopped salad with some chicken slices over the top and the dressing on the side which I requested. I asked if it was in fact a Chicken Citrus Salad because it was suppose to have cranberries, apples, and pecans. As I said that I noticed there was one pecan on the salad and commented "here is the pecan" and everyone at the table laughed. The helper said he would get cranberries  and pecans for me which he did. There was supposed to be mandarin oranges, which there wasn't. I did find some thinly sliced apples though. Being formerly in the restaurant business for so many years I don't normally complain, But the prices were high and a plate of salad with some slice apples and slice chicken for $15+ is a little outrageous. The waitress and her helper deserves 10 stars, they were fantastic, the food deserves -5 but Yelp won't permit that. This restaurant is serious need of some quality control.

Very pricey for ok food. Would of been better off with a burger and fries from McDonald's at least we wold have been full for half the price. Coleslaw is garbage and are bacon appetizer came out Luke warm you could see the grease turning white as if it had been sitting out. Just very disappointed I was still hungry when done and bill 100$ for 2 people not worth it!
We love their Mai Tais. Jen always takes good care of us and Alex was great too!  Food is huge but good!

We made reservations for seven family members to celebrate birthdays. It had been a while since I'd eaten at Claim Jumper. The first thing that hit me was that the prices have gone up substantially since then. I understand that food prices have inflated, so I let that go. However, I expect quality for price.

We ordered a variety of items including: filet, meatloaf sandwich, salads, and salmon, and ribs. I had the 1/2 rack of ribs and they were okay, nothing special. My mother ordered the salmon "finished with garlic herb butter." She received a dry, overcooked, small salmon filet. When we pointed this out to our waitress, she tried to argue that the menu did not indicate a sauce would be on the fish. It was, overcooked and too dry to eat and was sent back. The waitress sarcastically said that she would tell the cook to make the salmon "medium." My family prevented me from giving the appropriate response. When the new plate arrived, my mother began to eat the fish and soon realized that it was RAW in the middle, as in sushi raw! I was again prevented from "making a scene." Let me say here that cooked salmon should be moist, not dry, and certainly not raw. My mother was unable to eat a very expensive piece of fish and did not complain because she is too nice. My father's over-priced and under-sized filet was nothing to write home about either. 

I do not think that the quality of the food at this restaurant is worth the price. I will not be returning, as there are other restaurants more worthy of my money. 

What a disappointment!

Tasteful food, Brianna or Adrianna (Sorry can't remember her name) was our waitress took wonderful care of us. We went in around 3pm on a Tuesday restaurant wasn't busy and instead of our waitress hiding in the back playing on phone or chit chatting like some business our waitress earned a great tip for constantly refilling our drinks and being on the ball when our food was ready. Great portion sizes was enough for leftovers that tasted great too! Loved that our waitress could help with questions about food which shows she eats the food to help recommend which is a great quality! Would consider going back.

Looked at the online menu on the website. Called and ordered a 6oz Filet with 2 sides for $28.99. Went to pick it up and they said it would be $58. We said no way and they said the 6oz Filet hadn't been on the menu for 6 months. So they substituted an 8 or 10 oz filet. It WAS on the menu and they took the order for it. Asked to speak with the manager who came out, said the steak wasn't on the menu despite showing it to her the website on the phone.  Her response, nothing we can do about it. Worst customer service ever!

business.name: Benihana
business.categories: Nightlife, Japanese, Sushi Bars, Restaurants

reviews.text:
The hostess, whose name I didn't catch, was an absolute joy. I've been here several times and never received the type of service and instruction that she provided.  She really took ownership over her post and you could tell that she wanted us to enjoy our visit. 

Our server, Winter, was finishing up with another table,  so another member of the wait staff pitched in and took our drink orders. The teamwork and effort to keep things moving was nice to see. When he did make it over to our table, Winter was fast and efficient. He took our orders immediately and got everything out quickly and accurately.

Rolando was our chef. He had a good sense of humor and catered "the show" to the youngest guest at our table.  It was good fun.  By the time he was done cooking, we were full.  We requested to-go boxes and the bill. I was using my complimentary $30 birthday certificate and the server took care of that right away.  I should mention that the receipt said our server's name was Ceylon, but I'm almost certain that the hostess called him Winter.

The food was good (the filet was melt-in-your-mouth tender) and even with the short delay, service was timely.

This was the worst experience I have ever had at benihanas. It took 2 and 1/2 hours to get our food. The service was awful and we bussed our own table. We never got our drinks until we went to the bar ourselves to get them. I realize they may be short staffed but this was a terrible experience. It was not worth the $300 we paid for 5 people. Our waiter said he came from McDonald's on keystone and was using the skills he learned there at Benihanas. The manager needs to be fired. This place needs to close. I complained to the manager and he just blew us off and said go ahead and write corporate. Buyer beware here! Rocky Aoki is rolling over in his grave as this place has become a huge disappointment. Don't waste your money here, you will be sadly disappointed. The place was not busy either. They also blew off the birthday song saying they did not have time for it. Sayonara Benihana!

The chef was very personable and great at his craft. However, I question the freshness of the food & sauces on the cart. I will not go into why. Our 1st drink had alcohol, our second drink we ordered before the hibachi was finished but we didn't get it until after we ate.... that would have been all fine & good, but my cranberry spiced mojito had no alcohol, watered down on the cranberry juice, couldn't taste any mint or spices, also, no cranberry garnish.... it was like drinking cranberry juice that ice melted in. The 3 stars are ONLY BASED ON THE CHEF

I tried the sushi bar for the first time.  The quality of the food was really good.  Their main business is the grill area, so it's not busy in the sushi area.  It does seem outdated.  The food was great, but potions were much bigger than I expected.  I just ate the soft shelled crab from the spider roll, that alone is worth the trip.

Absolutely TERRIBLE customer service! I called in enough time to order a pick up and was denied service. On their website, it says curbside and pick-up are available until 11pm. I called and was told it was 10:30 for all orders. As I began to explain what is on the webpage, the hostess YELLED (no exaggeration) into the phone "NO, 10:30! 10:30! 10:30!" as I was trying to say. After I pointed out how rude she was to interrupt me, she finally let me explain and said "mhmm" as I talked. I am DISGUSTED AND DISAPPOINTED at this. I've ordered here in the past with errors to my order or rude hostess service, but this was the final straw. I understand they're usually packed and busy, but to treat a customer this was is absolutely unacceptable. Fix your website information Benihana, if you don't want issues like this to persist with carry out orders.

The last few times I've been here the service has been dreadful! If you're just 10 mins late to your reservation you will get canceled however you can be on time and still not seated for an hour after your reservation time! The last time I went I ordered a to go meal right at the end of my dining... the host told me it would be 15-20 minutes for my wait! No problem. Except an hour over that went by without receiving my to go order! I asked a manager to check on my order, he went to the kitchen and came back and told me it would be ANOTHER 10 mins! I was upset but respectful and said okay and kept my true thoughts to myself! 30 MINS later I ask again and am told that they are short staffed! Understanding again I explain that if I was told it would take even 45 minutes I would not have ordered my food and don't appreciate being lied to now TWICE about my wait! I take my seat and wait ANOTHER 20 minutes before I decide to ask for my money back! The manager quickly brings my food and I explain that I didn't appreciate the wait or the fact that during the wait I wasn't at least offered a water! The manager then rudely throws his hands up and asks (on my way out) "well can I make you a water?!" Obviously being a smart ass! I laugh and walked out to my car drive down the road only to find they didn't put all of my food in the bag! The manager had time to be a smart ass to a paying and waiting customer but did not have time to ensure my order was correct after such a dramatic wait! I'm tired of paying high prices for low services and will NOT be spending my money with Benihana again!

Two stars only because the food is good. We waited and waited. I was there today since 2:30 and ended up finally done at 4:30. I had tons of stuff to do today and they clearly didn't care. The guy Gio at the door continued to tell everyone who walked into the door 10 minutes. He was just basically lying to everyone who came in the door. A guy ordered his food and it took 1 hour to get. I guess that's what I should've done but wanted the experience for my toddler. Terrible experience and would not recommend.

Soooo. Benihanas is a classic. There aren't consistent standards of quality concerning either food or service. Depending on the hibachi chef, sometimes it's great, sometimes it's not. That can be frustrating considering the cost is consistent, lol. 

With that being said-, today, my service was excellent. Ernesto was our chef, he was friendly, and the food was excellent. 

Our waitress was phenomenal as well, super responsive. 

I had the twin lobster hibachi dinner, which comes with five courses. And the mango colada with a shot or two of tequila ;)

TERRIBLE HOST AND OWNER like the people are just rude and look bored with their jobs like no one forced you apply here and work SO DONT BLAME ME. Didn't even eat here the restaurant is UGLY. I'm from LA all of our Benihana's are cute and a great environment with great people. Only giving one star because I can't give ZERO.

This place needs to do better. 
I use to love coming to this place with the annoying wait but yall need to DEEP CLEAN! The amount of film grease/dirt on the ceiling is ridiculous and to make matters worse it's on the exhaust fan flute too (yuck). 
We did stay, Mi Amor vote not mine, and I ordered the veggie hibachi. When the waists was asked me what kind of veggies I honestly didn't know I just assumed it was only going to be mushroom and onions. They actually have a few other options, one of them being corn. If you're expecting baby corn don't get the corn (see my pictures).
Needless to say I wasn't in here long and didn't really eat. I HIGHLY recommend a deep clean and get some new ceiling tiles.
Never been so discriminated upon in my entire life. Tell me why there is a security officer with a gun on staff???!

Had my birthday certificate and dined with friends. Food was fantastic as always! The show was kinda sad. Our chef was not as enthusiastic as I have had at other restaurants. But again the food and service (soda refills) were great!

The worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. The service was awful. We had a reservation to celebrate a birthday with 2 at 6:30. I got a text at 6:15 saying the table was ready. We checked in and we're told we'd be seated right away. Waited 20 minutes to be seated. We then waited 40 minutes for drinks (waters). Then waited another 10 for the soup. Our drinks were refilled once over the 3 hour ordeal. The food tasted good but we were over it, as we only got a bite of food an hour after waiting. We then had to bus our own dishes and ask them to be taken away. Finally got the check and waited another 30 minutes for the waiter to come back. Then it wasn't right. The family we were with had a kid and she started to get a little fussy and so they asked for boxes and the check. They waited 30 minutes for them. All while this is happening the manager is not delegating any tasks and is singing happy birthday to people who have been waiting to leave. It was a shitshow and frankly felt like we were all apart of a joke. As we got our checks, we realized this man in a wheelchair was being seated. He had come in when we had come in. AT SIX THIRTY and was being seated with his family to celebrate his birthday as we were leaving at 8:45. The other man at the table asked for a waiter a few times and manager acted like nothing was wrong. It was sad and depressing and I will not be returning. Frankly I don't believe anyone who was served tonight will be returning. 

The best part of the night was walking out the doors.
Completely awful service. I called about 10 different times about them messing up my Togo order and no one answered. I finally had to just go in and had to wait 10 minutes till I saw an employee.

What has happened to this place..... I have been coming here for 20 years. Hadn't been since 2019 though and come back to a sh*t show..... Service  was so slow, the cook was horrible, the place is filthy, hostesses were rude, server was super nice but she would disappear for 20 minutes.  Bathrooms sticky and dirty. Ceiling look like a smokers house. 

I am allergic to shrimp, server asked about allergies I told her. I have slight allergies (bathroom issues mostly) Then the cook tosses shrimp on my plate and then cooks my steak in the shrimp area..... so if i was severally allergic.....

Never going back! Congrats!

We had dinner reservations at 7:15 for a birthday celebration . We were seated right away but it was 30 mins before we were able to order than another 45 mins went by the cook ever came out and then right away he started cooking the egg for the rice. Then the onion and he threw some chikcen on there now the rice was done first got it around 8:30. Now mind you someone chicken is still cokking but not given to anyone. Then next he cooked the veg but i guess since most of my table disnt want mushrooms he said okay so u dont get mushrooms either. So the vegables ended up just being onions n zucchinni. I could go on and on long story short our meats were cooked last but by the time he was done no one had any rice or vegs to go with their food so the ended up with just meat and I ended up being hungry and mad bc I didnt eat my food trying to wait for it to get done. Then the manager said she would take $20 off my bill of $169. Bc we did not get our meat until 10:30 so can yoi see my frustration. And she didnt take it off anyone elses bill. Moral of story dont waste your money or time dining at Benihana's go to fuyiyama or izayaka .

I'm not sure why the reviews are so terrible for this place, my review is a 3 1/2, but yelp won't let you do half stars. This place is great, you always get a good show the food is pretty good you never leave hungry. So once the bad reviews? Are you looking for better values and $30 a meal? Well you're going here for showmanship and for the experience. I think it's expensive and overprice to eat here, but my family loves it and it's great for birthdays etc..

The servings were absolutely pathetic. 2 little shrimp is not an appetizer and half a zucchini strip and a piece of onion is laughable. Literally sitting at the restaurant right now writing this review. I'd suggest going to ANY OTHER HIBACHI PLACE other than Benihana. It's unfortunate as Benihana use to be the gold standard. Will never be back

Edit: they also forgot the mushroom and the shrimp had zero seasoning on it.  Maybe I'll open a restaurant and cook shrimp on a float top with no seasoning and charge $50 a plate. I'd be rich.

Ever wonder what $50 gets you? When you order take-out, it's a whole lot of nothing... Unfortunately Benihana's used to be a happening place, but now it's a sad, junky restaurant that charges more money for less food and horrible service. The chefs are the only ones who make this place the experience it is, anyone else is useless. My husband and I order the hibachi steak meal and two portions of fried rice to munch on for lunch the next day. They apparently don't give you rice (fried or white) anymore with your meal as this is the second time it has happened- and the last since we will not be coming back. When we saw the portions for the fried rice, we thought it was a joke. They were TINY, not to mention, we used them for our meals since they didn't give any with it and the portions were laughable. Each time we ordered, they forgot to add the beer we had on there but didn't forget to charge us. To add, with this being the second time we ordered takeout from them in a close enough timeframe, they gave us an hour wait with our first order, and 45 minutes with this recent order. BOTH times we got there, we had to wait an additional 40 mins. It's ridiculous. Quality and quantity seem to be nonexistent these days. Take your money to Hibachi Express, instead. Same quality, much more in quantity, and for half the price. Or just go to Sapporo.

DO NOT GET CARRY OUT. Paid $30 for the teriyaki steak dinner meal. They didn't give me any rice, which comes with the meal. The soup is half empty and the manager was extremely rude when picking up the food. Very bad for $30. Always seems to disappoint.

I placed an order for pickup at 10:30am and arrived at the restaurant at 11:20am and the order was still not ready. The restaurant was completely empty, and the order was only 2 hibachi meals. The portions were small and the service is always subpar. We seriously bring home leftovers and the portion size of the leftovers are bigger than when you order a meal for takeout. We've always loved Benihana but this is just a Bad location.
Good clean atmosphere. Friendly staff. Quality food, i think it's a great place . Food was quickly cooked and to our specifications. I recommend if you want a sit down hibachi restaurant

This is what greeted us in the driveway. 
Restaurant was not  setup and seemed like everyone showed up late to work. 
After being seated the busser continued setting up dining room with no sense of urgency. Not a big deal but, I don't appreciate someone sweeping with a broom beside me. Especially when we had drinks on the table. 
Our cook  was less then enthusiastic and severely overcooked two out of three dishes.
Rare and medium rare are temps that he doesn't understand. 
Our waitress was the best part of the experience. 
I remember when the management and employees had more pride of self and workplace. 
It's a shame that the keystone location is now a dump in comparison to years past

Made a reservation for a birthday and waited an hour to be seated past our reservation time. The host and our waitress were not apologetic and the service was incredibly sub-par. It took twenty minutes for us to be served our first round of drinks. And thirty minutes for our food order to be taken. To order a second round we had to ask another waiter. Finally when we were trying to pay our check we waited fifteen minutes only to be told that our waitress was "on a call" and someone finally cashed us out. Absolutely abysmal service for a Monday night and with a reservation.  We also never received the dessert that was supposed to come with our meal and they never did anything for the birthday in our party, even though it was noted in our reservation and we mentioned it to our waitress. Not worth the money or the time.

Had the food been up to par the $200.00 plus bill would have been except able. However the shrimp tasted like lemon, lobster and filet were over cooked. Could not taste the beef was over seasoned with pepper. In fact all I could taste is pepper on an over cooked rubbery filet. The waitress asked how was everything , I told her that was overpowered by pepper. She said ok and moved back to get our check. Obviously she did not care. Were to get ice cream with meal. It never showed until we reminded her of of it.  Not the benehanas of the past. Should have followed our instinct and gone to Fujiyama. Avoid this location if you still have taste buds

business.name: The Wild Cow
business.categories: American (New), Vegan, Restaurants, Vegetarian

reviews.text: Great vegetarian spot. Lots of diverse food options (I highly recommend the burrito). It also has a sneaky good beer selection.

Only took us four years to finally dine here, and now we can't wait to return!  Everything was amazing!  Our server, Bre, was very informative and sweet. We ordered the nachos to start, and they are the most delicious nachos ever!  We will definitely be ordering this every time we return. We shared the portobello tacos on flour shells with a side of yummy lentil stew, as well as the chickpea salad. We've already decided to each get the lentil stew next time. Sooo much flavor. Wish I could duplicate the recipes!Believe me, you need to try it!
Food was good but not great. Happy to see a plant based option out here but the staff was rude and it just made me experience altogether bad.

Just stop by visiting from California. My wife and I decided to have lunch. Wasn't expecting much, but this place is amazing. I had the French dip and as a vegan connoisseur it was definitely the best vegan meal I've had in a long time. Did I mention I was from California? That should say a lot!!!
This restaurant was absolutely fantastic!  We had the special "lobster" roll and loved it. Really friendly staff. Good beer selection. Highly recommend!

I'm going to give this a 5/5. I thought this was a vegetarian restaurant which limited vegan options but according to the waitresses, everything is vegan. 

I ordered the sweet potato and black bean tacos which were topped with purple cabbage slaw and a side of the lentil stew (best decision I made all day). The stew is super good! 

I also ordered nachos which were soupy with bigger tomatoes (I'm used to pico de Gallo- chopped up tomatoes and onions).... But still good. I'm a picky eater, and I enjoyed everything I had.

We came in 30 min before closing after landing in Nashville from CA and the staff was very kind to seat us and treat us well!

We loved the food! Everything was so flavorful and "just right." We ordered the Patty Melt (w Beyond), Chipotle Seitan Tacos (I recommend flour tortillas), and Buffalo Tempeh wrap. Wish we could have spent more time here during the day time because the place was so cute! 

We also ordered the coffee cake to go, and it reminded me of the one my mom used to make  , delicious and I'm sure perfect w a cup of coffee! 

Thank you Wild Cow for the wonderful experience :)

We had a wonderful dinner at the Wild Cow with family friends this week! It was our first experience at a vegan restaurant and we will definitely be back! Some highlights were the queso, the Buffalo greens and beans, and the gyro wrap! Honestly I was so impressed by everything and our server Drake was awesome! OH I'm also now OBSESSED with the chickpea salad!

I found this place on Instagram through the "Nashville Vegan" page. Let me tell you, it has totally exceeded my expectations! 

I came here for lunch on a Monday with a friend. It wasn't too crowded. We were sat inside right away. The weather was nice so they had their patio area open as well. We ordered the hummus plate for a starter and both got the French dip sandwich as an entrée. Everything was very flavorful and the portions were pretty large (we both had leftovers). 
 I  bought the "cauldron" cake to-go for my husband. It was super cute and he said it tasted delicious too! I appreciated the Wild Cow waiter helping me pick a desert option what would hold up well during my hour long drive home.

The only downside to this place is their bathroom situation. The bathroom is located just outside of the restaurant and is shared by all of the shops in the immediate area. For this reason there always seemed to be a line. They also tended to be a little dirtier than if they were inside the restaurant and only used by customers. This isn't a big deal to me but something to take note of. 

I will definitely be going back next time I'm in Nashville!

Good, but not great. We appreciate restaurants that cater to vegetarian/vegan diners like us, but the food at the Wild Cow was so so. The dining area was nice. We chose to eat outside. It was early evening and very pleasant. We started with spinach artichoke dip. It wasn't bad. My partner had the Buffalo Beans & Greens and she really liked it. I had the Greek Gyro Salad and felt it was bland. It felt tossed together and lacked flavor. I'm giving them a 3 for ambience, the dip, and my partner's food. I guess I just chose one of their weaker options. Live and learn.

So surprised , had the worst service ever. The waiter wouldn't seat us though our table was ready. He wanted to finish his prep work. When I asked if I could sit and wait as I I recently had knee surgery he actually yelled at me. The service was then brutally slow and the food mediocre.
The vegan Reuben sandwich on toasted rye was fabulous. I never knew about seitan until today. Definitely will come back for more. :)

Looking for great vegan options, well look no further.  We had a yummy time at The Wild Cow.  Surprisingly the Caesar Salad, and Spinach Artichoke dip were my fav.  The salad had a delicious tangy sauce, and left me wanting more.  The staff were all impeccable.  Our servers were Connor, and Allie, and they were absolutely awesome. So kind, and welcoming.  They gave great recommendations.   I'm so excited to come back, and try more. 10's across the board! Would recommend.

Just a really nice place. Good, delicious food. The hummus is great, the options of salads, wraps and everything else is just really good. Staff is friendly too and has good recommendations. Big fan!!
There's a million options! Had my first vegan gyro! All sandwiches come with a wide variety of sides aside some the typical fries. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.

Really sad that it took me as long as it did to actually check out The Wild Cow. So far, I've had food from this spot a few times and both times have just been phenomenal. I would highly recommend the Wild Reuben, which blew me away, as well as the nachos/queso. Definitely a spot I am always happy to go back to.

I love The Wild Cow! It had been two and a half years since I had been there, and I frequently dream about this place.   On a recent trip to Nashville, I just HAD to go. I ordered their famous nachos - the best I have ever had.  I also ordered food to take back to Atlanta with me - tacos, and some sides like sweet potatoes, garlicky kale, black beans. AND the spinach-artichoke dip. ALL were sublime. They have some secret seasonings that elevate their food to almost ethereal levels. They accommodate gluten-free customers as well, and honestly, whether you eat meat or not is completely irrelevant. This food will change your mind about vegan food. I am sad to learn from other reviews that some servers give attitude. My server was completely gracious, and another server helped me bag up my take-out. They were very kind! I would humbly ask the supposed attitude-giving servers to dial it back, because for me, this place is nearly perfect!

"Don't have a cow, man." Bart Simpson

While known for fried chicken and barbecue, Nashville seems to have a great vegan and vegetarian cuisine presence as well. 
Wild Cow offers some good vegan grub in a hip, casual atmosphere. 
The menu has a lot of appetizers, salad, tacos and entrees on the menu. It was really hard making the decision on what to order.

I think it's great to have trendy vegetarian restaurants, and I love to support them. 
The Wild Cow does it's part in giving people the option for a meatless experience, but I found the food to be good, not great. 

The Patty Melt was pretty substantial but could have benefited from a better bread. 
The French Dip seemed promising, but unfortunately failed to really live up to the namesake sandwich. Hummus was good and served with okay chips. The Chickpea Salad, probably the highlight of my lunch, was fresh and fantastic. 

Service was good. Prices were a bit high for the offering. 

Love the options, like the food.
Overall A-OK
Cowabunga Dude

We had a great night sitting at the bar and enjoying amazing vegan food. I seriously love going to places where I can order anything on the menu! They were a bit busy when we were there, but the food was quick and delicious and the drinks were pretty dang good too. Definitely going back!

Winner, winner...chicken is not for dinner but dinner was damn good!

Visiting Nashville for work and despite all the great food around Nashville I was feeling the need for some Vegan fair.  A little cleaner eating...plant based is my new thing.  Did a little Yelp search; Side note for Yelp, your search engine sucks...always has but is definitely  is not getting better...the shit that comes up when you search "vegan" is a joke!

Ok, so despite Yelps lame search I did find this place.  Not to far of a drive, nice part of town and away from all the chaos  on the other side of the river...this place has been here for a while I guess.  Nice to see that places like this have made it through all the covid crap..even in TN.

Great space, nice open and bright.  Food was really good!  I had the burrito with chorizos sausage (meatless) and the cheese sauce (dairy free) on top!  My only beef would be the temperature of the meal....not super hot, I know you don't need to cook this type of meat but hot is something that is a sensory thing as well so it is always important.

Well worth the visit, I would come back and bring a friend.  Service was great, people really nice, nice sunny room...damn near perfect!

KT

Holy cow! Absolutley amazing. Top to bottom. John was a pleasure and delight to have serve us at the bar. To start the Wildflower Sazerac and Primavera cocktails were unbelievably delicious.
