Followed by a huge half portion of nachos - sooooo good! Then my wife and I split the patty mel on rye with a side of house made hummus and chips....a revelation. Everything expertly seasoned by the awesomeladies working hard at the grill. Huge thank you to John and everyone at The Wild Cow!!!!!

Wonderful vegetarian options and a real variety of choices, which is refreshing for a vegetarian/vegan restaurant. We really enjoyed the garlicky kale salad, and the chickpea salad. I still can't stop thinking about that chickpea salad. The sides were really lovely. Gyro and French dip were delicious. Kombucha is great. My son's nut and raspberry jam sandwich was surprisingly delicious!  We ate everything before we could take a picture. Excited to try other things on the menu. Will be back!
Wild cow was a staple for me when I lived in East nashville. I've always received great service. My favorite dishes included the Buffalo tempeh! But I've enjoyed everything I've ordered there.

Drove 2 hours south for this spot. Absolutely amazing. Food was so tasty and so fresh "it's gonna slap ya!!!"  If you not vegan or vegetarian, give it a try and taste food that you know how it was made and where it came from. Outstanding!!!

Great vegan restaurant. Unique vegan dishes, more than just veggie burgers. Highly recommend. Has some outdoor seating available. In a nice area of East Nashville. Will go back again when we are in the area.

business.name: Sweet Freedom Bakery
business.categories: Gluten-Free, Food, Bakeries, Restaurants, Vegan

reviews.text:
I had an amazingly good first experience with Sweet Freedom.  I spoke to a very pleasant lady on the phone who put aside 6 vanilla cupcakes for my vegan teen's birthday.

When I came to pick them up they were boxed and ready.   I also wound up getting 6 more cupcakes in assorted flavors, chocolate, salted caramel and triple berry.

My kid loved them and shared with her friends.

Good vegan desserts are a blessing.

Thanks, sweet freedom, for supporting our animal-free diet.

I truly wanted to love this bakery. With so many food allergies in our group, this was the only bakery that could cater to our needs. This is where the good ends. From the beginning working with this company was a nightmare. This nightmare only got worse when we received the cake. The picture below truly does not do it justice. It was rushed, crooked, barely legible, AND THEY COULDNT EVEN SPELL BIRTHDAY CORRECTLY. Not to mention inedible. For $77 this is unbelievably appalling. After more than 5 calls to them to attempt to rectify this situation, I am STILL waiting for a call from the manager who I was told would call me back within minutes. This was a week ago. We were holding off on this review in attempt to wait for them to do SOMETHING to fix this disaster they created. If I could leave negative stars, I would.
This is a $77 cake. Out of 8 people, this is all we could choke down. While the customer service was good, the product was not. Not worth it.

I was recently at Sweet Freedom and had a really exceptional and positive experience with my kid who has multiple food allergies.  Even though I have no food allergies and can eat anything, I prefer the taste of Sweet Freedom baked goods.  I find them moist and filling and there is something about the texture that is unusually rich and delicious to my palette.  The chocolate frosting that i usually get on our goods is always rich.  I had a negative customer service on one occasion that I went there but it hasn't repeated itself and I'm glad I returned.  (Everyone has a bad day once in awhile, so I am letting that one experience go.  And my kid still enjoyed herself that day, so it really was fine.) Personally speaking I also love the decor and think it's perfect and artsy for a genuine "get-away" for kids and families who can't eat traditional pastries due to food allergies or medical needs.  We also go to Sweet Freedom for the birthday cake; it's high for our budget but our kid loves it and it's delicious (and safe!!) so we return.  There's a really nice selection of cupcakes and cookies.  It's a real treat for us when we go.

I have stopped by here recently. My favorite was the magic bar, hands down, absolutely delicious. I sadly didn't love the cinnamon donuts or loafs. They can cater to a variety of allergies (gluten, dairy). I think the baked goods are too expensive.

This place is amazing!!!! Everything is gluten free, dairy free, soy free and corn free (and some other allergens but these are the ones that matter to me!). Being gluten and dairy free? It's hard to find cupcakes that aren't dry. These were so soft and moist. My husband and I shared the s'more (graham cracker crust, chocolate cupcake with a divine coconut cream based "marshmallow"), chocolate dipped raspberry (chocolate cupcake with a ganache like frosting filled with raspberry, and my husband got the French toast stuffed with strawberry. To go we got blueberry muffins, a chocolate donut and some cookies. I found the prices to be VERY fair when compared to a gluten free/vegan bakery where I'm from. I HIGHLY recommend.

Ordered a strawberry shortcake for my special gals bday a week in advance. Asked specifically for a "naked" style... the girl who took my order seemed so uninterested and unenthused. I went over with her two times what I was looking for. Well, $60 later, I picked up a birthday cake that was NOT cold, iced to the MAX, and had a huge hole on the side with all the filling pouring out. I called as soon as I got to my car and the same girl (I'm assuming their only help) didn't share a bit of concern. "Well is there something you want me to do for you right now? We close in an hour" I was so mad that I hung up.. I'm so upset with this bakery that I was so hopeful for. The cake was so bad that we left it at the restaurant after the dinner. Party of 8. I was embarrassed. Thank you for not giving it your all.
Healthy gluten free bakery w tasty treat! They use natural ingredients and nothing processed!

We were visiting from out of town and happy to find a dedicated gluten free bakery within walking distance. The service was lovely and the taste was pretty good (if overly sweet, my daughters felt), but the prices were high and all three of us felt ill after eating here. We figured it had to be something else that we ate- but we had bought extra goodies to eat at home the next day, and all ended up feeling ill the second time as well. Too much of a coincidence for me. As a celiac with a daughter who also has celiac, we try to support gluten free businesses whenever we can. Unfortunately we wouldn't visit this bakery again.

What a great resource - especially for those of us contending with food allergies. Sweet Freedom is a creative, clean and super friendly bakery right in Center City. I personally recommend the Fauxstess cupcakes and the chocolate glazed donuts!

I only had a Boston creme cupcake and a doughnut from this place.  In the world of gluten and lactose intolerance, pretty damn good.

Make a day of it:  hang out at the Philadelphia Magic Gardens then walk down the street to Sweet Freedom.  

Or don't.  Do what you want.  No one's stopping you.  Jerk.

I got a chocolate cupcake and a magic bar and both were delicious. It's not easy baking without refined sugar and gluten and I was pleasantly surprised by how tasty these treats were. I look forward to trying more desserts.

All of the cookies are great. Taste like normal cookies. There are plenty of chocolate chips to give sweetness to the cookies. The banana chocolate chip cookie has delicious banana taste. 

The blueberry crumb bars are awesome. Very moist with perfect sweetness, melts in your mouth.

Chocolate chip banana bread is great. Moist and sweet.

The s'mores cupcakes is awesome. It has pretty thick graham cracker crust, moist chocolate cake and creamy frosting.

The brownies are sweet and moist. Highly recommend.

Don't forget to check out on the side next to the register the baked donuts, muffins, and gluten free tomato pie. The donut is very dense but still sweet and delicious. 

I enjoyed everything there.

First of all, it is amazing to have a bakery that is safe for the top 9 anaphylactic food allergies; so many children don't get to regularly have sweets.  Sweet Freedom is a WONDERFUL option.  It is not a typical bakery; it is made for people with dietary and medical food restrictions, most of them kids.  Despite the restrictions, unlike some other reviewers, I still find the baked good delicious (though small and pricey.)  We have also ordered their birthday cake in the past.  However: I'm writing this critical review because I want to see Sweet Freedom to succeed.  I was recently at the Bryn Mawr location and treated very rudely by the young person at the register, who I believe may have been one of the pastry chefs.  I don't know, and I don't want to get any one person in trouble. I do hope they get this message and change their attitude here on out.  Sweet Freedom is not close to me; it is a hike to come to you.  I am a freelancer, and Sweet Freedom is expensive for me.  My child has been to the ER for anaphylaxis; we take their safety and cross-contamination very seriously.  These three factors make trips to Sweet Freedom extremely rare, costly, and special.  This young person came very close to ruining what is a major event in my life:  to treat my child to specialty items they can't easily get.  I have worked in customer service for decades, and I know firsthand there is never an excuse for rudeness or a condescending attitude.  This person's unsolicited hostility and entitlement were upsetting to me.  I do not know the next time I will willingly return.  The bakery itself is delightful; though costly, the sweets are moist, inventive, delicious, and best of all safe.  I enjoy the atmosphere as well.  However, no business can endure with rude customer service.  In past years I worked in many stores in the same location as your bakery, and I full well know the spectrum of what is acceptable and civil versus what is downright rude.  This person was awful.
Horrible, picked up half a dozen and each one tasted like chalk. $4 a cupcake?! They should be ashamed of themselves.

I am very, very surprised to see so many negative reviews for this business. I stopped by Sweet Freedom this morning, to pick up a treat. I'm gluten free and always disappointed when GF options are also vegan, because I love butter and milk and other distinctly non-vegan ingredients as much as anyone, possibly more. I had low expectations at Sweet Freedom, but I was delighted and surprised at how delicious their baked goods are. 

My friend got the banana chocolate chip cookie and took a little bite of it as we were leaving. It was so delicious she turned around and promptly bought another. I bought the magic bar for myself and it was really good. A little bit dry, but that's to be expected sometimes with modified treats. It was still very fulfilling and a delicious treat. 

One thing that really surprised me was the prices. They were much lower than they often are at specialty bakeries. The cookies and cookie bars were about $2 each which I think is a great price. I've seen similar products sold for $3-4 often. 

I don't live locally so I won't be able to return often, but I highly recommend for those who are in the area or who are passing through and have dietary restrictions.
I LOVE THIS PLACE Best sweets without feeling guilty and applies to ALL of my restrictions!! SOO tasty!!

Although I had a bad experience last time at this bakery due to the rude middle age ladies and awful dry, bready carrot cake, this time was much better. A nice, friendly young man helped me and was super knowledgeable about the menu. He knew all the prices and could answer any question about all of the items. I ordered a chocolate chip cookie, a magic bar, and a Samoa cupcake.

I wouldn't recommend the chocolate chip cookie because it wasn't very good. It wasn't sweet and not sure how to describe the cookie besides "blah". 

The Samoa Cupcake was AMAZING! The cake texture was moist, not dense like most gluten-free cakes. The caramel and chocolate drizzle was perfect and complemented the slightly sweet vanilla cake. 

The Magic Bar was also SO SO GOOD. Highly recommend! The cookie was super delicious and moist with a thick chocolate layer that almost tasted like a chocolate chip coconut cookie but so much better.

We stopped here while visiting Philadelphia from Northern Virginia because I was super stoked to be getting baked goods from a gluten free bakery. In fact, it was the very first stop when we came into the city. Parking can be tricky (street parking and it's hit or miss). 

The restaurant itself is clean with limited indoor seating available. Their expensive for what you get. We ordered a cupcake and some sort of berry oat dessert. Both tasted extremely dry. In fact, I didn't even finish either of them. Total disappointment. I give them props for having GF options and several baked good options available. Their location is in a trendy little building, and their service was good. Otherwise, I wasn't impressed.

I never imagined I'd be able to find a dessert I could eat out, since it is nearly impossible, no matter what city I am in. 

My restrictions are similar to paleo, but I can eat white rice that is included in some of the items. No chocolate (or multiple other things). If you are in a similar situation, just watch out for the baked goods made with garbanzo flour. All ingredients are listed on their website (super helpful!) so check it out before you order. See the indoor photos for a list of the ingredients never used (soy, corn, gluten, dairy, etc.).

There were multiple items I could choose from. I went with the vanilla cupcake, and it was heavenly!!! I cannot even remember the last time I ate "real" frosting. They were sweet and filling. There was a high-quality, healthy taste to them that made you feel like you weren't just eating junk. I bought a second one for the next day and am glad I did.

I noticed there are some negative reviews for this place. The space isn't gorgeous but is bakery-like. The worker wasn't extremely friendly. My friends that didn't have restrictions said they enjoyed their choices, but I'm sure it all tastes even better to someone who can't eat wherever they want. It just doesn't work to compare [almost]paleo desserts to regular desserts.

I don't know friends. I feel kind of horrible saying bad things about a place. It's not like me. I think I gave this place a good shot though. I got a variety of things on 3 different occasions. First, I need to say something that a lot of reviews about this place doesn't say. The service is great. I have never had a problem with service. I've always had a smiling, patient and kind person helping me. No complaints there at all!

My issue with this place is the food items. On visit number 1 I got a cookie and a cranberry crumble bar type thing. The cranberry thing was really really sweet, had a ton of flavor and was really yummy. I'm not complaining about it at all! The cookie on the other hand (chocolate chip) was kind of bland and had a strange aftertaste. I ate it anyway thinking maybe it was from yesterday and not everything can be amazing. 

Visit number 2 was a second kind of cookie, I went with the chocolate chocolate chip (or double chocolate - I forget the name) and an apple cider donut. The cookie tasted exactly the same as the first so I thought..ok maybe it's just the cookies. Moving on! But then the donut had the same kind of strange aftertaste. I noticed that the outside of the donut was good because it was basically just sugar and cinnamon, but the consistency of the donut was dry and again that aftertaste that I just can't put my finger on...

Visit number 3. I went with a mint chocolate brownie and a different type of donut. The person who helped me said that she thought it was a jelly filled donut, but she wasn't certain. I was seriously craving that brownie so a few steps out of the store I took a big bite of it. The flavors were mostly there. A nice bite of chocolate and a hint of mint, but the brownie was kind of dry and crumbly and again that aftertaste was lurking. It wasn't so strong this time, but I definitely got it. I waited until the next day with the donut thinking it would still be fine since it was sealed in plastic wrap. Instead of biting into it I decided to rip it in half so I could get to that sweet sweet jelly filling. I was instantly disappointed when I was greeted with what looked like a thick white pasty cream. Boston cream maybe? Not at all. I took a bite of the inside with the donut and the frosting on top thinking I should give this donut all I had and just go for it. Hard no. I actually spit it out and threw the rest away. The cream in the middle and the frosting on top were basically just thick creamy sugar with no flavor and the donut had that aftertaste thing going on times 1,000. 

I tried and then I tried and I tried again. I'm sorry Sweet Freedom. My gluten free sweet tooth had high hopes, but you just couldn't deliver. Let me know when you start using different recipes and I'd be happy to be your taste tester once again.

Not what it use to be

I remember going here about two years back at this same location and was totally impressed with the flavor of the cupcakes and other things I bought. Well this time the cupcakes were grainy/gritty like and the icing was overly sweet. I was so excited to try the carrot cupcake and was so disappointed. The variety looked for the holiday like cheaply done cupcakes with a ton of frosting so I should've known. I have been on a gluten free diet for years and know what good taste is and this place didn't meet the expectations of what they served years ago. I hope it's better if I ever go again.

Five stars because after an exhaustive search for a cupcake place to accommodate two vegan co-workers I finally was able to find this place.  First I asked about cupcakes at a bakery in town but they said I had to order like a dozen, no way!  There was a wide variety of different flavors and the prices were comparable to any other cupcake place.

If you have crazy allergies this is the place to be. I admit, I have celiac and dairy intolerance so I was pumped for this place. It's quite pricey and they don't use any preservatives so make sure you eat whatever you get quickly-learn from my mistake. If you're just gluten free and want something close to a real brownie, this isn't the place for you. But if you want vegan, dairy free, etc. then go here. It's not bad if you have all these restrictions

I dropped by here today to get me some birthday cupcake since it is my birthday today. I was excited since being a vegan its hard to find vegan treats but I was sadly disappointed.  The cupcakes were flavorless and that included the icing. I actually had day old donuts from Govinda's and it they were delicious. Im sorry Sweet Freedom, its a no for me.

business.name: Pisces Sushi and Global Bistro
business.categories: Asian Fusion, Restaurants, Seafood, Diners, Sushi Bars

reviews.text: Absolute BEST place to get sushi in this area! Nice location too in adorable Dunedin! Sometimes there's a wait to get in but it's well worth the wait!
The BEST sushi place in the area! Best apps, best service, great atmosphere, and awesome ambiance, excellent sushi and entrees.

Do not waste your time with this place. The entire experience was terrible. Upon arrival we were told the wait would be 20-25 minutes. After 30 minutes of waiting we were told it would be another 20 minutes and finally after an hour of waiting we were seated. Once seated we ordered 2 appetizers almost immediately and had to wait another 20 minutes before the appetizers were received. The selection of sushi rolls were not very appealing at all. Food put out by the kitchen staff often sat out for extended periods of time before waiters served them to guests. On one occasion food sat out for 7 minutes (we set a timer). We will not be returning to this place. If you want great sushi along with a great experience, go to Hot Tuna! Don't waste your time or money on this place!

Love this sushi spot! I generally order their vegetarian rolls because I've never seen another sushi place do them so well! My favorite is the "I Yam What I Yam" and the "Shroom A'Zoom"

Good atmosphere, good cocktails, hot sake, and a nice patio dining if you want to sit outside, great for people and dog watching too in Downtown Dunedin.

My boyfriend and I love sushi so when we moved to Florida we tried a few places but Pisces is still our favorite! We have tried several sushi rolls from there and they all have been delicious. Their outside seating provides a great environment since you are right on the strip of downtown Dunedin! I've only sat inside once and it was a little too cold for my liking but 10/10 would recommend!

This place is not only cute and quaintly placed in the perfect spot in Dunedin but it's got great deal for lunch which makes it 5 stars hands down. 

My favorite roll is the Aloha Broha but all the other rolls are definitely worth trying too because this place has the basics down-packed. The spicy tuna roll is delicious and pairing with sake during happy hour is the best. If I lived in FL I would probably be here everyday.

Love this place. Excellent service. Quality good and nice atmosphere 
Fresh fish and prepares in beautiful display.
Pricy for the quality. Great ambience and location but that's the only good thing. so so on food and drinks are expensive. There is much better sushi to get elsewhere

My family and I often go here when visiting the area.  Each time has been a positive experience.  The sushi is very good, my personal favorite is the Godzilla.  My mother who is also a "picky eater" found the variety on the menu in high favor.

The seating is good, both indoor and outdoor.

The staff was pleasant and knowledgeable on the menus. 

Overall, I highly recommend this place for sushi rookies or experienced alike.

We visit Pisces at least once a week and it never disappoints. It is by far the best sushi I've had in Pinellas and possibly even all of FL. 

My husband's favorite roll is the white ninja and mine is the pink panther but my all time favorite dish here is the kani krab salad. First of all, it's gorgeous, it looks like a beautiful avocado bulb and inside is a delish krab salad. It is served with a chili and garlic sauce that I highly recommend you order extra of because it is sooo good. They also have seasonal specials that are typically really good too. 

They are always hoppin', even on a Tuesday night we will end up waiting at least 10 minutes so plan accordingly.

Normally I would give them 5 stars, but today's service was 1 star.  This place is my favorite sushi place, but unfortunately we had a bad server.  Our table outside was too close to the giant loud fan and the server's station.  There were about 5 inches between my head and the a pile of plates.  A young male server grabbed the plates behind my head by making loud noises right over my ears while he could clearly see how close my head was.  We had no idea, but he had an attitude from the beginning, rude, almost mad at us who didn't do anything!  Asked him a beer, but he said "we don't have it" with the mad face.  He completely ruined the start of our nice weekend dinner, and we left the restaurant because I didn't want him to be our server.  We always have good food, good service, but not that day.  We'll go back if he won't be our server.

We had a party of 12, including 3 small children.  They provided us with the perfect spot where we wouldn't be too disruptive to other patrons.  The wait staff was amazing, EVERYTHING was perfect.  The sushi was FANTASTIC.  Hoping to move to the area next year....if we do, we will be frequent diners!!!!!!

Pisces Sushi and Global Bistro is a great spot to have some sushi in downtown Dunedin. It is centrally located to downtown Dunedin and a close walk from other spots and parking. I really enjoyed the outdoor seating Pisces has to offer but if you want to avoid the elements then they have plenty of indoor seating as well. The staff was very welcoming and attentative throughout the entire meal. I ordered the spicy tuna roll and really enjoyed it. We also ordered a bottle of sake from long list of options. I am not a fish lover but I would come here again for local sushi with the downtown Dunedin ambience. 
Food 4/5
Service 4/5
Atmosphere 5/5

Heard great things about this place and finally decided to check it out. 

I ordered the Dunedin's Dream, which is Panko Fried Grouper, Cream Cheese, Avocado, Topped with Spicy Tuna, Garlic Aioli, Sweet Chili, Wonton Strips, Scallions, Masago, and Sesame Seeds.

I also ordered the Alaskan, which is Crispy Smoked Salmon Skin, Krab Stick, Scallion, Masago, Kabayaki, and Sesame Seeds.

Both were good but the rice was not very sticky and kept falling apart while trying to pick it up. Also, I feel the menu was limited in rolls in general but especially raw rolls. A little pricey as well.

Would not go back.

Pisces !!! Ya know this isn't the first Pisces I've went to and certainly not the last. Every sushi spot named Pisces has been to has been excellent . Let's start with the Godzilla roll it's a deep fried roll with salmon, yellowtail, garlic aioli and quite a few more but those are the main components. It is everything you wanted in a roll though so many things going on and a slight crunch and chew from being fried YUM! The pumpkin panna cotta a must try if you get the chance. It's like the filling of the best pumpkin pie filling but more light and creamy . It's umai !!! but a seasonal thing so get it now!!! Cheers my friends :)

I have come here 4-5 times already. They have a great happy hour and the service is always superb. 
Some of my favorite rolls here are the caterpillar, Aloha Broha, White ninja, and the Alaskan. 
They also feature seasonal specials which are always a pleasure because there's some truly unique appetizers and specialty rolls on there as well as desserts. 
I always feel like I get a good value at Pisces and gladly consider myself a regular at this fine establishment :D

The quality of their fish and creativity of their rolls are amazing. They don't skimp on the portions so you enjoy every bite.  The manager and staff are all wonderful and make your dining experience special. I highly recommend this restaurant and it's by far the best sushi around.
Food is fresh and delicious, excellent quality and well prepared. Highly recommend the crab bisque
Excellent service and great sushi. They do a nice presentation. Only suggestion is to add a few more entrees for non-sushi eaters.
This was one of the best sushi restaurants we've enjoyed. Loved the vegetarian sushi choices. Also, our server was fabulous.
Best sushi in town hands down! My favorite is the volcano roll. Sort of like a California roll with crab meat on top.
My favorite sushi!! The edamame, krab kani salad and I yam what I yam roll are my  go toos but I have enjoyed everything I've tried here.
Fun little eatery of great fresh fish you can't find anywhere near the downtown Dunedin area for good sushi.

This place is my NEW FAVORITE sushi spot! Their menu is so amazing and they even have specialty vegetarian rolls!  it is all so fresh and tastes to delicious. The staff was nice and the service was good. I highly recommend trying this place I can't wait to go back!

I went on a Friday even wing and this place was pretty packed. I was a late attendee so there was no wait time for me and I'm not sure how long my friends were there prior to me showing up. 
Enough of that!  let's talk the food. I bought the Mexican roll and others at the table purchased the volcano and the California rolls. If you have ever had any of these rolls they are what you would expect; the size is just enough for one.
The drinks were good and not watered down, they only had 1 IPA option on the menu, although not a dealbreaker IPA's should be a standard at all locations. That may be just me and avid IPA drinker but worth sharing. 
The restaurant sits right in the heart of downtown Dunedin. It's situated at the corner of an intersection. Great location for people watching on a Friday evening. 
If your up for a some drinks, sushi and a great atmosphere than this is the place for you.

business.name: Zahav
business.categories: Nightlife, Bars, Food, Ethnic Food, Middle Eastern, Vegetarian, Specialty Food, Israeli, Restaurants

reviews.text: Super exclusive. I always stay at the hotel near this area but can rarely get in. Great lamb!

Wow, just wow. On a recent trip to Philadelphia I was shocked at how amazing the food is at Zahav. So many courses and flavors. I can't even pick my favorite because all of them were so good, however the sweet potato cooked like BBQ was over the top! Can't wait to be back.

A work of ingenuity. Came in for my husbands birthday and loved that the entire menu was already taken care of. Whenever I go to a restaurant I always ask- what would you recommend? What does the chef create that is good? The Zatar flatbread bread  smothered with zatar was a miracle and the myriad of 6 dips like  a tart eggplant  ( I need to reread the menu)) perfect tender crunchy carrots, beet salad, best   hummus I have had with this spicy aoli, and my favorite was the crunchy tangy cabbage...reminded me of Indian thali with chutneys.  

I can go on and on with the wine pairings flavors and write an entire novel about the layers flavors ambiance superior hospitality of this restaurant and meal. The chef came to the table- I was thinking how do you do it? Wish I took a picture with him.

Just another thing- my daughter said she was dreaming of the chicken- she is very picky and has eaten in many restaurants around the world ( we all have)-

Came here for my bday dinner and it was such a great experience. The staff were so friendly and accommodating. The food was amazing - lots of food with good size portions. The hummus was spectacular.
Highly recommend!

Went to Zahav in October and had a wonderful sit down dinner with this feast of a spread. The food and service here was amazing - for a world class restaurant there wasn't a shred of false pretense. We were welcomed in like family and dined like royalty.

A couple of tips for the uninitiated - pace yourself. There is a LOT of food that comes with the tasting menu and you will want to eat every single plate and clear it all before the next plate is set down. Don't do that. You'll just end up setting yourself for speed eating and losing out on all the nuanced flavors and appreciation for the technique.

Without question the star of the meal was the lamb shoulder and the rice... I'm really glad I left some room for that. Imagine being stuffed before that shows up at your table? Other personal favorites were the grilled haloumi - ours was served with these insanely umami bomb-like tomatoes that just sends shockwaves into your brain. The veggie salads to start were also a lot of fun, having a little variety to whet your appetite is a great way to start off an epic meal.

Enjoy!

We have wanted to go here for at least 5 years. Finally made it to Philadelphia and couldn't get reservations (as soon as we knew we were headed to Philly, I tried -- several weeks ahead). But I decided to check to see about any cancellations and snagged seats at the bar. First - for anyone who "keeps calling" on the phones... it is very clear on the voicemail that reservations are strictly online and questions need to be emailed. This includes seats at the bar -- they are by reservation. It makes sense. It's fair. There's a place in DC I love (Little Serow) -- they don't even have a phone. So take a deep breath and you'll get in if you're patient and willing to be flexible. We got in last night and the food and service were spectacular. It was fun! It was exciting! And my boyfriend is Israeli and was over the moon. He was so happy, I think I saw tears in his eyes. This is all fresh and beautiful food. Every bite is extraordinary. There is plenty of food (this is NOT a tasting menu where you could possibly walk away hungry. The food is plentiful at Zahav). And it's a fun vibe too. Worth every penny and we can't wait to come back.

Got a bit of a mixed feelings about the place.  Honestly the food and service is great so I can't give it less than 5*.  The amount of food is good.  Not great but really good and if you need extras you get extras.  Family style or rather Israeli style dining is wonderful it is filling and you have variety for all who can do spicy or need not spicy or need something else.  

I haven't seen a better Israeli restaurant anywhere in the US and believe me I've looked.  One thing that gives me pause a little bit is the wine list and the hype.  I get the hype but the wine list could be better.

Zahav is an Israeli restaurant that calls Philadelphia home. And it fills Philly citizens with Mediterranean delights. We citizens filled so rapidly that we requested to-go boxes table-side with each course, such that we could pile away hefty portions for our future selves. The leftovers were later devoured, which should tell you all you must know about the pinnacle of Michael Solomonov's little Israeli food empire. Pomegranate lamb shoulder, hummus, halloumi, eggplant, and a great wine pairing helped vault Zahav to the 2019 James Beard Award for Outstanding Restaurant. Deserved? Who am I, a leading restaurant critic / influencer with a large social following, to say? But you should surely try it yourself.

To echo a number of other review. You get a lot of very good food.  Don't fill up to early. Staff is amazing.  Went for our anniversary.  They ended up sitting us at the bar which was very cool. 

Very great experience. I would note that the experience can take a couple hours so plan accordingly.

Here's the deal:   The experience is too much to type ( which so counterproductive to Yelp)    This place I was every bit of a 5 star experience!     If you're a foodie and want to be taken on a culinary journey this pace is amazing!!    Our sever team lead by Aiden was helpful, attentive, accommodating, knowledgeable!    If you can get here be prepared to say this phase all night  "WOW, that's amazing...how can this  be THAT  good"     Bravo!

Easily the most flavorful food i have ever had at a restaurant. everything was paired so well together and cooked to perfection. Absolutely no complaints about this place. From the first course to the last, and every single dish in between, phenomenal. 100% recommend

Warning: Zahav serves you A LOT of food!!!
I can't believe I was able to eat at here. Zahav's food truly is a work of culinary art. Each dish is such a creative pairing between ingredients that typically wouldn't be paired together.

Everything was delicious but 2 dishes that stood out were the Dry-Aged Ribeye & the Chocolate Kanafi. The Dry-Aged Ribeye literally melts in your mouth. It was a great quality cut of Rib-eye. It was soft and tender, not overly seasoned. It was cooked medium rare and to perfection! The Chocolate Kanafi was phenomenal! The cake was made up of fried coconuts with a rich dark chocolate and pistachio ganache on the inside. The pistachio ganache was a perfect sweet compliment to the chocolate! 

Everything was delicious! I wish I could have eaten more, but each dish seemed salty. During my experience, it felt as if I was drinking more water than eating the food/drinking the wine. The smoked chicken was the saltiest dish. Also, the one guest found a hair in his food but accidents like that happen every so often and it's fine. 

The waiters were so polite, they brought us all boxes to take home the food! 

Zahav was an incredible experience! I will come here again because of excellent food, staff, music, & vibes. This is a great place to bring people!

My fiance has been talking about this restaurant for YEARS and I finally got us a reservation and I have to say I regret waiting so long to try it out. They were doing a tasting menu and I have never eaten so much food at a restaurant before. We had so many dishes they didn't all fit on our table. I did the wine pairing package with it and I do recommend adding it to your meal. The lamb ribs were AMAZING. We had mixed feelings about the appetizers but that what was so great about the tasting menu. We tried a bunch of things we wouldn't normally order. 

The staff was incredible friendly and the atmosphere was fun. We will definitely be going back.

The best Israelian restaurant in Philly, mayhap the best restaurant period. 

I went in having high expectations and they were exceeded. They have shifted to a prefix meal and the course is set up for perfection. We also decided to pair it with wine which made it even better. The only thing I'd caution is don't stuff yourself with bread or you'll be too full to enjoy the later courses. 

The six side dishes you get, which I compare to banChan at Korean restaurants were all tasty and kicked off the meal. The hummus was perfect, which was probably why I ate too much bread. 

The courses served during the Mezza portion were all top notch. Each unique in its own right. I was blown away by the persimmon dish. Each bite was heaven. The course after we're all delicious also with the eggplant standing out. 

Service was impeccable throughout and wine topped off so you were never dry. By the time we headed into the entree, I was nearly full but trekked forward to enjoy the lamb. The desert sealed the deal paired with a desert wine that was not overbearing in sweetness. 

I can see why it's hard to get into this restaurant, but if you can, you won't regret it.
Named one of the best restaurants in the country. I would say it is great but not a 10/10. Still very yummy food.

Zahav is an Israeli restaurant that opened in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania in 2008. It was founded by head chef Michael Solomonov and his business partner Steven Cook. Solomonov was born in G'nei Yehuda, Israel and raised in Pittsburgh. At the age of 18, he returned to Israel with no Hebrew language skills, taking the only job he could get -working in a bakery- and his culinary career was born. At Zahav (Hebrew for "gold"), Solomonov weaves together the culinary traditions of immigrants to Israel from all over the world with the ancient foodways of Arabia and the Levant. The cooking at Zahav comes from a deep well of Israeli hospitality. 

My wife and I ate at Zahav in April 2015 during our 4-day sightseeing trip to Philadelphia. Zahav is one of Philadelphia's most popular restaurants. It is so popular that I was only able to get a reservation at 9PM on a Sunday night. After scanning the menu, we decided to order the 'Taste or Zahav' experience where you get to try a little bit of everything. Up first was the Salatim course: six different small plates of Israeli vegetable salads (lots of pickled/marinated veggies). Then we had delicious Laffa bread with hummus. The Mezze course consisted of crispy Haloumi, house-smoked sable, fried fingerling potatoes and crispy chicken. For entrees, I had the Duck Kebab and my wife had the Chicken Shishlik. For dessert, I had the Israeli Ice Cream Sandwich and my wife had the Pear Sorbet. This was easily one of the best dining experiences we ever had! My pants were ready to burst by the end, but it was so worth it. We highly recommend Zahav! Make sure to make a reservation well in advance.
Delicious Israeli food! High end decoration and great customer service. The hummus is a must try!
The food is amazing! Everything from creamy hummus, beet salad with tehina to pomegranate, & lamb shoulder was cooked to perfection. The food is delicious here! We enoyed both the food and ambience!

This is our second time to zahav in the last six years (we live in Boston). The first time we were amazed and thought the food was good enough to fly down for again. 

This time- it blew the first visit out of the water. I only remembered to take one picture before we had devoured every other dish. From the laffa bread and hummus to the green apple sorbet at the end- 100% recommend every single dish. 

There was not one single thing we didn't like. The tasting menu was an experience and was worth every single penny. If you haven't been, make a reservation today. It is mouth watering fantastic.
Expensive and never have table available . It used to be a nice restaurant before their name wears on a magazine but after that, it is a different story

Great place with delicious middle eastern food. I love going to a place where I don't know what half the stuff is. My advice is to not worry about what it is and if you'll like it, just stuff it in your face and try something new! I went on Mother's Day with my mother, grandmother, and father. The service was exceptional and fast. The food was delicious as well. The only reason I imagine people wouldn't like it is if they're very picky. This is an adventurous restaraunt for people who are open to new experiences. I probably wouldn't have brought my grandmother if she hadn't lived a few years in Saudi Arabia. We all had a great time. Favorite dish was that crispy cheese roll with elderberry sauce (I forgot the name, haha). The lamb and rice was also delicious, best eaten together like the waiter suggested. Overall great experience, would definitely come back. Due to the difficulty of getting a reservation though I would probably only come for special occasions, haha.

I think Zahav's reputation precedes itself. This place is the real deal. You know when you're going there whether it be the first time or the 10th time that this place has built a name for itself and you know your experience will be lovely, if you can get a reservation. 

My wife and I went in with a fringe Resy that we found earlier this week to celebrate our anniversary. They greeted us at our bar seats with complementary cava and an explanation of the menu and dining structure. 

As the food started rolling in they explained every dish piece by piece and everything was a home run. It's a lotttt of food and justifies the $72 price tag which includes well above average wages for all workers. 

The lamb shoulder, seabass, swordfish, rice, spiced veggies, the HUMMUS, all 10/10. There were no misses on the menu. Must try for any foodie and definitely worth the hype. Sorry about the weird looking pictures, the lighting was dim in there.

Zahav is definitely an experience. I would recommend if you live in Philly or are visiting, eat here at least once. 

The restaurant has a really welcoming vibe, everyone is so friendly. The staff is super informed on all the food and give you ideas on how to eat it. 
In the beginning you're served bread and a lot of little appetizers (Salatim). All of the appetizers were delicious. I even loved the eggplant dish and I'm not a huge fan of eggplant! 

In the mezze portion of the meal, the Haloumi stood out the most. It was just such a play on flavor and texture. I loved it l!

For the entree, we got the lamb. It was delicious but I did find the coating Of the lamb a little bitter. Outside of that the way it was cooked was really well and tender. Maybe I was too full by the time the lamb came out too?

The dessert: there was this green apple sorbet that I didn't expect to like. But it had such a cool and refreshing flavor with ginger. I would go back and eat just that, I sometime crave just the sorbet dish since I went to Zahav in October. Then there was a very decadent chocolate mousse. But the sorbet was a
Combination of flavors I've had no where else. 

Overall- worth the hype, it's a bit pricey but worth it!!!

If only I could get a reservation here... You have to plan months in advance but clear your schedule if you get one and get yourself here! The mediterranean food is unbelievable. You really have to go to understand the hype.
Half the restaurant was empty and we were told that there were no open tables.  Wow at 5 pm.   Poor hospitality and the reception was EXTREMELY snotty.

business.name: P S & Co
business.categories: Food, Vegetarian, Coffee & Tea, Bakeries, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Food Delivery Services, Gluten-Free, Cafes, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Vegan

reviews.text: Fantastic gluten free and dairy free desserts with natural sugars! I don't have any food restrictions but I still wouldn't be able to tell the difference. The staff are fun and have great recommendations. Very cool shop

We came here, very pleased, spent a lot of money on amazing treats. Naturally sweetened, not much refined sugars and amazing ingredients. 

My wife and I were harassed by another customer for I had forgot my mask, and she cursed at us, and flicked us off on her way out.  As soon as she left she proceeded to take her mask off 1 foot outside of the store. 
Staff was kind enough to see this and offer me a mask. But this rudeness ruined our appetite and we couldn't really appreciate the good desserts. We hope we can try it again when we return to the city.

This is my second visit to this shop. It has a very cute ambiance inside; can't wait for the inside to open for dine in. This is perfect for a date spot. The sweets are kind of pricey; this was my first time paying $15 for a slice of cake. My second visit they had smaller slices for $9 *throws praise hands in the air* lol. The cake slices though! Some of the best I've had. The first was vanilla cake with pumpkin buttercream and the second was the Pumpkin Cake with Sweet Potato Cream, Vanilla Cream and Cinnamon Cardamom Buttercream. Loved them both! I can afford to stop by once per trip to Philly ha ha! Good stuff!

The only negative on P S & Co is that I'm jealous we don't have more places like this in my hometowns... 

The owner beams with pride as she explains what's in the display case and what the soups are. You can tell there's a passion there - and you can taste it in the food.

Really incredible cupcakes sweetened with maple. My gf thoroughly enjoyed the tahini choc chip cookie I brought home. The carefully constructed soup and slice of pizza were full of flavor (has someone been reading the Flavor Bible?)

I rarely make it to Philly, but now I have one more reason to make the trip. Thanks P S & Co!

Save your money and go somewhere else worth the visit. This place is a joke! $20 for a power Acai bowl that came with 2 strawberries, 10 blueberries and half a banana. When I asked the staff about having my nut butter added to the side they rudely said it would be an additional charge. 

I was just in town passing by and this was not my first choice but unfortunately because the other Acai place was closed I had to resort to this place. And glad to say it will be my last.

Came here for pressed juice and porridge. But was told they do not have hose specific choices on their menu. Okay so I went with a plan b and got a protein berry muffin and a different cold pressed drink. Bill was like $40 (I guess it's healthy). But was also given a paper cup for coffee with my cold juice in it. Literally was told there were no plastic cups available (when I saw an entire table full of plastic cups). I went to sit outside and saw everyone coming out with plastic cups. So it made me think either it was a race thing or either the girl who handed me my drink did not have connecting brain cells at 10 in the morning. I went back in and politely waited in line again and asked for a plastic cup. No questions asked and here I am writing this review. Pretty disappointed.

Just putting it out there that 2 average-tasting breakfast burritos cost $40

Also did not offer a bathroom to patrons
While I was disappointed that their food menu is very limited, I decided to get their fruit muffin and it was absolutely one of the best muffins I've ever had!

Twelve dollars for a small, single cupcake has made me discover my limit for supporting a local business (which I've been doing for years). I know GF and high-quality ingredients cost more, but the least they could do is post the price on the card in front of the product so I'm not shocked by the price. This is not sustainable. It's too bad.
A delicious brunch spot with plenty of GF and DF options! Also a very cute and cozy atmosphere. I visited in August 2019.

Really good vegan food. My boyfriend and I ordered the breakfast burrito and the nachos as well as a cupcake. The cupcake was Devine and the food was really good. The people inside were a little intimidating and we could not use the rest room. Which I understand cuz covid. But other than that nice spot for a vegan

I love PS&Co but their hours and prices are difficult. It's sad that it has to be a luxury to feed your body good food- especially when your dietary restrictions mean no gluten and no dairy. I know why they have their prices, but it's still unfortunate! Wish they were open later for dinner !

Reposting from Google reviews cause y'all deserve to know: The food is decent and caters to a very specific dietary crowd but when asked to do something without avocado or banana due to allergy they were unable to do so because everything is "pre-mixed." However when the person in the party decided to move forward with their order- it still took over 20 minutes and costed $46 for 2 items. Over priced and terrible experience

all of their food is healthy and fantastic. the tofu scramble, french toast, and tahini chocolate chip cookies are amazing. 

I had signed up for the meal plan one busy summer and really enjoyed it. they have a nice array of smoothies, and cold-pressed juices. the coconut yogurts are really tasty and filling, as well.
cinnamon roll cost $11 and gave me food poisoning. I thought I was safe eating plant-based :(

Got the cake of the day: A vanilla cake with a blueberry cream & mango passion fruit purée and was not impressed. The cake itself was just okay but the filling didn't taste like blueberries and you couldn't taste any of the mango at all. Normally I wouldn't care but the bottom of the cake had some horrendously burnt substance that made it unbearably bitter. Either the thing it was cooked in wasn't clean or the cake itself was burnt. It was largely inedible and I had to throw it out. I didn't want to make it a big deal, but for $15/slice, who wouldn't be upset..

Note PS&Co is normally fantastic so I realize this is just a fluke, but I would hold this place to a higher standard given the price point.

I shared a $12 smoothie with my sister because well, it was $12 for a smoothie.... but you can definitely taste that it is made from all quality organic ingredients. Hope to visit again as a special treat

I stopped by to get a fresh vegetable juice. The people working there were very nice,  juice was fine, made from spinach, cucumber and celery. I have a cold pressed juicer at home but just haven't had time lately to use it (and clean it). The price was a bit ridiculous though. With tax, $15 for a 16 oz. of juice. I needed it but unfortunately it's too expensive for me to do more than once or twice.  I don't begrudge them their prices, because to make fresh and organic food is not cheap.

This restaurant is amazing! We've gotten so many different types of items and each time we are not disappointed. Everything from their cakes to their smoothies to their food is delicious, well prepared, and healthy. If you're vegan, GF, dairy free, vegan etc. they are the best! They were also able to accommodate an oil free request for my mom's birthday cake. 

Overall, l know we will be patrons of PS & Co. for years to come! They're the best!

What can I say?! - Obsessed! 
Best Vegan & Gluten free bakery I have EVER tried. They are my neighbors in Rittenhouse Square. Love them! 

The Tahini Chocolate Chip cookies are my ultimate weakness
Just had their cold brew and a slice of cake : THE BEST EVER! Thank you!!! Service was fast, safe and super nice!!
Had to stop by for a slice of cake on Valentine's Day. It's such a treat and I love how warm and friendly the staff is here.
Was looking for something healthy in the DT area. Ordered the Elvis.... great creation- Brazil nut milk was very unique. Loved the flavor

Can't wait to go back for the food. Picked up a double chocolate chip cookie and pumpkin cheesecake brownie. So so good. Top notch customer service. You can tell the employees take pride in food they provide. I left my debit and they were awesome! I was able to come get it the following day.

Personally one of my favorite places to eat in Philly. My friend who eats GF and dairy free recommended this spot to me last year when we first moved here. I've been vegan for 4 years and I'm always ecstatic to find healthy, tasty vegan food. It's rare in most cities!

I've tried the cinnamon roll, which baked warm, is gooey and soft with the right amount of sweetness. The sea salt tahini cookies are also a must try. Also recommend their nachos and burrito. So many delicious items on this menu to try! I only give it 4 stars instead of 5 because as a medical student, it is pretty pricey and more of a 'treat yourself' type of spot.

business.name: Bourbon Steak by Michael Mina
business.categories: Bars, Cocktail Bars, Desserts, Steakhouses, Seafood, Food, American (New), Restaurants, Nightlife, Lounges

reviews.text:
Service was outstanding only surpassed by the quality of our meals.  Celebrated our anniversary and were treated kindly.   

Filet Mignon was excellent along with all the desserts.

One star because of how bad the music killed the atmosphere and the dining experience. 

This is an elegant, very, very high-end restaurant with an otherwise sophisticated ambience that was ruined with very loud rock and pop music. Red Hot Chili Peppers, Maroon Five, Rap, etc. is not appropriate for a place like this. I'm sure a few people enjoyed it but most did not.

We were in a group of 4, diverse backgrounds and age range from early 30's to 70 and we all agreed the music was just wrong. We told the waitress and then a manager. This had no impact. Got the typical "Yes sir. We will let corporate know" response. 

Our average cost per person was over $200. I would not pay to eat here again. Geesh. Play some Jazz, Classical, Lounge-type music in a fine dining establishment. Restaurant management 101. Correct the music and I will correct my review. Everything else about the experience was great. Thank you.

We were staying in the JW and everyone told us this is the steak house we had to try, well they were right. 

Amazing view, great service, delicious food.

The wine menu and bar service rocked. Looking forward to going back. 

Be sure and try the fries!

Special birthday dinner night! First off, the restaurant is absolutely beautiful! The views are incredible. It is a lovely experience. Food did not wow me for the cost, but I guess the ambience is worth it. I enjoyed it. Would I go back anytime soon..Probably not. If you don't mind dropping $300+ for dinner for 2 then you will enjoy it.
Excellent service and great food at this landmark restaurant. Will definitely return when back in Nashville.
The restaurant staff and service was amazing! I ordered the Tomahawk Steak and it was cooked perfectly.

We had a 5:00 pm seating for New Year's Eve and it was over the top perfect! Our head server John was so attentive, helpful and made us feel very special. From the time we got off the elevator until we drove away, everyone gave excellent service. Food and drinks were delicious and the view was spectacular.
Celebrated my birthday with my wife and we were extremely happy the food and service. Very pricey, but worth it!

The view is wonderful from this restaurant on the top floor of the JW Marriott.  Pretty much a full view of the Nashville Skyline.  The food was very good and service was great.  The waiters are attentive to refilling the water too. At our table we had Salmon, Filet Mignon, and a kids meal.  If you bring a child they offer very affordable kids meal options. Just have to ask your waiter what is available. The Salmon came with an option to have crusted and was very good.  The steak was a wonderful cut and perfectly cooked.  For sides we had a loaded baked potato and cream spinach.  Not so much a fan of the cream spinach, but very much enjoyed the baked potato.  It was huge and they will split for you if sharing.  Don't forget to get your parking validated for the complementary valet.

Exquisite service. My husband made reservations for our anniversary and this place didn't disappoint from the time we stepped off the elevator to the time we stepped back on to leave EVERYTHING was amazing the special touches the staff left us was a awesome surprise. The food was to die for I had steak my husband had salmon and we shared a few sides. AMAZING atmosphere great views and I can't say enough about our waiter he was knowledgeable made awesome recommendations and was very attentive to our every need. 10/10 must try again !!!

With the best views of the city, Bourbon Steak brings a classy crowd looking for a place to celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, or life in general. We went on a Saturday night. There were even lines to get up the elevator to this place. Took us about 10 minutes to get up from the elevators. It was an older crowd, which makes sense because of the fine dining steakhouse atmosphere. We couldn't get a reservation, so we just got drinks at the rooftop bar and enjoyed the views of the city. Great selection of drinks and curated cocktails. I got an old fashion, which was delicious. The food and servers all looked proper as well, so I am sure the food is great. Overall, this is a place that would impress just about anybody. Make reservations as soon as you can!
Best dining experience in Nashville. Food was superb. Service was exemplary. Ambiance, vibe, and view are just icing on the cake. The "bang" for your "buck" is justified and well worth repeat visits.
Amazing food and environment. Staff was fantastic. Steaks were cooked perfectly. Our server Ellie was helpful and friendly

This place is off the chain good! Steak had a good caramelization. Inside very juicy and tender. This is the New York. Actually put a little butter on steak sorry! Great selection of wine was offered as well.

I never leave reviews but this dinner was so disappointing! I ate there with a small group in a private room this week. We were supposed to have a 8 pm reservation. They only brought waters out at first and nobody came around to take even the drink/wine order until around 8:45. It's like they forgot about us in the private room! One of us had to finally get up go outside and grab a server to come start taking drink orders. We finally ended up ordering drinks and food. Service was slow. Appetizers didn't come until well after 9pm. Entree's didn't arrive until close to 10pm. My filet that I ordered appeared to be the cooked correctly but was stone cold. So disappointing... I didn't send it back because it was already so late and I was with a business group and didn't want to cause any commotion. We shared a lot of the starters and sides... but the food was all ok nothing seemed to stand out. I think the only reason to come here is for the view... but you can easily get that by just visiting the bar for drinks and then go somewhere else for dinner.

Fantastic food and atmosphere! A really great experience. The views of the city by the bar are phenomenal!  If you're looking for a high quality Steakhouse in the heart of Nashville, this is the spot! Each of our 4 steaks were cooked to perfection. The waygu ribeye cap was a treat!

Bourbon Steak has mastered the balance between providing a luxurious experience while remaining unpretentious. Top notch service, we felt like royalty.  Wonderful food, fresh inventive apps and salads, perfectly cooked steak and a beautiful atmosphere. Perfect place to bring an out of town guest for the best of Nashville.

Delicious food and beautiful views. The filet mignon was  superb. The Brussel sprouts and Mac n cheese were equally delicious. We got whiskey sours for our cocktails and wine. The drinks were great. For desert we got the crème brûlée. The complimentary bread and fries are a treat, they also give you caramel corn to take home. One of my favorite places in Nashville!
Excellent food and fantastic views. The staff was exceptional. Will definitely make this a regular spot.

Once again an outstanding evening.  Continually setting the bar for fine dining in the Nashville area!  Food, service, ambiance....all first cabin.  Keep up your high standards.  We will be back again and again!!

It was our first visit to Nashville as part of a birthday trip.  Our experience could not have been better!  The staff was gracious and warm.  The food was phenomenal.  My husband and I agreed we had the best steaks we had ever eaten.  The room is beautiful!  No stuffy steak house atmosphere here--but clearly a well run room with excellently trained personnel.  A divine evening! Hi

This has always been the go to spot in Nashville for special occasions- our one year wedding anniversary, birthdays, holidays, etc.  My husband is a chef and occasions to go out have been slim in the last couple of years, so in advance of his busy holiday weekend (thanksgiving), we decided to have our holiday dinner at our favorite restaurant.

Our request for a bench table was kindly accommodated and we were happy to see that the restaurant was lively and bustling. We ordered our favorites and while our interactions with our waiter were a bit odd, they weren't inhospitable to start.  We ordered a variety of dishes and when I was delivered my A5 steak, it was completely grey (except for one slice that was mauve) and I had ordered it med rare. I had been a waitress for a decade and my husband is a chef and I had never in my life sent a steak back. But, after trying a bite- I couldn't justify eating a $128 steak that had been cooked incorrectly. The expert at the table confirmed and I waited about 10 minutes for our server to check in. When I flagged him down, I was shocked to find that he argued with me about my steak. He told me A5 is "always grey" and if I wanted for it to be pink in the center, I needed to order it rare. He completely blamed me for ordering incorrectly- asking "have you ever had waygu before?" Instead of trying to assuage my discomfort in asking for the problem to be fixed in the first place--- honestly, this is a steak house and the steaks are cut before they are sent out, this shouldn't have even made it out of the kitchen.  Fortunately a manager walked by and inquired and immediately said she was sorry and that it was definitely over cooked. So, she brought the plate back and it was replaced at the right temp...which should be a guarantee for the cut and price point at one of Nashville's premiere steak houses.

Overall, we left our meal having spent $480 feeling awful.  We were reprimanded by our server, waited a very long time to eat and made to feel like unreasonable and demanding jerks- which we really aren't.  This has officially been crossed off the list of  places to dine and recommend, perhaps we will enjoy the great bar balcony in the future to enjoy the wonderful wine list and cocktails but we'll stick to other steak houses in town for waygu.

I absolutely loved this place! Great food, great service, lovely view of the city of
course :) the only critique I have is the music choice. The restaurant itself is very fancy so I feel like they could've gone with a more classic/mellow tone than the modern rock genre. Other than that minor detail, the atmosphere ticked every box of a top notch, classy, high end restaurant.

Great service, great drinks, and out of this world views! I didn't stay for dinner, just for some drinks in the Sky Bar (34th floor of the JW Marriott Nashville), but it's so worth it to add this spot to your list for Nashville! I tried the whiskey sour, and it was a delicious drink but also very pretty with the red wine mist. Our server was great in helping us pick our drinks to try. I can't say it enough, but the views alone are worth giving this place a try.

I would give this one star.  We never even tried this restaurant and never will.  We were out of town guests and had reservations for a month.  They texted several reminders about the reservation, except they missed the one letting us know they had electrical issues.  We had to scramble to get reservations at another steak house.  The manager and hostess were extremely rude at best.  It is pretty clear they don't care much for their guests.  Definitely will never attempt to dine here again.

business.name: Chandlers
business.categories: Nightlife, Restaurants, Seafood, Cocktail Bars, Jazz & Blues, Food, Steakhouses, Arts & Entertainment, Bars, Lounges, Adult Entertainment, Wine Bars

reviews.text:
OK... we ate so much food this time around....I got 4 different types of oysters on the half shell which were all very good. Then I got a mixed greens salad which was fresh but their dressing was heavy on the oil and light on flavor. For dinner I got the trout and my husband got the flat iron steak. Both were perfectly cooked and very flavorful. I could not get enough of the trout... my mouth is watering just thinking about it. For dessert I got the butterscotch creme brulee and, of course, delicious. 

We tried a few of their cocktails. The red light, the squeeze, huckleberry lemon drop and the rare wine co. new york, malmsey 16.
special reserve madeira, pt. All were great and well balanced. 

Don't forget! They have free valet!! Just don't forget to tip these guys as they work their butts off and are very tentative and nice! As is all the rest of the staff. 

See you soon Chandlers!!

Chandler's is absolutely devine. I've visited a lot of similar restaurants where I always felt some what judged that perhaps I wasn't part of the bourgeoisie enough to belong, but that has never been the case at Chandler's.
The food is exceptional as is the service. Please visit if you want a phenomenal meal.
Super tasty. Best wait staff in town. Love this place, especially Bodie! I take my father here every year.

If you like the elegance and understatedness of a dimmer dining room, amazing food, great drinks and even some jazz this is your place... The servers are cool the ambience is amazing it's gonna cost you a couple bucks but it's worth it with Foie, escargot and some of the cooler rare dishes... Great vibe great food will be going back frequently

I waited a couple of years to finally get a reservation here we live out of state and I would wait to late to book a reservation. Well this year I planned ahead before our Mother's 87th birthday. I am so glad we were finally able to celebrate her birthday here. The staff were all absolutely amazing everyone that we came in contact with from the time that we walked through the front door. The hostess walked us to our table and found out it was my moms 87th birthday and she was so sweet and squat down to her level at the table and spoke to her with so much kindness letting her know how it was so exciting it was her birthday and engaging with her. Then our waiter David went over and beyond with his service I preordered the chocolate soufflé and said we would probably order a additional dessert and he took it upon himself to place a second order of the soufflés which was perfect and appreciated.The portions were great and the food was absolutely amazing cooked to perfection We had the Argentina wine by the glass which was divine. They had a live band with a wonderful jazz singer that sang Happy Birthday to our moms she was so happy. We will make this our celebration spot for her birthday for the years to follow!

Dinner was fabulous, the steak was perfect, our waiter Bodie was absolutely fantastic, great Jazz band , overall great experience, and would definitely recommend this restaurant and would most definitely come again.
Great atmosphere.

First time dining at Chandlers and we were very impressed.  Perfect meal experience.  The food and service was outstanding and really couldn't have been much better.  I had the 'surf and turf' and the filet melted in your mouth and the 6oz lobster tail was three times more than the supposed 9oz lobster tail that I got from that place down under.  The portions are large in size and we ordered more than we could eat so keep that in mind.

This will be our place to go when in the mood for fine dining.

Undoubtedly the best restaurant in Boise. I had the wild rice and mushroom soup which was unbelievable, and then the New York strip with sautéed mushrooms. The steak was tender and juicy, and the mushrooms were savory, with a hint of salt - just delicious. They made me the perfect old-fashioned, although I probably should've ordered wine instead. The servers were fantastic the atmosphere is beautiful the people are friendly and I can't say enough about this place.

My boyfriend has been going to chandlers for years. It's his favorite restaurant in Boise, and I can see why. I went for the first time this last week and I loved it. I love restaurants that understand how important lighting is. Chandlers nails the dim lighting to create the perfect ambiance. The Christmas decor was also spot on and the perfect touch. We sat at a high top in the bar and thoroughly enjoyed the view and the wonderful entertainment. The jazz music made the night even more perfect. 
Our server was friendly and professional. My boyfriend had the trout and abalone. Both were excellent. My filet mignon and baked potato were the best I've had in years. Everything was so good from food to service to music, that we stayed for dessert. We had the lava cake and strawberry vodka sorbet. I'll be craving that sorbet until I visit Boise again. Thank you chandlers

Off the charts delicious!  Service here is top notch starting from checking in to being seated and table side. They had love music and the ambiance is perfect. All the food we ordered was absolutely delicious. We started with a martini and oysters on the half shelf. The limousine and the beat salads were delicious. The steaks were cooked to perfection and the sides were amazing, especially the Mac n cheese and the creamed spinach. We probably wouldn't get the Yukon rosemary potatoes again.

What a beautiful evening. Thank you Clayton for making my husband and my fifth anniversary so special. This was our first time visiting Chandlers and it did not disappoint. Clayton actually read the notes (made while making reservations) concerning our dietary needs and preferences. He was ready with suitable questions and recommendations. Everything was wonderful. We started out with the seasonal rustic mushroom, miso and black rice soup, a simple house green salad and our main course were  the gorgeous scallops. Divine.  I highly recommend the scallops and seasonal mushroom soup. The Zinfandel wine was a perfect pairing for our meal and coffee the perfect end. I love the attention to detail you find here. Clayton even asked if we were cold.... And he took care of that problem very nicely.  plus he took pictures of us for our memories. We hope to return soon.

This was a fantastic experience . We had the best service EVER and the food was delicious. 
The steak was the best steak I have ever had. 
100% 
Jordan and Nick for the win! 
We will be back

They could do better and have during our visits in the past. I don't like giving them three stars, but to be honest, that was the dining experience we had when we visited on September 22, 2021, sad to say.

We were greeted nicely and when we were asked about a wine to go with our oysters, clams, and escargot our server sent the Sommelier who was very helpful in our choosing a wine. The Alsatian Pinot Blanc went nicely with all three of these appetizers.

When we initially spoke with our server, David, we told him we'd like to begin with appetizers and might want to split a meal, but we were not sure about the meal part (halibut). We definitely wanted wine to compliment our selections.

Well my belief is a fantastic server will listen and make sure we are getting what we want. That is where the first review I wrote was a five star and this one is a three. We decided after enjoying the appetizers that we didn't want the halibut. But David told us it was already ordered and couldn't be changed. 

SIGH. We accepted his statement and waited another thirty minutes for the halibut to arrive. But here is the second miss of the night. The halibut was over cooked and thus dry. Chandlers was better than this. What happened?

We remarked to David about it's dryness, but let it go and ate it. We discussed later how much Chandlers had changed after Covid. Not that Covid was the reason.

Making this a Thanksgiving tradition. Several years on a row.  Met all expectations,  staff was stellar! Food was awesome.

However, we have made this a family outing and there is absolutely nothing to accommodate our young children onto menu.  This may alter our future reservations but I hope not.

The staff did try and accommodate  but ice cream and cheesecake is not an accommodating option .

Please make an effort to reach out to your future patrons so they make this their Boise tradition  and provide a children's option for dinner.

We went here for a family evening out. Service was outstanding.  We ordered veal, wagyu burger and halibut.  Our meals came with great caesar salad, salad wedge and lobster bisque.  Desserts of chocolate torte and cream brûlée.   All the flavors were just right. Waiter and staff was always there when we needed them but never in the way.  I have only one suggestion that could have been better.  I ordered the halibut, but I am allergic to potatoes, so I asked for a substitute.  When the meals came out the waiter noticed before even reaching our table the halibut had potatoes under it and promptly returned it to the kitchen.  He told me it would be out very shortly.  A few moments later my halibut was served to me by one of the cooks.  On my first bite I realized that the halibut had been placed over ice cold couscous.  Had it been placed over warm rice or couscous I think it would have been ten times better.  The cold just took away from the fish  Just a thought for next time.  Otherwise everything was absolutely wonderful.

We revisited Boise on September 22 due to a scheduled appointment. We had recently moved to Idaho Falls, but decided to revisit restaurants we had enjoyed in the past. We tended to come to Chandlers for special occasions and looked forward to this experience.

As always we told our server that we liked to dine, and space out the meal so that we could talk and share the special time. David agreed that would be fine, and engaged us in conversation about Idaho Falls, as he had lived near Driggs.

We ordered oysters, clams, and escargot and a nice bottle of wine recommended by the sommelier. We asked they be brought out separately and over time. We decided that was enough, maybe even for the entire meal, as we weren't that hungry; we just wanted to enjoy the ambience.

We had mentioned ordering the halibut, but realized we should wait to see how we felt after the appetizers. David pointed out that the halibut often sold out, and that if we wanted it, we should order it immediately.

We asked if it could be prepared under-cooked, as we tended toward sashimis and rare fish. He said sure, so we said ok to one order that we would split.

We enjoyed the oysters, and clams, and the wine, but by the time they brought out the escargot, we realized we really did not want the halibut.

We ordered a second bottle of wine, but asked that the halibut be released to another table, given it tended to sell out.

We had just started the escargot, but the response was, "I've already submitted the order. If you wish, I can bring it out in a box and you can take it with you."

That felt extremely uncomfortable, especially for a fine dining establishment. It would be close to 30 minutes before we would be ready to accept the entree. Certainly the halibut was still in it's natural form and could be given to another? Yet the server was adamant that we had made the order (at his urging) and that we couldn't rescind it now.

Also, he was aware that we were in a hotel and traveling and that a "take home" of the halibut would be a useless gesture.

So, we sighed, and said, ok, fine, but please don't have them cook it yet, as we need a little time to digest... thus it was at least 30 minutes before the halibut was served.

We enjoyed the escargot and held off on the wine so as to have some with the halibut. We were relieved we'd only ordered one to split.

When it did arrive, we were stunned. It was a nice presentation, but it was nigh on inedible for us. The asparagus was gigantic and woody, but the real problem was the fish itself. It was extremely overcooked, tough, and also lukewarm.

It had apparently been prepared long before, and had sat somewhere waiting to be presented to us. When we mentioned this, and reminding that it should be under-cooked for us, the response was that the chef works to prepare the dishes the way they should be enjoyed, implying that the dish was as it "should be".

We noted that we no longer had friendly banter, and that as we chewed the badly prepared dish, we also now had to pour our own wine.

The appetizers and wine were fantastic, but this incident ruined the evening that we had hoped would be memorable.

I reviewed Chandler's in 2019 about our 40th anniversary dinner with them. It was a wonderful evening, but I noted that I gave them only 4 stars because "There was just something a tiny bit missing to make the anniversary dinner perfect".

In hindsight, I now know what that was - the subtle attitude of the server and the restaurant that we were there for their benefit, not that they were there for ours, especially given we were paying over $200 for a dinner for two on every visit.

Very disappointing.

The food, service and ambiance were just amazing. They had live jazz music (Saturday night). We came in last minute, and while they didn't have dining room seating available they did have some tables in the bar, and we were able to snag one.

Our server Briana was kind, prompt, and checked in on us and made sure we felt looked after. We started with the escargot which came out bubbling, and was accompanied by fresh bread, butter and a mustard butter which was smooth, and had a tiny hit of acid to break up the oily nature of the escargot. Very yummy. We also got the seasonal fish dish which was Alaskan halibut with sautéed Spanish, mashed potatoes, asparagus, and a PERFECT beurre blanc. 

This whole experience made a difficult week just a little bit better and we're truly grateful. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone. 5 stars.

My favorite spot!  The best food!  Great ambiance, always consistent (food and service) and they have live lounge music Thursday - Saturday
Love that they have valet parking and it's never too long of a wait.

Came here by chance last Saturday with our besties. We started looking for a place to have dinner around 9 ish and found most places close at 10. Lucky for us Chandlers closes at 11 pm. 

Everything we had here was delishious. Special mention for the foie gras which was melt in your mouth. The a moelle which is a bone marrow flan, wild mushrooms and marrow demi-glace we got with our ribeye was ridiculously good. 

We sat in the bar area where we were able to order food off the regular and the bar menu which was fantastic. There was a jazzy lounge singer there that had an amazing voice.
