Our busser Rory was such a sweet guy with such good table manners we got him a dessert just to let him know he's doing a wonderful job. 

Overall food here did not disappoint.

As usual, another memorable and great experience at Chandler's on Saturday night on 4 September 2021. EVERYTHING was wonderful; the food, the service, the welcome, the cocktail, the dessert, the everything. If you've never been here before, do yourself a favor and experience dining nirvana in Boise, Idaho.

Amazing! I had an excellent dinner at Chandlers. I believe my servers name was Mark. He was very attentive, as was all of the staff. I tried the huckleberry lemon drop, which I thought was even better than their raspberry lemon drop. I had a couple of oysters, filet mignon, broccolini, and Pommes Frites (which were a little oily for my liking). Overall had an amazing experience and I would definitely return! Worth the $$$
This was a first time visit to Chandler's and they did not disappoint!  The service was absolutely first class and the food was fabulous! Best in class in a fabulous market of downtown Boise!

Server was fantastic and I guess this is really good for Idaho food. Idk I was trying to power blast through the State in 24 hours to say I've been there. Maine lobster was large and decent. Thi k it as 99 bucks for a 15 ounce. Wagyu A5 filet mignon was 5 ounce was 150. It was good enough, kobe and Miyazaki in Japan ruined wagyu for me. I guess I just put it on the pedestal now. Probably take the same cut and serve it to me in Japan on a street corner and I'd swear it'll taste better. Scallops were decent....and I had a bunch of potatoes. Must be an Idaho thing. Gave me more potatoes than I ordered. Overall it's a good steakhouse, really good if you take the town into context for the locals.
Very good food and quality service. What you'd expect at a good steak/seafood house.

In the category of steakhouses, this is the place I'd put up against any other in the world. There is attention to every detail from the music and lighting to every menu item. The wait staff is very professional. Presentation of the meal is excellent. You can't go wrong with the steaks. The oysters are superb. And yes, the vegetarians in your group will have options. The owners told me the visit fine restaurants when they're on vacation taking note of all best practices. Don't forget to try the exquisite gin/lavender cocktail called See the Woman. It's an invention of Boise favorite (now retired) bartender Pat Carden.  All in all, put this at the top of your list for finest dining.

business.name: The Capital Grille
business.categories: Restaurants, American (Traditional), Seafood, Bars, Food, Wine Bars, Steakhouses, American (New), Nightlife

reviews.text:
Great service. Mediocre food. 

I always heard great things about The Capital Grille and was super excited to try this place out finally. We stopped by after lunch hours hoping that the restaurant will be less packed, which was the case. When we walked in, it took us a while to be greeted and sat down, which is okay given that they looked little short staffed.  

After we were sat down, our server came rather quickly to greet us and took our drink order. The service was excellent and we had the similar experience with other reviewer. We were really hungry after running errands all day and so we ordered our food right away. 

The food came out hot and pretty quickly but our steak was overcooked and dry. It was so dry that we were dipping it in the steak sauce over and over again so we can chew it and swallow it. We were so hungry so we tried our best to finish the food but my mom was not able to finish her steak. Maybe the expectation we had for the food was too high but I expected my steak to taste better than TGI Fridays.

Definitely my favorite take out during Covid,hands down. Everything was great from the salad to dessert. Not all restaurants were good at this in the covid pandemic. They did an outstanding job!Really well done. Nothing cold or greasy. I think the price equals the quality of food and service. Highly recommend The Capital Grille. They will not disappoint.

We went for a birthday celebration.  The food was good.  We had a seafood platter to start, calamari and salmon and the dry aged strip for the table for our group.  All the food I would rate 4/5.  The salmon had good flavor but I would have liked it a little less cooked.  I don't know if I would say overcooked but well done which is not how I would have liked my seafood. Same for the cocktail shrimp.  Steak was flavorful.  The service was 5/5.  Omar was awesome.  Very professional and nice and even brought us a free birthday dessert and developed a picture card for us to remember.  Thanks Omar!! You're the best! Great place to celebrate and being ample parking which makes it a good choice for a solid, stress free experience.
Had our annual Christmas lunch here with my husband. From the moment you enter, atmosphere and staff are very welcoming. Excellent and friendly service, cocktails were perfect and meals delicious.

My mom took my sister and I here to celebrate our birthdays since I was visiting for the holiday. My sister ordered the sea bass and it came out over cooked. I ordered the recommended Kona steak for $54, also completely over cooked. I asked for medium. For a fancy steakhouse, they sure have no clue how to cook a steak or fish for that matter. I could've made a better meal at home for four people the price of that steak! Sadly, the best thing on the table was the free bread. Skip this joint unless you love overcooked and over priced food! What a joke!

For starters, we had a reservation for 645p on Thanksgiving. Knowing it was a busy day we didn't want to be late. I checked in at the hostess at 640p and was told "we'll seat you in a just a minute". Many other parties began to arrive as we waited. (It was my husband and I, celebrating our anniversary but we didn't add that to our reservation) At 7p my husband approached the hostess and asked how much longer, "we'll be seating you in just a moment". Subsequently, not 1, not 2, but 4 parties were seated that came in AFTER us. These ranges from larger parties to some that were the same size. When the 5th party was seated, I approached the counter AGAIN. I was told "we'll be seating you in just a moment". I proceeded to stand at the hostess desk just so they didn't forget again. We were then walked to our table at 706p...only to see the table was not set up, cleaned, or ready! We were then placed at the default table in the middle of the dining room and traffic. 
The service was great and our waitress Kali made up for the piss poor hostess'. The food was so so. Thankfully there were salt shakers available. Needless to say, with so many higher end steakhouses in the area, unless you're dining for a corporate event, feel free to pass on this one.

Awesome time while in Philly with my girlfriend. Good is good, service is first class. The only concern I had was that some of our sides were slightly burned on the outside. But all in all was good evening.

We made last minute reservations to this location to celebrate my birthday because inside of Philadelphia was way too busy. I had such a great experience at this location. The staff was extremely friendly. The food was great. The service was great. My bf and I truly enjoyed ourselves.

We went for our anniversary dinner. Everything was delicious, and the service was good. We purposely made a reservation for earlier in the day, so it wasn't too crowded or busy. We ordered the calamari appetizer, 2 ribeye steak entrees, au gratin potatoes, and brussel sprouts. Everything was delicious. We were also given a complimentary chocolate desert to share, which was nice. It's a good place to go for a nice dinner, and we would return.

Experienced a terrific dinner at the King of Prussia Capital Grille on September 17, 2021. The service there was phenomenal from beginning to end. Had the pleasure of being served by a wonderful waiter named "Matt" who made the dinner evening truly spectacular! I definitely will go back soon to dine again because the experience was surely perfect. Major kudos & compliments to the chef‍/‍.

A SPECIAL EVENT to celebrate? This must be the place! A few days ago, my wife and I had an anniversary dinner here in their King of Prussia location. The free-standing building is conveniently located on Mall Boulevard, a short distance from the massive, busy mall. Far enough out of the way to be able to avoid the Mall and traffic craziness, it has ample parking and accessibility. 
 We entered the building on a late, hot sunny day, and were startled by the dark, cool contrast in light and temperature as soon as we entered. Greeted by the hostess, we were wished a "Happy Anniversary" immediately, and soon seated in a cozy booth, topped with fresh white linen and bedecked with rose petals (yeah, for real) and glittery tiny hearts and confetti.  We looked at each other, and thought that, just maybe, I was too hasty in telling the reservation system that we were celebrating our anniversary.
 Every staff member who passed our table wished us a Happy Anniversary-- The busboy, Maître D', waiters & waitresses, food runners, and more. Never-the-less, the dinner was terrific. My Lillet on the rocks with a slice of orange was served perfectly, and generous. Our appetizer-- Lobster & Crab Cakes served with a corn garnish were overly hot and spicy, New Orleans style. Luckily, we like it hot, but these should have come with a warning-- or a fire extinguisher-- as to the volatility. My wife had a delicious 
22 ounce bone-In Ribeye Steak, and I had a Fillet Mignon, both perfectly done 
as ordered.
   À la carte sides are numerous and we chose Potatoes Au Gratin-- a nicely done casserole of creamy potato slices layered with cheese.
   A champagne toast followed with dark, rich flourless Chocolate Espresso Cake and freshly brewed coffee. 
   This memorable meal, prepared with perfection, served with cordial grace and elegance made for a truly special evening, throughout.

Late post: 
Mar 2021:
My husband & I celebrated our 10 yr anniversary here. Everything was great from the minute you walk in. When the hostess seated us, she handed us a card that wished us Happy Anniversary. So thoughtful! The servers introduced themselves and our waiter for the night was Scott. Scott was very attentive, kind & knowledgeable with the menu. 

Appetizers:
Oysters & Shrimp Cocktail:
Oysters were great not sandy at all.
Shrimp cocktail was very meaty & big. 

Entrees:
I got the Kona Rubbed NY Strip with South African Lobster Tail.

Omg this dish is sooo good. Steak was cooked perfectly and coffee rub complimented the steak very well. The lobster tail was freaking amazzzzzing! So tender, buttery and yummy!

My hubby had the lamb and he couldn't stop smiling from the first bite. It was cooked to perfection!

Our sides of mashed potatoes and lobster Mac & Cheese was very good. Loved the consistency of the mashed potatoes & we enjoyed the Mac & Cheese with the big chunks of lobster!

Overall it was a fabulous dinner. They ended our dinner with a complimentary dessert. I'm a sucker for dessert and a scoop of vanilla ice cream would've perfected it lol (yessss I'm greedy ). Oh and Scott also took our picture, printed it and placed it in a card to remember the night. 

It was one of the best dinners we've had in a really long time. I really appreciate my husband for taking me here. And you know what makes it great? Not only the food but the staff was awesome! Everyone was so friendly!! As we were walking out, we also noticed that every employee we passed would move to side so they can let us pass. I think this is the only restaurant where I've noticed that. We've been to so many others restaurants and paid double for the bill and the service wasn't as great as Capital Grille. 

Thank you Capital Grille for a wonderful & memorable dinner. We'll be back!
Food was delicious. Definitely recommend if you are in the mood for a delicious flavor ribeye .

I absolutely love it here! The food is amazing and such great service. They always make you feel welcome and help with recommendations but never feel pushy. The manager Chris is so friendly and wants to make sure your service and food is top notch highly recommended coming here and seeing Omar!!
Love the citrus glazed salmon. Everytime I order it it is excellent. Don't miss the Stoli Doli either.

My wife and I went here to celebrate our 30th anniversary.  It is really nice to be all vaccinated, and be able to go out without all of the pandemic hassle.  That being said, I try to stay low carb., and steak houses are great for that.  I had the porcini rubbed bone in rib eye cooked rare.  It was very good.  It was cooked perfect.  One of my frustrations with steak houses is that some of them are reluctant to really cook a steak rare.  The server warned me that it would really be cooked rare, and I let him know that was great because it was what I wanted.  

We also had the tomato with cheese salad which they split on 2 separate plates for us.  The portion was very plentiful so I do not know if they gave us more since they split it, but it did seem that way.

We also had the Brussels sprouts as a side which were great.  They were crisp and the bacon really added to the taste.  I know with Brussels sprouts some people love them and some people not so much.  Both my wife and I love them, and these were a great representative for Brussels sprouts if you do like them.

Finally, the service was fantastic.  many of the staff who walked by said Happy Anniversary.  The table was set up special as well with little glitter hearts.  The staff were very attentive without being intrusive.

The only negative we could really note is that the wine is very expensive, and not a good value at all but I suppose that is to be expected at this sort of higher end steak house.

The bottom line is Capital Grille is a great national chain steak house.  You know what you are going to get, and they deliver.  I recommend them strongly for special occasions.

We went to Capital Grille today for lunch. I had made a reservation and commented that it was our 27th anniversary after missing our 26 anniversary during pandemic. Capital Grille is a place we love to go because the food is so excellent. Well, they definitely blew it out of the park.  Our server Ryan tended to every detail with a smile, a laugh and complete awesome care. From the calamari app to the chocolate torte dessert, we felt loved and celebrated.  Best anniversary ever.  We are already very loyal customers of capital Grille and this just cemented that for a lifetime.
I love it every time I go here, I need to go more!  Fabulous food!  I've never had a bad meal here!

Came here after a longgggg day of fasting. I was really excited because I usually enjoy the Capital Grille & it was right next to King of Prussia Mall. The service was EXCELLENT in the beginning. We were given appetizers rapidly and our food came out rather quickly! We were thrilled until we barely received any service after our dinner came out. They seemed to forget all about us. No coffee no dessert no refills no plates removed. Not what I expected from a white table cloth restaurant or from this restaurant. The food was okay , a little bland but fresh. Overall I have been to much better Capital Grille locations. Hopefully this was just a one off experience. I would not get the sea bass again, it kind of tasted undercooked, my husband did like the lamb and truffle fries. The crab cocktail had a lot of fresh lump crab meat, that I enjoyed, and the spinach was just meh

An okay experience for our first time visit.

The Wood and paintings give you the impression of an old school steakhouse, where the fashionably dressed used to wave their cigars and cigarettes about as they dined at their white cloth covered tables. 

Service was okay. Our waiter was pleasant enough, but never introduced himself. No crumbing in between courses. We went at 1pm, but didn't receive a lunch menu...It was the expectation not aligning with the experience, for me.

The steaks were very good. Quality, cooked as requested, and seasoned well. The salmon dish was excellent! Very nicely cooked and very flavorful. The complimentary bread basket with salted butter was also enjoyable.The apps and sides though, all suffered from a bit too much salt. 

All in all, our experience was about 3.5.

We planned an impromptu lunch to take advantage of King of Prussia  Restaurant Week.  We made reservations easily.   Arrived on time and was seated immediately.  Tables are considerably spaced but they are seating every table. 

We enjoyed the prix fixed meal.   I started with field salad with parmesan vinaigrette; it was sparingly dressed but very tasty once I received extra vinaigrette.   Then I had the burger and truffle frites.   The truffle frites were by far the best part of the meal! A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! My husband had three clam chowder which was very good. His burger came a little overcooked but the situation was rectified quickly. 

We were so full we asked for desert to be packaged to go. We had creme brulee,  flourless chocolate cake and cheesecake.   All were fabulous but my favorite was the cheesecake.  It came with a delicious raspberry sauce. 

Service was polite and attentive.  We would definitely come back.

Dined for KOP restaurant week to benefit CHOP and the overall experience and taste of the food was just okay for a $300 dinner.  The wedge salad, lamb chops add-on and the warm bread basket was the highlight for me.  IMO, there wasn't a lot of love put in the food we received that night.  The 14 oz NY strip steak, mashed potatoes and spinach lacked seasoning and the steak was a bit tough and hard to get through. My grandson's kids filet was $17 and didn't come with any sides.  The overall taste of the main course wasn't worth the price point.  It didn't make me say OMG - this is so delicious - I want to come back and pay full price.  The manager removed the steaks after our feedback that night (stating that they were very busy for restaurant week) and I made a f/u call to the restaurant to try and understand what happened that night because I was thinking about giving them another try outside of restaurant week- and the manager told me that he already corrected the problem in "real time" that night.  Just because you remove food from the bill, doesn't mean that the customer satisfaction level and perception is fixed... My conclusion is to NOT expect any difference in the food, if I chose to dine there again.  It is what it is...
Great food with excellent service. We enjoyed our girls night out.  My lobster bisque and steak were fantastic. Will definitely be back soon.

4/17/21 well my last review said I wouldn't come back but my husband was celebrating his 20 year work anniversary and picked Capital Grille.  

This time was much better than before. Our server James was attentive and effervescent. He was excellent, and polite. At these prices everything has to be impeccable and impeccable it was!

We were seated in a semi private room. I was digging the privacy. There was another table of 6 in the same room but it was fine. 

Most got cocktails at my table except me- I had sparkling water. The cocktails were elegant and amazing, not just the price but the craftsmanship.

Appetizers -terrific! I highly recommend ordering the lobster and crab cakes the cream sauce that comes with them is amazing too. Chunky lobster and crabmeat. I highly recommend this as an add on to the dinner! We also got our standard calamari and the prosciutto wrapped mozzarella cheese. Oh. My. GOD! That was terrific. Most at my table started off with Lobster Bisque with sherry that they loved!  I declined because dessert is my thing.


I got the special-2 ten ounce lobster tails-succulent and delicious but I truly wished I would have ordered the filet Oscar with the mountain of crabmeat, asparagus, and hollandaise. That looked incredible and three at my table ordered it. We ordered up the creamed spinach, Sam's mashed potato's, asparagus w lemon, mushrooms, and the lobster Mac & cheese which was amazing. I enjoyed everything thoroughly as did everyone!!

We finished w desserts, creme brûlée, cheesecake, flourless chocolate cake and some cappuccino rounded it out nicely!

It's extremely expensive but this time they gave us the world!

It was a wonderful celebration. I would love to go again someday.

We celebrated a co-worker's 20 years of service at our company for lunch at Capital Grill in King of Prussia. The staff were very accomodating. The food was out of this world. Lobster bisque, shrimp cocktail, filet & lobster. Then to top it, they brought out a plate with two small dessert and a candle for the celebration, compliments of Capital Grill. The decor of the restaurant is gorgeous! Cannot wait to go back.

business.name: The Oceanaire Seafood Room
business.categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces, American (Traditional), Event Planning & Services

reviews.text: yum, yum, yum! What an amazing birthday dinner! Started with the most fantastic dirty martini, followed by absolutely luscious raw oysters, followed by seas bass, crab cakes and asparagus. Topped of with baked Alaska. This dinner was perfection!

If you love a great batch of oysters, this place is the spot! I absolutely love the hospitality of the staff, especially Ian who works the bar he ALWAYS exceeds expectations. I loved the New York strip I ordered, the steak is super tasty and moist! Everything is ala carte so I ordered a side of mash potatoes on the side which does very well with steak. Now for dessert, sticky toffee pudding has been my favorite dessert hands down, I highly HIGHLY recommend, but if you get it I recommend ordering it with a side of ice cream, I went to the Hell's Kitchen one time in las Vegas and they served ice cream on top of the sticky toffee pudding and let me tell you, it's a game changer, the warm texture with the cold texture together just goes so well together.

You can not go wrong coming here. We had a group of 6 that was going to eat here before a Colts game. We called a couple hours prior to the reservation to attempt to add on 2 more people and it was no big deal. They accommodated us and it was a fun dinner with a great atmosphere.

I ordered the cosmopolitan which was absolutely insane. One of the best cosmo's I've had. It even came with a sugared rim. Next, was shrimp cocktail. The shrimp was super fresh and gigantic. For my meal, I ordered a 10oz steak. Fries and mashed potatoes for sides. Everything was superb and worth the $. 

Nick was our waiter and he was so personable and was so attentive to our table. Ask for him if you go there!

Yum! But a $60 steak should come with a side of something! The lobster bisque is a little too sweet for my taste but still good. The halibut and crab risotto is delicious and OMG the blackberry cocktail was to die for! Nick was great and engaging but not annoying, and the cute little lady who kept our glasses full was like a ninja! We'd take a drink and look up and the glass was full again, no kidding overall great meal!

Came to Oceanaire to celebrate my husbands birthday. Made reservations on Open Table (love that app by the way). 

It is located in the heart of the city so parking can be a challenge but they do have Valet, this day it was $15 (on a Tuesday), not sure if it changes on the weekend or during events. 

When we walked in we were greeted by two lovely ladies and asked if we wanted to check our coat. I was surprised at how empty the place seems to be. Lots and lots of empty tables and nobody in the bar area. Perhaps it is because it's a Tuesday and things were just slow. Not sure.

Once seated at a very comfortable half moon booth our water server came right away, our main server came minutes later. Throughout our time there everyone was very attentive. 

We ordered Oysters which were amazing, I give them 10/10. They tasted very fresh and came with all the good garnishments. The remainder of the food was good, not mind blowing but good I would give it 7/10. 

They have a decent cocktail menu, but we ordered wine instead.

As we were finishing up I mentioned it was my husband's birthday in conversation and they brought him a nice birthday treat, it wasn't very good (a peppermint pie of some sort) but it was a very nice surprise. 

All in all, I think this is a solid place. We don't have a lot of seafood places downtown so it's refreshing to have a place to go other than a steak house!

I hate giving low ratings but I absolutely cannot think to give anything higher than a 1, buckle up because this is a long one.

Every year (for the past 20 years), the Saturday after Thanksgiving our large family gets together at St. Elmos in honor of their grandfather's birthday who recently passed away. This year we thought to change things up which involved calling every Steakhouse/Seafood place in downtown Indy. We were impressed by the organization, set menu and everything Oceanaire laid out for us, so we went with them. We had to prepay $89 pp one month before (25people x $89 $2,225). Oceanaire obviously knew we were coming and came up with a preset menu, so what could go wrong...right?

Our reservation was at 5:15 on a Saturday, we arrived about 10 mins early, they were still getting a few things ready - not a big deal at all, we will stay out of your way. There were MAYBE two other tables with guests there at this time.

We had three tables in their private room to preface. So we of course start by ordering drinks - great. Well two tables received their drinks 15- 20 mins in, ok fine, again no guests were there besides us really. The third table didn't receive their drinks until ONE HOUR IN. Again, pretty much just us there still at this point. We asked our waitress multiple times and she said they are coming. So yeah an hour for our first drinks meanwhile the other two tables have already finished their first drinks at this point and were getting appetizers.

So very poor service to start off. Then they take all of our orders - completely disregarded half of one of the tables. We had to flag down the waitress again and let her know she forgot about 6 of our orders.

Mind you we paid ahead of time and have a set menu, so there isn't really anything they shouldn't have been prepared for. Also we were down 4 people due to sickness so 21 total. Reservation started at 5:15, we did not get all of our entrees until about 8:15....THREE HOURS to eat!!! With a preselected menu.

Oh, salmon came our raw (see pic), several of the entrees were wrong. We didn't leave until about 9:30pm. Absolutely ridiculous. The waitress took about 30-45 minutes for our checks that we stated out how we would be doing them at the beginning to avoid confusion at the end. So on top of our prepaid amount we also were charged 18% gratuity on all of our drinks we ordered for the poor service. 

At one point I asked for a glass for wine (not for wine, a glass for wine since we had a bottle at the table) the waitress brought me my glass then wine and I told her I didn't order that and she took it back and still charged us.

We expressed our disappointment to the manager on duty and he said they would reach out Monday. Someone did reach out on Monday and had no idea what went on and said she would call back after she talked to the manager and never called back. So here we are, having to provide the feedback here.

As for the 4 that couldn't make it, they said they would make their entrees to go, please see pictures for a very sad $89 take out meal. One of the filets was raw, one was not filet it was like a skirt steak lol and they put my cheesecake in the same container so everything was coated in cheesecake and forgot our soups too.

So this restaurant, we easily dropped $4k+ that night and nothing to show for it. You just tainted a night that was extremely special to us and lost our busines completely.

Extremely disappointed in service, food quality and the lack of follow up.

Recommendation: do not come here for a large event.

AMAZING. This is one of the best seafood restaurants I have been too. It does come with a $$$ but it is so worth it for the experience and fine dining. If you are looking for a place to celebrate a graduation, birthday, or even just want a fancy date night this is the place. 

I went with a group of four to celebrate graduation and we shared many appetizers and loved our entrees!!

Came here for cocktails and a quick bite to eat before a pacers game. We started with the oysters Rockefeller which were delicious and quite large. Then we split the ahi tuna as we had a late lunch that day. Both were incredible. My boyfriend had an espresso martini and I had the Manhattan. The bartender made me his own make on a Manhattan and I'm glad he did because I liked it much better than theirs with peach in it. Great service and such a lovely place. Can't wait to go back.

The Oceanaire Seafood Room is a top of the line debonaire Seafood Restaurant in Downtown Indianapolis, Indiana. The Oceanaire Seafood Room was established in 1998 with a mission to provide guests with the Ultra-Fresh Seafood Experience, featuring seasonal and sustainable seafood that is flown in from all over the world fresh daily and featured in a chef-driven changing menu that makes seafood truly exceptional.

The Raw Bar custom platter is made to order with shrimp, lump crab, king crab legs, Australian lobster tail, Russian osetra gold caviar, chef select oysters & stone crab claws. Our Raw Bar platter selections included Alaskan King Crab legs, Australian Lobster tails, and chef select oysters. Everything was fresh and tasty. 9/10

The Shrimp cocktail appetizer came with 5 jumbo shrimp and cocktail sauce. 8/10 

The Shrimp & Grits came with just 4 jumbo shrimp, Grits, and cajun butter sauce. 7/10 

The Filet Mignon & Shrimp came with 3 jumbo shrimp, filet mignon, and 2 pieces of asparagus.  

The Seared Massachusetts Sea Scallops came with 4 large diver scallops, Squid Ink Linguini, Scallion Cream Sauce, Parmesan. The scallops tasted nice but the portion size of this dish including the pasta is small so while this is tasty, I can't recommend order this if you're super hungry. 8/10 

The Surf & Turf came with 10 oz center cut Filet Mignon & West Australian Lobster Tail. The steak was cooked medium rare, wll marinated, and not overcooked and the lobster paired nicely with the butter. 9/10 

The Chicken Fried Lobster with Grits came with fried Lobster, Grits, Truffled Honey, Cheesy Grits, and House Hot Sauce and the as absolutely delicious! This is a one of a king dish you won't see at many places but so good! 10/10

The Baked Alaska Dessert came on Fire and is quite the head turner when it's lit up. It's great for a photo opportunity but the fruity ice cream combined with the chocolate sponge cake was not my favorite combination and I can't find a full description of the contents of this dish anywhere to tell you what exactly is in it. 6/10 

If you're in the Downtown Indianapolis and looking for upscale exotic seafood flown in from the best spots around the world, I definitely recommend you visit Oceanaire Seafood Room!
It doesn't sound great but the chicken fried lobster is dynamite.  Several in our group had it and loved it.  In fact, one guy had it 2 nights in a row.  No one had a bad meal.  Service was great!

This had been on my list for a while but could never ignore my frugality to give it a try.... Until now!

Good ambiance and attentive staff. I always like trying something different so I went with the lobster fried rice Shanghai style. I was not disappointed. VERY tasty and filling. Rounded the meal off with some solid creme brule. Its not your everyday place but a go to option for date night

I'm struggling how to start this review, because I can't put it into words how thoroughly impressed I was with this place. I have been wanting to try this forever, and was surprised here on our anniversary.

First, they literally gave us a menu that said happy anniversary. Its something so small that made us feel so special. The menu has a pretty concise list of seafood... because its literally flown in daily. Its that fresh. I did have questions for our server because I haven't heard of several of them. I decided to order the monkfish.

But first for a drink, I ordered a spiced pear mule. If you like Moscow mules, with a hint of cinnamon and pear flavor, you will love this. They also use high quality vodka (i believe it was grey goose)

Our food then came. The monkfish came with oysters, potato wedges, and kale as well. This was by far the BEST seafood dish I have ever had. You could tell it was fresh. It had a sweet, yet savory flavor. The oysters were on point, and the tomato broth that is in the bowl had a great flavor that complimented the entire dish. Usually I always only eat half of my dish when I go out, but I couldn't stop eating lol. To the chefs, seriously you are amazing and the best in my book.

If you come in for anniversaries, you are served complimentary baked Alaska, which is basically a brownie with strawberry ice cream and whipped cream, then set on fire with 151. Once again, the flavor was amazing and we were super impressed with the presentation.

The service was also on point. Our waters were always full by the servers walking around with pitchers. Our main server Brian was also amazing. He described the food so well and was super friendly. He checked on us periodically, but not too much.

This place definitely is expensive, but for the quality, it is 100% worth it. I cannot wait to come back here, maybe for a birthday or holiday, and experience this fine dining again. I highly recommend trying it!!

So excited I finally got to try this place!!! My husband and I were came in to celebrate our 2nd wedding anniversary! The staff was extremely polite and incredibly attentive. We had a lot of questions since my husband is allergic to shellfish, and our waiter answered all of them with a smile. Overall top tier service! 

The food was pretty delish as well. My margarita was fantastic, very strong but still had a lot of flavor. The calamari was fried perfectly, they even included a tiny fried lemon which was a nice touch. The main courses were delicious as well... My lobster & grits was incredibly flavorful. The honey & hot sauce was a great balance between heat and sweet. Although the breading on the lobster was a little too salty for my taste. My husband's salmon was seasoned to perfection, light, and flakey! The sauce on the pasta was to die for. Absolutely amazing. 

We will definitely be returning even if it's just for happy hour drinks.

Been here a few times, the service is always great! Seafood and steaks were awesome. But the sides that we got look really flavorful, got the asparagus and cauliflower, but actually no flavor at all really bland. At the end of the dinner the waitress came up and said I see it's your birthday,  so would you like an Alaskan bake dessert. So we said yes, now that was horrible. Really thankful that was free!. The bill came to 564.00 for 3 people, that's alcohol drinks, Oysters,  appetizers and entrées. Will always come back because I absolutely love the service that we get.

Worth it! 
Great food and great vibes. 
We wanted to do something special for our anniversary and this place was worth it!

Came here for our anniversary and it was our first time. Would love to say this place was great but it was mediocre. Service was good, waiter was sweet. The food was ok, really nothing to rave about. But what really saved our night was the drinks! Now the drinks were bomb! Would come back just to have drinks but that's about it.

Beautiful classy restaurant! Primarily known for seafood that is flown in daily. I visited with a group during Devour week and what a great choice. The Devour menu didn't skimp on quality meal options either. 
1st course: New England Clam Chowder, Caesar Salad or Fried Calamari
2nd course: Faro Island Salmon, Chicken Fried Lobster, Filet Mignon or Ecuador Swordfish.
3rd course: Seasonal Sorbet, Cheesecake or Sticky Toffee Pudding.
Drink special: Strawberry Fields.
We were a group of 10 and our waiter was Brandon and he was awesome. He had to go over the menu several times as we had people ordering off the main menu as well. He kept the evening flowing very smoothly. We ordered quite a selection, most of it off the Devour menu and everything from the bread through to dessert was excellent! Several of us ordered the oysters and I can recommend the Plymouth Champagne oysters. There are many varieties to choose from. I had the calamari as my appetizer and  I loved it. Not overly fried and I love the tentacles so always happy to see those. I had the Swordfish with risotto, asparagus and mushrooms. Amazing! The Sticky toffee pudding  was similar to a bread pudding and very rich. The Strawberry Fields drink was a great match for this meal. 
Others ordered the Chicken Fried Lobster, Lobster Mac & Cheese, the 22oz. steak among others.
Lastly, there were a couple of orders of the Baked Alaska. Don't miss this!
Everyone was beyond happy with their choices.
Go! You wont be disappointed.

Decided to treat myself after my barber  couldn't stop talking about how good the chicken fried lobster was from here. 

I indulged in the devour for this visit so let's go by each course

First Course: calamari...let me be clear I do not typically do marinara but theirs was so tasty. It was fried well and the garlic aioli was flavorful. 

Second Course: Again, I'm typically not the biggest lobster fan (sue me) but this was Fire! Only con was too much of the honey. The grits were cooked to perfection. I went to school down south and sweet grits is just not my thing. 

Third Course: the sticky toffee pudding. YUM! You could tell it wasn't a packaged premise dessert and if it is they do it well. Only downfall is that if wasn't served with ice cream

The ambiance was great and the food was absolutely wonderful. However our server was unresponsive, was not very attentive, unfriendly and to my dismay really condescending. I unfortunately ordered a drink that I did not care for I apologetically asked for the drink to be taken back, the server then acted offended in me doing so. My significant other and I ordered oysters as an appetizer our server felt the need to explain in detail the price listed for the oysters only included one as if we were not knowledgeable of that fact. We continued to say thank you and remain polite throughout our visit however we were met with the continuous response of "uh huh, yep, and mmm hmm" all in which are inappropriate responses to guests. In our peripheral view we witnessed our server exhibiting the exact opposite behavior to the other guests. This was my significant other's birthday and unfortunately our server tainted what would have been a perfect dining experience due to his demeanor.

Haven't been here in a while. There were 4 of us and we had a great meal. Our server was delightful, very chatty and personable. The food was very good, but the prices, yikes. $50 for a dozen oysters? Chowder for 12? I really enjoyed it but it was way too pricey for anything more than a once every few year splurge. The downtown market seems to want to price itself out of existing.

Best tuna I've ever had, remarkable service, and a great place to enjoy a retirement dinner. The macaroni and key lime pie were also very special highlights. Our waters were constantly topped off and all the staff was so friendly. Highly recommend!!!

What a great meal! 

The drinks were awesome- simple but great! Would recommend the Manhattan, blackberry smash and the patronarita! 

We also got the wedge and Cesar salads! Delish and fresh! 

For main courses - our group got the halibut cheeks, halibut and the chicken fried lobster.

Halibut Cheeks- so light and well cooked!
Wild Alaskan Halibut - well cooked, good amount! 
Chicken Fried Lobster- what a concept- not dry or rubbery! Plus the grits! The honey and the hot sauce was a perfect balance.

They said it is a la cart - so we ordered sides too but the mains did have a small amount of a side (like the grits mentioned above). We ordered the Brussels and the truffle whipped potatoes. Both were great- the potatoes had an amazing flavor and creamy consistency. 

A great place to treat yo self or celebrate!

Had a very special birthday dinner there on Saturday. Seated in a luxurious corner booth, custom menu and a professional server who knew the menu and the wine to pair. Just the right amount of checking in without being intrusive. The food was outstanding. We had some fresh raw oysters, crab, Chef Special meals and a complimentary dessert. From the moment we were greeted at the door to the moment we left, it was a perfect experience.

Very nice place, with great service! Too overpriced food though.. had the calamari appetizer and the lobster fried rice with water and my total was about $87.. would I go again? Maybe on really special occasions, because the food was good but it wasn't extremely good..

I just wanted to put in what I'm cautiously calling a "post-Covid" update!   Here's hoping we are moving toward "post"!    Please see my earlier review as well.   I had a great dinner out with some other fully vaccinated colleagues and we had an amazing meal.    They are of course still limiting capacity, staff are all wearing masks, and there is hand sanitizer readily available.   Like a lot of places, it seemed they were a little short staffed and were super apologetic throughout the evening, but we did not care a bit as we were just SO HAPPY to be able to safely eat out again.   I had the halibut with Swiss chard and prosciutto which was absolutely delicious.   We had hash browns and Brussels sprouts as shared sides which were both delicious.   For dessert, get the baked Alaska and thank me later!   We have had this twice and it is wonderful, plus it is flamed on the table so you also get some entertainment with your dessert!  The desserts are all huge and easily serve multiple people.   If you're downtown, and looking for a good place for a splurge dinner, this is a great option for top notch seafood! The quality is just as it was in the "before times".

business.name: Takamatsu
business.categories: Restaurants, Japanese, Korean, Sushi Bars, Vietnamese

reviews.text: This was my first time going here and I have to say the Sushi here is very delicious and full of flavor. Also the prices are very fair. I myself will be back very soon. Thank you for the lovely experience.

Yes the service is sometimes slow, yes its a bit dated, yes you will pay for what you get. But, this is place for Korean barbecue in Tucson. Fresh meats, a million different sides, good sake selection, just what I want.

Thanks to local Yelp Elite, Dahee's recommendation, we had a fabulous dinner.

Extensive menu options on yes, 7 menus: Korean including lesser known soups; 8 hot & spicy soft tofu Soon Doo Bu's; Cold Noodles, Sushi, Bento & course K-BBQ.

My Spicy Squid hot stone bowl $16.95 with crispy rice and veggies, Oh Jing Uh Dolsot Bop was such a treat, with just the usual chix, beef, or pork bibimbap on offer in every other restaurant, and it was spot on, tons of squid, lovely crispy bites of rice from the sides of the piping hot bowl, veggies carrots zucchini, bolstered by the fantastic au gratis banchan, small veggie & fishcake sides that accompany your Korean main. The napa kimchi was the best I've ever had, and have ate lots with Korean cooks in our family restaurant ;) Dolsot Bap was enough for 2.5 meals, hubby and I shared leftover the next day.

Hubby was very happy & full belly with his Happy Hr 50% off beers ($3 for drafts: Barrio Rojo local brew & $3.25 Sapporo) and discounted miso $1.65, sushi $3.25 (tuna, salmon, yellowtail was my fave, & Seattle roll $5.25.  His fave was the spicy jalapeno seared albacore $4.

Our server Linda was very experienced, previous manager, patient with us out of towners visiting for the first time, explaining the 7 menus to peruse, brought samples of local brews, checked in often and offered extra banchan, even tracking down the extra, nightly special side, tofu banchan when she realized it had not been included when the dishes were initially delivered to the table.

Notice on doors ask guests to please wear mask if unvaxxed, tables are spaced out on the far side and do fill up, as do the more crowded BBQ section.
With a large outside area, it would be Covid-friendly, preferred, & a great option to expand the dining room to the fresh air with natural rays, patio tables and umbrella like so many of their uptown compadres.  Cost & staffing always a concern but would definitely elevate this experience.  

Takamatsu got hubby's nod earning keeps on the dining list when in town and south asian food is his last ask  ;)

The food is pretty good and moderately price. when pulling into the parking lot it looks like a dump. Overgrown weeds and trash everywhere, transients sitting in the parking lot and if you go there early transients sleeping under the porch. The owner dleant seem to want to clean up the parking lot. It is a big turn off and looks like a homeless camp half of the time. Peter should get his act togethet

I used to love going to this place great food , but for some reason they took off the all you can eat sushi from the menu.  Now I feel like it's not worth the drive for me. I do hope they bring the AYCE back

The food is incredible but the service is so bad I give 1 star. The restaurant could be empty and have 5 wait staff and still take 30 min to take your drink order. Most the staff are rude and 2 happy rolls took 75 min. Fire your waitresses and get faster staff.

The website and sign outside show all you can eat sushi. This is not the case. They haven't had that for about a year. The staff does not have name tags or uniform to wear so they look like customers themselves. We went there and left along with others that wanted the all you can eat shush.  Don't go there because of false advertisement and staff is a bit rude
Very frustrated! It is 2:45 pm and Google maps says dining room is open but it really isn't until 4:00pm. Way to go Takamatsu!

We perchance the all you can eat sushi and they wanted to charge us an extra 17.. because we left 2-3 pieces of Shushi and they said we had to pay full price for each piece that we did not eat???. I know some people would be intimated and pay...not me. the service was slow and they need to be educated on the law and should not be able to  even suggest such a thing. 
SERVICE WAS TERRIABLE

I've been going back to this place despite their shortage of staff and crazy wait times for food this past year. I understand it's rough times during the pandemic, and the food was decent and their Korean menu is extensive to fill that craving where I don't feel like making it. The owner is always nice as well. But, today was the last straw. I order my food way ahead of time and my SO goes to pick it up. He still waited an hour in the parking lot for it. Okay, fine I guess cause their wait times have always been that long when dining in lately. Brings home the food, and oh the mess unfolds. The bibimbap is missing the rice and the sauce. I called the restaurant to see how they could remedy it, and the person that picked up wasn't even sure what went into the bibimbap. She transferred the phone to another girl, who then also wasn't sure if the dish had rice or sauce and asked if I should be having rice. In my head, I was like the Korean word for "rice" is LITERALLY in the dish name, and yes, comes with sauce. Just try to tell this Korean it doesn't. I didn't pay all this money to just have veggies and a fried egg. I just calmly said, yes...it should. She then was like whatever, you can come pick it up. At that point, I'm like y'know what, I'll just heat up my own damn rice and make my own damn sauce cause guess that really is what I gotta do from now on instead of ordering from this place. They also pre-mixed the bibim naengmyun, which they usually don't, and just created this hard ass blob that was miserable to eat (pic attached). Was like biting into a buckwheat mush dough. Even the sushi smelled a lil funky. This ain't worth $50.

Side note: I also dined in this past Sunday, and it took over an hour to bring out my sushi roll and two hours for the nigiri (two pieces of sushi). Didn't even bring out the soy sauce with it or my friend's dipping sauce for her tangsuyook. It's just ridiculous. Until this place gets their act together, I'm just gonna avoid it from now on. There's only so much try to "understand their situation" and then encounter such carefree attitude regarding their business like this.

Sadly, we went to the wrong place. We were supposed to go to another Korean restaurant near Takamatsu that was recommended to us, but we mistakenly went into Takamatsu instead. Takamatsu had the WORST Korean food I've ever tasted. Watery marinade and undermarinating the beef made the Bulgogi actually bland and flavorless except for the vague flavor of soy sauce and lots of sugar. There was no attempt to achieve balance between sweet and savory in their barbecue marinades as both the Bulgogi (beef) and Daeji-Bulgogi (spicy pork) were disgustingly sweet even though we grilled them at the table, which should have carmelized some of the sugar. The kimchi was one-dimensional, tasting mostly of salt and red pepper due to their skimping on the fresh garlic and fresh ginger. The kimchi was just raw tasting cabbage soaked in salt and red pepper, because it had not been allowed to sit long enough to actually ferment and develop flavor (in addition to the missing flavors of fresh garlic and fresh ginger). It was bizarre to get such badly done, tasteless, un-Korean dishes in a place where so many Koreans were working as managers & servers in the front of the house. 

Also, the table was clammy and sticky when we sat down, which means it was not cleaned very well and that's disturbing given the need for cleaning well for COVID-19 safety. (I do not recommend anyone go here during COVID-19!) They also took way too long to bring the check and the whole time the pile of our dishes sat in front of us. 

The meal was a total waste of money as we could have had a more authentic Korean meal from a grocery store frozen food section. It was an actually bad experience with bad, inauthentic food and bad service at a poorly cleaned table.
Udon was weird tasting nothing like it should be Korean bbq was flavorless and manager wasn't friendly at all.  Don't go here won't come back ever again.   No more u of a parties here.

I love this place.  Good sushi, great other menu choices, and the serving staff is very friendly. Server freaked out because thither server didn't bring rice with the meal and it was charming. Never a bad experience. Highly recommend. Enjoyable.
This place was so dirty !!!!! The food was terrible do not I repeat do not even try it the chairs were gross the walls looked black ! Terrible

When we first arrived they sat us in the dingy back, well to be clear the whole place is gross. They took about 10 years to bring just water and forever to bring our food, which tasted terrible. The appetizer was cold and didn't resemble a dumpling, more like a fish stick. The sushi was alright, but the udon soup tasted like sewage. The waitress was rude and acted like we were a big inconvenience, and would walk by on her phone. We also saw her sitting in the kitchen, and the sushi chef was coughing on the food. I highly recommend to stay away at all costs!!!
The service was terrible and waited a long time for sushi and soup. I was waiting 20 minutes just for water. Would not recommend. Poor management and poor service. I will not be back!

The food is great but their service is awful. You rarely see your server. Trying to get a refill or your check feels like an impossible task. The food is so good that I come anyway but I always leave frustrated. Please improve the customer service here.
Decent sushi. It's an average dining room that lacks any vibe at all. I used to go here years ago and it's definitely gone down hill from when it first opened.

The food and service here were not great. We came for Father's Day and ordered egg rolls as an appetizer. They brought us vegetable tempura instead. We told them about the mistake so they took the tempura back and said they'd correct it. Then ten minutes later they brought us the same plate of tempura so we had to tell them again that it was wrong. Then they brought us our main course and said the egg rolls would be out in 15 minutes so we asked to cancel the order. We didn't want an appetizer after our main dish. 

All of our main dishes consisted of over cooked meat and soggy rice. They weren't good. Our waitress also clearly became annoyed with us for asking for things like more water and telling her, very politely, that the wrong appetizer was brought out. Will not go back and would not recommend.

I came in tonight with my family and ordered kalbi. When raw beef was brought to the table, I told the waitress I was uncomfortable cooking the meat myself. She ignored me and refused to take back the meat. A second waitress showed up 20 minutes later and I asked where my cooked kalbi was and she said the other waitress never told the kitchen to make order for me. My family were finished with their meals by the time I finally got my order. Horrible service from the manager and two bitchy waitresses. He still charged my father for the late kalbi.
Saw recent advertisement for all you can eat sushi. Went to restaurant and found out they don't offer all you can eat sushi. False advertisement to lure people in.  Bait and switch.
Gave this place a chance twice, but They take over an hour to bring you your order. Place recently changed management and hasn't been great since...

This was my wife's first Time here. I have been before with our son. We were seated immediately for our lunch. We both ordered a beer to drink and we both ordered the beef bulgogi. I ordered mine spicy. The main dish comes with several sides including rice, potatoes, fish cakes, pickled ginger, kimchee, and a few others. You cook your own at your table which I fun and you can't say it wasn't cooked right. Service was great and they were always checking on us to see if we needed anything. I was surprised as my wife is not a fan of Asian food. But she liked this place and said she would like to go back. We had more food than we could eat and brought some home. Prices are reasonable for what you get. So, good food and great service. We will return.

Absolutely delicious, but these folks are swamped at dinner sometimes and seem a little disorganized under the pressure.
Just be prepared to be patient and to have a fantastic meal!

This used to be my go to for sushi. On Friday night my son and I attempted to have dinner here at 820.....they close at 900 dinner meaning a couple of orders of sashimi and a couple rolls. We don't linger and would have been done sitting at the sushi bar. When we arrived at the sushi bar and were shooed away by the sushi chef saying we have to be temperature checked....ok we went back to be temperate checked and the host said they were not taking anymore tables. What??? Are you open? Yes why are you not taking anymore tables there were probably 10 tables in the entire restaurant occupied. She asked the manager and he said no more tables and he was extremely rude about it. We won't be back! I won't make the mistake again. I will drive the extra 15 minutes to Ra and have sushi there at least I can count on them to be open, have delicious food and the management not shoo us away.

business.name: Chase Restaurant
business.categories: Event Planning & Services, Restaurants, Nightlife, Caterers, Italian, Bars

reviews.text:
This place is a favorite for my husband and I when we visit Santa Barbara! This place just reminds of of a home cooked meal at yours moms... or something like that! During the Christmas season I love their decor. It's just so lovely and feels like home. 

The food is good!

A great place to wine and dine and get some yummy Italian food... you won't be sorry! 

Their music is also just lovely.
Excellent food, ambiance, and service. Free bread was cold but the garlic bread we ordered was delicious
I just went here for a to go order and they gave me completely the wrong other. When I came back they gave me the right one but without any compensation. I don't recommend

I don't know why all the reviews are so bad! I definitely think you should give this place a shot! The vegan items on the written board PULLED us in! Surely, we were not disappointed! We both ordered the vegan chicken parm & a side of fettuccine. My fiancé said it was the best vegan chicken parm he's ever had! It's not usual to find CRISPY vegan chicken parm, but they did it! Moreover, the marinara sauce was perfect. Not salty & was delicious! The fettuccine on the side was also cooked nicely as well & the sauce on it was creamy & amazing! Even the patio decorated for the holidays made for a welcoming ambiance. The servers were attentive as well. I thoroughly enjoyed our meal here!

Once again our favorite restaurant excels in every way.  Jack and his staff are wonderful. Today, it was Erica who served us and she was delightful and such a happy spirit. She is a fine example of someone who enjoys her job and the people she works with. The food was impeccable; Shrimp Parmigiana for me and Salmon for my wife.  No restaurant can compete. We live in the SFV and make it a practice to visit SB just to make certain we have a great meal at the Chase.  There is nothing that is superior to fine Italian cuisine than this establishment. Their home made marinara sauce is as precious as the original recipe for Coca-Cola. We don't know exactly how they do it and it keeps bringing  us back.
Thank you Jack, Erica (who kindly posed for a holiday photograph with us) and The Chase.

Food is tasty and staff attentive. Inside they have a long bar with burgundy tufted curved booths. Outside is cheery with Xmas decorations. Portions are big! Lunch menu , prices are reasonable.

Traditional Italian cuisine. I've had their chicken piccata and another time, shrimp piccata. Both piccata dishes were delicious! My husband had their meat lasagna and another time the chicken Milanese. He enjoyed it! 

Their strawberry basil vodka is sweet, more like a dessert cocktail. 

Their tiramisu is delicious!

Outdoor seating is very nice and cozy!

Came here for our date night. Originally we were going to go to another restaurant, but they were closed so we walked around until we came up on this Restaurants menu, and I was drawn in by the tomahawk steaks. We decided to sit outside where they had heat lamps for those who get cold easily and oldies but goodies in the background. We ordered the fried calamari, fresh steamed clams, and Tomahawk steaks. The fried calamari had to slight fishiness to it, so we had to add the lemon ( reunion has better calamari if you like the body only), but their chipotle aioli was a good addition. The Chipotle aioli had a little bit of smoke and not too much heat. The steamed clams shocked us because we were expecting tiny ass clams but these were ginormous! The broth in the clams were very flavorful without being salty, and the garlic bread was a good addition, so we could dunk the bread in the broth after we were done with the delicious clams. When the entree came out, my Tomahawk Steak was cooked to perfection, rare like I like it. The potato was just a potato, and the veggies -nothing spectacular,but the real star was the tomahawk steak. Nice, tender and juicy. Will note our waiter provided exceptional service.  He would check up on us regularly, and he also gave my wife a wine enjoy with her steak because he thought it went really well with the steak, which he was spot on.

I've always wanted to try this place and finally got to for our date night. To be honest, the oldies music also drew me in this particular night. We sat outside near the beautiful patio area. I ordered a strawberry basil cocktail which was pretty strong. We ordered two appetizers, the fried calamari and the fresh steamed clams. For our entrees we both got the tomahawk steak, for my side I got spaghetti and marinara (unfortunately the photo I took came out super blurry and I made a rookie mistake of not taking multiple photos to choose from...ugh!). As far as appetizers go, the fried calamari was slight on the fishy side but the chipotle aioli was really good...it also came with the tentacles which most people don't like but it's my favorite part. The fresh steam clams was my favorite thing out of the whole dinner! When it first came out my jaws dropped because I could not believe how big these clams were(they seem to be quahog clams), the broth was perfect for me when it came to seasoning, it was not salty like most places tend to make it. I was also surprised by their garlic bread that came with the clams. The flavor was garlicky and not bitter, the bread was not too dry or overly toasted. Moving on to the tomahawk steak, it was cooked to perfection(I got mine medium rare), the seasoning was just salt and pepper(I have to give it to them for not overly making anything too salty). The side of spaghetti and marinara was also good too, normally I'm not the biggest fan of marinara sauce because it's usually too watery and bland but this one had actual depth, it felt like I was eating hearty bolognese sauce without the meat. The salad that came with it was a standard style dinner salad with your choice of dressing and I chose balsamic vinaigrette which I wasn't super fond of(too sweet for me taste buds).
By the way, the service was great and the waiter was amazing. So when they first brought out the steak the waiter also brought a glass of red wine to me and I was about to say we did not order a glass of wine but the waiter said this wine goes really well with the steak and that it was on him. So I tried the wine with the steak and he was spot-on!! 
It was a wonderful evening with great service and food! And awesome oldies music to groove along with while eating and drinking!

The hostess took my drink order, then forgot about it. 20 minutes later, I asked for my drink (notice I had to ask) and the order hadn't been put through. I ended up waiting 30 minutes for my drink. The waitress snapped at me and then apologized. (What!?) We had to ask for a bread basket. I had to get up to find the waitress so we could have the check. And, finally, the worst part: The bathroom was dirty. Is there any excuse for a dirty bathroom? No. Sorry, I'm a local but I will not be going back.

This place has a beautiful setting, good menu selection & ambience which tempted me to book this place for our thanksgiving dinner in Santa Barbara. We reserved the restaurant in advance but when we arrived we were told that half of the menu items weren't available to order!!! How do you take reservations & not have food to serve?! It was a 8pm reservation on Thanksgiving & we couldn't go anywhere else since most restaurants were closed or booked. Ended up eating there only. Couldn't pick anything that we liked. Ended up ordering what was available only. I asked the server in the beginning if I should order the Apple pie with the dinner as well in case they run out but she said it would be ok but guess what! when we finished our dinner that was gone too!! Pretty disappointing experience on our vacation. 
We were seated outdoors & told they don't have heaters for our table. Mind you this was a cold night & reservation was made for outside. 
Only positive thing was our server. She was warm, friendly & very quick. She kept saying, "thank you for putting up with us". Hope they do better job on their inventory & service!

Cons
- We waited for an hour for our food after ordering
- Appetizer was not ready by the time our entrees were over
- Pasta was cold, hot molten chocolate was not hot . 
- They said they'll get 4th glass of water and plates - both of which never came! 

Pros
- Chicken Primevara was amazing! Marinara sauce was delicious.
- Outdoor Seating was good

This is a very special restaurant. 

I've always viewed The Chase as an upscale, fun place to dine. The interior is dark and cozy with white Christmas lights adorning the walls and pillars. It gives off a romantic vibe and is the ideal spot to patronize after a stressful workday. 

The food and the service have always been great. Personally, I love their chicken picatta - but you won't go wrong with anything on the menu here. The restaurant is well-staffed and I've always felt that the service has been nothing short of stellar.

This place, like most others on lower State Street, offers a large parklet dining area which complements the interior well. It's got more of a casual vibe than the indoor dining. I love their front bar. The cocktails are top notch. I could go for one of their martinis right now. 

Santa Barbara is home to a multitude of upscale Italian restaurants. This spot, in my opinion, is one of the best!

Nice quiet spot in the heart of downtown Santa Barbara. They have tables all over the front of the restaurant, some right on State street creating a very unique experience. Their iconic Italian decor and friendly atmosphere, makes them a family favorite. I had their famous bacon cheeseburger. It was grilled to perfection; AMAZING!  Their tiramisu is really awesome as well. 

PLUS! Parking is super easy since the city parking lot is literally on their back entrance.

Save your money. 
I honestly wished I went to the grocery store and bought boxed pasta or a TV dinner from the frozen foods section. 
Bruh this was hometown buffet grade and how the hell does one mess up a salad? 
I'm looking forward to what I can eat tomorrow because this was bad and unfortunately this was my mother's birthday dinner. 
The bathroom also felt grimy as if a cockroach was ready to make an appearance. 
I don't like leaving reviews like this especially with the pandemic, but this was a meal that I felt could not get screwed up. Hoping they put more respect on the food they put out in the future.

I do not recommend this place, we ordered calamari for appetizer,  it's the most  disgusting calamari I've ever had, it's stale. The bruschetta bread was stale, pasta had no flavor, so plain. Broccoli tasted like it's been steamed a day before, the chair where my daughter was seated was wet. Sorry folks, I just can't recommend it, do not waste your money, go somewhere else.

came into chase on a saturday night at 5pm for some early dinner. i got the salmon provençal with asparagus and the brussels to start. the brussels sprouts were super super good and the salmon was insanely tasty. unfortunately the middle of the filet was quite raw so i had to send it back for a quick sear but other than that the experience was 5 stars. would definitely consider coming back here!

I hate to only give it a three stars because the waiter, Joey, was awesome and the food was really delicious. Decor is a bit tacky, so I was a little nervous.

While dining, two tables over the owner was on his cell speaker phone yelling and swearing at someone about a legal matter. Not cool. That really took away from the experience. If you go, try the homemade ravioli with pesto or the chicken piccata, just stay clear of the owner!

We try to come here when where ever we are visiting Santa Barbara which isn't very often unfortunately... Today I stopped in and Edgar took great care of me -enjoyed the shrimp Parmesan, delicious, with a salad and glass of wine and a beautiful outdoor patio... thank you for the great service and food!!
It's so nice especially during these tough times when service is in short supply to have such excellent attention paid to you... Thanks again Edgar!! Such a lovely afternoon!
Have you ever been to a restaurant were spaghetti and meatballs = spaghetti and one meatball! Ridiculous! Tasted like a cafeteria meal. Sad but true.

Horrible! Horrible! Horrible! Getting seated was the fastest thing they did. After waiting for our server for about 30 mins he finally took our order. I should've known something was wrong when he wasn't writing down the order just memorizing it. After 15 mins, he accidentally walked by our table and pretended to confirm our order but he really he forgot it. After an hour and a half of waiting and one beer later, no food! My wife and I decided to walk out, do not eat at this place. What sucked is we made a reservation and it was extremely cold that night.

Once again have to applaud chase. Nothing but incredible every time. The service is always very fast and friendly and personable making it feel like a very old school classic Italian dining experience. The food is always cooked to perfection. The atmosphere is amazing. For sure one of the best restaurants in SB.

I have to state I did not eat here and thankfully just by walking into this place I reassured myself I would never eat here. It smelled old and dirty inside. The corners, bars and lights were caked with dust and dirt from years of neglect. I only walked in to try and get a night cap drink. I baffled the bartender when I asked what type of Amaro's they had. He had no clue what I was asking for. I looked for myself and to my surprise I did not even see the basics like Aperol or Campari. What type of so called "Italian" restaurant doesn't even have Campari? After reading some of the other reviews and seeing how loud that they have to play music  outside in order to pull people in I have come to the conclusion that this is 10000% FAKE ITALIAN food place. Only meant for tourists who don't know any better.
Terrible hamburger.  Dry and flavorless.  Same goes for the salad.

Lame ass Restaurant 
Waiting for 30 for a salad and only realized it wasn't coming when my waitress was leaving and said the other girl was supposed to help you. It never got ordered. Lame service,over worked and under supported by absent managers. These guys used to be good. Crap now.

Updating my review from the last time I was here. I believe I had mentioned working here many years ago. I went tonight not expecting much and I had a waaay better experience. Food was amazing, service was not amazing in the sense that we waited a while for our waitress a few times but she was very nice. The new outdoor patio was completely gorgeous and to top it off the owner came to chat with me at the end of my meal. What a nice extra touch. I will be coming more often now.

business.name: Tree House Vegetarian Restaurant
business.categories: Vegan, Coffee & Tea, Breakfast & Brunch, Vegetarian, Restaurants, Food

reviews.text: So freaking good every single time. Made with love and care and high-quality ingredients. Give me their hash with egg over medium and an Italian greyhound cocktail and I'm happy as a clam. Top it off with the best cinnamon roll in town, and I swoon at my good fortune.
Very delicious ! The jackfruit and plantain appetizers were amazing! Waitress was nice and very informative.

Great vegetarian/vegan dinner restaurant for a date night! From a former meat eater and a Northeastern seafood lover, try the krab cakes - they will not disappoint! Everything we had was delicious and the service was great! Highly recommend. It would be dangerous if we lived close especially with their specials!

I revisit the treehouse yesterday and was very very disappointed. I had vegan crab cake and beet fries. The crab cake was horrible and the beet fries was just ok...I will give them another try later on maybe it was just an off day.

YUM! Whenever I'm in STL this is one of the places I always go to eat. I appreciate the diversity and creativity on the menu and have never been disappointed. During the pandemic, I've appreciated the patio seating and that all of the servers are mindful of masking.

Now THIS is a vegan restaurant! They serve both dinner and weekend brunch, both are obviously great... BUT! I prefer their brunch because of the Desayuno Latino, it's INSANE! Fried masa cake stuffed with legumes, topped with a red and green sauce, tofu eggs and potatoes. Unreal.
Our picky vegan ordered the burger and fries and enjoyed every bite! Glad for the great options and quick service!

Took the group to Tree House tonight and had a wonderful experience. The sweet corn hushpuppies were our favorite appetizers, and I was blown away by the mushroom stuffed ravioli with fried brussels sprouts - delicious! The staff was so friendly and attentive. We'll be back soon!
Our picky vegan ordered the burger and fries and enjoyed every bite! Glad for the great options and quick service!

We loved our experience at Tree House. Our waitress was incredibly sweet and accommodating throughout our meal. We ordered the maduros as an appetizer and the special fiery red curry and the mushroom ravioli. We loved the sweet maduros and the ravioli were to die for. The fiery red curry left something to be desired.. SPICE! Our waitress brought out some chili paste so I can add it to the mildly flavored curry. Other than the that the drinks, ambiance and remaining dishes were great. Would come again and try other dishes!

Not a vegan or vegetarian & very much enjoyed my time!

Atmosphere was great. I made a reservation early & got there right at 10. Staff was very friendly. Lighting was nice & it was warm (cold December day). Music was a vibe, s/o to whoever picked the playlist. Our server was very attentive (& stylish), as was everyone.

I had green tea, a cinnamon roll & breakfast potatoes. Delicious. Cinnamon roll was warm and gooey, very sweet. Potatoes crisp, lil salt & they had Louisiana hot sauce & Crystals hot sauce, extra stars.

My brunch date had biscuits and gravy with chorizo and cheddar. They are vegan and cleaned the plate, (also recommended the restaurant). 

We also ordered a mimosa kit (bottle of champagne and container of orange juice, serve yourself), & stayed a bit long, they were getting busy, but they had no issue!

I wasn't in food adventurous mood so I stuck with familiar flavors & they delivered. It's a yes.

(we also got a very nice hair comment on the way out, always appreciated)

Super tasty and unique takes on vegan/vegetarian cuisine. For an appetizer, try the Queso Fundido or the Brussel Sprout Salad. You can't go wrong with this menu, but my fav main dish is the Pasta Florentine.
The best vegetarian restaurant in town! Hard to find a dish that you don't like. Service is always great too. 10/10 recommend!

Tonight was my second visit to the Tree House and I was just as impressed as my first visit.  In the summer, I came in to check this place out with a vegan friend of mine and completely enjoyed their delicious food option.  

During my first visit, I had the cheeseburger, completely vegan and added some Tempe bacon.  I absolutely loved it! It was tasty and delicious and I could not believe the whole thing was vegan.

A couple of days ago, my husband had asked me about this place and I excitedly made reservations for our Friday night dinner. When we arrived, we were immediately greeted by a gracious host and seated at a table.  We started with some cocktails.  He had the mule and I ordered the hibiscus mojito.  We enjoyed our cocktails but I don't care too much for an abundance of sweet things so I switched to a glass of Cabernet for our meal.

We ordered some fried beets and jackfruit tinga sopes to start.  Both were delicious but the jackfruit tinga sopes were so different, yet very flavorful and tasty!  I kind of wished they had it as a main dish.  

For my main dish, I ordered the vegan meatloaf.  Very flavorful, very tasty, and came in very generous serving portion.  My husband had the jambalaya.  He said he was hoping for a spicier dish but otherwise, it tasted good.  We decided to get another round of drinks and shared the dark chocolate avocado mousse.  I loved the mousse.  My husband was indifferent but said the meringue was quite delicious.

Service was wonderful as usual.  The place was clean and accommodating and I'm very glad my husband agreed to try this place out with me.  I cannot wait to come back and order more of the jackfruit tinga sopes!

We went here for dinner, seated immediately and sat outside because the weather was beautiful. Our waitress was Susan and we LOVED her, super knowledgable about the menu and just generally delightful. We ordered crab rangoon, queso fundido, smoked gouda sourdough patty melt (vegan option), jambalaya, and finished with the caramel apple cheesecake. We literally dove into everything so the only thing I got a picture of was the dessert, lol. The crab rangoon was quote, "the best crab rangoon I've had in my life" per my seafood hating husband. The queso fundido was so good, I got the jambalaya and it was such a perfect winter comfort dish. It comes with celery which I hate but you could barely taste it and the dish was so good so that's saying something. My husband got the smoked gouda melt and loved the entire thing, then we shared dessert. All of it was so good, we ate at Lulu's the day before and it was awful so save yourself the trip and go to this wonderful little gem

Came here for breakfast/brunch! Walking up to the restaurant, the outdoor dining area is very nice. Cute string lights, little fence surrounding the patio, nice tables. The inside was a little less assuming - I'd like to see some bigger tables, more upscale decor, etc. but the chairs were very comfortable. 

Our server (and the other staff) was outstanding. Friendly, attentive, and overall warm demeanor. Super considerate of any food restrictions etc. Also provided us with great recommendations. A++

The food itself was good. I got got seitan sausage, which was good but a little chewier in texture than I expected. The brussels sprouts and sweet potatoes in my dish were also good, but could have used more seasoning. I tried my partner's dish and thought the same about it - could, but would benefit from stronger flavors. The biscuits were perfectly baked. We had the vegetarian cinnamon roll as well - it was more like cinnamon bread than "roll" but it was very good, super fluffy, and covered in delicious brown sugar based icing.

Nice place, good vegan food. Food has great quality ingredients and wonderful waitresses.  Long wait time however because it's soo popular and even longer wait time for food. Get  here early. Sometimes I think our food sits in the window too long and is not as hot as it should be. But we come because it's a nice vegan restaurant and nice ambiance. The drinks are nice too.

I absolutely LOVE this place! The blueberry pancakes are amazing!!! I'll say that I grew extra love for this place after seeing them feeding a guy who was less fortunate. I have mad respect for Tree House and will visit every time I come to STL.

Amazing experience at Tree House!  

100% try the Krab Rangoon, hands down the best part of our entire meal!  We also enjoyed the Hush Puppies as an appetizer.  For entrees we had the Patty Melt, Mushroom stuffed Ravioli, and Chorizo.  The chorizo and ravioli were a fan favorite! 

Our server was so kind and you could tell she really loved her job at Tree House!  We will definitely be back.

Be sure to make a reservation!
