Service was awesome and our server made great recommendations on what to order. The fried green tomatoes were hearty and we enjoyed the chicken sandwich and potatoes. It was a super cute patio to sit out on and people watch. Definitely recommend a stop in!!

Great service! Great food! But the best part is that everything is vegan but you can make it vegetarian (eggs or dairy cheese) 

The pancake breakfast is made with aquafaba whipped cream (uhm yum!) everything was great. The sausage was my least favorite but the tofu eggs and breakfast potatoes were bomb.

The cinnamon roll had a super thick icing which was delicious and was like brown sugar cream cheese flavor if that makes any sense.

The burger was good and everything tasted really fresh!

Excellent!  Creative and delicious food. Really cute vibe! They have outdoor seating on a corner with an open space designed interior. The servers are excellent at serving and bar tending. Great drinks too! Try the hibiscus mojito. I was there with a friend and she had krab rangoons and I had the krab cakes. They even warmed up well the next day. For dinner we both settled on the Milanes and definitely opt for the extra cheese between the polenta and the seitan. I would absolutely return and highly recommend. They are more nut based cheeses which is great for my soy intolerant tummy. Go go go!!
The food was amazing! I recommend reservations because it can be popular. Great place for brunch.
I'm not particularly a vegan or vegetarian but this restaurant is one of my favorites in STL. Deliscious dishes and great drinks. Fun for Sunday Funday brunch or a weekend dinnernight out.
My favorite place for vegan food in St. Louis. Get the fried beets and breakfast hash, you won't regret it!

business.name: Barcelona Wine Bar Passyunk
business.categories: Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants, Wine Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Spanish

reviews.text: Not too many Spanish Restaurants in Philly, but this one exceeds my expectations. Casual but a touch of finesse, drinks are crafted with so much details. The food is excellent as well. I will definitely recommend this place.

Great spot in Passyunk for tapas and wine. It was a great reputation in Philly since multiple people had recommended it to me when I asked for a good tapas spot. 

With tapas, it's best to go with a group so you can order a lot of different dishes. We ended up ordering the croquettes, the Brussels sprouts, the fried calamari, patatas bravas, and beef empanadas. I'd say my ranking for each is:
1. Croquettes
2. Brussel sprouts
3. Beef empanadas 
4. Patatas bravas
5. Fried calamari 

The server was so kind and attentive. He even helped recommend a good red wine that me and my friends all enjoyed! (He asked us some questions about our wine preferences before making a suggestion). I can't wait to go back.
Fun place. Originally discovered the place in D.C. and was thrilled when a location opened in Philly. Good Mediterranean menu of various small plates.  Bar service can be slow-ish at times.

Our server was so amazing. His hospitality was through the roof. The food was really nice and the restaurant itself was adorable and so modern. I would totally recommend it. Especially if you want are looking for a beautiful. The deserts like the flan were so good.

We had dinner here with a couple of friends from out of town. I have family from Spain, so I'm pretty picky and also quite familiar when it comes to tapas... I came here to say this place hits the spot.

It's hard to miss when you're driving down Passyunk... It looks a little commercial, even can be considered boastful if you want to personify a building. If it is boastful, it is rightfully so. Try the Patatas Bravas, trout a la plancha, and whipped ricotta. And for dessert - the Catalan Flan. I think about this once a week.

We had such a fantastic meal, the service was great, it felt pretty COVID safe and compliant, and the price is suitable for the quality of the food and the atmosphere. Except for one thing -- the music is just too loud. It's distracting, and honestly, it took away from the tasty food and overall experience.

I don't want to actually yell about how good the food is across the table, even if it is trendy to say you want to "scream it from the rooftops." I suppose if you're trying to not have a conversation with your party, then come here and just eat in silence, because you might lose your voice in competition with the rest of people yelling over the sound.

Next time, I think we'll try to eat outside, hopefully not under a speaker.

My second time to Barcelona- first was on a date second lead for a 14 person company holiday get together. both times food, service and atmosphere were perfect. Company holiday dinner half my party was very late but they sat us, took care of us and even sent free shots to the team who got there on time. Food is wonderful and I lived in Barcelona for two years- definitely would recommend! vegetarian option too!

Came here a couple of months ago and I can honestly say I enjoyed everything ordered. Food was delicious and I was very much pleased! The only thing lacking was the service. The male server with the long braids was extremely slow and lack luster. It felt like we were pulling teeth ordering food from him.. and forget about getting another round of drinks. Merely impossible. The restaurant wasn't busy at all and I was just a two top. I also noticed the table next to me becoming irritated because of the evident neglect. Some people just don't want to make money I guess! 

Food and atmosphere: 10/10
Service: eh.

Used to love this place, but it's changed in the last few years.   Food is great, but service has really been lacking the last few times I've been.  Being ignored while staff stand around isn't great business (they are not short staffed).  Last time there I had to seek out a hostess to help get another round of drinks.   This place is not cheap, so service should reflect that.

This place makes me feel like I'm NOT in Philadelphia. Great food, interesting menu, amazing staff and a fun/hip atmosphere. The menu is the real deal if you are looking to escape the hum-drum Italian restaurant scene of Philly.

The small plates are reasonably priced so you don't feel like you are gonna go broke if you try something new (hint...hint, Amanda) and the servers are really well-versed of what you are looking for in mood and flavor.

I've now been here 3x and had three different servers and each was super knowledgeable about the menu and wine pairing. BRAVO!

Perfect place for dinner on Passayunk! If you look for a sexy, dimmly lit restaurant with an extensive wine collection and tapas, this is it! 

I will say the taste of the food is a bit inconsistent. The first time we tried this place, the food blew our mind! The second time wasn't so good and the service was poor.

Calamari is the bomb!

I would deduct another star but it was a slight issue that affected my experience. I felt rushed after being seated. The waitress asked whether we wanted still or sparking, but I asked her for more time and to come back later, as we were waiting for another individual. She came back with still water and sparkling. To continue, this is the first time that I've received bread cut so lazily. We had to tear the bread apart amongst 4. Besides that, our server was generally cold. 

Onto the food, we ordered a variety. I think the best item was the warm complimentary bread. Majority of the tapas needed more salt, besides the empanadas. The calamari came mostly with batter than calamari. The mini steak tapas was bland and chewy. The grilled jalapeños were just okay. Finally, we had the seafood paella, which was fine. But we did find some grits in the clams... I think it would've been nice to have black pepper available at our table.
I'm not the biggest tapas fan but they are so delicious! Can't wait to go back. The fig appetizer is a must.

A strong presentation and good food. Pulling one star off because the food is GOOD (worth trying it out if you haven't been) but it wasn't "omg everyone needs to go here" good. 

They do have an excellent wine selection and knowledgeable staff which is awesome. Check it out and see what you think. A good place to have in the neighborhood for sure.

First time back since god knows when!  It's still good.  Had the potato tortilla , very good, followed by the spicy beef empanadas which I loved...and then the truffle bikini which essentially is triangle shaped ham and cheese grilled sandwich which was the clear winner of the night.  They've added some large plates to the menu which I would have gotten...the sea food paella looked great but the wife wanted to stick with small plates.  Next time hopefully!

Barcelona is a wonderful amazing place. It's a great go-to for tapas, and in my opinion the best people-watching in the city.

It's getting a little colder at the time of writing this review. But, sure enough, if you can get an outdoor table during these pandemic times, you're sure to enjoy yourself with a bevy of dogs and people walking by to entertain you. Inside the restaurant is very nice as well - the dimly lit area and nice tables sets a great ambiance for meeting with a friend, date night, or a treat-yourself day. 

The menu has a few items I love but generally, it seems to have rotating items which I try to sample every time I'm there, but I'm telling you right now: always get the bacon wrapped dates. That is a must.

I am not as well-versed in wine as I'd care to admit, but every time I go, I try something different and often ask for suggestions. Always, I am met with a great explanation and suggestions, and never once do I feel like I'm being talked down to for not knowing my wines. No wine snobbery at Barcelona, but they still have offerings that will make any wine snob happy! 

All in all, Barcelona is a nice change of pace if you're in the Passyunk area and are looking for a change of pace from beer.

Ordered 7 tapas. None were super great. 

- Patatas bravas 3/5 - tomato sauce on the bottom was a bit too sweet and the aioli was on the bland side interestingly 
-Mussels: 3/5. Not a fan of super tiny mussels and the bowl it was served in was too deep so we couldn't access the broth until the end. The mussels were dry without it but the broth was flavorful 
- Hanger steak with truffle: gross! Photos looked amazing but it was not good! The truffle sauce was nauseating we tried to scrape it off the meat 1/5
- Pork belly: 3/5 just okay 
- Ham croqueta: 4/5 tasty! But very rich  
- Boquerones: 3/5 my partner complained that they didn't taste very fresh but flavor was there 

Also got the olive oil cake which I didn't care for but my spouse loved. 

Overall, it was just an okay meal.  My husband and I love Spanish tapas but this restaurant didn't really do it for us, unfortunately.

Unbelievably bad paella.
Makes me really miss authentic Spanish food.
It seems well staffed though the paella took more than 30 mins. The staff were pleasant but the food was less than mediocre. Greasy rice, small portion of chicken and mushy chorizo. I actually didn't feel well an hour after eating it.
Find a nice hole in the wall Spanish restaurant or stick with the drinks.
I don't wish to badmouth anybody but 24 bucks should buy a person a decent entree.
I hope the review will cause the owners to spot check the kitchen.

Perhaps I just ordered wrong but the food was just kind of . . . mediocre? My server was adamant that we try the whipped cheese with honey which was alright but one-note, and the rest of our order with the exception of the gambas al ajillo was a bit bland. I would also recommend passing on the olive oil cake - definitely unpleasantly greasy.

This place is amazing! We came for brunch but didn't order anything from the brunch section (they have 4 extra tapas added). 

Came around 11:30am on a Saturday and there were barely anyone here but 1hr later this place was packed! 

The four of us shared Boquerones (fresh anchovies), chorizo with sweet & sour figs, beet salad, pork belly with cherry pepper, and the seafood paella. The waitress was amazing! We were definitely overwhelmed by the menu but she was so excited it was our first time and took the time to explain any questions we have. 

My favorite dish was the chorizo with sweet & sour fig and the beet salad! You can't go wrong with any of the tapas though, really depends on your preferences. I highly recommend coming with a group of 3+ to share everything. The one dish I didn't like was the seafood paella - it was not crispy at all at the bottom and you could taste the metallic taste from the pan. 

They even have a cheese menu! This place is amazing... can't wait to come back again. The waitress recommended coming back during dinner for a more romantic vibe.
Great spot! Definitely check it out if you haven't yet! Espresso martinis here are one of the best in the city

Great experience from making RSVP to taking and exit picture with the Executive Chef. Service was attentive yet not intrusive. Our server (Jared) was knowledgeable but not pushy. We planned to have a few appetizers and then a entree but the appetizers were so nicely portioned there was no need for the entree. The bread had a crusty crunch that was superb. See pics attached for selections we had and descriptions. Overall a pleasant experience that invites you back for more.

This is my 4th time at Barcelona and every time I leave loving it more. The servers are always so kind and helpful but not too overbearing. The tapas are soooo good and come out so quick and of course the drinks are great. The atmosphere and interior is what keeps me coming back the most, when I'm looking for a nice date night.

This place was poppin on a wed evening. Although, their parking space seating on passyunk wasn't happening. Maybe it's just a weekend thing. It took me like 2 years to realize this was sort of a chain; I've only been to Boston and here. Both were excellent! 

Our favorite tapas are always the gambas - can't go wrong there, and we really liked the boquerones too; they are deceivingly filling. Their bread is so good and doesn't fit in the little baskets they serve it in - maybe that's on purpose? They have a nice selection of G&T's all named something kinda dumb related to a tree like "leaf" and "root". 

Public health shoutout to the hostess who I overheard politely asked a lady to put her mask on like 2 seconds after she entered the restaurant. All staff are fully masked as well. Bring your parents here. It's safe, they have good food, and there are a lot of dogs to be seen walkin up passyunk if you're smart and eat outside!

this place is just...*chefs kiss*. the menu can be described on one word and it's delicious. every time i'm there the music is incredible, the wait staff is so awesome, and of the course the food is great. 
highly recommend the red wine sangria, which i never recommend bc sangria is usually heavy and sugary but this one here is just so good i'd take one to go. the green beans, beet salad, ham and cheese croquettes, hummus, the list goes on. just incredible. 
definitely the place to share a bunch of tapas with friends and look cute while doing it ya know? 
would love to see some edamame on the menu tho

Came here with a group of friends on a busy Saturday night and was seated promptly (we did have a reservation though!). Our food was pretty tasty - we ordered the pork belly, jamon & manchego croquette, broccoli raabe, and seafood paella. Only complaint was that the seafood paella took a long time to come out after our other dishes that it felt more like an afterthought. The drinks were definitely on point though and pretty reasonably priced for the city! We had a great experience here and will definitely be back in the future!

business.name: Su Xing House
business.categories: Kosher, Chinese, Restaurants, Vegetarian, Vegan

reviews.text:
everything just perfect 
no complaints

Vegetarian Chinese food restaurant located in Philly Penn Center. 

With all of the delicious gluttonous places to eat at all around Philly; it's nice to have a spot to go to that's just veggies! 

We ordered the chow mei fun noodles -Singapore style. Tasted pretty good! Reminded me of curried angel hair pasta with veggies. My daughter thought it was kinda dry. I thought it was flavorful. 4/5

I've been coming here for 10+ years and haven't grown tired of it! 

Some of my favorites are the eggplant with tofu in garlic sauce, sesame tofu, and the vegetable tofu and glass noodles hot pot. 

If you dine in, there's lovely ambiance AND you get complimentary hot tea! Everyone's always been very kind to me here and I don't foresee a time when I'll ever stop coming to eat here.

I did a Yelp delivery from Su Xing, my work colleagues had a variety of food limitations, that Su Xing was able to do what I asked in my order, a vegetarian fried rice. Delivery was done at a timely manner. Fried rice was quite oily, but my colleagues had no complaints.

Ordered from here for the first time tonight with high hopes and was very disappointed. General Tso's Tofu was overly salty and had not even a hint of general Tso's sauce. Sesame bun was tasteless and extremely dry. Veggie pan fried dumplings had an off putting taste as well.

I feel bad giving vegetarian and vegan places 3 stars as there aren't many and the standards are somewhat different. However, I'm just not impressed with this restaurant. For vegetarian, I want to just have a simple dish that highlight vegetables and not dishes that mimick or replace existing meat dishes. The restaurant as a whole is okay. I'm not excited about their food. I recommend going to Unit Su Vege instead. 

P.S. The best vegetarian food is at a South East Asian Temple. From my memory of Vietnam. It was very delicious.

We first went in not realizing this was a vegetarian chinese restaurant until we got here. It was my first time trying something that was imitation meat, but everything we ordered was DELICIOUS! I see why this place has such high reviews. I recommend this place to anyone wanting some chinese food that's light on the stomach. We also got their bubble tea & fruit smoothies and they were all amazing too.

I went to Su Xing House by accident (I had confused it with another place), but it turned out to be a great mistake---this is a wonderful spot in central Philadelphia.

For appetizers we got the steamed vegetable dumplings ($6.25) which were fresh and nicely done; they tasted home-made and not just reheated from frozen. The steamed vegetable bun ($5.75) was also great with a pillowy-soft rice/wheat shell and savory innards.

For mains, we loved the kale and dried tofu with spicy red pepper ($13.50), which is a colorful, light, fresh and addictive stir-fry.

The crispy tofu and dried bamboo shoot ($17) was deeply savory with a nice array of textures, from the crunchy bamboo to the crisp-then-soft tofu.

The service is friendly and attentive.

Pro-tip: skip the "popular dishes" like the General Tso's Seitan and Sesame Seitan. If you go with basic dishes like those, you will not be impressed; try something new. 

Su Xing offers variety and has unusual creativity with custom dishes you won't see elsewhere. The chef has a deft touch and great vision. I'll be back the next time I'm in Philadelphia.

I cannot say enough about how much I love Su Xing House! My favorites are the veggie fried rice, spring rolls, and soybean nuggets Szechuan style. I cannot get enough! We're there almost every week (more to-go orders during the pandemic).  My friends also love their General Tso's Seitan.  If it's your first time there, be sure to grab some seitan on a stick! It's all about the sauce!  I've been coming here for over 3 years and they've never let me down.  I bring my friends here (especially out-of-towners) whenever I can.  Most of the menu items are vegan except those marked on the menu as vegetarian (a fun reversal from what most places do).
I'm not vegetarian but their dishes so far are pretty tasty and well seasoned. They take credit card and the restaurant looks clean. I'd recommend the chow fun, and will be back to try more things.

So... we've been searching for a replacement for our beloved-yet-defunct New Harmony. Sadly, this is not that. 

The portions were large and there was a huge variety of vegan foods and several vegetarian options (though it is not super clear on the menu that everything is vegan unless notated). Everything is kosher. 

The appetizers were all fantastic. But the main meals just didn't quite dazzle. They were one-dimensional, uninspired, and sort of thrown on the plate -- like here's a protein, here's a vegetable. One dish tasted just like tofurky sausage. It was disappointing after the yummy first course options. The server was somewhat brusque but generally friendly. The bench seat kept being pushed from the person seated directly behind us which was super irritating throughout the meal. A few minutes after closing of bolt-tightening would do the trick. 

I hate to give a veg(itari)an place a bad rating, but they need to do a little better.

Long story short, vegan Chinese is where it's at. Every dish we got was delicious and, if we didn't know we were ordering vegan versions of the original dishes, we may never have known or cared, considering how amazingly it all worked. The plant based "duck" and "steak" were marvelous, with the latter making for perfect bao. The golden feather knishes were amazing, with the taro filling providing a sweet and savoury burst with each bite, even more enjoyable than the tasty sweet and sour sauce in which they were bathed. Vegetable Heaven also lived up to its name with perfectly cooked eggplant, dippable tofu, and some of the best fried string beans I can remember having. The fact that our hot black tea was being topped off regularly just added to the experience, not least of all considering how we had gotten caught in a downpour just before entering. All in all, a perfect meal and one I'd highly recommend to someone looking to explore vegan substitutes for their favourite dishes.

Very yummy food! Most dishes are Vegan, the ones that are Vegetarian and not Vegan are marked with a leaf in the menu. I tried the As-You-Wish with steamed peapod leaves, and Taro Croquettes with Sweat and Sour sauce. My friend has Potatoes Peas and Cauliflower in curry. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals. The service was attentive, informative, and friendly. Meals served with a nice Puh Erh tea, which is brewed from a fermented tea leaf.

I will definitely come back to sample some of the other dishes!

The most amazing vegan menu in the city! I was super impressed and wish that I lived closer to enjoy it more.

Even if you are not vegan I highly recommend checking this place out.

I had been ordering from another Chinese food place that boasted vegan options, but I felt it wasn't great and it seemed inconsistent. I figured I would give this place a shot even though it was a bit more expensive and it is literally 10x better. I didn't even really acknowledge how mediocre the other place was until I tried Su Xing. 
This is my favorite vegan Chinese I've ever had. I grew up a meat eater (like most vegans I'd assume) and I was always a typical general tsos, dumplings, spring rolls kind of girl. I tried all 3 of those things here and they were literally excellent. The general tsos seitan was so good. The dumplings were amazing, a lot of cabbage which gave them a great texture. The spring roll was, you know a spring roll, but delicious nonetheless. 10/10 recommend.

I really love this spot. Though it changed hands recently I don't think the food has changed. I am however a slave to my favorites though and they have not changed. The general tsoa's seitan is really delicious as well as the veggie lo mein, which I get with garlic sauce and of course some spring rolls and hot and sour soup. They currently don't have any seated dining available due to the pandemic but offer take out and delivery which we have gotten several times in the last few months. It is always consistent and speedy.
Our absolute favorite veg Chinese place. Can't go wrong! General's seitan, spicy green beans and chow fun are our go-tos.

Ordered delivery on a cold day a couple weeks ago. We got bean curd home style, sesame seitan, and vegetable noodles with sesame and garlic dressing. The sesame seitan was my favorite; it was definitely delish but unfortunately the order was very delayed and it ended up being cold and slightly tough on arrival. I feel like that dish would have been much better hot and fresh. The noodles were also very tasty (I guess I really like sesame), and the home style tofu was good but not especially memorable.
Unfortunately, mainly docked the stars for my delivery experience. But the food was good enough to try again! Maybe I'll pick up my order next time!

This was one of my go to spots for lunch on weekdays! You get SO much food for a very reasonable price! I'm not even vegetarian but would eat here often because the food was delicious and the price was just right. I'm tried numerous dishes here and can't wait to go back. Very fast service!!

Solid vegetarian American-Chinese food. I'm not a vegetarian, but I still found this place to be delicious. Ordered the sesame "chicken" and broccoli - was very tasty and didn't make me miss meat at all.
Literally the best. Always. Never too salty, always flavorful, my fave takeout ever. Loveeee su xing!!!

I love this place. A great place to go especially if you're vegan or vegetarian. I've celebrated a bday here because I really love it here and it was my favorite lunch place when I worked nearby in the past. 

4 stars instead of 5 because I was here with my disabled coworker, who lives in a row house in South Philly with many steep stairs. When he tried to climb the stairs (4-6 steps) because that's where the bathroom is, a staff member almost made him fall trying to hold onto him going up. It was insanely embarrassing for my friend not to mention dangerous because they almost made him fall. I know they were trying to be helpful and that it was in good faith, which is why I took the other good experiences into account but we haven't returned since.

Used to be our go-to place for Asian food, as it was strictly vegetarian. Tonight, however, no mask, no gloves makes it a place we won't get food from again. Too bad. If you require your customers to mask, you should as well.
Absolutely disrespectful person at front desk was very rude. Was waiting my order almost 50 minutes. Definitely not in future.
consistent. yummy. get that "chinese food fix". relatively clean. always friendly. lunch specials are nice.

business.name: Suraya
business.categories: Active Life, Beer Gardens, Grocery, Middle Eastern, Specialty Food, American (New), Parks, Cafes, Food, Nightlife, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea, Lebanese

reviews.text:
If we learned anything it was definitely give second chances (and totally dine in versus take out). 
We had the most wonderful date night here. Surprisingly busy on a Tuesday, busy overall great experience. Expect some heat in most dishes as is normal for Levantine region cuisine. 
Highly recommend-
Sumac spiced French fries (some of THE best fries in the city..yes I said that)
Arnabeet Mekle (crispy cauliflower with pickled vegetables..great balance)
Kastaleta (two large lamb chops with a good amount of vegetables)
Samke harra (grilled branzino in this amazing sauce, just wish there were more vegetables a part of this dish)

Can't wait to go back!

My wife and I went here for our anniversary. We got lucky because the weather was awful, so there were few tables available. We decided to sit at the chef's table, so we can enjoy watching the hustle and bustle of the kitchen. Inside was an intimate setting. I recommend get the spice fries and the lebna. They were a new flavor, style that i haven't had, and it was delicious. You can order whatever you want and it will be delicious. We decided to stick with the sides because we wanted to try all the different dips with the pita.

We went for the prefix brunch this morning for $37pp. The things that came with the brunch are a plate of dips to share and you each get an entree. Our total bill came to over $100 for 2 because we each got a pastry (thinking it was part of the prefixed brunch based on how the menu was set up) and a drink (which was clearly not included. The drinks and pastries were absolutely the best part of our meal which is ironic because they weren't included in the brunch. The cruller was my favorite thing we had along with the chai tea latte. This menu is definitely a very lunch heavy brunch menu there were 3 options that we considered to be breakfast foods (like with eggs). The dip plate was really good also and had decent size portions for two people. I had lamb kebabs for my entrée and they were delicious, even though I did order the beef kebabs lol. My boyfriend had the Ful Mudammas and really didn't like it. The service was OK the waitress was a little bit weird towards us throughout our meal. I would go back to get the pastries and tea and coffee but most likely won't be back for the prefixed brunch.

Suraya Weekend Brunch  
* must pay $37/pp for tasting menu

We made a reservation for 10am because we tried to avoid crowds esp on the weekend. Went in and there was about 2 other parties, which was perfect. 

The Tasting Menu:
Before the entrees, they will bring out as default the following 
-hummus 
-baba ganoush
-labneh
-muhammara
-taboulé

naan (flatbread) to go with it! i was so in love with almost all 5 and def got a little full from naan. Dont go too hard on the naan because you need to leave some room for your entree.

Entree:
-Shish Taouk (Chicken w/Yogurt)
-Kafta Kebab (Ground Beef Kebab) 

The kafta kebab has cumin seasoning but was hard to taste that due to the meaty taste.

On the other hand, the shish taouk was perfectly balanced 

P.S.
Their latte/ oat milk was really good

One word - INCREDIBLE
Highly recommend doing the Taste of Suraya menu. Well worth every dollar!

The place is very nice, I like the vibes.

Started with the baba ganoush, fattouch and arnabeet mekle.
Baba ganoush was good, the pita bread was the highlight lol
Fattouch was fine, enough acid to put the taste of some of the rich dishes.
My favorite was the arnabeet mekle, well seasoned and executed.

The kawarma was good, a little too rich. I wish i saved some of the fattouch to help cut the richness of it. It's a bit heavy, I suggest to pair it with the fattouch.

The prawns weren't mine but they were good, make sure you suck the head! thats were all the flavor is at, eat it with the rice. If you like lemon squeeze it all over the prawns and suck the head lol

Overall it was good, I can say I expected a lot more but it was a pleasant experience still
Service was good, and attentive. They were ready to answer any questions and make suggestions

Come try it for yourself, they're doing something right to have high reviews.

The mezcal cocktail was fire

The restaurant itself is very nice with dim lighting and nice decorations. The food was rather expensive so we were expecting amazing. Unfortunately, it more than fell short. My friend's brother and I ordered roasted lamb and they both were flavorless, dry, and tasted like charcoal! Seriously bad!  We never complained about the food because we were hungry and didn't have time to wait. My food was nothing to write home about and although our server was very nice and my eggplant old-fashioned was good too, not enough to warrant the food prices. Needless to say, I will not be returning and if anyone is willing to pay $35 for a burnt lamb please come to my house because I can make them the way they should be.

A great spot in Philly! Loved the food and ambiance of the restaurant. The service was great and we loved the open kitchen. Interesting to see the food being made. We ordered the tasting menu and everything was delicious. The lamb chops were the stand out item. I would definitely go back and try other menu items!

This place was on my list to try for the longest time, and it turned out to be well worth the hype! I had avoided going for dinner on a Friday or Saturday because you are required to get the $70/guest prix fixe option on those nights. I went on a Sunday night for the option of ordering everything a la carte, which worked well for me because the one vegetarian entree (grilled mushrooms) did not appeal to me. Instead, I ordered an extensive array of mezza plates which was 100% the right way to go. The bags of warm pita just kept appearing on our table and we just kept eating them. The most memorable dish was the fatteh, a warm plate of chickpeas, eggplant, crispy pita, tehina yogurt, toasted nuts, and fresh mint. WOW, it was delicious. All the different flavors and textures came together like a symphony in your mouth. The next best dish was the arnabeet mekle (perfectly seasoned crispy roasted cauliflower). We demolished that one. We also ordered the hummus and the baba ganoush that were both very good but did not exceed expectations. The turmeric rice was good although the portion was a little skimpy. My friends also spoke really highly of the yakneh (seafood stew) and the kafta kebab (ground beef). They also have a fun and interesting cocktail list! I started with "the throne of beauty" as recommended by our waiter, which was boozy and tasty, with mezcal and pineapple. The even more intriguing cocktail was "the poet" with gin, cucumber, aquafaba, and a sprinkling of za'atar. Overall, we had a really lovely time at Suraya. It's not somewhere you would go everyday because of the prices, but I think the quality is well worth the price. We ended up spending $70 per person (including tax and tip) for all the food we wanted (possibly too much? haha) plus one cocktail each. I'd especially love to return for brunch sometime so I can try the Lebanese chai that others on here have raved about.

By far the best restaurant experience i've ever had. The service was impeccable and the food was thoughtfully made and delivered. Shoutout to our server Richard, who took the time to get to know our table of 10 and really made us feel special. Every single dish delivered was  enthusiastically and thoughtfully explained and i truly have never had a better experience restaurant wise  in my life. Great vibes and great food. Would recommended over and over again. PS richard if you see this, the MD crew is shouting you out !!!!
My favorite restaurant! The food is incredible and the servers were helpful in describing the dishes. Would recommend to everyone!

Randomly found this place on a quick trip to phili reviews were good so decided to try it and they were nice enough to accommodate us last minute . 
The place has a great ambiance ,appetizers were quickly prepared and great,  got the babaghanosh and Kebbeh . 
The entrees took longer then expected about 45min to an hour they were great we got the lamb chops and the poissant dish forget the name . so overall great food but the serving time was a little longer then other restaurants, so I'd rate it 4 .

We went to this restaurant on a weekday evening and found great parking in the lot behind the restaurant (access through Front St). The ambience was nice and there was a decent crowd even on a Wednesday night. Plenty of staff service every guest's move, from seating to filling water to even folding napkins if someone leaves the table! We ordered a bunch of mezze for dinner and had great servers throughout. 

The food is delicious and was a nice treat for a special occasion. The wait staff was extremely attentive.

Wow! This place has great Mediterranean/middle eastern cuisine. I came here for a quick lunch and love that you can order your meal at the register then sit down at a table.  servers bring your food out whenever it is ready which makes it perfect for a casual lunch scene!

We had a weird mishap where one of our orders didn't come out to our table (it was somehow forgotten). We asked the server and showed our receipt and they made the delivery. Other than that would definitely come back again!

Suraya has been our favorite restaurant since they opened.   Last night we were so angry after spending over $300 for two.   Our waitress was non-existent and short when we needed anything, but was there quick as a flash to take our plates before we were finished eating. This happened for each of the 3 courses!  I actually had the fork to my mouth when she swiped my plate. I had to stop her with a mouth full of food!  Brought some desserts out that we didnt order as soon as our plate was swiped.  She never asked what we wanted or if we wanted coffee or tea with it.  It just arrived, and we had a hard time explaining that we werent given a chance to look at the dessert menus or order.  Then, someone brought my husbands wine which he had ordered with dinner after we were finished eating!   As for the food, my entree, slow cooked lamb, was cold when it arrived. But there was no one to tell, so Just ate it.  The first course apps were very good as usual, but the pita was cold and stale like cardboard. Those were our favorites in the past!  Not what we were used to at Suraya. The restaurant wasn't very busy and plenty of staff, so not a staffing issue that we might excuse because of covid.  We were so angry and disappointed after spending a fortune.  I don't usually post reviews, but this was so bad that I am making the effort.

The food here is incredible. I've been twice and it was very consistent. The tasting menu gives you so much food and at a reasonable price. Service is great. My only complaint is that the second time I went, we had to order everything on our phones rather than with a waiter or waitress which takes away the feel of normal dining. I'm not sure if that will be the new normal at Suraya, but it's definitely not a reason to take away a star.

The Bloody Mary 
And olive oil cake will
Bring me back - SO GOOD

*flavor explosions with all the foods, but those 2 are winners, baby

Are you kidding me!! This place is absolutely amazing. Top 5 restaurant in Philly right now. Went for brunch and will be returning for dinner soon. Could not get a seat in the garden area, but the inside is just as cool. Literally, can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The Mezze Plate is something that will take you right to your happy place. My latte had rose pedals on it that I swear cured my hangover. This place is magical!
We had such a great time here! We got the hummus, potatoes, peppers, lamb entree, chicken entree and more! Highly recommend checking out this spot!

Suraya has been my favorite brunch spot for years, but just a few updates since my last review.

Currently, for brunch they only offer the tasting menu at $37 pp (see photo). The portions also seemed to be slightly smaller (see photo in review). Previously, all the shared "on the table" items were served in individual bowls/plates. Now, they are all placed on one small plate. 

I can definitely recommend the branzino for brunch - both times I've gotten it have been perfectly cooked, and love the red pepper sauce that it is served with. 

I really hope one day they go back to the previous menu or add some of the previous dishes, I really miss the man'oushes. 

Overall still a great spot to go to, but the price/value has decreased ever so slightly in my book - which I understand may be related to covid/staffing and inflation

This was my first time here and I'm obsessed. I got full from the appetizers, which were big portions between 2 people, and the entree was the perfect amount (if you're not eating apps I'd get a side). The ambiance and service was fantastic. The hummus was so authentic too!
We came here for my birthday. Everything was amazing. Treat yourself to the Taste of Suraya and don't look back. Longer review to follow...

A great experience!   Very nice place. Tables spaced far enough that we didn't feel packed in. 

The service was impeccable. Polite, friendly and knowledgeable. Best service I've had in at least the last two years. 

Food, especially starters and dessert was great, as were drinks.  

And a real bonus: their own parking lot! A rarity in the city.

One of my favorite restaurants in Philly. The restaurant itself is gorgeous but the food is want keeps me coming back. The Taste of Suraya option is great if you have a big appetite and want to try most of the menu in one go. The baba ghanoush (eggplant dip), lebneh (yogurt dip), fattah (warm chickpeas) and Lebanese chai latte are excellent and are must get items. The samke harra (branzino) and abu sayf (halibut) are the best entrees in my opinion. I personally don't recommend the kawarma (slow roasted lamb) even though it's a popular dish here. It tasted simply like shredded lamb meat with some salt and the outer layer is seared to a crisp and was very dry and a bit tough. Anyway, always end the meal with the verrine for dessert here. It's  heavenly!

The mezze alone is something to write home about. It was by far the highlight of the meal. The inside of the restaurant is beautiful. My mother and I had the tasting menu and sat at the chef's counter. I think that since our first course was so incredible, the main course and dessert were good, but underwhelming compared to how good the mezze was. The kitchen was a little slow, however, they were very busy. The service otherwise was excellent, and one of the managers that recognized me from when I used to work there gave us some free sweets at the time end. Overall, the experience was excellent and is definitely one of my favorite places for middle eastern in the city. I will definitely come back.

business.name: Hotel Tango
business.categories: Nightlife, Bars, Distilleries, Cocktail Bars, Food, Beer, Wine & Spirits

reviews.text:
I happened upon Hotel tango when I was visiting the area before our family moved here after I followed a motorcycle rally for the Boone County humane society that ended there. I went in and was pleasantly surprised the drinks were out of this world and the food was phenomenal, something you would expect from a master chef
The only negative not allowing me to give them a five star rating is that they don't allow children as we went there one night and were refused service, with as many bar/restaurant you would think that they could have some setting set up for families. Maybe they just want to keep it a bar so unfortunate and disappointing as I was truly hoping to share this treasure with my family.
This is a really cool place! I always love when their Is an event here. The bar is spacious and the locally distilled spirits are always really great. Love then cocktail. You can't go wrong here!

We booked a flight tasting for a group of 5 for a small birthday gathering, led by Forrest.
Forrest was very knowledgeable about the Hotel Tango lineup, as well as non-HT varieties. Our overall experience was great - Forrest talked us through all of the spirits, what to "look for" as we tasted the lineup.
Spirit-wise: I recommend you try everything in the tasting. The stuff you typically don't drink may actually taste good. Case in point: their Limoncello/Orangecello. Typically I avoid them because they tend to be thick, syrupy sweet, and can be quite "boozy" - however, Hotel Tango's versions have a pleasant balance between fruit, spirit, and sweetness. So there's enough fruit essence, sweetness, and alcohol without any of the components being too offensive.
Food was awesome: charcuterie board & pizza were both phenomenal (kudos to the kitchen team)

We even got to see the staff's professionalism in action. One customer (not in our group) was intoxicated - and the bar staff let him know and proceed to stop serving him, per their policy. The more this particular customer tried to argue his case and air his grievances, the more Forrest and the team held their position. They were firm but respectful, while never losing their cool. Kudos to Forrest and the staff for handling this situation with class, and keeping their energy at a calm level, despite the overserved person.

Top notch experience in a top notch local establishment. Given the latest with COVID, the staff is very respectful and mindful of safety. The craft cocktail menu was phenomenal - if you don't see anything on the menu, talk with their creative mixologists. They'll come up with something!
Continued success to Hotel Tango in 2022. Cheers/Salud!

I absolutely love this place, but last night our server Ashley cut my friends and I off after two drinks... some of us only had one drink... when we asked her why she said "I just think you guys have had enough". We were playing cards at one of the tables so I can understand if maybe we were being a little loud, but if that's the case just say that... or a warning would have been nice. I'm a bartender myself, and we definitely were not drinking enough to the point where we needed to be cut off. Big mood killer, and I talked this place up so much I hope it doesn't deter my friends from going here again! Anyway, the drinks were still yummy as ever and before that experience the vibes were immaculate. Also got the bbq pork nachos, which were yummy but could have used more toppings throughout because once you got through the top layer it was only chips. Might just hold off on going here for a while after that experience.

I had the opportunity to visit Salute to Santa at the Foxhole at Hotel Tango. If Santa lived in Indiana this would be his house. I just absolutely love the decorations, the candy cane walkway, the fireplace, the trees, lights, all so beautiful.  If you are feeling Bah humbug, you won't be after leaving the Foxhole as it is sure to get you in the Christmas spirit. 

The drinks are fire. They have hot chocolate mixed with their house bourbon, a holiday old fashioned and other holiday inspired drinks. They also have also have snacks, empanadas and Reindeer tracks. All of which goes to benefit the Marine Corps Toys for Tots program.

While I really liked the vibe and enjoyed my nachos very much, I had no idea how pet friendly this establishment was. There was a dog just walking around with no leash on (I'm assuming it's the owners dog) and our server played with the dog a few times while serving us (unsanitary) another customers dog also jumped on me while I was leaving which turned me away from revisiting.
Delicious drinks, great service and a wonderful, cozy atmosphere!! Great place to sit and chat over some yummy cocktails. We will be back soon!!

Fun Atmosphere! Cool seating options around the massive fireplace and surrounding space. Beautiful bar! Awesome drink special supporting soldiers. We did charcuterie, excellent!!! The pizzas looked yummy, and the nachos were tempting! Fun merch too!

My friends and I are always trying to find new places downtown to get off campus and have some great drinks/food. We had heard amazing reviews of Hotel Tango and wanted to try it for ourselves. Overall, I would say that we loved everything about it! It is a little hard when you are on a college budget to go to places like this all the time, but special nights call for Hotel Tango!

The feeling of being inside the bar/restaurant itself is what made the experience so awesome. Theres a really great rustic and aesthetic vibe to the place that makes you feel like you aren't in a typical restaurant/bar. My friends and I were seated in a couch area that was great for hanging out and getting a few appetizers. 

I decided to have a mule after being overwhelmed by the many unique drink options. Honestly, it was one of the best Moscow Mules I have ever had! My friends loved their drinks as well, especially their drink called the Agitator. Our appetizers came out really fast and tasting amazing as expected. We went with the pulled pork tacos and a hummus platter that was easy to split amongst the 10 of us. 

We will definitely be going back to Hotel Tango to try some of the many other options that we did not get to on our first trip. Our server had many great recommendations, its hard to resist going back for more!

What is not to love about Hotel Tango?

Local. Fletcher Place. Parking lot. Beautiful Brick Exterior. Twinkle lights. Oh my.

Hotel Tango is a whole vibe and I am here for it. I hadn't been in a couple years and when I went recently, I was reminded why I enjoy it so much. Open seating, table tops, a fire place, cozy couches. Choose your own adventure.  It is the perfect date night spot. We got a seats at the bar top. Our bartender was fantastic -- friendly, fun, and he even made us not one but two surprise shots. Yes, really. What a gem! Cocktails are fresh, delicious, and made with love. They are also gorgeous. How is that even a thing? I also love that they support other local businesses like Beech and Penn and Broad Ripple Chip Company. Bravo! See what I did there? (if you know, you know). Definitely won't be years for my next visit.

Amazing drinks and adorable dogs, how can you go wrong. This place seemingly does not know how. We were at a place previously in the day that gave us horrible service. Our bartender was unknowing of this and went above and beyond in appetizers and drink/liquor knowledge. he was spot-on with what we would like and regularly made sure we were happy and doing ok. My only complaint is that a "caprese dip" should be melty and dippable. This "dip" is more of a salsa type accoutrement than a dip, however, the drinks are delicious an well balanced.

I've been meaning to check the place out! It's super cute inside and there was a lot of seating options. There are couches, high top tables, the bar, and regular tables to sit at. The interior was also nicely decorated with lots of natural light. 

I was honestly overwhelmed by the drink menu and asked the waiter what he recommended. He recommended the Lisa the Agitator, which was gin, saffron, smoked raspberry, and lemon. I really enjoyed my drink! It was pink and came with a pretty flower in it. 

Our waiter was attentive and not too hovering. I would definitely come back to try some of the other cocktails.

My Father is retired Air Force with 30 years of service that included a tour in Vietnam. I read about the folks that started Hotel Tango and their story and loved the military tie. My Dad loves a good vodka martini every blue moon so I ordered him a bottle of Hotel Tango Vodka via the website. My Dad lives in a condo with a concierge service that receives mail/packages (among other things). Last weekend, I asked my Dad if he had received the vodka I ordered and found out that he never had. I couldn't find the link to the company that shipped the vodka so I reached out to Hotel Tango's customer support. On Monday, I received a message from their customer support telling me that the company that shipped the vodka attempted to deliver it 3 times and I now had two options: pay $25 to reship the vodka or pay $20 to return the vodka (I paid $25 for the vodka and $15 for shipping initially - $40 total). I immediately responded to the message letting the customer service representative know that my Father's condo has a concierge that receives packages AND I had shipped many bottles of wine to my Father over the years without any issue. Additionally, I expressed that no one had ever called or messaged me to let me know of the issues the shipping company was having with delivery. Four days later and an additional email to customer services and I have not heard back. From a customer service perspective, this is incredibly frustrating. I feel like I have been completely ghosted and am being penalized because the shipping company that was used failed to deliver. Sharing this experience so that others can be aware when placing online orders.

I wish I lived closer to this location, because I would be here every day! I love the atmosphere and the staff. We stopped by here for a drink after having dinner at another location. We were greeted immediately to check IDs and let us know we can sit anywhere. We sat at the bar and were greeted by the bartender. He went over the menu with us and made great recommendations based on the flavors we liked. I love that their menu changes often, so you always have something new to try!

I had been wanting to try Hotel Tango, as I see their products in grocery stores. Finally I was able to stop in with a group of friends. The interior was not what I was expecting from the outside. It has a very rustic, lodge or cabin feel outside. There was a wide range of drinks on the menu and the server was able to make suggestions based on our preferences.

In all my travels across the country over the years, choosing a great bar is usually a part of the itinerary. During a recent visit to Indianapolis, Hotel Tango shined brightly as one of the best bars in the country. 

The beautiful brown brick exterior of the building is matched by the sophisticated yet simple interior of the bar room.

While conversing with the cool, friendly bartender, I inquired about whether she makes Kurt Vonnegut-inspired cocktails since Indianapolis was his hometown. We both laughed when she mentioned working at a Vonnegut-centric bar in the past.

Loved the cocktail the bartender recommended to me, which was made with aquafaba, had citrus notes and was served with a beautiful flower.

Hotel Tango is always great and that is coming from someone who typically does not order cocktails.  Their menu is seasonal, but I can always find something I will enjoy!  It is also a great space for events.  The space is truly unique, comfortable, and cool!  Parking is very easy with their lot and all the free street parking on Virginia Ave.  Keep an eye out for their cute bar cat lurking around the stairs to the office upstairs!

Great place to go on a date night or with friends. I had two fun based cocktails and not only were they visually beautiful but they were delicious as well. However, my favorite part of the night was the atmosphere! They had a great playlist of current hits, classic Britney, and even ABBA. Our server was also fantastic. Can't wait to return next time I'm in Indy!!

I'm a big fan of this place! It's a great and unique vibe, a great spot for a date night or evening with friends. I'm glad they have the Broad Ripple Chips, those are always a great snack while drinking. Last time, we had the charcuterie board and it was really fun and tasty.

Overall, I've always had a great experience. I hope that the free popcorn comes back after COVID! :-)

My favorite spot in Indy for drinks. Their cocktails are truly artisan and they have the best servers. Summertime is great when they have the doors open and the outdoor seating for all the doggos, and wintertime is so cozy in there with the fireplace and low lighting.
Lovely low-key atmosphere, space,  and great drinks. The cocktails were well-balanced. Adequate spacing indoors.

I'm glad they are in Fountain Square.  I'm glad they have some food offerings now. Service is friendly.  I wish they had more gluten free options for food. Also wish there were a few more regular vodka cocktails that are not so wild and fancy - the Vodka is gluten free so I can drink it! Just need more options as far as drinks go.

Hard to beat a cocktail from Hotel Tango! I bring any friends who visit me in Indy here first, and they always want to come back. The most current menu isn't as exciting to me as previous seasons, especially with a significant number of the drinks focusing on cucumber flavor for spring, but I've always found something I like there, and even a standard old fashioned with Hotel Tango's house made spirits is a solid option. I'll keep coming here again and again with friends.

We had so much here! It was my first time here as I'm just getting into bourbon and cocktails! I love that they serve food now too.  Great atmosphere with a lot of outside seating and very fun drink menu!

This place is so much fun!!!! The lounge is so cozy and inviting and the drinks are so fun and unique. I personally had the "auntie vackser", which I thought was hilarious. They fill up fast so get there early so you can claim your spot! They also thrift shirts and other clothes and put their logo on it that you can buy and it's all so trendy! Will be back to try their newest cocktails!

business.name: The Chef and I
business.categories: Tapas/Small Plates, Nightlife, Bars, Food Delivery Services, American (New), Southern, Restaurants, Tapas Bars, Food, Cooking Classes, Arts & Crafts, American (Traditional), Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Caterers, Shopping

reviews.text: It was really good. Dad said his shrimp was the best meal he had in years. Even was good for vegetarians, though I think you get the most out of the small plates.

Such a fun experience! Be sure to sit at the counter! You can watch the chefs. They are so friendly and will answer any questions. We did the 5-course dinner and was not disappointed. Just wish we'd had the time and the tummy space to do the 7 courses because I hated to miss out in the clams. Sophistication  with southern hospitality. Treat yourself!

Such an amazing experience!! One of the coolest in our time in town (and there were many)! 

Make sure to sit around the open kitchen. That makes it ten times cooler. The chance to get to see these true artist conduct a symphony of food as you order...can't be beat. An opportunity that won't be soon forgotten by us!! 

Sat for a late brunch. We got the last spots at the "stage". Ordered the sausage bene and the bisque. Both high 10s!! So good. Do it. 

Ordered a killer queen drink and a random next to me saw my love after the first drink and he ordered one. Tops!!

SUCH A GEM OF NASHVILLE! We were waiting for another restaurant and stumbled upon The Chef and I across the street. Came in for mimosas and appetizers to get us going. 

First can we just note that it is an open kitchen. The ambiance is amazing. Theres a super small bar as well.

I would definitely say this is a higher scaled American dining experience. The ambiance is relaxed but the menu is exquisite. Theres a lot of different items and ingredients offered that you do not see in many restaurants. 

Definitely worth the stop if traveling here. Plus take a picture with the guitars outside. Great lighting out there for the gram!

We enjoyed the 7 course chef tasting.  Completely blown away with each plate.  Delicious food!  Our server, Addison, went above and beyond to provide excellent service.  Extremely personable and knowledgeable.  The Chef and I is truly a "MUST" while in Nashville.

This place is fantastic!  The atmosphere and staff are welcoming and totally approachable.  We sat at the large bar that surrounds the exposed kitchen.  It was really fun to watch the food as it was prepared.  Most importantly, the food is delicious.  The dishes are unique without being crazy.  My husband and I did the 5 course tasting menu with wine pairings, and it was outstanding.  The combinations of flavors and textures made every dish a delight.  We had a hard time ranking which dish was best.  To top it all off, our server, Mike, was passionate and knowledgeable about every item on the menu.  This meal exceeded my expectations in every way.

Great food and overall experience at The Chef and I. Excellent food quality and prepared just right. Definitely recommend this restaurant if you're looking for something off the beaten path and unique.

This was a very nice experience. Although it is on the higher end $$$$$... the food was very good . Recommends are the lobster bisque, the brussels sprouts and the goat cheese with pesto and cauliflower on bruschetta bread.  We arrived later so the only things available were the small plates. Also Ivan was an amazing person to be serviced by !!  Xoxox

Outstanding!  Funky fun atmosphere with a very knowledgeable staff.  We shared the cauliflower small plate (AMAZING!), crispy duck with purple rice and the mahi-mahi with fingerlings and artichokes.  Everything was delicious.  Our server was Scotty and he was terrific!  If you get a chance, by all means try this place!

I'm so glad that my friend planned a reservation during my Nashville trip! The experience was definitely A+ all around, and I can't wait to return on my next trip to TN.

This review is only for brunch, which, I must say, was out of this world. But I'm super curious what their evening dining experience is like now that their brunch rocked my world!

The following is an overview of what our dining party ordered and some brief highlights. Each item was super tasty, and we would recommend any of these (although, as we understand it, the menu changes frequently).

Steak Bowl - This breakfast masterpiece included delicious fingerling potatoes topped with an Asian-inspired gravy (a curry coconut concoction) and tender slices of flank steak.

Patty Melt - A dish with local ground beef layered with chipotle aioli, balsamic onions, and smoked gouda cheese on toasted focaccia. This dish was served with a super tasty warm red potato salad that had yummy pieces of eggs and bacon mixed into it.

Pimento Cheese Appetizer - This appetizer dish featured yummy toasted bread slices smothered with yummy homemade Pimento Cheese.
Brussels Sprouts - This appetizer (or side) dish was composed of shaved Brussels that were toasted up just right with bacon, lemon, parmesan, apple cider glaze, and whipped goat cheese.

Wow! This place is A+ all around. I'm so glad that my friend planned a reservation to this place during my Nashville trip!shville trip!hville trip!ville trip!ille trip!lle trip!le trip!e trip! trip!trip!rip!ip!p!!are at long counters that align an open kitchen where kitchen staff are working together to prep the dishes. As they work, the chefs chat with customers.. and you can ask them questions about the process!  to

Service was great. The kitchen and waitress were all very attentive and nice. The food was mediocre... I don't understand the other reviews. Did we miss something or maybe we ordered the wrong things?

We both got cocktails and the 7 course meal. I can't remember each course but some things I noticed. Walu was buttery  (it's sushi grade fish. Slice and done. Can't mess it up unless kept at wrong temperature) but rice was undercooked and really cold - a lot of raw rice kernels. Rice needs to be at room temp and cooked all the way. The pork belly mole just didn't go together. The mole sauce overpowered the pork belly and the dish really needed more acidity. Risotto was cold and salty. Duck confit and short rib were just shredded meat on a plate with no texture - mushy. Elk was seared nicely on the outside but the mashed potato under it was cold. Mussels were clean and tender. Did I mention all the food was cold? They were cooking it right in front of us.. I don't understand how it was all cold.... The best part was the dessert which was some sort of cookie bar. I forgot what it was called. 

It definitely reminded us of catered wedding food where they are serving so many people, the food comes out either dry, bland, or cold. Nothing was amazing or stood out.  We ended up spending about $400 for two of us. I don't think we will go back.

Quite honestly, amazing! Coming back from Asheville, NC and we specifically stopped in Nashville to eat here! The food is exquisite! The staff is wonderful! If you are planning to stop in Nashville...you MUST eat here! If you're not planning on stopping in Nashville...you should just do you can eat here! This restaurant is easily in my top 3!!

Oh my goodness! As a visitor, we had a fantastic meal at The Chef and I. The layout has an open kitchen concept so I highly recommend you sit at the bar. (Not the "drinks" bar but the "kitchen view" bar- they have both.) Everything was incredibly delicious. My hubby had the 7 course chef selection with wine pairings and I had Thai Lobster Bisque and roasted cauliflower on toast points. I can't even begin to describe how much we loved this food. Staff was delightful. Food was delightful. Watching the chefs prep, bake, mix and stir was delightful. The whole experience was delightful. If I ever come back to Nashville, The Chef and I will be one of the reasons.

The food was something we don't make at home. I got the duck and waffles $30 which were good. It is pan seared with thin berry sauce....... 

My husband and I went here for our 3 year wedding anniversary. It wasn't acknowledged and I wrote on my reservation that is was a special occasion. Reading that this was owned by a loving married couple I guess I expected more. Maybe a plate with ice cream that says 3 years? At least? Their website is misleading, seems as if it's going to be some type of experience. Not really for me. I will go somewhere else next year.

My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this gem during a quick visit to Nashville years ago and the food was exceptional. We recently came back into town and made this our first stop. The food is just how we remember it... the quality is nothing short of amazing. Same goes with the service! We love sitting at the bar where we can interact with the chefs and watch our food get prepared. Cocktails are also incredible. HIGHLY recommend if you are in Nashville.. you will not be disappointed!

Save your money and do NOT eat at this place. I'm a simple guy and look or good food. This was not good. I could not finish my $42 steak, yes let me repeat that $42 steak. It was a horrible cut and had a horrible flavor. My partner got the pork tenderloin and it had so much sage it was inedible. I was so looking forward to this place but the food was not good. The staff were awesome, we left a great tip, but if you want tong onto a great restaurant in Nashville, do not come here.

EDITED TO ADD: See the attached screenshot of the review the owner left on my business when we've never done business before in a response to me sharing my experience and review of his restaurant. To personally attack my business because I had a bad experience with his-- is that a restaurant you want to go to and a person you want to support?

Not at all what I expected. I was horribly disappointed. Came here for a unique experience for my 40th birthday. Flew in from Florida.

The staff completely ignored us most of the time. The chefs were not interactive. We awkwardly sat in front of them while they scrambled around cooking, completely ignoring us. I expected something more like a hibachi type experience with interaction of any kind. They didn't acknowledge my birthday at all. Not even saying happy birthday let alone bringing a dessert etc. The food was okay but mostly disappointing. Couldn't eat my entree as it made me feel sick. 

Honestly after coming here I feel angry and sad for wasting a milestone birthday at this place with so many other great options in Nashville.

One of the best restaurants I have eaten at in a long time! It's a small quaint restaurant and the staff was extremely informative and friendly! We sat at the bar where they are preparing the food which was the best seat! The executive chef was so friendly and didn't seem to mind our questions! My husband snd I shared every dish and was stuffed by the time we left! The arugula salad was delicious although a little spicy for me but still delicious. My favorite was the roasted cauliflower. We s add lido had the lobster shrimp squash bisque which was my 2nd favorite. The salmon bellies were a great treat and then the catch of the day which was grouper was delicious! The wine, one I had not had and highly recommended by our server (imagery Cabernet)  was extremely tasty!  A great restaurant that  we will definitely go back to if we return to Nashville!

We had a group of eight and had a great time the drinks and food were fantastic. Very interesting restaurant. Lots of great memorabilia with records and other photos in the room. They even had Bob Ross painting a picture on video.

My boyfriend and I ate dinner here and had a wonderful time. We sat right by the kitchen so we got to talk with the cooks while they were working which was a great time. Our waitress was very helpful and friendly. The food was great. My pasta was a bit dry, but otherwise a delicious meal. Would definitely recommend.

Mike took care of us today and made us feel like family. We were celebrating saying YES to the Dress  where my daughter found her wedding dress.  We enjoyed the most wonderful food and fun atmosphere.  Truly grateful for finding this special place. Thanks again to all the staff.
The chef and I will hold a special place in my memory as this was the first time I had set for a seven course dinner with the wine pairing. Each dish was delicious  and beautifully plated!

We absolutely enjoyed our dinner here. I read reviews before I chose this place for my birthday celebration with the family. As we parked and walked into the restaurant it was nothing like what we expected. But we soon realized this is a very unique place (nothing fancy but high quality food and service) where we could watch our chefs cooking everything in front of us. 

We ordered the fish entree and caprese salad plus the waiter recommended seven course tasting menu.  Except for the salad (quite bland) everything was fantastic! I'm a foodie and a world traveler. Very few highly rated Tennessee restaurants satisfied my taste buds. This place is exceptional. They chose every food ingredient carefully. 

The presentation of each course was beautiful. Our server knew all the seasonings and ingredients that went into the food. The chefs were all super friendly.  Even the house cocktail wa s great. They didn't put in so much juice  that made it barely tasting like alcohol. I often felt cheated when so many restaurants do that. All in all it's a joyful experience of food, people and great conversations. 

Don't let the location and appearance of the restaurant discourage you. You won't be disappointed by the unique culinary experience. If you really want a fancy place then go to Jeff Ruby's. These are the only two restaurants that I highly recommend.

The food is great!  I enjoyed the duck and the brussel sprout and goat cheese appetizer.  However, the pans are not cleaned between use (no regards for food allergies), I never saw a cook wash their hands, and seating is very cramped.

I had the most amazing meal of my life here on Sunday. We made a reservation for 8:30pm with every intention of getting the 7 course tasting menu and was blown away by the selections. It was our first time and we were pleasantly surprised at the restaurants atmosphere. We were seated at the bar in front of the open kitchen! We were sat promptly, the tasting menu was well described by our waitress Autumn who was wonderful and attentive. The chefs provided delectable food and light banter and made the whole experience that much better. I will definitely be returning to experience more of the menu on my next trip to Nashville. Don't miss this wonderful place and give it a try. Don't let the prices scare you. Every penny spent was worth it. Thank you Chefs for the wonderful meal!

business.name: Carmo
business.categories: Asian Fusion, Vegetarian, Vegan, Seafood, Restaurants, Brazilian, Latin American, Caribbean

reviews.text: Great Place! Great vegan choices super cool space nice place to chill off our cruise ship before heading to the airport.

Great place!
Great vegan choices!
Super cool space
Nice place to chill off our cruise ship before heading to the airport
We have to keep ourselves from coming every week! The food is absolutely delicious and you can tell they use high quality ingredients. Great place for a vegan/omnivore mixed group.
This restaurant has very unique dishes, from countries all around the equator. Each was delicious and maintained their own authentic flavor.

Carmo had some delightful moments, and some less delightful ones. We arrived at this fun and funky looking restaurant and were seated promptly (with a reservation). Our server came over and was very sweet, but probably also very high, if the service was any indication. We couldn't decide what to get, so ordered the Brazilian cheese bread to begin - especially as she said it took about 15 minutes to prepare. We thought she'd eventually come back to take our order...which she did, when she brought the appetizer (15 min later!). 

After much indecision, we decided on Rico with pork and the fermented tea leaf salad. 5 minutes later, she came back to tell us the "crispies" on the tea leaf salad were out, so we couldn't get that. We chose the broken noodle salad instead. While waiting for our entrees, we drank our all water...then waited, and waited, and waited for our server to come by. When she brought our orders, we got water (yay!). We asked for serving spoons when she brought the entrees, and she said "sure" and then just walked away. Forever. 

The Rico was really good - a plantain covered in shredded pork and a mango vinaigrette. The salad on the side was soaked in delicious flavor, but the avocado on the top had seen (much) better days.

I also liked the broken noodle salad, although my dining companion thought it was only so-so. I can agree with her that there were just too many noodles for the rest of the stuff in the salad, but the tofu and the vegetables were just delicious. The portions were also huge, and we ended up taking a lot home - the Rico was excellent for leftovers.

So...food good, service not so much.
Very nice vegan options, jazz trio on Friday night was a nice surprise. Cocktails could be stronger.

The food was fresh, delicious, and colorful. We enjoyed the Veggie Rico, Fish Fritters, and Esmeralda salad. The meal was a refreshing break from the fried food we've been eating mostly. I'm giving only four stars, however, because the service was lack luster. Both the hostess and our server were aloof, not attentive and generally not excited or friendly at all (almost seemed annoyed). Maybe other servers are great, but our experience was not the best. Stop here for delicious and healthy food, and hopefully some better service than us!
This place is one of my neighborhood favorites. Love their fresh caipirinhas and sashimi dishes the most however their seafood soup is pretty awesome as well.

Such a gem! I can't speak highly enough fo this place. All of the food is amazing. I love the raw bar and am never disappointed. All of the cocktails are also winners. The staff is great. Atmosphere is lovely. Even the desserts are all made in house - fresh and delicious! Nothing else like it in the whole city. Great for private events too. The owners also give back to the community wherever they can and are all about authenticity. Definitely would recommend checking this place out if you haven't been.

This is a jewel of the warehouse district. With all the heavy, rich food everywhere else in Nola, it was great to find a place with light, Caribbean style food. The ceviche was amazing! They even have a large space for groups! Love the wall art, too. Great local place to eat and hang out.

Wow wow wow! This is my new favorite restaurant. The service and food was exceptional. Every single item I ordered was full of flavor and freshly prepared.

Starter: Sweet potato quinoa fritter. Seasoned perfectly even without the dipping sauce. A+

Entree: Curry (no meat or tofu). Very filling, I requested very spicy, and seasoned to perfection as well. A+

Dessert: sugar pie and lemon bar. The sugar pie was exceptional while the lemon bar was very good. I want an entire sugar to-go next time I visit.

I can't wait to go back!
Amazing find! Love everything about this place. Food, atmosphere, staff are wonderful.

What a stunner! We went with completely raw entrees - tea salad and two versions of ceviche -  which was satisfying and refreshing. We splurged with the cheese bread, too. Service was fun and timely. We didn't get drinks or dessert but the options were certainly tempting. I also feel that the prices are more than reasonable for the quality of the food. Memorable and highly recommended.

It had been a while since my last trip to Carmo and I was happy to find that the quality food and cocktails are still great.

I'm a sucker for good ceviche, and I was very happy with their Cuban ceviche. The fish was extremely fresh and the bread was nice and crunchy. We also got the Brazilian cheese bread as an appetizer which was good but I probably won't order again. For my main dish I went with my old faithful the Rico sandwich with pork. 

The only downside to this trip to Carmo was our waiter. He had a very condescending manner and haughtily corrected me when I pronounced the name of my drink incorrectly. I do not speak Spanish so I'm not surprised that I didn't pronounce it correctly, but I did not expect to be corrected in that manner and it kind of set the tone for my meal. He was pretty much absent for the rest of our meal with us having to rely on other waiters for water refills.

Been a good long while since I've been back here. Happy to say it was as good as I remember. 

Kicked off my chomping with a refreshing mojito. 

This place has probably some of the best ceviche in the city. This go round went with Cuban. The fish was fresh and melted in your mouth. 

For my main course did the curry of the day, which was a yellow Indian curry. It had a great spice level was flavorful, aromatic, and was very filling. Also got some Brazilian cheese bread. You can pull it apart and just see the gooey cheesy goodness. 

Really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. They use fresh seasonal ingredients in everything they makes.

Doesn't look like much when you walk by but we were just thinking of having drinks only.  We read over the menu and it was definitely an eclectic selection which was very intriguing. We watched food coming out and we were impressed. We sat at the bar, which I highly recommend. The bartender, Carmine, was awesome. Suggested several things on the menu and we decided to give it a try. The salads were not like anything I've had before. So many layers of flavor. We also got the Rico. Wow. Another amazing dish. They have a raw bar too which I want to try next time and the breads because those looked delicious. We just got too full. We will be back and found our new fave place to go to when we visit again. The service and food were great! Awesome experience.

My friends and I are visiting New Orleans for the first time. I am vegan and it was my turn to pick the place. I'd hoped for a different restaurant in the Garden District, but it was closed today for a special event. Sad to have missed the other spot,  BUT SO GLAD to have made it to Carmo. 

Dinner was amazing and service was on point. 

We ordered a variety of items, some vegan (Rico with red beans, Curry, Quinoa sweet potato fritters), some vegetarian (plain bread, creole bread, and tomato/cucumber/avocado salad), and some carnivore (ceviche, smoked fish fritters, and soup of the day - black bean with crema).  We also ordered one vegan dessert (chocolate cake with pecan and kahlua) and one no -vegan (chocolate mousse). The food was definitely on point. 

The only bummer was that the black bean soup wasn't quite hot (temperature) enough. My friend did ask the server if it could be warmed up some. She obliged, but it still could have used a little extra warming. 

Having said that, the overall was amazing!! Definitely recommend. If I were here longer, might even try to make it again. So very glad we found this place!!
