I ventured to this restaurant for the acaraje, which I was told they no longer serve. I ate something else, but it was unsatisfying. Without their stellar acaraje, this place is just average.

Over the top great food! My partner was needing gluten free because she has celiac. We usually can't eat many places out, or at least she usually has very few options in most places. This was like a banquet for her, and me! The creations and the quality of the food left us feeling so completely nourished. We loved it! Will come again and tell all our friends!
Such a great place! Loved how fresh and clean all the food is. The Peruvian ceviche is to die for and totally something everyone should try at least once! Love all the vegan options as well.

Had a great lunch experience here. Stopped in for a late lunch, had a few drinks and some great food. The trifongo was my fav! Being vegetarian it's rare I have so many options when perusing a menu in New Orleans and since so many items sounded interesting we ordered a few things for lunch and then even more to take home for dinner. Overall some things were a little hit or miss but I have to hand it to them for crankin out quality vegetarian options done in a creative fashion. The restaurant itself is funky and kewl. It has bohemian vibe with a lot of artwork around that is offered for sale although pricing wasn't listed and the server I asked didn't know any information on pricing.  Wether your vegan/vegetarian or not they offer a lot of choices for everyone.
Good was unique and delicious. Service was wonderful. Sat outside on a perfect fall night. An overall exceptional experience.

Wonderful place.  Tropical food is an unusual theme, and you wouldn't necessarily think it would work.  At Carmo, it does, because the dishes are *so* good.  We had Cuban ceviche and Peruvian Tiradito, like sashimi, this time of Sea Bream.  (We shared everything, which works really well there.)  Both were truly exquisite; gorgeous to look at, delicately flavored and spiced.  We had the seafood gumbo, which was fantastic; then the smoked tuna salad - a wonderful variation on what you're used to - and the Sri Lankan chicken curry, also delicious.  

Our server was very attentive, checked in regularly, which is great when you're sharing and aren't sure you've ordered enough.  There was nice quiet jazz, a piano/bass/drum trio.  Although the seating with good sight lines to the band is limited (so **you need to REQUEST this when you reserve if it's important**), all the seats in the main room can hear it well.  Plus, if you're further away you don't have to feel bad about talking while they're playing.  

So, it was just great, and you should go.
My husband and I enjoyed a great meal at Carmo. We loved the eclectic menu with bold flavors. Excellent choices for both a vegan and a pescatarian. Highly recommend!

The food at Carmo is extremely vibrant and fresh! So far I've tried the Rico, ceviche and their trick go! Each one is their own little flavor bombs that will make you want to come back and try more! The atmosphere inside and outside is wonderful as well. It really fits the vibe of the surrounding arts district on Julia Street! I heard their desserts are amazing too but I have yet to try. I guess I just have to come back again I suppose!

business.name: Coyote Crossing
business.categories: Mexican, Restaurants

reviews.text: The food is great here; same with the drinks. The prickly pear and hibiscus margs were wonderful, a little on the sweet side (which personally I LOVE). The two tacos I tried - duck and vegetable - were great, and very hearty. The mango guacamole tasted good and was a large serving (plenty for two), but I was hoping for a little more flavor. The gratuitous chips and salsa were also good! I probably would have asked if they had a spicy version. But overall the whole meal was wonderful. I had the churros for dessert, which was the cherry on top of the meal. I think the only thing that would make me think twice about coming back was the cost/value of the meal. Menu items are a little on the higher end. But the experience, service, and food were all worth revisiting.

I would give this restaurant a 10!!! My sister and I went to coyote crossing for lunch! All I have to say is WOW!!! 

There food is out of this world!!!! Everything was delish and the fresh squeezed lemonade was sooo good!!!

Great authentic food! 4 stars because for the prices, it's a little ridiculous that they do not allow for substitutions on any of their menu items. Their appetizer prices in particular need to come down because I would have ordered a few had they been cheaper. $20 for queso is high even for the area. With that being said, our food was DELICIOUS! I can't wait to go back and try other items. I ordered the Burrito Tinga. The atmosphere inside is unique. Great option if you are looking for something different! Think this will be a new to-go for us.

Having a boozy late lunch there, sitting under the sun in their large outdoor patio, a frozen margarita in one hand ... very relaxing and enjoyable even if the food is so-so. Coming back in a rainy evening in a packed loud room, waiting for drinks and food from poor service is frustrating. Only book on sunny days

I am SHOCKED that Coyote Crossing doesn't have a higher rating! I LOVE LOVE LOVE it here. It is my go-to spot. 

Vibes 10/10
Food 10/10
Service 10/10
Authenticity 10/10
Decor 10/10

I haven't had one bad experience here. Friend wants to get dinner? Coyote Crossing. Co-worker just so happens to be in Conshy and wants to get lunch? Coyote Crossing. My birthday dinner? Coyote Crossing. 

Shrimp fajitas are my favorite, and the margaritas are THE BEST margs I've ever had... and I've had a lot in my time. 

I can't recommend this place enough. If my boyfriend liked Mexican food, I would be there more often. Maybe that's a dealbreaker.... ;)

The food is good - but high priced compared to some of the other great Mexican places in the area.  Sort of a classed up version - the decor was great. The bar chairs are hard to mount/dismount, especially if you aren't tall. They look great, but not as functional as some other chairs I have enjoyed. The real stars of the show are the margaritas!  Just get a pitcher - you won't regret it.

Very good authentic Mexican food... Service could have been alittle better but the place was very busy on a late dat afternoon and the quality of the food made that a non factor..Very comfortable room with a roaring fireplace...Guacamole was a definite top 10 for the area...

Honestly I have been super disappointed. The food is really really good. However their prices went up and portion sizes have gone down. I even confirmed it with the waiter last evening! He said a lot of customer recently have complained as well. My boyfriend and I went here about 2 months ago and since then, they have gone down. For example, 3 tacos were around $14-16 dollars total. Now, a taco can be $8-10 a TACO. The prices for the quesadillas were the same; but they went from a 12 inch quesadilla to 8 inches... it's such a shame because the food has good taste. Gets to be too expensive for Mexican food.

I wanted to really like this place.  I debated about leaving a review that wasn't very amicable.   We went here on November 6th for my birthday.  Made a reservation and on the notes asked for a romantic table.  We got there and it was pretty obvious that they weren't ready for us at all(just 2 of us).   I feel like our table was thrown in a spot that isn't usually there.  The reason I say this is because a few times someone tried to deliver food to tables around us that weren't theirs.  Anyway, we were seated and our server was nice but SLOW.   We were seated next to a large party of women and it was LOUD.   The whole inside was loud actually.   The appetizer(brussel sprouts) we got was great and so was my margarita(prickly pear).   Had to ask a second time for water though.  That was the extent of good.   We were seated at 6:45 and by 8:00 we still didn't have our main dishes.   I mean, it shouldn't take that long for tacos and fajitas.   So, we ended up asking for our food to go because we had somewhere to be.  I feel like our food was thrown in the boxes (by the way, their take out boxes are AWFUL).  Our waitress was very apologetic and I felt bad for her.   But we were disappointed that nothing was taken off of our bill or even that the manager didn't come to apologize.  Unfortunately,, I don't think we'll be back.  Plenty of other places in Conshy to choose from.

Food is good, but overpriced for sure. If you want authentic Mexican food, don't come here. This place has good food with very good potion, but definitely not authentic. The atmosphere is amazing though, I came here for my birthday and was glad I did. However, we were seated outside and there was mosquitos everywhere. We asked to move indoor, since we saw indoor is quite empty. It took them over 15 minutes to move us in. I don't understand why. I got so many mosquitoes bites.

Highly recommend if you love margaritas. They are the best! I live close by so this place could make me go broke. It has a fabulous atmosphere and the outside area is phenomenal. I recommend going during the week at 5ish when it's not too busy. Sometimes when it's busy service can be slow. Other than that though it's a fantastic place!

Pleasantly surprised and impressed with this place. I am critical of most Mexican places (it's too Americanized and not authentic), but Coyote Crossing executed great. Just note- they do their version/twist on a standard dish. 
The corn guacamole was a massive portion with corn, tortilla strips and smoked paprika on top (not spicy). 
The Poblano Cameron was a massive plate with lotsssss of cream and cheese (almost soupy-like) so beware of that's not what you're expecting. 
The Enchiladas Pollo Tomatillo were not your typical enchiladas - it was layered flat tortillas in a little skillet covered in a layer on cheese on top. More cheese than you'd normally expect, but the tomatillo sauce was excellent. 

Unfortunately, service was not great (felt like we were forgot about most of the night). Something to be mindful -  totally understandably with COVID prices of good and supply chain has effected prices. With the above (an app and two mains) with two margaritas was $115 with tip for two people. Just be prepared to spend that kind of money.

After hearing how great this place was and the uniqueness of their menu we decided to try on a Monday afternoon to beat the crowd. After being seated in a empty restaurant we were started off with the completely different drinks then what we ordered (charged for them too!!!). The waitress didn't even have the audacity to take them back or offer us the drinks we originally ordered. So after washing down an overly spicy margarita we had high hopes for the food. With the foods arrival came a fair amount of disappointment, the dry chicken in the tacos that should have been covered in gold (when comparing their price) was impossible to swallow leaving your mouth searching for water. The Burrito was a poor excuse for a microwaved burrito covered in reheated frozen salsa. I'm hoping this was just a fluke in the day but makes me wondering what it is like when there are more then 10 people seated at their overly seated restaurant (50+ tables..., and "understaffed", no wonder you need the whole city of Philadelphia to staff that restaurant).

Coyote Crossing was an amazing surprise.  Nestled on a residential street you would never guess that this incredible restaurant if it's hidden gem.  I walked in and the back wall was open to this amazing courtyard, lights on the trees, private and perfect.  The coconut watermelon margarita was like no other!!!  The carnitas nachos were incredible and the Tinga Burrito had more chicken in it than I've ever had at a Mexican restaurant.  I can't recommend this place enough.  It's the total package, easy parking, easy location and just crazy good food and ambience.

Somehow, this restaurant ad showed up on my Facebook and it looked really cool and had a really large outside eating area., so it got our attention. One day we were near the location and decided to stop in. First, the place is even cooler than what the ad showed and it did have a large outside garden area, which we chose due to not wanting to be inside due to Covid. Second, it was strange they did not have any menus or a code to scan at the table, so we had to go back to the front door podium to take a photo of the code to get the menus. The restaurant was almost empty but service was very slow to greet our table. Once we ordered our drinks and food, we got a chance to look around further and was really impressed with their atmosphere and could see that the patio had a lot of light strings, which would provide a really nice ambiance at night. The food and drinks were very good, definitely the highlight, but service, was the main reason why I gave it 2-stars. We had to ask for water 3 times, then the server brings out a bottle of water and that was added to our bill for a shocking $6, however, the table next to use had tap water so that definitely set us off. Since the portions were way larger than we expected, we asked for a takeout container and a side of rice. The rice never arrived and it was not on the bill, but the server did came very quickly with a handheld credit card reader, which he presented to me for payment , it had auto tip tabs starting at 20%-35%, why in the world would anyone pay 20% for the service level we received?? Anyways, unfortunately that will be a one-and-done experience. Cool place, very expensive and poor service.....

$14 FOR ONE TACO?!?!  This place was horrible. First off I had a reservation for 8pm and I didn't get seated till 9pm. When we were seated and I looked at the menu I didn't realize it was $14 for one taco... I got the mahi mahi fish taco. It was the worse taco I've ever had. The fish was dry and I took one bite and I sent it back because I was not going to pay $14 for something that tasted like Taco Bell  (Taco Bell is 100% better then this place!) . Also the table we were seated at was slanted so we had to hold on to all of our drinks. One person in our party got water spilled on him and all of the staff just looked at him and didn't offer to help.  I was so excited to try this place because the reviews looked great, but sadly my experience was horrible and I will not be returning.
An hour and a half it took them to bring the food. It was freezing outside so we asked to take out the food, and the food was horrific. Bland, chewy, and horrible.

I do not know why this place isn't 5 stars, Everything about it was amazing. The ambiance was spectacular, with a beautiful outdoor patio with lights and greenery everywhere. The service was outstanding- our server Leo was so friendly and thoughtful and even went above and beyond with glasses of mezcal to close out our meal. And the most important part: the food was probably the best Mexican American food I've ever had. While the prices are a little higher, it is well worth it because the portions are huge and absolutely delicious. We had the flautas to start and they looked just like the picture. The free salsa was the freshest and most flavorful I've ever had. My boyfriend and I both had burritos and they were full of flavor and spice with perfectly cooked meat. Highly recommend this place and we definitely will be returning!

I see a lot of people on here so negative which is cool. Everyone's experience is different. I recently went here and I must say that my experience was amazing. The waiter was not rude no one in the establishment was rude they allowed us to choose a seat between indoor and outdoor and the food was amazing. the hibiscus margarita drink was delicious . Will absolutely be going here again .

I cannot believe how much this place has gone downhill.My husband and i which he is a chef,went out for a date night.We drove out there 40 minutes to get there.First strike he made a reservation for outside which we did not get when we got there.Then we get in there and the freaking bug zapper is on zapping flies! Not the point, but my husband and i both asked for certain things mine is particular was no veggies on the quesadilla.I get it, veggies all over to which i asked to send back .The waiter did and to which my waitress comes back over and told me THE CHEF WILL NOT REMAKE IT FOR YOU,HE IS TOO BUSY!!!!! ARE YOU KIDDING ME!!!! i spoke with Carlos the owner and he fixed it for me,but the quesadilla was awful! Fu of grease and chewy steak.I been coming here for 2 years!!! Never again!

From the food to the decor it was a great night for dinner! The outside was beautiful with string lights and a rustic fountain! We ordered the corn guacamole which came super fast and had a smokey kick to it! My only complaint is that the portion was small considering it was $17, it's only enough for 2. The chips were crunchy and warm which isn't common at most places! The glasses for water were unique and cool. The food took forever, so I would definitely recommend getting guacamole which came very fast. The fajita portions were huge and the fish tacos were flavor packed with fish cooked and seasoned perfectly!
Three out of four plates were filled incorrectly. We asked for a box for the one plate. It was too small. Not worth the money given the poor service.

this place was probably cool about ten years ago but that ship has sailed. will never return- the service was downright awful. The margaritas did not even have tequila in them and were so watered down that I drank an entire pitcher and did not even feel buzzed. The steak was so tough we couldn't even eat it. Bathrooms were filthy. As Anthony Bourdain once said- i will never eat in a place with a dirty bathroom because if they can't keep a bathroom clean imagine what the kitchen looks like. disgusting. Oh and the owners are infamous for being downright assholes - see the hundreds of google reviews saying so.

Met a friend here a few weeks ago (on 7/17). What a great vibe. From the décor inside to the outdoor patio seating and latin music. They also have these crazy drinking glasses I thought was so cool.

I arrived  before my girlfriend and decided to order a cocktail while I wait. I went with the white sangria cause frankly it was hot as *ell that day. Typically, I would of went with a Margarita. Anyway, the drink was cold and refreshing. The waiter served chips and salsa along with my drink.

My friend ordered Quaso and I had the chicken chop salad. My salad was different in a good way. Nice chilled chop romaine lettuce, carrots, onion, queso chihuahua ranch dressing with chicken mixed in. Perfect for a hot day.
First time here. Awesome. Lived in LA for 40 years. This place feels like home! A great restaurant!

business.name: The Italian Barrel
business.categories: Personal Chefs, Nightlife, Event Planning & Services, Bars, Italian, Wine Bars, Restaurants

reviews.text:
I had a reservation for four on Christmas Day.  Around noon, on Christmas, we received notice that we had been exposed to COVID.  It was incredibly depressing to cancel our Christmas dinner plans but it was the responsible thing to do.
They are charging us $25 dollars per person for cancelling the day of the reservation.  Tonya, the manager said: if you cancelled yesterday we wouldn't have charged you.  I told her WE LITERALLY JUST FOUND OUT 10 MINUTES AGO!   I understand it's their policy but there should be exceptions during a world-wide pandemic!  It added insult to injury to our misfortune on Christmas Day.  I ASKED: WHAT IF WE CHANGE OUR MINDS AND COME DOWN?  THE RESPONSE: YOU CAN!
As much as we wanted to enjoy our first Christmas dinner after last year's lock down, we decided not to take the chance to potentially expose patrons and staff to COVID, despite the fact we are vaccinated.  That would be selfish.  I guess we have to now pay a significant penalty for being conscientious and considerate of others.
Suffice it to say, we will never go to The Italian Barrel again!  It's New Orleans, there are TONS of other amazing restaurants to visit!

This place is amaizing! We came 15min till closing time and they still took us in. We are really grateful for it because we were starving. Food was real italian food, that is actually pretty hard to find in US (both, me and my husband are Mediterranean). They has great wine as well. Staff was amaizing!

Wow!  This place is amazing.  The polenta appetizer melts in your mouth. 
The porcini mushroom and truffle ravioli is like heaven when it hits your tongue. All the flavors just mesh together so well and nothing overpowers the other flavors.  But altogether, the mushrooms and truffle oil with the white cream sauce packs a flavorful punch.  This dish is absolutely delicious. 
The ambiance here is wonderful. It's a quiet little gem in a loud city.  And the service was impeccable.  This should be a go to spot for any one visiting New Orleans.  I love this place.

I have been a cheerleader and patron of this restaurant since she opened it. I have sent hundreds of my customers. No more. First Samatha was in the restaurant on Christmas Day. She didn't even say hello
Or I'm sorry. Biggest transgression of all. That said we showed up for our 11:00 reservation at around 10:45 we were rudely told they didn't open until 11 and we'd have to wait. We were the first table seated. Then the shit show started. It was a very limited price fixe menu. We ordered and ordered drinks, it was painful the service problems whether it was kitchen caused or other issues it should have been addressed. We tried to be patient abs hood sports but other than the ravioli everything was poorly cooked poorly served and generally disappointing. We didn't leave the restaurant until 3 pm. Not by choice but by not getting food. And tables seated way after us getting food. We drank and drank, trying to stay in a good mood. They never offered free drinks because it was taking so long or any compensation. We would have left after the entree but it was so late it didn't matter. So terrible but could have been saved if the chef had been coming around apologizing as we understand. But she stood outside looking at tables but never once said a word. Terrible from the top down. Don't go. There are too many options to have uncaring chefs. They should let the market say this isn't ok and let others take their place. Make room fir ones that care. Oh fir four of us it was $650.00 with a tip added automatically.

We tried this place on Christmas Day. Food was good but so slow to arrive. I call it a complete disaster. We got there at 2:54 pm for our 3:00 pm reservation, and stood outside until they seated us at 3:30pm. We departed after the last course at 7:30 pm. I had to add $50 more time to my $50 premium parking space, to complement my $740 dining bill. I added $56 (10%) tip to the 20% tip the restaurant added to the bill (for a 30% gratuity for staff that suffered through this). I was sympathetic for the wait staff that suffered from management's failure. Many restaurant staff had failed to arrive, they were quick to point out. I should be quick to point out it is not my job to have an emergency cadre set up and available as a ready reserve. The Osso Bucco was good but only warm, not hot. Sitting on the sidewalk in uncomfortable steel chairs for 5 hours left my butt hurt. I remain that way.

Made reservations for  Christmas Eve, as they had an open menu (not a reveillon) and came with a recommendation of someone who lives near by.  We got there about ten minutes early and were told that due to staffing shortages that we'd have to wait until our time.  So we did.  And then kept waiting.  And then someone else came in with a later reservation and asked to be seated right away.  At this point I spoke up again, it was 20 minutes past reservation time by then, and the host was like, oh yeah we can seat you right away.  Frustrating, but okay, I get it.

It looked like things would get rolling right away, but other than being seated right then, everything was still a slow roll.  Ordered the bruschetta.  Got our complimentary bread at the table, and eventually the bruschetta came out.  The complimentary bread "was the best part of the meal," according to my father, but my mom and I would both contend it was the bruschetta.

We eventually received our main courses.  They were good, although nothing spectacular or amazing about them.  Standard lasagna and other Italian restaurant status quo.  Our server was friendly whenever she was around, but it wasn't enough after so much wait.  We didn't even want to have dessert at that point; might as well just get on to our festivities because this wasn't adding anything to the fun.

Overall?  It was good.  I had hoped for better, especially due to the prices and the wait, but it was just good.  Maybe when it's not half empty due to staffing shortages, or when I'm more excited about a holiday meal and being let down at the lackluster result.

Had reservation. No hostess when we arrived. Owner seemed to have to "do-it-all". Seated, took 15 minutes to be acknowledged by waiter and receive a menu. Asked for chicken piccata instead of the veal piccata listed on the menu. NO substitutions. Even though Piccatta sauce is identical, whether Veal or Chicken. Took drink order. Was able to order dinner after another 30 minutes. Food took OVER an HOUR to land on the table. 
Waiter was pleasant, but one could tell that the kitchen and front house was a mess. Everyone's short on good help, so we'll blame it on that.

While it may not matter to the owners, we won't be going again.

I had high hopes for this place, and the first 10 minutes were good-a nice intimate Italian restaurant.  Then the first "86" came in from the waiter-3 of the menu items weren't available. No problem, didn't want to order them.  Then, no bread!  An Italian restaurant with no bread! Ordered a Dewar's...no Dewar's!  Switched to Johnny's. Had the mussels (with no bread for the wine sauce), very good.  
Then waited and waited to order entrees.  Can understand the waitstaff shortage, so we were patient.  Ordered a Cabernet to go with dinner, 10 minutes later, no Cab. Merlot, then. 10 minutes later, no Merlot.  Ordered a plain red, 15 minutes later, finally got it.  Food came, had the veal piccata- was all right, but I thought it came with pasta-nope! (My fault, but can't think of an Italian restaurant that doesn't have a little pasta with each meat dish).
Their excuse for the shortages was that the person who orders was out with COVID. Nobody else could step up?
No other excuses, nothing comped.  Good food, good atmosphere, but bad business.

New Year's Eve!  Been last two years. Excellent service and delicious food. Need reservations for sure. Bread was yummy. Bruschetta devious with house salad. Had lobster ravioli. Very rich. Restaurant was out of chicken Parmesan. Sea bass was good with wilted spinach and tomatoes. Lemon sorbet was the best.

Disgusting !! Rip off!! So bad it's almost funny.

My family stopped in here before our flight home. We were hoping to get a good solid meal in before heading home.

We walked in at 11:45am and we were informed it would be awhile before we could be seated(even though the place was empty) because someone called in sick.

We are finally seated and given water. At this point we are informed that they our out of bread and 4 of the most popular menu items. My wife tried to order a Prosecco but she was told they were out of the by the glass varieties. If she wanted it we would have to pay $100 a bottle( for a $10 brand).

We order the spinach salad that was recommended by the wait staff. When it arrived, I almost laughed at how cheap it looked. The spinach was clearly a few days old with a few onion scraps and soggy oranges thrown on top. We informed the manager of the matter and she promptly removed it and offered her apologies.  


My wife ordered shrimp and noodles which she said was ok but it clearly been hastily prepared( half the shrimp still had the shell).
My son ordered spaghetti with meat sauce , the meat sauce had clearly been reheated as the tomatoes were ice cold. 

The lasagna I ordered was also cold and was soggy. Upon closer inspection, I saw that it was cheaply prepared with very little ricotta cheese. I only ate about 4 bites because I was afraid of getting sick.

They asked if we wanted dessert but I didn't feel like having another one of my favorite dishes ruined.

It was always an extremely long wait - walked in at 11:45; walked out 1:30pm.

The atmosphere here was nice but the Italian food was disgusting.

Sadly, this was a huge disappointment.  We'd heard fantastic things from friends and decided to book for our Christmas lunch. It was a prix fixe menu which had 5 courses for $90.  From the moment we stepped into the restaurant we knew things weren't running smoothly.. a bartender had called out sick and they seemed short staffed with only a handful of servers for a packed seating.  The hostess was lovely and seated us with apologies for any possible delay.  Our server ran by our table letting us know she'd be with us.  This occurred three more times before we received a menu.  Water came and our cocktail order was taken. After 30 minutes we almost gave up on our $20 cocktails and asked for the wine list.  
Finally, bread and drinks arrived.  
We are now almost an hour into our meal and the first course appears. One of the stars was given for this meat and cheese board. It was delicious but nothing you couldn't find at a wine bar. The next two stars go to pasta course. Fantastic. 
I'm going to wrap this up because I'm getting bored recalling the endless waiting... main course was a choice of veal osso buco or flounder.  I don't eat veal so this left me with the flounder.  Overcooked, dry as a bone.  Dessert was forgettable. 
I can't blame the servers because something was definitely off (GM came out to apologize to every table). My biggest regret is taking my family here for Christmas and spending an exorbitant amount on mediocre food and endless apologies.
Fabulous!!! We sat at the bar- Kendall was awesome!  Best melon and prosciutto, excellent wine and lasagna that was perfect.

We were in NOLA as an early Christmas trip but the hubs was tired of seafood (who gets tired of that?!?), so I looked for an Italian restaurant. We were not disappointed!! You should make sure you have a reservation. We didn't but the hostess took a risk and worked us in. The bruschetta is amazing! And my hubby loved the red wine he had. We did wait a little while for our meal, but since we were worked in, I'm not upset about it! 

Also, Frenchmen Street is a short step away and the music there is AMAZING!
I was in NOLA for 9 days, found this little gem after wandering around the market. The servers Michelle & April were great! The food delish!  Sat outside, yay! Thank you! I give them an additional

Great atmosphere and menu choices however the value for the money was not there.  $36 for the leftover osso bucco sauce on tagliatelle and spinach we ordered was never brought to the table.  For $36, one would expect Osso Bucco itself. 

For dessert we had lemon gelato and tiramisu.  The presentation was great however the gelato had ice crystals and the tiramisu lacked flavor. Server was reasonably attentive.

We had a great waiter.  And the gentleman who brought us out bottle of wine.  

But an Italian restaurant that won't let you substitute the cream sauce to red sauce on the SIDE DISH of pasta that is being served with chicken parm that has red sauce on it. And when you ask "what cheeses are on your cheese board tonight?" should not take TWENTY MINUTES and three employees to answer.  And being out of mozzarella appetizer at 7pm on Saturday?  Even our first choice of wine was sold out. 

Everything tasted OK (the sausage in the arrabiatta was delicious) but we had to settle quite a bit and with so much not available our dinner took almost 2 hours which would be fine if at least there was wine or food on the table.

The restaurant is so quaint and cozy. The hostess was very nice upon arrival. The server was uninformative and slow. We had to ask for the specials and recommendations. Had to ask for drink refills and we didn't even get a table check after any of our food items arrived. The food was just ok, there was nothing that was outstanding about. If you're looking for good Italian with a great atmosphere just go to Irenes.

A hidden little gem way off the beaten path. So glad we found it. (Bar tender at Molly's suggested we go) One of the best meals we had during our stay. Ambience, service and food all perfect. Not pretentious, just good food done really well.

Had an odd experience here, to say the least. 

A server caused a huge scene, apparently quitting his job in front of everyone. He shouted that he was leaving the job forever, and had essentially had it with working there.

To the staff's credit, nobody reacted dramatically, and all kept calm. That said, it struck us as strange that the incident wasn't acknowledged by anyone. There was no apology or explanation for the drama, and it definitely put a damper on our experience. 

The staff seemed undertrained or inexperienced, but I understand these are trying times. 

Food-wise, both the lobster ravioli and lasagna were good. 

All in all, we won't be returning.

Conflicted how to rate this one.  A couple of friends of mine who live in NOLA told me if I like pasta - this is the place to go.  So I went on a Monday at 1pm for lunch.  

The food is incredible.  I had chicken parm, which comes with linguini in a white cream sauce, and both were Heaven.  I would absolutely order these again if I ever went back.  

IF.  

Because the service here rates into negatives.  I arrived and waited - no one greeted me or sat me.  There was only one waiter working the entire place, inside and out.  There was one person behind the bar pouring drinks.  I think the server was new because there were a LOT of conversations going on between the server and the bartender, and they seemed to involve the computer.  I went ahead and sat down outside.  I waited 10 minutes.  No one came.  Not even a menu.  The other people sitting outside had ordered quite some time ago and were also getting angry and restless.  

To be clear --- I'm not blaming the individuals who were working their asses off.  I waited tables for 10 years and STILL have nightmares (literally) about this exact scenario -- I'm the only one on the floor, there's drinks at the bar, food in the kitchen window, everyone is angry.  I get this is horrible, I don't hold the one server accountable. 

Eventually I came inside, asked the bartender if I can order from him at the bar.  He said "yes" and everything was bliss from there on out.  He was friendly and attentive, and the food, the FOOD, was worth the price and the aggravation. 

But why did there have to be aggravation?  If someone didn't show up for work, why wasn't a manager or owner stepping in to help out? 

So five stars for food, 1 star for aggravation = 3 stars.  This place is highly recommended as long as you are patient and not too starving and hungover from the night before.

I am on cloud nine after eating here! Usually Italian can make you feel heavy after eating but I felt light and fulfilled. The bread had an air of fluffiness with a perfect outside crisp! It was done just right - made with consideration. The truffle pasta came plated in the perfect portion - the edible flower doubles as decor and as a floral fragrance to the dish. I smelled the dish and my senses filled with the perfect balance of truffle - next I broke open the flowers and a burst of florals filled the air as I sprinkled the petals over my ravioli - many people can overhand truffle but this sauce was superb! Biting into the mushroom mix ravioli gave an earthy savory balance to the fragrant flower petals and truffle, with a light dusting of fresh parmasean - the smell alone felt like heaven - the textures were also well paired. The waitress and bartender were attentive and accommodating. The signature fussili dish was also a light yet creamy sauce - the peas were fresh and plump and the prosciutto was not left soggy and stuck it had great gently fried texture - the textures played well together the sauce did not wilt or over power any note in this lovely symphony of fussili ,  it was well balanced and large portioned our kids split it - my husband had the vodka and crab penne and he finished the plate - the drinks were well made and the ambiance was aesthetically pleasing! I enjoyed the fine touch of a few fresh flowers on the table. I would love to come back and try the filet mignon with peppercorn sauce. You will not be disappointed here at the Italian Barrel - the wine list is extensive and although as someone with vitners in her family I usually enjoy looking it over and taking my time, we were with the kids but it was very clear they had many fine wines. I only wish I could've enjoyed my time a bit longer but with the kids we sort of pressed on to see the rest of New Orleans, they surely did not rush us and the outdoor seating looks like a lovely afternoon with European Mediterranean vibes. Even met a nice couple of patrons to chat with outside.

Came here for lunch and service was just terrible. the servers and hostesses were so rude. the server looked high and you could tell. took 15 minutes just to get water. we were sat outside and it started to rain and it had seemed like rocket science to fix the problem. food was good but was so annoyed by the time the food came couldn't even enjoy it. new orleans is known for the great food dont waste it on this place.

Service was nice but overwhelmed.   Recommend not going here during busy times.  Besides service being very slow I specifically asked to have wine BEFORE the food and they did the opposite. By the time the wine got there the food was ice cold.  Ravioli was ok but too rich and not a delicate sauce at all.  Overall food was fine but nothing special.   Ate outside to the combined smells of disinfectant and truffles.

My girlfriend & I went for our anniversary & when we made our reservation they only had bar seating available. We told them we would love to sit at a table if one becomes available. They asked us if we were celebrating a special occasion, we told them yes, and then seated us at a regular table. It was so nice! 

The food was delicious. The waiter was great. We will definitely be back!! 

More veggie options would be awesome, but overall we highly recommend! Perfect for date night.

As the first restaurant on our list to try during our trip...I went in with some high hopes and expectations. I love authentic Italian.  Unfortunately, I was hardly impressed (as a whole).  I requested an outside table, because we really wanted to experience as much city views as possible.  That didn't disappoint! The staff was friendly enough (they seemed new to the fine dining scene- if that's what they are trying to portray here). Being from Charleston, SC, I'd hardly consider this as a fine dining establishment, but that's just based on overall experience.  

The bruschetta was good. I wasn't WOWed by any means. It was just the same bread they put on the table, smothered with an over abundance of dressed tomatoes, large parm shavings, and basil. Good enough for sure, but I found it hard to keep any tomatoes on the bread, and it made for an annoying bite each time. 

The lamb was absolutely cooked perfectly! No complaints there! The veggies were very delicious as well.  The chicken parm, however, was a bit lackluster, and practically flavorless.  Unfortunately, the accompanied fettuccine lacked flavor as well.  My guest actually complained to the server about it.  Normally, in a fine dining establishment, a member of management will come to your table in a matter of minutes, but no one ever arrived. I actually approached the manager and asked if he could speak with her, and he mentioned that he was never told about the situation.  He did quickly rectify the situation by removing the entree from the bill.  

I didn't get to try dessert, because as I was away from the table, the server asked my guest if we were interested in dessert, and she said she was not. I was never asked once I returned and was brought the bill. I mean...I always make room for dessert. Again, just not the typical process of a fine dining establishment. 

Overall, meh. They did stick to Covid guidelines upon checking in with the hostess, which I appreciated. I just wish they put that much effort into the overall dining experience for their guests. 

I'd dine there again...if someone else was paying.

business.name: La Strada
business.categories: Food, Beer, Wine & Spirits, Restaurants, Italian, American (New)

reviews.text: From the service to the food, everything was top notch! The seafood linguini and the chicken Alfredo was amazing! La Strada is a definite must try if you haven't been.

Honestly 4.5 
Reservations was the cause of -0.25. At first we wanted to place reservations through open table but the wanted $25 reservation. We were staying at one of the 3 hotels so I find it pointless to put an extra $25 reservation fee. So I decided to call the restaurant itself and they had no problem making our reservation for free.
The other -0.25 was lost because I told them it was my friend and I birthday (legit) and usually someone would get a complimentary drink or dessert on the house but we didn't.
Service: 5  our server was amazing he took the time to talk to us and give us some suggestions and didn't seem like he was rushing to serve others. 
Food: 5 the bread was amazingly fresh and tasty, the charred octopus was amazing. It was quite tart-y. Seafood Linguini: 10 out of this world AMAZING!!! Good portion, very flavorful, were not cheap on the seafood. This alone scored a lot of points. Definitely would come back just for the seafood linguini.
Beautiful setting and decor.

Would you come back? Definitely without a doubt!

Just had a very disappointing experience at La Strada. The highlight of our meal unfortunately was the bread, after receiving that it just went downhill. Our waiter was nice enough to start, my friend ordered the Carbonara and I ordered the Fettucini alfredo with chicken. Order comes, and its not correct. The waiter misheard my friend, and brought out spaghetti marinara which wasnt a big deal, I let him know it was not correct and our server, Mike, decided to get very condescending. One of his remarks were "well I repeated myself sweetheart, those are 2 completely different things!" and I responded saying I heard her say carbonara, I heard you say carbonara on the reply, and she was even pointing to it. My friend said it was fine, we were both starving and she would just eat the dish he brought out but he would not take our answer and took it from her, then took mine saying ill keep this warm for you. His tone and remarks made us really uncomfortable, so we called over the front desk agent who was nearby and asked for a new waiter. We were reseated to a new table, they were very apologetic and said we want to make sure you have a great evening, and we had hopes it would get better. They even reconfirmed our orders, and made sure it would be out quickly. Unfortunately, it seems noone bothered to tell our old waiter Mike this. He kept eyeballing us, making us even more uncomfortable and came right over asking why we were at a new table, why did we move, etc and I told him he should go speak with the front desk as they reseated us.  Our new waiter came over, we told him about the experience, and he said he would make sure this was resolved. He also asked for our order, a third time which was a little strange, and then went away. While we continued to wait for our food, I saw the manager asking the kitchen about our order and trying to expedite it as fast as possible. Finally get the food, waiter said he would be back with cheese. Never came back, after waiting a few minutes we both decided to start eating and were immediately met with bland food. Mine was extremely underseasoned, and I had to add pepper and salt at the table. My friends carbonara was not great either, she stated the pasta felt very crunchy and almost undercooked. The manager came over and asked how we were, I let her know the food was fine, but very underseasoned and I had to add pepper to get some taste to it. She asked if I wanted fresh cracked pepper, which I reiterated I had just done that myself..... so no. We were ready to just get out of this place as the old waiter kept throwing glances our way and making it just an uncomfortable time, and barely ate half our meals and did not take any to go. Asked for the check, were informed wine was comped and they offered a free desert (which was were the 2nd star came from, it was a nice gesture to try and salvage a bad night) but we had no faith desert would be quick or taste good and declined. Overall, just a bad experience which is a shame as a friend recommended and hyped this place up.

Horrible experience. Per our reservation, we arrived at 8:45 PM. Our appetizers arrived at around 9 PM and we finished them by 9:15. From then, we waited uncomfortably for our entrees that arrived after 10 PM. You would think 45 minutes or so (that might have been an hour) is a short time but when you're sitting in a restaurant and hungry, it feels like the longest and most uncomfortable 45 minutes. Worse, no one even checked in, our waiter just disappeared. One of us finally stood up and asked a staff, then 20 minutes later, the waiter finally appeared after 10 PM with our food. Our whole group felt terrible and had a horrible night. What added insult to injury was we observed how attentive they were to the other guests while we were walking out passing by the center and front area of the restaurant. They sat us at the back area. I started to think maybe we were discriminated because of the color of my skin. I remember asking the Italian family by us if they had to wait a while for their food, they said no, and that they really like this restaurant. I hate to think these things (that people treat other differently because of bias) when I just want to have a nice dinner with my family. We understand that restaurants are struggling and understaffed but we had advance reservations and they should have put us somewhere so we will not be neglected. I am a generous tipper especially during the pandemic, and it pained me not to tip this restaurant, but I felt the need to make a statement because no one even officially apologized to us there though they all knew what happened. They just ignored us through and through.

We come here once a year, We are from out of town.The risotto is out of this world. But last night I had to sit next to a dog. It was sitting at the table next to me. I like dogs but this is an upper class  restaurant. This should not be allowed.

We wanted a decadent anniversary meal and La Strada was the perfect choice!!

We had a reservation and were seated right away, and our server Antonio was super helpful the whole night! He helped us pick a nice bottle of wine and was very attentive the whole evening.

I've seen a few reviews that comment on the length of time a meal here takes, but what I experienced was the staff allowing me to take time to enjoy each of my courses which I really appreciated! I think total we were seated for an hour and a half, and it was so wonderful to not feel rushed at any point during the meal.

The garlic bread they place at the table is dangerous- I could definitely see myself eating the whole basket!! 

We started with the calamari and were astounded at the portion size- look at how much is on this plate!! Similarly the mushroom ravioli said it came with 8, and I ended up with 12 on my plate which was such a joy. There's a reason the mushroom ravioli is so highly celebrated- it's just incredible, the pasta itself is so delicate and the sauce is so creamy and packed with flavor. I almost passed on this dish like a fool, thinking I'd want something 'heartier'- If you're reading this review and feeling the same way take this as a sign to get the ravioli! The baked ziti was also delicious and packed with flavor, a great choice too! We ended up taking home some of the ravioli and some of the baked ziti, the portion sizes here are so generous.

We ended the night with the tiramisu and I got the oh Danny boy coffee cocktail, both were the the perfect balance of sweet enough but not overpowering. I was personally really delighted by the icecream served with the tiramisu!

Overall, we were so delighted by the service from Antonio, the ambience of the restaurant, and the portion and flavor of the food. We can't wait to come back!

Superb service. You can tell the servers were trained well. Food was great. The t bone was huge!!! For desserts definitely get the pistachio cake. Créeme brulee was good too. Inside is like being on the streets of Italy. Kitchen is open for all to view. Beautiful Italian music playing. I'd definitely come back.

My party of four really enjoyed La Strada. We wanted a relaxing experience in the casino complex. 

The decorations are delightful! Way over the top! If you love 90s Tuscan esthetic, you'll love this place. It could absolutely benefit from a more modern decor, but come on, who doesn't love that level of cheese when dining at a casino. 

The service was too notch, super helpful and attentive and our server made spot on wine recommendations for our entrees. 

We had mostly pasta dishes and the sizes are MASSIVE!!!!  I was super happy with my spaghetti carbonara!  I would have had plenty to take home leftovers, but was leaving the next day. 

Overall I'd happily go back to La Strada and enjoy a slow restful meal with good wine and amazing service.

We have been going to La Strada on Christmas Eve for years.  We are always treated well and enjoy the food, atmosphere and staff.  We were not disappointed again.  However, we did feel a little rushed this year, maybe because there weren't enough servers/staff??  But we understood, just sad we felt like we had to hurry (even though we didn't).  Biggest complaint is that the El Dorado no longer offers valet parking unless you're a high roller.  That stinks, as we are local and may consider another place to continue our dinner out on Christmas Eve tradition.   We had to park on the 6th floor and walk to the parking garage.  That was not ok.  Plus it doesn't give us the opportunity to tip the very hard working valet staff.  Boo on the El Dorado.  I still give La Strada high ranks, as the food/staff and atmosphere usually don't disappoint.  

Thank you everyone for working on Christmas Eve so my family and I could enjoy another Christmas Eve dinner.

I would say that it is either the best Italian in reno or tied with the best. I will take family here of special occasions. It is more upscale and a little pricey but you get what you pay for. Very good:)

The decor and music was great and very Italian. Our server was Serbian and very sociable. We enjoyed our chat with him. We came in early and it was not busy until about 6:30. We enjoyed the bread basket and the employees were very attentive. We thought the food was a little pricey for the amount of food you receive. My lasagna was very tasty but it was small. I order a salad on the side and was surprised it was just some spring mix with a few tiny additions. I can get that at home and not pay $10 to $15 for it. They need more salad choices. I did not order the Caesars because when I did at the other restaurant there, it was a lettuce wedge, very basic. This seemed to be the same. My husband got soup and he stated that was good. It was creamy with spinach. My husband got Chicken Alfredo. It was good but the chicken was two very flat strips laying on top. So it has to be cut up first when it is laying on the noodles. I don't think flat chicken was the way to go. It looked like it was fake or out of a can. My main issue is the cost for such a small meal that was nothing special.

I found my new favorite Italian Restaurant in Town -It was about time!
During our staycation at El Dorado (Now the Row), my husband and I made dinner reservations for La Strada.
We arrived on time and waited about 5 mins to get seated...
The Place:
This beautiful Italian-style restaurant has brick walls, columns, dimmed light, and esthetically set tables inside the El Dorado casino. I would recommend dressing nicely as part of the experience ;-)
The Food:
Everything looked so good on the menu that I had a hard time deciding what to get.
They bring you some complimentary garlic bread to share. One of the best garlic breads I have ever had! I could not stop eating it!
For the main course, I had the "Lobster Fra Diavolo". Lobster Tail served over homemade spaghetti with a spicy tomato-based sauce. I was debating between the lobster dish or the scallops. Our fantastic server, Keith, recommended adding some scallops.
Everything on that plate was a piece of art. The pasta was unbelievable, the sauce was so flavorful and the lobster and scallops were cooked perfectly!
My husband had the "Lamb Chops Scottadito" - perfectly cooked medium rare lamb chops served over artichoke hearts and potatoes glazed with a flavorful balsamic marinated. I had a bite of his dish, and it just melted in my mouth. Some serious and juicy lamb! YUMMY!!
We started the night with a cocktail. Margarita, of course! Then we transition to a bottle of wine. We decided to enjoy a bottle of Jordan 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon for this particular date night - One of my favorite wines.  Cheers!
The Service:
Our server for the night was Keith. He and the busser did a great job at taking care of us. They refilled our waters constantly, checked that we liked our food, and always had wine in our glasses.
I could not choose what to get and Keith was super helpful.
He also recommended my husband to go with the lamb, and we could not be any happier!
Keith chatted with us a little bit. He is knowledgeable about the dishes and wines, and he has so many years of experience in the service industry. He made sure that we had a very memorable dinner.
Manager Nicole came to our table and checked that everything went perfect. They were super busy. So I always appreciate it when management takes time to greet and check-in with clients.

Some of the best food in Reno, for sure. We came for my birthday and left fat, sassy, and satisfied.
We started the meal with the calamari, and I think out of everything this was the least satisfying, but still good.
Between my wife and I we had the veal ossobuco and the buffalo cheese gnocchi. Each of our entrees were outstanding. I was happy to have some of it come home for leftovers. Each bit was delicious and the entire meal was so memorable, not to mention the service being prompt, professional, and friendly.
When you read reviews that their sauce taste like Chef Boyardee....BELIEVE THEM! yuck! Their calamari was bland and rubbery. I have no clue how they got any awards for their food.

This is an excellent Italian restaurant. Overall, good service, good food, and beautiful decor. The pasta is all handmade. I had the scallops and risotto. They both tasted amazing, but I got 3 scallops in this huge plate of risotto. They both tasted good, but I found the plate to lack balance due to lack of more protein.  My boyfriend has the veal parm and it was amazing, so I was jealous of his order. His sister had the carbonara and the pasta was perfect! The taste was a bit bland for my taste, as I have had amazing carbonara previously. The cannoli for dessert was not good at all. I had one but didn't eat the 2nd because it wasn't satisfying. I found it to taste like a less sweet protein bad.  Overall, it's a good place to eat, but a bit lacking in balance on their plates.

Came from California to Reno on business with husband (Truck Driver). Every time we come here we go to the Casinos.  We decided to check out a nice restaurant in casino. Everything was absolutely perfect.  The staff treated us like royalty.  Everyone was so nice and accommodating.  The ambiance was romantic.  Eating by the candlelight, great jazz music.  The food was amazing we had T-bone steaks with bleu cheese. They give you a generous basket of  garlic bread and bread sticks.  Our Server was Chris. Chris was an awesome fellow. We will definitely be back

If you aren't lining up for this place, then you're asleep. The service and food is so beyond anything else you'll get here in the casino. The service that Jordan and Chris gave my boyfriend and I made us feel special and touched. We felt like we were royalty and have not had that nice of service even in some Michelin star restaurants the service isn't as good as it is here. It is friendly, clean, professional, exceptional food. YOU MUST come here!!!!!!

The entree, the appetizer, the cocktails, the server and his assistant (Jack and Cameron) were amazing! The meal itself was possibly (don't tell my nana) the best Italian meal I've ever had. Dessert however was as disappointing as everything before was great. I made a 3 hour trip and rented a hotel room specifically to try the cannoli unfortunately I think the cannoli was having a bad night. The ricotta was chunky, watery and sour. I've never been so disappointed, I'll try again next time I'm in town but I won't be making any special trips. Otherwise.... The meal was truly exceptional.

Great experience here. Server was very informative and helpful with the menu and with his recommendations. The ambience was really romantic and peaceful (a nice break from chaotic casino atmosphere) but the absolute STAR of the night was our busser  names CHRISTOPHER. He was amazing and charming and full of life his personality was very contagious and helped absolutely MAKE our evening amazing! I hope he moves up the ranks fast there so he can continue making more amazing experiences for people!

I will start with a positive. Our waiter and the person who brought us bread and waters were fantastic and we tipped them separate.  Our bottle of $100 wine was superb.  
Now onto the negative part. If I could give 0 stars I would.  I ordered the "fresh" pasta and lobster tails.  It came to the table it looked like soup! Tasted like rotten old chef boy R Dee raviolis.  I had one small bite and literally almost got sick. The taste was one of the worst ones I've ever had.  My husband got the Veal parmigiana. He said it tasted like chicken fried steak. The manager came to the table we told him how bad the food was. He apologized and said he always warns people not to get the veal! Who says that ! He was nice enough to not charge us for anything but the wine. I felt so bad for the waiter he was so sweet and felt so bad.  Please if your coming to eat here have a back up plan for needing something to eat when you leave. Unfortunately we didn't and had a show to get to right after and had no time to grab something else to eat. Starving we left one of the worse restaurants I have ever been to!

Driving through town just happened to stay at the Silver Legacy which led us to La Stata as it was one of the few restaurants open. From the menu it looked and sounded incredible. Walking down to the restaurant from our room, we passed Ruth's Chris steakhouse. Probably should have ate in there but I wanted pasta. Get to the restaurant, it is dimly lit, service was slow, and the food was substandard. Christopher told us the specials and my wife decided to go with the filet. I ordered the lasagna. Wife's steak was over cooked and served with a mushroom sauce that wasn't mentioned before ordering. Steak was bland, overcooked, and not worth the $65 price tag. I ordered lasagna that came out looking like it came out of a frozen entree, reheated to double the temp it should be cooked to, and served in the bowl/plate is was cooked in. Sauce was horribly, tasted like a mix between tomato paste and sloppy joe mix. Again, not worth the asking price. Total bill with apps and drinks was north of $125. Expected a lot more for the price point. Will not come back here when we visit again.

First off, the atmosphere is absolutely breathtaking. The music was enjoyable, but not so loud you had to shout in order to hear whomever you may be speaking to. (Much unlike most restaurants I've been in). The service was by far the best I've ever experienced. My server, Melissa, was very knowledgeable on every question I had for her. (Mostly surrounding the alcohol I preferred, something completely foreign to me). And I was especially impressed with her dedication to bar tending, absolutely inspirational. Her suggestions were on point, from the wine I preferred, to the course and dessert I ordered, clear down to the scotch I liked as a night cap. Honestly, I'm kinda upset I didn't get to try the other two suggestions she made for my wine and scotch preference. And the proportions? Definitely worth the price paid, again much unlike a bunch of "fine dining" restaurants I've been in. By far the best restaurant I've been in, if I could rate it ten out of ten I would.

We made reservations during a busy weekend (Italian Food Festival) recommended by the concierge at Silver Legacy. Upon arriving (a bit early), we were seated immediately thanks to the great hostess. The restaurant was packed, but it did not effect our dining experience. We liked the family atmosphere and overall, the restaurant was very classy.

Tony was amazing. He assisted with the pairings of wine, offered great recommendations, and was throughly attentive. Antonio or Eduardo (tanned-skin gentlemen with an accent - I apologize for forgetting his name) was also amazing. We were well taken care of.

Must haves: the Mushroom Ravioli. Amazing! Probably the best we've ever had. Also, the Fettuccini Alfredo with roasted chicken breast. Best Alfredo sauce we've had. Hands down in the top 3 of Italian restaurants we've ever visited. Fresh, authentic, and full of flavor.

Whenever we decide to revisit Reno again, La Strada will be on the top of our list. Also, we were able to witness a birthday celebration with full-on Bel Canto from an enthused staff member. This restaurant is a gem!

It was a lovely evening, made a reservation for two. It wasn't busy and lots of empty tables. When we got there we were seated right away, but the hostess seated us in a little dinky table we barely fit, it's good for one person table, so we asked for the manager for a bigger table. She lead us to a cozy nice wine cellar room, it was perfect table. Our server Gary was so nice, very attentive & funny, he made us very comfortable.Told him we're celebrating for a birthday, he said he has only Tiramisu but no one will sing & he can't sing. We laugh, Gary he gave us all we needed. The food was absolutely delicious. Seafood are fresh and pasta cooked "al dente" the T bone steak aged perfectly and soft. The bread basket are overflowing. I'm definitely coming back for sure.

Last night my husband and I dined at La Strada in Reno.  We were celebrating our 51st Wedding anniversary.  The food was very good; the service was great.  Why I only gave it three stars is that we were asked when booking if we were celebrating an occasion.  I indicated it was our anniversary.  When we were seated I mentioned to the hostess and to the waiter it was our anniversary.
If La Strada is such a 5 star restaurant would you not think we might have gotten a dessert in honor of our anniversary or at least an acknowledgement of the occasion before I mentioned it.  No dessert; no special attention to the occasion.  Why did they even bother to ask if we were dining because of a special occasion.  In every other restaurant in any city that we went out on our anniversary, we were gifted with a dessert and even a decorated plate to honor the occasion.  If this restaurant wants to compare themselves to other nicer restaurants, they need to do more customer appreciation.

business.name: IndeBlue Modern Indian Food & Spirits
business.categories: Cocktail Bars, Food Delivery Services, Nightlife, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Bars, Event Planning & Services, Caterers, Restaurants, Indian

reviews.text:
I went to indieblue a few years ago for happy hour, and found it pretty lack luster at the time. But our last few visits were great. The food was creative and tasty (just stay way from the chicken and waffles, or you'll be really disappointed), that every time I come back  I like to branch out on the menu to be surprised. 

The drinks were really good, and the service was phenomenal. The staff all around was extremely friendly  and welcoming, gave samples of new drinks they were trying out, made accommodations for our toddlers without being asked, and we really enjoyed our time there.

So it's made a spot on the few restaurants we place on rotation for our nights out,

Attempted to come here for happy hour, but they only allow you to do it if you're sitting at the bar. No seats were open so my group of friends and I did restaurant week instead, which was worth it. 

We all purposely ordered different items so we could all share. We ordered the demitasse soup, spinach chaat, crab corn tikki served with sweet chili aioli, "butter chicken" poutine, chicken korma, makhani, kheer, toasted coconut gulab jamun and chocolate pot de crème.

Everything tasted amazing with a nice blend of various spices. Definitely modern Indian cuisine but still very good and worth a try! 

The dishes that stood out were the spinach chaat, crab corn cake, chicken korma, and chocolate pot de creme! 

The decor is on point and it is a nice and small intimate restaurant with friendly service. Out of the 3 desserts, my friends and I all agreed that the chocolate cake
Was the best. Kheer was similar to rice pudding and delicious, but too liquidy and runny. Naan bread is also on point and amazing to dip with. 10/10

Tried for restaurant week. It was good services were nice and staff was phenomenal. I got paneer and poutine fries. As well as a Chai sangria. The Chai sangria wasn't worth it and the fries didn't have enough cheese curds. The paneer was okay. But I have had better Indian. However the location isn't bad right next to the patco

My girlfriend and I came here for lunch on New Year's Day after spending the night in the city for New Years. They have great options and a wonderful lunch special which gives you a very nice spread of a few options. I tried something I've never had before and it was excellent and so was my girlfriend's lunch special platter.

As you walk in there is a bar, on the smaller side but a fancy size to fit the restaurant, and then the dining tables are set deeper into the building as you walk through the bar area. 

The entire restaurant is very cute and the wait staff was very attentive and courteous. The only reason I leave four stars over five is for the bathrooms. They were clean but not as clean cut as I had expected for how the restaurant looked. They could use a little facelift in my opinion to keep up the classy look of the rest of the restaurant.

If you are in the area you should certainly stop in. I'd love to return and sit at the bar for food and a drink.

Really amazing happy hour!!! 

I stumbled upon this place just walking around through Center City one evening and I'm glad I did. Each visit, I meet an incredible new person, try a new food item and overall just grateful to experience such a great time! 

The staff is phenomenal. Each time I come in, I have a great experience with staff from the host, bartender and management. 

I recommend the Crispy Spinach Chaat and Tikka Naan Pizza!

i was here last night on a date .im not from the city .everything was amazing. lori was so swet and made amazing suggestions.gia was so nice and friendly. can't wait to come back to the city and stop in again

I came here after being told by many people that it's an amazing Indian spot. 

I came here with some friends and inside it is decorated very nicely. The vibes are homey. 

We ordered happy hour drinks which were great and were ready to order our food. What upset me from the start was that our waiter looked at his watch when we told him we needed a minute to finalize our dishes. 

Then after we ordered and our food came, the server dropped my rice all over the table. They apologized, but they did not clean the mess or give me New rice. I assumed they would given the fact that my rice was everywhere and inedible. I waited about 10 minutes but I was forgotten. I had to ask someone to remove the soiled rice and give me new rice. 

Because of the service I received, I couldn't enjoy my meal for what it is. All I remember is that the drinks tasted good HAHA. It's upsetting that there was zero care for my experience overall. 

Maybe it was a bad day, but I had expected better.

I had an extremely sad experience due to the behaviours of the staff. The team wasn't paying attention to the customers , were busy with their own talks and careless. The place was empty, was seated at the bar also was told to try couple of drinks which I didn't like so I politely refused. Later they told me so casually that my computer has an issue so it don't take ur order to kitchen . The male guy told the waitress in front of me to ask me n offer me some drink n "Just asked her whatever she wants" then waitress comes to me says casually i forgot to ring in ur order can we give u some drink. I told them i don't want any drink and then the male guy told me rudely that she is being "courteous" Really ? and then he was extremely rude and called me some unnecessary and not required lines suggesting that it's my fault instead. I had to walk out of the restaurant. This is not expected at an INDIAN restaurant especially because I was there just to grab an indian meal on my birthday.

As a proud Philadelphian foodie, I am honored to write a review of this extraordinary restaurant. Indeblue is at the top of the list of our favorite restaurants on the planet.  Not only is the food fabulous, the staff is the friendliest, most welcoming we have ever experienced. Gia, a manager, not only welcomed us warmly but remembered we had been there a couple of months ago, remembered where we sat and remembered that the friends we brought were from New York! By the way, our friends thought our dinner was one of the best they've er had!

So here is what deliciousness we had tonight: butter chicken poutine, vegetable samosa, tandoori chicken pizza, and fried spiced cauliflower for appetizers. The butter chicken poutine comes in a very hot small cast iron skillet lined with crunchy fries topped with butter chicken and cheese curds. One of my favorite dishes ever. The crunchy vegetable samosa came atop a beautiful plate of chick peas, tomato chutney with a swirl of creme. The cauliflower was crisp and flavorful, as was the pizza with chicken, cheese and grilled onions on top of fresh puffy naan. The  Kashmiri bread was stuffed with coconut and raisins and was delicious!

Main courses were just as amazing.  We had biryani with lobster and shrimp and an amazing raita.  Fabulous! We also had a spicy lamb, chicken in coconut sauce, and sea bass in a creamy spicy sauce.  Even the rice was delicious and plentiful! 

I strongly recommend this extraordinary restaurant!
Unsure as of now but prepandemic they had happy hours ee or less all day at the bar. There are yummy vegan options and some tasty mango cocktails. Great ambiance and friendly staff as well.

Top 5 restaurants in the city. If you like Indian food this is a must check out. We had 6 of us for dinner and tried their tasting menu. We got SO much food and it was all delicious. The pacing of the courses was great, the cocktails were amazing and the wait staff was super friendly and attentive. Definitely recommend the spinach chaat, tikka masala and the laal mass. Plus we had almost 7 BOXES of leftovers so perfect so meals over the next few days....worth the money!
Best Indian food in Pennsylvania period.prices are great the dishs are awesome mines is the fried spinach and crispy califlower.
Awesome Sunday Brunch with mimosa. Strongly recommend for those that like Indian food but are looking for new and fusion alternatives.

I love love love this place. Each time I go I get a different item and they excel at each. Brunch with the besties so I'm going for the pancakes. Oh my my delicious, I'm in heaven. Bacon cooked perfectly. And the server LORI she's amazing. She knows what you want before you do and so kind and patient cause we had a LOT of catching up to do and ran a little over into the turnover service. I come for the food, drinks (try the jalapeño tequila drink Mumbai(?)) and service. Right in the gayborhood and not one to be missed. And if you like mimosas... they got you covered with some great juice combos-- I however go for the liquor. Yum yum always going to get me some! I'll try to remember to take pics next time I'm always diving right in! You should too

Gia & Vipul-thank you for making my 50th Birthday so perfect. Gia was super helpful in putting together a beautiful table & took care of every need of every guest. Vipul was spectacular & served us with utmost care & warmth, given we had so many different needs. I have never been served so well in my 50 years. Food was OUTSTANDING & the 1-2 things we weren't too crazy about were easily overshadowed by the hospitality of Gia & Vipul. Thank you Heather for working with me prior to the event & assigning them for my day.

Great weekend lunch with family and was able to make a reservation a day or 2 ahead of time online even for a larger group of 9. Food wise the appetizers were fantastic like the kale chaat and cauliflower, and the shrimp Thali and chicken + waffles were favorites at the table. The chicken roll was just ok but the French fries were the perfect side. Skip the paneer tikka also but get the mimosa bar for the table and delicious desserts!

I was here last night with a friend and we tried the tasting menu for dinner. Lori suggested some amazing vegetarian appetizers and entrees. She waited in between each course and waited before we finished each course prior to having us order the next one. She was very patient with us and extremely gracious. She clearly loves what she does and is very passionate. This was truly one of the best meals we've had. She even suggested that we not order additional food because the tasting menu would be more than enough. The tasting menu is great value for the amount of food you get. We had a lot of leftovers. The camaraderie between the employees in the restaurant was very strong. We plan on coming here again in the near future to try their brunch.

Truly an amazing experience. We came for a birthday dinner and although there was a delay for our reservation, the staff were very kind and did their best. The food was amazing, I've never had such interesting dishes before. The crispy spinach chaat was my favorite. We did the tasting menu and it's so worth it, because the amount of food and quality exceeds the price. There was a man with short brown hair who was attentive and explained our dishes to us, and we appreciated it because we weren't familiar with a lot of the dishes. Thank you for the wonderful meal, we have such a great time!

After a long day taking in the sights of Philly, we decided that ordering takeout was the way to go. Indian is a favorite of ours, so we decided to give IndeBlue a try. 

Reader, WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED. 

We ordered a preposterous amount of food, and I can tell you that there is literally nothing left (and this isn't just because we are eating our Penn State football feelings).

There was a naan tikka masala pizza--AMAZING.
Mango-pork spring rolls--ALSO AMAZING.
Crab tikki--See above.

Everything arrived, piping hot and perfect, at the hotel, and we retreated to our room to scarf it all up. Every single bite was better than the one before it. And if they were open for table seating right now, we'd already be on our way over there for drinks. 

We are HUGE fans of Indian food and get it when and wherever we can. This is some of the best I've had in as long as I can remember.

Excellent tasting dinner last night. So many wonderful dishes:
Beet salad with greens
Samosas (very good)
Potato cakes (like mini puck-shaped hash browns)
Crispy kale greens (a favorite)
Potato and cauliflower stew 
Pork spring rolls (bit dry)
Lamb stew (good)
Chicken (good)
Shrimp (good)
Brussels sprouts (outstanding)
3 desserts: a milky rice pudding with pistachio crumbles; an Indian "donut" poached in sweet syrup, and a little chocolate mousse/gelato with blackberry ans whipped cream)

Drinks were good too: ginger cocktail, nice selection of wines and whiskies 
Service was very attentive and friendly

This is the best meal I've ever had in my life!! We arrived for an early reservation to take advantage of the happy hour drink specials, and split the taster menu between 3 with enough for leftovers for tomorrow to take home. Truly exceptional salad, brussel sprouts, cauliflower, chicken, spinach and cheese naan, honestly everything. The cocktails were exquisite as well. I have a new favorite restaurant and will certainly be back.

They charged you more money. Check your credit card! Stay away!!

My friends and I chose this place for my birthday celebration. It turned out to be the worst eating experience in our lives.

1.They kept us waiting for 30+ minutes just to order food until we asked them to get our server 2 times. We were very unhappy with the waiting since the tables were half empty that night. 

2. Taking food away from you while you are still eating. When we were still eating, they started to take the food away from our table. We said that we were still eating, but the server argued that they would close in 45 minutes. We looked around and found that other tables were eating as well. Some of them were ordering desserts. Why dont you take their plates as well? Why allowing other tables to order desserts if you are closing? 


3. They charged you different from the receipt. If you think unreasonable waiting time and taking food away from you are bad enough, you have to check your credit card to get the full horrible eating experience: they charged more money than we wrote on the receipt, which we found out 3 days after from our bank account. What a thief!
So good. Can't wait to go back! Loved their Brussel sprouts and cauliflower! Great service too.

When I think about potential dining spots in Philly, Indian would never come to mind. But here we are perusing Yelp and seeing these amazing reviews for IndeBlue, so we had to try it out!

Loves:
+ Yummy Indian food (our faves were the Lamb Chops ($15 for half rack) and Pork Vindaloo ($23) 
Friendly staff who accommodated our "please make this marg extra spicy with some chilis" request (lol)
+ Good value on drinks ($12 for most cocktails)

I don't have Indian often but I am so glad to have eaten here! I would totally come back here again and recommend it to others too. Thanks so much, IndeBlue! :)

Absolutely in love with IndeBlue. I am Indian American and I struggle to find authentic Indian restaurants. IndeBlue is the exception--I proudly rate it 5 stars for taste, quality, decor, and service. 
Walking into the restaurant, it is centrally located downtown and has a beautiful vibe. I love the huge gold center piece. The menu had unique cocktails that I definitely wanted to try.
