I fell in love with the sangria chai--I have never before tasted a mix of red wine and masala chai but it was luxurious and velvety, there is nothing like it out there! 
Next, our waiter Vipul was extremely kind and gracious in helping us decide what to order. He checked in on us several times during the meal. I had briefly mentioned that I was craving masala chai and he personally brought out two cups for us to have on the house!! I was so happy with his service, I was proud to give him a high tip :) thank you! 
The food was so fresh, including the perfumed rice. I felt very good about the quality, especially for the price!! Very well priced restaurant. If I lived nearby, I would dine several times a month! 
Please order the banana Nirvana dessert, it is essentially like banana bread donuts with ice cream, just fantastic.
Thank you for such a wonderful meal, one of the best I've ever had!

business.name: Iozzo's Garden of Italy
business.categories: Italian, Restaurants

reviews.text:
We have loved this spot since our first visit, and make it our go to 'fancy' Italian place for celebrations and romantic nights out. Located off a busy downtown street there is free parking along the road and we never have to fight to find a spot. The entrance is a bit unassuming but once you are seated the ambience is like a quaint Italian villa.

We usually have reservations as it can be quite busy so if you are going forward dinner it is recommended. Tonight we were early but they seated us anyway in a spot near the back.

Our waiter, Gregory, was very knowledgeable about the menu and a delightful host for the evening. On Wednesdays they have half priced wine if served by the glass so we had some Prosecco which went nicely with our entrees.

The menu is constantly changing with seasonal updates and new housemate pastas with delectable sauces. They also have the house favorites as well as some new sides so there is plenty to choose from no matter how often you come for a meal.

We chose a side of fried Russell sprouts and a side of cauliflower. The Brussels sprouts were nicely fried with a light sauce which was delicious. The cauliflower was good and the cheese sauce was light and tangy. I'd probably not get the cauliflower again even though it was good, as the Brussels sprouts were much tastier to us.

Each entree ones with a house salad that has the best dressing! Of course there is also bread with oil and tomato and herbs so it felt as if we had more than plenty!

My e tree was a butternut squash with roasted sage and pumpkin seeds in a house made pasta. The pasta was so thin it was crispy and held the butternut squash like in a pocket. It was amazing and the brown butter sauce complimented the flavors. I could have done with a bit more filling in my pasta as I didn't get much squash flavor, but it was delicious. My husband had the ricotta gnocchi which was full of flavor and very light and airy. We heard them say it is made of ricotta instead of potato starch which gives it the light feel. He said the sauce was heaven, and he would absolutely get that entree again.

Our waiter kindly remembered we were celebrating my birthday early so brought a gelato with a candle as a treat. So kind! Plus the perfect end to the meal!

This is one of my favorite spots in Indy and I love going there as the food, ambience and service are amazing. If you haven't been I highly recommend it!

This a delightful restaurant for those cold winter months when you are craving something rich and comforting. The menu is creative, with the chef adding little interesting flairs, like salmon roe on crab tortelli. Everything we tried was delicious, so it's hard to go wrong. I especially enjoyed the toasted ravioli. This is Indianapolis' best kept secret, so make a reservation for a special occasion and you won't regret it. 

Also, the service is impeccable. The staff are welcoming in the formal way that is common in more upscale restaurants. It's almost theatrical, except that it feels sincere, like all they want to do is please you and make your visit a shining memory in the ashes of covid. Speaking of which, they do take out. Treat yourself and keep this gem sparkling!

Absolutely everything we ate was delicious! We ordered the ravioli & cheese bread to start and the lasagna and veal parmigiana for entree. The food was so tasty, pasta was handmade, & the sauce was rich and flavorful. The tiramisu cheesecake was great as well, very light & creamy. I haven't been to many Italian restaurants in here in Indy, but this place is in my top 3. I don't have anything to complain about.
Really great find in Indy. They found us seats despite being super busy. Phil at the bar was outstanding despite the hectic nature of the night. Food was over the top awesome.

We had excellent service last night. From the front door greeting through the dessert and limoncello we were impressed with the staff. 

I had the short rib with pasta. It is as amazing. The pasta was fresh and lite. The short rib was perfect. Also had the chocolate dessert. Again delicious. 

My hubs didn't like his nearly as much but it was still good. Ricotta Gnocci. 

The kids had pizza and fettuccine Alfredo. They are most of the Alfredo. The pizza was a bit greasy. 

We will make this a tradition. Overall 5 stars. Yum.
Excellent service. Adorable restaurant. Incredible food. Try the lasagna or the pesto fettuccine.

So I went back and ordered the special truffle pasta for a special event dinner. They didn't really do anything for the event, which was a let down a bit, but not a big issue. The bigger problem was that the pasta was nearly $30 for the special, and truly tasted like buttered noodles. They mentioned that the pasta was great and light, but it just tasted bland. Also I understand the issues that come with eating outside, but there was a never ending number of flies while eating on the patio, and I wish they had a better way of controlling that with traps or something. After the monumental bill and having a larger party with only 1/4 enjoying our meal, unfortunately won't be coming back for a date night.

This place was fantastic!  We started out with the fried ravioli which was delicious.  My wife had the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and mushrooms which she loved.  I had the lasagna bolognese and it was out of this world.  Wish we could take Iozzo's back to Tennessee with us.  If you want real Italian this is it!

This place is my go-to for special occasions, out of towner visits, and any other lame excuse I need to treat myself.  You walk in the door to wooden floors with years of wear and care.  You are immediately greeted by the family-owned restaurant warmth you would expect from an aunt who is so happy you are finally visiting.   Head out the back door to a downtown oasis of flowers and water features with patio heaters for the fall chill.  The drink menu may leave you scratching your head because it's difficult to choose between an Aperol Spritz made with limoncello or a Manhattan with smoked ice.  Make your way to the apps.  Fritto misto lightly battered and crunchy, sausage stuffed dates, and a full page of goodness awaits.  The dinner menu has something for everyone.  This place has been a local favorite for many.  Kudos Katie Harris and family form making Iozzo's a memorable place for the people we love.

Finally I had the pleasure of eating at Iozzo's. Every time devour would come around I would say I was coming here and never did. Well it was a random Saturday night last month when I decided to come. I did not make a reservation like I should have and of course the place was packed. The host let me know it was about an hour wait to sit in the actual dining area or I could sit at the bar. I was okay to sit at the bar and there was literally two seats in the middle for me and my friend to sit. It was a very tight squeeze since the bar was full as well but we made it work. The fella at the bar which I forgot his name was very pleasant. He acknowledge us right away and even gave us suggestions on different menu items. We ordered drinks first my friend got a cosmo and I got the venetian breeze. The bartender warned me that the venetian breeze is one of the sweetest drinks and he was right. It kind of reminded me of hi-c but with alcohol added. I liked it! I ordered the caesar salad and chicken marsala. I'm sorry I don't remember what my friend ordered. I am literally going to start taking notes when I go out with others. I know she did not complain and actually finished her meal. Me on the other hand needed a to go box. The chicken marsala was good and the chicken breast were huge. I loved the wine sauce and mushrooms. The caesar salad was just okay to me not a huge fan of the dressing. I probably would get a different salad if I came back. We were too full for desserts unfortunately. Above all I think the place is nice and its actually not near a lot of other businesses. It was easy to find street parking. When summer comes back around I hope I can come back to dine in the outdoor area.

Visiting from PHL - started w a classic martini using Wheatley (Buffalo Trace) vodka and lemon twist - it was perfectly done. Not usually a fan of Caesar vinaigrette but theirs was nice, good salad.  The star of the show was the spaghetti w meatball w Diablo sauce - wow - that sauce with meatball is outstanding!  I am a chili head and this sauce hit the mark w it's spiciness - above avg spice w smoky hint.  I will w/o a doubt be back here - thank you!

Absolutely love this place. There is so much to Bragg about. Number1- the food was amazing. I took my husband here for his birthday and we both were very pleased with our dinner. Number2- The service. Our waitress was Nikki. We absolutely appreciate you. She isn't like any boring waitress. She's extremely knowledgeable and has a great personality. Our reservations were a bit late, but she treated us like any other customers. There was no rush or anything. On the contrary, Nikki went above an beyond with us. She even gave us a slight tour of the restaurant, due to the little history behind it. Thank you Nikki. Last but not least, the history behind the restaurant is amazing. Nikki was able to tell us a little bit about how it started and the back story on the owner. If you're intrigued, I highly recommended to stop by sometime and enjoy.

Loved eating here! Super cute patio with a fountain and a *cottage core* aesthetic. Service was friendly and fast. Not a place for crazy cocktails but the drinks we had were well made! Overall, amazing food, generous portions, reasonable prices. Will definitely return.

Make a reservation for as soon as you can. It's delicious! 

My boyfriend offered the Alfredo and said it was the best he has ever had. I ordered the shrimp Linguine and YUM! Strong lemon flavor, and this was the best shrimp I've had in Indiana. 

Drinks were great too. Italian margarita was strong, but so worth it.  

Great wait staff too. Highly recommend coming here.

I've been to Iozzo's twice now and enjoyed both times very much. The dining area was crowded but we lucked out and they had a table on the gorgeous patio. If you have never sat on the patio you're missing a treat. The patio is cozy with an abundance of plants, a fountain, brick patio floor and walls and umbrella's on each table. It is very romantic outside as well as the inside. Go soon before the weather becomes nasty and cold.

Our first visit was terrific and we sat on the gorgeous patio for the first time. I had the Chicken Diablo which was spicy, very flavorful with a gentle kick of heat and spices. My husband had the Spaghetti and Meatballs. He enjoyed the Meatballs but thought the sauce lacked spice and not worth the price.

My second trip was a beautiful, fall day and I sat in the the inviting little garden behind Iozzo's. I started with the Italian Margarita which was full of flavors.

Next, I had the tasty Basil Cheese Bread served with marinara sauce. The bread is soft, topped with butter and cheese and lightly toasted. A wonderful selection!

My entree was the lunch size Chicken Marsala served with a house salad and a side of spaghetti. The chicken was topped with mushrooms and a wine sauce and was very tender. The Spaghetti was alright but did lack spices. The Salad was fresh and crisp topped with a generous out of Parmesan Cheese.

The dessert was fabulous with Italian Coffee and a slice of Tiramisu. Both were amazing and the Cheesecake was the perfect end to a delicious meal.

Our server, Dale, was a 10 if I could post it. He was the only server on the patio and we wanted for nothing. He was a very professional, polite, knowledgeable and timely server. He boxed up all three of my left overs, returned with fresh coffee and answered several questions.

Ignore the bland looking front of the building and find a spot on the street to park. You'll be glad you did. The inside is beautiful with lots of dark wood and a large bar.

Great atmosphere. We came on a Saturday night without a reservation and we were offered a seat at the bar. It was so friendly and the staff were very accommodating. We had the garlic bread which was unique and an order of lasagna and an order of spaghetti. We will definitely be back!

I'm giving two stars instead of 1 for the amazing atmosphere. The decor inside and outside was very nice and fit the Italian restaurant. However, the food was just bad. The marinated olives were very dry and had too much lemon flavor. The pasta carbonara was very bland. A member of my party loves pizza and was not a fan of their pepperoni pizza. The lasagna Bolognese was terrible. Loved the atmosphere and I expected to love the food based on reviews and my love for Italian food, but I would never go back here again.

This place my have ruin it for me going to any other Italian restaurant! We sat in what I believe was their best table - outside, under the stars, next to the fountain! It could not have been more perfect! We started out with Bruschetta followed by homemade Cannoli! Then we finished with Gnocchi and Lemon Chicken Piccata!  To make the night even better, there was live music too! I can't wait to go back!

Celebrated our anniversary and had an exceptional dining experience. The entire evening was great. The outdoor patio was relaxing and quaint. The staff were friendly and helpful. Best Italian cuisine in Indy.

We were in Indianapolis for my birthday.  I wanted to eat at a local Italian restaurant.  I looked on yelp and found 2 places nearby us. It was still early for dinner but we were hungry.  This place opened at 4 so I gave them a call to get a reservation.  They said they were totally booked up for the evening but we could come and eat at the bar. When we arrived at 4 there was one couple being seated in the restaurant ahead of us...no others sitting in there.  They were super friendly and seated us at the bar. The bartender was great, told us about the menu, etc. We split the Lasagna Bolognese and ordered an extra salad. It was all excellent.  And since it was my birthday they let me pick a dessert off the dessert menu. 
 There were still many empty tables in the restaurant when we left. Several people were seated at the bar during this time. 
I was really confused as to why there were so many open tables if they were booked with reservations. It is the only reason I gave it a 4 star rating.
Great food and service! The gnocchi is tremendous. This is one of our favorite spots.

I cannot describe the love I have for this place. About 3 years ago, my husband and I were looking for a nice place to eat for our anniversary and stumbled upon Iozzo's. It is now officially our anniversary tradition to go here! I also always choose it for my birthday dinner. 

The food is soooo good!! Ive had multiple things on the menu and not only is it delicious, the portion sizes are fair. You have to try the garlic bread and the black and bleu gnocchi for sure! 

The staff is also so nice. They are knowledgeable about the menu and very helpful with any questions you have. I've never had a bad experience with any of the wait staff. 

Things I would recommend: make a reservation! Every time we gone we are glad we made a reservation. Also request to sit in the courtyard! It is beautiful and very comfortable - definitely a fun atmosphere in the summertime. 

Overall a great place!

This quaint Italian restaurant is excellent. Last night I had the cheese ravioli and added sausage - incredible. We started with the Antipasta plate, which was delicious. The service is great too. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but holy cow is it good. Probably my favorite Italian place in Indy.

One of Indy's hidden gems. Some of the best Italian cuisine in the Midwest. Iozzo's is an Indianapolis staple with so much history. It was fun to learn that old location used to be where now seats the JW Marriott. 

The servers were excellent, and nothing could beat the outdoor seating on a beautiful summer evening. Prices are fair and street parking is available right on South Meridian. Highly recommend!!!

Wow, absolutely delish. We had the mushroom arancini--YUMMY. I had the lasagna w/meatballs, and my BF had the gnocchi. We both loved BOTH dishes. The meatballs are tender and ACTUALLY have flavor (so many places think that b/c the meatball goes into sauce you don't have to actually flavor the meat!). Lasagna was tender and cheesy. The gnocchi were amazing. 

Also, the riesling they carry is delicious, and my BF likes the "Italian donkey," which is like an Italian moscow mule. 

We cannot wait to go back!

business.name: Taste Bar
business.categories: Dive Bars, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Food, Tapas Bars, Specialty Food

reviews.text: So much fun packed into such a small venue. May want to come a little early for a seat. Bartenders are creative and knowledgable. Tasty, but elevated "bar bites" make it easy to keep cocktails flowing. I enjoyed all the drinks that were made for me specially. Very cozy atmosphere. Will be back

My friends and I were lucky enough to sit in the upstairs dining table room for an early dinner. Such a cozy and chic ambience, excellent cocktails, and solid food options. Enjoyed the mussels and the fries (they were really good)

We celebrated our first anniversary at Taste and it was a perfect way to begin our celebration. The staff was so kind and provided great recommendations for drinks and food. The atmosphere is romantic and perfect for a date night or meeting with friends. They even offered us complimentary glasses of champagne when we first sat down and gelato later as a first anniversary gift. Every cocktail we had was delicious and unique - unlike anything we've had elsewhere. The service was attentive but not overbearing. Can't recommend this place enough...we will be back!

So glad taste has opened back up! We went for my birthday once again and it was a perfect night. The host was great, the waitress was great. Service was simply excellent all around. We shared a few drinks (all delicious and beautifully presented). We split a few dishes -the chicken wings, the crudité, and the pork belly. There wasn't a single weak spot- each dish was excellent. 
I often make my own pickles at home but the plate of perfectly blanched green beans, a slightly curry flavored collection of carrots, spicy bread and butter pickles and fried artichokes came together so well. It was a great variety of flavor and texture. The pesto style dip served with was simple and a nice compliment. 
The chicken wings were huge! Big portion with a perfect crunch and wonderful flavor. However I was grateful I was eating with my partner. These are tricky to eat in any graceful way so maybe not a first date order. 
The pork belly was cooked so well and the glaze on it was also so so tasty. I loved the pickled banana peppers and onions that came with. It was a great contrast to the rich pork belly. 
They kindly brought out a complimentary birthday dessert with a candle. It was so sweet. The dessert was a lemon gelato (maybe ice cream?) and was tart, sweet and a great finish to our meal. They didn't rush us at all and made sure we were comfortable with our table upon arrival (inside, outside, our pandemic nerves were handled well). 
Last note because I just can't help myself from sharing...
The table next to us was a bachelorette party and the bride threw up all over the table at about 6:30. The staff was so kind to her and accommodating to us. They offered to let us switch tables but thankfully we had finished up. They let us sign the check outside and I was very grateful (cause stinky). I was really impressed with the way they handled that messy situation. 
Welcome back Taste! I can't wait to return.

I really wanted to love this place, but I couldn't get past zero happy hour on a Thursday at 5:30 pm. I had read previous reviews and Google info about their happy hour, but note they don't currently offer one. The pickled vegetable smell was overwhelming at the bar area, and the drinks were expensive. We chose not to stay for another drink or food.

Super glad that Taste is back after more than one year of close due to Covid! The bartender's choice cocktail was super fun that you can choose the spirits and flavors you like and they would just make the magic happen! Fries is our all time favorite! The best we've ever have and a must for every visit! The ice box pie were very special and delicious too

Talk about romantic! I've been on a few dates here and this place never disappoints! Even if the date was bad, the ambiance alone will make up for it! The food is good and the eclectic drinks are even better! Top notch spot!!!
I have a great time when I am here - there drinks are really good - my only complaint is sometimes their wait staff is snobbish - it isn't all of them, but the the vibe is there.

Okay, this was a bit pricey but absolutely worth it. The duck fat carrots were probably one of the most transformative dishes I have ever tasted. I have always said cooked carrots were, "meh," but after this I was left wondering if I just had one of the best dishes I've ever had! Would highly recommend.

If you're looking for a unique and fun atmosphere, you'll absolutely have it here. You immediately feel like this is a place you've been coming to for years, drinks and service were amazing. However, the food here is off the charts. I am not a fan of Brussel sprouts, however these were some of the best veggies I've ever eaten. The menu is unique and creative with dishes that you won't find anywhere else. We will be frequenting this place again
Great atmosphere and the cocktails are unique and delicious. It's my favorite place to go on a date, and they have a pretty decent happy hour, too!

What a disappointing start to a hopeful night. Way to be assholes about opening at 5. There's a hospitable way to treat someone who shows up at 5 till opening and your horn rimmed hipster didn't nail it.
Great drinks to pare with some great small plates. Me and my daughter came for her 21st. Thanks for setting the bar high for any boyfriend to top that date night.
Love this place! Very tasty and great atmosphere. Great cocktails. Can't wait to go back.

Weather was wet and snowy, so the bar was pretty sparse when we arrived for pre-dinner drinks. The bartender was incredibly friendly, greeting us immediately when we sat down. When we explained that we were newcomers, she started asking us what we usually ordered and suggested some things on the menu for us. I ordered a Henry Brown Never Dies on her suggestion and it was a really unique drink! I could taste the ginger, cloves spice through the liquors and it had a hint of an anise flavor that thankfully wasn't overwhelming. It was also in a beautiful, chilled glass. Ambience was intimate and romantic, so perfect for a date night. The food smelled amazing and next time we're back, we plan on grabbing dinner there too!

First time experience (recommended by the wonderful Mick at The Last Hotel).  Very warm, relaxed, atmosphere with extremely skilled, fun and conversational bartenders (Will and Adrian). Drink menu extremely well done including classic cocktails from Circa 1800 all through the decades.  The small/large plate menu is creative and scrumptious... the wings, the fries, the beats....  what may sound so simple reading when the menu is OMG!!! Hats off to the chefs who have reinvented these traditional apps!!! Will be back for sure!!

What a disappointment! I ordered one of the special cocktails "only a shadow" listed under "herbal spicy and savory" but it was sweet and watery. My friend ordered Tom Collins and it was overly sweet. She asked for less sugary and it came back completely sugarless, just sour and bitter. The three small plates: tempura mushrooms: a disaster. All you taste is soy sauced fried shell. Chicken wing: same soy sauced shell and dry and almost woody meat. The bacon fat carrots was the only thing ok for me but my friend couldn't bring herself to like it. We wonder what's all the fuzz about it. Don't waste your money and time here.

Taste Bar, you blew me away last night. I've always known you were good, but last night was exceptional. My cocktails were masterfully prepared, the fries were crisp and plentiful and my scallops were scrumptious. It was a night of pure perfection. 

I may over over indulged in the cocktails, but after the smoothness and perfection of my first one, I just wanted more and more. I started out with my usual, a Manhattan. The bartender asked if I wanted it up or on the rocks, I choose up. It was served chilled perfectly, and the mixture of the bourbon, vermouth, with the bitters was spot on. It was a perfect cocktail to sip as I munched on my fries. 

Now let's talk about those fries. OMG! They were served in a bowl and piled as high as the rafters. When they were placed in front of me, I could hear Diana Ross singing, Ain't No Mountain High Enough. There were so many crispy shoestring type fries, that I asked a young lady seated next to me if she'd like to share. She graciously accepted, which I was thankful for, as it was way to much for even this foodie. 

My next  cocktail was my second most ordered, an Old Fashioned. My heart skipped a beat, as it was absolutely the best Old Fashioned I've had in STL. It was severed with one large cylinder type ice cube and a sliver of orange peel. It was so smooth and refreshing. It went perfectly with my Scallops. 

Anyone who knows me well, knows I have a deep love for Scallops. They are my absolute favorite seafood. I follow TB on FB and when I saw they had added them as an entree to their menu, I got here as fast as my work and social schedule would let me. 

My entree was six huge sea scallops, I prefer sea over bay. I'm going to give it to you straight from the menu - XO marmalade, cornbread-pistachio crumble, celery root pumpkin seed oil. Let me tell you, the crumble had my toes curling and my taste-buds doing a happy dance. The menu also tells you that, "large plates" requires a longer cooking time. Trust me, it is well worth the wait. Enjoy a cocktail as you wait, it really isn't that long. 

For dessert, I had another cocktail. If they did a masterful job with a Manhattan and a Old Fashioned, I had to see what they'd do with a Sazerac. I've traveled to the City of New Orleans where this cocktail is famous and those bartenders need to come try one at TB to see how they're suppose to be done. It was a wonderful finale to a great meal. 

The young man seated next to me enjoyed a Pork Burger and when it was presented to him, I couldn't resist taking a picture. I'm a Yelper, it just comes natural. He asked me if I've had on before and I assured him that I had, but my heart belongs to scallops. 

Being seated at the bar as usual, both bartenders on duty were friendly and attentive to all of us. I appreciate their friendliness and professionalism. 

I'll be back? - Absolutely 

When: December 13, 2019
Why: Scallops now a featured Large Plate

Love the ambience. The brasserie old fashioned is a top notch drink best around. They took care of our party of 6 with easy. Staff was very friendly and answered everything we asked. Was a wonderful night and highly recommend.

Oh my gosh this place! What a gem! We were staying nearby in town for the hospital next door and decided to drop by around 5:30pm on a Saturday. They were so welcoming and accommodating. Best French fries we've ever had?! Is that possible? Yes! Chicken wings and Burrata squash toast with goat cheese were on point. Cocktails did not disappoint. Ordered an off menu ginger pear martini and the bartender made it happen. Lovely understated decor and excellent staff that doesnt hover but gives 5 star service. Go visit this place right now.
So good. Food was delicious. Many options for drinks. Great small plates. Ask for Jack the bartender and sit at the bar if you can! Great service.

Taste Bar is an incredible cocktail bar. They have delicious fries and I highly recommend the brussels sprouts. However, they have very limited entree options. With two entrees to choose from - (a pork burger and brick chicken), this isn't really a place you can eat at too often. My partner and I both love fries and brussels sprouts, unfortunately, both are fat-heavy dishes, and we find ourselves choosing other cocktail bars due to the lack of menu items at Taste. 
The other update I wanted to tack onto my original review can be construed as both a positive and a negative. Taste frequently updates their drink offerings, which is awesome if you love trying new cocktails. Unfortunately, it's sad to see your favorite drinks disappear from the menu over time. 
My final verdict? Taste is the perfect destination for trying creative, unique and high-end cocktails. You won't find drinks like these anywhere else. However, if you are hungry, eat somewhere first, because there won't be much to choose from.

Taste is the perfect place to pick up a few snacks and have a wonderful conversation, all while having exquisite cocktails. There's a drink for everyone here; if you can't find one, they'll create something just for you! Every time I've been here, the staff knows exactly what to recommend. I've never been led astray. The atmosphere is warm and cozy.

I wanted apps for dinner and was craving a cheese plate and charcuterie board, and taste gave me exactly what I needed. The cheese plate came with three types of cheeses, a blue, a hard cheddar (I think), and a soft Brie. To accompany it, plenty of crispy thin slices of baguette and raisins. 
The charcuterie came with tiny pickles, grainy mustard, and three types of cured meats. Service was wonderful and very accommodating. Very chill environment.

Taste is a lovely place for a meal and a proper cocktail, which I would love to try next time!

Michael the bartender was a cocktail wizard.. he made five outstanding drinks for us one night. One of my favorite was the cucumber dill. I ordered a Manhattan and didn't suit my taste.. so he asked me a few questions and remade me a cocktail that I would like, but using whiskey because I was trying to experiment with whiskey. He's a real kind soul and good at what he does. 
And Their roasted Brussel sprouts are a must try.

business.name: Great Full Gardens - South
business.categories: Restaurants, Vegetarian, American (New), Cafes, Sandwiches, Breakfast & Brunch

reviews.text: Cheesy bruschetta is my favorite Since it is always crowded inside, I usually do take-out these days. I love this place because I love eating something light and healthy. The only thing that tastes a little weird was the burger. I am not sure if they forgot the sauce but there was literally no sauce in the burger.

Fresh, delicious food! A lot of it sourced locally. Can't go wrong here! We ate there while my kids were in town. My eldest is a vegan. She did not go hungry. I am not a vegan, and neither did I! If you are vegetarian/vegan (yes, I understand the difference), gluten free (like I have to be), or a meat lover, everyone is invited to the table.

TLDR;
Honestly, this is one of my favorite restaurants of all time! I wish we had one of these restaurants in the Las Vegas area. What makes this restaurant so great is the high-quality ingredients, great service, and well-cooked food. Anything you order here will be delicious and cooked to order. One of my favorite things is as well is that this is the perfect restaurant to eat with a group of vegans and non-vegans as there is a little bit for everyone without compromising menu, flavor, and freshness. I highly recommend trying any of their three locations in the Reno/Sparks area. 

Service
Our server was fast and friendly. The server was also able to confidently answer any/all the questions I had about their vegan food and vegan modified options. 

Environment
The restaurant has a huge dining area with tables of different sizes. Even though there are a lot of tables they are still well spaced apart to avoid it feeling cramped. They also have a lot of art and pictures on the wall. 

Food

Jackfruit BBQ Sandwich
This sandwich was nearly perfect at replicating a pulled pork sandwich. The jackfruit was flaky and pulled apart like you would expect pork too. With the sauce and texture, if my eyes were closed I don't think I could tell the difference. The roll was fresh and crispy and a perfect texture compliment to the sandwich. I thought the sauce was just a little tad too sweet but overall a very good sandwhich.
Really like this place, however, in the winter this place is cold and drafty. Please turn up the heat

My Aunt and I visited recently and we both remarked on seeing Gino sweep, serve, talk with staff and customers. We come from a family of restaurateurs and know the value in owner dedication and support. It was great to see. And the food? Delicious. Warm and healthy meals on a cold and snowy day.

We go there a lot and the food and service are consistently very good!
I like the Bedazzle for breakfast and the Pizza ala Bizmark for dinner.
My favorite restaurant!!!! Thank you Sawyer for being YOU and representing Great Full Gardens.

Good quality food in general... but i ordered take out from here solely because of their heirloom caprese dish, and the tomatoes def weren't heirloom which was REALLY disappointing. I don't like grocery store tomatoes and it's exactly what they were. It's a pretentious, dishonest and misleading move that makes me not ever want to come back because who knows what other ingredients they are being misleading about. I get heirloom tomatoes are seasonal, but let's of farmers markets have them this late in the season. Why not simply note when they are out of season, for you, if that's the excuse you use.

I love going in the early morning and watching the sun rise over the mountains while I eat one of their hearty waffles. Their fresh squeezed OJ is the best in town! They also have some creative dishes like a fruit omelet- not sure about that, even after trying;)

I love everything about this place.  As someone else mentioned, this is my favorite of all the Great Full Gardens.  Everyone here is very friendly and welcoming.  My husband and I love the vibe here and we are especially fond of the mushroom tea, it's so tasty and makes you feel so good. We come here at least every couple of weeks as it's a bit of a trek from our home, but it's worth the drive.  We are exploring the menu and we have tried many different appetizers and entrees and they have all been very good.  We love the hummus appetizer and order that often, it's such a good combination of excellent hummus, vegetables, olives, etc.  We also like the Stuffed Shrooms and the Smoked Salmon Rollups.  We have ordered sandwiches, bowls and dinners and it's all very good.  Sometimes we order vegetarian, sometimes we don't, but we are never, ever disappointed.  The one thing that we order every time we come is the Banana Split Liege waffle.  So tasty.
My go to spot for grilled cheese with ham on gluten free bread and tomato soup! Always amazing and no gluten reaction (for fellow celiacs) I'll add pics next time

Variety variety variety here. So many choices and any dish I have chosen has always been a good choice. Salads are very large and the toppings are bountiful. Soup is amazing. Burgers are very good. Again I've never had anything but good food here. 
The staff- very friendly! I've always had a very friendly waiter or waitress. 
So I guess what I'm saying you cannot go wrong choosing Great Full Gardens-South. I'm so happy this place is nearby.

Saturday lunch, a bit of a wait for a table but worth it. A clean, cute restaurant, a tad loud because it was BUSY with good reason- staff is so welcoming and friendly, great selection on the menu, and simply delicious! 

Had a tuna melt on sourdough and it was toasted just right with melty cheddar, red onions, and green leaf lettuce. Super satisfying!


I might become a regular here!

I love great full gardens! I have NEVER had a waiter/waitress I did not want to be friends with (is that weird) ahaha. My daughter was a little fussy last time we came in and the waiter brought us avocado on the house. I mean come on. Avocado on the house?! Everyone knows you get up-charged for avocado! He also gave me a free cookie because it was a few days after my birthday - lol! I loooove the papusa. I believe you can get it a breakfast way and lunch way. Their menu is super thorough and they have all the vegan and organic options you could ever ask for. Most vegan options you can adjust to add meat to and vice versa. I also love their kombucha drinks both alcoholic and non. Love this place!!
Love this restaurant. Food and service is always great. I always visit the South Reno restaurant. Gets busy during lunch time, but they have plenty of seating.

I'm a fan of the teriyaki bowls; great flavors, especially with shrimp.
Great atmosphere!

Out of all the Great Full Gardens in Reno, I have to say that this is probably my favorite of the bunch. I've loved being able to try out more of the plant-based, organic specialty restaurants in town, and my last experience here was definitely a good one.

Mostly because with my take-out order, nothing was missing and everything tasted amazing - where I've now discovered my favorite meal to order from this place.

Perusing their extensive menu for the visibly labeled vegan options, I went with their Wasabi Vegetable Bowl ($13) and it was amazing! A power bowl of sauteed kale, broccoli, spinach, brown rice, cucumber, avocado, and their house wasabi dressing. I added a side of white beans ($1) for protein since the bowl was missing a bit of that, and my god was it delicious. I loved the dressing the best and am now trying to recreate it at home.

I also ordered a vegan Snickerdoodle Cookie ($4) which was a lot more crumbly than I would have liked compared to other cookies. The flavors were there but it was a bit messy to eat.

There's seriously something here for all diets so if you are looking for a plant friendly spot with great flavors, this is the spot to go.

Friday lunch--
Plenty of parking in the shared lot. 
We were seated right away, but time between then and our orders being taken was 20+ minutes. 
The place was pretty busy and no one from our party was in a huge rush so no big deal, but if you're on a time crunch, I'd suggest coming when it's not as busy. 
Chips were served warm with the dips to give a nice "fresh out of the oven/fryer" taste. 
There's something for everyone on their extensive menu, and seems like you can't really go wrong with anything you order.
My rule of thumb is to usually order something I can't make myself at home, so that's how I decided on the pupusa. It was flavorful and just the right size for lunch. 
Everyone else enjoyed their dishes as well, so I'll definitely be back to explore more of the menu. 

The staff were all super friendly, even though you can tell they were getting slammed, so please remember to have patience when you dine in at any restaurants at this time because the service industry is extremely understaffed!

Great 2nd location across from Renown South Meadows. Large and spacious with great servers and other staff. We ordered crab cakes, half a grilled cheese sandwich/ homemade tomato soup combo, and a double edge tri-tip paleo bowl. I had the paleo bowl with delicious Brussel sprouts, kale and other veggies. Best bowl meal I've had- ever. 
Server got extra for being really polite and helpful. The artwork on the walls was nice and is available for purchase.

An eclectic menu, with loads of interesting dishes, well prepared and tasty with good service at a reasonable price. What's not to like?  Best thing is their staff, energetic, attentive and friendly. Give yourself a treat and try it. Sundays they serve breakfast all day, my favorite meal!

This place is soooooo good!  All four of us are vegan and their plant based options were amazing.  Several in the party ordered salads.  I had the reuben with homemade sauerkraut. The lentil soup was super flavorful and we got some vegan cookies to go.  There are plenty of options in all categories, but we were just looking for a light lunch.  The ambiance and service were also great.  We will definitely be back!

Stopped in and was looking forward to a garden fresh salad.  Got seated extremely fast then just sat.   .and sat ..and sat.  Service is a pet peeves and plenty of staff, not that busy.....just ignored.  Sorry but this was a fail. Went next door and got sushi.   Hopefully next might be better.

Who and where's the manager? Service was the worst, was seated at 11:40am and waited 10 minutes before anyone came to the table. Ordered right away as we knew what we wanted already, there was a few more customers that came in after us who were seated. Well 30 minutes went by and the waitress never came back to check on us or the food. 40 minutes after our order I asked her to check on the food, mind you my wife ordered a wasabi bowl and I ordered waffles, eggs, and bacon. Finally 50 minutes after we order we get our food, I was upset but how embarrassing it is to sit there waiting while the other tables seated after you get there food. My wife was upset she began to cry during our lunch hour. The guy who I think was a manager said we're short staffed, excuse me but what does that have to do with being an observant manager or server knowing how long a table is waiting and checking in on the food and patrons? We are all about the service and this was an epic fail on management as it looked like the ship was sinking. A guy at the coffee bar got up and walked out saying he was going to tell Gino about him, who Gino is I don't know.

Who knew healthy organic could be this good? One taste and you'll be a fan. Great Full Gardens is a local chain that is consistently excellent. This visit, started with sesame seared ahi appetizer to share. Followed with fresh greens salad and signature tomato soup options.  We both had sea bass that was perfectly cooked over rice with asparagus side.  Justin and EC were fun and informative in addition to providing top notch service.  Nicely done at all levels.

We have always had great food here. Sometimes I think the bowls could use more flavor but if you add an egg or something additional it can be enough! The service is always friendly and we haven't experienced a wait time which is nice when you're hungry!

business.name: Chubby Cattle
business.categories: Restaurants, Bars, Seafood, Japanese, Hot Pot, Nightlife, Chinese, Conveyor Belt Sushi, Mongolian, Asian Fusion

reviews.text:
Went on a bustling Tuesday night. Our waitress an was amazing. She found the time to fill up our water at least three times in between all her busy tables. The food marched the quality of her servide.
The lamb was the star or the Broadway show that was this meal. Thinly cut, it only took two swabs to finish cooking. Would recommend
Had a great meal and An was our waitress! The broth came out quick and all the meat was delicious and beautifully prepared. We'll be back!

Came here on a Tuesday night with friends, and there was no wait! Service was great, they seated us immediately and explained their menu politely. We ordered the beef combo, A5 Wagyu, and your choice of  vegetables. An was our server and she was very patient and informative when it came time to order! Would definitely recommend going here again. Probably the best hot pot in town. Quality, price, service and atmosphere was perfect.
Delicious, authentic food, and the staff are the best. The soup bases are really tasty and the the conveyor belt with yummy food passing by that you can dip is fun!

Visiting from LA--best hotpot yet. An, our server was formal, straightforward, friendly, and quick. We had to come back for seconds before our flight. Wagyu & prime ribeye 10/10, house-made ponzu sauce 10/10 (added garlic, cilantro, and chili flakes). *** Mon-thurs it's buy one get one free! *** Open one in LA please!

I rarely write reviews on Yelp but this is my second visit to Chubby Cattle in 4 days!!! I have had shabu2 my whole life but their Wagyu is truly fantastic. Our server: 'An' is extremely friendly and provided such details into each ingredient that can go into the ponzu sauce. Upon request, An also provided me with another ponzu sauce. Highly recommended!!! Great service and food :)

Possibly the best broth I've ever had when it comes to hot pot!!! I got the tomatoes oxtail broth and wow, it was so flavorful like I can drink it all day. Everything we got was very fresh and the presentation was awesome!! I really wish this place was AYCE. Even though it wasn't, I left satisfied because just drinking the soup was pretty filling. I would definitely come back the next time I come to Philly.

We really enjoyed this place! Our first hot pot experience and our server walked us through pretty well. 
We got the spicy broths in entry and medium levels. They were both pretty spicy in case you don't have the best spicy tolerance. 
You order at the beginning of your meal and they also have a rotating bar that includes different meats and veggies for you to add while you are eating.

The only negative is that they have shareable sauces and seasonings with the rest of the restaurant so we didn't end up getting them until later in our meal.
Got delivery and food was cold and they didn't bring silverware.   Asked to get food at my hotel room, but driver left it in the lobby

My family had a really nice experience here. We enjoyed the food immensely. My 3 children liked the conveyor belt a lot. My kids are really picky eaters and there were so many options for them. We will definitely come back soon. The sauces were amazing too, and added so much flavor to the meat and vegetables.

Okay first off the décor is to die for, some of the hanging lights are also friggin terrariums  also the staff is INCREDIBLY NICE!!! Literally every single person we interacted with was awesome. The manager was attentive and helpful, checking in on us multiple times. Our server David was EXCELLENT. Neither of us were familiar w how to eat hotpot so he walked us through the process step by step, clearly and thoroughly. I def felt like I knew what I was doing after his instructions! Every time someone brought up ingredients from the kitchen, they told us how long to cook them for, without that I would've been lost!! Everything was DELICIOUS, the ingredients were really fresh and the soup was chefs kiss. I got the Oxtail Base and my friend got the Mushroom Base, we split the scallion pancake, mixed mushroom basket, Napa cabbage, quail eggs, and I got the brisket. Again, everything was perfect! The little basket of sauces was both adorable and super functional, I chose my sauces appropriately & really enjoyed the soup I, personally, got to create and eat!! Will def be coming back here & would ABSOLUTELY recommend!!!!!

My friend and I had an amazing experience! This was our first time here and getting hot pot, and our wonderful server David very clearly and patiently explained the process and menu to us! I had the mushroom hot pot, which is vegetarian/vegan, with fried tofu, cabbage, quail eggs, glass noodles, and mixed mushrooms, and everything was delicious and flavorful. I'll definitely be coming back!

Chubby cattle has always been a personal favorite of mine, from the cuts to the sauce, however the service at the Philadelphia location was exceptional. Our server, David, was very attentive and considerate of whatever we needed. We were given a free plate of lamb shank due to the long wait times. Overall, it was a great dining experience and chubby cattle will forever be my top hot pot spot nationwide. Additionally, the manager was also very accommodating. 10/10 recommend recommend the Waygu beef platter and short rib with egg with any veggies based on preference

Came here on a chilly winter evening and had a lot of fun experiencing the exquisite hot pot.

The meats were perfectly cut, veggies fresh and tiger shrimp on point! To top it off, our server Sammy always made sure that we had everything we needed.

I will definitely return to try more of their soup bases.

Ordered take our. Took forever and they never answer their phone.

Salt to the wound, they got my order completely wrong! What if I had an allergy? Nothing was marked and it was super expensive. Could not get an answer so I was stuck with food I did not order that cost way too much. 

Never going back.

The service was really quick and all of the food came out in an orderly manner. The conveyor belt had a lot of variety and it's truly unique. All of the servers were really nice and provided great service. 

We had the medium spicy hot pot, and the tonkatsu miso broths. Both were delicious. Would lean more towards the spicy broths because I am a fan of the numbing spices. Highly Recommend the chubby cattle signature cut beef.

Our first time here was nice with good food and attentive waitress Kitty. We ordered A5 wagyu short ribs with egg with the house hellious spicy soup and tomato oxtail soup. The wagyu was fatty and melted in my mouth immediately, mixing with the juicy and flavorful soup. We actually liked to mix the two soups together since the house hellious spicy soup was quite too strong for us. It was good experience and we appreciate the BOGO deal on Tues & Wed. Worth a try!

I think the only word I could use to describe this restaurant is 'janky.' I was definitely excited when reading up on this place. Now onto reality. Imagine being ushered in to a dark corner of the restaurant where you hardly make out the words on the menu. Where the convenient touchscreen ordering apparatus is dangling from its socket as if on its last breath. For the record, I did ask a waiter for a different seat, but I had the pleasure of being escorted to an even dimmer area adjacent to the bathroom. 

The conveyer belt is full of non-meat items, which I suppose makes sense for freshness sake, but the items on it seemed more like a joke than anything else. I'd imagine that most things were previously canned or is able to keep in a freezer for more than a year without spoiling. So items like little sausages, quail eggs, and fish tofu. Paying $1+ per mini-sausage or fish tofu seemed not quite a good deal. Side note: the handmade noodles arrive in one-biters.

Soup base is alright and waygu/beef was very nice, albeit with a price markup. When you order, the waiter/tress will haul over a tray full of sauces and condiments which is really cool, except for the fact that it was all open to the air and also during Covid season. Staff were very kind. Unfortunately, food was not great(besides beef) and the environment was dubious. Kudos to you if you are graced with the opportunity to bask in the light, and pro tip is to go during lunch for discounts if you must.

Place is great, good selection of soup bases, and meat choices. Conveyor belt was a nice touch but we didn't take much from it.
An, our server was great. It was our first time here and she walked us through everything perfectly!
We got the wagyu combo and it was amazing.
Definitely worth a try!
Great Hot Pot  Highly recommended for Holiday! The server - her name is An is the best server ever!!!

Wish they had highlighted the fact that you can't order Milky Sichuan Spicy Hotpot when you want to dine in. I just don't get such a practice. Not everyone wants to do hotpot. 

It's also baffling why you couldn't order steamed beef dumplings from the entree section without doing hot pot. The waitress told us we have to order hot pot soup base in order to order that dumpling. But why would anyone drop steamed dumplings (xiao long bao) into soup? Even their menu shows the dumplings in a regular steamed basket. 

We were on a tight schedule today so we ordered two rice dishes and Woodear mushroom salad. The woodear mushroom salad is very good, well worth the money. However the rice dish doesn't look like what's on the picture--instead of thin slices of beef, you get ground beef; it didn't taste bad, but not sure if it's worth $17 each. 

Service is attentive and friendly. May come back again to try the hot pot.

It so pricey but my favorite hot pot place.  The quality of their meat and seafood is really fresh, service is good and hot pot broths and ponzu sauce you dip your food with is so good.  I love their original broth, spicy broth and tomato oxtail broth and I usually just drink it as soup at the end.  The waygu meat combo is usually what I go with and I also love their fresh mushroom platter, pork belly and their shigoku oysters were really good.  Try to make a reservation ahead of time because wait times can be really long and it's not a filling meal for what you pay but quality is great and I'd come back here.

Servers are all super nice and quality of food and meat is amazing!


Soup base could be better and bit expensive.

Saw a promotion of one meat dish get the second one free.  Even ask before ordering but when the bill came they needed me to give a good review on yelp first before the discount.   Did it and they still charge us for the second dish of meat.   I asked and was told they gave us extra meat to accommodate the discount.   I honestly did not feel they gave us extra meat.  Besides the point, give the customers what you promote.   Disappointed.   Never again to this place.
Great food! Great service on Meat BOGO Wednesday night. Server, David, was great also!

business.name: Henrietta Red
business.categories: American (New), Bars, Seafood, Nightlife, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Eating here is like living out the story of your co-workers's favorite meal. But that co-worker who talks a lot so you hear about every "favorite meal."

The general vibe is sort-of-gentrification-but-without-hundreds-of-cactus-photos-and-b&w-hexagon-tile. White walls, unpainted wood tables, very short chairs, mostly green and white, no warm colors, you get the idea. 

Our server was quiet and busy so I'll not knock him for the time it took to get the food. 

Warning: the names of the dishes aren't joking around. If it sounds like it'd be good, it's probably great. Gnocchi was fresher tasting than I've ever had it, the seeds and butternut squash melded together with the sauce to make an unforgettable dish, will be getting this again if I go back. 
Other side of that coin is if it says "anchovy butter" you can probably bet it's anchovy+butter, and not something that tastes good. That's just a personal opinion by the way, I'm sure if I ate anchovies by the handful I probably would have politely suffered through the fecal glob, but I'm don't so we didn't. 

I got a scotch, so I can't comment on the cocktails. But it did come in a fancy glass if that's your kind of thing. 

Where I was truly blown away was the dessert. By the end of the long evening we just wanted to get it and leave, so we accepted whatever the waiter would've recommended, and fortunately he recommended this chocolate/hazelnut dessert of which I didn't get the name. 
It was delivered in a plate with three tiers of glory. In the center a glob of cinnamon ice cream, surrounded like a moat with a thick creamy spread, all encased by a crumbled chocolate brownie or the like, sprinkled with delicately placed citrus shavings and green foliage, all placed with such care and expertise that I could hear what the pastry chef was thinking as they released their child of a dessert unto the unsuspecting public: "if anything is done right, it shall be done through the grace of love in effort. therefore this shall be my arrow, my plate my bow, and I the cupid."  
I felt like I was committing a crime, digging into the rolling Scottish highlands before me. Each tragedy befallen to the eden between our glasses was a forkful of attentive detail to flavor and texture. Each bite reminded me of other desserts which had distilled into greatness from the bias of memory. Each chew was different. The creator of this dessert knew how to balance unique flavor profiles into one dish without any hampering the  intentions of the former. I only got a couple salty bites, but maybe that's all I needed, because that's all I got. The waiter said that those salty parts were bits of dehydrated Kalamata olives, a trick I have never heard of. Ingenious indeed. And once the three of us had cleared the plate, we sat back feeling as if we had no more than we deserved and no less than we wanted. 
I will be getting this dessert again. 

Take someone here if you want to show them what "people who live in germantown" look like, and want to have a great meal.

Also they're known for their oysters but I don't eat grey salt water lumps as a principle so I'll let you be the judge of those slippery melted lozenges.

Visited Nashville this weekend and ate here Sunday evening. It's hard to get a reservation, so make the reservation weeks in advance. 
As for the food, everything we ate was amazing and it was fun to share everything with friends. 

I would highly recommend the linguine which had a spicy kick going and the sweet potato toast dish. Those were my favorite. 
The crab dip and bread was also delicious. 
Order anything and you won't be let down.

This place SUCKS!!! Do not go there! The manager Ally is a total jerk and the general manager Ben is nothing short of an asshole!! All they care about is money. ZERO customer service. And the food is flat out gross! I promise you, do not waste your time or money going there!

One of our favorite dining experiences!

It was absolutely fantastic. Perfectly executed cocktails, perfect dinner, great dessert. 

We got the - 
Oysters and red snapper crudo
shrimp linguine (deliciously smokey)
Grouper with crispy parsnips - (AMAZING and I'm not a big fan of grouper usually!)
Cheesecake dessert 
Cocktails- Dr Amp- fall in a cup! Gold rush- Smooth and wintery. 
Would go back frequently if we lived close!

Kitchen seemed like a well oiled machine, and it was fun to watch them through the window!
Great food! A little more noisy than I would like but the food makes up for that. Will definitely return.

Our friend suggested Henrietta Red when we were recently visiting Nashville.   Like other posters noted, terrific venue and menu and, yes, make a reservation. Ours was a little last minute and the only slot we could get was 5 PM on a Friday. Of course, that made it easier to find parking. 

You share dishes here but their servings were ample for the three of us. You also know a dish is masterfully executed when you're satisfied after only a couple of bites. It was more than dinner. It was a tasting experience. We ordered Red Butter Lettuce, Crispy Potato, Roasted Lamb Sausage, Grouper, Seared Scallops and, for dessert, chocolate cake. Each one was a hit. Service was impeccable and fast and it seemed we were never left waiting for a dish to arrive. 

This will be our go-to place the next time we're in Nashville.

As a Nashville native, I've never been here, but will not return after my first time last night. This place is suck a joke everyone comes here in beanie hats. We had a reservation, had to wait 10-15 mins before being seated on a Tuesday night. We're told we could not wait at the bar because it was not a standing bar. The service was below par. We felt very unwelcome. My friend came from LA and this was her top restaurant to try. Literally everything was covered in dill. Our server said she had a lime in her hand and then laid it on our table to go get us new plates? Lol very bizarre. The food was okay. We ordered numerous dishes. I'd say the scallops & gnocchi were the best. Just simply not impressed.

Forgettable. Good service, cool vibe, good drinks (try the Foreign Diplomat). The food is nothing to write home about. Scallops, however, were very good. Oysters also tasty and variety impressive. Do not order the desserts which were by far the weakest parts of the dinner. Will not return.

This place has been on my list to check out for a while now. We were able to get seated at the bar with no reservation on Friday. Service was prompt and friendly. Cocktails weren't exceptional considering they were $14 each but the Dr. Amp and Foreign Correspondent were still pretty good. The serving style is tapas-like so we ordered the crab dip to start and the shrimp linguine and lamb sausage to split. The sausage was delicious and had some very unique touches like the orange yogurt that went perfectly with the dish. Loved all the flavors in it and was super excited to try the linguine afterward. It wasn't anything to write home about and was filled with sourdough breadcrumbs that seemed excessive and didn't add much to the dish. It was still decent but I would have been disappointed if that's all I had, especially after tasting how good that lamb was. It sounds like their menu changes a lot so we'll probably just check it next time before we decide to go again.

Such a great spot for date night! The ambiance and decor were beautiful. 

We ordered a selection of oysters from the raw bar, crab dip, and the seared scallops. 

The oysters were fresh and prepped really well. The crab dip was generous and I liked that it wasn't just all filler. However, I do wish that it came with more than 4 pieces of bread, since there was a lot of dip to get through. The scallops were perfectly cooked and I loved the sauce and potatoes it came with.

Made reservations online the Friday night of, were greeted immediately upon arrival, seated immediately in a lovely, polite manner. Wonderful, cool atmosphere, but gotta say LOUD AF. I wish the acoustics were better? Or is that a trend now? Idk, but it's super loud. Also, food was SCRUMPTIOUS BUT SALTY. You better like good food, salt,  and you better not have a salt restriction if yous comin heeeyaaa. Ya feel?!

Honestly, don't waste your time. This restaurant is right up there with the average Nashville restaurants nowadays. Average is generous. My third time back was not the charm. Each time the customer service is subpar, and the food is absolutely nothing to write home about. It comes down to food. If you're looking to eat at a great place in Nashville, this wouldn't be it. Just pass this one up on your restaurant list.

We are visiting family in Nashville for the first time, and the four of us wanted to celebrate. Henrietta Red is a stunning  venue with a great menu. This restaurant is beautiful- a magnificent marble oyster bar running the full length of one of the rooms-like something from another era. We chose to sit outside ( it was a beautiful mid-October evening). We had glasses of cava to celebrate oysters and being together after a long and difficult year, and switched to a delicious white, Daisy Chain from Ricca Terra for the rest of the meal. A perfect compliment to the menu we chose. 

The service was attentive and professional- our waitron was very well informed and guided us through the menu. She suggested that we choose plates to share, and explained the way the menu was designed- start with lighter dishes first, moving through to 'meatier' dishes. The pacing of dishes coming out of the kitchen was masterful-neither too rushed or too slow: a relaxed roll...

We started with two dozen plump and briny gulf coast Alabama oysters to share. They didn't disappoint! The crudo that followed was superb-the balance of lime and thinly sliced red onion, a crunch of pistachio and a hint of watermelon was masterful. The beetroot and apple salad with a tahini dressing was cleansing and fresh, with just enough tartness. The textures were just right-paper-thin apple and a delicate hint of lime and mint. 
We followed with the scallops in a mustard cream sauce-plump, juicy and generous. Next to arrive was the crab dip served with warm wood fired bread which gave it a slightly charred flavor. Complete heaven! 

The last dish of the evening was the beef tartare, delivered on a platter with a tarragon drizzle and sourdough toast, which rounded off our choices without being heavy or overwhelming. We are in Nashville until Monday and as we are staying in the neighborhood, we plan to come back for a cocktail/ Jell-O shot on Sunday evening! Thank you for a memorable gathering.

Came here for appetizers and a cocktail for our second night in Nashville. Very happy with the service. Order the oysters and crab dip!!! The atmosphere is super welcoming and love
the open kitchen concept

What a perfect little birthday celebration for my partners birthday! We were so excited to start our vacation off with Henrietta Red. When we walked in we got seated at a nice little two seater, nicely spaced out between other tables. They even customized the menu to say Happy Birthday! The atmosphere in the restaurant was amazing, we really enjoyed the open kitchen to watch the chefs at work. 

They were having 2 for 1 happy hour, but we opted out and just got wines we preferred. I ordered the vegetarian gnocchi dish, and my partner got the shrimp linguine. The gnocchi was decedent and pillowy. I completely finished it and even said I wished I had a spoon because the sauce was THAT good. For the linguine I personally did not try it, but my partner was raving about it, mentioning his never been anywhere that was so generous with their shrimp. 

For dessert we got their vegan option, which was a chocolate brownie, mint ice cream, and cashew fluff. It was so moist, literally if you didn't tell us it was vegan we would of had no idea. One of the best meals we had in Nashville, if not the best meal I've had in awhile. 

The service was also exception!

I'm very impressed by this place. The decor was immaculate through and through: from the outside to open air kitchen to the restrooms. The theme was very farmhouse chic, inviting and modern. 

Onto the food! We apparently came just at the right time as they were preparing to close for their fall break so oysters were all 2 dollars a piece. We had probably 30-40! The burrata and melons was surprisingly great and refreshing. Truth be told, I was a little skeptical that they would go well together but it was refreshing, sweet, and savory all at the same time. The tomatoes were in heirloom tomato salad were fresh and the pesto was a tasty highlight coupled with pickled cucumbers. It's like summer in a dish. The smoked white fish salad was nice and light, without being too fishy. The tang of the pickled squash (which I've never had) and the radish offset things nicely. The crab cake was delicious; choke-full of crab meat, a little smokiness, and light on the breading. Finally, the fries were perfectly crispy and garlicky. What a nice way to round out our Nashville weekend!

Best seafood in Nashville! The oysters are as good as the ones I had at Slip14 on Nantucket! The heirloom tomato and watermelon salad with homemade burrata is not to be missed. And go ahead and order the shrimp and pasta while you're at it. You won't be disappointed.

Came here recently for brunch with my girls and I was not disappointed. I had heard great things about this place, so I was excited that we were able to get a reservation. 

Ambiance: clean, open areas. Was a little loud inside but not too unbearable. Nice, large windows that have great lighting inside.

Food: I ordered the mushroom polenta based on pictures I'd seen on Yelp. It was delicious! I also ordered the biscuits on the side because I wasn't sure if it was going to fill me up, which I'm glad I did. Both I would highly recommend! 

Overall, great experience. The staff was super nice and my friends all liked the their food as well. I really want to go back to check out their dinner menu next!

When I go on vacation, I like to treat myself like it's my birthday!

First step - Make A Reservation! 

This place fills up fast and they will send you reminder text too. I know this is seafood in Nashville but it was literally the best food experience I had while visiting. 

My friend and I arrived from a long flight from NY and had a couple cocktails at Skull's Raimnbow Room before heading over. Yet, Maci our waitress, sold me on this gin, blueberry, egg white cocktail, called Negative Space. Mind Blowing! It's like this girl could read my mind. I am a sucker for gin and egg white cocktail. I could not have been happier. 

The restaurant itself felt modern, clean and spacious. I like to not be elbow to elbow when I am splurging on a meal. 

We started with a dozen oysters. The oyster menu was perfect. It explained the flavor notes for each, of course some of the obscure ones were sold out. Our dinner was pretty late. I would say come as early as you can for the full menu. Also remember to check the boxes for mignonettesauce, horseradish, cocktail sauce and lemon. This was the best way to start the meal. 

They suggested 4-5 plates to share. We ordered 4 after the oysters and it was a lot. But happy we got to try so many of the dishes. 

Poppy's Caviar - was a delicious and light dish 
Octopus salad - So good with the grapes, avocado and crunchy pepitas
Crab Dip -  A really meaty one of the dishes, rich and comforting. Loved the cast iron skillet it was served in
Smoked Trout - a lovely layering of flavors. With the potatoes it became a lot heavier too

We ended up taking some of the crab dip and smoked trout home and it made for the perfect morning chilled breakfast. 

Thanks to our lovely waitress for helping us through the menu and making our experience so enjoyable. I have been singing your praises Henrietta Red, until we meet again!

It was OK. They said food is served family style to encourage sharing however the food is not something that is easily shared. we had reservations and it still took over an hour for our food. It was very overpriced for the service and quality. Food didn't taste very fresh and the meat was undercooked and when asked about it, the server did nothing to remedy the situation or make anything better for us. Skip this place on your Nashville trip.

I have only had a couple of great meals out since COVID. Overall, service at most restaurants is average at best and it takes forever to get our meal. From the hostess interaction to the service provided by the bartender who served me, my experience was fantastic. I ordered the crab cake and mimosa. I wish I had more time and more room to order a dozen items on the menu. It is at the top of my list when I go back to Nashville. Thank you Henrietta Red for making my quick lunch a great experience!
The quiche with side salad was perfect for brunch. I also enjoyed the mimosa was made With fresh squeezed orange juice

Walk into a loud room, sit at a picnic table, pay $6 for 4 biscotti-sized pieces of bread w enough anchovy butter for 2 of them.  I could go on, but why bother?  It's a bar w very small, overpriced apps. The food looks good in photos, though, so there's that.

Overpriced, very noisy, uncomfortable (basically sitting at a picnic table), limited uncreative menu. Portions are very small, served on large plates with no garnishment.
Pleasant server though...
This place has it all. Perfect welcoming ambiance, stellar food and drink menu with fresh inventive food and the fresh baked bread with anchovy butter... um YES!

business.name: Sbraga
business.categories: Restaurants, American (New)

reviews.text:
Oh, no, man, Sbraga closed before I even get the chance to finish my review. 
Lauren S and I went to Sbraga couple of months ago, to celebrate its five years anniversary. Sadly, it was the only time I've been there. We enjoyed some of their classics from opening night menu- special prix fixe menu for $45. 
Everything was just amazing. I loved everything, the delicious food, the excellent service, and the reasonably priced menu.

Four and Half Yelps.

Entirely underwhelming in all aspects. A place that pretends to be a high end restaurant but really does not belong there.

Food was merely okay: the famous popover was cold; half of the dishes were way too salty: the escargot soup, the octopus, etc. The octopus was really a shame.... The chocolate mousse cake was very pasty - definitely a let down. 

Service: Our table was wobbly so i asked the server to fix it. He did; but acted like he did me a huge favor and never apologized for the problem. Waiters kept hovering around and took away our dishes as soon as we put down the fork, once while I still had the food in my mouth -- Gees what's the rush?? 

Poor ambience. Tables are set so close to each other that i felt i was having dinner in a party of 6 instead of just the two of us. We could hear the conversation of neighboring tables and I'm sure they could hear us. So awkward. It's impossible to get up without guests at the neighboring table making way. Absolutely not cool. A business venue not a romantic one.

We came here on new years to celebrate our 5 year anniversary and it was amazing. The stand outs were definitely the Foie Gras Soup and the fried chicken (seriously don't miss the chicken) but everything else was wonderful. The service was great and the staff made it a really special night. Thanks Sbraga!

Every thing was heavy and overly salted. I had only one night in phily and regret wasting my time and money here. Octopus probably was the worst ku treated! Soaked in oil and salt! I can not recommend this restaurant!

The food here is amazing. Every course was delicious. It starts with an amazing popover followed by soup (I'm vegetarian, so they brought me a carrot soup, which may have been my favorite thing overall). I had the hamachi crudo, risotto, butternut squash, and carrot cake. I would highly recommend all of them. Unfortunately, I didn't plan well and only allotted 1h 45 minutes for dinner before we had to leave for a show. Our waitress (who was great) asked up front how much time we had and when I told her, she said she would have to quicken the typical pace of each course. It was fine, but I wish we had more time. I was too full to really enjoy dessert and if it was paced the usual way, I probably wouldn't have been so full. I would allow yourself at least 2 to 2.5 hours for a meal here so you can take your time and really enjoy each course.

Gruyere Popovers w/ Truffle Butter.
Foie Gras Soup.

Capicola Mousse.
Beef Tartare.
(Both on Toast)

Spaghetti w/ King Crab.
Saffron Risotto.

Octopus.

Carrot Cake w/ Chai Ice Cream.
Chocolate Mousse w/ Pumpkin Ice Cream.

Everything was Superb.
Delicious Food.
Very Enjoyable Dining Experience.

My boyfriend and I celebrated my birthday with a near-perfect dinner at Sbraga on Friday night.

The rundown of what I ordered:
- Escargot
- Gnocchi [the addition of goat cheese and blueberries was so surprising and delicious]
- Fried Chicken [I would have happily ate about 4 plates of this]
- Caramel Bavarian [a perfect dessert in my opinion - slightly sweet, fruity, and crunchy]

Honestly each course was perfectly curated and delicious. My favorite course was the Fried Chicken - our server had advised that the dish was spicy, but recommended it whole-heartedly. The spice blend on the chicken was wonderfully salty and spicy and deeply flavored. The berbere stew, with the injera beneath the chicken added to the dish's warmness. Yes, it was spicy, but in the best, finger-licking, soul-warming way possible.

Our server, and service throughout our experience was top notch. Our server was really knowledgable, easy-going, professional, and personable. She was happy to help me make decisions about my order (chicken or lamb!?).

Maybe one of the best meals I have had in the city, and certainly one of the best values for a tasting menu!

Always a great dining experience. Great quality, taste, presentation, drinks,decor, service, and nice bathrooms too!
Yum every time!
One of the best meals i ever had! I came all the way from New York for Kevin Sbraga's cuisine, and it was well worth it! We paired every course with wine, so fun and satisfying. Impeccable service.

Finally had dinner here last night with a couple of friends after wanting to come here for years. The four-course dinner was excellent! Each course was clearly prepared with care. I highly recommend the beef tartare as an opener! Filet mignon with mashed potatoes and oxtail was worth the up-charge as was the spaghetti with king crab. My only criticism is that I actually felt like four courses (plus an amuse bouche and popover) was a little too much and too rich. Otherwise, would highly recommend and eat here again.

This place was awesome. 9:15pm was the only reservation we could get, and it was worth the wait. The service was great without being pretentious, and the food was amazing. The foie gras soup amuse bouche almost set the bar too high, but the rest of the food still delivered. My husband called the venison pasta dish "the best hamburger helper in the world," which isn't far off - super flavorful and rich. Definitely worth checking out!

Did not realize this was a four course place, so definitely pricier than what we expected. But it did not disappoint! The gnocchi is delicious and fluffy, but don't get it if you're not a fan of goat cheese. If you don't like foie gras, you can substitute for carrot soup which was really good. Fried chicken entree was extremely spicy, couldn't taste very much but it seemed to be pretty good. The caramelized dessert was delicious. Restaurant is a little small but cool ambience, with dim lighting and lots of professional looking restauranteurs. Be prepared to take at least an hour and a half for dinner.

Truly a top-notch dining experience! 

I am consistently impressed by the fabulous restaurants in Philadelphia, and Sbraga is no exception. Reservations are strongly encouraged due to the popularity and the relatively small dining space. We were seated exactly at 9:00 PM as planned.

The four of us decided upon the wine pairing menu, which included four courses of wonderfulness. Each of us stretched our culinary comfort zones and tried something that we would not have ordinarily selected. This proved to be a good move, as the culinary creations along with the expertly selected wines made for a wonderful experience. 

The foie gras soup was everything that we dreamed it would be and more. I can see why Yelpers are feeling the love of this amazing dish. I probably could have eaten only that all night and I would have been happily satiated. I should have saved my gruyere popover to dip into it, but I devoured that bad-boy in seconds.

Some of our selections were:

Escargot (hazelnut, mirepoux)
Beef Tartar (toast, cherry peppers, provolone)
Hamachi Crudo (sweet potato, tigers milk, citrus)
Octopus (potato, olive tapenade, piri piri)
Gnocchi (blueberries, chevre, parsley pistou)
