Spaghetti (king crab, tomato butter, Calabrian chili)
Caramel Bavarian (hibiscus, oat crumb, blueberry)
CMP (chocolate, marshmallow, and peanut butter mousse)

I love culinary combinations that make me think! 

Sbraga appears to be quite popular among locals and visitors alike. Excellent place for a special occasion or just for a night to celebrate the awesomeness of the people you love!

I stopped here for a drink and bite to eat before Rizzo last week, and forgot how much I enjoyed the place. As a result, I brought my husband for dinner over the weekend since he had never been. 

The prix fixe is still $55 which is crazy they hadn't change the price from 3 years ago! It includes the popover, fois gras soup, 3 courses and a dessert. I had the Hamachi crudo (nom nom nom), saffron rice (with calamari and mussels), salmon, and a peanut butter dessert. Everything was delicious and service impeccable. I also had a couple of Cool Cucumber cocktails. 

The tab can definitely add up with each person ordering drinks but it was a fulfilling meal.

One of the best dinner experiences we had in a long time. I took my wife to celebrate her birthday. The food was top notch. We did the 4 course meal. For the amount of food and especially the quality, you can't beat the price. I loved the ambiance and would definitely recommend for someone looking for a nice dinner downtown.

I have been a big fan for awhile. Sat at the Chef's Table last night and had the September menu. Take-aways below. 

-Service is excellent. Attentive, friendly, A+ hospitality

-Food is exciting and plentiful (I don't leave hungry and it's a great deal for $55/person). I noticed some concerning inconsistencies, though - and a few of the dishes seemed "off" in terms of flavor profiles.  

1. Love the gruyere puffs, but ours were cold. Needed a little more time in the toaster. 
2. 1st Plating portions were inconsistent depending on which of 2 chefs prepared it. My salad had 3 times the amount of pistachios, double the dressing, and much more salt than some of the others coming out. The Crudo was the worst I have ever had. Not refreshing, bland, warm... the only good part was the blood orange at the end to help erase the sweet potato puree taste. 
3. Pasta courses I had: fettuccine and gnocchi. Rabbit in the fettuccine tasted like it was boiled in broth. Bland dish if it wasn't for the salty cheese and black pepper on top. As for the gnocchi - fantastic. Great flavors, savory, and fun twist with the blueberries.
4. Had the supplement for the Main dish - filet mignon. Mashed potato/oxtail side was solid. Filet mignon was good, didn't blow me away. The succotash had to have been made incorrectly. The amount of ginger in the dish made it inedible. Not acceptable to have a side dish come out like this at Sbraga.   
5. Couldn't eat either of the desserts. Way too sweet. If you are a toddler or an adult with a HUGE sweet-tooth... than you'd have loved it.
Fantastic experience. Loved the $55 tasting menu.  The foie gras soup and the spaghetti with crab were memorable dishes.  We will be back!

The food here is outstanding. I never visited this restaurant in the four years I lived in Philadelphia, and realized I had made a serious mistake when I had a chance to go on a visit back here for work.  I will definitely be revisiting this restaurant as I visit Philly often. Wish I had more chance to explore here while I was here! 

Meals are prix fixe, and a bargain given the amount of quality food you'll receive.  The gruyere popover and the and foie gras soup are outstanding, and were actually among my favorite dishes here. I would also suggest the escargot, they do a great job at replicating what used to be one of Le Bec Fin's bread-and-butter dishes. 

In New York, this meal would easily cost $100+ per person, so $55 is a killer bargain.

This place in my opinion is just good. It's sold as a high end place, but compared to other remarkable Italian restaurants in Philly (I'm looking at you Vetri), I see it as one tier below the Italian restaurants I'm sure it's comparing itself to. The popovers were good, but not as delicious as I've had at Barclay Prime. The food itself is also solid, but again, it's a place that other people love, but for me, it is not going to be the first place (nor in top 10) that I recommend for people asking for a high dining place.

Wow. Wow wow wow. I really didn't have many expectations coming into this, because as a general rule, "New American" cuisine never exceptionally impresses me. That's probably unfair, because I could give a higher rating to a mediocre restaurant serving sushi, for example, than a well-executed American menu, but that's usually how it goes.

Sbraga is an exception. I had the tasting menu, which offers the foie gras soup (which, as the other reviewers note, was amazing) as well as a choice for each of four courses. I had the hamachi crudo (yum!), gnocchi (the standout, I've never had gnocchi that tasted anywhere that good), lamb (standard, well prepared), and caramel bavarian (unique. I started out eh about it then it grew on me with every bite). I honestly can't remember the last time I was blown away by every single dish I had at a restaurant.

My husband picked this place for a nice meal before going to see a ballet, and it made him look really good. We had a table at the bar, overlooking the open kitchen, which was fun. The multicourse set up was interesting, and almost everything was good, if not really good. There were one or two things I wasn't crazy about, but so be it. I might have preferred a bit broader set of options, and I was disappointed that the steak requires two people or a large surcharge (as you may know from my rants in other reviews, hubby is a vegetarian, so I don't get to eat as much steak as I would like). But this is a solid, elegant, inventive restaurant. We look forward to coming back. My suggestion is that it is a good place for out of town colleagues or your favorite aunt and uncle--I wouldn't call it romantic, but it is a very pleasant place. The service was fine, but a bit rushed and stand offish. There are other restaurants in town that have garnered more affection from me--Sbraga is not warm and fuzzy. Next time, I'm getting the steak.
This was a great experience. The wait staff was very attentive, polite, and knowledgeable. Not to mention the food! All six courses were superb. The selection was unique and tasty to the palate.

We've dined at Sbraga's several times and never been disappointed. The tasting menu is simply a fun way to explore the creative and tasty dishes the fantastic kitchen continues to send out. Our server Carrmen was very helpful and service was spot on. Pace of the meal was excellent and we were able to enjoy our meal yet had plenty of to get to our show. Great meal, great service, great location.

Girls night out in Philly brought us to Sbraga. We arrived early for our 7pm reservation and were seated right away. We started with cocktails which were lovely. The popover and foie gras soup was such a great start. The soup was just the right amount  (though honestly I wanted more...) and had such a velvety texture. I loved the way the flavor built the more you tasted. Really great! The three of us all ordered different items and no one was disappointed. Standouts included the capicola mousse, the fettuccine with rabbit, the rigatoni with pork shoulder, the salmon and the Bavarian dessert. Our server was just attentive enough - there when she was needed but not overwhelming. We never felt rushed or crowded and even when the place was full it didn't feel overwhelmingly loud or cramped. I would happily return if I find myself looking for a fine dining experience in Philly again!

I love the open kitchen at Sbraga.  It's so much fun watching the chefs behind the counter cooking.  The space itself is simple but tasteful and comfortable.

Our waitress was friendly.  The strange thing was that they were sold of salmon at 8pm on a Saturday night (initially), but after we ordered the waitress let me know they were in stock again.  

I started with the salmon mousse and was not a fan but I'm not a huge seafood eater.  It had the same consistency as cream cheese but was just not my thing. 

The risotto and gnocchi were incredible.  Both dishes were delicately flavored and not heavy.  The gnocchi was so incredibly soft and the green strawberries were a unique addition.

I had the salmon as my entree which was cooked well.  The cauliflower and parsnips added a nice bite to the dish.  

Dessert was also good!

business.name: The Gallery Pastry Shop
business.categories: Restaurants, Bakeries, Breakfast & Brunch, Food, Desserts, Specialty Food, French, Diners, Macarons, Pasta Shops

reviews.text: We went to the Gallery Pastry shop in broad ripple on an insanely busy Sunday. We waited for about an hour for our food, but we didn't even notice because we were enjoying the patio and our amazing waitress kept the mimosas flowing and even gave us some free macaroons for our wait. This place is perfect for a summer brunch!

Addicted to The Gallery Pastry Shop!

Situated in a cozy corner off Broadripple's Monon Trail, this place has it all! Breakfast, brunch, lunch and treats galore! 

My go to order is the crepe combo. Pick two crepes, savory or sweet or one of each. My favorite savory crepe is Breakfast at Tiffany's. 

Some if the crepes rotate out with the season. My all time fave is the peach! Today I had the lemon poppy and it was just as delicious! 

Pastry treats like their croissants and macarons are must try items as well!
Went there hoping to eat two days in a row only to told condescendingly that they decided to close the kitchen over an hour earlier than published hours, but that I should "please come back!" Eeesh.

If I could give this review 10 stars I would. Wonderful local spot in the SoBro area, from the space and the environment, to the menu, to the service. We shimmied up to the bar and started out with a couple of drip coffees and an order of the fruit brûlée. They came back and let us know that they were out of the fruit brûlée, but suggested the brûlée trillium, which we were happy to try out instead. From there, we ordered a 2 Egg Hash and a Breakfast w/ Tiffany (1 crepe), both of which were delicious without being overly filling. My only regret is not grabbing a macaron to go!

Several folks and I visited the Gallery Pastry shop the Tuesday before Christmas for brunch at 10:30 a.m.  Much to my surprise there were only two or three other tables of patrons.  On the weekends if you don't arrive before opening you won't get a table without a long wait.  Having checked out the online menu before arriving I knew that I was going to get the appetizer sized portion of bruleed fruit (oh so good-a must have) and the create your own two crepes.  However the menu in the restaurant was different than the online version and no longer offered the build your own crepes and the bruleed fruit plate had increased in price and size.  The waitress was apologetic about the build your own crepes option only being offered on Thursdays as she said it slowed things down in the kitchen.  Thought that was kind of strange since the place was practically empty...but I just ordered the breakfast Sammy instead.  Although I had planned to purchase some pastries to take home the pastry case was virtually empty so this visit was a let down for me.  The highlight was the bruleed fruit as always, however, I just checked the menu again and during the week crepes and bruleed fruit are no longer served.  Guess the only way to get my "fruit fix" in the future is to fight the weekend crowds.

First of all, I have been to 'Gallery Pastry Shop', a couple of years ago, when it first opened.  This was way before their 'Gallery Pastry Bar' and 'Gallery at 16th' had even opened.  I remember the first time I visited 'Gallery Pastry Shop', a couple of years ago, it was mostly empty.  After I had my meal, I asked for the bill and the waitress calculated the bill in her head, no physical check was presented.
After visiting 'Gallery Pastry Bar', a couple of times in downtown.  I decided to stop by 'Gallery Pastry Shop', in Broad Ripple.  It was around 2:00 p.m., on a Tuesday.  I didn't expect there to be so many guests, at the time and place!  The shop was packed with guests, almost every single table was full!  They also have a clear window, so you can see into the kitchen.  I even spotted their pastry chef, Ben Hardy (@chefboyhardy) behind the counter, making brunch!  He was wearing a black apron, with a black button down shirt with his sleeves rolled up to his elbows.  It was a real treat to see all of them, especially Ben Hardy, behind the counter making brunch!
The display case was filled with pastries, croissants and macarons!  'Katy' took the time to tell me about the almost dozen pastries in the case.  She even told me what was in them.  
I went with 

3 'French Macarons' (Almond Praline, Cinnamon Pear & Pumpkin)
2 'Misc. Pastries'
1 'Almond Croissant'

It was such a nice experience!  Next time, I'll have to dine in!
Amazing experience every time we go! Definitely recommend! Whether it's just my fiancé and I or bringing our family & friends it has always been a fantastic time!

Awesome lil neighbor gem...Sunday Brunch Style...it's not just pastries uts great food

Food is fresh and creative.

Service with smiles and vibes

Atmosphere shabby chic yet comfy and groovy.

I don't want rave cause I wanna save this place just for me, but it is a must try in SoBro let alone the city!

Eat Local, Shop Local, Live Local JC

Came here for my birthday and Nick was our server.  I had no idea that this location existed because I always go to the downtown location.  We were super happy because this location was closer and went over and beyond for the bday. Nick was amazing, he made sure my birthday was sweet. He took time to explain the menu and offered me all the vegetarian options! The mimosas... were amazing! Love how they have the packages. Having bottomless would be even better! I ended up getting the broccoli and the pesto vegan breakfast. It was super tasty. I loved the plants and environment, and I really thought it was cool how you could watch the cookers cook the food! Score. 

Pros
Nick
Customer service 
Decor

Cons
N/A

Girls brunch. Boys brunch. Summer. Spring. Fall. 

Whatever you have to do, whoever you are with--come here. The food is wonderful beyond words and the aura of the place and people are simply the best. I've not had a bad experience here and I cannot envision I ever will. 

Go and enjoy yourself.
I enjoy visiting this place but I wish they had more options. The pastry's were yummy but very pricey so be ready for that.

This restaurant is one of my favorites in all of Indy - they have amazing brunch and can you say HOMEMADE CROISSANT? It's delicious - get the breakfast sandwich! Check out their Instagram page for rotating specials - they always look delicious. Parking can be difficult at the restaurant, but if you're willing to walk there are adjacent parking lots.

I had my wedding reception brunch here and everything was just as we'd hoped. The manager Jonny is so helpful and friendly and the owners Ben and Alison are awesome too. Aside from the wonderful customer service experience the food and desserts are absolutely delicious! Since our wedding, we've continued to visit, and are never disappointed. I recently ordered my husband's birthday cake from here, and it's was absolutely delicious!

An unfortunate incident occurred this Sunday at this establishment. 

My boyfriend, the driver, turned into the parking lot to look for a spot when a blonde woman and her husband were walking in the middle of the parking lot. I, the passenger on my cellphone, looked up as my boyfriend made a comment about how he was trying to get around them for quite some time as he thought they were being rude and he managed to circle around them with a little wave (with plenty of room to spare) to drive to the entrance of the restaurant to drop me off as I have a knee injury and can't walk long distances. As I was waiting in line to put my name down, the blonde lady and her husband quite literally shoved past me and stood directly in front of me. I was shocked. I told the person at the front "excuse me, but this woman just walked right in front of me." The blonde lady whirled around and said "yeah well YOU JUST ALMOST HIT ME WITH YOUR CAR!" Her husband said "yeah you , or your boyfriend or whatever just almost hit us, yes we're those people you almost hit!!!" Again....I was shocked. Thinking back to the very  brief encounter of driving past them, where they did not look upset or angry? The person behind the register was shocked also and clearly did not know how to handle the situation. The couple again loudly stated "she just tried to run us down." She catered to the white older couple and told them they were able to talk to the host at the stand to be seated. I responded with "this is a really mature way for adults to act." The blonde lady, assumingely felt some sort of remorse for her actions, then told the host with a roll of her eyes and not even looking at me that she "thinks I was here first, so to go ahead." 

I was so excited to take my boyfriend to this restaurant,  as a Butler alum and it's been more than a few years since I've been to the Broad Ripple area. Now I was embarrassed and shaky and trying to hold back tears. The host was so nice when I told him what happened and checked back on us later into our meal, which was great. Our waitress, Liz, also made the rest of our experience extremely pleasant. And I was so glad for them. 

I guess I just wanted to say that just because someone looks a certain way or is a certain age or looks like they "have money," doesn't automatically put them in the right. Which is why I took a star off. This lady was pulling a classic white victim card and I'm sad that she felt entitled to walk in front of me and yell at me for something that 1) DID NOT EVEN HAPPEN and 2) even if it did, as a passenger, I have no control over. However, just for the record, my boyfriend isn't driving around like a maniac trying to run down civilians just for some scrambled eggs. 

Maybe it's because I walked into the restaurant before them that pissed them off? Maybe it's because I am a young Latina woman that she felt privileged enough to exert some power? Maybe it's because of their socioeconomic status? Either way if something like this ever happens to you, keep your head held high and don't stoop to their level. Chances are if they're making up this kind of drama, reasoning with people like that will never go anywhere fruitful.

Gave this place three chances and never had a good experience. Poor service, missing food in my take away order, and bad vibes from staff. With so many great options in this area, there is no need to ever return.

My 3 girlfriends and I love this cute place. A least one time a month we meet there for brunch. We enjoy very delicious food and mimosas. I enjoy trying something new each time and one friend gets the Brûlée Trillium
Croissant, Tulip Tree Trillium, mixed berry compote, honey, pecans. She is obsessed over it!!! Their desserts are amazing as well and if the have one with pistachios we will get it. It's a really cute cafe and we enjoy walking around the area after we have a great filling meal. I highly recommend you give it a try!

i've been meaning to stop in here for months, and finally got a chance to come in. i ordered the salad niçoise as well as a chocolate mousse crepe. the salad is served in a smaller bowl than im used to, but it packs a big punch. i ate about half before turning to my crepe. the mousse was fluffy and light, with the perfect balance of sweetness and bitterness from
the chocolate. again, i underestimated the crepe and only ate half. on my way out, i dropped the box with my crepe. i've had a really rough week so when they offered to remake it i was so thankful. it's been a long time since ive had either of these dishes, and i'm so glad i came out today. i can't wait to come back and try more delicious dishes!

In search of a great brunch spot with great outdoor seating, amazing food, and mimosas to wash it down? This little gem is five star in so many ways! Their outdoor seating is cute and intimate, and additional seating is available inside. For a cool experience, you can sit at the bar facing the kitchen, and watch them work their magic as they put together some delicious brunch favorites! I chose the croissant with sausage gravy and eggs over easy....so good! I may never want a biscuit with this again the croissant was so good with the gravy! My friend and I shared an order of the fruit brûlée, which might have been my favorite thing I had that day! Fresh fruit with a crispy glaze, I love a good bougie extra! She ordered the greenie omelette and added smoked salmon. Everything in the omelette tasted so fresh, like it just came out of the garden! I had to try the pear lavender latte and I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked it! They have milk alternatives so I was able to sub almond milk with no problems. Last, the blood orange mimosa is a great choice! But then again, doesn't a mimosa make any brunch better? Beware, there's usually a wait for a table so find a spot to sip a coffee and wait outside, it's worth it!!

This place slaps. The end. Seriously though, their breakfast is always delicious, fresh, and perfectly seasoned. I've tried many items now and they are all fantastic but some top favorites are the hash, crepes, JTL, and croissant and gravy. Lattes could use a little work. But overall great atmosphere, staff, and food.
The food is always top notch and the environment is super welcoming! Our server was super helpful and personable! Such an enjoyable experience

I recently revisited Gallery Pastry Shop for Sunday morning brunch with friends and it's just as quaint and unique as I remembered. We managed to snag a table on the patio and while we were there, it quickly filled up with patrons. The later in the morning you get here, the longer you will have to wait.

The mimosa and two egg hash were delicious. 

My only complaints are 1) difficult parking, which I realize isn't entirely their fault but is a challenge nonetheless and I imagine deters some customers and 2) once we were finished eating, our waitress hovered in the hopes of hustling us out so she could flip our table for new customers. I get it, but it seemed like she was a little too eager to give us the check and get us out of there.

5 stars for the OG HQ for Chef Ben! Nestled in a cute complex around the corner from the Monon is the mothership to some of the best brunch and pastries you'll find in Indy. The owner is a classically trained chef / competitor / culinary instructor / all around awesome entrepreneur. The service here is always top notch and you can see dedication of the kitchen team to their craft. Chef Ben definitely gets some of the best talent in the area for Gallery and you can feel the love from the moment you walk in to till your last bite of whatever you're eating here! The Macarons are a staple, the cakes are all phenomenal & the crepes are amazing.

My friend and I came here for Brunch on a Saturday. We started w the mimosas that was $25 for a bottle of champagne and choice of juice. 

I cannot have dairy so my options were limited. I did go w the Vegan Hash. It was made w basic ingredients but was so delicious. I also had the brioche toast w berry compote. 

The service was amazing. 

We went inside and got some pastries to go. This place is reasonably priced and deliver amazing products.

My book club wanted to switch things up so we decided to meet out for brunch instead of out monthly house hosting rotation. I'd heard a lot of hood things about the Gallery so we booked a Sunday brunch to give if a try.

I absolutely loved this restaurant, their brunch, and the entire experience! 

I has such a hard time choosing my entree because there are do many tasty choices. Almost everyone at my table opted for the hash bowl do i decided to try the crepes. You get two crepes with your meal and there is a selection of both sweet snd savory crepes to choose from. I ordered a breakfast at tiffany crepe filled with meat and veggies followed by a peach flambé crepe. Both were absolutely delicious! The peach one was very very sweet, but in a good way! And I found the savory crepe yo be very filling but light and fancy.

I ordered a side of hash browns, woah! I could feed three people so be prepared to share!

We also ordered their mimosa package which gave us all the chance to have drinks for about $5 a person.

I'm going back, and coming often!

The outside atmosphere is amazing and the blood orange mimosa was delicious! Menu items for brunch were staples like omelets and crepes, but with a fancy flair (think tulip tree trillium). A really good experience, though don't expect to get in/out quickly

business.name: Linvilla Orchards
business.categories: Fruits & Veggies, Farmers Market, Food, Pick Your Own Farms, Arts & Entertainment, Shopping, Tours, Specialty Food, Nurseries & Gardening, Farms, Hotels & Travel, Home & Garden

reviews.text: Poor inventory on Christmas trees over 6 feet this year. If you want a tall tree this isn't the place. There are fields and fields of 4-5 ft trees but very little over that height. We like a tree that nearly touches the ceiling, did the pick your own hayride, and came back empty handed (and several other people on our hayride did too). We figured we'd pay the extra $50 ($139!) for the trees that are pre cut out front because they had some taller ones. But then by the time we got back most of those were picked over and we wound up over paying for a sparse tree that isn't very attractive. Next year we'll probably try to find another farm.

First time on a hay ride and it was so much fun. This farm is lovely. They had the whole Halloween set up, shops and yummy treats and foods. Staff super friendly and I am so happy they are so close to me. Can't wait for berry season!

Whenever my husband and I visit our family in the Media area, Linvilla has become a staple for our time together. With plenty of things to entertain both adults and children, it is a win win!

When we went over the summer, we spent more time enjoying the animals and outdoor walking/play spaces, but we also bundled and enjoyed the animals this time, as well! I haven't yet done the hay rack ride, but our family in the area says that it is a ton of fun. I look forward to trying some day in the future!

Linvilla always goes out for the different holidays and is delightfully themed. Right now, everything is beautifully decorated for the Christmas season. You can even go get your Christmas tree, ornaments, and holiday seasoned plants in the Garden Center! So so fun AND beautiful! You can even go meet Santa! Bring your wish list and talk with Santa and snap a picture. And all at a COVID-safe distance. Thanks for taking safety into consideration, Linvilla!

Prices are a bit high, but to operate a facility with such wonderful goodies and family-friend experiences, one should expect to pay a higher price!

The food is also consistently delicious! Whether you are getting baked goods, sauces, or produce in the market OR picking up the seasonal apple cider donuts with toppings, your stomach and taste buds will always be satisfied! My husband and I shared the Reese's apple cider donut (pictured) and our niece/nephew shared the apple pie apple cider donut. Yum!

All that to say, we love Linvilla! I look forward to visiting again next time that we are in town!

If you're looking for a 4 to 5 foot tree for Christmas,then you're in the right place. Not many options over 5 ft. The ones that are bigger are half dead already. You will find bigger trees in the pre cut area but that kinda defeats the purpose. I know they have other things there but very disappointed with the "cut your own tree scam"

First time visiting Linvilla Orchards and luckily enough, it was the perfect fall day for it. The group purchased tickets online a couple days before and had the easiest time doing all the activities we planned. 

Pro-tip - phone Internet was a little spotty but if you buy tickets online the staff can find the reservations in their system. 

In October this place is a fall utopia hosting everything from hayrides to Apple/pumpkin picking. If you are 21+ there's also a beer garden filled with quick bites and seasonal beverages (highly recommend the cider). Parking was pretty seamless with attendees helping folks find parking. 

Linvilla also hosts a market where guests can but jam, cider, etc. I had to get my hands on some of those donuts which are always a treat.

If I could leave 0 stars I would.

Do not plan a birthday party at this venue during their "Bee Season".

We planned a 2nd birthday party for our son Oct 23rd. Once arrived our area was swarming with bees due to an over following trash can next to our party area.

We asked that the trash can be removed which they kindly did.

We then took off on the hayride and activities to let the bees die down. About An hour later the bees where still there but now on our treat bags, tables, juice, cupcakes and food. 

We had two children get stung by the bees in which point I asked the gentleman Mike why is it this bad. To which he stated it's a farm and it's bee season in a joking manner.

We explained children had been stung and needed ice and they said the parents would need to take the children to the refreshments area to get ice.

We decided to try on with the party which was from 1pm-3pm and our extra guests (the bees) did not begin to disperse until we packed up and left.

We then called to explain our concerns as with bees of that number , it could have been an issue if we unknowingly had a child allergic. We spoke to the Manager Jean which  she apologized but remained in the same nonchalant manner as the Party Coordinator Mike. That it's a farm and there's bees. Jean then implied my husband was lying about them not providing ice as they have ice packs in their Saftey Kits. Again that was never offered or communicated.

Jean then continued to state they were understaffed, I explained that is a lot of establishments at this time but that is not a reason for poor service.

At the $800 price point it was not a fun memorable experience and shame on Linvilla to not take action and show concern of children.

Very distasteful of an establishment we had grown to love over the years.

I not that we wanted anything in return in which we were made to feel but a genuine and sincere apology would have went a long way.

This was an awful experience.
We made the unfortunate choice to promise a young child a hayride on a Sunday before Halloween (October 24th) so we purchased tickets ahead of time.
The place was way overcrowded.  Absolutely  no Covid safety measures in place and most people were not wearing masks.  At most activities people were shoulder to shoulder.

We did take the child on the hayride, but there was a man smoking.  On the hayride . Sitting on the hay surrounded by young children and families.  

I did let the driver know, but his only response was "I am sorry that happened".
Every single activity was a separate charge.  
We will never make this mistake again!

Had a great time at Linvilla. This place gets packed, get there as early as you can! We got there at 11 and parking lot was already full. There was an overflow parking but it's a bit of a walk. You can buy tickets for activity online, since it's cheaper and you'll get to skip the line. We did the corn maze and it was a little too short and easy for adult but we still had fun. Lines for the apple cider were long but moved fast. The hot cider was delicious. Apple cider donuts were also delicious. You can wait on the line outside or get them inside the store. We also had the blooming onions which were fried to perfection. 
Parking was hectic everywhere. Just be patient and make a couple laps until you can grab someone's spot.

I have been bringing my children and grandchildren to Linvilla Orchards for 14 years.  It's our annual Fall family trip the whole family looks forward to. 
This is the first year that we were all so very disappointed.   It was bad enough that when arrived, (12:00) parking was horrific, the entire place was packed and lines were extremely long everywhere. BUT, the worst part was when we walked back to the apple guns (which were  slingshots a few years ago) and the mazes.  We get in line for tickets and apples... We get to the counter where we see a sign that reads "Apple guns sold out", I ask about it and we are informed everything is purchased online now & they point to where the website is posted.
If you know anything about the area, you know how difficult it is to get service on your phone.
Soooo, I walk all over until I finally get a signal and see you have to choose the date & a time for each event AND... Guess what... they are SOLD OUT of everything except the hay bale maze.  (All hay rides day & night to witches house, corn maze & apple guns).  
So, lines to each vendor (and the store) are 50 to most being over a hundred feet long.  I spoke with a few people that were feeling the same as me.  One lady said she has never in all her years witnessed this and she was very disappointed that she couldn't do anything there today with her grandkids either.
As much as we have loved Linvilla in the past... the relaxing day out full of fun, (I don't mind knowing ahead of time to purchase tickets on line, but it looks as though we are going to have to look elsewhere for relaxing enjoyment since everything at Linvilla is now by appointment only.  It just makes it too hectic and rushed, not working for us.
The playground is still very broken down and hazardous to children. I would like to think safety is a priority here but several months later the playground is in disrepair.

I wish I got to see more of this place it was insanely overwhelming crowded and poorly marked for driving it was very very stressful trying to leave with so many people walking in the middle of the road. It took 30-45 minutes to get through the lines for the attractions, I wish I got to actually enjoy it but it was so packed I just had time to get donuts and leave. If you go make sure you're not an anxious driver and that you like huge crowds, it didn't feel very covid safe. It's a gorgeous area though I'd love to try another time of year

Linvilla is a wonderful Orchard + Farmers Market. My fiancé and I have been coming here for a few years and "Picking Our Own" has always been such a wonderful and delicious experience! We come every year for the yellow peaches (which are the sweetest, juiciest peaches we've ever tasted) as well as when it's apple season. Linvilla Orchards does a wonderful job at helping break in the Fall Season with their Fall Shops, Markets, Pumpkin Patches and Food Pop-Up Tents which make for such a great family location for those briskly fall weekends!! Linvilla is my Orchard of choice + I plan to continue to create beautiful seasonal memories here for as long as I can!

This was SUCH a fun time. Did the "witches hayride" which was perfect for my 5 year old twins. There is a large playground area (bring $1 in cash, for the honor system), a huge market with delicious syrups and jams and cakes and everything! And of course the incredible flowers and pumpkins. This is fall central!! There were huge dolls and various things along the hayride entrance. We did 7:15 which was perfect to enter the forest right at sundown. The witches gave some cookies and told some jokes then it was back to the farm for some free marshmallows to roast over the fire and cider! This place is a gem and will be a family tradition!

By chance the day I decided to hunt for pumpkins a craft fair was going on. So parking was a little intense but they had plenty and even someone guiding traffic. I found a cart and walked to the pumpkin area of this place. . . YES, this place is huge and fantastic . 
Below you'll see the pumpkin area, where I found black, yellow, white ,and orange pumpkins. There are other gourds and squash as well. Some cute photo op areas too. 
There is also an indoor garden area with decor and plants. Very well made cute stuff in there, very seasonal. When you walk back outside to the right there were food venders with pickles , cotton candy , varieties of popcorn and nuts. A delicious cherry limeade is a must try , GET THE BIG CUP. 
Because of the fair I was lucky to bump into a all natural, women owned soap company , I bought 4 bars . They all smelled so GOOD , had lots of color and even some glitter. ANDDDD lets not forget all natural I mean "would you lather". . 

I will deff be visiting again and recommended to anyone who asks.

Outstanding setup!  It's been a while since I've been to Linvilla but my boyfriend loved it. The atmosphere is great, definitely a good time. We also enjoyed the beer garden. The ciders were very good especially the original apple cider, red can I believe. Thanks guys for all you do!

I came here to go apple picking with my family, and had an awful interaction with Norm, the orchard owner. We spent $70 for peaches and apples, but the owner deemed our box "too full" and spent around 5-10 minutes standing over us and talking about taking advantage of his farm, when our box was the same as every other customer. He even made a point to say that he humiliates customers to show his employees what an "acceptable" amount of pick your own is. We were excited to go to the market portion of the farm, but could not further support his business after this extremely terrible experience.

Awesome place to take the family ! MR Bob was a little hands on but with three kids who doesn't need the help. Fruit was delicious for days and days. Donut peaches and shiro plums - never had them before but they sure was good.

If you want to visit Linvilla Orchards, here is what you need to know: 

- If you want to pick fruit, check out their website to determine what is available for the date of your visit.
- Buy tickets in advance! This is a new option and they are cheaper online.
- You are no longer able to bring your own produce to feed the farm animals. Instead, you can purchase produce at the market. They have bags of food for $1 by the market registers.
- Check out the gift shop and greenhouse. There are some unique gift options and beautiful plants!
- Bring water and hand sanitizer with you, or get some from the market.

I visit Linvilla multiple times a year and always enjoy the blueberry and peach picking in the summer. Their fresh produce is the best! I always end up finding new jams, sauces, and treats at the market at the end of my visits. It's a great trip with lots to do for all age groups! My only complaint is that it is not dog friendly.

[Peach Picking ] 06/13/2021

We went to Linvilla Orchrards at 12:30 pm. We had previously reserved the PICK YOUR OWN ticket online for strawberries, however when we arrive, they told us there was no strawberries to pick and we will have to pick peaches instead. It's fine by us since we love peaches but for people who only wanted to pick strawberries, this might be a little disappointed. 

We got on a 10 mins hay ride to the peach field. Most of the peaches in the front are still pretty firm. We found that if you walk all the way to the back of the row, you will find riper and redder peaches. It took us about 15-20 mins to fill up our papper box and only 5-10 mins wait for the hay ride back. 

The farm has plant shops, indoor farmers market, beer garden and more. Perfect for a day trip with friends or family. 

*I put the firm peaches in brown paper bag for 48 hours and now they're perfectly ripe and ready to be made into peach cobbler

Fun and cute place. I went there during the weekday and was quiet but looks like it would've been so much fun on the weekend great for family with kids. The Apple cider donuts were so good. You can buy them by one, half dozen, and dozen. 
The market was filled with fresh fruits and vegetables, snack and fresh baked goods. I want to come and visit here again on weekends.
I go for the firewood but they have fresh vegetables, herbs and preserves. My neighbor and I make many trips here for there great wood selection.

An amazing family owned business with the friendliest, most courteous and helpful staff you've ever met. The treat of picking up freshly made compost for my garden and having a conversation with Steve one of the proprietors, was just a great way to start the spring after such a year of tumultuous spirits.
Thank you to Nancy and Steve for caring for me and providing me with such great support for growing some amazing what I look forward to a great  vegetable harvest.

I'm giving 5 stars for our experience yesterday at Bunnyland. My kids loved riding the hayride to Bunnyland. The hayride was right on time and there were only a few families so there was plenty of room to social distance. It was a super cute set up once you got to Bunnyland and they gave out candy bags. The Easter bunny walked around the wagon to get pictures with the kids. My kids are also super excited that the  playground is open again. We also enjoyed riding the train and feeding the ducks and goats.

This is a great place to visit with family.  Their farm market is great and the people are friendly. This review is for the playground.  The playground has reopened and it's in disrepair.  Slides are cracked with jagged edges, the wooden play structures are splintered and the wooden truck with a "do not use" sign had a large bee's nest in it!
I really hope management considers bringing this playground back to being a safe area for children to play.

We came here for the mini golf and petting zoo. While the commute may have been rough, the end result was so fun! My daughter ran around the mini golf course as if it were an obstacle course, yes she's still a bit too young for this, but it was so much fun buying locla produce and feeding it to the goats, sheep and geese and ducks in the back of the farm! Definitely worth a visit!

business.name: Rooster & the Till
business.categories: Restaurants, American (New)

reviews.text: This is absolutely the best place to eat in Tampa bay! Seriously. Every time we come here it's a incredible journey for your Tastebuds. The service is always outstanding, they are all extremely knowledgeable and very friendly. The food is just amazing. Every single time we visit. If you want to impress your friends take them here! It's a very impressive restaurant without all the stuffiness of other fancier places.  Quality food, quality people and great vibes.

We had so much to celebrate so we decided to try out Rooster and the Till for a special night. My bf and I ordered:
- A5 Miyazaki Hand Roll
What a flavor bomb! There was so much umami packed on a half shiso leaf. Between the wagyu, uni, and caviar, there was so much flavor that came together all at once in one bite!
- Cobia Collar
These fish collars were big! Our waiter said just pick it up like a chicken wing! I love the crispy fish fin and all of the meaty fish, and it didn't taste too fishy.
- Gnocchi 
How do I start explaining this delicious dish? The gnocchi were so expertly made that they had so much texture and taste! It felt like I was biting into some mashed potatoes. They were paired with short ribs that was so saucy.

I've gathered that they have seasonal menus so we will be back!

Not sure if this restaurant is new to online ordering but I did not have a good experience. I placed an online order on Monday for pick up on Friday. I arrived at my scheduled pickup time but the hostess said they never received an order. After I showed my emailed receipt they began to make the order and I had to wait another 20 minutes. Extremely disappointed.

A must visit when you come to Tampa. 

If you want to impress a date, friend, family member, SO bring them here! 

Come ready to try something new and ask questions because your server will be ready to answer them and give you all the details you need.
A great restaurant with creative, delicious food. Top service. We ordered the featured Christmas Eve dinner and it was excellent.

Celiac and gluten intolerant friendly. I called ahead and was able to speak to my server about my restrictions. The staff was very accommodating and I was able to have a beautiful delicious meal without getting sick. Will definitely be going back!
I have now visited and indulged in the amazing food at Rooster and the Till. It was absolutely incredible, thought out and delicious. The service is impeccable and we will visit often.

What a dining experience...First class all the way. Great service, eclectic menu where every dish was a new a new dining experience. First time I have been to a tapas styled dinner and left full at very reasonable prices for the quality of the food. Chef Ferrel's personalized service was a plus. A must experience will be back many times.

Obviously the food is great, but they are at a point where they think they're too good to need business. I will never go here again, for customer service alone. Exhausted after a long work day and driving home, I wanted a delicious dinner, and decided to call in a to-go order. I was told that they won't take phone orders, you have to order through the website. I'm not going to do that while driving. I will take my business elsewhere.
Great atmosphere, great food, great service. We are so happy every time we come to this Seminole Heights gem.

Best in the city! My mother and I sampled pretty much the entire menu. This was my second time coming but I decided to take her because she's in town for the weekend. The food was even better than the first time! One of the head chefs was even gracious enough to bless us with a free dessert (the mochi donut holes). 

I really appreciate the thought of the different flavors that goes into the creation of these dishes. I don't know how they do it but it is as if they layer the flavors. I don't know how much sense that makes, but it's just an experience that you have to try.

We love Rooster and the Till. We always get at least one order of the cobia collar. The cobia is our favorite dish. The scallops, the Katsu Sando (I forgot to take a picture of that dish) and the mochi donut holes were all outstanding. Top notch service; attentive but not intrusive.  We love Rooster and the Till!

Had a great dinner here. Unique dishes that you aren't going to find on other menus. I agree with others that it feels a touch expensive, but for the focus on quality (not to mention rising food costs) is probably fair. The highlights were the gnocchi, katsu sando, and A5 hand rolls. All delicious. The cobia collar was solid, the grilled summer peaches were fine (didn't get much of a 'grilled' flavor - could be b/c the peaches were underripe and there wasn't much sugar to caramelize). Only note would be on the foie dish - they need to take the time to devein the foie lobes. When trying to cut through it just turned into a stringy mess. Ruined an otherwise inspired dish. Excited to come back and try more!
Best Restaurant in Tampa Two Years in a Row.....

Rooster & Till offers gourmet tiny bite-sized farm to table plates with odd exotic pairings that will have you Googling what the heck you're actually ordering. Rooster & Till has a rustic farm vibe with old school drop down Edison bulbs that still manages to bring an upscale vibe to the place. The menu is incredibly small with only 13 items and does not feature steak or lobster or anything fancy that you would expect to spend a lot on. The menu definitely did not feature anything I would go out of my way to get but came here on the recommendation of a girlfriend. 

The Seared Foie Gras came with must 1 tiny piece of foie gras paired with Huckleberry minus 8 Gastrique, Cashew Pear Vanilla, & Vanilla Pear for $24. The Foie Gras was way too salty. For the price, I should have gotten 4 times the serving size. 5/10 

The Seared Scallops came with just 3 scallops paired with salsa Macha, Boniato Puree, Lamb Neck Agridulce, & Lamb Consumme for $30. For the price I should have got 4 scallops with more filling garnishments. 7/10 

The Gnocchi came with just 1 small plate of Braised Short Rib, Ricotta, pickled peperonata, Parisian style for $24. For the price, the serving size should have been triple the size. 6/10 

The Cobia Collar Plate came with just 1 small plate of fried Cobia, Nuoc Cham, Thai Chili's, & Cilantro and had a nice flavor for $21. This dish was over-fried and way too fishy smelling and barely edible. 4/10 

Be prepared to get tiny tiny dishes so you'll have to spend at least $100 per person with at least 4 small plates per person at Rooster & Till or you will end up leaving hungry. The Rooster & Till does not offer a large enough selection of options with just 13 menu items, is not the best value, portion sizes should be much much larger for the pice, but at least many of these dishes are filled with ingredients so obscure and unique you probably will not find them at any other restaurant! If you're looking for something different and don't mind spending $100 per person without getting steak or lobster, definitely give Rooster & Till a try.

Hands down one of the best hidden gems I have been to in a while  Staff was so friendly, service was great, the playlist and vibe was just right. But best of all the food was out of hand. Every dish made do a little happy foodie dance and just so you understand how good it was ....  tried half of their menu the first night I was in Tampa & by the end of the night I was asking if they were open the next day so I can go back for every other dish I didn't try. Still dreaming  of every dish I had

My wife and I have been going to Rooster & the Till since we moved here two years ago.  We have had both the tasting menu and the regular menu, both of which are excellent.  The service is always good, and the atmosphere is great.  

I scheduled our graduation dinner for a party of 10 at R&T.  They were easy to work with, provided a quote for the large party that was spot-on, and accommodated food preferences including a gluten allergy and my wife who is pregnant.  The food and drinks were perfect and we all had a great time.  My friends who hadn't been to the restaurant before all loved it, and will be back.  The staff even provided signed congratulations cards for each of the graduates at dinner!  We are moving out of state but will certainly make reservations here when we're back in town.  

Wonderful experience.

There are many great restaurants here in Tampa Bay. There are none as creative & spectacular as Rooster & the Till. Chef Ferrel Alvarez, along with Ty Rodriguez and Chon Nguyen, crafted a tribute to inventive and delicious cuisine.

Sit at the kitchen bar and watch them perform mastery right in front of your eyes. The cobia collar is a must-get. The gnocchi, pork secreto, and scallops are exceptional. The way these ingredients and flavors come together will have you shaking your head in sheer amazement. This was a spectacular experience and I cannot wait to return.
Amazing isn't even enough to describe the menu, the service and the ambience. Will be going back again and again!

One of the best food experiences I've had. The staff is amazing, and the food is just *chef's kiss* 

I can only hope that something like this pops up in Miami. However, until then ... I guess I'll have to travel to Tampa more often ‍
Hidden in a strip mall, this sophisticated, open kitchen spot serves delicious food with a charming staff. Worth the drive.

One of the most amazing food experiences I have had was the chefs six course tasting menu at Rooster and the Till. I used to go here when the restaurant was half the size before it took over the shop next door. There's a large bar in the center with the kitchen behind it and tables throughout the perimeter of the restaurant. Beautifully designed and decorated. Chefs Ferrell Alvarez and Ty Rodriguez do an amazing job with combining unlikely food pairings to make beautiful and fantastic dishes. The chefs tasting menu has two options. With and without the wine pairings. I chose just the food option. All the members of your party need to have the tasting menu if one person wants it because of the timing of when the food comes out, 
The first course was Lamb Tataki: pistachio green harissa, green strawberries, tahini beet root dahl. 
Second course was the Kathi roll: onion pakora, sweet potato almond chutney, raita, red garlic chili smear. 
Third course Sea bass belly: chili cumin long beans, korma curry, coriander coconut chutney 
Fourth course: Fried sweetbreads: caulilini raisin aschar, curried potato croquette, smoked vindaloo, yogurt
Fifth course: goat cheese, rhubarb nectar, burnt carrot ganache, lavosh 
Sixth course: Cardamom turmeric meringue, green mango, mango jelly, coconut milk snow. 

What a flavor explosion in every bite! Hard to decide on my favorites but I would say the sea bass belly and I just loved the burnt carrot ganache with the goat cheese. My friend loved the Kathi roll. The presentation was just as professional as the flavors. This is a once in a lifetime experience that you will pay for but it's worth it. 
Our server was so knowledgeable with all the items on the menu, the wines and beer. Because they don't have a liquor license they have to be creative with some of their cocktails. Had the Yuzu margarita served with Sake. It was absolutely amazing. 
The restaurant is in a strip mall, so there's a few parking spots in the center but there's another lot across the street to park. They are only open for dinner Wednesday to Saturday from 5-9 so I highly suggest a reservation.
What a fantastic experience, solidifies my love of this restaurant as number one in Tampa bay.

First time back since COVID got a couple of seats at the bar no wait on a Saturday night.  Sitting at the bar let's you look right into the bar and kitchen and all I saw all night were a group of people giving it 110% and turning out masterfully prepared food with the precision of a Swiss watch.  Did I mention the food is exceptional?  Get the Cobia collar.. roll up your sleeves and dive into it.  By the time I was done I felt like I needed a cigarette and I don't even smoke.  

A true gem in Tampa can't wait to go back.

Cons: Grossly overpriced, ridiculously small portions, hit-or-miss food quality, too noisy for conversation.

Pros: Genuinely friendly and helpful wait staff.

Won't be back, definitely won't recommend.

Food was great. Menus do change often. Servers very attentive and explained every dish served. When we went, it was more of an Asian fusion fois. we had gnocchi, Iberico pork secreto, seared fois gras with strawberries, crispy cobia collar, pork katsu, sesame ice cream and five spice donuts. We enjoyed everything, except the fois gras and the 2 desserts. The strawberry sauce did not go well with fois gras. Five spice should not go on desserts. Couldn't enjoy the sesame ice cream either. There are reviews from different people who enjoyed these desserts. Everyone has different tastes. We'll return to try different menus.

business.name: Kobe Japanese Steakhouse - Brandon
business.categories: Steakhouses, Sushi Bars, Restaurants, Japanese

reviews.text: Yabu was amazing and very entertaining. Great food prepared by our awesome chef Yabu.
Food is always great but the last two times I went there was zero entertainment value and there should be for the price.  I will be trying other places.

Had a large party of 13 had a reservation for the room to hold the party we had the gave our reservation away golds the party was never booked after we showed them all the information of the booking managers were no help and had the choice of splitting the party up or squeeze all on one table this was our first time here and will be our last time if I could give them a zero I would and food sucked
Yabu was awesome tonight and great service from our server. Her name started with a V. Great food as well.

Couldn't say one bad word about this place. Celebrated my birthday here tonight (my kids treat) 
From start to finish laughs and great drinks. Lord of fun entertainment and high energy from the chef :) he bring the tricks and jokes and we enjoyed it. The food wow .. fried rice, vegetables, mushrooms, chicken, steak, soups and ginger salad all executed perfectly and the flavors were right on time. Service was exceptional. Can't wait to go back again but for now I have leftovers for tomorrow :) make sure you get your yum yum sauce to go along with the yum yum yum food.

Shawn was great! His chief style is superb! 
We had a party of 6. Large portions and whatever you didn't finish , they personally boxed up for you!

Food was amazing and our chef Yabu was hands down the best I've ever had at any hibachi restaurant. So friendly, entertaining and absolutely hilarious! Our server Ashli was very attentive and super friendly. So glad we decided on Kobe for my son's birthday dinner.
We had Shawn as our hibachi chef and he is amazing!! Hands down the best hibachi ever!! Thank you Shawn for being so awesome.....you're the best!!

Walked in without a reservation and was sat in 5min. The chef was very funny and was engaging. Even told some new jokes that I haven't heard before. I had the sirloin and lobster which were prepared perfectly. Only downside was we felt rushed after the chef left to leave.

Last minute decision to have a family dinner landed us here.

I reccomend making a reservation, it was busy for early dinner.

Our sever was friendly and had a sense of humor. He served the salad  at the table which had a flavorful  ginger dressing.

I upgraded to filet with my chicken and shrimp.

The filet was tender, the chicken juicy and the shrimp went well with the fried rice and vegatables. I was very happy that everything didn't need extra yum yum sauce. I've been to other places and the food was not great. This was an amazing meal.

We will definately be back to this location.

This establishment is very annoying. Literally calling for DAYS! I'm not understanding how the phones rings off the hook to the point were calling on multiple phones repeatedly with no one answering. Like???? What the hell.

I won't be back to this restaurant any time soon.. my family and I chose to sit at the dine in side rather than the hibachi tables because of social distancing but the food we received was awful! I have been to this restaurant a few times and never had such a bad experience..

First time visiting a Kobe restaurant, very impressed. Shawn + Ashli where brilliant and made the experience brilliant, food was great but the service was better. Great job and very happy with the evening. We will be back.
Great place to take family.. good food and it was a fun  experience. The constant happy bdays with the drums is a bit chaotic but besides that all good.
Terrible! Had to wait an hour to be served even tho we had reservation at 8. Never coming back here again. What a waste of time. Not to mention steak was super dry!
Amazing service by our cook shawn! great and funny guy! definitely will be back to see him!

This place is just a great place to have dinner with family and friends. I am not a fan of hibachi but the layout of this restaurant doesn't allow for the hibachi to be too loud or overshadow conversations. The food and service were excellent!

Our chef was amazing.  He did the spatula twirling and even tossed it behind his back and caught it.  I have been to a few restaurants that do this and he was the first one I've seen that did the volcano with another few layers on top to make it look like an hourglass before he lit it and then he knocked off the top part that looked like a funnel so the steam came out of the "volcano."

The food was delicious.  Both my 5&7yo liked the soup and my 5yo doesn't even like mushrooms normally but she ate them and said she liked them anyway.  They both liked their noodles and my 5yo loved her rice.

My husband and I shared the land & sea with lobster, shrimp and steak.  We asked for the steak to be cooked medium and it was really good.  Maybe it was the cut but it was tender and good.  The lobster and shrimp was good too.  I enjoy eating like this - right when the food is ready and nice and hot on your plate (I like my hot food hot and my cold food cold).

There was a little confusion on my brother in laws extra orders to go but other than that everyone was nice and the food was delicious.  It's been a while since I've been to a place like this and it made me think I need to go back more often.  Give it a try!

You absolutely have to make reservations now; which I am quite okay with. I love the precautions they are taking to keep people safe but entertained. 

This was a pre-birthday dinner for my hubby. Our sever was very good. I don't remember her name, but she had a fresh burn from an accidental almost fall. Either way, get drink suggestion was spot on. 

Our cook was new and did a crazy cool light show with the volcano. The food was plentiful, the drinks were good and the interactions were just enough. 

Kobe will always be one of my go tos for fresh "Japanese good".

Outstanding customer service given by both our server Hadeal as well as our Chef Masato!!!
Excellent food, phenomenal drinks and... clean restaurant.

Fantastic service and even better food. The wait was worth it!!! The sushi OMG!!! Amazing!!!!! The portions are huge. Please go see Anthony "AN" he was the best!! Thank you fir making my birthday a special one!!!! 

Thanks again!!!

After waiting an hour and no text back, I approached the host and she frantically seated us (past 9pm--they close at 9:30pm). 
Waitress rudely asked us for drinks and if we are ready to order. Barely came to check on us. We felt rushed and unwanted. 
Food tasted great as usual, but the bill was rushed too. It wasn't like we were the only ones there. They had plenty of hibachi tables just seated for the show and all. We just came in to eat at a table for the dinner for two which the host said was available for table dining while the waitress said it was not. No wonder they charge a standard gratuity fee for any kind of dining--so they can serve you however they want and still get paid. Disappointed!

*UPDATE*
After contacting Kobe through their website, all they did was say sorry in the dullest way possible. This could have been said through a comment instead of having me send in something through the website. 
This has left a bad taste in my mouth which is more than I can say for your food. Truly disappointed. 
I wish I could give 0 stars.

Was not my first choice but certainly my last. We share the same anniversary as our friends and after bouncing around on restaurants, the girls settled on this place. They demanded a credit card to hold your reservation and if you didn't get there on time they bill you like a doctors office no show!!! Never ever heard of that before anywhere!!! Of course we were running late so I told my friends to head in. Traffic just had to be terrible that day and that didn't help!! We had a 15 minute window and got there with one minute to spare. Inside, typical Japanese restaurant...food and service were great. I'd stay away from this place and reservations in the future!
Awesome experience and great to watch your ‍ making your dish. Food was great . Seriously would recommend this place for your family.

business.name: Centro Bar & Kitchen
business.categories: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Favorite local tapas bar which is quite a treat in Reno somewhat simple tastes. 
They have a seasonal transitioning menu keeping fresh options as an option.
I don't think I have ever had a bad plate here and I have frequented enough to be recognized as a regular. 

The newest addition the short ribs were spicy and delicious with a building heat.  I was wise to only eat one as I was a bit more sensitive to spice right now.

The service was amazing and the food excellent 
We asked for the server to pick 6 dishes and each one was unique and tasty. Great choice
Great small plates. Gnocchi was amazing. Had a great old fashioned too. Very cozy atmosphere. We will be back for a date soon!

Prefect date night restaurant!!  We had the absolute best server tonight Jeremiah if you find yourself here you must ask for him and have him select your meals.   We did not order one item We had him select everything and it was by far the best experience I have ever had.   The food is absolutely out of this world and perfect for a person that loves to try new things and doesn't want to get super full.  I can not wait to come back again and introduce friends to this restaurant.

The  Executive Chef at Centro is Cameron Atkinson, a dynamic, creative chef who is the young man behind the gastronomical creations at Centro. Demand warranted the expansion in the rear of the restaurant to accommodate diners at one of Reno's hot spots. Cameron will be moving to the new Centro location at the Rancharrah Village when it opens for business in the near future.
A birdseye view of my most recent experience at Centro:
Hangar steak  4*
Chicken thighs  5*
Grilled Octopus. *4
Heirloom Tomato salad  5*
Saki Cheesecake  5*
Service 4*

An excellent culinary experience.

The quality of the small dishes, the casual, cool ambiance, array of quality drinks, and friendly service all to make Centro Bar & Kitchen a spot we're confident to take out-of-town guests. We do miss their delicious brussel sprouts that have been taken off the menu, but continue to find enough to more than satisfy our taste buds!
Very hip and cutting edge food. Great craft cocktails to go with a leisurely paced meal.

Tapas done right! So happy we had the chance to give this wonderful little gem a chance.  

The seating inside is very very limited so if you are comfortable sitting outside give that a shot. The wait staff was very attentive and great with descriptions of the food. 

Check out the potatoes and the bone marrow those were our favorites.

Came here for our anniversary dinner and we were definitely not disappointed. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. Our server was very attentive and made great food/drink recommendations. All of the food was beautifully plated, and the drinks were so aesthetically made. Hands down, the sticky ribs were our favorite plate, but the ahi poke and filthy fries did not disappoint. Overall, we had an awesome experience and would highly recommend this place!
We can't help but order multiple things as well as drinks! We enjoy our time, service, and food here! Highly recommend trying multiple dishes to find your favorite one!

A highlight of our weekend trip to Reno. We tried just about everything on the menu and loved it all - stand-outs for me were the honeydew, which was light and delicious paired with cucumber and all kinds of crazy-good flavors, the sticky ribs (coulda used a wet nap - perfectly spiced sticky sauce all over my greedy fingers), an expertly seasoned and charred cauliflower dish, and the lovely beets with creamy goat cheese-dressed greens. The Smokey and the Bandit took the cocktail prize - genius pairing of bourbon and tamarind, plus a chile-infused liqueur that I will have to try to source so we can try to relive the Centro experience at home until our next trip to Reno. Cool space, friendly servers - all-around 5 stars.

This place blew my mind! It was my first tapas experience- but man has it set the bar. We ordered the beet salad, shrimp po boy, the tacos and the pork belly. All were delicious. The shrimp po boy had a little too much of the siracha that overflavored the honey/slaw/shrimp, but still tasty. The pork belly was my favorite. The addition with the mustard seeds atop the belly was amazing. We each had a few cocktails, all of them were equally delicious and easy to go down. We had a seat at a high top next to the open window, for it was such a nice place to sit and lounge there while looking out at the sky and Reno's downtown. I HIGHLY recommend this place for whatever your hunger needs are. Though the plates were small, our tummies were full. Especially when we topped off dinner with the divine bread pudding.

Everything we ordered was incredible and inspired by a medley of flavors! Not only did the food taste good- it was also expertly plated for a visual feast.

My favorites of the night were the striped bass- with a luscious, light creamy orange sauce and yummy root veggies accompanying. The shrimp poboy was another favorite- colorful, with explosive shrimp and bread that wasn't too greasy - perfectly light and fluffy! The beet salad with creamy goat cheese that melted in your mouth was nice- as was the mizuna salad. We also had the quail, bucatini and beef tataki. The cornbread paired with the quail was spectacular! I normally dislike cornbread because it gets mealy and grainy- but this piece was silky smooth. The beef tataki was my partners favorite dish- another bangin rare dish with amazing flavors an asian miso twist where the salt level was just right. The bread pudding dessert was another favorite!! Did not anticipate such a creative interpretation of bread pudding. 

My favorite aspect of eating at centro was that you left full but not heavy- every dish was fresh and healthy(ish)- and with an opportunity to try a lot of different dishes! The only downsides were that the drinks weren't as lovely as the food- the lemonade stand and Moscow mule were decent but nothing out of the ordinary and too small / too much ice & the dessert took wayy too long (like 10min) to arrive. But otherwise really spot on! I will be back to try the next season's rotating menu.
Service, food and atmosphere was great.  Will want to return.  Both my husband and I enjoyed our date night here.

This spot is great for date night/ girls night or just grabbing a drink and a snack. My friends and I went o an weds night so we had no wait and got to sit at the back patio. The food came out super quick and the drinks were great. I def recommend the ahi poke and hanger steak. The beef tataki was also really yummy
Blown away by this awesome restaurant. Had the best meal in years. Definitely favorite spot in Reno. Great chef and kitchen crew. And awesome friendly waiter. The best. Thank you guys.

We got here around 6:30pm on Saturday and the tables just filled up so we took a seat at the bar. I love sitting at the bar especially when you can watch the cooks in action. The bartender was phenomenal. So friendly and attentive. Based on the suggestions from friends and the photos on Yelp I could tell the food looked great but I was honesty BLOWN away by the beautiful dishes we were served. We ordered several items as you need three or four per person(in my opinion!) and loved it all. We tried the beef tataki, mizuna, beet, and papaya salad, fresh bucatini, striped bass. Bread pudding for desert washed down with the desert wine was the perfect pair. 

We were informed they are opening a new restaurant near/at the old Harrahs ranch in July. I can't wait to check it out and have also now book marked their sister restaurant La Vecchia for some more hand made pasta!

I thought I had been to this place but I've never and so glad that a friend picked this place or tapas! At first glance as a vegetarian, I wasn't sure if I would have anything to eat but the papaya was absolutely delicious - a perfect balance of sweet and savory. Also we did the filthy fries without the bacon and omg were they bomb! Putting this place on my list to come back to again soon. They have outdoor and a tent area for seating too.
Excellent food, great cocktails and a lovely atmosphere. Small plates, but packs a punch. Worth every penny

Centro Bar & Kitchen might be the best spot in midtown. Both the food and drink menus are stellar (if you go, you can't leave without ordering the beef tataki and the pork belly). I've been in a few times now by myself, but brought someone with me for dinner last night. Sat at the bar. Andy, the bartender, was fantastic. Great recommendations, knew exactly when to ask us if we needed anything, etc. Andy is great. Can't go wrong with Andy or Centro.

Had a great evening at Centro. Would highly recommend the sticky ribs, bone marrow, and trying a fun cocktail! A bit on the pricey side. Would go with no more than four people so you don't have to order doubles of everything.

Wow!!! Haven't had tapas like this in a long time. Safe to say the best I had so far in the States from East to West, pretty much right there with those found in Barcelona. Coming from the SF Bay Area and involved in the wine food industry, I am so glad to stumbled upon this place. Food looks great and the flavors seem to Tango with each other so effortlessly..... WOW!

Centro has been around a while, and I have been quite a few times over the years. When it first opened, I remember the menu being fun, diverse and creative. Then, in my opinion, the menu became smaller and more Mediterranean focused, which isn't my style, and so we hadn't returned in some time. Recently wanted a quick couple hours out of the house for some small bites and drinks, as I wasn't feeling a full blown dinner. The other tapas places in town I refuse to support, so I checked out the menu at Centro and again, it was diversified, creative! 

It is first come, first serve with the Covid stuff, so we came on a Saturday around 3:30 to hit their happy hour. We sat in the back patio where it is covered, but they turned on the heater for us too. Turned out the happy hour that day was on drinks only, only a slight bummer as I was wanting to have some oysters, I guess in preparation of their new spring menu debut to happen in a few days.

I started with the Scallop Crudo, and the Sticky Ribs, and Cory got the Al Pastor Tacos and Filthy Fries. He had a couple of beers ($4 on HH) while I asked for a creative mocktail ($4) I got a bright orange drink with a pretty lime rind twist. I don't know what was in it, we thought maybe mango and lime? but I would describe it as a sophisticated sunny delight. I thought I wasn't that hungry, but then ordered the Beets to help calm down the spiciness of the ribs. 

The scallop crudo was a surpise in that it was bay scallops and not thinly sliced divers scallops which was what I was expecting. The scallops were fresh and just sweet enough without being overpowering, and served with super sweet peas, salty red tobiko and drizzled with chili oil all sitting in a yuzi broth. I really enjoyed the components of this dish. The ribs were also good, I like a crust on the outside and a bit drier meat, but still tasty, not road kill, the meat came off the bone completely too. They were just unexpectedly spicy and the pickled carrots didn't do much to cut the burn (I am a wimp with spice, but even my husband said they were spicy). The beet salad was a good portion, lovely baby beets with the root tails still on, whimsical touch there. The goat cheese was the typical creamy and tangy. But really the star of the show here was the candied fennel sprinkled throughout. I loved the crunch and the pop of sweetness when combined with the tangy goat cheese. Really simple, but executed well dish. Cory really enjoyed the tacos, they were loaded and not overly greasy. The fifthly fries were also a hit, and filling! The cream sauce they put on them was delicious though. 

I wanted to order so many more things on the menu that was to be disappearing, the quail, octopus, desserts! But my body limited me. I really feel like the prices are amazing with the small plates almost all being $9, a couple might be $10. Then the big larger plates seemed to go around $14-$16, again, I think a great value. I am super excited to come back and try the new spring 2021 menu though! Additionally, they are opening a location at the Village at Ranch Harrah, which is closer to my house, so truly stoked for it. 

Sorry for the wordiness, I guess I get excited now when I go out and get to be blown away by the food! Enjoying life!
Amazing food and cocktails.  Always the best atmosphere. They change up the menu, drinks and desserts. The 'donuts' are incredible.

Always a great time at Centro!

This place is definitely one of my Reno go-tos. Love the tapas style plates and the food and drinks are always elevated and amazing.

business.name: Sidney Street Cafe
business.categories: Nightlife, Bars, Wine Bars, Soup, Restaurants, American (New)

reviews.text: I hadn't been here in at least 10 years. We dined in on a Thursday night and had exceptional food as well as service. Our waitress knew the menu and explained each item in depth, she was attentive and friendly. My friend is a chef and knew the chef there so he sent out some champagne as well as a few desserts that were amazing. My filet was divine and the pasta I had was a Cavetelli maybe and it had Alfredo sauce and red sauce and a pesto and you swirled them all together it was dreamy. I can't wait to go back

We went for a birthday dinner tonight. Started with some delicious cocktails (winter whiskey) and veal pot stickers. The pot stickers had a Teriyaki honey glaze, really good. Next was the fried bread which was so light and fluffy followed by our salads. I had the Ceasar, dressed perfectly with a flavorful dressing with a hint of anchovies on the back end, my partner had the apple salad with bleu cheese. For our entrees I had the Ribeye with Hassleback potato's and my partner had the pasta ravioli with brussel sprouts. Everything was excellent but, I cant handle spicey and the potatoes had some harsh chili oil. When the server saw me struggling after eating some she changed them out with a new order less the chili oil. We finished with the apple cannoli for dessert and they threw in a blond brownie with a vanilla ice cream for the birthday boy.  The experience was very nice, the food was fantastic, the ambiance was relaxing and they have a great drink selection. I am a bourbon drinker and they had at least a dozen high end bourbons including 2 Van Winkles. Overall a must try.

Everything you want from a fine dining experience. Amazing food, classy not stuffy, and attentive service. We came for an anniversary dinner and would highly recommend for a special occasion. 

My one criticism was that our waiter sounded a bit robotic when reading off the evening's specials. As a former server, put some personality into it and sell it! I joked with him so he would know he could lighten up with us and all was good after that. He did give us a free brownie a la mode for dessert which was fantastic.

Food: Filet (wasabi style) and scallops did not disappoint. Both cooked perfectly. You do need to order multiple sides as they are somewhat small. 

Drinks: Fantastic cocktails and wine list. We splurged on a nice bottle of Red with dinner. 

Ambiance: Dimly lit with exposed brick, large mirrors and wood tones. Classy. 

Service: Fantastic 

Cost: It's fine dining so it is more expensive but I still thought there were a lot of reasonable choices. Entrees $25-40. 

Overall, definitely a place for a celebration.

Not sure how we missed it all these years, but we saw Food is Love PBS show about the owners of this restaurant group and decided to try it with our out of town guests for  Pretty Woman at The Fox Theater, first show since Covid-19.
