Like others commented, the lobster turnover is richly perfect.  The apple salad was as good as a salad gets.  Potato soup was puréed perfection.

To be honest, the tenderloin with wasabi and mustard (?) sauce was perfect and bested the sweeter ribeye to our taste.  The trumpet mushrooms side was nice but sweeter than we were expecting.  The sweet Brussel sprouts were addictively good.  Dessert was triple death by chocolate (the call it dark brownie) was brilliantly original on the old classic. We are ready thinking about what we will try next time.

We will also find an excuse to visit their nearby Peacemaker restaurant.

It is true that the portions aren't massive, but it really was nice to get an appetizer, extra side and dessert.

Service was top notch.

My cavatelli pasta was tasty and my aperol spritz was very refreshing and balanced. Our server Jason was great. I deducted a star because unfortunately we were seated at a table that is placed by a back door that's not being used, which is tucked away from the rest of the restaurant. Another party may like the privacy, but I felt like it was the 60s. I should have just summoned my inner Nate (for any Ted Lasso fans) and asked for a better table, one where we may have actually enjoyed what seemed to be a nice ambience of the restaurant. Will visit again in hopes of a better table situation.

What looks like a stuffy, old-school, fancy dining experience actually contains one of the best chefs in St Louis! A long standing establishment that was spoken fondly of by every local I conversed with. I myself was swooned by the flavors that happen under this roof. Make sure you get a reservation. It looks like 5PM is the easiest time to get one, but by 6pm, the place was packed.

The veal dumplings are pure pleasure. The teriyaki sauce is plate licking good. The honey glaze only enhances the indulgence, while there is a noticeable spiciness that lingers in the backdrop. The veal itself is a nice touch of gaminess but coming off more like a sausage. I like that you can order them as a single piece rather than the full order, especially since I wanted to taste as much as I could on the menu.

The lobster turnover were also a highly decadent item. Not only are you getting flaky soft phyllo dough, but that brandy cream is the star of the meal. 
The lobster, although small, was cooked just right texture wise. You can also order these by a single piece.

The beignets they serve at the table are lovely display of their bakery skills, but that slightly funky whipped butter is the real item to get excited about. It can be addictive!

The ribs are Ok, but the sauce is what you really get excited for. The midwest think they can smoke ribs, but being from texas, they still dont hold a candle to what we do. They have a nice pull from the bone, but thats about it. They dont seem as rendered as they could be.

The crudo is a lovely interpretation of a peruvian dish with north american ingredients. The slightly acidic popcorn, along with its slightly soft texture is a great play of textures on the tongue. Light on the stomach but packs a tasty punch. This is one of those contemplative dishes. If you are there while it's in season, get it. I have a feeling the different seasons of crudo are all good.

The snickers dessert should have been described as deconstructed, but it didnt matter with how delicious it was! The salty caramel sauce, the tangy chocolate ice cream, that nougat marshmallow fluff, and coarsely chopped peanuts all made this a delightful meal. Luckily for me, this dessert appeared back on the menu only a week before I arrived. It was frequently requested by guest that the chef decided it was time to resurrect this beauty. It makes sense, especially in the fall/winter time when lots of fruits and vegetables are out of season.

Even with the slight misstep on the ribs, this place is absolutely worth going to. If you only have one option for dinner, this is the place I would recommend.

Looking for a nice date night and willing to splurge on some amazing food? Look no further, Sidney Street is all of that! My husband and I save our visits to Sidney Street for special occasions like anniversaries or job promotions or other similar celebrations. 

They change parts of their menu (appetizers and desserts) regularly and will have a small chalkboard at your table with those items. The servers are able to talk through each dish and help you decide which one. The entrees are set up ala carte so you choose the meat and sides separately except In just a handful of items (like my mushrooms maiyaki). Again the server is great at helping describe the items and help you decide what you want to enjoy. 

While it is certainly pricy, Sidney Street is well worth the cost, especially for celebratory occasions.

Order: Burger, french onion soup, Caesar salad


Pros: the food was AMAZING for the most part. Loved the ambiance of the cafe and the waiter was amazing & patient (there was 7 of us). Listen the beignet's was off the chain (ha ha ha)! I had like 4 of them suckas with the homey butter. That burger was amazing damn! It needed nothing added to it! 

Cons: french onion soup was ok and not what I was accustomed to. I like croutons and provolone on top of my soup. The flavor and base of the French onion tasted like wine or something. I ate it but wasnt a huge huge fan.

We had never been here before but wanted to try a nice restaurant for my daughters 33 birthday. We walked in and were immediately greeted and taken to our table.  The restaurant has a very warm, comfortable feeling with lots of dark wood and brick surroundings.  The waitress was friendly, and attentive, providing us with detailed descriptions of the specials and making sure all our needs were met.  

The food was phenomenal!  We started with the lobster turnovers and veal dumplings. Both were delicious.  The lobster turnovers were like a pastry with lobster inside and generous amount of lobster sauce.  

I had the  beef tenderloin, which was a filet that was butterflied and stuffed with lobster and covered with a lobster bearnaise sauce.  It was as delicious as it sounds and cooked perfectly.  I had the 8oz portion and it was more than filling.  I forgot to mention the bread and butter. The bread was actually beignets that had a slight sweet flavor to them.  

My wife had the rigatoni with smoked chicken which was amazing.  I wish I could have had two entrees as I would have ordered this as well.  It had a great smoky flavor with a creamy sauce and a generous amount of chicken.  You can order this in a larger size but the portion provided was more than enough, even with me helping out.  

We tried multiple deserts but my favorite was the panna cotta.  Again, the sizes were more than generous and we shared, but could not finish all of it.

Overall, the food, ambiance, and staff made this a night to remember and we will certainly be back.  The prices were more than reasonable and made this a restaurant that is not just for special occasions but is affordable to visit on a regular basis.

It was my hubby who choose the restaurant this time as he knows i am a fan of fine dining. The restaurant entrance resides at the corner of a building, which is tricky cause who would know there is such a nice restaurant inside. This is authenticity it self. 
It has an old vibe, tables closets chairs are all dark wood, lamps are dim and closer to each table rather than being high closer to the ceiling which adds a romantic vibe.
Our waiter was a young very delightful, and calm gentleman. He was knowledgeable for what there was on the menu and the ingredients.
Food wise , we got Crudo and lobster turnovers for appetizers. Crudo was make of Fresh raw Hamachi, when when I say fresh it means Fresh. The lobster turnovers is small slices of lobster rolled in Phyllo which was crispy topped with tomato sauce that had some lobster sauce taste to it. 
I thought about not sharing this plate but I had to leave a space for whats coming next. 
As for main plates, they come with salad.
i got scallops and it was maybe one of the best scallops i have had. The portions were of good size not too slimy, had buttery taste. I really recommend the scallops.
Beef tenderloin was medium done as requested, was juicy and had right amount of seasoning.
PS: this is for restaurant, house salad needs bit more flavor. The dressing was super light mostly flavorless. Adding extra virgin oil, salt, balsamic vinegar /lime juice will do the job.

Overall the experience was amazing and i give it 5/5 .

Dined at Sidney Street Cafe last night and it was great.  I had the steak and it was perfect, my wife had the chicken and it was prepared to perfection!  We sat in the bar area because we were walk in's and did not have reservations.  Two entrees and drinks with tip ended up to be about $100.

Astonishing that in this day and age a waiter would give the check to a man and return the receipt to a man after a woman paid. If we'd been greeted properly upon entering I might have been willing to overlook this. Otherwise a good experience. But perhaps not a terribly progressive or woman friendly establishment.
Excellent dinner!!!! Have to start with the veal dumplings.   The main coursers are always changing and ability to build your own main via the a la carte menu!

This is the finest establishment I've ever been to. Everything they do, from prep to service I would give ten stars to. I also would like to say I think the prices are very reasonable, my bill was 200 bucks and was worth every penny. I went there to celebrate an anniversary, and my girlfriend and I were complimented with a congratulations and the dark chocolate turtle brownie. Ten stars hands down.

Ridiculously small portions - very ok food.   I think we could have found a much more satisfying place to have dinner in St. Louis.  Comparing it to Polite Society where we ate the night before - ambiance and food much better at Polite Society.

Hands down my favorite restaurant in STL. The service is top notch and the food even better. You can't go wrong coming here for any occasion, impress your date by bringing them here. This place rivals those others that are priced higher than here. Highly recommend!

My husband took me here for my birthday and it was amazing. From the cocktail to the lobster turnover for starters and the scallops and trumpet mushrooms, the ribeye and creamed kale it all tasted amazing. The service and atmosphere were exceptional and pot de cream and brownie were amazing desserts. I will be back and recommend you trying it too.
Food and service excellent in every way - our waiter was very attentive without being obtrusive.

I'll start by saying the food is incredible. We started with lobster turnovers, salads and then I had a filet and my husband ordered the roast duck. We went for Valentine's Day and the ambiance was amazing. Very dark, romantic and quiet restaurant. Our only complaint is how small the portions are. My husband's plate had two very small slices of duck. It was absolutely worth going and every bite was delicious, but you won't need a takeout box!

Took my fiancé here to celebrate a birthday. The meal did not disappoint. We had the lobster turnovers and tuna crudo for an appetizer both were 5 stars. We then had Caesar salads with the freshest homemade dressing you've ever had with fresh Parmesan and crumbled croutons on top. For entrees we had the filet and scallops with Brussels sprouts and fried rice on the side. Have to say the greatest Brussels sprouts and fried rice in our lives. Finally we had the Sidney street take on a banana split for dessert. This dessert was decadent and far exceeded our expectations. Top 5 best desserts in our lives. Will absolutely be back. Also, Lenny was our server he had great recommendations and took wonderful care of us!
Went for my birthday and this place was so cute and had the best food! 10/10 would go back for the lobster turnovers and scallops

What can be said about Sidney Street that hasn't been said before? The quintessential dining spot in St. Louis, that was killing it here locally even before St. Louis had this stellar dining scene and is still setting the bar high today. On my most recent visit we ordered the lobster turnovers to start. I don't think I've even been here and not ordered the lobster turnovers and as usual they did not disappoint. My god they are good. I had the scallops for my entree. I was a little surprised at how small the scallops were, but honestly after the lobster turnovers, butternut squash soup and house-special rolls, I couldn't even eat what I had. Excellent experience all around, as expect. Consistency at its best.

Sidney Street Cafe has been our date night, birthday celebration, anniversary celebration and "need a date night" for years. We love the ambiance, the owners, our waiters and of course..the food. It is a measure above any place else by far. We so appreciate any and all that they do, especially this year 2020. We have picked up their take out and it also has been spectacular. If you have not tried it, you are missing out on so many things.

Delicious food and top notch service. I love the fact that they put the appetizer selection in a blackboard and explain each and every single thing. The wine list is decent and the cocktail options are spot on. This place absolutely deserves the coveted James beard award.

The food was amazing! Everything we ordered was very flavorful. Some of the best Brussel sprouts and fried rice I've ever taste! Our waitress was the best ever! She was very informative and generous. We are definitely going back!!!

business.name: Bakersfield
business.categories: Bars, Mexican, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, Restaurants, Tacos

reviews.text: The margaritas were on point along with the food!! Our server  Camron, was friendly and attentive.  Definitely would come again if I ever visit indy again

Went to Bakersfield last night for the first time! Went around 4:30pm on a Saturday and only waited about 10 minutes. My friend and I ordered a Orange Hibiscus and Pineapple margarita and they were delicious. We got regular queso to share then she got chicken taquitos and I got a few different tacos to try! I got the Polle Verde, Carnitas, and Papas & Chorizo. I loved them all and I can't wait to go back to try more! Parking was street parking since it's off Mass Ave, for 2 hours, I paid around $3.25 for parking.
Chelsea pitwar was our sever and she was great! I would highly recommend her! Love this place!

I typically swing by Bakersfield for drinks, but tonight was my first time getting food and getting to experience their service. 

We had a great time! Taylor, was our server and she was fantastic. We had to split our bill in a funky way & she had no reservations about splitting the bill up & executing flawlessly. Salt for Taylor - she's a doll! 

We had a variety of food at the table - from appetizers to tacos to salads. All the food was 10/10! 

Highly recommend going to Bakersfield to grab drinks, get food food, & not feel rushed about getting out!
Taylor was fantastic!!!! She's great and lovely and her personality was where it's at!!! She's amazing and deserves a raise

Bakersfield is always a classic for us although moving away it has been awhile. Jo however was amazing, personable, friendly, and outstanding bartender. She really helped us recreate that experience that first brought us on our first date to Bakersfield.

The food was very pricey and it was not worth the price NOT TO ME! We just moved to INDIANAPOLIS unfortunately for work and I tell you this I paid so much money for food that wasn't good at all. I took my daughter here for the first time and I can tell you this NEVER AGAIN. The food is as dry and tasteless
Taylor was the best! She had great recommendations and was super kind!! Loved the short rib queso!
Amazing tacos and margaritas!! Wait times can get quite long, but so worth the wait! Definitely try the fish tacos.

Dinner Tonight was at the Bakersfield. Now, in the past I've had some rough experiences, but today was by far the best experience here. Our server Jack was super on point and fast, over all customer service was great. Our appetizer was the Esquites and The Trio. We had the Monday drink special the Four Roses for 3$ (Not bad), and we had tacos 3Carnitas, Pollo Verde, and the Fish. All tasted very good. And it wasn't a long wait.

I've been coming to this place for YEARS! Now!

I love the margaritas and the tacos. I also can't get enough of the queso.

As of lately, my last two attempts to attend this establishment have ended badly!!! The front staff or the hostess the guy at the front is just so rude. 

Came in after Dave Chappelle screening night and even though it was 10pm and they closed at midnight..was told they weren't seating people. Let that brush off my shoulders and went to the eagle and got a seat.

Last night, arrive and he's in his phone first. Literally in his phone and doesn't even acknowledge us waiting for a table. Secondly it was 9pm and although there were plenty of empty tables open but he told us.....1 hour wait every rudely. He then proceeded to get in back into his cell phone.

This has been my second attempt to attend Bakersfield as of lately. THE front staff is just horrible. You'd think someone would be kind enough to give you the opportunity to spend money. However, if the front staff is rude Simply put I won't be eating there !!

Our server Hannah was AMAZING!!! So friendly, welcoming and catered to our every need!!! Her manager Collin was also extremely friendly and we really enjoyed our time! Food was amazing as well as the service, cannot thank them enough!

I'm only updating my review to add my picture from my recent visit here and remind the public once again that I love Bakersfield! So good and especially loved the chorizo taco. The shrimp taco is a classic that I will never not get when I go. 

Xoxo,

Is this thing on?
Best taco place in downtown Indy!! It's literally steps from my apartment and I've probably been 20 times in the past 18 months, no lie. Get the mezcal margarita and the loaded queso!!

Let me start with service. Fantastic friendly service. We dined on a very rainy evening. I started my Bakersfield experience by falling down the stairs to their basement dining area.  I was in flat riding boots not heels ( and no I had not been drinking). Please be careful on the steps when you dine here, they get slick.  Margarita was wonderful.  Queso loaded with chorizo delish!  Tacos are tiny, flavorful and creative. Well worth the $4 price each. Got 3 and could not finish. Good meal!
People say they love the tacos here, but I've never really understood why.

One of my favorite places downtown. I love the Al Pastor & Short Rib tacos, Queso and chips, fresh guacamole, and the Willie salad just to name a few. The staff is usually friendly and attentive. Nice atmosphere!

I came here on a rainy Wednesday night with some friends! There were a lot of people considering the rainy weather. We sat downstairs.

I got the Al Pastor Taco and Shrimp Taco. I enjoyed both! Our server Kylie was super attentive and great!

3 tacos: al pastor (with pineapple), pollo Diablo (with chipotle lime sauce) and a Baja shrimp taco (with pickled Fresno chive). The meat was tasty. But what have made them better was a grilled handmade tortilla. A little spendy for $4.00 each.
Restaurant has a hip atmosphere. Lots of tequila and whiskey at the bar. Next time.
#spicemeister approved.
Taylor is one of the best servers I have ever had. Her kind personality and quick service was very much appreciated. We will be back and telling all of our friends to come to Bakersfield!
Love all of the food here (especially the short rib tacos), but it's on the pricey side for smaller portions.

Went there for the first time the other day.  The tacos were delicious!  I especially liked the shrimp and the fish taco.  Also tried margarita and that did not disappoint.  I think our servers name was Max, and he did a great job.  With Covid you could tell he was really hustling to take care of a lot of tables, but we never felt neglected.  Will definitely return.

Great place with amazing ambience and food. The service is great And the  servers are friendly and knowledgeable, they helped us out figuring popular drinks and the food.we tried tacos and margaritas pitchers and loved loved loved them. Would definitely recommend getting a trio for the table to experiment with different salsas.

The food came out cold but the flavor was there!! The chips are delicious and the guacamole was outstanding!! The interior is such a nice modern rustic mix... feels like Nashville more than Indie... the music is a nice selection a bit loud if you're trying to talk though(just sit outside)... overall I'll definitely be back to try it again and hope to get hot food.
Amazing tacos and amazing margaritas! Wish they took reservations but otherwise going is always a good experience

business.name: Thai Lotus
business.categories: Thai, Restaurants

reviews.text:
Staff is always friendly and smiling.
The service is amazing, but the food is phenomenal!!!

I've been here about last year because my cousin kept telling me that their food are so good. I agreed with him at that time. 
So today I went back here but I had to changed my opinion about this place. It was not because the service so bad, not at all. The server ladies were all very nice and friendly. 
I just didn't get the wow sensation no more. I ordered the curry potstickers, lunch special padthai and panang curry. 
The soup that came with lunch was plain, no flavor. 
Curry Potsticker were tasty but a bit watery. 

Lunch special came with salad drizzle with peanut sauce and egg roll. The salad basically just lettuce but the drizzle was so skimpy. I barely got it mixed with the lettuce in the bottom. The egg roll was good, typical egg roll taste. 

Padthai was way too much sauce so it was wet. The flavor was quite sour than sweetness side. I asked the spicy level 4 but this padthai wasn't spicy at all. They gave a little cup of chili powder, I guess it meant to sprinkled on your padthai to make it spicy as your liking. 

Panang curry was awful. Too thick, and I didn't taste any curry at all. It was too peanuty flavor instead mix with curry paste. I got it that panang curry is all about peanut but this one was over powering peanut flavor, it should called peanut curry. Panang curry usually has richer, creamier and sweeter not just peanut flavor. 
Thai tea boba was good, just typical Thai iced tea too with boba.

I ordered delivery as I was craving pad Thai.  Everything looked good. But as I started eating it the shrimp had a weird string in it and I thought maybe they hadn't removed the poo line. Well as I pulled it apart it was something else more like fishing line. I started pulling apart all the shrimp and they were all the same. It was disgusting.

Our new go to for Thai food ands takeout. There's not been one thing I've had thus far I haven't enjoyed. Most entrees are great to share between two people. In our home we like to get two entrees to split for variety than plenty of leftovers for later. The shrimp ran-goons are a favorite and they'd cashew chicken remains a staples.
Thai Lotus has amazingly quick service!  Staff is professional and friendly.  Quality of food is tasty.  This restaurant always has business.  Would highly recommend.
Great lunch spot in Midtown! Large selection of lunch combos and the service is fast and friendly. When they say Thai hot they mean it! Great value for the price.

Went with the Chicken Yellow Curry lunch special and a side of Roti. This by far is now one of my favorite Thai restaurants in Reno. Service was great and very quick. They also have perfect sized lunch specials.  I will definitely be back the next time I'm in the area. If you love a good yellow curry, this is your place to go.

This is an "after the fact" review. It's been a couple years since we lived there and visited this restaurant regularly. We STILL frequently talk about the dumplings (pot stickers) in red curry sauce and how delicious that combo was.  We ordered it mild BUT had the spicy condiment tray brought for us to use and we could customize it from mild to fiery depending on our choice of spices.  Everything we ordered was fresh, delicious AND beautifully presented. The service was always great. Vegetarian / vegan options were available. I was thinking of the restaurant today and am pleased to see they were able to make it through this past difficult year! Definitely recommended! Try the red curry dumplings!

LOVE this place. Their Pad Thai reminds me of some I've had in Seattle and San Francisco. It's more of a flavorful take on Pad Thai, with the lime flavor very prominent. My favorite dishes are the panang curry and the pineapple fried rice, both of which I order with fried tofu. Their tofu is to die for!

Thai lotus is what love would taste like if it were food. I've never ever had a single problem with my orders here and the service is ALWAYS on point. Love GG, shes amazing and always smiling. TL is always my go to for comforting Thai food
This is the best Thai in Reno! The specials are so unique and flavorful. I always come here when I'm craving Thai

I actually like coming to Thai Lotus, but today was upsetting. I ordered food for pick up and when I went to pick it up they said they ate it because I didn't come in at a certain time frame. Granted they did try to get a hold of me, but how can you not consider that people get stuck at work and can't pick up their food right away or answer their phone. I used to work at a restaurant and we would wait for the customer to come a pick up their food even if we closed down for lunch. I don't know why they have this tacky policy of eating the customer's food if they don't pick it up within 30 mins or so.  Ridiculous

Some of the best Thai food you'll find in town.

Awesome curry selection with some delicious appetizers. Would honestly recommend this place to anyone looking for delicious Thai food. 

A little busy on Friday/Saturday nights because it is that good, but not too bad.

My go to Thai restaurant in town.

10/10

We love Thai food and have been wanting to explore all of the offerings in Reno. Based on the many positive reviews we ordered from here tonight. Unfortunately the food was not good. Nothing tasted fresh. The Tofu was spongey. The yellow curry was more of a brown than a yellow. The prices were higher than average as well. Sorry to say, either this was a really bad night for Thai Lotus, or this place is a hard pass.

Had a craving for some good Thai food before catching a flight back home from Reno. This place was close to our airport hotel so very convenient. Busy on Friday night, but not too crowded and service was fast and friendly. The pad kee mau was very flavorful with lots of Thai basil and the noodles were cooked perfectly. Prices were pretty good too. So happy we found this place!
Best Thai food in town! Their fresh spring rolls and pineapple fried rice are my favorites! I recommend this place.
We ordered pickup and it was ready quickly. Everything was accurate, and staff was very polite. Can't wait to go back for in person dining.

Great experience, EVERY TIME!  Consistency is key! Always great service, delicious food, and clean restaurant.  The staff is always friendly and tentative. This is our go-to spot for great Thai food in Reno. Been dining here for several years and will continue to return for many more!
Ordered a 5 Star Green Curry, got a zero star spicy served to me. Sent it back and got a 1 star dish back. Got wish washy excuses on why it was not spicy.  Sent it back...

I love Thai Lotus. They have great vegetarian options and consistently good food. The stand outs for me are the Red Curry, Curry Pops, and the Thai Lotus Pad Thai. They serve great portions  and are a great local business. I have been eating there for going on 8 years. If you want comfort food this is the place to go.

Ordered 4 take-out dishes.  Total disappointment.  Everything was overcooked and the dishes looked completely inedible.  To make matter worse, I ordered spicy level 6 and they put in a lot of chillis rendering the dishes inedible.  My tongue was in pain from the massive amount of chillis.   You can see the disgustingly looking dishes below with a lot of chillis.  I called the restaurant to complain and they did not care.  The woman's response was "well that is how it is here".  I don't recommend anyone eating here unless you want stomach ulcers, acid reflux, and possibly food poisoning.

When first pulling up to the restaurant- I thought it might be closed! Very unassuming from the outside. Inside though it's cozy and clean with plenty of space and tables. 

I ordered the yellow curry, eggplant and pad kee mao. The yellow curry was delicious!! Such a delicate coconut flavor- a good curry soaking in rice is the heartwarming comfort food you need any day. I will say the potato could have been either softer and more cooked or just have less of it since it kind of took away from the saucy star of the show- the broth is really what you want most of. I think the other two dishes were good but lacked flavor or ingenuity. The eggplant had too many non-eggplant veg (read: onions and cabbage galore) and I can't help but compare it to the vortex of spicy flavor of moo dangs eggplant dish and be slightly disappointed it didn't live up. The pad kee mao was good but again just didn't wow and tofu lacked luster and flavor. 

Everything was reasonably priced and a great deal. A reasonable spot with comfort food when you need it just nothing out of the ordinary. Service was good if not a little slow. Will be back to eat the curry again at the even better price point of lunch special!

Gosh. I never thought I'd change my rating of Thai Lotus but the last experience just didn't measure up to literally every one before it and I wanted to share just in case it represents an issue the business needs to address.

I've been ordering the same dishes at Thai Lotus now for more than 5 years. I love the Spicy Spicy Catfish, Green Curry, Thai Ribs and just about anything they list on the nightly specials board. When friends offered to stop. G for dinner with takeout from Thai Lotus, Spicy Spicy Catfish was calling my name and I was pumped to have it for dinner. My wife loves the Green Curry and she got that for her dinner, so two of my faves were on the table! 

Well, both dishes were pretty different from every previous order, and I was left kind of puzzled. 

The catfish is normally tossed in a light spicy sauce with the consistency of a paste that coats the fish, eggplant and other veggies. It's complex and herbaceous, and just damn delicious. 

The dish I got on this evening was swimming in a rich panang curry like sauce with a peanut flavor. The only thing similar to the other dish I knew and loved as spicy spicy catfish were the items in that sauce. While it was tasty, it absolutely was not the dish I'd ordered before and it left me very disappointed and dissatisfied.

The Greet Curry with shrimp was light in flavor and incredibly watery, and instead of coating the rice, it turned it soupy. I will say the shrimp were plump, tender and sweet, and the veggies in the curry were cooked well too. 

I hope this was a one off mistake and not how these dishes are being served now.
This place has great  Thai Curry, it is so tasty. The veggies are fresh, the serving sizes are perfect. I love this place, the servers are friendly and helpful.

Friendly service is always a great start to a meal!
Food was quick and delicious too. We enjoyed the fried pork potstickers, orange chicken, and pineapple fried rice with chicken. Loved it all, but our favorite was the pineapple fried rice!

business.name: Fond
business.categories: American (New), Bars, Seafood, Restaurants, Nightlife

reviews.text: Attentive staff, intimate atmosphere no matter how many are in your party. It's rare to find a restaurant with such a talented creative chef, great bartender, professional and engaging staff in a quality atmosphere. I'm really glad we found this jewel to kick off a special night. From appetizers to dessert options the offerings tease and tantalize the tastebuds. Presentation was great and the food matched. A great place for a first date, small group of friends for dinner, a low key happy hour or casual drinks. You won't regret it. My congratulations to the chef and staff. When in Philly again I'm definitely going back.

The Culinary Adventures of Tom Coghlan, FB
So... Last week I was pondering Brunch... I wanted to try something new... Something different... Somewhere I have never been... A tough order to fill, but with some thought I managed  to come up with this...  Fond is on the corner of 11th and Tasker. The Chef-owners Lee Styer and Jessie Prawlucki, a husband-and-wife team have a wonderful story.  "Chefs Styer and Prawlucki met as students, at the Culinary Institute of America, in 2003. After honing their skills in a few different kitchens, they opened Fond in 2009, then married. Today, they live in South Philadelphia with their two young children. Chef Styer uses techniques he learned working with lauded chefs including Georges Perrier and Jean- Marie Lacroix to transform fresh, seasonal ingredients into a bold menu of globally-inspired dishes. Chef Prawlucki, who worked her way up to Pastry Chef at Le Bec-Fin, prepares desserts layered with flavor and texture, as well as freshly baked breads to complement her husband's dinner menus." They clearly share a passion for food that  can be tasted and felt... I found a single seat at the bar where I introduced myself to my server Shane. After previewing the cocktails I naturally ordered The St. Germain Spritz. Elderflower liqueur, sparkling wine, club soda, paying Homage to my friend Beth, who is a representative for St Germain.(See Quality Cocktail in the Valley). It was REFRESHING !!! I started with Escargot chartreuse, hazelnut, garlic, toast. The snails were served in a bowl of melted butter with garlic, chartreuse and crushed hazelnuts. A couple slices of toast that were fried in butter were provided to sop up the juices. They were perfect ! I then ordered The Mushroom Omelet, tallegio, maitake, truffle oil. If you like mushrooms, this is an omelet for you ! The flavors of the maitake mushrooms and the truffle oil dominated the omelet and were complimented well with the tallegio cheese. THIS OMELET EXUDED MUSHROOM FLAVOR !!! It was all beautifully presented on a plate with greens and fried potatoes and toast. A couple more coctails and I was happily on my way !  I REALLY enjoyed Fond, and I will be back for more... I am also interested in visiting their sister breakfast restaurant, The Dutch, at 4th and Tasker !     https://www.fondphilly.com/

I went there for a birthday dinner with my husband last night. Everything was on point. The restaurant is cozy, the staff were wonderful and the food was very tasty. They also make very good cocktails. I highly recommend this wonderful neighborhood spot.

We've been coming to Fond since 2013, but this was our first time back in a few years. It didn't disappoint. Chef Lee's cozy restaurant is perfect for intimate dinners. The cocktails are on point, portions are generous but not overwhelming, and the courses are delicious, fresh, flavorful honest cooking without unnecessary gimmicks. You can have a great meal at Fond and feel healthy doing it. 

Service is personal and responsive. Congrats to the team for continuing a winning recipe here consistently. In a saturated and competitive Philly restaurant scene, Fond deservedly stand out.

Mediocre at best. The desserts were delicious, but the dishes were just okay. The sauce that the fish is came in was a watered down tomato broth with little flavor, and the short rib came on a cucumber and tomato salad..which was just not that appealing nor filling. On the other hand the actual short rib itself was delish! 
I don't think I'd go here again when the options for food are limitless in the city!
Service, wine and atmosphere were all decent. Food was disappointing, especially given the price point.

We had a spectacular evening at Fond - the drinks, the food, and the staff were great! We are still trying to decide what our favorite dish was - the little gem lettuce salad, the pork pate, the short ribs, or the grilled bread.  We were too full for dessert, but the selections are reason enough to go back.

What a disappointment!  We have been going to this restaurant since its original location.  The menu on their own website is not even close to the menu they offer.  How can a restaurant of this caliber misrepresent themselves to this extreme.  Four entrees, two of them are chicken!  Really?  Do you not have any creativity or imagination?  You're kidding, right!  Paper menus, which I get,  given the circumstances.  However,  the ink must have been dry or running out because all the text is blurred.  One person hosting, serving etc. And, if she called me "darling" one more time, I was going to totally lose it, especially since she knew my name.
Poached branzino?!?! Are you kidding me!  What is this a geriatric center? The entire meal, with the exception of their signature dish, chicken liver mousse, was  a disaster! We expressed our dissatisfaction to our sever, she got annoyed and did management or the Chef come out to talk to us? NO!  
We have been supporting this restaurant way before COVID and during COVID!  This was it!  NEVER AGAIN! 

To make matters worse, I was taking my boyfriend out for dinner, to his favorite restaurant,  because he has been so good helping me with my recently broken wrist.  Really wanted this to be special!  It was the complete opposite!
  
Thanks for nothing!!

Had such a great experience at Fond, I cannot say enough good words about the staff and chef. They were extremely accomidating with our group (adding guests) and really gave us the BEST evening with friends after a long quarantine. They set are table up in the back "chefs table" which made for such a great atmosphere. The food was amazing and cannot wait to come back again with our group to try new menu items!

I went to Fond recently after they opened their outdoor dining. Great dining experience - we got the $50 prefixed menu. It's not the first time I went to Fond and the food and drink were great as always. So I felt compelled to write a review. 
There was no cocktail menu yet but I was able to order Aviation which is my fav there. We have not seen skate on the menu at any restaurants in a while so super excited about that. For appetizer we got chicken liver mousse, octopus, entree skate and soft shell crab. Both entrees was extremely good- reminds me of why I love the Philly food scene so much. Outdoor dining experience was overall good, social distancing was maintained well (6 ft apart from tables and person to person). It was quite sunny and hot out so that was the only downside. If there had been more shade it would've been perfect.

What a wonderful gourmet meal during this pandemic. We tried the shrimp, tuna tartare, skate and soft shell crab entrees and chocolate cake and tarte desserts. Everything was absolutely delicious, and the sauces weren't throw in the containers randomly like some places do.The packaging was also well thought out. We have dined here several times over the yrs so we went into this order knowing it would be good... it was great ! We paired the meal with a Sancerre and we were in heaven in our backyard Thanks!

Great dinner fixed price $50.00 a little on the high side  but a small restaurant has to make a profit. 
Soft shell crab outstanding.  The tuna app was amazing. Deserts were good not great.  The service was excellent

Recently, we ordered from Fond. Fond is located in South Philly, near Passyunk Ave and we were supposed to go for New Year's Eve two years ago. We ended up canceling last minute due to undesirable conditions but it's been on my Philly food bucket list for years. Fond is of the restaurants continuing services with delivery and curbside options. Not only are they offering plenty of sandwiches, soups, and prepared foods, but they also have a mini-market. This market contains household items like salt, flour, and eggs, but also includes necessities like toilet paper, wine, and beer.

We ordered a ton of items, enough for lunch and dinner, and even grabbed some beer. Although the beer was more than what we would typically pay for a 6-pack, we ended up getting a delicious blood orange IPA. We were given the Tommy Knocker Mountain Town Craft Beer, brewed in Colorado. Definitely the best blood orange IPA we ever had. It was lite on the hops and the orange just tasted like fresh juice. It was so nice to be able to order food, salt (since we ran out a few days ago), and beer - one-stop shop. I will always continue to support local restaurants. 
Corned Beef Sammy: The sandwich was served on marbled rye (the best!) and had a large serving of corned beef. It was topped with Thousand Island dressing, Swiss cheese, and sauerkraut. The meat was moist and pretty tasty. It wasn't the best corned beef sandwich we've had, but definitely tasty.

Bahn Mi: I've been craving a Bahn mi for weeks now and was so excited that it was on the menu. Although not traditional, it was served with chicken. The vegetables were pickled perfectly. I would have liked more pickled juice or heat (like extra jalapenos). The bread was so soft. I love when Bahn mis have soft bread; I think it kind of defeats the purpose of having succulent meat if the bread is so hard to chew through. Definitely hit my craving and I can't wait to recreate this.

Thai Chicken Curry: We recently had curry from a local Thai restaurant and I've been craving it ever since. The curry is part of their prepared foods and so glad we ordered this. It was a large portion that had plenty of veggies. I was surprised that it came with chopped potatoes. Is this normal? Can someone confirm this? The flavor was great with just the right amount of heat. We ended up making a side of rice and having it for dinner the following day. It kept great and highly recommend.

Italian Hoagie: We inhaled this for lunch the following day. The bread was super soft, just like the Bahn mi. The sandwich was full of meat - a mix of ham and salami. It was topped with provolone, lettuce, tomato, and onion. I would have liked it to have some oil and vinegar, but glad it didn't make the bread soggy for the following day.

I know this isn't typical of what they would normally serve but it was really tasty. The food traveled well and kept for leftovers. I would highly recommend ordering takeout from Fond Bistro. I can't wait to come back when things return to "normal".

RW Review: This is a cute romantic spot in south philly. Excellent assortment of cocktails, as well as a special rye one for RW. We opted for one of those and an aviation. We started with the beef rillettes, which came with a horseradish sauce and the a warm parsnip soup with little shrimp and parsnip chips in them. The whole bowl was served with just the fillers, and the broth was poured into it. 

Then, we got the coq au vin, which was cooked perfectly and the skate wing with Meyer lemon risotto. I was a little confused why there was edamame in it, but I like edamame so I wasn't about to ask questions. The servings were a good size. Sometimes I feel like I'm getting ripped off for restaurant week. 

For dessert, we got the mocha cake that had several yummy layers and this orange creme brûlée. The best part of dessert was the passion fruit cannoli on the creme brûlée. I could have eaten 12 of those. American food with French flair done quite well!

Went for dinner during restaurant week and it was not the same experience as a normal night.  They were very busy and the service was off from their usual standards.  We were waiting in the bar and the hostess told us they had our table but it was not great and if we would rather sit at the bar she would offer us a few additional dishes.  The dishes never materialized but we did get a comped glass if very nice wine.  As for the tables there are no bad ones so I think it was a bit of a hustle and frankly the bar does not have a sufficient overhang for comfortable dining. The food was good not great again not the usual standard.  If you go steer clear of restaurant week and sit at a table.  Even on an under performing night a 1000 times better than Hungry Pigeon

My sister took us here for the 7-course prix fixed menu tasting for Christmas and it was epicly delicious and a ton of fun!

First off, I gotta say their cocktails are off the chain. Some of the best I've had in the city. Especially their jalapeño tequila with passion fruit and something called Milk of Amnesia. 

The wait staff was very warm and friendly. And the food hit the spot. The chicken liver mouse? My favorite.  Fresh Scallop ceviche. Crispy pork belly. Pan seared Skate. Buttery bread and Escargot. Double cream Dutch Cheese and coal roasted bread. Dessert too? Check and check- both Cheesecake and ice cream.

There is something magical about ordering prix fixed little plates and everyone having the same plate. There's a sense of community and conversation around what's being eaten. No one feels like they're missing out or jealous of someone else's dish. There are strategic trades between people with different palettes. Oh how I've missed the prix fixed- and by the end, we were all full and bloated. 

My sister nailed the family Christmas gift this year. This place was great - would definitely come back!
Went for the 5 course tasting menu with the wine pairing and it was delicious! Service was excellent. I also love the interior atmosphere, very cozy for a date night.

Yum!!! It's taken me a while to get here but never -the -less, I'm glad I made it. The intimate space, the sweet bar while waiting for a table and the great service... all so good! The food? Delicious! I had the pork belly and the flavor, the texture, the egg, the broken rice...WOW! I'm still thinking about it the day after. Everyone at the table enjoyed their orders. The space is a bit small and the conversations whirling about can get a bit loud. But it's still sweet and the good service and food make up for that. We ordered a bottle of wine and enjoyed our night and our food. The desserts looked delicious but we had something unexpected come up and couldn't partake. Next time. This is a top notch space. If you haven't gone... you should go. I'll be back.

We came here for a birthday brunch on a Sunday morning. The food was very good; I may be judging harshly because of the price, and because I've heard such good things.

We were the only people in the restaurant when it opened at 10, and they sat us at a corner table in the back. There were something like 5 flies that were buzzing around the table during our entire meal that was sort of annoying us.. but that isn't really the restaurant's fault. I imagine it's hard to control that. But maybe they could have put us at a different table?

We ordered oysters to start which were FABULOUS but we had to ask for lemon and hot sauce. I had an iced green tea that was barely tea, it was basically ice water. And I got the mushroom omelet.. the mushrooms and cheese were absolutely phenomenal, but the omelet was overcooked.

It was definitely good! But not great.

This was my second time at Fond. My first time was in 2013. Six years later, this little restaurant still puts out excellent food. The paté du jour, duck paté, was awesome. So flavorful and hearty, it was accompanied with a sweetened mustard, green scallions, and grilled white pancake bread similar to the kind they would give you at a Chinese restaurant with your Peking duck. My salmon with lemon asparagus risotto was a heavenly dish. The thick slab of salmon was light and flaky, cooked just enough to preserve a medium rare like texture inside. The outer skin was a wonderful contrast of crispy to the tender, succulent inside. The risotto was a perfect complement. A fine French-style dish. If I could find a way to come and eat here by myself without looking like a crazy, single old bat, I would. I would come here quite often.

Sadly, my date this time didn't have the same hearty appetite as my date the first time. I got the feeling he wasn't very adventurous with his food as he ordered the "green circle" chicken, which was actually quite remarkable as far as chicken dishes go. The chicken was cooked perfectly. I will definitely be eyeing this place again as a dining destination now that one of my other favorite French restaurants has bumped up their prices to astronomical proportions.

Out of Towners Discover a Great Local's Place

Fond is a very, very good restaurant. The menu is good, the bar is good, the staff is good. We were a party of six on a Friday evening and they took great care of us. It's in south Philly and looks to anchor a small neighborhood retail area. The menu is small but the offerings were varied and in season. We got four small plates to share and separate entrees and we all agreed that there wasn't a weak link in the mix. All was perfectly cooked and plating was superb. Cocktails were creative and, though the wine list is small, what they had paired easily with menu items. Ambiance is warm and comfortable. If you're from out of town and want to find a place the locals treasure, you won't do better than Fond.

We came here for dessert after eating at another restaurant on Passyunk and this was great. The chocolate ice cream and blueberry lemon tart were both delicious. Service was excellent. Would come here again for dinner. Vibe was cozy and romantic.

Service was excellent. It appeared that most of the customers were regulars because the wait staff seemed to know many of them personally. Loved the chicken liver moose and seared foie gras. The complimentary olive bread was delicious. The only disappointing part of our meal was the pork belly dish; the crispy skin was burnt so a lot of it was bitter.

Had a reservation for two on a beautiful Saturday evening--my date rudely bailed, which was completely fine because more food for me!! I had the 7-course tasting which was nothing short of incredible (highlights: chicken liver mousse, put it on everything; and escargot, but the star is that rich, buttery brioche). Also had the wine pairing which was wasted on me being so full, having cleaned off every plate. Staff was delightful and attentive, turning what would've been a relatively boring evening into a memorable dining experience in Philly. Amazing value for delicious food, will be back for this one!

I wish I can put separate review for food and service, so just had to average it. Chef and food -GREAT!. Service - went down the hill, since my last time in Fond. Had scallops and pork belly - reasonably sized portions, sauce - just enough, well complimenting. Sorbet - made on premises, distinct flavors and very refreshing, chocolate mousse - great presentation!!! Really liked mix of flavors / textures. Server ... thought present, but not really helpful (just covered sauce stain on a table with the  new plate, w/o bothering to wipe it out..). Table was wobbling and thought server saw our effort to fix it , made no attempts to help. Front door was stuck, and it does not makes good first impression when you have to muscle your way in... Would it be a hard fix? But let me finish with - Food was Great!

business.name: SweetArt
business.categories: Vegan, Arts & Entertainment, Shopping, Restaurants, Vegetarian, Art Galleries, Food, Cafes, Bakeries, Desserts

reviews.text:
Always friendly at this establishment.
The food is good and the baked goods are great. My favorite go-to's are the Mac'n cheeze, the fauxstess cupcake, and Big Momma cinnamon Rolls are phenomenal !

I learned about this place from the Food Network! What a gem! I love that all the options are vegan - after you're done eating you'll feel full but also not gross. The audre lorde and zora neal hurston sandwiches were bomb! It was crispy, spicy, and so flavorful. The vegan bun was also so tasty and light. I can't wait to try more of their dishes and desserts.

I'm vegan, and I'm also gluten-free. So what I'm about to say might disappoint many of you, SweetArt is definitely not the most gf place. But, it's also my "I want to hurt on the inside because the spicy chicken sandwich is so worth it." Gluten is life, even when it hurts. The spicy chicken is way too good, like WAY too good. And as a celiac, I will do it again. And again. And again.

After 7 years and approaching 100 check-ins, it is WAY past time for an update of SweetArt.  Over the years, this "small yet mighty" (as the owner oft describes it) establishment has continuously pushed itself and raised the bar that they've set for themselves.  Literally no one in the STL is doing what they are doing, and they are the best at what they do, even during a pandemic.  Especially during a pandemic. 

You still get fresh and homemade burger patties and chik'n sandwiches, made in so many ways with an array of different topping options from the Lorde to the buffalo (that buffalo sauce is fawesome!). They've added some delicious french fries to the mix. The kale salad and that dressing (THAT DRESSING!!!) is the only salad I crave.  They even sell whole bottles of certain dressings and sauces. Totally worth it! 

There are weekly specials, all guaranteed to be amazing. I'm currently not on social media but I created a dummy page just so I can personally stalk their ig to see what deliciousness she's gonna taunt us with.  (She def still knows it's me. lol!) Like when that undisputed, heavy weight champion of the potato salad game (aka the Creole Potato Salad) will make an appearance.   Or to see what the new cupcake flavors of the month will be. I remember years ago when I disliked their vanilla cake. Well chileeeeee, she has flipped that recipe and it's now one of the best vanilla cakes/cupcakes on God's green earth. Blessed be!!

And the BEST part??  SweetArt is now ALL VEGAN by default!!!! Like everything!! Vegan biscuits, all the cupcakes and pies.  I'd walk barefoot through hot lava for some of their lemon cream pie.  There are lots of gluten-free items too (food items and desserts)! Now you can even buy some of her cake mixes online and bake your own sweets at home.

The owner has her sights set high (as she should!), so I don't know how long we'll have the pleasure of her highly favored touch. So I suggest ye hesitate not, and mosey on down with haste to 39th for some of the best food to feed your soul.
Honestly my favorite restaurant in St. Louis. I religiously order the Audre Lorde Chicken Challenge sandwich and hostess cupcake

The quality of food here is unmatched.  I don't know how they do it.  Their cinnamon buns are a must, their cauliflower bites are the best I've ever had, and their faux chicken sandwiches are absolutely dreamy. SweetArt is amazing.   I don't know what else to say.

We stopped here for brunch on a Friday, ordered curb side pick up (lunch was supposed to start at 11), we placed our order at like 10:20 and our order was ready at 10:58. We ordered the buffalo caulfilower, mackin cheese, sweet burger, and audre lorde's chikn. 

The sweet burger was sooo good, I'm pregnant so I'm wary of anything super spicy or sweet but the flavoring of this burger was perfect. The patty was so good, I loved the sauce and the bun, all of it was perfect. The tomato was perfectly juicy too. I ate some of my husband's cauliflower bites and they were so good too (I'm weird and like them plain so with sauce they're probably even better). My husband loved his chickn sandwich and the mackin cheese was highly reviewed by him. All in all, the food was delivered quickly and deliciously, hiiighly recommend

Zora neale hurston's spicy chicken sandwich and french fries for the win!!!  You must try.  Great crispy texture and tasty buffalo sauce. The french fries were warm and crispy seasoned with salt and pepper.

My husband and father in law ordered the sweet burger but they both did not like it. My husband tried my spicey chicken sandwich and was amazed. I would be safe to say any of the crispy chicken sandwiches would be good. 
The 3 of us did not like the mackin cheese.

Great desserts. We had the oatmeal-raisin walnut cookie and "fauxstess" cupcake.

I will come back and also recommend the Zora neale hurston's spicy chicken sandwich and french fries.  I don't know if I would need to try any other sandwich, it was that good!

*as of Nov 2021, it is still curbside pickup, you must order online.  No customers allowed inside. Friendly and fast service.

Le me say that I've been doing business with SweetArt since it was just a bakery back in 2008 when they first opened. The fauxstess cupcake is amazing and always moist, as is the strawberry/raspberry lemonade cupcake. Since then they've grown, and let me just say that I haven't had mac n cheese since my dairy allergy diagnosis in 2014, but once I learned about and then tasted their vegan mac n cheeze, it was game over! I vouche for the cupcakes, the chocolate chip cookies, BIG MOMMAS cinnamon roll, the Buffalo cauliflower, and the infamous Mac and cheeze! 
To top it all off, the staff there are very professional and personable!

I saw this restaurant featured on a food show so I was determined to try it.  My family and I were in town visiting my sister so we all piled in the car and headed over.  We placed an online order and decided to walk around to the neighboring shops while we waited.  

I'm the only person that's actually plant based but everyone took my word that this place was the real deal.  I ordered the zora neale hurston's spicy "chicken" sandwich with fries, cauliflower bites, a brownie, a cookie, and my family ordered the burgers, and the other "chicken" sandwiches. 

We rushed back to the hotel to eat and BAAAAAYYBEEEE!  What kind of sorcery was that?! That zora neale hurston's spicy chicken sandwich!l was pure perfection! The texture was perfect and it packed a little heat, the soft bread hugged that " chicken" just right without falling apart from the juiciness.  I took my time with that sandwich because I didn't want it to end.  I promise you the whole room was silent as we enjoyed our meals. 

The pastries were amazing also...SweetArt you really out did yourselves with all of that deliciousness! 

My family enjoyed their meals just as much as I did.  My sister is a first year medical student at WashU  and she will be a regular.  I'm so jealous.  Lol!  

Just know you have a fan in the Carolinas and when I return I will definitely be back!

I heard about this place from a Netflix show & I told myself that the next time I'm in town I was going to try this place out being that I live 4.5 hrs away, perfect day trip for me so today was the day & the Food did NOT disappoint it was soooo good, I had the spicy "chicken" sandwich & fries. You have to order online & they bring it out to you (curbside service) which I appreciated. If you're an Avid vegan then you've probably already had it, but for everyone else TRY IT!!

I saw this restaurant on the Netflix Show "Fresh Fried & Crispy" and was excited to try it out during my next visit to Saint Louis. However it is with much disappointment that I say neither items I ordered had flavor. The chicken sandwich actually gave me an upset stomach. I had to stop eating it bc I felt the bubble guts coming on. Not only did it lack flavor but all I could taste was the Buffalo sauce, which was to heavy on the sandwich and made the bread soggy. The cauliflower batter tasted like the batter that is used for fried shrimp. The only thing I like was the dipping sauce which was the honey mustard sauce. I ordered a brownie and I will say it was delicious. I think the owner should stick to desserts bc that seems to be her specialty.

OH. MY! ‍

Okay okay. Yes I saw "Fresh, Fried, and Crispy" about a year ago and that is what led me here. I eat a more vegetarian diet but when I saw this vegan sensation on Netflix I knew I HAD to try when the opportunity presented itself. 

It's currently October 2021 and they are still doing curbside pick up. You have to wait for their menu to go live for the day you are wanting to order. I basically ordered everything that was available on the menu for my family and I to try. 

The spicy vegan chicken sandwich is the one I was waiting for and it was anything and everything I ever expected. The texture was perfect and the flavor was amazing. The original chicken sandwich was just as delicious (especially for the ppl that can't so spicy). 

I also ordered the vegan mac and cheese - we were not crazy about the flavor. I think it was a little too much turmeric. We tried the kale salad and it was good but nothing that special. 

Desserts were amazing and delicious. Loved the chocolate chip cookie. It was crispy on the edges and was sweet and salty. 

We also tried the kombucha (delicious and refreshing). I got a couple vanilla lattes with oat milk and they were great too. 

All and all - let's me honest. I came here to try some serious vegan chicken and I would come back over and over again. There sides may not be as exciting but the chicken sandwiches are so good it still gets a solid 5 stars in my book forever. 

This is a solid find that runs their buisness with heart and passion and that shows with the friendly service. Thank you Sweet Art - much respect!

We stopped by going through town to get the vegan chicken sandwiches. They were without a doubt amazing!!! We also tried the burger and that was great! However, the other items we tried (Mac n cheese, kale salad, and latte) were just ok. The vegan desserts were spot on though!

A friend mentioned this restaurant to me and how good m the cinnamon rolls and mac and cheese are and that they're a must try.  I was walking my dog and realized it was only a few blocks from my place, which I love. I didn't get to try the cinnamon rolls or mac just yet, but the vegan brownie and sweet potato cupcake was so delicious. I can't wait to go back to try the mac & cheese and cinnamon well maybe not together but definitely will still get both haha. The staff is so delightful and I can't wait to be able to dine in there.

Checked out SweetArt after seeing them featured on Netflix. I ordered the "best vegan burger" and my husband, who is non vegan, ordered the "crispy Buffalo 'chicken' sandwich." His sandwich was delish! My only regret, not trying some of their cupcakes while I had the chance!

We saw this place on a netflix show, and since we are trying to eat leas meat, we decided to try it aince we were in the area.  It was really good vegan food.  We had a chikn sandwich and cauliflower bites.  Buth were good.  Bites would have been better with sauce (wasn't in the bag), but they were good nonetheless.  We will definitely be back when we come to the St. Louis area.

Ordered online. Food was ready as promised. Fauxstess cupcake was delectable. Cauliflower bites were a great alternative to chicken wings. Excellent with their bbq sauce. I also ordered the l+m kale. My only complaint was that there was no description on the menu. I was hoping it was warm kale, but it was not. Overall, pleased with my experience. Will be bsck

Such an amazing joint. Absolutely love stopping here for breakfast, and lunch. Everything on their menu is FILLED with flavor and super delicious!

I absolutely love that everything is vegan which makes it accessible for people will all dietary needs. Since the food is vegan you aren't left feeling bloated or sick! Every time I finish a meal from here I am left feeling satisfied and full :), and can't wait till the next time I can stop by. 

Sweet Art Tip: If you're looking for a really good sandwich with some spice. The Buffalo sandwich is bomb!! Also their Mac n cheese is bomb.com

In a non pandemic world, this place gets 5 stars. The food is wonderful even if you're not vegetarian or vegan. However, they are docked a star because a year into Covid measures, it's still an exercise in patience in getting your food.

I first ran across this place years ago when a group of restaurants did a cupcake crawl. I think this was right around when Hostess had shut down operations (temporarily, though no one knew it at the time), so one of the first things I tried from here was the Fauxstess cupcake (much better than the original). Eventually, I tried their burger. This was long before impossible burgers were even remotely trendy, and I was amazed by how great they were.

I've since ordered a variety of items from there, including a cake (which was amazing), and though everything is delicious, I keep going back to the Maine Event cookie and make it funky burger. In my mind, those are the stars of the menu. If you can't make a decision, get those.

When Covid restrictions hit, SweetArt closed for quite awhile until they came up with their curbside option. Order online and then you park nearby with your blinkers on. I tried this several times in the first few months of the option, and it wasn't uncommon for me to not get a text at all or to be waiting an hour after my pickup time to get a text. Eventually, I just started going here less and less, as the wait times were too unpredictable.

One caveat to that, I did go once during the week, and the wait times were similar to other restaurants, but a year into a Covid restrictions, it was 30 minutes after the Square estimate before my food was ready on a Saturday. The food was great and the staff apologetic, but keep a lot of buffer time if you plan to order food on a Saturday. It is so good that it is just about worth it, but I look forward to them being able to open their shop so that a quick stop becomes possible again.

I was looking forward to eating at Sweet Art. Well, when I got there I was confused by the ordering process. A worker came out and stated that food has to be ordered online. I placed my order at 12:42 p.m. My food was brought out at 1:54 p.m. I must say that the chicken sandwich was tasty, but hardly worth the wait. I am not vegan and would have been just as satisfied with a sandwich from Popeye's at a fraction of the cost. The fried cauliflower was also tasty. The customer service was the worst!!! None of the workers took the time to speak with me about the menu selections. I had plenty of questions by it being my first visit and not being vegan. In the meantime, my niece fell to the concrete when she sat in an unsecured chair. None of the employees showed concern or empathy. One came out to ask if she was ok with a smirk on his face. My niece hit her elbows on the concrete as she tried to break the fall. A little more concern on behalf of the employees would have been appreciated. I will not waste my gas or money to patronize a place with such horrible customer service....no matter how tasty the food is. Slow down, show concern, and be gracious to people that are trying to patronize your business. Thank you.

Ny husband called to inquire about one the burgers and Max, the manager, said to go ahead and place our order because they have a lot of orders.  It was also a hour before closing. He tried to place with her over the ohone and she said go to the site. We live 45 minutes away. As we were walking out the door, we received an email that our order was cancelled.  Then, I received a voicemail that our food was being cancelled because they were at their capacity for today. I called and talked to Max and I told her that my husband just talked to her and she didn't tell him they were at capacity. She stated she could ask the kitchen if they would make it and they said they didn't have enough food. What! You are only open a few days a week. This was very unprofessional.  Max should have told my husband they were stopping for today. My husband is vegan and I'm not but I like some vegan items. As a black business owner myself, I try to support other black owed businesses. I understand  things happen but they need to do better with their communication!!!

We got the southwest burger and the chikn challenge sandwich and they were both great. My partner is not a vegan and said it was better than an actual chicken sandwich! We will be back and have already recommended to friends.

I appreciate that SweetArt is honoring the fact that we are still amid a global pandemic and are therefore offering curbside only. When we pulled up, a lovely staff member was outside to greet us and help us efficiently navigate the curbside pickup situation. Honestly, seeing SweetArt on Fresh, Fried, and Crispy was one of the main reasons we visited STL in the first place and I'm SO SO happy we did! It was well worth the almost 4 hours drive and we are already planning our next visit! From the art to the food, it was a great experience and this is all from the outside waiting in the car. 

The Zora Neale Hurston's spicy chicken sandwich, the cauliflower bites and the sauce that came with them were my favorite things we tried, but I can't imagine that you can go wrong with anything on the menu.

My husband ordered some small cakes for my birthday  and additional pastries several days prior to pickup. He even prepaid for them. When he went to pick them up they did not have the additional pastries. They had sold them. They said they would refund him his money BUT THEY NEVER REFUNDED HIS MONEY. He also had waited forever in the heat for his order. He arrived when they said order would be ready and then he ended up waiting at least 20 minutes to get the order and it wasn't the full order. 

I had previously bought similar sampler cakes for his birthday and the ones for my birthday were much smaller. 

Overall I am very disappointed in Sweet Art. I really wanted to support small and local but their service overall disappointed me.

business.name: Graze Nashville
business.categories: Restaurants, Nightlife, Vegetarian, Vegan, Bars, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Food, American (New), Cocktail Bars, Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

reviews.text: Best veggie burrito I've ever had. The veggies were super good and the burrito was perfectly cooked. Whatever sauce they use in the burritos are heavenly! The drive is short and the wait is never long!
I am not a big fan of vegan food but this one in east Nashville is really great. Its flavor and size never fail to satisfy your appetite. Casual and laid back.

Graze always knocks it out of the park. There isn't a thing on their menu I would hesitate to recommend. Particularly I love their burritos and their cashew mac and cheese. (Have them put chorizo on top, too. Yummmmmm.) 

I've gotten them for take-out and pre covid had dined in here quite a bit. They do vegan food in such a way that you wonder why anyone eats meat at all when you can cook entirely plant based and have it turn out so delicious. 

If you aren't vegan or vegetarian, I'd say do yourself a favor give this place a try. 

Brunch there is fantastic.

Cupcakes are a must.
Had Graze yesterday for lunch. Absolutely delicious! This review doesn't need to be long lol. Plain and simple food is great!  Nachos are amazing! Brussels sprouts as well!

Thoroughly enjoyed my meal! I'm a wanna be vegan and was excited to try some new vegan food. The loaded potato's and brunch tostadas did not disappoint! Lots of flavor and very filling. I'll definitely be dining with you all again.
Great vegan options and healthy food for the entire family! They reopen the dinning in and I couldn't be happier, since unfortunately they are not longer on Uber eats
Excellent atmosphere. The food is unbelievably good! This restaurant may have to scale for larger customer base very soon due to its unmatched food options and taste.
Loved the fact that eating healthy also meant eating delicious food.  Loved the atmosphere and the staff!!

Yummy vegan food in Nashville! We ordered the bay cakes which were a little too crumbly and soft with a crispy exterior - they could have been seasoned a tad more but the sauces that came with it more than made up for it!
We also got the Hot Tempeh Sandwich which was super creamy and absolutely yummy and got the Soup of the Day which probably was our favorite item!
We ended with a GF Chai Cake which was full of fall flavors - a little chewy and gummy but delish nonetheless!
Food was great and filling and fresh! We ordered a couple of things but couldn't finish one meal.  Biscuits are homemade and very good!

I recently visited Nashville with my friend who is vegetarian. We looked for veg-friendly restaurants in the area and found Graze, and decided to give it a try. Even though I am a meat-eater, I'm always down to try meat alternatives because they usually end up being better than the real thing. I ordered the hot tempeh sandwich, and let me tell you... THE BEST sandwich I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. Texturally, could not tell the difference between the tempeh to chicken. It was the perfect balance of fresh flavors, while still curing my hangover. I think about that sandwich every day of my life since that moment, and I would make the 5 hour drive from Ohio just to have one again.

This little place is to die for!!! I love everything about this restaurant. I was really happy that I was able to eat here on my last night in Nashville. The food and drinks are amazing. Overall, my favorite was the sundae. The vanilla ice cream is the best ice cream I have ever tasted. I was told it's coconut base and made locally. Wow! Love it! If I go back to Nashville i will definitely come back to this restaurant. The service was amazing too. Congrats for such an amazing spot!!

In East Nashville in a trendy, fun area. Chill vibe in the restaurant, staff was friendly and very helpful. I had a lot of questions. I tried the Roasted Vegetable burrito today and it was to die for. Took home an oatmeal creme pie with me to eat later, but did have a nibble on the way home. Very tasty. Also, very much enjoyed their cashew cheese on broccoli as well as the cranberry quinoa salad. Definitely will go back and try other menu items. Can't wait to go back for brunch especially.

Craving satisfied yet again!!!! I've been to Graze a total of two time now and everything I order is always SOOOO GOOD! John our server was AMAZING! He recommended my side dish of the Broccoli and Cheese and I have to say it was FANTASTIC!! I also had the Hot Tempeh Wrap and it was INCREDIBLE not to mention we also tried the Black Magic cocktail (double of course) which was to "die for".
So delicious! Everything is completely vegan and oh so tasty! My friend and I had the burrito and the breakfast tostadas and they were to die for. Super light and delicious.

Everything I had from here was absolutely delicious! I love when vegan food has amazing flavor. It was so satisfying and satiating! I took half of my dinner home with me for later! Thank you for having different options and making tasty food that's healthy for the body! Can't wait to stop every time I am in Nashville!!

Cute place, really good food! It's pretty small inside, but the food is great and it comes out pretty fast. I am not vegan but I enjoy vegan food every once in a while. When I went, I ordered a salad and it was delicious! This place has very reasonable prices and I was happy with what I ordered. The staff was friendly and very attentive. I'll definitely be back!
Such delicious food and a great staff. I'm not even vegan and I enjoy everything on this menu.

YUM!!! I'm always skeptical to try tofu but this was exceptional. I'm also a slut for bacon so please TRY IT. It's thick cut but not too floppy, taste right on. Customer service was excellent and the restaurant was dead so I got to pick anywhere for sit!

Graze is absolutely delicious! And this is coming from a guy who literally loves the taste of meat and is by no means in any way, shape, or form a vegan. They also have really great kombucha beer (don't knock it till ya try it!)

This place was the bomb! I have really enjoyed the Nashville vegan scene but this place takes the prize for dinner! The ambiance, music, and lighting was fabulous and we had a wonderful server. So many options of amazing food, we ended up going with the bbq quesadilla and the supreme nachos - both of which our server recommended and they not disappoint. Their chorizo/meat substitute(and I think "cheese") is locally sourced. Fabulous vibes, fabulous food, fabulous service, 10/10 for this place! 

Also fun fact - Guy Fieri checked this place out just last month!

I randomly ended up picking this restaurant. I'm visiting from out of town and really just wanted something fresh. I had the Supreme Nachos and they were so very good! Wait staff is friendly, attentive, and laid back. It was great to go in there alone and sit at the bar. Clean kitchen, tasty food, welcoming environment, and great staff. I recommend checking this place out whether you are vegan or not.

Heaven is a place on earth. My God. This food is beyond amazing. We are not natives of Nashville, but every time we're in Nashville this is our go to for amazing vegan food!! 

The customer service could be polished- every time we've gone the service is just ok.. but they seem to perk up when they see our tip. I'm not sure if customers are under tipping, but please don't make assumptions when a group of black girls want to order everything on the menu! We tipped 25% last time and the waitress seemed shocked. But we understand the service industry so we keep coming back for the amazing food!
Was very impressed. The food was very good. Lovely atmosphere and the staff was exceptional. Would certainly recommend this place.

So delicious! Everything we had was amazing! Especially the citrus caesar salad and the oven fries! The only thing I would change... I'd come at a less busy time than a Friday night and make sure to get a table instead of sitting at the bar!

business.name: Oak and Ola
business.categories: Nightlife, Modern European, Cocktail Bars, Bars, Restaurants, American (New)

reviews.text:
My friends and I made a reservation for Oak and Ola on a Saturday night. I've been to Armature Works a million times but somehow have never made it in here so it's been on my list for a minute. The ambiance is super sultry and vibey. We got a table that had some couch seating which was cute. 

The drinks were great! We got a round of espresso martinis and they were really well balanced and not overly sweet, just how I like them. The Josephina I believe it's called is their drink similar to a spicy margarita and it was divine! My favorite drink I had. 

We all got starter dishes for the most part because we were going out and didn't want to be too full so we decided to share a few things. We had to try the octopus because the waiter claimed it was the best in tampa! It was quite delicious! The chorizo underneath was surprisingly flavorful and desired considering I'm not huge on chorizo. The octopus was cooked just right and not overly chewy. We also ordered the cauliflower side dish which was honestly amazing. The flavor and the breadcrumbs- wow. The Mezze starter was interesting. It came with three different dips all kind of squished together. The eggplant one had good flavor and the the raisin salad was fresh. The white dip kind of tasted just like sour cream. Not sure if I'd order again but wasn't bad.
