I'd love to come back and try some entrees and desserts! Our waiter was super friendly and attentive as well. Overall good experience!

I stopped into Oak and Ola on 12/19 at 1:25pm for lunch. I had driven down to Tampa from Wesley Chapel to start my New Years holiday weekend. I was greeted with and empty hostess station. An employee soon came over, she seemed upset and undone. She was sweaty and unfriendly. "We won't seat you without a reservation, we are understaffed and you'll have to wait!" My fiancé looked taken aback but she asked the wait and the woman replied angrily "15-20 min". I was annoyed by the hostess' attitude and I said "I could probably just make one online now" I wanted to try out the restaurant and had drove 30 min to be there so I did just that. I made a reservation at 1:28pm for 1:30pm same day. Surprise, the hostess had left her station again and I waited for her to return and told her I had a reservation for 1:30pm and she lost it. She said, "Yeah, I see that. That was brilliant!! Just sooo smart!" She was obviously being sarcastic, condescending and rude so I asked her name. STEPHANIE was the obnoxious woman's name. Luckily at that point one of the founders of the restaurant came over and apologized for her. He understood the hectic day and the employees calling out was not the customer's problem and immediately showed my fiancé and I to our table. Our waiters were awesome and happy to serve us. The food was awesome and the drinks were even better. We ate, drank, had great conversation, tipped 25% and left. Had it not been for Stephanie this would have been a five star review. She has no business in hospitality.

Where to begin?! Food was SO good. However service from our waiter, Justin, was perfection. And let me tell you...I counted 8 additional staff that visited our table. Wow. We were never overlooked, and greeted professionally by all. Hats off to management! Perfect location, nice decor, ambiance, noise level...
Notable dishes were the Onglet hanger steak, the octopus, the white veal bolognese and the carrot starter. Cocktails were delicious, too!

We order the special tequila drink off the menu it was amazing. For starters the Brussel sprouts, netballs, and octopus all were very good. We thought about ordering a large dish but it's good we did not in advance as we were full from what we ordered. Our waiter I forget his name but a mustache and beard with glass and blond hair he was excellent.

Great food and ambiance!! 
We arrived earlier and they had no tables available so we sat at the bar. That was the best decision. Our server, Alex was great and made excellent recommendations. We had the Spinach Bianca pizza, the meatballs and the charred/wilted Brussel Sprouts. Everything was delicious. The hanger steak next to us looked delicious as well but we were too full by then :D 
Highly recommended!

Great service but wine is very over priced.. ordered a bottle thinking it was around $30, nope was $100! Apparently a $20 bottle at the liquor store equals 100 at a restaurant.. ridiculous if you ask me. $25 a glass for Louis martini! I know it's always more expensive at restaurants but $100 is way too much for what it was so double check the wine list!

Great restaurant with such a cute ambiance.  Called for a last minute reservation and they were able to squeeze us in.  
They offer indoor and outdoor seating.  We sat outside.  If there is a wait, there's plenty of places around to grab a cocktail while you wait.  

For starters we ordered the Albondigas -fire roasted Spanish meatballs, Pommes Frites, and the wilted Brussel sprouts.  All the appetizers were just okay. 
The meatballs had an interesting texture.  I should have know the brussel sprouts would be soft by the "wilted" description but I hoped they would be crispier.  Fries were good with a nice aioli.  I wouldn't get the meatballs or sprouts again though.  The charcuterie and mezze sounded delicious and would like to try those next time. 

All of the mains were amazing.  For the mains we got the Spanish fire roasted octopus, which was so tasty and the Octopus was cooked perfectly.  The chorizo and white beans were a nice touch.  Would highly recommend this.  
We also go the Onglet - 8oz hanger steak and the NY strip.  Meat was cooked perfectly, sides were delicious. The NY is juicy and a large plate.  Can serve 1-2. 
Service was wonderful and we got the bottle of MacRostie - a Pinot noir which was smooth and nice. 

Great for date night or large groups.  Cute bar seating as well.

Definitely worth the trip over the bridge to Tampa. We had such a great expierence.

We decided to leave St. Pete and head to Iak and Ola to celebrate my friends birthday. 
We were seated at low table with a couch and chairs which was perfect.

Sal our server was perfect! Provided suggestions of drinks and food when people in our party needed help deciding. He was friendly and great to chat with.  He did an amazing job taking care of our group.

The drinks are really creative with fun and interesting ingredients.  We had a variety of drink from gin to bourbon to wine and champagne. Everyone enjoyed their cocktails and there was a great selection of wine and bubbles. I had a delicious Oregon pinot noir and the buddles I ordered, is a new favorite .

You have an option to order plates to share or an entree .We ended up getting the plates to share. We started off with a cheese board, a meat board, the mezze , and the panko encrusted artichokes . The boards were good but I've had better ones,  these were average . The mezze had roasted eggplant,  with goat cheese , a carrots raised salad and lavash. I'm not an eggplant fan but everything on that dish was delicious, it was a great combo. The artichoke was good  but there were a few tough parts of the artichoke. After some conversation and some wine, we decided to order a few more items, the cauliflower gratinee, Spanish meatballs, pomme frites, roasted octopus and the crab and beet salad. 
The cauliflower was delicious,  it was topped with bread crumbs and roasted. I'm not sure what else was on it but it was cooked perfectly. The Spanish meatball were tender and were served in a romesco sauce , this dish might have been my favorite . Soooo good. I don' t eat seafood so I can only tell you how the rest of the party felt about the dishes with seafood. Everyone raved about the octopus except for one friend who felt it tasted like fish. ‍

Everything was so good, the service, the setting, decor and the food, everything..This is one place you should definitely go to if you haven't been here yet. Love it!

This was the best service that we had during our week in Tampa. Charles is a fantastic asset to Oak & Ola. He was very knowledgeable about all of the menu items and was very easy to talk to. We enjoyed recommendations from him including the blue crab & beet salad. The gulf fish amandine and the white veal bolognese were both so flavorful! We enjoyed some great bourbons and wine, as well. Ambiance was very romantic. I would highly recommend Oak & Ola, especially for date night. Thanks so much to Charles!
Crappy service, crappy food, disappointing in so many ways not going to waste my fingers on this. Just don't come here

I came here for dinner awhile back pre-Covid and remember loving everything we tried. So, my fiancé and I decided to walk to Armature and grab brunch here on Sunday and try out the lunch/brunch menu. We were not blown away. The prices are expensive for what you get and the food itself is just okay. Best thing by far was the pizza! Service was awesome. I'll be coming back for dinners only from now on.
Appetizers were good, but the entrees were salty. We had the worst service.  The server kept forgetting our orders and had to return multiple times to ask what we ordered.

The food was really good,  pork chop, flounder almandine. Beet salad and artichoke salad and a bottle of pinot... all great!  What really made the meal outstanding was the service provided by Clayton! Thank you Clayton!

Cool atmosphere and phenomenal food and drinks! We got the meatball and pomme frites appetizers and they were delicious! For our meals we opted for the fish options and again, the food surpassed our expectations. Had a really great time here - highly recommend!!

Wonderful restaurant by Tampa's waterworks. By the same owners of OLIVIA and On Swann, oak and ola is up to par with the other restaurants in their portfolio. Has a great ambiance and many tables, which also included a few outside and a bar area. Great place to come with a group or for a date. 

Food was amazing- for appetizer, highly recommend the grilled octopus which had chorizo in it, and the beet crab salad which won the James Beard award. Entrees we're great, the NY Strip was large enough to be shared. The veal took us a bit by surprise as we didn't know it would come as a pasta dish vs. a veal cut, but nonetheless was still tasty. Cocktails were phenomenal as was the dessert.

Visited just after opening and sat at the bar. Received our drinks in a timely manner however did not have the opportunity to order food because we waited for a half hour for someone to acknowledge us. Only after we decided we weren't getting served and presented our card did one of the four bartenders working say anything. I haven't had to leave a restaurant before and won't be back.

Oak and Ola is superb!  The service was outstanding and the food was simply delicious! We arrived early enough to be seated outside, but the restaurant literally brought the outside in with an open air configuration - making it very comfortable for dining during the pandemic. 

We had both fish provisions - red snapper and salmon.  The portion sizes were perfect and both dishes were heavenly! 

I would definitely recommend Oak and Ola and can't wait to return!

Came here for the second time last night.  I was happy the first time, I was happy again last night.  Had a few friends with me from LA and we had a great dinner.  The service and vibe are amazing.  Server was knowledgeable, friendly and quick.

We all shared many different things to get to taste it all.  Heres my food review:

Octopus - Amazing and very well cooked.  Medium sized portion

Endive Salad - Delicious, but a small salad, not entree size at all

Sausage Dish - Was recommended by waiter.  I wasn't a huge fan, but sausages aren't my #1, good sized portion.

Brussel Sprouts - These were good.  Not your typical deep fried and crispy sprouts, but were still tasty. 

Artichoke Hearts - Small but absolutely delish.

Blue Crab & Beet Salad - Was okay, not my fave.  But if you love crab...


Will definitely be back.
I couldn't wait to eat here again. The atmosphere, food and service are impeccable. Hands down my favorite place in TAMPA!

Delicious food, good alcohol selection, but don't expect the entree to fill you up. For the price of the entrees I expected a bigger dish or a side with the entree. Be prepared to spend money if you come hungry. You will need an appetizer.

After a super dramatic performance by the host team tonight I was unable to be seated in an empty restaurant after having called several times beforehand to no answer, and then being ignored at the host stand for over 25 mins. See ya! Go to Rocca across the street.

Amazing. The best fish I have ever had in my life, hands down: yellow snapper amandine. The almonds & butter make it caramelized on top, giving it a delicious crunch that fish never has. Just perfection! The green beans it was served with were fabulous as well, really fresh.  We had a few appetizers, I'd recommend the cauliflower, they season it really well and it's cooked just right. 

We had a gluten-free member with us and they were very accommodating and provided a celiac-friendly meal. Clayton, our server, was the most polite and thorough waiter I've ever had, too! He kept running back to the kitchen to ask how they made everything so good :-D Plus the other waiter moved over a heater for us to stay warm outside after sunset. It was a lovely evening made so much better by our visit to Oak and Ola!

One word - Fabulous!
Great vibe, service is superb.
The food, man the food absolutely delicious.

Probably one of the best meals I've had in weeks. A friend who was in New York also stated - hands down better then anything he had in NYC all week.

He had the pork chop which was juicy with load of complex flavors. Surprised it wasn't dry considering how thick it was. The blue crab & beet salad was grub.

The charcuterie board was amazing, especially the spicy sausage. 

I had the pan seared yellowtail snapper which was amazing! If I wasn't so full I'd have ordered another serving. It was that good.

I have been wanting to visit Oak and Ola for quite some time now. Let me tell you it did not disappoint! We were a party of 4 heading in for a celebratory birthday lunch and were able to get outdoor seating right away. The waiter was knowledgeable of the items on the menu and went the extra mile to check with the kitchen on some items to get a gluten content clarification for one of the people in our party with a gluten allergy. We began with a round of cocktails and they were all super delicious. I had the Herbed Fresh and it was crisp and refreshing. For an appetizer I decided on the French onion soup. It was very tasty as well and I enjoyed the bite from the sour dough breadcrumbs. For my entree I had the pecan chicken salad which was served on a large bed of greens with a virus vinaigrette dressing it was both delicious and light and a generous portion. The rest of our party also enjoyed their entrees. I must note I had a bite of the fire roasted octopus and it was perfectly cooked. Can't wait to come back soon!

Love this place, been here many times. It gets busy and reservations are highly recommended, especially Fri/Sat nights.  Great location in Armature Works by Tampa Riverwalk, plenty of nearby parking.  Food is a bit more European style, lots of variety with both larger entree options and also some tapas-style / smaller plate items.  Food has always been great.  A few of my faves: pork chop (massive cut), octopus along with a local sausage, mezze appetizer. If you don't have a reservation and it's just 2-3 people, you might be lucky and snag a spot at the bar instead which is first come/first serve.

On a recent visit, John Cena and his wife sat at the next table over from us.

business.name: LaCo
business.categories: American (Traditional), Vegan, Restaurants, Vegetarian, Nightlife, Bars, American (New)

reviews.text: I was visiting the area and looking for an outdoor covid friendly option and was happy to find LaCo.  The woman I believe to be the owner was friendly and apologized for the wait (she was allowing her staff time with family for the holidays- no apology necessary) which I didn't mind because it was a beautiful night and I was enjoying the live music.  I had tacos and my husband one of the bowls, both were enjoyable.

Such a special place! The big tree and stage in the courtyard covered in twinkle lights really have a magical feel. If you are there to really hear the music ask for a table in front because there are a lot of people talking at times. The food and drinks are great. Definitely a top place to visit in Tucson.
Incredible food, great vegan options, one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had. The vibe of the place is also pretty unbeatable with the lights and live music.

It's probably been a few years now since I've come to LaCo, though I'm not sure why. It's definitely a place worth visiting! About 90% of their seating is outdoor though so be sure to dress appropriately for the time of year you'll be visiting. The tacos are delicious and the Chile rellenos is extra crispy. Plus there are a bunch of really cool and quirky shops right in the same plaza so plan to make time to browse!

Food was meh...bland taco and burrito dishes... couldn't order different meats for the tacos as they were busy per the server...no fruit flavors for the margaritas..the rice side dish was hard and grainy...the seating area had some nice leafy shade...overall disappointing for the price and I wouldn't return...
We were so impressed by the service. We sat outside and got to hear amazing live music along with great tacos. Margaritas were great, too.

First time in, and it was so cute! Ah! I loved alllll the lights and outdoor seating. The margaritas were delicious, and I LOVE me some margaritas so I am rather picky. The food was great...had the soup and their chicken quesadilla (they had another name for it). Next time I am in town I would definitely come back!

Disorganized service, confusing seating protocols (you're not allowed to sit in a wide variety of areas if you're just visiting for munchies and drinks), QR codes instead of actual menus. The worst part, though, was the food: The Tallboy burger was maybe a quarter-pound of squashed flat beef that was crisped to a bitter leathery texture, much like something my grandpa would have pulled off the grill at a 4th of July BBQ, with a handful of pale fries thrown randomly on the edge of the plate -- all for $15. No love, no technique, no pleasant plating. We felt gouged and left unhappy, and I won't even talk about the margarita that tasted like it came straight from the bar at Carlos O'Houlihan's.

One of pur go-to Favorites whenever we have company in from out of town which is quite often I am delighted to say. The food is consistently good, service always good in A delightful outdoor atmosphere and the live music is always superb too.

Searched Yelp for a fun and gluten free option restsurant. We went on a Sunday and parked on the side of the street. There's not a time limit on Sundays for street parking. 
We did have to wait until our entire party showed up before we could be seated. 
We waited in the inside bar area for about 5-10 minutes. 
They seated us outside and the weather was really nice. They did have an interesting musician playing. It was the perfect genre for outdoor dining.
They did give us a little qrc code to scan for the menu but none of us could get it to work. 
They did hand us a paper menu when asked. 
I ordered the gluten free taco salad. It was a little bland and really nothing special. 
We walked the little shops that surrounded the outside area. Really a cute fun restaurant. Wish the food tasted better. I would still come back and try something different because it was so cute!

Giving it two stars for the ambiance. 
We were called to the hostess stand for our table around 5:20. After about 20 minutes without a server or anyone making eye contact we finally flagged someone down. 25 minutes after being seated some came to greet us with no acknowledgement of our wait time or communication as to why. Just a simple "are you ready to order." I understand places are under staffed, but a little communication goes a long way in customer service. Dinner took another 30 minutes to be delivered. Tacos were cold so it's hard to tell if they we're good at all. I think the tortillas would have been delicious if they were warm. Pasta was over cooked and mushy, but was at least hot. A little after 7 we had to again flag down our sever to pay so we wouldn't miss our show. For spending $100+ on drinks and dinner I was thoroughly disappointed. I'm sure this place has potential but their staff is not happy to be working there and I felt like I was paying them to be treated as an inconvenience. 

All three of us at dinner are in the industry and we're overly patient and polite. Again a quick check in and some communication goes a long way.

Fabulous! The Spanish guitar playing of Nathan and his trio was wonderful and made for a great atmosphere. When they were on break the turtles in the Koi pond were fun to watch. Loved the open air venue. And the food was versatile and very very good. My skinny margarita was yummy!! One of the best. Reasonably priced I highly recommend.
Food and ambiance makes for a wonderful evening to entertain friends and family. Definitely will be coming back.
The food is great, the atmosphere fantastic, the staff helpful and nice. Great place for a casual meal.

LaCo is a hidden gem in Tucson. Tucked away in a courtyard downtown and sandwiched between Tallboys bar and Art House Centro it is an absolute treat. 

We visited mid week in the evening and they had live music, sat us in a beautiful little courtyard next to a pond with Coi fish and turtles and surrounded by little shops. So from an atmosphere perspective it was an A+

They were pretty busy when we stopped, the service was good (not great) as we did sit for a bit before our drink order was taken and between check ins but nothing too crazy. 

The food was FANTASTIC! I had the BBQ meatloaf and my companion had the Elote pasta. We both easily cleaned our plates. It was enough food to fill you up without being so much that we needed to take home leftovers. 

Prices were reasonable for the food as well. 

Very happy to have discovered LaCo!
Came here with friends but unable to get a table even though many empty tables. Will not return. Do not bring friends and family at 4 pm

Wonderful experience. Service was excellent and food was amazing. I had the pulled pork hash. It was creative and delicious. House margaritas was great. The patio atmosphere is charming and inviting. We'll be back.

My 10 year old says come to Tucson for this restaurant! We enjoyed the pulled pork taco plate very much. My sangria was lovely and my son loved his prickly pear lemonade. The dark chocolate brownie sundae was deliciously decadent. 

Would absolutely return!

This place is so cute! The owner is so nice and you can tell she really cares about the experience of her guests! The food is really good and I recommend the pasta and chimichanga. Last time I went here is was raining and we were quickly moved inside and still got rapid service! I will definitely be back!

Went on a busy Friday night & waited about 25 minutes for a table with friends but the staff was friendly! Got to enjoy drinks while we waited which helped! Got the taco salad and it was delicious! Margaritas were awesome too! The live music was great to listen to in between conversations with my friends as well.

Amazing ambiance, but food and drinks left something to be desired. 

Ambiance: Their outdoor area is beautiful! Lots of greenery, water fountain, stage area, strung lights. Very cute area and perfect on a beautiful Tucson night. 

Service: Efficient and friendly.

Food: Got some drinks, salmon, and the burger. Drinks tasted fairly watered down and didn't taste like much. Salmon and burger were okay, the prices were a bit expensive. Standout was the tiny tots! Amazing combo of sauces with perfectly done tots for that nice crunch. It was so good that we actually ordered another one after we had finished our entrees! 

Overall, would come back for the vibes and the tots. Might try other things on the menu, but I'm not too ecstatic about it.

I am a little disappointed. I went in to grab dinner by myself. I was told by the host to go sit at one of the high top tables, which I did. After 15min, no one had come by my table. Within those 15min other people were sat and waited on, even the people sitting in front of me. The high top tables are visible it's not like they couldn't see me. I am a poc and was by myself. You can imagine everything that was going through my head. I really hope neither of those two things were the reason as to why everyone after me was taken care and I wasn't.  The place is super cute though. I have gone before and had a great time but I wasn't by myself. I don't know if I'll ever go again but I still highly recommend this place, for the ambiance. It's a cute date place.

Great spot for outdoor brunch and live music near downtown! The food is tasty, the outdoor seating is lovely, and you can browse the surrounding shops in Old Town Artisans right after eating. If you're in the mood for a mojito, definitely recommend getting one - so light and refreshing on a warm Tucson day! 

As for the food, we shared the green chile quesadilla and the Tallboy tots. We added chicken to the quesadilla - it was a pretty standard quesadilla but still satisfying. We added pulled pork to the Tallboy tots - the dish overall was really good, and I would definitely get them again. The tots were crispy and crunchy and didn't get too overwhelmed by the toppings (which all complemented each other well). Looking forward to another meal here!
Live music is great and lights are very pretty. But food had zero flavor, was cold and dry. Less than impressed with the food aspect.

We found La Cocina in a restaurant brochure
and checked it out on YELP, which has never let us down. There was a 20 minute wait in the bar for a table in the dining area. They only take reservations for 6 or more. The prickly pear marguerita and the Kentucky Cherry Lemonade we're both good drinks.  They also have a limited beer and wine menu. The food menu included Mexican and Mexican flared dishes which all sounded tempting.  The 4 of us chose the Chimichanga, the Lemon Chicken Penna( and my husband thinks he doesn't like Mexican food) and the taco salad, which was an upscale version with wonderfully roasted vegetables, black beans, guacamole and creme in a lightly fried taco shell. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dinners. That, coupled with Shane, a charming attentive waitperson and the live music, outside sparkling lights, and a warm atmosphere lent to a very magical evening!

business.name: Grindcore House
business.categories: Coffee & Tea, Vegetarian, Food, Restaurants, Vegan

reviews.text:
I'm obsessed. There aren't many coffee shops down near Dickinson Narrow so it truly a gem. Their caramel apple cider is sooooo delicious and their BLAT sandwich is so good! 

Their chai latte and zucchini bread are equally delicious.

Can't wait to explore more of their menu.

So tasty! That MickeyG breakfast sandwich is amazing. Each ingredient is given it's proper treatment- gravy, biscuit  
My marshmallow latte was fun without being overly sweet- yes, I added the marshmallows bc it's not often anyplace carries vegan marshmallow. Ended with a blackberry lavender muffin. I could eat this meal every day of my life- i mean, yay veggies

Great staff with delicious, quality food and beverages. Im so happy they have been open for over ten years now and were able to survive the Covid pandemic. Ten years ago they were one of the only coffee shops in the neighborhood and never over charged for the nondairy (which are all of them) milk options. Some places used to charge .75 extra for a table spoon of soy milk in your coffee, or tea, or whatever your beverage of choice is.

I highly recommend supporting this local business and support some of the causes they are involved in.

I have always been a fan of Grindcore, the people here are always super polite. I'm not vegan or even vegetarian, I don't even miss the meat or dairy when eating from here. I am really disappointed to see that anyone would give a poor review for an establishment taking precautions due to a PANDEMIC. I actually really love the pre order app system and hope it stays as an option post opening. Very appreciate of this place for taking precautions over the last 14 months to keep both it's workers and patrons safe.

My sister, boyfriend and I made a pit stop at Grindcore House after having breakfast at The Dutch. It's been my sister's favorite coffee shop while she's been out in Philly, so I took her word for it. 

Due to the pandemic, all the ordering and paying are done online. Pretty simple and straightforward. Many of the customers pre-ordered, but we easily placed our order on the spot. The turnaround time for drinks to be made was quick.

I'm all about the custom coffee drinks and wanted to try something unique to the place. The Swamp Thing totally caught my eye. The drink was an iced Americano with green mint syrup and soy creamer, so there's no way I could miss the bright minty green layer. Over time the top coffee layer mixes in with the mint syrup, which makes the top layer legitimately appear to be this murky green color. It may not sound appealing, but it tasted great. It wasn't overly sweet and had the right touch of mint that was subtle.
30$ for two cannolis (those were really good) and 2 lattes. the lattes tasted like old bitter coffee meh

I walked here to grab my boyfriend & I a cup of coffee - the front door is blocked off by chairs & rope to stop people from coming in (understandable, I guess, since it is a smaller coffee shop & they don't want people coming inside due to covid but kind of unwelcoming). Anyway, when I walked up the woman working opens the front door, I say "Good morning, I'll have one large coffee -" and I'm interrupted by "YOU HAVE TO ORDER ONLINE". I say, "okay, do you take cash?" she abruptly answers "NO". The overall experience was just unpleasant & I felt like I was almost bothering the employees by showing up & trying to order a coffee.

I understand there are precautions due to everything going on, however, why do I need to login to a website, create an account, & enter my credit card information to order two plain coffees? And why am I treated so rudely?

We came here with friends on a Saturday morning. The friends were passing through town and we wanted some vegan food that consisted of hot drinks and tasty breakfast. 
This place was wonderful. We ordered online and our food and drinks are ready to go when we got there. And because of Covid we are able to get outside in the nearby neighborhood park. I got the BLAT sandwich. It was both tasty and refreshing and I also got the turmeric golden latte was so milk and it was warm and delicious as well. I had ginger in it but it's definitely stood out to me as someone else is trying to like ginger but thinks it is spicy. 

I can't wait to come back here next time. It's definitely a new vegan Philly favorite for me. I highly recommend. 

Pros: great breakfast food selection, great hot drinks selection, excellent online ordering system!

My absolute favorite vegan cafe! I have yet to try something from Grindcore that isn't amazing! Some of my absolute favorites are: Sandwiches- Italiano and the BLAT! Baked goods- zucchini bread! Drink- chai latte with whip! In response to the pandemic you now order online and pickup outside of the cafe. You can even schedule an order ahead of time! They have made take out super easy!
Thanks to yelp for suggesting Grindcore House. A very unique environment. Really tasty and healthy. I became great friends with the staff, who are all wonderful and super courteous. Bon appetite.

I absolutely love this place in and out. Currently it offers take out/curbside pick up with a large variety of options to order online, from coffee drinks, with probably one of the largest milk choices I have seen, baked goods, amazing sandwiches, cakes to bulk purchases. This is a staple of good coffee, the tastiest vegan baked treats, and really healthy sandwiches; and you get the amount of ingredients you are supposed to get, never shortchanged. I sincerely recommend it as a customer who's been going to this place for few years now. Also, separate thank you for a dog treat to every doggie with any purchase. Woof!

I stopped in this weekend to get a quick treat to enjoy in Dickinson Park since the weather is still so nice out. I had the Golden Latte with Oatmilk and a Philly Muffin with jam. I have heard great things about all their food but I just wanted something simple. The Golden Latte is superb, it has a nice spicyness that I couldn't get enough of. 

Currently everything is order on the web and pick up at the pickup window. I didn't know this so I ordered from my phone while I was outside and once I got my order in it was up within minutes.

I've had a sandwich and coffee here before and absolutely loved it. However, today I am very disappointed. I ordered the grizzly and the biscuit was extremely over powering, where you couldn't even taste anything else. I had high hopes for that breakfast sandwich when all I tasted was a giant biscuit. I also wish the pumpkin bread was bigger and I wish the green tea wasn't as watered down.

This place was one of my "must go to" stops when visiting philly overnight and I was not disappointed at all. Everything is order online and take out here but they made it super easy and were fast! Even with the traffic making us late to pick up everything was still hot! The grizzli breakfast sandwich was the best vegan breakfast sandwich I've ever had, I miss it already. I have t had a brownie since going vegan two years ago and this one was just how I remember them! You've never know it was vegan and it was super fresh and soft still. I also got a "swamp thing" coffee which wasn't as minty as I expected but from someone who doesn't like coffee, I enjoyed it. Def making sure I always come here every time I visit.

I order pick up from here almost every single day, whether it's just a morning iced latte/cold brew or food for the whole fam. I personally enjoy the fact that you can choose to make your own sandwich with the given bread/bagel options + toppings & spreads. Never disappointed. I enjoy starting my day off with caffeine & breakfast/lunch sandwiches from here, it's my "me time". I think they're doing an awesome job with handling business during a pandemic too! :)

This place never disappoints!! Got the best sandwiches and latte from here today. Service was very quick and friendly. 
I got the golden latte and it was literally the best thing I've ever had. Not too sweet but just right. 
Lots of vegan places are only doing takeout on weekends during the pandemic so when I saw that grindcore is open during the week I was so happy!
For anyone wondering about pandemic safety- they do follow guidelines well- wearing masks, etc when handling food and passing the food to you for takeout. THANK YOU GRINDCORE

I hardly ever leave reviews, but I think Grindcore House deserves it. I took the trip from Conshohocken to get a Sunday quarantine lunch, and picked the Seitan Sammy. It was perfect! The flavors are wonderfully salty but so perfectly balanced with a vegan aioli type sauce and the best ratio of pickle to sandwich there ever was. 10/10 would recommend. The bread was really fresh, flavorful and toasted super well, and it was the perfect amount of bread to sandwich filling. I also ordered a chai latte with oat milk because I was feeling sassy -- it was not only delicious but I so very much appreciated that it didn't taste overly ladened with sugar like you might encounter at Starbucks. I'm not vegan, but I can't wait to hopefully take my friends and family here one day. Keep it up, GCH!

The Grindcore House is a neighborhood vegan and vegetarian coffee shop that serves sandwiches, salads and baked goods at reasonable prices.  The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is relaxing.  The only downside is the loud heavy metal music. I will definitely go back and try them again.

Excellent third-wave coffee with hardcore, metal, and grindcore playing in the background.  Local art featured on the walls.  Fliers for local DIY shows.  My brother claims that the cold brew is the best he's had.  There's a comfy couch and plenty of space to do work.  The bathroom has iconic fliers of classic hardcore bands.  This place is a truly special gem.

I've been wanting a hoagie since becoming vegan about 4 years ago. I finally made it to grind house today. I ordered the Italiano and it was delicious!! I also had a blueberry muffin which was good a little dry but good. Also, the service was excellent and the staff were very friendly and welcoming! I will definitely be returning for another Italiano soon.

Great little vegan coffee and sandwich shop in Pennsport! I was so happy to find this place within walking distance of my apartment. I love a good coffee shop with lots of seating and tables I n the back. Also, the vegan sandwiches for lunch are amazing!!!!

The best cafe in Philadelphia. They have the best lattes, iced and hot. Their gluten free bagel is amazing. SO appreciative for a cafe to be all vegan. They have delicious desserts - you can't go wrong with any of them. I truly can't believe they are vegan. The sandwiches are great. They're open nice and early. The vibes are unique and everyone is so kind in there. The staff is great and supportive of your needs.

Lots of choices for vegan baked goodies, bagels, cream cheeses, milks for coffee, etc. It was a nice space with wifi and on-street parking (if you can find a spot). It's an older building in a residential area, but it feels cozy and I noticed  the staff  warmly welcoming their regulars. I got a mocha, bagel with cream cheese, and a chocolate cannoli. Everything was delicious!

I had some time to kill before my appointment in the area so I made my way to the nearest coffee shop. This place is unique and true to its name. My caramel latte basically was art. I love the local places with great staff and beautiful crafted beverages. I will always support a local business! Thank you for the wonderful latte.
Absolutely amazing food and drinks. My favorite is the seitan sandwich, it is the best vegan sandwich I've ever had!

business.name: Padmanadi Vegetarian Restaurant
business.categories: Restaurants, Vegan, Indonesian, Vegetarian

reviews.text:
I can't say enough to be honest... 

The Ginger Beef is some of the best I've ever had.., and its not even beef!

One of my fav places to order in from.
Awesome place with super good vegetarian options. The variety of foods they serve here is very surprising. I would recommend 100%!

Great restaurant and food period. None of that "for a vegetarian restaurant" crap... 
great flavors and textures! Love the legit Indonesian food selections

This place came recommended by a local who knew we were looking for a good vegan restaurant. The weren't crowded which was nice. The server was very friendly and helped with recommendations for both our drinks and our food. Food is served family style so we sampled a little of everything. Perfect way to try multiple dishes. Will definitely return. Curry had nice spice but not too much. Strong flavors!

Padmanadi is a restaurant that you'll hear rave reviews about constantly, to the point where you'll just have to check it out for yourself. Open for many years and a fixture of Central McDougall, it's almost impossible that you haven't paid them a visit at least once. Padmanadi has even recently opened a second southside location, which only makes their delicious food more accessible. VUE Weekly named them #1 Best Vegetarian 2018 and #1 Best Vegan 2018, while Edmonton Journal called Padmanadi the Best Vegan/Vegetarian Restaurant 2020. This should come as no surprise because they have practically been dominating the vegan/vegetarian scene since the day that their doors first opened. So what's the deal at Padmanadi? What is the food all about? Owned and operated by Indonesian immigrants, they serve Indonesian, Chinese, Thai, and Indian plant-based dishes. Everything is vegan. But let me assure you that this food will completely change the way that you think about the vegan experience. As an omnivore myself, you will always hear me say "if all vegan food was this delicious, I would never eat meat again" when I visit Padmanadi.  The original restaurant is not situated in the greatest area of the city, north east of downtown. But don't make the mistake of letting the location deter you - everything else more than makes up for it! The vibrant and bright restaurant lights up the street and welcomes you inside. I've always adored their beautiful and fresh space, and it's big too! Every aspect is well thought out and perfectly appropriate, combining the feelings of Southeast Asia and veganism to a tee. The gorgeous bamboo wood, pops of colour, and the centerpiece of the dining room; a massive Buddha statue adorned with flowers. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming, making it quite apparent that this is the type of place that really cares about its' people - staff and customers alike.  The menu is extensive and you almost have to remind yourself that none of the dishes contain animal products - especially when you find yourself face to face with the "vegetarian meat dishes" section. Confusing? Just keep reminding yourself that there is no actual meat within the restaurant and let them show you their wizardry. I have personally visited the restaurant many times in the past, in fact you'll find them listed in the Worldwide Faves section of this website. However, it had been many years since my last visit and I was very excited to revisit some of my favourite flavours. Seated at a comfortable table, I looked over the familiar menu and didn't notice too many changes. It was a relief! I ordered all of my old stand-bys and even tried something new. First, always, had to be the Crispy Chicken Strips (Veggie chicken fried to perfection & served with homemade hot sauce - $10.95). My absolute favourite thing on the menu. How I had missed these! An instant craving, you might never guess in a million years that you aren't eating real chicken. Except that it's better than chicken. Every piece is moist and impossibly tender on the inside. The outside is coated in the most wonderfully crispy, crunchy and salty batter. The sweet and spicy chili sauce has a great zing to it, an ideal accompaniment. There is only one word to describe these magic morsels: ADDICTIVE. You have to try these just so that you can be in on the amazingness.  Next, our main courses arrived and I had to stick to more of my old favourites, starting with the Ginger Beef (Soy beef strips, sweet bell peppers and julienne carrots in a tangy ginger sauce. Our best seller - $15.95). We also grabbed an order of Coconut Rice ($2.75) to go along with everything because rice is life. I especially love the sweetness of coconut rice and was happy to see it as an option on the menu. It looks just like ginger beef... But it's not. The crispy pieces of not-beef are tossed in a thick glaze that actually tastes like real, fresh ginger. The vegetables are bright and full of flavour. And you'll find yourself wondering why you would ever bother ordering "real" ginger beef when you could just enjoy this instead (and feel less like trash afterwards).  We also ordered the Curry Chicken (Our signature dish! Our famous homemade rich and delicious yellow curry coconut with veggie chicken, potatoes and vegetables - $16.95), which I truthfully don't think I'd ever tried before. I was glad to get something new into the mix and this seemed like the exact right dish to bring into the fold. This dish packs a spicy kick but boy is it delicious! The curry itself is velvety smooth, full of sweet and spicy flavour. The potatoes are incredibly tender. But it's the not-chicken that is the real star. All we kept saying is that it tasted better than real chicken! The main reason for this is because each piece is so incredibly tender, boasting a consistently uniform texture that you don't get from real chicken. It's like they were able to take all of best things about chicken, harness that pow

I absolutely love the food at Padmanadi! Being a massive meat lover I did not think I would love a vegetarian/vegan restaurant. But boy was I wrong! My favourite dish is their Curry Chicken. It is a definite must try on your first visit! The owner, Kasim is always so warm and welcoming and makes everyone feel like family there
It has a good selection of vegan and vegetarian meat options for those who want to try those flavours. Liked the mutton curry with coconut rice.
I am not a vegetarian, and I typically don't eat meals with no meat, but the food was very tasty.   If you want to take out someone for a meatless meal, this is top of my list in Edmonton.
Love love love this place! We absolutely die for their buffet days and can't wait for the next.
we like the idea of meat base the taste is good we are only confused to the taste of teriyaki sauce it taste like sweet and sour this is an honest review.

OMG Yum! This restaurant is one of my favourites.. the staff, the atmosphere, the food.. so professional and inviting. I love coming here to relax or enjoy the take out. Either/or I am never disappointed. The variety of menu choices are vast, we need more plant based restaurants like this leading example. Thank you, I will visit again
This place is amazing the service is superior and the food is fabulous. My wife and I have made this restaurant definitely our top three vegan restaurant.

I like this restaurant and I am not a vegetarian or vegan.  The buffet works best for me so I can try a variety of foods.   I admit I love my meat so the buffet lets me to pick and choose.  To me it doesn't really taste like the meat I am used to but I still enjoy the textures and flavores.  It is too bad it is busy and of course Covid 19 has changed things for now but I do enjoy the food here.

Not only does this location serve some seriously delicious vegan food (my mum who vehemently hates vegan dishes even likes food from here such as the sweet and sour 'pork' and curry 'chicken'), but the staff are incredibly thoughtful. Over Thanksgiving I was sick with a flu and locked down so I ordered from here as comfort food; they sent me a generous helping along with a complimentary order of the sweet and sour 'pork' which had 'Happy Thanksgiving :)' written on the box. It made my sad, lonely holiday so much better. Honestly cannot recommend this place enough.

I let my husband talk me into trying something new and I do not regret it. Padmanadi is by far my favorite restaurant. The ginger "beef" is incredible. Cauliflower, delicious. I will CRAVE this place from time to time and I am so happy I was talked into this one!

This restaurant is amazing!! The vibe of the restaurant is homie and comfortable! I believe they hang pictures of the family members around the restaurant. So cute! Staff and owner are super friendly and attentive! 

Food is amazing! Everything here is vegetarian. We ordered a variety of things and they were all delicious. My favourite was the ginger beef. It's bomb.com. Price of items ranged around $10-$15 per dish! Very fair pricing for the quality and portioning of the food. 

If you haven't tried this restaurant... you must go there NOW!
Good tasting food for those of who have dietary restrictions. Most foods are hot when prepared. Very long wait times to get a table because it's popular restaurant.

I'm not a Vegan although I certainly am changing my attitude about becoming one.  If I could eat here every day I think my decision would be made rather quickly!
I've eaten here twice and both experiences were phenomenal!  The food was delicious and  the service was excellent!
I HIGHLY recommend you trying these guys!

I'm not vegan nor vegetarian but I could be if I could eat here every day! Honestly shocked the first few times I ate here because their dishes are indistinguishable from the "real" thing! Sometimes it's better! The atmosphere and service is just lovely as well. I couldn't recommend this anymore highly than I already do!

Ordered some takeout one evening during COVID and was very impressed with everything. They do a sort of hodgepodge of many different Asian cuisines, which can sometimes be a red flag, but in this case, they pull it off. We ordered the mushroom tofu, vegan "beef" rendang, and szechuan green beans, along with some rice, all of which were really nicely crafted dishes -- the rendang being the clear highlight. Normal pricing for Alberta (read: high), with moderate portion sizes. Definitely will revisit when back in Edmonton.

Decided to try a vegan restaurant since I am Slowly cutting out eating meat. 
I had heard a lot about this place from friends and  coworkers before but never got around to eating here.  Since it was a nice day today, decided to try it out! Definitely was worth trying. I got the general Tao chicken, ginger beef, noodles. Everything tasted good and well portioned. 
The ambiance is nice but definitely targeted more for pickup.
I later ordered the soy milk chai latte for my mom. A kale spinach oatmilk smoothy for my kids and a brownie. The brownie was delicious. The soy milk chai latte was very spicey for our taste. The kale smoothy was good. 
Definitely would be on one of the good restaurants in Edmonton!

Great texture in the meat alternatives and good flavour in the curries and stir fries! I love having this tasty veg option around! However the soups... I've tried a few times and just do not recommend them more gelatinous than soup like and off-putting flavours.

Love this place. 
No complaints. 
I recommend the curry and kung pao.
we got this for a lunch from a drug rep the wraps were amazing.
Happy mothers day. Daughter ordered lunch. Delivered on time. Delicious as always. Thank you

business.name: Oliver's
business.categories: American (Traditional), Vegan, Restaurants

reviews.text:
For our girls weekend, we decided to check out Oliver's vegan restaurant. It's a quick walk from any of the rooms if you're staying at the Coast Village inn.

The outdoor patio is stunning with the most picturesque lights and gorgeous trees. Even though we were outside, the heaters kept us warm and we felt comfortable the entire time.

Hands down the best part of our meal was our cocktails. The endless summer drink was to die for.

I also highly recommend the pear and arugula flatbread, though we enjoyed everything we ate! 

I don't typically eat a lot of vegan cuisine but we loved this place and we're already planning another visit.

Oliver's is great! I've been finding myself in a couple of vegan spots lately and I'm not vegan by any stretch of the imagination. I'm one of those who will not dare consume an animal product in my coffee drinks, like could not pay me any amount of money in the world to drink cows milk - but will devour an entire block of cheese a couple hours later.

I eat what I want, when I want but my sister is Vegan and I'm totally not opposed to others living that life. I bake a bunch of vegan items and I really do love a lot of vegan options but the commitment to an entire lifestyle isn't right for me.

I'd asked my bestie if we could grab dinner at Oliver's on our way home the other night. We usually eat brekke at Jeannine's or grab coffee and pastries in Montecito on our way out to wine tasting in Los Olivos but we are never quite in need for dinner on the return because we've either already eaten a bit sooner than we hit Coast Village Rd. or I've way overdid it on McConnell's froyo stop a couple exits before here.

Either way, I knew I wanted to grab dinner so I intentionally asked the gal at McConnell's to only give me half of my froyo order because I needed to fit in dinner tonight.

My bestie is definitely not vegan so I didn't mention to him this restaurant was and as it got closer to dinner, I simply suggested this spot might be "vegetarian" I didn't want to totally scare him off of the idea.

We'd eaten a late lunch and ordered a few plates to share which was plenty!

We shared the Apple Salad, Kung Pao Cauliflower and Spinach & Artichoke Flatbread.

All three dishes were very yummy. We both really enjoyed the salad, but agreed that the Spinach & Artichoke flatbread was our fav. It was super filling and would be a great share for a larger dining party.

As much as I wanted to try dessert and under normal circumstances would have totally tried to do dessert (my froyo) before and dessert after dinner, my dessert stomach was already full and we had to table that one for our next visit.

Service was great, the salad came out quickly and the other dishes seemed to take a bit longer but it was a Sunday evening and we had no place else in the world to be so it didn't matter much.

We'll definitely return in the future. This is a great option if you are staying in the area or passing through and want a really scrumptious meal in a nice calm atmosphere.

It was a chilly night and as lovely as the patio was I wanted to cozy up in a corner booth and keep warm indoors. The patio seems perfect for warmer evenings.

Plenty of street parking out front.

Oliver's is such a cute restaurant! 
We were very pleased with the entire experience. 
The staff was amazing-  attentive and friendly. 
The outdoor ambiance is beautiful with outdoor lighting and fire pits that creates an intimate setting. There were plenty of heat lamps around to keep you warm. There is also indoor seating too! 

For dinner we had the artichoke flatbread, tomato salad, and jackfruit tacos... they were all very tasty! Oliver's is also family friendly, they had high chairs for children. They also offered pasta or cheese pizza for children to eat. 

I would definitely come back to Oliver's again. It's a great place for a nice dinner as a couple, family, or even a date night with drinks at the bar. Aesthetically, the bar was incredibly chic. I loved it. To note: parking is on the street from what I am aware, not in the actual plaza as it is saved for hotel guests there.
Very slow service and major attitude from our server. Vegan food was good flatbread was uninspired
Delicious vegetarian food. The Pad Thai and veggie burger were both very yummy. We liked this place so much we visited twice in one trip!

Oliver's is a must visit each time we come to Montecito/Santa Barbara. We happened on this place during a visit to SB and fell in love right away. It's just one of those restaurants that sweeps you off your feet. 
Our server was best in class. He was passionate about his job and the food, offering us great recommendations which made our experience very special. 
And the food was just so wonderful. The dishes were so well done from the plating to the colors and the mix of textures; it was truly a great food experience. 
Whether you're vegan or not, this place is a must visit!
Always such an amazing experience here at Olivers. Can not thank Carly enough for being such an excellent server last night! Oliver's burger and the apple crumble are to die for!

This was an amazing experience. The ambiance of the restaurant was absolutely wonderful. The seating options were wonderful and the decor was great. The servers were all extremely kind and helpful choosing what to eat. The food was INCREDIBLE. We got multiple share plates and split everything between us. Everything was delicious and the portion sizes were really good. The flavors were wonderful and even our friends who weren't vegan enjoyed.

Every time Oliver's is 5/5 stars! The best restaurant in Montecito. The staff is always great too and the atmosphere is perfect. The interior design is beautiful and I highly recommend stopping at Olivers. They're only open for dinner and get very busy but you can make reservations or order to go!

Excellent restaurant, service, ambience, location and best of all delicious food preparations using plant based conscious ingredients.  5 star all the way.

Parking was challenging.  Oddly all the spaces surrounding the restaurant are marked "for hotel only, no restaurant parking" despite everything looking like it's on the same property and the stalls being contiguous to the restaurant

I like their improved menu. I still like to see more items like I see at crossroads kitchen. Their drinks are excellent I just wish they made their own juices Or better understood who they are supporting given where they are sourcing their juices.

Whether you're plant-based for your Health or because of animals or because of civil rights issues, this may be of interest to some customers.  It's nice to eat and support businesses that align with doing good., So Olivers is doing that in many ways except for where they purchase their juice.  

We've been learning a lot about how to walk the talk with the environment, human rights, and well-being. Switch for good has some excellent information on this. We appreciate that Olivers gives us a true vegan all plant-based option and beautiful montecito

Plus - It's usually got a good energy. Pretty lights. Good looking service. And it's wonderful to eat so healthy... Delicious plant-based. Thank you Olivers

A really outstanding dining experience. Food was very (very) good, service was outstanding, a very enjoyable bottle of wine certainly helped. Expensive, but worth every penny.

Unless you are a regular I would view Oliver's as a small plate establishment. The two of us ordered 4 plates; the two dishes that were not spicy were served first (Artichoke Cakes, Brussels Sprouts). We were periodically tactfully watched so the spicier dishes (Kung Pao Cauliflower, Shishito  Peppers) could be prepared and served as we were finishing what amounted to a first course. 

We were both extremely happy with the four dishes we ordered, getting unfinished portions boxed so we could enjoy desert with excellent coffee. The Key Lime pie was the perfect finish to a perfect meal.

In addition to the small plates the menu includes flatbreads and sandwiches. If I lived in the area and ate frequently at Oliver's the options would be appreciated. As a visitor, as mentioned previously, I would recommend the small plates.  As others have mentioned, the outdoor dining area (where we ate) is well situated, overlooking the shopping area across the street and the menu is fully vegan.

Adding to the enjoyment, we walked to the restaurant from downtown Santa Barbara, about a 1 hour walk largely along the beach and a Bird Refuge, taking an Uber back.

Definitely would return on a future visit to Santa Barbara.
Best place ever. The food is amazing. I shared a few dishes with my guest but everything was excellent. The cook tails were delightful and the ambiance is so magical.

My husband and I started off and ended our honeymoon in Montecito. Since he is a strict Vegan, I had to do some research on restaurants that had a good choice of Vegan dishes. *Oliver's has entered the chat* First, I was surprised to see an *all Vegan* restaurant. The reviews and the menu looked good, so we made a reservation. Let me tell you how good this food is! Everything we ate was delicious! The staff was very welcoming and answered all the questions we had about what was in the dishes. Our waitress, Heather, was awesome (we even made sure we sat in her section when we came back a week later). Also, the restaurant itself is SO CUTE! Patio seating amongst trees, hanging lights everywhere, and lots of heat lamps. The music was great too. We loved it so much, we made a reservation for the following week before we left. The menu items we had amongst both visits: Brussel sprouts, Thai curry, Pad Thai, Braised mushroom ravioli, the Veggie burger, and the chocolate fudge cake for dessert. Oliver's is one of our absolute favorite places now. We just wish they had a location in OC.

First of all , the fact that there's an upscale restaurant with an all vegan menu is something to celebrate in and of itself. This place gets full points on ambiance and service. Very friendly and hospitable staff ! The food is not too bad  but unfortunately not elevated. The crab cakes were well executed and quite tasty. The shishito peppers were extremely tangy - I get that there's lemon tamari in it , but it was far too pronounced in it's expression. The cauliflower was not the star in the kung pao cauliflower dish. And whoa, was it saucy ! Maybe it was on me to eat it last , but once it was on the plate , it pretty much imparted it's overpowering essence on every other dish we ate after . Maybe dial down the sauce so that there can still be harmony between all the dishes ordered? (And also spare the poor cauliflower from having an identity crisis ?) And the truffle potatoes were mediocre - nothing to write home about and not very " truffley ". The wild mushroom tostada was quite good , but not good enough to atone for the sins of the dishes that came before sadly ... Is this place worth a visit ? Yes absolutely but if you're looking for culinary artistry , you will be disappointed. I would want to rate them a 3.5 but since that's not an option here , I will have to go with a 3. I will end on the note that they did show promise and I sincerely wish them the best and hope they can attain the superlative level of excellence that's still rare for plant based cuisine.

OMG! This restaurant is a real gem! The atmosphere is beautiful and the food is easily the best vegan food in the West coast. We had truffle potatoes, a jackfruit taco, mushroom ravioli and a Thai curry as well as dessert. Everything was incredibly delicious - the flavors were absolutely spot on!

Sorcery, this place is pure sorcery! We have been exploring vegan restaurants on the west coast all the way from San Francisco to San Diego, this place is the best, the real deal. The dishes are new and delicious, too bad they are about 5 hours south of SF, but totally worth a weekend visit every now and then!

Very pretty location, love the vibes. Food was yummy. I got the sausage flat bread, pink drink, and cauliflower to start. Rest of the family got the other flatbreads, Thai curry, pad Thai, and burger. For food I would stick to the flat breads :)

I highly recommend this restaurant!!  As a vegan it is hard to find places like these.  Classy and 100% plant based.  The garden style dining with the lights and classy decor made it a perfect setting for my wife and I's silver wedding anniversary.  Now onto the food.  We chose a sparkling wine to complement our meal.  The wine list was extensive.  The first course was the Roman artichoke hearts with dipping sauce.  Amazing flavor!!  Then we moved on to the mushrooms ravioli.  Once again, delicious!!  Both dishes were prepared with good presentation.  We wrapped our meal by sharing a vegan chocolate cake and coffee.   Great service.  Our server Brooke was very attentive and thoughtful.   All the the staff were very friendly.  Glad that I found this gem along the central coast.   We will be back!!!

There is nothing like this! I went with an open mind and came out a loving and devoted patron. 

The seating area is very cute- we sat outside by a heater and the view was gorgeous. The wine selection is incredible and they have fun cocktails too. Service is also outstanding and very quick. 

We ordered three things to share: the tomato zucchini starter, the cauliflower, and the pad thai. The tomato zucchini starter was PHENOMENAL! I could not believe it was vegan and essentially just a pile of veggies. The sauces were incredible- this completely scratched our pasta itch and didn't even taste that healthy even though it was completely raw. The cauliflower was also incredibly decadent, something even a devout meat eater would love. The pad thai was also incredible but definitely more noticably veggie heavy. 

This is a place I'd feel more than comfortable taking non-vegans, as they have so much variety and incredible flavor in all the dishes. I can't WAIT to go back!
Sadly overrated. The impossible burger was so bland.

This place has a great vibe - and the layout is fantastic.- indoor / outdoor open area - music level was good - nice lighting at night. Staff is A+friendly

A Vegan loves it when you are not limited to a few items on the bottom corner of the menu. Everything here is VEGAN and like a Doc Holiday said "I'm your Hucklebery!"

We kicked it off with the artichoke crab cakes and loved it. I have to say the corn and arugula  were the scene stealer like Akwafina in Crazy Rich Asians!

Shishito peppers came out next and they did not disappoint. The sauce at the bottom was delicious and we mixed them in with our other share plates.

They replace your plates and utensils between share plates without you even asking - nice touch.

Closed the show with Pad Thai - nice encore - we needed some volume and it delivered . Great mix of vegetables and noodles - very tasty.

My only regret is we should have swapped out the peppers for ravioli and the reason is - we only had two of us for the peppers 1 I recommend 4+peppers There is a lot of peppers!

So I have a plan for next Visit! Make sure you get out there. It is great!
Tasty, inventive vegan food. Try the flatbreads and pad thai. Great service. Great space.

One of the best plant-based restaurants I have ever been to. 
We went on Halloween and the place was packed, but we still got a fantastic table service.
The menu has a lot to offer with a big variety of gluten-free options. We definitely want to come back to try more!
We ordered braised mushroom ravioli (my favorite so far), Italian sausage & peppadew flatbread, and Oliver's burger. Everything was delicious, and the texture was not compromised on the gluten-free meals.
As dessert we got a complimentary lime cheesecake for my birthday  that was delicious 

TIP
make sure to have a reservation 

PROS
- gluten-free options
- delicious plant-based food
- a variety of options in the menu
- excellent service 
- a beautiful ambiance perfect for celebrations

CONS
- Parking can be a bit challenging, but maybe this was our experience because of Halloween
- On the pricey side (but worth it in my opinion)

I love Olivers so much. The Olivers Apple salad is my favorite all time salad. I have also gotten the truffle potatoes, herb roasted sweet potatoes, crab cakes which are all good. The thai curry is spicy but really good. The mushroom tostada is also really good and a little bit spicy.  The pear and gorgonzola flatbread is TO DIE FOR. I am gluten intolerant but I chose to deal with the tummy ache and cheat for this flatbread because it is just so amazing.  I really hope that in the future they create a gluten-free option of dough for the flatbreads.  Overall, all of my dining experiences at Olivers have been great!

business.name: Craft Kafe
business.categories: Restaurants, Gluten-Free, Coffee & Tea, Food, Bakeries

reviews.text: Give Craft Kafe a shot just so that you can be blown away by the number of gluten-free options they have available daily.  I had no idea one could do so much...and still maintain the deliciousness.
Good food at a premium price. Sort of busy when I was here on a Thursday morning. Unique...

The fresh made muffins and breakfast pizza is dynamite!
The omelettes are very delicious too.

They have the Best gluten free breakfast food and desserts I have had while in Florida. We ate there often during our past two trips to St.Pete, the omelette was tasty, so delicious, the potatoes and, of course, their many dessert items, especially the hand pies, were so delicious, I'm salivating right now while writing this!

I actually wish the baked items here weren't so delicious because Im worried about how much weight Im going to gain visiting over and over! We have been here 4 times now and almost every item we've purchased has been amazing. The raspberry hand pie was filled with gooey, delicious berries and all of the pastries have a light but substantial texture to them. We have also tried the carrot cake, spinach pie, blueberry coffee cake and cinnamon rolls and we would absolutely order every single one again. The only disappointment has been the paleo truffle, which had a strange slightly sour taste to it. I cannot recommend this bakery enough! Cute interior and friendly staff top it all off!

This place is a little blessing in the area. The coffee is yummy and gets me lit and I am stoked on house made syrups - always superior to the other options. And I haven't eaten much of their goodies, but I've had some loaves and they're delicious. Everything looks good. I could do a major bang bang here, and maybe I will someday. The seating situation is also nice and functional... service is fast. It's all good. Thank you for existing!
Always great staff when I go in. The Kyoto drip gets me started in the right way! Great food choices and yes it's all gluten free

We were visiting FL, what an amazing find!
Our son has Celiac so to be able to eat anything and be safe was huge. Breakfast items & salads were great. The baked goods - to die for!!  We made multiple trips, will definitely be back. In addition, service is top notch.
Love this place !!

We've driven past this place so many times and finally stopped in yesterday morning and absolutely loved everything we ordered. The menu has something for everyone. Pastries are unique and delicious, the coffee is excellent and it could be a dine-in or take-out depending on your schedule. Service is great-- super friendly, welcoming, and quick. We will definitely be coming here as a regular spot from now on!
Stopped here on my birthday- Very friendly to-go service! Great coffee, nice assortment of pastries (both savory and sweet). Cute vibe.

I had gone to the smaller cafe and picked up some really great gluten free bread loaves and some hand pockets (filled with potatoes and cheese, yum), but it took a few weeks for me to figure out that there was a much larger Craft Kafe a short distance from there.

My husband and I ended up grabbing lunch there, and being gluten free, let me tell you this place is a dream because I could pick whatever the hell I wanted here. Nothing was off limits! What?!

Yeah. So, I ordered the chicken avocado cream sandwich and the tomato soup. The sandwich was brimming with freshness, even the roasted chicken. Soooo good! The tomato basil soup was equally yummy, but they served it up way too hot, so it was a while before I could even take a taste. Full of flavor though.

My husband ordered the vegan burger with a side of buffalo chicken pizza and a hand held pie. Yeah, that's right, he ordered three meals at once, with the plan to have more when he got home. He's a glutton for good food!

This place is LOADED with gluten free and vegan treats. It's a GF bakery, by nature, and their breads, crusts and what have you are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, unless it's a muffin or something, of course. The texture of their baked goods are off the chart delicious. You would be hard pressed to even guess that it's gluten free because they're THAT GOOD.

Not only that, they have a huge covered outdoor patio for you to hang out in and eat. Social distanced and everything. People even had their dogs with them. It's a cool joint. The inside decor is all eco-cool and artsy - "crafted" organically, if you will. Love it!

Don't believe me? That's cool, try it out for yourself. I'll be here to thank when you get back. :)

Cute place. Really enjoyable coffee shop but I did not like my caramel latte. Their caramel sauce was not good! Got a breakfast sandwich and it was huge but was not a big fan of the taste. I'm glad I stopped in for the atmosphere

The best food and drinks, I love the turmeric latte! As someone with celiac disease, it's very difficult to eat out with truly gluten free items and craft kafe is a godsend for baked goods, breakfast and lunch. I'm just hoping for another location from the owners with dinner options .

This cafe is incredible. I am GF and I cannot even express how amazing it is to have this little gem. The best part is you would never know their food is GF because it's phenomenal. It's a favorite for my husband and kids as well.

I have been here on 2 occasions: pre and amid the pandemic. Two completely different experiences naturally on the ordering side--but, unfortunately, also on the food quality side. 

Pandemic order (as it's the most recent): Noted from the parking lot with signs all over windows that they're only accepting pre orders. You're not even allowed in to order - must call.  After I stated that I was already of the parking lot, they were very gracious to offer incredibly fast service. Gentleman over the phone was cheery and courteous, just like I remembered their top-notch service.  Also had to provide payment credit card number over the phone, which he asked if I was comfortable with. I agreed and completed order. 

Within 5 minutes, a sweet young lady came out of the store with my order in a cute little box, scolding hot.  While she was wearing gloves, she was not wearing a mask - which I know could be a concerning issue for some during thre crisis (sp whose health is compromised or the elderly). 

mushroom adobo pastry... what happened?! It was pure ginger, smelled like essential oils... waaayyy too overpowering, nothing like last time.

The quiche though? Delicious, although thre cheese on top was way too "crunchy" - overcooked. 

 All in all, I would still come back, although I'm afraid it may not offer a consistent experience.

Love everything about craft. For those who aren't already gluten free you would never think twice about everything here because it's all so good. It really never disappoints! Good coffee and tea selection as well as some kombucha and sparkling water options in the cooler. Perfect for breakfast or lunch!

It's probably a fine option if your dietary needs require gluten-free food but without that necessity, it's just okay. Prices are fair and the selection is good, just don't care for the taste personally

I have been gluten free for years and this is the first place in the US I have found that has real flaky good pastries. They have strudel, hand pies, cupcakes, cinnamon rolls and more. They are very fast and will heat up your pastries for you. They even have gf and vegan pizza and breakfast sandwiches. My only complaint is the chai is a bit weak. But I asked for extra spice and sweetener last time and that seemed to help
Cute little coffee shop. Staff wasn't super friendly or helpful to me as a new customer, but very chatty with regulars. Coffee is excellent, and pastries look delicious.
One of the only coffee shops in Saint Pete that still serve poor over and I am so thankful! Never had anything here that I didn't like! Super chill vibes, and great food and drink.

I forgot my mask so I have no idea what the inside looks like. The pictures from Yelp seem pretty cool. There are tables on a tiny sidewalk outside of it and it looks a little strange. 

I like their cups. Cute with the stamps. I genuinely enjoy the taste of the espresso.
The best gluten free coffee house in St. Pete.  Staff is always friendly with great service.

I go to craft cafe about every other day. 
The specialty coffee drinks are all so good and the pastries are amazing. I have never had anything I didn't like. They also cater to different dietary needs (gluten, Keto and paleo diets, etc) The staff is great and really sweet.

I can't get enough! Always my favorite place to go for delicious food, witty banter from the staff and my favorite beverages. Today's picks from the fella behind the counter... something with pistachios! Pretty women ( sugar free ) quiche, blueberry muffin... 
but let's be real... I have almost everything from here at some point! THEEEEEE BEST!
The treats they have here are delicious. I just wish they had more in stock. The drinks are a hit or miss though.
